Name: Kevin Scott
Text: Childhood hunger is a serious problem, made worse by the COVID pandemic.  No Kid Hungry is raising $100M to help kids get the nutrition they need.  If you are looking for a good cause, this a great organization and a very meaningful campaign.

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: One of our favorite questions to ask on the podcast is: What advice you would give to yourself when you were first starting out in your career?Kevin Scott the CTO at Microsoft shared this amazing insight the last time he joined us.  If you could go back to the beginning of your career and give yourself one piece of advice, what would it be?#cto #technologyleadership #leadershipinaction #leadership

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: I had a fascinating conversation recently with one of my favorite sci-fi authors, Charlie Stross, for my podcast, Behind the Tech. Reading sci-fi is one of the things that inspired me to become an engineer. Many of you might feel the same way. We talked about his broad range of interests and how he comes up with some of the futuristic ideas in his books. Can’t wait to read his latest one, Dead Lies Dreaming, which is out in October.  https://lnkd.in/gPs-aX3

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: We're excited to announce a deepening of our partnership with OpenAI to bring their GPT-3 language model to Microsoft's customers.  GPT-3 was trained on our AI Supercomputing infrastructure in Azure, and Open AI API for GPT-3 is hosted on Azure.  Our announcement today will result in GPT-3 being used to make Microsoft products better, and will allow us to offer new cloud services powered by GPT-3.

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: We lost a giant last night. Ruth Bader Ginsberg advanced women’s rights through both her legal decisions and her personal path. And she showed us how to live in these fractured times, able to bridge conflict in the workplace and forge relationships — without veering from your true north. This article she wrote in 2016 is short and illuminating about how she did, well, everything: “Ruth Bader Ginsburg’s Advice for Living” https://lnkd.in/eap9dwcAnd she practiced what she preached. The top comment on the story is from a woman who, as a young law school student, had her entire career launched thanks to the actions of RBG — a stranger to her. It’s the Jewish New Year today and I’m committing this year to live more like RBG: a little deaf (read the article) and a lot more giving.

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: Had a super-fun and far-ranging conversation with Kevin Scott on the importance of democratizing access to machine learning and on the opportunity (and moral imperative) to use ML to help patients. Also talked about the excitement of work at the boundary of two disciplines and building systems that involve both cells and bits, combining building blocks like stem cells, gene editing, microscopes, and cutting edge ML models. https://lnkd.in/gtBqNS8# #machinelearning #medicines #biology #science

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: I recently had the chance to talk with Daphne Koller, CEO and founder of insitro. Her company’s cutting edge work combines machine learning and biology to help transform drug development.  In addition to the fascinating and important work that Daphne is doing with insitro, she was also co-founder of Coursera, a MacArthur Fellow, is a renowned computer scientist, and was named one of TIME Magazine’s 100 most influential people.  Listen here: https://lnkd.in/gH3pgix

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: I love #TeamsApp more than any other VC tool. I have a lot of reasons like:1. Reminder when the meeting starts 2. New room for every meeting, so no accidental crashing another meeting3. Integrated meeting notes4. Closed captioning not just for #accessibility even for folks who speak softly when toddler is sleeping nearby5. Screen sharing on phone!6. Seemless transfer of call between devices7. Shows status if you are on another call, so no more guessing or pinging8. Direct integration to “ask to join” which calls on the phone too 9. Professional virtual backgrounds, I specially love the blur effect.10. Together mode! Today the together mode caught my entire team in a sweet <3 shape... lots of love and admiration for this amazing power packed team. Each one of you inspire me to do my best! Raviteja Kanumula Allison Chang Jianxu (Ethan) Pan Zhihao Zhang Lin Xu Prachi Mehta Ian Schoch Sarah Yu (not in pic at this time)

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: I could not agree more with Nacho (Ignacio) Solis saying: "2020 should not have been pushed into production"

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: We are announcing more AI supercomputing goodness today on Azure.  I'm really excited to see what Microsoft, our partners, and customers will be able to do with next generation NVidia A100 GPUs and high performance network.  We are already seeing a huge jump in performance and capabilities with this evolution of our AI supercomputing platform.  The next 12 months will be interesting in the world of AI!

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: My wife Michelle and I are honored to support the Stanford Institute for Human-centered Artificial Intelligence (HAI) as it facilitates collaboration among a wide range of the University's researchers and scholars exploring ways to use AI to benefit humanity. HAI's first six grant recipients are exploring everything from wearable robotics that aid human locomotion and predict and prevent older people from falling to an active learning system that makes tax collection fairer and more efficient.  You can learn more about all six of these inaugural projects here: https://lnkd.in/gUyAqgm#stanforduniversity # #ai

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: I recently joined Discord as their head of engineering and thought I'd share my motivation for joining their mission and why I am incredibly excited about making it a reality!I'd like to take a moment to thank my mentors who've helped me grow, I look forward to continuing to learn from you in the future Christine Heckart, Jeff Weiner, Kevin Scott, Mohak Shroff, Erran Berger, Igor Perisic

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: Dear friends,I wanted to share a career update with you. I have resigned from LinkedIn to pursue a role in public office.  As Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong has just announced, I will be joining the Singapore Cabinet as Minister of State for Ministry of Trade and Industry (Singapore) as well as the Ministry of Culture, Community and Youth (MCCY) I am humbled to be entrusted with this responsibility to serve my country during these extraordinary times.LinkedIn has been great to me. It’s been a privilege serving as a member of our leadership team and work alongside some of the most talented people in the industry. I will continue to keep in touch with my LinkedIn family and remain an active member of our LinkedIn alumni network.#Nextplay.

That conversation is now available on the McKinsey Global Institute's podcast available on your favorite podcast platform, or by following the link below.

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: My latest Behind the Tech podcast is a fascinating discussion on the benefits of melding biology and engineering with UW Neuroscientist Tom Daniel.  Prof. Daniel explains why combining machine learning, device technology and gene editing is creating tremendous progress in the biosciences. He also shares thoughts on important research in biomechanics – more specifically, the physics of animal motion – from molecules to moving moths! Check it out here: https://aka.ms/AA86k2w

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: Getting to Net Zero carbon emissions globally, and eventually to Net Negative, will require cooperation, investment, and innovation across a huge range of public and private institutions.  I'm excited about what the Transform to Net Zero coalition will accomplish over the coming years.

The new Transform to Net Zero coalition can help us all turn carbon commitments into real progress toward a #NetZero future. Learn more here: https://lnkd.in/gw4wwHq #sustainability

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: This is a really great and approachable explanation of some of the intricacy of the virus that causes COVID.  We already understand a ton of the molecular mechanism of SARS-CoV2, and have an army of brilliant scientists in national labs, universities, and companies across the world trying to translate that understanding into therapies and vaccines.  I can say without hesitation, that some of the best science that I have ever seen is at work right now in service of helping us defeat this pandemic.

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: Changed my LinkedIn headline to "graduate" a month ago and it still feels so surreal! Happy to share that I have graduated from Brown University with a Bachelor of Science in Cognitive Science and as a recipient of the Joslin Award, a University honor awarded to seniors who have significantly contributed to student wellbeing. Most importantly, I've graduated with a heart full of love for my peers who are true forces to be reckoned with.Thank you to those who have been in my corner at so many different points in my life, especially my loving family. I'd like to also specifically thank some incredible women in the Disability Justice and mental health field - Shirley Yen, Sarah Everhart Skeels, Alison Darcy, Athena Robinson PhD, Jade Daniels, Sarita Kohli, Stefanie Lyn Kaufman-Mthimkhulu, & Yema Yang to name a few. You have helped me grow in immeasurable ways. So what's next for me? I'm excited to return to Providence as an AmeriCorps VISTA fellow at the Center for Prisoner Health and Human Rights where I'll be work alongside formerly incarcerated Rhode Island residents on healthcare policy. Then, in 2021, I'm off to London to pursue a Masters of Science in Clinical Mental Health Sciences at the University College of London!#classof2020 #BrownUniversity #UCL #AmeriCorps

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: Today is truly bittersweet. I'm thrilled for my next step as CEO of Magic Leap and can't wait to work with the impressive and truly innovative team over there, but I am also sad to leave the amazing culture we have built here at Microsoft. I'll be forever inspired by the passion and dedication of all the people I've worked with at Microsoft and wish to extend a heartfelt thank you to each of you. You are what have made the past six years incredibly special for me. I'm particularly grateful for the example that Satya has set as a leader. I feel like I've had the privilege of a lifetime learning from the very best and will always be thankful for the guidance and mentorship he's shown me throughout my time at Microsoft – lessons I'll take with me to Magic Leap. I'm excited to be joining Magic Leap and building the future with that team, and will continue to cheer for all of my colleagues and friends at Microsoft.

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: Congratulations to Peggy Johnson on her new role as CEO of Magic Leap ! You have been an unbelievable boss, mentor, and friend. Thank you for everything.

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: 9 years ago I walked into the #MicrosoftStore in Bellevue. I’ll never forget seeing Ann playing Dance Central in the front window. I was amazed and thought to myself “wow, I can’t believe you don’t even need a controller to play games anymore.” After that day I kept coming back. I couldn’t begin to explain how special it felt that people knew my name and were so happy to see me. Little did they know that I was in foster care at the time and going through a lot of rough life changes but how they welcomed me meant the world to me! They didn’t care how I looked or how “tech” I was, they were just happy to see me come back and I kept coming back for 9 years. These stores and the people in them have changed my entire life. I never would have imagined that so many dreams would have come true or doors opened to me yet the best part was always the people inside of these stores. YOU, Microsoft family have shown me just how smart, strong, accepted, cared about and supported I am through our culture. This next chapter is about us bringing that culture outside of a physical store and into the rest of the world. I will miss this place tremendously but I know that this is the beginning of something even greater.

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: Very important piece on models in this week's Nature.  With COVID, now more than ever, data and models are front and center in reporting, policy-making, and our public discourse.  As these models become more important in everyone's lives, we modelers have a responsibility to ensure that they are serving society well.  I agree with the authors that modelers should be thinking about these five things as they do their work and disclose the results to the public.

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: I've been looking for data visualizations that give me an overall sense of the progression of the pandemic, and keep coming back to this one.It is basically a pie chart of new cases in the last week (reporting is highly periodic over 7 days), grouped by state.For each state, I divided the number of cases in the last 7 days by the number of cases in the week prior. States that had more cases this week than last are "Accelerating", and get a shade of red; others are "Decelerating" and get a shade of blue. States with the same number of cases are white.It doesn't give any sense of how many cases there are, but it does show me where they are, and points me to places to research. Michigan, for instance, is an anomaly here due to a reporting change, but Arizona appears to be experiencing a real upswing.https://lnkd.in/gvhUjvm

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: I am really loving the workflow that I have now for data wrangling.  Starting with the new Windows Terminal, Windows Subsystem for Linux, and Ubuntu, I've got all of my favorite Python goodies (pandas, numpy, matplotlib, scikit-learn, pymc3, etc.) and my favorite old school editor (vim).  I can start a Jupyter notebook server from my WSL Ubuntu shell, and have it throw open Microsoft Edge browser tabs.  And I can have my notebooks writing files into the Windows filesystem where I can pop them open with Excel or other tools.  My first Linux install was Slackware 2.0 that I dual booted with Windows 95.  We've come a long way...

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: I am really loving the workflow that I have now for data wrangling. And I can have my notebooks writing files into the Windows filesystem where I can pop them open with Excel or other tools.  My first Linux install was Slackware 2.0 that I dual booted with Windows 95.  We've come a long way...

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: In my Build 2020 Keynote this morning at 9:45am PDT, I'll be talking about some of the big technology trends shaping our lives as developers, and the things that we've been doing at Microsoft to push those trends forward.  We've got some exciting stuff to announce on our work in AI, and some pretty cool demos to show everyone.  You can watch, for free, at mybuild.microsoft.com.

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: At #Microsoft we're pushing the boundaries of #AI at Scale, training very large state-of-the-art AI models (e.g. language and language-vision) through world-class expertise, #Azure large-scale infrastructure, systems innovation, and massive amounts of data. We're using these models to enable many new experiences in our products (e.g. #Bing, #Office, and #Dynamics). We've started open sourcing the systems that we use and the models so that everybody can benefit. The animated video below provides a glimpse on this. Tomorrow I'll go into detail and show some demos at Kevin Scott's keynote "The Future of Tech".

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: A little over a year ago, I joined #Pinterest as the SVP of Technology. The world looks different than I thought it would around my first “Pinniversary”, but the opportunities before us are more apparent and abundant than ever before. As usage skyrockets, we're #hiring for roles from #machinelearning to #datascience and shopping, and building for a longterm vision of being a leader in visual discovery.

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: After almost a decade of decline, women graduating with CS degrees have finally surpassed the 2003 peak. We have a long way to go until gender parity, but let’s celebrate the achievement of young women and efforts to support increased diversity in CS!

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: COVID Operations 101, Part 4, Communication

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: At the onset of the pandemic, some were suggesting COVID was the great leveler. Turns out, this virus is not a leveler so much as an amplifier that is sharply accelerating the gaps in healthcare, jobs, and education that were already being experienced by underserved communities pre-pandemic. As the world starts to open back up for business, it will be critically important to extend the same sense of urgency that has been so rightfully focused on heroic frontline workers to include supporting our underserved communities as well.

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: If you have #COVID or recovered from it, please consider participating in this clinical study by @AdaptiveBiotech and @Health_IT, to help decode immune system response to this disease and produce open data for drug/vaccine discovery.

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: Last year, I spent some time in New Zealand and met with Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern. I was so impressed by that country's digital ambitions. Our new data center there will only accelerate its digital transformation and help propel all New Zealanders forward.

Name: Kevin Scott

Text: Paying it forward.  Today I paid it forward by donating my plasma that will be used to assists critical patients that have COVID.  I want to give a big shout out to this "small boutique" company I work at.  They have been so supportive in my journey to help save some lives here at Hackensack Medical Center, NJ.  #linkedinlife #linkedinfamily #payingitforward #COVID

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: We've been using our current stay-at-home moment to perform experiments in #personalagility utilizing the idea of #safetotry. The first successful example of that was an exercise in-home barbering to solve the lack of access to haircuts, and I've been happy with how that turned out.Our second major experiment was to foster a rescue dog. We'd been talking around the subject of getting a dog for a few years, but with my travel schedule and the lack of access to work-from-home for my partner, we felt like we couldn't leap. So we thought that fostering a rescue would be a safe way to see we were compatible with the dog life, but also to give a safe and loving home to a dog in need. If it didn't work out, we'd learn something, and it would help out shelter and a dog in the process. I have to report that we have had such great success with the experiment and found such an awesome pupper, that we've decided that we have a new family member and forever-dog.Meet Izzy...

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: At a time when there are hungry New Yorkers, no food should be wasted. Especially not something as nourishing as milk.As part of our newly launched Nourish New York Initiative, the state will partner with Chobani, Dairy Farmers of America, Upstate Niagara Cooperative, Inc., Cabot Creamery Co-operative and other NYS dairy producers to use excess milk to make yogurt and cheese that will be distributed to food banks & those in need.Thank you to all our partners on this effort to ensure New Yorkers across the state have access to dairy products.

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: Thanks Kevin Scott for giving me the words to describe how I operate. When people ask me if I'm "optimistic or pessimistic" I've normally described myself as "in the middle" but this is a much more precise explanation:"I’ve always thought of myself as a pessimist. At the very best, a short-term pessimist and long-term optimist. It’s sort of the engineering mindset. If you weren’t a short-term pessimist, you wouldn’t be able to see all of the sub-optimal things around you that need to be fixed. It’s also hard to be an engineer if you’re not a long-term optimist, because then you wouldn’t have the necessary faith that all of the brokenness that you see around you would be fixable at all."From:

Name: Kevin Scott

Name: Kevin Scott

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: It's my Birthday today, and my only wish this year (and my immediate need) is a good, full-time job or contract.Ok LinkedIn network, show me what you are capable of, after all, this is what you were meant for - Let's demonstrate the true power of LI Network.Applying directly to a job simply does not work anymore, please dig deep, make a personal introduction to the Hiring Manager or Senior Management.I fit well in most Marketing, Product Marketing, and Product Management roles: Strategic, Tactical; Individual Contributor, Manager; Business, Consumer; Funded startup to Large Company.I'm near SF, so the opportunity needs to be in the San Francisco Bay Area or Remote.Thank you in advance from me and my family.Best,TedP.S. Even if you don't have a lead for me right now, someone in your network might - A simple "Like" or "Share" can go a long way toward helping me find a great role!#Jobhunt#JobSearch#JobSeekers#HumanResources#GetHired#Careers#Fulltime#Contract#Freelance#RemoteWork #Consulting#Marketing#ProductMarketing#ProductManagement#DigitalMarketing#AdvertisingAndMarketing#Management#Strategy#Innovation#Technology#SanFranciscoBayArea#Amazon#Google#LinkedIn#Startups#Entrepreneurship#JobInterviews#HiringManagers#InItTogether #ThankYou

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: For years I've been fortunate to do work where the things I set out to accomplish every day are beyond my ability to achieve alone.  I've worked in amazing teams and with so many talented individuals, perhaps none more so than Jennifer Janzen who helps me manage nearly everything I do.  Thank you Jennifer for all you do to help me, our team, and Microsoft!

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: Happy Administrative Professionals' Day to my Executive Business Partner, Melissa Afentoulis who makes our team better every day.  While Melissa crushes it in all the boxes you'd expect of a high performing business partner - she offers so much more in terms of creativity, passion and is a great human being.  I'm grateful, Melissa!

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: Quarantine work !== Remote work. I’ve been work remotely with success for 13 years, and I’ve never been close to burn out. I’ve been work quarantined for over a month and I’m feeling a tinge if burn out for the first time in my life. Take care of yourself folks. Really.

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: While I don’t agree with all of Marc Andressen’s points, I applaud his directive: build! Take off the cuffs, cast all the infighting aside, and let’s all work together to realize our astounding untapped potential. I’m reading Kevin Scott’s book Reprogramming the American Dream right now. I think it could be a model for how we approach an unprecedented opportunity for growth. https://lnkd.in/e2YQFZt

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: If folks are interested in a diversion, my colleague Asa Hillis just published the first three maker videos on our new YouTube channel, Behind the Tech Labs.  We have a couple more videos of projects in the editing process right now, and plan to publish new project videos roughly once a month, with shorter techniques and tips videos in-between.  We'll be covering lots of ground, from fine woodwork, to machining and tool-making, to electronics.  Hopefully we'll inspire folks to let their imaginations run wild and go make stuff!

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: It's increasingly obvious that home isolation is taking a disproportionate toll on our colleagues with small children. I know words may not mean very much given the overwhelming circumstances, but, for what it's worth:1. You are not being judged if your output dips more than others. We know how hard this is. We've got your back.2. Getting to meet your family is a delight. Don't be self-conscious of interruptions or screaming kids. We're happy to reschedule meetings if you need to run suddenly.I have such deep respect for the parents who are persevering while having a second full-time job dropped unexpectedly on their lap. If there's anything your colleagues can do to make getting through this easier, let us know.

Name: Kevin Scott
Text: We are in the midst of tremendous uncertainty. But if history teaches us anything, it is that ingenuity coupled with compassion can be a salve, if not a cure. In this #WeekendEssay, I share an excerpt from my book "Reprogramming the American Dream: From Rural America to Silicon Valley – Making AI Serve Us All" (https://lnkd.in/g8ZQCTu) and explore the intersection of technology with the traits that make us human.

Text: Fantastic coverage by the The New York Times of Ultranauts Inc, a quality engineering startup that’s 100% remote with  75% of their workforce on the autism spectrum. They’re pioneering a new way of work for distributed and diverse teams, with valuable lessons for companies of all sizes. Proud to be an investor and to be helping the Ultranauts team scale up.  Stakeholder capitalism in action. #stakeholdercapitalism

Name: Francisco D'Souza
Text: Data is the new gold. 4 archetypes of data driven value creation1. New value pools2. New business models3. Richer stakeholder experiences4. Better decisions: and better decisions.The result of these new opportunities and incentives is a paradigm shift; companies can use data responsibly while developing sustainable new services and revenue streams. Since these new collaborations and partnerships are not constrained by traditional industry value chains, the cross-sectoral partnerships are eroding traditional value pools and shaping the industries of tomorrow.A new model based on collaborative ecosystems, trustworthy data stewardship and aligning business success with better outcomes for all, is already emerging.Hat tip: Derek O. Francisco D'Souza #datadriveninnovation #datastrategy #digitalstrategy

Text: I was delighted to read this last night even before this inaugural #entrepreneurship camp concludes today. These smart young people make me more hopeful about the future. And although next week's session is sold out, we just opened up a new section for August 10 - 14.Hi Mr. Barrood! I hope you are doing well. My name is M J and I am one of the students who is taking part in the Rutgers Global Entrepreneurship Experience virtual teen camp. I just wanted to reach out and let you know that I learned so many new things when it comes to leadership, collaboration, teamwork, STEM, etiquette, social entrepreneurship, and so much more. Name: Francisco D'Souza
Text: I'm really pleased we are able to support students like these. "I am following up on an email sent by my mother inquiring about scholarships for the Global Entrepreneurship Experience. As mentioned, because she is unable to work as she fights cancer, I am her primary caretaker.As a youth entrepreneur who is committed to educating my community and the African diaspora about the rich and inspirational heritage of Africa and learning first hand through my grandmother and mother about entrepreneurship it has always been a passion of mine to become an entrepreneur. I have always been fascinated about learning from more experienced entrepreneurs, in hopes of being just as successful one day. I love learning new things. By investing in me through one of your scholarships it will greatly impact the success of my business by increasing my knowledge base about entrepreneurship through the information your camp has to offer. If selected as an awardee, this opportunity will enable me to increase my chances of becoming a very successful youth entrepreneur. My dream is to hopefully have my product line on every major store shelf readily available to inspire others to learn about the rich heritage of Africa.  Thank you so much!"K Mhttps://lnkd.in/giSHv_M

Name: Francisco D'Souza
Text: Dear Team Cognizant,Today, on my last day in Cognizant after a memorable 18 years, I feel a deep sense of gratitude and humility. When I joined this organization in April 2002, little did I know that I was going to embark in one of the mostly exhilarating phase of my life, a journey of self-discovery, an experiment in expanding my horizons, challenging established assumptions and taking on world-class competitors. I realized that we should try to be the best we can be, and not imitate others, and never back down from the goal of doing good by our clients and our employees. Revenue and growth were outcome of that mindset, not the only objective. Thank you all for your help in this experience – for the countless friends that I acquired over the years. I learnt so much from so many of you, and you were there to lift me up in my private moments of despair, help win large deals, counsel when I needed advice, partner with us when we needed help. As I embark on the next exciting chapter of my professional life, I will carry these awesome memories and friendships with me. Good luck and thank you again. Best regards,Nachi

Name: Francisco D'Souza
Text: Join me Tuesday, May 12th to hear Dr. Robert Hariri, MD, PhD talk about fighting the virus with special immune cells.He will update us on:1. His research into Natural Killer Cells to fight #COVID2. Where we are in the war against the virus3. The strides Celularity is making toward increasing longevity4. Q&ARegister: https://bit.ly/2L7rX6ZDr. Bob Hariri is an accomplished surgeon, biomedical scientist, and serial #entrepreneur in two #technology sectors, #biomedicine and #aerospace. He is the chairman, founder, and CEO of Celularity, Inc., one of the world's leading human cellular #therapeutics companies. Dr. Hariri was the founder/ CEO of Anthrogenesis Corp, and after its acquisition by Celgene, served as CEO of Celgene Cellular Therapeutics. He also co-founded Human Longevity and has served on public boards including Cryoport (CYRX).Dr. Hariri pioneered the use of #stemcells to treat a range of life-threatening human diseases and continues today to make transformative contributions in the fields of immuno-oncology and cell therapeutics along with tissue engineering and functional regeneration. He and his team were the first to obtain FDA approval to use its cryopreserved allogeneic, off-the-shelf Natural Killer (NK) cell therapy to treat COVID infected adults.

Name: Francisco D'Souza
Text: This is Tyler, GE Healthcare engineer and a guru in the valves that are used to make ventilators. When he heard about the shortage, he and his wife packed their dog into the car and drove from Salt Lake City back to the plant in Madison, WI in one day — through an earthquake aftermath and a snowstorm — to help lend Tyler's skills. He arrived safely at the plant and is now hard at work, helping to make ventilators to support clinicians in the fight against #COVID.

Name: Francisco D'Souza
Text: During the height of the financial crisis in 2007/8, the team at Cognizant created this video to remind us, as Aristotle said, that “it is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light”.I’m sharing this video as a tribute to the health care workers caring for patients, the scientists who are work tirelessly to find treatments, the business leaders that have stepped forward with creative ideas, the governments and regulators who are work hard to find solutions and all the individuals who, through social distancing,  are helping to flatten the curve.Their collective leadership is shining through the fog. #COVID #flattenthecurve

Name: Francisco D'Souza
Text: My almost decade of journey at Cognizant came to end last week. No words can explain the incredible adventure it was.  I know that all good things must come to an end and I've had an incredible ride. I just wanted to end it on the right note, and I did.I was lucky to be part of Cognizant for the last decade. We accomplished a lifetime worth in this period. When I was hired to lead Healthcare BPO ten years ago we were the smallest in many ways.  We had an incredible amount fun in building One of the largest Healthcare BPO’s in the industry. Ten years ago, none of the analysts counted us as a significant player in this space, today Cognizant is sitting on top of the pack.I also had a wonderful opportunity to build the Healthcare BPaaS practice for the last five years. Such opportunities come once in a lifetime and I was the chosen one in this case. It would not be wrong to say my thinking totally got transformed in the process of building this practice.I have heard many people say, one can leave Cognizant, but it’s impossible to take Cognizant out of them. It’s so true.  I am excited about the possibilities in front of me at the same time I am sad to leave a team behind which made an impossible journey look easy to me. #cognizant #bpo

Name: Francisco D'Souza
Text: Another solid quarter for #Firstsource, revenues up by 7.0% Q-o-Q (4.7% in constant currency) and 6.9% Y-o-Y (8.3% in constant currency) at an operating margin of 11.2%. All of our business segments grew, with very strong growth in Mortgage. Our focused investment in ‘Digital First, Digital Now’ is driving new logo wins and industry and client recognitions. Thanks to all the 20,500 Firstsourcers globally for their continual efforts to deliver the best for our clients.

Name: Francisco D'Souza
Text: When we were building this trading platform we did not know that it would be once in a life time opportunity, a roller coaster ride like none of us had ever experienced before but to see the system every year and year on year scale new heights in the last 7 years has been the one that makes me specifically very proud. Architecting, designing, building and rolling out a high performance ultra low latency trading platform for an Exchange, now in hindsight, seems to be the most satisfying time of my professional journey thus far as a technologist, architect, designer and developer. For all my team members, client teams and Executives who supported us wholeheartedly to take the risks, make the calls, fall and rise - thank you one and all for never wavering confidence & support. #highperformancecomputing #lowlatency #stocktrading #tradingplatform #technologytransformation #scale #teams #derivatives #stockexchange

Name: Francisco D'Souza
Text: I’m mourning the loss of one of the greatest leaders I’ve ever known. Bernard J. Tyson was a man I had the privilege of calling my boss, mentor, teacher, confidant, and friend. He was an extraordinary man who led an extraordinary life, and his strength and courage inspired us all. As Chairman and CEO of Kaiser Permanente, he challenged us to reimagine health care with big and bold ideas. He championed the use of technology in health and how health care is provided. He has ignited a movement to transform health care in America, taking on homelessness, climate change, and other social determinants of health. For all of us at Kaiser Permanente, it will be our honor to carry forward his legacy.

Name: Francisco D'Souza
Text: On this special day having spent half my life at Cognizant and earned this Cognizant 25 award, I want to thank each one of my team, leaders, family, friends and my parents where I learned everything in my life who supported me being a successful leader in IT. Perform with purpose and be passionate in making a difference is what I've learned from my leadership. My strategy is always that a customer comes first and we strive for excellence in customer service. Name: Francisco D'Souza
Text: Just don't do itDon't buy LESS of Nike and don't buy MORE because of activism. Do whatever you need to as a rational consumerAs Margaret observed this week animal activists killed the circus. In doing so they deprived thousands of humans with odd skills of a job, indeed their year round family. Where were activists for those unusual humans? Where were activists for young kids who through the generations have had imaginations expanded after they saw exotic animals at a circus? Us parents should have made those decisions for our kids.Make your own decisions. Don't let professional activists sway you this way or that!

Name: Francisco D'Souza
Text: Many of you know I am a proud American and passionately, sometimes too loudly, defend what it stands forI arrived 40 years ago this month and was grateful to celebrate the milestone with my first visit to Ellis Island. Combined with visits to Lady Liberty and Brooklyn Bridge I am in awe of the grit and the amazingly hard work my predecessors put in to build this country. I arrived on a jet most of them did on uncomfortable boats. Without jackhammers or mobile phones they built wonders that survive To honor them I did some very simple things. I sought out and thanked every Park Police officer and Park Ranger I could meet. I also had a meal at the cafe many of them had their first American meal.Thank you to everyone who preceded me and made this such a beautiful country

Name: Adam Lashinsky
Text: Here's the #video link where I discuss China's upcoming #digitalcurrency with Fortune: "Rolling out a new [national] digital currency is a leap in innovation.. we're going to have money that we program to do things automatically, that has functionality"Q: How will #data be used by central banks and how will the central banks reassure people about the #privacy of their data?A: So there are big alarming questions that need to be properly considered when it comes to privacy and anonymity. The #technology is there to enforce anonymity, but it's a question of are they going to implement it? Is that something that they're going to build into their currency? Time will only tell if different central banks come up with their versions of digital currency, as they say there is no one-size-fits-all, they're all going to be different and likely to reflect the values and culture of their citizens. Are we just going to accept that all governments get to have this data like we've kind of accepted with tech giants like Facebook? No one has really done anything about it.#fortunemagazine #fortune500 #fortune #future #cbdc #blockchain #cryptocurrency #china https://lnkd.in/gTiKpDZ

Name: Hadi Partovi
Text: The 2020 State of Computer Science report by Code.org, CSTA, and ECEP. The good news: almost half of US schools teach CS thanks to the nationwide education movement. The bad news: access is unequal, and statistically predetermined by geography, wealth, and race. Lots of charts in the article below show how simple state policies have improved equitable access, and there's a long way to go.

Name: Hadi Partovi
Text: “Education in specific, growing technology fields like data science, AI, digital marketing, and information security can help individuals and communities pave a recovery. It’s also crucial to America’s continued competitiveness ... While we’re known as a hub of tech innovation, the U.S. does not rank in the top ten of business, data, or technology skills — and our technology skills are not equitably and widely distributed among our population.”

Name: Hadi Partovi
Text: This is the biggest tech news of the day, and is surprisingly overlooked. It’s true that driverless cars were overpromised, overhyped. But an actual citywide service for driverless taxis, especially during a pandemic. This isn’t a test. There are no safety drivers. It’s totally driverless transportation at citywide scale.

Name: Hadi Partovi
Text: Code.org is work to develop cross-curricular activity sets that allow teachers to embed CS opportunities into their traditional curriculum. This is a separate project from CS Fundamentals.We are in need of grade-level and subject-area experts in ELA, math, and/or science to co-design new integrated activities. We are looking for 3-5th grade elementary educators to work with our Curriculum team over the course of the next 3 months (Oct-Dec 2020) with the possibility of extension. The time commitment for co-designing will be about 3-5 hours per week and teachers will be paid for their time. Teachers will be asked to pilot new lessons with their students as part of the iterative process.Submit an application by Wednesday, October 14, 2020 via this form: https://lnkd.in/ghMBGvW

Name: Hadi Partovi
Text: Jumping from engineering leadership to spending a year work alongside Dan Lewis was a pretty unconventional career move, but gave me insights and perspectives I would never have gotten otherwise. More importantly, they helped me become a significantly better engineering leader for my next go-around!I'm looking forward to sharing what I learned at the SFELC Summit, and tell you why you might (or might not) want to consider doing something like this yourself. h/t Ari Bixhorn for the amazing GoT reference in the title ✋🤴🏼

Name: Hadi Partovi
Text: I took a walk with my daughter Michaela on Sunday. We needed to be together after the devastating news of Ruth Bader Ginsburg’s death on Friday. Justice Ginsburg was an icon in our home, and, true to form, Michaela was wearing her 'Notorious RBG' shirt that day. As we walked, many women stopped us to talk about what RBG meant to them, and it meant a lot to us to have that connection with strangers in a time of such sadness in the country.I’m angry that we have all been denied the opportunity to celebrate this extraordinary woman because the sadness we feel about her death is mixed immediately with fear and anxiety about what may lie ahead. It’s important to take a moment to remember that Ruth Bader Ginsburg changed the world for women. Long before she was Justice Ginsburg she fought for women’s equality in every realm--in the economy, in politics, and at home. She reminded us that there’s nothing absurd about dreaming of a future where nine women sit on the Supreme Court. It’s impossible to overstate what she did for us. Despite her small stature, she leaves enormous shoes to fill.The days since her passing have felt especially hard. I don’t know what the future will bring, but I hope we can all find strength for the challenges ahead in Justice Ginsburg’s fighting spirit.

Name: Hadi Partovi
Text: Docusign may be an even bigger winner than Zoom from the pandemic. Post-COVID, schools will stop needing Zoom. But pen/paper signatures should disappear forever now that banks, etc finally accept Docusign. As the dominant e-signature platform, I suspect Microsoft, Oracle, Salesforce will start a bidding war over Docusign.

Name: Hadi Partovi
Text: Shifting from "contract" to "dynamic pricing" is the premise of digital freight network. It provides transparency and guaranteed capacity at projected market rates without the high operational cost of an RFP. The idea has been around long enough; in fact, it was the topic of my research at MIT back in 2018.I am excited to see this grand idea comes to life here at Convoy Inc. I am proud to be part of the team that makes this accessible to our customers. Earlier today, #convoy officially launched Guaranteed Primary pricing program; available for all shippers. #freight #trucking #logistics #truckyeah #transportation

Name: Hadi Partovi
Text: ✨ ⁠Join Women Of MENA In Technology Washington D.C for our next online event hosted on Thursday, October 15th from 7:00 pm - 9:00 pm (EDT) with a network session and panel discussion on "The Future of Education."✨Our events are gender inclusive and open to all in Tech (STEM).⁠ Register: https://lnkd.in/g5i4bm2Meet Our Panelist: Hadi Partovi, Tech Entrepreneur, Investor, CEO - Code.orgHadi Partovi is a tech entrepreneur and investor, and CEO of the education non-profit Code.org.A computer science graduate of Harvard University, Hadi began his career during the browser wars in the 1990s, when he led the Microsoft Internet Explorer team. In a second stint at Microsoft, he was General Manager of the MSN portal, delivering its first year of profit.As an entrepreneur, Hadi was on the founding teams of Tellme Networks and iLike, which were acquired by Microsoft and MySpace, respectively.Hadi has served as an early advisor to numerous startups including Facebook and Dropbox, and as a tech investor his portfolio also includes airbnb, Uber, SpaceX, Zappos, and others. Aside from his investments, Hadi also serves as a Director on the boards of Axon and Convoy.

Name: Hadi Partovi
Text: Playful teams can be serious about changing the world!I'm so excited to share a workshop series that Christina McFadden, CPCC, PCC (she/her) and I will be co-facilitating in mid-September. The Playful Meetings for Meeting Leaders workshop series is designed for anyone who leads virtual meetings and wants to spark authentic connection and creativity with their team or group. You'll experience a handful of engaging 5-7 minute activities that are ideal to kick off your virtual meetings, and can be easily adapted for a variety of team sizes and video call platforms. Come be professionally playful with us!Note: This workshop is a 2-part series, but folks can register for either or both weeks, as we'll be covering different activities at each one! #professionallyplayful#fashionablyfun <-- Christina, that's for you :)#meetingleaders#virtualmeetings#virtualteams#remotework#preppingforwinterinvideocallland <-- you know it's coming

I remain a hard NO on California Prop 24 as a strong lifelong advocate for privacy, public safety and ethics in our online and offline existence.

Name: Eric Goldman
Text: Some big news – The other week I officially stepped down as Chairman of @LexMachina and leading Analytics at LexisNexis - focusing on my campaign to represent one million residents of Silicon Valley in the CA State Senate.  I’m so proud of all we accomplished at Lex Machina – creating the category of Legal Analytics and fulfilling our mission of bringing openness and transparency to the law. I’m excited to see what the team and LexisNexis will continue to create.I am running to make California a leader on fighting climate change, promoting economic opportunity, racial equality (and improving our justice system), funding our schools and ensuring our residents have access to affordable healthcare and housing. 1. If you would like more information about my campaign visit joshbecker2020.com2. If you live in the District - please vote for me (Silicon Valley from the border of SF down to Sunnyvale).3. If you want to support the campaign you can do so here. Thanks all and stay in touch!

When it comes to the government regulating the Internet--our greatest most important means of worldwide human communication--I urge you all to stay vigilant.#NoOnProp24 #CPRA #privacytech #privacy #ccpa #dataprotection #dataprivacy #gdpr #infosec

Name: Eric Goldman
Text: Should #internet #platforms be liable for user-generated content?This question is at the heart of an ongoing debate over the U.S. Communications Decency Act (#CDA), section 230.Here's a short clip explaining the CDA, section 230: https://lnkd.in/gz5dbYFHere is a more detailed explanation that goes into the "nitty gritty" of the proposed amendments: https://lnkd.in/gtmEFDrWhile the debate over section 230 has implications for the upcoming Presidential election, it also has implications within Canada.Many Canadian claims concerning content should logically involve U.S. corporate parties which own/host platforms. However, certain Canadian court orders against those parties may not have any practical force. See my prior post mentioning the Equustek saga: https://lnkd.in/gbKE7zJThis obviously affects Canadian litigation strategy over U.S. internet platforms.Amendment of section 230 would remove an automatic immunity currently enjoyed by U.S. platforms. It is posed to drastically affect internet regulation on an international scale.Stay tuned for more updates.#data #bigdata #privacy #defamation #cyberdefamation #cyberlibel #socialmedia #litigationmanagement #litigation

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: “The reality of it all is that we've got to take care of ourselves and be committed to our partner (employee) base. We want to make sure we got our own house in order before we take on everything else," [Roz] Brewer said, adding, "We want to lead by example and set the tone, which is why you'll see us get a lot more intentional about what we want to do in this space." #inclusion

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: We continue our journey at Starbucks to advance racial and social equity on behalf of our partners (employees) and the communities we serve.  As we consider the role and responsibility, as a company, to lead by example in areas of inclusion, diversity, and equity, we will: 1) be intentional about the actions we take and how they line up with our Mission and Values, 2) commit to transparency with all stakeholders about our thinking and our goals, and 3) hold ourselves accountable.  Today we shared our next steps.

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: Thank you for your continued stewardship, Michael. We know that leadership in sustainability takes investment, innovation, partnership and an enduring commitment.  We continue our journey here at Starbucks.

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: After seven years of some of the most rewarding experiences of my life, I’ve decided to move on from Starbucks at the end of the year.  Below is Kevin Johnson’s note to Starbucks partners.    Serving the 400,000 Green Apron partners around the world has enhanced my life in ways I could not imagine when I started and being part of the Starbucks family has been a distinct privilege in my life.  But after a particularly intense year full of turmoil, we are now out of crisis mode and on a path to recovery.  As hard as it is to leave, now is the right time for a transition to some exciting new challenges in the new year. Considering the global hardship and tragedies from COVID, I feel especially blessed to have had a career that has created options like this at this point in my life.  Teddy Roosevelt said, “the greatest gift life has to offer is the opportunity to work hard at work with doing.”  Working hard with the best Public Affairs and Social Impact team in the world has been an amazing gift for which I will always be grateful.

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: At Starbucks, we have a responsibility to build bridges and a mission to inspire and nurture the human spirit. As citizens in a democracy, we have the right and responsibility to vote as the most visible and impactful way to have a voice in our system of government at all levels. Starbucks is taking several steps forward this year to make sure that no partner will have to choose between work their shift or voting for the candidates of their choice, on or before Election Day.

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: “Starbucks still sees a future where customers will seek "that third place connection," especially as more therapeutics for the virus are made available. With more than 32,000 stores worldwide, Starbucks has always promoted itself as a destination — or a "third place" between work and home.But at least for now — with more of its clientele work from home and scores more unemployed — customers that seek those "safe, familiar, and convenient" experiences will bode well for the coffee giant, Johnson said. Those customers can choose from options like drive-thru, mobile order for pickup, contactless pickup, and the upcoming curbside pickup offering.” Cc: Reggie Borges, Maggie Jantzen

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: Making a positive social impact runs deep at Starbucks. Since the beginning, our purpose has gone beyond profit. We believe in the pursuit of doing good. The idea of Starbucks being a Third Place for the community to gather means our stores have often served not only as a place for human connection, where everyone can feel welcome, but also as a beacon of hope and resilience during crisis – whether that’s the aftermath of an earthquake, hurricane or a wildfire, or now as we re-open and strive to provide some normalcy in the midst of the global pandemic.   I am very proud to share with the world our latest global social impact report and look forward to continuing the work forward here at Starbucks.

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: This past Saturday we called for an open forum for any Starbucks partners who felt compelled to join a conversation about the murders of George Floyd, Ahmaud Arbery and Breonna Taylor and the many other racial injustices that have shaken the entire country and each one of us. Two thousand partners – many joined by family members — came together virtually to share stories, express emotions, and support one another as we all try to make sense of what is happening in our society.  As we all deal with our personal feelings and experiences through this, there are important questions in front of us. How can we help each other heal, and how can we contribute to society in a positive and constructive way on the topic of racism and injustice? https://lnkd.in/g98wsG7

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: 1 million cups of coffee (and counting) donated by our our green apron partners to our front-line responders. Thank you all for your continued dedication to serving your communities.

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: Today, in a letter to Starbucks partners (employees), I have outlined how we will transition to a new phase of operations in the U.S., best described as “monitor and adapt,” based on experience in China during COVID. As was the case in China, Starbucks will gradually expand and shift the customer experiences enabled in stores based on a clear decision-making framework.  Through all this, Starbucks remains resilient and in service of over 32,000 communities around the world, including our heroic front line responders.

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: Great news. We value our partnership together, Rich Pierson and Headspace Inc.-- in these times and always.

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: On Saturday morning, something incredible happened. Our partners in every region around the U.S. and Canada showed up before dawn to open drive-thru-only experiences at their stores. They filled in for each other at short-staffed nearby stores. Our stores that could open, did. Our partners showed up. They showed up for their communities.

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: For decades, Starbucks has worked to invest in, and create the best possible experience for partners (employees). We were among the first companies to offer comprehensive health benefits and equity to those who work just 20 hours or more a week. And why we offer paid sick leave and personal time off, as well as catastrophe pay in such uncertain times as this one.  We also know that mental health is vital to our society’s well-being.  Today, we announced that we are enhancing our mental health benefits for U.S. partners, based directly on their feedback.

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: It is our intent to remain transparent as we navigate the dynamic situation of COVID. Starbucks resilience is owed to our unwavering Mission to inspire and nurture the human spirit – one person, one cup and one neighborhood at a time.

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: Every name on every Starbucks cup has a unique story. #whatsyourname

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: Sustainability has been at Starbucks core since the beginning and is part of our belief that we can build a great business that scales for good.  Today we announce our aspiration to become resource positive – storing more carbon than we emit, eliminating waste, and providing more clean freshwater than we use.

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: What a great day spending time with Giampaolo and team at the Milan Roastery in the run up to the Holiday Season.  Thank you! #tobeapartner #giampaologrossi

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: What a fantastic week as we opened the largest Starbucks in the world... the Starbucks Reserve Roastery Chicago.  Our Siren retail, design, coffee, roasting, Princi food, and operations teams of partners have created an experience that has surpassed all expectations.  A must-see destination! https://lnkd.in/gFJjfD9

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: According to the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs, more than 1.7 million Veterans received treatment in a VA mental health specialty program in fiscal year 2018. I can only imagine there are many more who go without the necessary support they need. In work with Veteran Service Organizations (VSO) like Team Red, White & Blue and Team Rubicon, spending time listening to our partners (employees) who are Veterans or military spouses, and hearing stories from Starbucks customers like Vic, it’s clear to me we have more work to do.By continuing to listen and learn, and in partnering with others, I am confident we can play a role in elevating the conversation around mental health. Because, for those that have given so much to this great country, they deserve nothing but our best in return. On Veterans Day and every day, we thank you.

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: It was great to join Marty Hartman and the team at Mary's Place today to kick off the 2019 No Child Sleeps Outside. I’m proud that Regence BlueShield is supporting this year’s campaign and a huge thank you to the folks at Starbucks, including Kevin Johnson who announced their generous support. You can find how you can get involved here - https://lnkd.in/ebVUjxH

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: Can Dreams change the world? To continue the conversation that began a year ago about the corporate values ​​that Starbucks represents all around the world, during the fifth edition of Dreamers Day Nov 17th, 2019 Teatro Dal Verme Milan, three wonderful people will go on stage, Cristina, Junior and Andrea who will tell their extraordinary stories.  You can be the best manager in the world, qualified and prepared but if you don't have the People by your side you will never be anyone. #Dreamersday #dreamersday2019 #motivation #life #Team #people #candreamschangetheworld #Starbucks  Francesca Del Nero Paolo Gallo Diego Agostini Giuseppe Stigliano Martin Brok Bob Marcus Anna Torri Leone Felaco Emmanuel Sogah Maurizio Cacopardo Alessandro Lana Kevin Johnson

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: I don’t think it’s a coincidence that the age of unparalleled technological connection is unfolding concurrently with the age of unprecedented human disconnection. I believe technology is instrumental to realizing our potential – both personal and societal – but our current obsession and addiction to technology, and the mobile device we all carry with us, threatens to destroy the most essential elements of the human experience. We’ve got to find a healthy, balanced path forward – a path to realizing our potential while also living a life rich in human interaction, personal fulfillment, and shared joy. #artificialintelligence #AI #machinelearning

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: Thanks to Starbucks CEO Kevin Johnson for an inspiring conversation last night at War Memorial Gymnasium! The latest speaker in USF's Silk Speaker Series, Kevin spoke about his commitment to compassionate, transformational leadership at one of the world's largest companies☕️

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: Some days you just win the work lottery. What an honor to have Kevin Johnson and Jay Shetty both at Microsoft to talk about the importance of purpose in our work and in our lives. Kevin is a remarkable, authentic and compassionate leader who hired me into Microsoft -and he’s been an incredible mentor ever since. While I just met Jay for the first time, I feel like I’ve known him for years and was deeply moved by the wisdom and love he shared with us. Both are inspirational leaders –and they’re also just a ton of fun to be around. 😊

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: Cover reveal! Sharing the cover of my upcoming book with you is giving me the chills! It comes out officially Oct 22nd in the US!💛It’s available for pre-order on all major platforms including Amazonhttps://lnkd.in/gKnBDwe  Pre-sales are excellent and the publisher decided to do a second printing already! 🙌💛When I was desperately trying to figure out how to be wildly successful AND vibrantly healthy, I promised that if I ever figured it out and got better, I would SERVE, I would give back, and I would do something that had a positive impact. 💛And here it is! The book I wish I had back then! It saved my life and it will change you too. I used to ask myself: What if there were a book that:Proved you could DO WELL and BE WELL simultaneously?Taught you how to customize the 18 spokes of well-being just for YOU?Shared surprising secrets of 18 jaw-dropping CEOs and Founders who are leveraging well-being for immense power?THIS is that book!! I can’t wait to hear what you think.Chip Conley Gopi Kallayil Kara Goldin Riley Etheridge Yanik Silver Scott Kucirek Denise Brosseau May Lindstrom Rich Fernandez Steven Rice Kevin Johnson Robyn Denholm Judy Belk John Worden Marie Case⭐️ Jen Groover ⭐️

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: I’m full of gratitude from attending Starbucks Chicago Leadership Experience 2019.  Receiving the key to Pike Place, sessions by Common, Brené Brown, & Eitan Sharir, development workshops hosted by our senior leadership team, meeting our CEO, Kevin Johnson & sitting front row with my team watching John Legend perform. Thank you to the many leaders who have allowed me to be vulnerable while growing with this company. “When you're surrounded by people who share a passionate commitment around a common purpose, anything is possible.”Howard Schultz you can relax and be very proud of the future of Starbucks.  #commonpurpose #passionate #LE19 #starbucks #powerofone #inthismoment

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: It has long been our belief that when we put our partners first, the result is an elevated Starbucks Experience for our stores, our customers, and our communities.This morning, more than 12,000 Starbucks store managers and field leaders have come together at the United Center in Chicago to kick off Leadership Experience 2019, the largest partner-focused gathering in this company’s history. Over the next two days, we are going to reflect on the journey we’ve been on as a company over the last 48 years and chart out how we will build the next 50 years of the Starbucks legacy. #LE19https://lnkd.in/ejUmtH7

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: Great customer experiences become destinations and destinations are complemented and amplified through digital customer relationships. That is the transformative formula for modern-day brick-and-mortar retailers. This week, we announced two new exciting milestones in as we continue to expand our digital capabilities and reach more customers.

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: Rebecca Zimmer is a certified badass. Proud @starbucks partner right here.

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: One of the most exciting examples of Starbucks new innovation culture is the Tryer Center – our 20,000 square-foot facility in the Seattle SSC. Based on the principles of human-centered design, Tryer is a space where anyone, from partners who work at the SSC to our baristas in the field, can have an idea, put it to the test, and learn and adapt quickly – moving from idea to action in 100 days.

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: To the audience of nearly 4,000 shareholders, partners and special guests at our 27th Annual Meeting this past week, I posed the question, "What does it take to build an enduring company?"​ ...Here’s what I believe.

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: Starbucks annual meeting of the shareholders. My team and I got to meet Kevin Johnson CEO Starbucks and eat all the sweet treats. We remain a revenue driven company through the eyes of humanity. #annualmeetings #shareholder #tobepartner #starbucks

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: Over the past 48 years we have worked to build a different kind of company based on a mission grounded in the human experience, the world’s finest coffees, and a constant of pursuit of doing good. Starbucks now serves more than 100 million customer occasions across 78 markets around the world. It all started with our first store in Seattle, Washington, and we now celebrate Starbucks 30,000th store that just opened in Shenzhen, China.https://lnkd.in/g3HihGr

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: Our Starbucks Reserve Roasteries are brand amplifiers that allow us to share our most creative expressions of premium coffee, innovation and human connection around the world. We have just opened our Fifth Roastery  in the heart of the Nakameguro neighborhood in Tokyo, Japan, and I could not be more honored to have stood beside the remarkable team that brought to life four floors of coffee passion and design that overwhelm the senses.  Thank you Takafumi Minaguchi, Liz Muller, Kengo Kuma, John Culver, and all our Japanese Starbucks Partners who have delivered an unwavering commitment to excellence.  I leave with great pride and look forward to coming back soon.

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: Great news for our global coffee alliance with @Nestle. Starbucks will now be available for Nespresso and NESCAFE Dolce Gusto at home coffee systems as we look to bring our premium coffee to more homes around the world.  https://lnkd.in/gEBs-V6

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: There are more than 350,000 Starbucks partners around the world. This week, we celebrated those who helped us open our 1,000th store in Latin America. Thank you to everyone who made this day special and for continuing to elevate the coffee experience for our customers and the community of Mexico City.

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: There are more than 350,000 Starbucks partners around the world. This week, we celebrated those who helped us open our 1,000th store in Latin America. Thank you to everyone who made this day special and for continuing to elevate the coffee experience for our customers and the community of Mexico City.

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: Thank you Satya Nadella, Brad Smith and Microsoft for your leadership on this issue and for your significant contribution to a complex problem in our region.

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: The Puget Sound is Microsoft’s home, and it has been foundational to our success. We believe everyone who works here – our employees and business partners at Microsoft, and all those who serve the broader community, from teachers and small business owners, to first responders and medical practitioners – should be able to live here. And we are committed to doing our part to help.

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: #AffordableHousing in the Puget Sound region is in short supply and the housing gap is only continuing to widen, pushing out members of our community. It’s time for us to come together and address this growing problem.

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: 🚗 Need a break from the morning coffee rush?☕ Starbucks Reserve Roastery is serving up an immersive coffee experience at its new 2️⃣ 3️⃣,0️⃣0️⃣0️⃣-square-foot location. More than 1.5 million pounds of coffee will be roasted here every year. Take a look inside.

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: Yesterday I shared some reflections and aspirations with our over 350,000 partners who wear the green apron, and a commitment to continue to embrace our mission and values and do our best to strengthen the communities in which we serve. Today, I share these thoughts with you as well as I wish you all a Happy New Year...

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: Reflecting on this past year, I couldn’t be more proud of our partners and the impact our brand can have on the communities we serve!  Thank you to each and every partner who helped bring the following programs, initiatives, focus and priorities to life here in market in 2018!  Inspiring and nurturing the human spirit, one person, one cup and one neighborhood at a time! 👊🏼

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: Starbucks 2018: The year in picturesBy Joshua Trujillo / Starbucks NewsroomStarbucks is a coffee company that is all about people. It all starts with coffee – high-quality coffee served to customers around the globe. But it is the lens of humanity that has helped redefine the role of a for-profit company.In 2018, some of the company’s most important moments showcased that spirit: creating opportunity for young people; hiring and caring for military families; standing firm against bias; educating and serving coffee farmers. There were also a couple of great parties as Starbucks opened a Reserve Roastery in Milan, Italy, and New York City.Here are some of the pictures that showcase 2018’s amazing moments.

Name: Kevin Johnson
Text: “Starbucks partners consistently share with us their passion for service both in and out of their stores,” said Virginia Bergin Tenpenny, vice president of Global Social Impact at Starbucks and executive director of The Starbucks Foundation. “The Service Fellows program powers that passion through philanthropy and partnerships to have the greatest impact. Our Service Fellows program is an innovative approach that combines work, service, and partnerships, a model that will inform how we catalyze our partners and grantees to create enduring change in our communities.”

Name: Jon Fortt
Text: The 5G-capable iPhone 12 has launched, and carriers are ramping up marketing for the faster networks. But will consumers really get the speedy experience they've been promised? How quickly can the networks improve? How much of the early 5G economy will center of industrial and enterprise, and how will that affect the U.S.'s competitive position with China and other geographies?Qualcomm is a key player in 5G, providing IP that's essential throughout the technology stack. We'll explore all these questions and more, and take your questions, in a 5G deep dive with Qualcomm's Durga Malladi. Industry analysts Patrick Moorhead and Chetan Sharma will join me.

Name: Jon Fortt
Text: New from Fortt Media's Cross Cultural Newsletter:An example of the power of shared physical space as a first step to bridging culture comes to us in Acts 8: 26-39. In the passage, Philip the Evangelist has a significant encounter with a seeker from Africa, which is important enough that an angel and the Holy Spirit both intervene to make it successful. In this encounter, Philip's physical interaction with the Ethiopian convert is one of the most noteworthy parts of the process. I think it also offers an admonition to us that crossing cultures is an intimate business, and shouldn't be attempted at arm's length.If it resonates with you, please subscribe and share.https://lnkd.in/gS28ZRd#biblestudy #bible #pastors #forttmedia #diversity #culture #evangelism #newsletter

Name: Jon Fortt
Text: Role models matter.This was one of the most #challenging, and #fulfilling, weeks of my #career. I helped lead the conception and #execution of a CNBC primetime special and a CNBC Events presentation focused on the #Black experience in #corporate #America and the path forward. We focused on #data, not politics, and tried to illuminate ways companies and leaders can work toward #equality of #opportunity for everyone.It was hard. Really hard. I had to push my point of view on why we should frame things in certain ways and not others, and I had to be vulnerable to show how my personal #experience was relevant to our mission.I also had to help gather the right voices. One of the best was my friend of 20 years, Lloyd Pierce, now head coach of the Atlanta Hawks.#representation #leadership #culture #storytelling #sports #blackexcellence #diversity #captioned #CNBC

Name: Jon Fortt
Text: Two years ago today, I started at LinkedIn. My son was four days old, having arrived much earlier than anticipated. I left him with my wife to come in for orientation, and I will admit to being more than a little nervous. I was starting a new job in a new industry with colleagues I mostly didn't know well. 732 days later, I have discovered the most creatively and intellectually satisfying chapter of my career. It's an honor to work among entrepreneurial, visionary journalists deeply committed to bringing members the news and views that will drive their professional lives forward. And yes, I am still counting my time here in days because it still feels as though I've just arrived; as much as we've created in these past two years, the most interesting challenges are just ahead of us.

Name: Jon Fortt
Text: Today, I am excited (and nervous!) to start a new role - Director of Corporate Communications, at Chegg.  Chegg is a fast-growing, public company; the leading student-first connected learning platform, with a mission to help every student achieve their best, in school and beyond. The online learning platform roughly doubled overnight when schools shut down during COVID The company’s stock is up almost 80 percent this year. I’m excited as it is not only professionally exhilarating to join Marc Boxser and the rest of the world-class team at Chegg, but a personal passion. As a mom of two school-age boys with individualized needs, I see their daily struggles to learn and grow. I believe every student worldwide deserves the chance to reach their full potential. They should not be inhibited by access, or affordability. Chegg started out as an education technology company focused on affordability and accessibility, but now the company helps students every step of their journey from learning to earning. I am looking forward to building out a professional communications practice, work with agencies around the world, and mentoring and developing the team of strong, ambitious communications professionals. #newjob #corporatecommunications

Name: Jon Fortt
Text: You can't make deals you can't see. When Jason Calacanis was getting started as an angel investor, he relied partly on contacts he made as a journalist covering technology in New York and Silicon Valley. One of them, Travis Kalanick, had an idea for solving San Francisco's notorious taxi problem with the iPhone's new GPS feature and an innovative payment mechanism. That idea became Uber, and Calacanis's small-dollar investment became, well, big. He told me about it in this Fortt Knox archive conversation. Subscribe to the new weekly Fortt Knox Newsletter! https://lnkd.in/gTMFmyc #forttknox #angelinvesting #uber #inspiration #risk #entrepreneurship #technology #investors #deals #talent #startups #public #stocks #stockmarket #iphone #gps #maps #NYSE #CNBC #captioned

Name: Jon Fortt
Text: Rob LoCascio founded brand-to-consumer chat LivePerson during the dotcom boom and kept it alive during the bust. Now, with ecommerce more essential than ever, the public company is valued at more than $3 billion. I'll talk to him about the latest problems he's trying to solve, his entrepreneurial path, and what's next for artificial intelligence and the conversational cloud.

Name: Stephen Balkam
Text: Today on the Aspen UK podcast - what does the future of online safety look like? Many of us are now living much of our personal and professional lives online. What threats to online safety has this revealed, and what challenges does this pose?Stephen Balkam, founder and CEO of Family Online Safety Institute is joined by Richard Allan, formerly of Facebook, Tessy Ojo FRSA, CEO of The Diana Award, and Vicki Nash, Deputy Director of Oxford Internet Institute, University of Oxford.

Name: Stephen Balkam
Text: Are you and your kids tech ready for this unprecedented school year?  Join some of the top experts in the field talking about great online content and experiences.  Panelists include Alicia Blum-Ross, Josianne Galea Baron, James Filippatos as well as Deirdre Quarnstrom and Leanna Prater for an in depth conversation this Thursday at 11am ET.  And there'll be a virtual exhibit area to go deeper into the topics raised.

Name: Stephen Balkam
Text: Got kids at home this school year?  Join us on Thursday, Sept 10 at 11am for this vital discussion where we explore:- How can we shape kids' online experiences to include meaningful, enriching material that supports their academic success?- Where can parents easily find entertaining and educational ways to play and learn online with their children? - How to parents know their child is interacting with safe, appropriate online, that are positive for their digital wellbeing and protective of their rights online?

Name: Stephen Balkam
Text: Personal update: This summer, I moved on from the Center for Democracy & Technology #cloud #digital #privacy  for Democracy and Technology to take up a new position with Workday, starting this month. Workday is a leading provider of cloud-based enterprise applications. We are growing fast in Europe and globally, and my role will be to drive our engagements with European policy makers on issues that matter to the company and to Europe’s digital economy and society. We’ll be active on  #artificialintelligenceai, #dataprotection, #workforcedevelopment #blockchaintechnology etc. I will be building on the excellent work done by the Workday Public Policy and Corporate Affairs team, and will be work with colleagues and friends at BSA | The Software Alliance, BITKOM e.V. etc. More about Workday's Public Policy priorities here:

Name: Stephen Balkam
Text: To my friends and former colleagues who work at Facebook, I wrote you something. I sincerely hope it helps. https://lnkd.in/gxUuw-XTo everyone else, we are facing a lot of problems right now. I don't know what to do about most of them so I wrote about the one I do know at least a little bit about–misinformation and divisiveness on Facebook. It doesn't mean I think it's more important than any of the other problems. However, I do think it is making everything worse and it's worth some thought and attention. That's what I gave it. No more. No less.Feedback welcome.

Name: Stephen Balkam
Text: Today is my last work day at #Amazon. The past 4 years have been very dynamic and amazing for me, both professionally and personally: starting with basically no team… and then building up a strong team of public policy super heroes (Matthias Ernst, Anett Sachtleben, Lutz Reulecke, Mareike von Frieling, Thorsten Freers, Anael Licht, Anna Kerner). It is very rare to be part of such a ride! I have enjoyed every step along the way and I appreciate having had the opportunity to work with such outstanding teams, colleagues and policy stakeholders. Having worked for companies like #AOL and #Facebook in the past I came to the conclusion that it is now the right time for me to join the next generation of social media companies: As of August 1st I will be joining #TikTok as Director Public Policy in Berlin. Looking forward to work with Theo Bertram, Gudrun Herrmann and the rest of the crew.

Name: Stephen Balkam
Text: Meet Owen....Owen was stationed under the Eiffel Tower (literally!) during his service in the Army Air Force during WWII. He was commissioned to paint nose art on many planes, including Doc, one of the only two B-29 bomber planes still flying today. He is truly an amazing man. His 101st birthday party was canceled because of the impact of the Coronavirus. Please share and comment to help us make his upcoming birthday special. Please leave him a message here and they promise he’ll get it at his assisted living facility. Take 60 seconds and do it for Owen!

Name: Stephen Balkam
Text: Spread the word.  As a country we have an enormous task to ensure those with little or no Internet access can bridge the digital divide as we stay at home with our kids during this challenging time.  Kudos to Comcast and a shout out to Rudy Brioche and his colleagues for this inspired move.

Text: Excited to have been part of the 2nd annual ‘State of Cybersecurity’ at Georgetown University last month.
