Name: Stephen Balkam
Text: “Australia’s e-Safety Commissioner, Julie Inman-Grant, started her tech involvement with @Microsoft when the tech industry could do no wrong: ‘‘Fast forward two decades and the policy pen- dulum is definitely swinging the other way, with calls in the US for section 230 to be repealed and governments across the world seriously contemplating whether internet industry should be more closely regulated,’’ she told the National Press Club in Canberra last year.”Remembering those early, heady days of nascent tech policy of the 1990s when we were full of hope for the promise of technology Larry Irving Stephen Balkam Jonah Seiger - Then, the industry did move too fast and broke things. And, Governments are left to fix an online world that is collapsing under its own weight...

Text: Super interesting the conversation between Julie Sweet (Global CEO Accenture) and Alan Murray (CEO Fortune)regarding how Pandemic has transformed the business. 3️⃣ BIG SHIFTS:1. Opportunity to Accelerate the achievement of The UN's Sustainable Development GoalsJulie's main advices for constructing the future:🧰 Focus on stakeholders: develop a responsible business by design🎯 Define how the business will emerge strong by the crisis🚶🏻‍♀️🚶🏼Invest in the people, re-skill the workforceVery interesting video. Take your time to watch it. Thanks Fortune to share it. #digitaltransformationstrategy #digitaltransformation #womenleaders #womeninbusiness #innovation #entrepreneurship

Name: Alan Murray
Text: Our CEO Carlos Brito joined Fortune Magazine's CEO Alan Murray and Editor-in-Chief Clifton Leaf on the #LeadershipNext podcast to share some ways we are helping farmers thrive and how we've offered support to retailers during the pandemic. Brito also discusses some of our efforts that earned AB InBev a spot on the 2020 Fortune #ChangeTheWorld list. He explains that 95% of our products are brewed locally from local ingredients, and then sold locally. This means our policies have a direct impact on communities around the world, and it makes caring for those communities a clear business imperative. Listen here for the full podcast: https://lnkd.in/efAcARG#TogetherForBetter

Name: Alan Murray
Text: “When I think of law firms, I think of them as super-spreaders - but in a good way! They have such a broad reach.” This statement couldn’t be more true, as stated by Margery Kraus, Founder and Executive Chairman of APCO Worldwide,  and the moderator of a panel discussion “Leading with Courage: A Statement from Business Leaders for Renewed Global Cooperation” during one of the United Nations opening plenary sessions this morning.“It is around value and purpose – not just what the law says. What can we as a law firm do to understand the issues and ultimately give better advice to clients?” Kevin Coon of global law firm Baker McKenzie.“The Big4 accounting firms have done some good work – but more needs to be done around measurement and accountability – to help ensure the #sdgs are achieved” added Alan Murray, CEO of Fortune Media.And finally, Dov Seidman, Founder and Chairman of LRN and The HOW Institute for Society, added “The business of business is no longer just business. The business of business now must be society!”Wise words, indeed.Many great sessions remain during this week’s General Assembly of the United Nations in this, the 75th year since its inception. #lawfirms #accountancy #esg #buildbackbetter #UnitingBusiness

Name: Alan Murray
Text: Which companies are changing the world through core and profitable business (not symbolic charity)?Fortune released its 2020 Change the World list with vaccine makers as a collaborative group awarded top spot. Familiar top ten names include Alibaba Group, PayPal, Zoom, BlackRock and Walmart.It's not so much who made the list, it is why. Alan Murray explains:"Is this a list of “good” companies? We make no such claim. Companies are as complicated as people; they do good and they do bad. But these are companies that have found innovative ways to have a measurable social impact and also make profits, all at the same time"These companies are successfully transitioning to the new economy.#sharedvalue #stakeholdercapitalism #leadership #purpose #strategy

Name: Alan Murray
Text: Businesses are under increasing pressure to take care of all their stakeholders and lead in a world that’s facing multiple crises. As a result, many CEOs are reevaluating the status quo and considering how we can all do better to advocate for the society we want to live in. I’ve shared this perspective for a while now, but this year it has come into focus perhaps more than ever before: Our system of capitalism needs an upgrade—and it’s a moral obligation for business leaders to be part of the solution. My thanks to Alan Murray and Ellen McGirt for hosting me on Fortune's “Leadership Next” podcast to have this important conversation.

Name: Alan Murray
Text: Back in 2014, Marzieh Ebrahimi had an appointment with a dentist and was stuck in traffic in the central Iranian province of Isfahan. She rolled down her car’s window only to see a huge volume of pure acid splashed on her face.  Unfortunately, she lost part of her face and the cornea of an eye in the acid attack.Police never caught the perpetrators, as it is usually the case despite the fact that the street was surveyed by video cameras. All these horrible acts were directed towards women who were not wearing conservative outfits. Many Iranians believe that these attacks were made in complicity with different authorities to discourage women from adopting a more liberal way of dressing. But both national and local authorities denied any involvement.    Today Marzieh raises awareness about these terrible attacks and advocates for the ban of acid sales.Despite this tragedy, the news of her marriage 3 years later made headlines in media and social media. #strength #courage #resilience #advocacy #hope #progressThank you to the Atlas of Beauty and the many other media articles for bringing this story to light.

Name: Alan Murray
Text: Today we are celebrating Jen L. WongChief Operating Office at Reddit, Inc.Whose hero is also Mr. Rogershttps://www.reddit.com/A forward thinker, a parent, a Fast Company's Queer50 and a D&I leader. Jen Wong is my idol. A self-described “die-hard New Yorker,” Jen joined Reddit as Chief Operating Officer in April 2018. Since then, she has been building the company into a promising digital ad business and “birthing a new narrative and discipline to marketers.” Her goal is to get Raddit to reach 1Billion monthly users.Growing up on Long Island with Chinese immigrant parents, Jen felt pressure to choose a practical career over becoming a music producer. So she went to Yale, then Stanford for management science. As digital media started to take off, she got an MBA from Harvard and set off on a tremendous career in the field. Prior to Reddit, she was the Chief Operating Officer at Time Inc. – the highest ranking female executive in the company. In her previous life, Jen was also the Global of Head of Business Operations at AOL and Chief Business Officer at PopSugar.In addition, Jen serves on the Board of Discover Financial Services & Ad Council.~Business Leader Spotlight Series~Who happen to be of #Asian origin.#Diversity #Inclusion #Equality #Equity

Name: Alan Murray
Text: Today we are celebrating Jen L. WongChief Operating Office at Reddit, Inc.Whose hero is also Mr. Rogershttps://www.reddit.com/A forward thinker, a parent, a Fast Company's Queer50 and a D&I leader. Jen Wong is my idol. A self-described “die-hard New Yorker,” Jen joined Reddit as Chief Operating Officer in April 2018. Since then, she has been building the company into a promising digital ad business and “birthing a new narrative and discipline to marketers.” Her goal is to get Raddit to reach 1Billion monthly users.Growing up on Long Island with Chinese immigrant parents, Jen felt pressure to choose a practical career over becoming a music producer. So she went to Yale, then Stanford for management science. As digital media started to take off, she got an MBA from Harvard and set off on a tremendous career in the field. Prior to Reddit, she was the Chief Operating Officer at Time Inc. – the highest ranking female executive in the company. In her previous life, Jen was also the Global of Head of Business Operations at AOL and Chief Business Officer at PopSugar.In addition, Jen serves on the Board of Discover Financial Services & Ad Council.~Business Leader Spotlight Series~Who happen to be of #Asian origin.#Diversity #Inclusion #Equality #Equity

Name: Alan Murray
Text: Businesses are under increasing pressure to take care of all their stakeholders and lead in a world that’s facing multiple crises. As a result, many CEOs are reevaluating the status quo and considering how we can all do better to advocate for the society we want to live in. I’ve shared this perspective for a while now, but this year it has come into focus perhaps more than ever before: Our system of capitalism needs an upgrade—and it’s a moral obligation for business leaders to be part of the solution. My thanks to Alan Murray and Ellen McGirt for hosting me on Fortune's “Leadership Next” podcast to have this important conversation.

Name: Alan Murray
Text: Fortune’s Alan Murray is capturing the social shift introduced in RESET: Business and Society in the New Social Landscape (Columbia University Press 2018). Worth reading his column this morning. Margery Kraus Prateek Allapur Jimmy Koo Meredith Howard Myles Thompson Michael Bzdak Leon Kaye “The social issues discussed—combatting climate change, creating training and employment opportunities, expanding diversity and inclusion, addressing COVID and other health care crises—once may have been considered the province of governments. But companies clearly have a role. And in the absence of government leadership, CEOs feel increasing pressure to step up. They uniformly insist that doing so is good for their business—and ultimately, good for their shareholders.”

Name: Alan Murray
Text: I receive Fortune's Alan Murray CEO Daily newsletter, and have deeply appreciated his regular focus on stakeholder capitalism (we have a big study coming out in September on #purposedrivenorganizations). Today's newsletter hit it on the nose for me though, and if you care about #purpose in organizations (and individuals!), I want to encourage you all to read his comments plus the linked articles: "But what critics miss is this: stakeholder capitalism isn’t a choice. It’s an imperative. It is happening, driven by trends that show no sign of reversing. The outpouring of CEO sentiment after the George Floyd killing wasn’t just because “woke” CEOs suddenly decided to speak up. It happened because talented employees demanded it, and talent is today’s top driver of corporate value. The post-pandemic focus on employee safety wasn’t just because of a wave of CEO empathy. It was forced by employees, government officials, health experts and many others—“stakeholders,” all."RedThread Research

Name: Alan Murray
Text: I met Polina Marinova, author and founder of The Profile, when my former boss and mentor Alan Murray, CEO of Fortune, told me she was brilliant and that I had to meet and collaborate with her.Polina told me she was leaving Fortune to devote her time to The Profile, a newsletter she created that compiles the best stories on successful people and companies. Polina is the epitome of someone who has bet on herself and has succeeded tremendously. In one of her posts, she eloquently defines the founder's creed, "You are most powerful when your identity is tied to your own name." Last week, I brought together a curated group of executives to talk about why you should always bet on yourself. Click on the link below to listen to the recording and find content and resources surrounding the topic.p.s. If you stay till the end of the video, you'll get a bonus Q&A with my 5-year old daughter!#communityofseven @Leadershipfirst #leadershipfirst

Name: David Kirkpatrick
Text: Since learning the movie (The Social Network) distorts the tale of Facebook’s origins, I’ve wanted to learn the truth...So I got a copy of leading #technology #journalist &  #author David Kirkpatrick’s 📚 ‘The Facebook Effect’.It’s about the first 6 years, starting in Zuckerberg’s college dorm, before becoming the 🌍 fastest growing company.Going from 0 to over 500 million global users in just 6 years!Zuckerberg’s aim was never to create a company, he wanted to build something that made a really big change in the 🌍.His vision was to make Facebook the chosen social network platform 🌍 & have a positive effect on society through accountability, with the transparency of their users.Zuckerberg is so strong is his beliefs he vows never to let go of the helm, turning down a $15 billion bid from MicrosoftHe even had to borrow money from friends & family to buy more servers, to keep the service running & continually sold stock to keep them afloat.Zuckerberg was so focused on his vision & on wanting to give users the simplest & best experience, he kept adverts to a minimum, meaning they never made a profit up to 2010.It’s a great read for people interested in #business & social networks, and full of amazing characters and stories.‘The Facebook Effect’ gets 👍 & ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

Name: David Kirkpatrick
Text: How Microsoft conquered China?A fascinating and historical article by David Kirkpatrick written in 2007 (13 years ago) when he traveled to China with Bill Gates. Chinese security officials were troubled that government & military operations depended on Microsoft software made in the US.  Could they be spying on China?Quick summary:- Bill Gates was “bigger in China than any movie star” in 2007- How Microsoft had to become the un-Microsoft- How and why Windows is used on an estimated 90% of China's 120 million PCs in 2007- Microsoft was a great turnaround story in China with wonderful lessons for many companiesMind that not everyone can hire Secretary of State Henry Kissinger to open doors :) https://lnkd.in/gCifuq9#china #microsoft #chinatech #windows #startups #tiktokban #tiktok #global #growth

Name: David Kirkpatrick
Text: I joined TED 3 weeks ago as their tech curator. What did they have me do day 1? A live interview Eric Yuan, CEO of Zoom for TED2020! Thankfully he does not see a Zoom only world in our future. We touched on online education, ethics, Zoom in 2050, Silicon Valley (he's a believer), China/US tensions. I have to say, he's got great, positive energy. Ben Wootliff Alison Taylor you'll recognize a couple of the questions:)#tech #communication #thefutureofwork #workfromhome

Name: David Kirkpatrick
Text: Facebook is, by all available evidence, unwilling and unable to embrace civil rights fundamentals, including non-discrimination and actions to combat racism, without being taken to court. Significant policy and algorithmic decisions including course-correction have generally only come about in the wake of legal settlements. I find this quite extraordinary. Here we have a company that is inextricably entwined into the socio-political, commercial, cultural and economic DNA of hundreds of countries around the world resisting at every turn calls to embrace civil rights as a central pillar of corporate governance and content regulation. How did we end up here?https://lnkd.in/gzv6hTBMy latest op-ed in Techonomy Media. Thanks for inviting me to contribute David Kirkpatrick.#Facebook #SocialMedia

Name: David Kirkpatrick
Text: It's with a grateful heart that I share that today is my final day at the World Economic Forum.  I'm proud that this has been my professional home for a decade:  the Forum taught me how to be a leader through the Global Leadership Fellows programme; showed me how to curate and produce thought leadership at nearly ten Annual Meetings in Davos, Switzerland; and most importantly connected me to some of the smartest and most thoughtful people on this planet.  I am embarking on a new adventure with Facebook's Responsible Innovation team.  If you're interested in hearing what we're doing, please reach out!  I would love to talk to you. #worldeconomicforum #goodbye #newadventure

Name: David Kirkpatrick
Text: Just received advance copies of my book! The main message of the book is that we need to rethink our relationship with experts, and I offer several strategies for how to keep experts on tap, not on top. To reclaim control, I suggest we need to stop blindly outsourcing our thinking to experts, but that we should not dismiss or ignore them either. I realize I'm biased, but the message feels timely and highly relevant. The global lockdowns have led to many conferences and events being cancelled or postponed. As such, I’ve had fewer opportunities to tell people about my message. If you’re able, I’d appreciate your help in two ways:1) Pre-ordering the book (this is very helpful to me). Here’s a link: https://amzn.to/36a9y30.  2) Sharing news of the book with friends, family, and colleagues…and encouraging them to pre-order it as well.

Name: Naomi Simson
Text: "ANTI-LOCKDOWN" BUS STUNTAnti-lockdown protesters have found a clever way around Daniel Andrew’s radical lockdowns by hiring a “LET US OUT” bus to drive around Melbourne calling for the premier to be sacked. Melbourne is now the World's longest lockdown city with an average of just 10 cases a day over the past 2 weeks. The mental health and societal impacts are enormous and the trauma from this travesty of our human rights will last for generations.We definitely need a fleet of these buses. Please help to give the millions of Melbournians who are suffering their lives back.#Covid19 #melbournelockdown #melbournebusiness #Government #humanrights #employment #education #economy #jobs #mentalhealth #health #wellbeing #trauma #depression #freedom

Name: Naomi Simson
Text: FORMER HEALTH MINISTER BLAMES PREMIER Jenny Mikakos has turned on Daniel Andrews blaming the embattled premier for subverting Cabinet process and contributing to the hotel quarantine disaster. In a closing submission to the quarantine inquiry, she warned the board to treat Mr Andrews’ claims with “caution”. “The fact that no such Cabinet, or Cabinet Committee process, was engaged for the setting up of the hotel quarantine program is the root cause of some of the issues which have been ventilated before the board in the course of this inquiry,” the submission said. Ms Mikakos said had the hotel quarantine program been the “product” of a Cabinet or Cabinet Committee decision the issues would not have arisen.“More importantly, such a process would have enabled differing views and potential risks and weaknesses with the program to be identified and addressed prior to its establishment,” she said.The rule of law in Victoria and our democracy and politics is broken. #COVID #victorialockdown #quarantine #democracy #mentalhealth #leadership #victoriangovernment

Name: Naomi Simson
Text: RedBalloon was looking to connect with thrill-seeking consumers via premium digital and out-of-home assets. Uniquely, the Val Morgan Group offered an integrated campaign solution spanning Val Morgan’s Digital and Outdoor networks.  The editorially-led campaign strategy saw five bespoke articles created by TheLatch—‘s in-house editorial team, outlining but a few of RedBalloon experiences. Content aligned with current events, including ‘post-iso’ local travel ideas and Father’s Day gifts to support local communities.  The material was then amplified across the VMO network. Utilising VMO Shop screens, RedBallon were able to access extensive reach and connect with shoppers who were in the mindset to make purchasing decisions. The VMO Active network also played a pivotal role, amplifying the content to a unique, active audience – who are proven to possess a positive and receptive mindset – and within an environment that is contextually relevant to the experience-hungry demographic. Matthew Cavalier, Chief Growth Officer at RedBalloon said, “The collaboration with VMO provided a seamless and integrated approach to bring ‘make every moment count’ to life and inspire Australians to support our experience partners across the country and to create lasting memories.”#DOOH

Name: Naomi Simson
Text: The political battle over state borders is heating up. The Premiers are standing firm but the Prime Minister wants interstate travel to resume by Christmas.Hard border closures are helping contain COVID cases but have caused massive problems for business, health care workers and families in need of medical attention.And thousands of Australians remain stranded overseas faced with a cap on international arrivals, soaring ticket prices and quarantine costs.So, who’s got the power when it counts? Are we getting the balance right when it comes to restricting free travel in the name of public health?I will be part of the ABC Q+A panel about border wars this evening at 9.35pm (AEST).Read more and submit your questions here: https://buff.ly/3lSsfjv#pandemic #isolation #recession #quarantine #COVID #borderclosures #economy #disruption #ABC #entrepreneurship #business #politics #government

Name: Naomi Simson
Text: At the core of Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg’s extraordinary life was a simple conviction: “Women belong,” she said, “in all places where decisions are being made.” She was a brilliant jurist, an inimitable Supreme Court justice, a force for equality and integrity—and she was one of my heroes. There will never be another RBG, but we are a much better, fairer country for all that she gave us.

Name: Naomi Simson
Text: COVID has hammered home some uncomfortable truths about us as a people says Chris Uhlmann. See the full article below.Soon enough there will be a global reckoning on whether the coronavirus defences did more damage than the disease.In time it's a fair bet the cure will be seen by many as the real curse, as people whose lives have been destroyed seek retribution.https://lnkd.in/gBH4Kwa#COVIDaustralia #victorialockdown #lockdowns #borders #factsnotfear #Victoria #mentalhealth #depression #society #economy #humanrights #freedomofspeech

Name: Naomi Simson
Text: This edition of Handpicked is intended to give you some ideas about how to deliver a little #fun to the work place. Whether you have remote teams, you're onsite or in lockdown. We tell the story about how and why one# client chose to surprise and delight its remote work customer care team with experiences and we give plenty of suggestions on how to entertain the kids this school holidays. #corporateculture #funatwork #makeeverymomentcount #newsletter #teamculture #betternormal #experiencesatwork #employeeexperience #team #remotework #kidsholidays

Name: Naomi Simson
Text: Completely concur..... #joblosses every day - a whole generation of people will not enter tourism and hospitality. #opentheboards #oneaustralia

Name: Naomi Simson
Text: This morning I wrote to all 29,000 people at the Qantas Group with some difficult news. The COVID crisis means we need to be a smaller airline until more flying returns. We know we have the strength to get through this – but that doesn’t make it any easier for many of our amazing employees who will leave the Group or face a long interruption to their aviation careers. The recovery plan we announced today is about protecting as many jobs as we can longer term and to set the national carrier up for its next 100 years.

Text: Indigenous researchers and experts from around the country are leading a $1.3 million project that will allow Indigenous community organisations to better analyse their data and make decisions to improve outcomes for their communities.The Indigenous Data Network (IDN) —an initiative of UniMelb's Indigenous Studies Unit—is work in partnership with the Coalition of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander community-controlled Peaks (Coalition of Peaks) to develop the new platform.Learn more at Newsroom.

Name: Naomi Simson
Text: Victoria's roadmap is the wrong approach. Read The Conversation article & please share.Governments need to have a willingness to engage a broad range of expertise.A sole focus on predicting and controlling COVID case numbers fails to take into account the other compelling consequences of our public policy. We need to draw on the predictive powers of psychologists & psychiatrists, sociologists & anthropologists, economists & educators + the epidemiologists.These 3 principles — an international perspective, a breadth of expertise and an ability to look to the long-term as well as the short — show us precisely where Australia, and especially Victoria, has gone wrong. When Premier Andrews announced his roadmap out of lockdown, none of these conditions were met.The Andrews administration have not learned from global best practice & show no interest in doing so. In fact, the only references to other countries made by government officials have been derogatory & dismissive.Most worryingly of all, the Andrews roadmap says nothing about the long-term consequences of lockdown, incl. a future where there is no workable vaccine & societies around the world must learn to live with the virus.#COVID #Victoria #Australia #leadership #publicpolicy #victorialockdown #liberty #policestate

Name: Naomi Simson
Text: The global pandemic has hit tourism hard worldwide, but Queensland has a plan for economic recovery.Today we announced a further $11.3 million boost to Far North Queensland tourism, on top of support we've already provided under our $7 billion recovery plan.The funding package includes:▪ $6.5 million for 4 shovel-ready projects creating 127 construction jobs and more than 50 ongoing jobs▪ $3 million to help attract major events to the regions▪ $1.8M to assist Reef Fleet operatorsThe four projects part of the $6.5 million announcement includes:🐊 $500,000 towards Wildlife Habitat's new CrocArena at Port Douglas, including enclosures for three iconic male crocodiles🚐 $2 million for an additional 40 van sites and an amenities block for Paronella Park at Mena Creek⛴ $3 million to construct Dreamtime Island for Reef Magic Cruises in Cairns. This will be the largest floating activity platform on the northern Great Barrier Reef🏔 1 million for 21 air-conditioned accommodation units to support the Undara Experience  at Mount SurpriseAdvance Cairns Cairns Regional Council

Name: Naomi Simson
Text: Out in the US next week -- and just nominated for FT/McKinsey Best Business Book award!

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: A Deep Dive into Hidden Delights! Here are a few ideas from listeners:- Use maps as drawer liners, as a reminder of favorite trips- When ordering a sandwich, ask for one slice of jalapeño- Hide cash in unexpected places- Display children's art inside cabinet doors or closets- Add a book nook to your bookshelves (I ordered one of these!)Do you have a hidden delight?

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: A fascinating look at the future of teletherapy. My friend Lori Gottlieb explains why "the toilet has become the new couch."

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: As a writer, what device do I lean on too heavily? Introducing an idea with a question.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: So often, when we give ourselves more of what we crave, we don’t feel satisfied—we want even more. We induce demand.It’s important to recognize this phenomenon so that we don’t spend our time, energy, and money on what we think are solutions—but actually just feed the problem.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: I love children’s literature, and one of my favorite books is Ellen Raskin’s mysterious, powerful, funny “The Westing Game.” I was fascinated to read this piece about the novel and the author. I’ve read this book about 20 times, and after reading this article, I think I will go grab it off the shelf again right now.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: Could you use more calm in your life these days? I sure could. Ryan Holiday shares ten tips for finding stillness in turbulent times. (My favorite is #2.)

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: "Several times a day, notice that you’re basically all right."I appreciated this concrete, manageable advice for coping with anxiety.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: Even if we aren't "auditioning" for an acting role, we find ourselves in many situations that are auditions of some sort, in all areas of our lives. I found advice on this subject from an unexpected source.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: Learning about the importance of sunlight—and particularly, early morning light—made me even more diligent about looking up at the sky when I walk with Barnaby and Jamie each morning. I make sure to glance up to see the beauty of its ever-changing colors, and to get the benefits of its healthful dawn light.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: I love the TimeHop app because it reminds me of great memories from years past. Like this night five years ago! Oprah Winfrey

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: Of all the aphorisms I’ve written, one of my favorites is “The days are long, but the years are short.” But not 2020. This year of 2020 has seemed long, and we still have a few months to go. Agree, disagree?

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: Try This at Home: Do something familiar in a new way. We can find ways to take new pleasure in activities that we already enjoy.Plus, we interview the legendary Al Roker about absurdity, getting up an hour earlier, and why he doesn't recommend making a five-year plan.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: For my next book, on the body and the five senses, I'm exploring each sense through a "reboot" exercise. But when I did this exercise for sight, I hit a snag. Have you found a great solution to my lightbulb problem? Please weigh in!

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: On the “Happier in Hollywood” podcast, Elizabeth and Sarah have been talking about a listener’s question about whether to tell her boss that she’s struggling with depression. Interesting article in the Wall Street Journal addresses that issue:

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: This was the third time I've read Joan Didion's "A Year of Magical Thinking"—I went to look up a passage, then ended up re-reading the whole thing. It's that good.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: Years ago, when my husband Jamie had to stay in the hospital overnight, the nurse said something that I've always remembered.At the time, I was so preoccupied with Jamie’s recovery that I didn’t think much about it. But later, her observation made me very happy.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: I love museums, and it’s interesting how many unconventional museums have sprung up. Here’s a museum I can’t wait to visit:

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: "The things that brought us joy so easily before—travel, grabbing lunch with friends, hugging our loved ones—are suddenly out of reach."How can we cultivate happiness in such a difficult time? This article shares some terrific ideas. (My tip: walk outside—safely, of course.)

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: I’m a giant fan of the book “Teach Like a Champion” (plus author Doug Lemov is the brother of my college roommate). On the Teach Like a Champion blog, in “Doug Lemov’s Field Notes,” there are fascinating clips and discussions of successful online teaching—something of interest to many of us these days. I found many of the points useful to my own Zoom engagements.https://bit.ly/2ZDPZOw

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: In a book full of acting advice, I found a helpful list of antidotes to common self-doubts. These tips apply just as much to non-actors as to actors, because we all find ourselves in situations that are auditions of some sort.Have you ever taken helpful advice from an unexpected source?

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: I took this photo after recording an episode of the #happierpodcast. I put pillows and blankets around me to improve the sound quality. It looks messy but sounds better.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: I love aphorisms, koans, fables, and teaching stories. One of my favorites comes from Mark Twain: “To be good is noble; but to show others how to be good is nobler, and no trouble.” I remind myself of this satiric maxim often: Never give good advice that I’m not willing to take myself.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: “It’s not the cruel criticism from folks who hate us that scares us away from our knowing; it’s the quiet concern of those who love us.”In today's episode, we talk to mega-bestselling author Glennon Doyle about her latest book, Untamed. Glennon shares why it's important to be able to disappoint others so that you never disappoint yourself.We also talk about why you should imitate a spiritual master. What part of the discussion struck a chord with you?

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: "As parents, we all homeschool our kids—it’s a matter of where and how we choose to outsource." Tsh Oxenreider shares what she's learned from adopting a homeschooling mindset:

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: One of my aphorisms is: "Nature makes it pleasant to follow her commands."Now, when the days are getting shorter, I'm particularly aware of the importance of sunlight and the crucial work it does for our bodies. What habits help you get outside?https://bit.ly/3nkTgwt

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: A friend in college told me, “Never knit your boyfriend a sweater.” I’ve never forgotten this, even though I don’t know how to knit and in college, I didn’t have a boyfriend.I took a few pointers from this trenchant piece of advice:

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: For many of us, vacation and travel plans have been disrupted. If you can't leave home, Ingrid Fetell Lee suggests ideas for having an adventure right where you are. I love this tip: "Read books and movies that transport you."

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: I love colored pencils, I love “Game of Thrones,” I love “The Office.” A thoughtful reader sent me the link to these hilarious mashups. I especially love the purple labeled “Joffrey’s Face” and “Broccoli Rob” green. Hamiltones, Stranger Colors, Colors and Recreations…https://bit.ly/3m5sdoa

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: This year of 2020 marks the 100th anniversary of the 19th Amendment, which guaranteed women’s constitutional right to vote—and I was reminded of a happy memory. I clerked for Justice Sandra Day O’Connor, and she had a tradition that each year, her clerks would decorate a Halloween pumpkin for her chambers. Because she’d recently given a speech related to women’s right to vote, my co-clerks and I were inspired to make this pumpkin suffragette. A great reminder that we must all exercise our precious right to vote!

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: Because I’m studying the body and the five senses, I’ve been learning more about synesthesia. A fascinating study shows that for some people with synesthesia, their associations of color to letters of the alphabet are based on…Fisher Price alphabet fridge magnets! The magnets don’t cause the synesthesia, but rather shape the association.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: I’m happy to announce that I’ve joined Rare Beauty’s Mental Health Council. It’s an honor to work with this terrific team to raise awareness of the importance of mental health and resources that are available. To learn more about Rare Impact, Mental Health Council, and Rare Beauty’s mental health initiatives, go to https://lnkd.in/g-jducS.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: Lately, many people have asked me, "Can the Four Tendencies be used to encourage someone to vote in the upcoming U.S. election?" The answer is: YES.This matters, because in the 2016 election, only about 60% of eligible voters cast a vote. We want to do what we can to encourage people to participate in the election of our representatives.What messages work for you, with your own Tendency? What strategies have you seen resonate—or fall flat—with other Tendencies?Click here to read more: https://bit.ly/2GmuwmC

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: I put down a book if I don’t feel like finishing it, so I have more time to do my favorite kinds of reading.This habit means that if you see a book included in this post, you know that I liked it well enough to read to the last page.Here's everything I read in September, along with short reviews of each book:

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: Thanks to all the thoughtful readers who sent me a note in honor of the day; today is the Feast Day of St. Therese of Lisieux, my spiritual master. Which reminds me, it’s time to re-read her spiritual memoir, “Story of a Soul,” for the fifteenth time, and to remind myself of  her words: “It isn’t enough to love; we must prove it.”https://bit.ly/36mDn2H

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: Talking about books always makes me happy! In this short video interview I shared a few books I've read recently, including a novel, a book of short stories, and a collection of essays.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: What are your best tips for encouraging kids to eat vegetables? Listeners shared so many terrific ideas, from starting a garden box to trying vegetable sushi to adding greens to smoothies.Plus, we discuss why you might try anticipating pandemic regret: In the future, what will you wish you'd done with this time?

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: I'm endlessly astonished and fascinated by human nature. The desire to take a "flight to nowhere" is something I would never have predicted. I'm impressed by the airline officials who realized that this offer would appeal to people.Would you go on a flight that took you right back to your starting point?

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: I love children’s literature, so of course I love Frog and Toad—and I laughed out loud reading this spoof about the pair’s new adventures in the time of COVID.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: Do you have a hidden delight? On today's episode we talk about why you might want to create one. A listener suggests a hack for using clothes as a way to stick to an exercise habit, and we discuss a challenging question related to gift-giving and gift-receiving.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: Writing a personal manifesto is a great exercise for clarifying your thinking—and it's also a creative, absorbing process. I've written my Twelve Personal Commandments, and I also collect #SecretsofAdulthood, which aren't manifestos, but related to the same impulse.When I wrote my book #BetterThanBefore, about how we make and break habits, I spent a lot of time thinking about habit-formation. Voila, here's my Habits Manifesto. What would you add (or subtract)? To order your copy of the book, click here: https://bit.ly/35E2GwF

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: I love the work of both Ann Patchett and Robin Preiss Glasser, and now they have a new children’s book called “The Escape Goat.” The book is terrific, and the story of how it came to be written (told in this short video) is wonderful too:

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: During the interview for this story, it was interesting to reflect back on the time when I was switching from law to writing. Now the decision seems inevitable, but at the time, it certainly didn’t feel that way.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: I do love a prophecy, and I loved learning about this ancient prophecy which, by setting what seems a straightforward problem in geometry, aims to transform the values of an entire people.Sometimes, to do a small thing, we must prepare ourselves in a very large way.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: I love a list of reading suggestions, and I love a great campus novel—though I never knew that term before! I’ve read several books on this list, and liked them all, so I’m going to follow up on several of the ones I haven’t yet read. Even though this year, the “campus” experience isn’t what it usually is.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: How I miss experiencing the Metropolitan Museum among crowds of other people! I was honored to appear in this video, along with Assistant Buildings Manager Angela Reynolds and artist Hai-Hsin Huang, to share #MyMetStory.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: My daughter Eliza told me to read "Mariana" by Monica Dickens, which she described as "cozy." Say no more! Bring on the cozy. By Charles Dickens's great-grandaughter. Published by Persephone Books, a publisher that all book-lovers should know about. Wonderful books, beautifully published.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: Lately, many people have asked me, "Can the Four Tendencies be used to encourage someone to vote in the upcoming U.S. election?" The answer is: YES.Read the full post to learn what strategies work best for each Tendency. What messages work for you, with your own Tendency?

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: The brilliant Nick Quah is one of my favorite people in podcasting world, and I had a great time talking to him on this episode of his “Servant of Pod” podcast.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: I write often about how morning people and night people really do have different daily rhythms, and why it’s important to keep these in mind when we’re shaping our habits. This fascinating article looks at the differences among “morning,” “day,” or “night” people. One small detail jumped out at me: that morning people tend to be hungry early. I’ve been struck by the fact that I’m very hungry in the morning, and other people aren’t.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: If you’re work from home and want to improve the experience, this article includes lots of suggestions—from small to big—for ways to make your experience more convenient, efficient, and comfortable.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: On today's #happierpodcast, we talk about why you should get out of your self-storage unit and interview relationship therapist Esther Perel.Esther shares the big mistakes that we all make in our relationships, why we need connection and touch, and how our personal lives influence our work lives. What part of the discussion struck a chord with you?

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: This is a sad story, but it also fills me with awe, and a sense of transcendent peace.To be able to see what is right action, to be able to hear it, and to be able to do it—these are not easy. It’s beautiful to see it happen.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: We've picked our next book for the #HappierPodcastBookClub, the brilliant novel by Yaa Gyasi: "Transcendent Kingdom."This novel just hit the shelves, and it has immediately generated tremendous buzz.Through the wonders of technology Yaa Gyasi will join Elizabeth and me to talk about her novel for episode 297 airing October 28. So get reading!What are your questions or insights about the book? Share them in the comments here or click through to the blog post.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: "All we really know, at the end of the day, is that work has been fundamentally changed."This article offers helpful tips about how to cope with these uncertain times—including practicing self-discovery and turning outwards.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: More Colson Whitehead! "The Underground Railroad" is a deeply moving book, and an unusual way of using a fantastical element.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: "Worry wastes your life. In my studies of the wisdom of older people, this is one thing they really taught me."Karl Pillemer is a family sociologist and gerontologist. He's written two books sharing older people's advice for living, and now he has a new book called "Fault Lines: Fractured Families and How to Mend Them."

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: As a lover of children’s literature, and as a fellow red-head, I was delighted to read this Wall Street Journal piece about the countryside depicted in the Anne of Green Gables books.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: A new study suggests that we experience loneliness differently, depending on age—which means there is no one-size-fits-all approach to combating loneliness. What are you doing to stay connected to others during this time?

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: An extravaganza of hacks! We share listeners' best relationship, pandemic, clutter, parenting, travel, and #Walk20in20 hacks.My favorite: You can’t be angry if your armpits are exposed. "Hands up, baby! Hands up!"https://bit.ly/3jVgbMm

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: Curious about how to communicate better with your children? Knowing each child’s Tendency can help! I joined Dr. Robyn Silverman on the "How to Talk to Kids" podcast to share tips for helping kids with different Tendencies thrive.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: Spotted: my favorite logo. I love that hidden arrow. FedEx

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: "I sometimes in the morning choose how I want to feel at the end of the day and then relate all my choices to that.So if I want to feel accomplished, I might make a To Do list early in the day and be sure I tick things off, or if I want to feel Peaceful, I might read or take a long walk and avoid email."

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: That observation—“you can only dream of what you can imagine”—is so profound.I wonder if the internet will be a force for good in this way. Can it help people to dream bigger, because they can imagine more, because the internet has shown it to them?I hope so.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: Do good, feel good—it really works. Fascinating piece about how being kind can comfort us during the pandemic. Plus tips for being kind.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: My to-be-read piles are alarmingly huge, and my library list goes on for pages—and yet after I read this post, I added several titles. Seventeen booksellers rave about their favorite books! I simply couldn’t resist.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: What I read in August: research for the five senses, memoirs, YA literature, and our next Happier podcast book club pick: Yaa Gyasi's Transcendent Kingdom.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: When a member of our family goes away overnight, our dog Barnaby is so excited to see that person return that he can't stand still. He races from room to room, jumps over furniture, comes over to wag his tail a few times, then zooms away again. He just can't stay in one place.That's how I felt during my first visit back to the Met. I couldn't concentrate on any objects; I just walked from room to room to take in the atmosphere. Everything looked both familiar and new, in the most beautiful way.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: I had so much fun talking to my friend, the brilliant Michael Melcher, about careers, career-building habits, and the Four Tendencies for his podcast “Career Stewardship.”

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: For too long, I've treated my body like the car my head is driving around town. My prediction was that by getting back inside my body by systematically exploring my senses, I could shake my mind awake.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: I'm looking forward to joining Healthline's Good Talks tomorrow (September 2) to discuss eating for a healthy, happy lifestyle. Event begins at 7pm ET / 4pm PT.https://bit.ly/3hSuD7s

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: On today's episode, we talk to Dr. Rangan Chatterjee about how to feel better in just five minutes. His Try-This-at-Home suggestion: For a daily gratitude exercise, answer three questions: "What have I done today to make somebody else happy? What has somebody else done today to make me happy? What have I learned today?"

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: For too long, I've treated my body like the car my head is driving around town. By systematically exploring my five senses, I thought I could shake my mind awake.Here are some of the experiments I've been trying. What are some of your favorite ways to shake yourself awake?

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: For the last several months, our dog Barnaby has happily been getting attention all day long from my family. I was interested to see this article about how it might be hard for dogs and cats to adjust to less company. Do you think your dog or cat might miss the constant companionship?

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: While nothing like Zora Neale Hurston's vision has ever happened to me, I love reading this passage, because it reminds me of how mysterious the world is.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: Congrats to my brilliant friend Dawn Davis who will be next Editor-in-Chief of the magazine Bon Appetit. I can’t wait to see what she does in her new role.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: On today's episode, we talk about why you should learn to do something with a beginning, a middle, and an end.Learning a new skill is especially energizing during this formless COVID time. I decided to learn poker—inspired by two excellent memoirs, and by a friend who told me that her family played every night during the height of safer-at-home.Have you learned a new skill or hobby recently?

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: I’m planning to hire a Growth Strategy and Operations Executive to lead the business side of my work. If this description sounds interesting to you (see below), and you have the appropriate experience, please read on and consider applying.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: What's the opposite of meditation? Recess.I realized I didn’t want to empty or quiet my mind; I wanted to flood my mind with sensations. I wanted to visit the playground of my own mind. One way I can give myself the luxury of recess is by exploring the world through my body and my senses.How do you give yourself the luxury of recess?

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: Screen-time! It’s the subject of so much discussion and anxiety, especially these days. This New York Times piece by my friend Anya Kamenetz touched on many key issues.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: "Once upon a time, a long time ago, a farmer lived with his wife, their five children, and his parents in a small farmhouse. They were all constantly getting in each other’s way..."I love this story, and its reminder to be grateful.

Name: Gretchen Rubin
Text: I was very interested to read this piece in the Harvard Business Review about the value of taking a summer vacation, even in these strange times—and then gratified to see a reference to my own work on the “atmosphere of growth.” Fun fact: Lin-Manuel Miranda conceived of “Hamilton” during a vacation.

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: I’d like to share the good news around the arrival of the dedicated bricks-and-mortar trading exchange, IPSX, in Mayfair. I’ve given this venture my seal of approval by investing in it. Take a look at the article to see why.

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: Since inception Recruitment Entrepreneur has expanded its portfolio to partner with more than 20 businesses. This is thanks to the expert knowledge and dedication of the senior management team, namely Abid Hamid, Greg Hollis, Angus McDowell, Daisy Betteridge and Samantha Proctor.  I’m proud to see them launch their new website, which more accurately reflects where they are as industry leaders, investing to start or scale in some of the most innovative recruitment brands currently operating in the market. I know that with the excellent work the new Investment Directors Alex Niarchos and Mike Ryall are doing, they will continue to go from strength to strength, in supporting recruitment leaders in the realisation of their ultimate business dreams.  If you’re wanting to start or scale your recruitment business, visit the new website to see how Recruitment Entrepreneur can support you.

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: Excellent to see Walter James have launched another new brand into the market, Walter James Solutions, as part of the wider Recruitment Entrepreneur portfolio.  Group Commercial Director Riko Arends has joined the portfolio to launch Walter James Solutions, which will specialise in recruiting talent for mid to senior professionals in the Consumer & Retail, and Life Sciences industries.

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: Looking for business advice or investment? You can get a guaranteed response from me on Vintro here: (https://lnkd.in/duNAWsu) All in the click of a button! #AccessTheInaccessible

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: With the implementation of the new ‘rule of six’ by the UK government posing a real threat to the jobs market, I believe entrepreneurs and businesses need to get creative to achieve success in the coming months. To find out more, read my full article below:

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: A leader’s decisions and the culture that they inspire can make or break a business. In my experience, it’s rare to find a business that scales without a strong leader in place.

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: Hard work is often the single-biggest action associated with successful entrepreneurs. But in my experience, the allocation of your time is even more crucial. As you look to grow your business, the way you choose to delegate responsibilities will have a greater bearing on your success rather than your actions as an individual.Deciding what not to do is as important as deciding what to do. Agree?

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: It is during the most testing of times that the most capable leaders rise to the challenge. In 2019, Matt Burton Associates, one of the 27 recruitment businesses in my portfolio had a record year, growing over 200%. In 2020 we were really excited to build on this momentum - but then the pandemic hit. The economic shock was sharp and sudden, with UK output contracting by an unprecedented 19.8% in Q2. Matt Burton, my partner in MBA, knew that he had to find a way to sustain the progress made in 2019. Despite sadly having to put staff on furlough and tightly controlling his costs, he thought outside the box by assessing his client base to see if we could do more with the existing customers we had.Whilst the competition had been negatively affected, it has allowed Matt to successfully diversify his processes and build a robust area of specialisation where we previously had no coverage.During this very difficult period I have seen Matt literally work seven days a week, making sure he was ahead of the game in anticipating the challenges which came his way.You never know what is around the corner in business, but with each obstacle comes an opportunity to strengthen.

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: What an achievement. For two years consecutive years Recruitment Entrepreneur has won the award for Best Recruitment Start-Up Investment Firm 2020. With this year posing more challenges than ever, this is a fantastic accolade and well deserved recognition for the Recruitment Entrepreneur team. They’ve worked incredibly hard to successfully lead the 21 portfolio partner businesses through some of the toughest market conditions with fantastic feedback. Well done to everyone in the team that has helped make the vision of our partner businesses a reality.

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: I am delighted to announce that I will be joining Richard Croft on The M7 Real Estate Ltd Monthly to discuss The future of work. We will discuss how the ‘new normal’ way of work is impacting London and the regions, what this means for investment into commercial real estate, particularly offices, and whether or not the days of having a family picture on your desk gone for good!Taking place on Thursday 8 October 2020 at 11:00 BST, to register for this topical discussion please follow the link below:https://lnkd.in/deDCxPi

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: We need to end the negativity in the term ‘lifestyle business’, because that’s what a business is fundamentally there to do - fund your lifestyle. Not everyone is going to be the next Bill Gates, and not everyone wants to be.

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: I recently came across a really interesting business that could potentially transform recruitment advertising. They offer an extremely innovative and creative approach to sourcing the right candidate and finding new clients. The company is called ReverseAds, and they have designed a new search advertising solution using A.I. to help recruiters build both sides of their recruitment business simultaneously.Now recruiters can get in front of HR departments and key decision-makers at companies looking to hire, as well as building your talent pool with people searching for opportunities across job boards and professional networks. Take a look at https://lnkd.in/dXbkfE5I think you will be intrigued!

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: When Elaine Tyler first approached me about this business I was sceptical. However, I recognised the energy, drive and commitment she had to build Venatrix, and over the course of the last 5yrs, I've seen it continue to go from strength to strength and establish itself as a leading brand. Elaine and the Venatrix team in partnership with Recruitment Entrepreneur have created their own luck through hard work and determination, and I'm incredibly proud to have played a part in that. I'm excited to see what the next 5yrs brings for this fantastic business. #saassales

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: 💜💜💫🥂Venatrix is 5🥂💫💜💜To say I am proud of what we have achieved is an understatement. From just me and my best friend & biggest inspiration Sophie Allen  in the early days – no candidates, no clients, no brand & potentially no clue (!),to where we are now; 1200+ placements & 400+ clients later!! We have a phenomenal team & get to recruit for such a great industry – I AM SO LUCKY!On my 1st day Recruitment Entrepreneur HQ – they asked me to write down my company vision. I wrote I wanted Venatrix to become “The No1 source of SDR talent in London” and I really feel like we have achieved our mission. What “No1” means is very subjective, but to me it means providing the highest quality service to candidates & clients in every interaction 😊 Covid was/is tough for us as business but it also allowed everything that is the essence of Venatrix to be cast into the spotlight. Helping people find employment against the back drop we faced underlined the importance of what we do.We brought optimum positivity each day, cried but mainly laughed. It’s no longer just a company, it’s a vibe. I hope if you get to work with us in any capacity, you will feel that too.I myself, feel super lucky that I get to do a job that I love all day, everyday & I realise what a privilege that is. 💜

Text: 💜💜💫🥂Venatrix is 5🥂💫💜💜To say I am proud of what we have achieved is an understatement. Name: James Caan CBE
Text: Examples of businesses work together to innovate and drive change in the recruitment industry are refreshing. It's good to see Recruitment Entrepreneur, JobAdder, and Workr Group leading the way to improve efficiency in payroll processes.

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: In September Bila Group has been retained on 3 very exciting roles with some of steel’s leading employers. These roles sit exclusively with Bila & the searches are underway. I’ll be posting more detail in the coming days. The roles include;Estimating Manager (c£60k)Business Development Mgr (c£65k)Bridge Rehabilitation Technical leader (c£65k - £90k)The opportunities are UK wide & will require the successful candidates to travel to Scotland & Southern England.I have also appointed a six figure senior leader to add value to a steelwork client’s growth plans. Whilst it is a difficult market, there are daily reasons to have a positive outlook & it is very encouraging to see the market showing good signs of recovery.If you work in steel & you need support either as a candidate or a client or you fit the aforementioned roles, we’re here to help so please get in touch! We are the UK’s most connected recruitment business in the steel industry & have 18 years experience specifically in this sector (as well as the wider Construction, Engineering & Infrastructure markets).Thank you for your time.#executivesearch #steelwork #steelindustry #steelfabrication #structuralsteel #steelstructures #steelbuildings #steelfabricators #steel #metalwork #metalfabrication

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: The Coronavirus Pandemic has struck at the heart of our economic system. It has propelled government intervention to unprecedented levels, even surpassing the controversial bailout of the banks in 2008. In this Newsletter, I explore the long lasting effects I believe the pandemic will have on the job market and the way the country functions economically.

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: Congratulations to the team at Baldwin Boyes for launching their new website showcasing their offering to the legal market.

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: The government has spent £9bn to incentivise companies to get their employees back to work. I think it could be spent more efficiently.Lockdown has resulted in record numbers of redundancies across the UK. I spoke to BBC News last week about how funds could be redirected to help those who have lost their jobs as a result of the pandemic, and are in need of re-training to help them back into full time employment. Do you agree with my sentiments?

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: Recruitment Entrepreneur is hiring a Group Bid Manager.

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: We're looking forward to receiving applications for our new Group Bid Manager role. This is a fantastic opportunity to make a significant difference in the growth of our portfolio. Click here to apply: https://lnkd.in/eUYyeRZ #groupbidmanager #bidsolutions #bidmanager #bidwriter

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: Hayward Hawk Professional Services are delighted to welcome two new senior hires to the team.Gemma Murphy, Director at Hayward Hawk Professional Service Director, stated “As the professional services industry starts to recover towards the end of 2020 and into 2021, we are delighted to invest in two experienced professionals to service our Business and Accountancy Support desks – both on a permanent and temp/contract basis.”Welcome to them team Katie Doyle and Stephanie French!

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: Hayward Hawk Professional Services are delighted to welcome two new senior hires to the team.Gemma Murphy, Director at Hayward Hawk Professional Service Director, stated “As the professional services industry starts to recover towards the end of 2020 and into 2021, we are delighted to invest in two experienced professionals to service our Business and Accountancy Support desks – both on a permanent and temp/contract basis.”Welcome to them team Katie Doyle and Stephanie French!

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: It's interesting that some of the most successful businesses start in adverse market conditions. The resilience, work ethic,  and strength of client relationships these two talented entrepreneurs James Boyes and Luc Baldwin have already demonstrated, will stand them in excellent stead for the growth of their business, Baldwin Boyes. Congratulations on the launch of your new venture!#legalexecutive #legalrecruitment #legalcareers

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: 😂😀It’s Friday and I’m excited again! 😂😀💜📞Calling all members of the SaaS community who are interested in wellness, wellbeing, mindset and stress management📞 💜🎁A gift from Venatrix to our community during October 🎁📺Tune in Tuesday 12pm for the announcement!📺

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: I’m delighted to share this conversation with Noor Sugrue, founder of Vintro. Noor spoke to Neil C. Hughes’ Tech Talks Daily Podcast about the central purpose for her business.Noor says: “I believe that the most important part of a founder's story is that everyone needs help. Our purpose at Vintro is to help those who don’t have a network or the connections to help them. Those who don’t experience the serendipity of a chance encounter which speeds them on their way. Vintro’s mission is clear: To ensure that no good idea is left behind, and to increase global opportunity and innovation for everyone.”I’ve been lucky enough to talk with Noor on a number of occasions and have been struck by her passion, vision and authenticity each time.She’s created a fantastic marketplace of decision makers, VCs, Nobel Prize Winners, academics and creative talent; united in their goal to democratise access to those who have been previously inaccessible for everyone.Listen to the full interview here: https://lnkd.in/d_nqKK8If you're a business leader looking to help the next generation of businesses succeed, take a look at the Vintro website, linked in the comments below.#foundersstory #entrepreneurs #venturecapital

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: I’m delighted to share this conversation with Noor Sugrue, founder of Vintro. Noor spoke to Neil C. Name: James Caan CBE
Text: When seeking investment, it is far better to be conservative than elaborate with your figures.Investors are looking for:- Accurate numbers- Clear opportunity for growth- An entrepreneur that can demonstrate the above clearlyParticularly in today’s society, realism is your best strategy.

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: Redundancy in business is like an injury in sport. You’re not judged on the injury, you’re judged on how you recover.

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: Urban Connect is going strong with new roles in structural design engineering.

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: BOUNCE BACK CONTINUES TO GAIN MOMENTUMSTRUCTURAL DESIGN ENGINEERINGWe are partnered with a couple of industry leading technical design consultants. These are practices built on technical innovative design at the heart of their ethos. As a result of their existing client relationships, they have stayed constant during the lock down period and are now in a position to recruit strategic hires as part of a well calculated recovery plan. We are searching for the below 3 positions;Associate Structural Engineer - Birmingham - up to 65kPrincipal Structural Engineer - Manchester - up to 55kStructural Revit Technician (2-3 yrs exp) - up to 28kPlease see the job links on our website below and get in touch to discuss on 0161 470 7180.#structuraldesign #structuralengineering #charteredengineer #buildingsdesign #engineeringleadership #timber #masonry #concrete #steel #revit #structuraltechnician #technician

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: I am delighted to announce that we have appointed Patrice Mantey as our second Non-Exec Director here at Ignata. Our goal is to become the most diverse & positively inclusive recruitment partner and Patrice joining our board as a D&I expert is testament to this.For those that don’t know her alongside her full-time role leading the Joint Venture at Virgin Atlantic, Patrice is also a highly qualified Executive Coach and Personal Development advocate specialising in Women’s Development Programmes, Inclusivity and Reverse Mentoring. Her efforts on building an inclusive environment for all has been recognised by Richard Branson.Here at Ignata, our mantra is “there’s a better way”. It has taken some honest soul-searching to realise that we have quite a way to go to achieve our goals. In hiring our second NED (alongside David Reynolds) we feel that a seismic change is genuinely possible by hiring one of the leading commentators on D&I to work on us internally first & foremost and thereafter with our clients & candidates.Her recent accolades include:2020: WeAreTheCity as a Rising Star within Transport & Logistics 2019: EMpower Ethnic Minority Future LeaderWelcome to the team Patrice! #diversity #inclusion #equalopportunities #reversementoring #coaching #ignata

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: More often than not, entrepreneurs place too much emphasis on WHAT they are doing. I believe it is preferential to spend more time focusing on HOW you are doing those things. In the age of Coronavirus, this audit is more important than ever. Do you agree?

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: Never be afraid to make mistakes if you are in a position of responsibility, and never be afraid to make them in front of those you lead. Making mistakes in the open is a strength, not a weakness.What you are actually doing is:1) Giving your team permission to step out of their comfort zone2) Allowing them to think outside the box without fearIt all results in the fostering of a stronger work environment.

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: Construction work on HS2 begins.Transport chiefs have announced the formal start of construction work on HS2.The new high-speed rail line will run between Birmingham and London and comprise two new stations in the capital alongside sites in Birmingham city centre and Solihull.Prime Minister Boris Johnson said: "HS2 is at the heart of our plans to build back better and with construction now formally under way, it's set to create around 22,000 new jobs."As the spine of our country's transport network, the project will be vital in boosting connectivity between our towns and cities."#urbanconnect #HS2 #railindustry #connectivity #londonconstruction #birminghamconstruction #birmingham #railwaytrack #stations

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: I spoke on Sky News this morning to give my views on the government's Kickstart scheme.In short, I believe it should be rejigged to provide help to older workers and SME's - not just young people.Watch the full interview below.

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: I’m a great believer that when you start a business, what you need to create value and success is scale. When Andrew Welsh approached me to start a recruitment business in Scotland, I was intrigued by his plan as this is a very competitive market with some well established names in the region.To have a chance of building a scalable business, you need to show real leadership, strong commercial acumen and the ability to attract the best talent in the market. It was immediately clear that Andrew had all of these, as well as detailed financial projections and a proven track record. Meraki Talent Ltd, pre-covid, had a team of over 35 experienced consultants, a revenue run rate in excess of £20,000,000 and offices in Edinburgh, Glasgow and London.I’m confident that as the market settles and we enter the new norm, he will continue to build Meraki into a market leader in its field.I’ve met a lot of people who have been successful in business, but Andrew marks himself out as someone who lives and breathes his business. A true testament to entrepreneurship. Meraki is a great business to have in my portfolio and a good example of what can be achieved from a start up not too long ago.Well done Andrew!

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: *NEW ROLE*STRUCTURAL DESIGN ENGINEER - LONDONWe are work with a well-renowned Structural Design Consultancy based in London City who have a vacancy for an Intermediate/Project Engineer level Structural Design Engineer.They are searching for someone with at least 3 years experience in a similar environment work on buildings. They are looking for someone who will invest their future in the company and work on prestigious projects across residential developments, commercial, leisure, higher education and specialists glass structures. You will work with some household client names. They also have a number of IStrucE assessors within the office who can assist in achieving your chartered status.Get in touch right now to discuss on 0161 470 7180 or email andrew.kerr@urban-connect.co.uk#structuralengineering #structuraldesign #structuralengineers #buildings #urbanconnect #londonconstruction #london

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: I am delighted to welcome Annabel Weeden to Walter James as a Partner in our Commercial Practice. After a successful early commercial career with Mars and PwC, Annabel became a qualified executive coach and moved into Executive Search. She has a depth of experience work with clients within the FMCG and Retail sectors and will be Co-Chair of the Walter James Diversity and Inclusion Board. I am really excited to work with Annabel on this new journey and have Annabel join our ever growing team.

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: An individual may have all the talent in the world but, without the right attitude, they will get nowhere. Attitude is the single factor that takes you from good to great.

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: Of all the people who approach me to start businesses, sadly only one in ten is female. Often, women have to work harder to prove themselves in a competitive, male-dominated market. When Elaine Tyler told me her business idea - graduate recruitment for multinational companies - I could see she had what it takes to be a successful entrepreneur. Elaine’s business plan was precise and succinct. She understood her market incredibly well, had identified her ideal customers and had clearly thought through her pricing model. A very good sign!Venatrix is now a superb, thriving recruitment business. She has a solid team in place and has won some exceptional clients along the way. Her idea is unique, as Elaine provides companies with graduates who are trained, prepared and ready for her clients in the market.Elaine has an enviable reputation as an outstanding entrepreneur and businessperson, and people love work with her. An extremely driven, highly motivated individual with a clear idea of what she wants - as well as being a fun, exciting and inspirational presence in her business. I see Venatrix continuing to grow from strength to strength and see this as a great investment from Elaine, where she is on track to create a truly exciting business.

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: Being thrown in at the deep end is not always a bad thing. Quite the opposite. I have lost count of the amount of people that say their best work is carried out when they are under pressure. Testing times give birth to golden opportunities.

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: Steel Design Vacancy - UAEWe’re work with a large International steelwork contractor based in the Middle East who need an engineering professional with extensive/demonstrable experience in Tekla Structures as a Steel Designer, not only detailing but also designing complex steel construction (design & build projects). Experience of primary/structural steel is essential. Due to the current situation, the client needs someone who is already in the UAE and can join immediately. Desired experience includes; a master’s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering, Preferably MIStructE, 5 years+ Tekla design & detailing experience, extensive knowledge of EURO codes. Salary is open to attract the best candidate for the role. Please contact me directly to learn more - we’d like to get interviews happening on this next week! My email is doc@bila-group.com. Have a great day! #steeldetailing #steeldesign #steelstructures #structuralsteel #fabrication #steelconstruction #teklastructures #tekla #steelfabrication

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: COVID has changed the narrative on a number of preconceived ideas long-held by employers. We examine how the concept of work is being redefined in terms of output versus time spent, and how the relationship of trust between employer and employee has had to evolve in response to the pandemic. How do you envision the "new norm" of work and employers' priorities?

Name: James Caan CBE

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: We have experienced one of the most severe economic contractions in history over the past few months, yet I am seeing a number of opportunities arise. Opportunities for:- those whose purpose benefits the post-pandemic work environment- those supplying companies with the technology to work remotely- those who have a business that tackles the spread of Coronavirus head onA significant amount of my contacts are bringing every single one of their employees back from furlough.The bounce back could be quicker than what many had assumed. Do you agree?

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: What will the world look like when we come out of this pandemic? I have been asked this question by hundreds of people over the past couple of months. One thing is for certain - our work environment is set to change beyond recognition permanently. The norm of office work in the post-coronavirus world is unlikely to say the least. In this LinkedIn Newsletter, I outline four hallmarks that I believe will feature highly in the years to come.

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: When I first started out in business, being an entrepreneur was always something that someone else did. Over 30 years later, it has never been cooler to be one. Since the last financial crisis, we have grown and grown to become a nation of small and medium sized enterprises. They formed the backbone of our economic recovery.In the advent of the biggest storm in our lifetime, I believe these are about to reach new, unprecedented heights.The combination of government funding and technology provides the perfect antidote to offset some of the job losses that are about to hit us.I remember a time where people that ran so-called ‘lifestyle businesses’ almost felt the need to apologise.From 2020 onwards, these are about to become the norm.Creating your own company is not about owning premises and hiring employees.It is about work for yourself.It is about flexibility.It is about freedom.We are on the cusp of becoming a nation of independent businesses.

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: The government’s latest economic intervention is a complete knee jerk reaction. The decision to offer £1,000 to any company that brings any worker back from furlough is generous at best, wasteful at worst.Many companies that were going to bring back workers anyway are set to receive a free windfall. I commend Primark’s decision to refuse this payment, but not everyone is going to follow in their footsteps.It seems as if ministers are simply throwing money at the situation and hoping for the best.In my view, a better way of doing things would have been to activate this payment after you have brought at least 50% of your workforce back.If you bring back up to 75% you should receive the payment, and there is a business argument to increase the payment for companies that bring back 75-100% of their workforce.This could have saved millions.That money could have been poured into training those left unemployed for the new world we are living in.The genie is out of the bottle, and we are not putting it back. Governments around the world need to be more creative about their allocation of spending.

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: With the furlough scheme sustaining millions ending in October, the future looks highly uncertain for those seeking work. We are set for a sustained period of higher unemployment. This does not mean there will not be opportunities. Even if you are a graduate with little work experience to your name, you may still possess commendable research and analytical skills.My advice to you is:1) Identify a range of companies that match your skill set2) Do not ask these companies for a job, but contact them about any help they may need3) Tell them you can work on a project for a fixed rateCompanies jump at this proactive approach.Convert your skills into a commercial structure, and reap the benefits.

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: In business, the one thing you can be sure of is that if something can go wrong, it will. Do you work best in pressured situations?

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: I want to expel a myth about business. To build your own tangible income without work for someone else, you do not need to be an entrepreneur in the classic sense of the word. As we approach a time where unemployment looks set to reach historic highs, you are going to need to think outside of the box to maintain the living standards you once took for granted. The fundamental notion remains: you need to be able to sell your skills to earn a meaningful amount of income. What will change is the nature of work. Approach companies with confidence. Play to your strengths and develop your skills for both party’s benefit. Ask them if they have any projects to work on and consider contracting. Lifestyle businesses are back on the table. After all, the fundamental aim of this process is to be able to sustain a living. You do not need a large amount of capital to start work for yourself. It is your expertise that forms the backbone of your capabilities. The tragic events of 2020 could be the dawn of a new wave of lifestyle businesses. If you can create one, to me, you are a winner.
