Name: James Caan CBE
Text: I recently posted about an exciting new platform that could revolutionise business. The platform, Vintro, gives you direct access to in-demand and time-poor industry leaders like myself. A few weeks after posting, I learnt that one of my followers, Hamzah Malik tried it out for himself and was able to get his idea in front of the right people. He selected 5 business leaders to contact, submitted a pitch and within 24 hours had video replies from them. As Hamzah said to me, Vintro doesn’t guarantee you investment, but it opens the door for you and lets you control the conversation. As a result, he has found two new investors and is launching his app in the Middle East. Congratulations to Noor Sugrue and team for building a fantastic product.

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: As a business owner with over 30 years’ experience, I have seen it all when it comes to the recruitment process. One notable change has been the diminishing importance of the resume. It forms just one part of the jigsaw I use to recruit people. Resumes are surprisingly limited in what they can tell me. They are focused on the past. Of course they form a foundation, but to make a decision I need tangible evidence of the present. It’s a face-to-face discussion over a video call that really opens my eyes to the complete picture of the candidate. The image is even clearer to me when the candidate engages in conversation, the talk should be anything but a question and answer session. The final decision rests on a number of factors, but don’t think your resume is the be all and end all.

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: A friend of mine who was starting his own business recently told me that he was spending too much time on his IT, tweaking his website, looking after his office in lockdown and various other administrative issues. He was used to coming into the office and having everything ready for him when he worked as an employee. As an entrepreneur, I understand the stress of having a company’s success rest on your shoulders. The stress is especially pronounced for anyone who has spent a long time work for huge, established companies: they are used to being a cog in a machine, taking the power of the brand for granted and having clients flock to them with minimal effort. Try to undertake these administrative tasks outside of key business hours. An hour of negativity can easily translate into a bad day, which if not rectified turns into a bad week, which can easily turn into a bad month. Starting a business is always going to be difficult, especially in today’s climate. Many successful businesses were started in adverse conditions so don’t be put off. But the more work you put in, the more you will get out of it.  You just have to believe in yourself and be prepared to give it 100% and roll your sleeves up, get stuck in and enjoy the ride. #Entrepreneurship #Founder #Business

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: In an interview, whether it is in person or over video, I like to see examples of a person’s work. At an interview for one of the investment managers that we hired, he showed me a financial report that he had written, and I was really impressed with it. I was trying to evaluate the usual questions: is he right, is he wrong, can he do the job, can’t he do the job? There were a hundred things going on in my mind, but that one document answered all of my questions.   It demonstrated, in one hit, his style, ability and skill set.   I didn’t have to read it all.  Just scanning through it told me that he was the right person for the job. Ultimately, it’s all about the impression you leave. So give the interviewer tangible evidence of your credentials. It could be a report, your position on a league table, a testimonial, a reference or even an example of your work.  This ensures there is something visual to remember you by when the interview concludes. #Interview #JobInterview #Business

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: People are always unsure of the best way to deliver bad news. The list of things that can go wrong in business, especially in today's climate, is endless. Negative developments are just part and parcel of the journey. Avoiding this is impossible...- Maybe performance last month dropped beyond budget. - Maybe costs this month have started to exceed budget. - Maybe cash collections are forecast to be poor.The most important thing, when any of these events occur, is to be honest about it with the people who matter. If you hide bad news, the problem compounds.Your investors knew they were taking a risk when they invested in you. They’re expecting you to have bad news from time to time. Sharing bad news shows confidence and strength. A lot of events will be out of your control. All that matters is that you’re upfront and honest with them and that you reassure them that you are dealing with the situation.Once you tell them the issue, it becomes their issue not just your issue. Nobody expects you to have all the answers, and a problem shared is a problem solved.

Name: James Caan CBE
Text: To all entrepreneurs: Many businesses begin with contacting people cold. It gets the ball rolling. Relationships are built on this, but maintaining them is what really allows your venture to thrive. As you build your network of clients, your list of potential referees grows too.  In the recruitment business, I have always found referrals from existing clients an extremely powerful tool. This also applies to candidates. If you have performed well and you call the client back with another top candidate, they are going to be interested. You live or die by your reputation, and a positive reputation builds momentum. That is why at Alexander Mann, I worked so hard to make sure the candidate met the client’s needs. We are naturally inclined to stick with who we know. Using your hard-won network to reach out to others is an incredibly powerful tool. It’s simpler, faster and more enjoyable.  So really, it all comes down to the business to deliver a high-quality service and keep the relationship going. The coldest leads can turn into the warmest relationships.  #ColdCalling #Sales #Relationships

Text: This remarkable guest wanted a healthy alternative to addicting diet soda and couldn’t find one. Click to listen  https://bit.ly/3nUKwgSKara Goldin created Hint Inc. in her kitchen and gave samples to neighbors for market research. “When you have a billion-dollar advertising budget, you can get Taylor Swift to come and stand by your billboard and sell Diet Coke, but it’s still not healthy,” she says. “We’re not interested in selling glitz. What we’re doing is selling health.”Today Hint is over fifteen years old and sales exceed $150 million. It gone from employing Kara and her husband to employ over 200 people.In this episode we discussed: 🍊 what it takes to make a cold call 🍎 get your products into Whole Foods 🍋 and, in general, how to be undaunted#remarkablepeople #podcast #KaraGoldin #undaunted #unstoppable

Text: “This is a game changer” - ME! I said that. Here’s the deal: I buy a lot of tech gear, and with those come a lot of digital manuals which I like to refer to later. My solution: drag and drop the PDF from my Mac to the reMarkable Mac app on my desktop. The PDF saves instantly, and I can take notes right on the PDF for later use.I can organize my PDFs by moving them into folders under My files. All my PDFs will appear in the filtered PDFs section on my reMarkable, regardless of how they are organized. Now I have them all in one place, and I can easily find them. Like I said, game changer.#remarkablepaper #remarkabletablet #papertablet #paperpeople #paperlove #tablet #tech #technology #eink #ebook #notebook #work #worksmarter #newtech #newtechnology. #macapp#techpeople #remarkable2 #betterpaper #betterthinking #paper

Text: Clip from an upcoming interview with Dr. Vivek Murthy. Please listen before you vote and share. “I spend time briefing the Vice President [Joe Biden] on a regular basis on COVID. And what has struck me about him is that he is very, he’s really focused on the practical and the personal, I would say those are two sort of themes that guide him.And when I say the personal, what I mean is he grasps numbers with great dexterity. He understands key concepts. He knows what the big drivers are of spread, et cetera. He knows a lot of that stuff, but he’s anchored in the personal, his sense that he always wants to know, how is this affecting an everyday mom or dad, how is this affecting small businesses on the street?” #biden2020 #bidenharris2020 #bidenharris #COVID #DrVivekMurthy #RemarkablePeople #smallbusiness #smallbusinessrecovery

Name: Guy Kawasaki
Text: "People of all genders can be socialized into patriarchal systems, and white women, in particular, sometimes benefit from their proximity to, and participation in, authoritarian white masculinity."

Name: Marla Gottschalk, Ph.D.
Text: It was a privilege to interview my friend and former colleague Cathy Engelbert, the first-ever Commissioner of the WNBA (Women's National Basketball Association), at this year's The Chicago Network virtual event. We discussed her vision for the league and the revolutionary 'wubble'. She also shared learnings from her time as a student-athlete and how it's translated to leadership skills that extend beyond the court such as her favorite lesson 'shoot when you are open because you miss 100% of the shots you don't take'. #womenleaders #womenintheforefront #leadership

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Opportunity to join a great company and an awesome team.

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: It seems impossible to find meaning in the monotony of the last 7 months, but maybe it’s as simple as rewinding to remember the past and fast-forwarding to envision the future.

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: We're often told to live in the moment, which is good advice (though hard to follow), but I think there's also merit to mental time travel to the past and future.  The key is attentiveness and intentionality about the journey.  The reward is purpose and perspective.  #worklifeintegration #leadership

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Most of us fail at communication. But - there’s a simple formula leaders can use to share new information with teams. 1) Remind everyone of the “old” strategy2) Share the key rationale points for the change 3) Articulate the new strategy that incorporates that new information#2 is critical - especially in uncertain times like these. How do you manage decisions when you’re taking new information? Share in the comments below 👇#leadership #communication #decisionmaking

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: What will the future of marketing be? I'm thrilled to be partnering with the American Marketing Association to produce a Non-Obvious Summit on the Future of Marketing as part of #marketingweek next Thursday, October 8th. We have some amazing speakers lined up, including Bill Kircos, Katya Andresen, Guy Kawasaki, Tom Fishburne, Charlene Li, Russ Klein, Jinal Shah, Angela Long, and Mihali Stavlas. You can still register at www.amadc.org/nonobvious. #marketing #ama #amadc #tomfishburne #nonobvious #guykawasaki The American Marketing Association—Washington, DC

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Wonderful women, wonderful inspiration. Congrats Jennifer R. Jackson

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: "When you create #experiences based on the rational mind, you’ll get something that might be seamless but it most likely will not resonate with people on an #emotional level."#UnthinkingMind Really enjoying the process behind Katya and her Capital One experience team; how they reinvented their banks to be more customer-centric, and how they continue to evolve to meet the complex expectations of customers using human connection and emotion. #CX INBOUND #INBOUND2020

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: A new piece on why businesses focusing on 'anti-bias' might solve more than a focus on 'anti-racism'.  Would love your thoughts (at least I think I would!).Huge thank you to Katya Andresen—the friend and business leader I mention at the end—for your feedback and insights.

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: In this important and compelling piece, Khalil Smith points out: "In almost no facet of business do we reward effort. We reward results and progress. So don’t stop at asking leaders if D&I is important to them; make the priority come alive."  Yes!

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: I'm proud to share that Capital One Arena will serve as an Early Vote Location and Election Day Super Center in an effort to increase access to voting. #Election2020

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: A lot of businesses are experiencing a giant reset.This has the opportunity to level the playing field.More female founders.More black entrepreneurs.More minorities leading companies.This reset creates an opportunity to recover differently.Let’s take advantage of it.#culture #change #leadership

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Our #BlackHer Sheroes of the Week are the brilliant, beautiful, accomplished Black women considering and being considered for Vice President of the United States - Stacey Abrams, Congresswoman Karen Bass, Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms, Congresswoman Val Demings, Senator Kamala Harris, and Susan Rice.We are honored to call them our own.  Check out Higher Heights for America to learn more about and support ALL Black women running for public office!https://lnkd.in/eB44TRq#BlackWomenLead #BlackWomenLeadVP

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Anxiously awaiting the Black Girl Magic Summit!  Listen to this great teaser from Celia Edwards Karam  and Marty McDonald, MBA  for the great conversations we’ll hear at the Summit!

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Many thanks to Marla Felcher for interviewing me for her blog.  I'm honored to be in the company of other 'Good People.'

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Thank you Sukhi Sahni for this thoughtful post on how you are managing on the coronacoaster.  This: "Finding hope in the unknown has allowed me to reevaluate what’s truly valuable, realign my life to live by those values and redesign my priorities for a better tomorrow."

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Sharing stories of hope, learning and the celebration of little things in life. A big thank you to Vinay Banari Sonia Anand and Sacheen Punater for sharing their perspectives with me.  #prbosslady #storytelling #everydaycounts #hopefortomorrow

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: I have a particular sense of urgency around these principles, given the toll of the COVID pandemic, the challenges of remote work environments, and the importance of coming together in our workplaces and in our society to respond to social injustice.  The physical, mental and collective health of our teams matters deeply in this moment.    #leadership #coronacrisis #remotelife

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: What happened when I got mad at work....even though women have been taught not to show anger. In this week's What the Elle newsletter, from Ellevest.#whattheelle #career #diversityandinclusion #personalfinance

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: I always thought the “Blue Eyes, Brown Eyes” exercise was a compelling way to illustrate how discrimination operates.You create arbitrary groups, add an oppressive hierarchy, introduce stereotypes and stigmatizing cues, and discrimination emerges very quickly in almost any audience.It reveals something very powerful about human nature.

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Proud of Capital One for supporting Boss Women Media to bring to life the Black Girl Magic Summit: a virtual experience focused on helping women build, grow, and thrive financially. 👏

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: One of the most frequently asked questions I’ve answered while participating in panels for rising leaders, coaching, or otherwise while network with female emerging talent, is: “How do you find work life balance as a work mom.” My new article outlines the top 3 Work Life Balance insights I’ve learned from mentors and thought leaders along my journey.  Thank you Brené Brown Grace Killelea Katya Andresen Arianna Huffington Sheryl Sandberg Melinda Witmer and so many other female though leaders for generously sharing your insights. #sharingiscaring #workmoms #workmomlife #worklifebalance #worklifeharmony #leadership

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Dear white CEOs like me,We need to pay attention. The frustration, disruption, discomfort, distraction we are experiencing in this moment is a fraction of what our Black employees, customers and partners have dealt with their entire lives.This is not something that “will just pass."We need to own this experience.Write down what we are feeling at this moment.Date it.Print it.We need to put it on the wall where we’ll see it every day.To create sustainable change, leaders like us need to feel these emotions over the long haul.Like a decade or two.That’s nothing compared to the centuries of pain that our black colleagues and their families have dealt with.Racism is real and each of us has benefited from it.I’ve seen some posts about “cluttering” LinkedIn with “social issues.”It’s time for all of us as business leaders to recognize that Racism negatively impacts everyone - including us. Our profits. Our customers. Our partners. Our employees. It’s time for us to lead and do our part to be antiracist.Not sure where to start? See the first comment for things you can read this weekend to get you going.#diversity #leadership #business

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Dear white CEOs like me,We need to pay attention. The frustration, disruption, discomfort, distraction we are experiencing in this moment is a fraction of what our Black employees, customers and partners have dealt with their entire lives.This is not something that “will just pass."We need to own this experience.Write down what we are feeling at this moment.Date it.Print it.We need to put it on the wall where we’ll see it every day.To create sustainable change, leaders like us need to feel these emotions over the long haul.Like a decade or two.That’s nothing compared to the centuries of pain that our black colleagues and their families have dealt with.Racism is real and each of us has benefited from it.I’ve seen some posts about “cluttering” LinkedIn with “social issues.”It’s time for all of us as business leaders to recognize that Racism negatively impacts everyone - including us. Our profits. Our customers. Our partners. Our employees. It’s time for us to lead and do our part to be antiracist.Not sure where to start? See the first comment for things you can read this weekend to get you going.#diversity #leadership #business

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Such an important time to partner in this critical field & we are thrilled to deepen our partnership with St. John Fisher College. #NoBackRow

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: It's unacceptable that women and people of color get penalized when they advocate for diversity at work.When people who aren't white or male speak out on bias, it's not a self-serving act. They're putting their careers at risk to fight systemic injustice.When I mentioned this evidence last week, I failed to call out how desperately it needs to change. It’s a double bind for oppressed groups: the very people who suffer from systemic disadvantage are punished when they voice it.One small way we can all be supportive is to celebrate our colleagues who go out on a limb to speak up and reinforce the importance of change. Yes, it might create some discomfort, but dismantling broken systems is not supposed to be comfortable.

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Dear HR and Comms and CEOs,Please stop asking your Black leaders to stunt for you. Some of you have very few Black execs in your midst. You are asking them to represent your company in expressions of empathy or good intent. Do not do this. They have been carrying the rest of your Black talent in their hearts and in their arms for years, intervening when people want to leave, negotiating opportunities for them, navigating misunderstandings with executive peers on their behalf, listening to them vent about the structural racism in your company and offering support, even while they themselves suffer from it. They have, in some cases, single-handedly prevented multiple “mass exodus” moments triggered by some insensitive thing you did or said. Your Black execs have been toiling. For years. YEARS. A whole extra job, out of love and a sense of purpose. Without acknowledgment or appreciation or hazard pay.It’s your turn. You have the hard conversations. You listen. You show empathy. You apologize for your ignorance. You share your commitments moving forward. YOU do it. Now that some of you have paused long enough to see what is broken, let your Black execs rest, and lead. It’s your responsibility. #raceatwork #leadership #wednesdaywisdom

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Thank you Khalil Smith for this important guidance on allyship.

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Khalil Smith is the best leader I have ever known. And as always, he knows exactly what to say. To everyone wanting to be an ally right now, read his article below:

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Sharing this incredible story and perspective from my amazing friend Lauren Sudeall. Please read!

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: "We’re in a perfect storm for us all to operate in our most comfortable ways of work, and we have to push against the natural biases that make it feel right to create a safe space with just a few trusted partners, to the exclusion of everyone else. Being intentional about creating belonging for others, and seeking it for ourselves, is critically important right now." -- Khalil Smith, NeuroLeadership Institute.  Thank you Khalil for the conversation and so much wisdom over many months of learning from you!  #belonging #inclusivity #blacklivesmatter #inclusionmatters #allyship

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: And Breonna Taylor And Ahmaud Arbery And Trayvon Martin and...on and on! Growing up in the 60s in Memphis, I lived with the threat of being lynched or killed just bc of the color of my skin & I have spent my entire life trying to prove that we are worthy and we are human...Today I feel like a failure in that effort because this keeps happening...I pray for George Floyd and I pray for our country but prayer is not enough we must all bear witness and we must all act peacefully but firmly in the pursuit of justice, peace and love for all! I pray and I say their names #georgefloyd #ahmaudarbery #trayvonmartin #breonnataylor

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Capital One is announcing an initial pledge of $10 million to organizations advancing the cause of social justice for Black communities. This pledge builds on our recent commitment of $50 million to support long-standing non-profit partners struggling to pursue their core missions in the face of the COVID pandemic, including many organizations dedicated to meeting the most pressing needs of the Black community.

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: I'll have more to say as I continue to process my experience and find my voice about everything that is going on, but I didn't want too long to go by without saying a heartfelt thank you to all of the current and former co-workers and friends who have reached out to see how I'm doing, and to share a cry, a laugh, frustration, or hope.I know that there are countless others who have sent their positivity and strength my way, even if it wasn't in a text or an email, and I appreciate that too.I've likely been thinking about you as well, as I recount how fortunate I've been throughout my career, and as I think about how to best pay that back through listening, sharing, and taking action.

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Network for Good stands unequivocally in support of the protesters, activists, and community leaders fighting against racial injustice and inequality. We are a business created as a force for good, and we power good across the nation every day, but we believe we need to do more...We've posted our commitment to fighting racial inequality here.#diversityandinclusion

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: As a middle-aged white male founder, I can’t begin to understand the experiences of my black founder peers.I won’t even try to act like I can.I’ve been extremely privileged.I haven’t experienced the persisting challenges that others have.About a month ago, Amos Winbush III and I had the chance to talk about diversity and inclusion.Amos shares his entrepreneurial journey and how he felt invisible and seen as not credible.He discusses how having an authentic voice at the table benefits an entire community and acts as a voice for the voiceless.It’s on me to leverage my power of influence to make my mark.I’m committed to changing this game. #blacklivesmatter #leadership #founders

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Hello, LinkedIn / Twitter! I usually start with Happy Friday, but what a week…what a week.I just finished the The Fearless Organization book and timing couldn’t be more appropriate with everything happening around the world. Here are my quick thoughts on the book.I want to thank a couple of people that may or may not know how much they have contributed to this timely book selection and so many important learnings along the way: Katya Andresen, Soumya Kanchinadham, Liesl Leach, Liz Kelin, and Chris Womack#leadership #psychologicalsafety #workplace #team #speakup

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: I’m tired. Our team has been work around the clock. But there is no middle ground and I’m proud to do this important work for a company that understands that. “At Capital One, we reject racism in all its forms. From our founding days, we have been committed to the dignity, respect, and inclusion of every associate.”

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: If you are an ally and don't know what to do, please 1) read this and 2) do this.  Thank you Michael J.A. Davis

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Before you hop on your first call of the day or send a follow-up email to a colleague, please take 3 minutes to read this---especially if you are not Black and you have Black colleagues. If it's hard to find empathy then reflect on how you felt after 9/11. That is how Black people feel every time a Black person dies from police brutality and racial profiling. #empathy #employeewellbeing #allyship #compassion #leadership #racialjustice #racialequity

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: While our circumstances are all unique, our need for compassion is universal. It's our job in the face of this overwhelming reality, as large and loud as the mother of all roller coasters rushing and rattling us to the core, to treat ourselves with kindness. And then to spread our compassion to everyone we can. Fortunately, coronavirus is not the only thing that's contagious. The healing force of compassion is too. #coronavirus #COVID #leadership

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: George Floyd. Breonna Taylor. Ahmauad Arbery. Dreasjon “Sean” Reed. Tony McDade. Racism, inequality, hate and privilege in our American culture. To the people in my life and their families and friends who have to deal with racism and hate in America on a daily basis: you matter and you are important.The pandemic has magnified the inequality in America. Racism, especially black oppression and murder in America, is a multi-century tragedy. I’m a middle-aged suburban white man of privilege. I’ve cruised through life as if I could accomplish anything - and I’ve taken full advantage of it.For more than half of America - people of color, women, the LGBTQ+ community and dozens of other groups that represent anyone non-white-male - daily life is filled with fear, frustration and death.I want to do better. I want our country to be better. Racism. Hate. Inequality. It limits our ability to have the best and brightest bring their best selves to the challenges we face as humanity. I’m work to figure out my part in making change. I’ve let this be someone else's problem for my entire life. It’s time for me to dig in.#blacklivesmatter

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: George Floyd. Breonna Taylor. Ahmauad Arbery. Dreasjon “Sean” Reed. Tony McDade. Racism, inequality, hate and privilege in our American culture. Name: Katya Andresen
Text: If you work in corporate communications and you are not work on your company statement to address racial injustice what are you work on? If you are in HR or Diversity & Inclusion and you are not assisting or urging your company to respond why not? “On behalf of your Black colleagues: we’re not okay. And you shouldn’t be either.” I applaud my Capital One leaders and colleagues for using your voice, checking-in, and consistently creating space (in the form of scheduled town halls, round tables, mental health seminars, meeting agenda items, and associate blog posts) for us to voice our anger, disgust, hurt, and overall feeling of exhaustion with discrimination in healthcare, policing and the criminal justice system.   #capitalone #leadership

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: If you are an ally and don't know what to do, please 1) read this and 2) do this.  Thank you Michael J.A. Davis

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Proud to work for a company that cares for their community.

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: I could not be any more proud of this young man and his accomplishment!   Congratulations son!   Great things are out there for waiting for you!

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Thank you Hilary Sinegal for sharing. I feel leaders must listen and recognize this tragic truth with compassion and supportive action.

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Today I sent an email that read, "Over the past couple of weeks, I have struggled with balancing the pivot between dealing with what is going on in society and trying to be effective at work. I am heartbroken and filled with rage about what happened to Ahmaud Arbery, Breonna Taylor, Christian Cooper, George Floyd and the many protesters around this country. In thinking about myself today, I know that I don't have it in me to be in a space where I am still figuring out the rules of how much of myself I can share. I can't sit in a room of strangers and give them my focus, time and attention."  I agonized over sending it wondering what impression it would give and then realized that it didn't matter.  I needed to opt out of that meeting for me; my health and well being.  As you go to work every day remember that not everybody is in the same head space you are.  Be kind and compassionate.A shout out to the person on the other end of the email who said that they stand with me and appreciated me stating what I needed.

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: I’m proud that @CapitalOne is included in @Fortune Magazine’s list of Best Workplaces in Texas. My experience has been filled with great friendships, challenges that we’ve faced and overcome, and the vibrant culture that we’ve all built together. Our associates are some of the brightest, most innovative minds in the industry. Beyond sheer talent, they are simply amazing people. https://bit.ly/3eppUsn

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: This is a very well done article.  Strongly recommend!"Many successful leaders react to anxiety by work harder, holding themselves and others to an impossibly high standard, or trying to control things that are beyond their power. For them, it’s hard to imagine not fussing over every project and detail in their work lives, not taking responsibility for everything or always giving their all. “People respond to anxiety by trying to be more perfect and more in control,” Boyes says. “They not only have a Plan B but Plans C, D, and E.” In many societies those behaviors are rewarded. We think of it as a “good work ethic,” but often perfectionism and overwork only cause further anxiety — in yourself and others."https://lnkd.in/eRC4dsC

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: A skill I never expected to see on our son's kindergarten report card: "Can independently mute and unmute himself when requested to do so."Maybe we should add this to performance reviews at work. I know a few adults who are still struggling with it 😆

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Friends, like many others, I’m on the hunt for a new opportunity and could use your help in two ways:1. I would love to connect with you if you or someone you know is looking for product leadership in the DC/MD/VA area. I bring 15+ years of B2C and B2B2C product experience to the table. I’ve managed products and product portfolios in the media, e-commerce, nonprofit technology, cleantech and healthcare spaces. I’ve been a player/coach leading product management and product development teams at small-to-midsize startups and at large enterprises. 2. If you know a job seeker who might be finding it hard to keep positive and motivated, please share this article with them. It explains how OKRs (Objective and Key Results), the goal-setting tool created by Andy Grove and brought into mainstream product thinking by John Doerr, have benefited me and my own search in expected as well as unexpected ways.Thank you all!#jobseeking#productmanagement#OKRs#wearestrongertogether#pleaseshare

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: THE FIGHT IS REALI stumbled across this article, which really resonated with me. It discusses the value of integrated marketing experiences, as much as 31% more effective, and the very real challenges of pulling it off in large enterprises, "the fight is real and the enemy is us". Personally I love the work principles of our Chief Customer Experience officer, Katya Andresen. She's one of the best executives with whom I've ever served.1. Work in purpose driven squads not in siloes2. Focus on influence and inclusivityShama Hyder's article outlined some great suggestions, which were highly reminiscent of our own.#leadership #marketing #influence #principles #inclusivity

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: In remote work, we don't need micromanagers. We need "macromanagers" to highlight our contribution to the team and reinforce the broader purpose of our work.One of the most meaningful parts of a manager's job is making other people's jobs more meaningful.

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: My colleague Katya Andresen on psychological safety and the challenge of speaking up."We might be tempted to put the burden for that on the members of our team and say, Why aren't you speaking up more? Why didn't you say something about that? It’s easier to judge others than to look inside ourselves and ask, what do we need to change about ourselves and the environment around us in order to make people comfortable with speaking up?"

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Grateful for a company and colleagues like this Shavonne Gordon

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Making lemonade out of lemons - read about how me and several other Moms are dealing with work at home during a pandemic with our families. #lifeatcapitalone

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Ran my first half marathon today. Man I need some ice...The first 90 minutes was spent listening (through Audible) to Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella engaging book on his quest to rediscover his company's soul - "Hit Refresh".I found myself really drifting towards his way of thinking. Building companies is not a #ZeroSum game, when others (even competitors) win, then we can all achieve something better.The last 40 minutes of my run, after I switched from Audible to more inspirational up-tempo music, was spent trying to convince myself that running a #halfmarathon was actually a good idea. After the tenth mile, all I wanted to do was quit and start walking. Every single step... All of you that have run a #fullmarathon I respect the heck out of you. #wellDone and #BigUps.Off to the ice bath...

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: While our circumstances are all unique, our need for compassion is universal. It's our job in the face of this overwhelming reality, as large and loud as the mother of all roller coasters rushing and rattling us to the core, to treat ourselves with kindness. And then to spread our compassion to everyone we can. Fortunately, coronavirus is not the only thing that's contagious. The healing force of compassion is too. #coronavirus #COVID #leadership

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Recession is coming.Three big things are more important now than at any time in your company's history.1. Transparency - consistent context for your team, how you are thinking and processing new information2. Ownership - responsibility and authority for your team on execute and make decisions3. Resiliency - recover from mistakes / get after opportunities to take advantage of this window of time.If you demonstrate Transparency, Ownership & Resiliency every day, your team will move faster and accomplish more.#leadershipincrisis #founders #leadership

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Making a conscious effort to insert breaks into your work can make you more creative.

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: I couldn't help but feel nervous about my job commitment with everything going on. I've seen so many of my peers loose internships or full-time offers, I almost half expected it to happen to me. In the midst of this, I get a knock at my door with a delivery of all of this Capital One swag and a note welcoming me to the team. Couldn't be more excited to be joining a team that is still taking care of its future (and current) employees despite a global pandemic. Thanks Capital One!

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Quieting the storm is important for any leader to attempt- Looks like it will be a Summer of Working at Home.  I am incredibly proud of our Capital One Leadership and our CEO for declaring. A post Labor Day discussion and next steps will unfold.  Rich is a employee focused leader and also customer orientated. Capital One Proud  #workatHome #bringonthegadgets #CapitalOne #leadershipbyexample #businesscontinuityplanning #COVIDresponse #CapitalOneProud

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: The first batch of #INBOUND speakers dropped this week and I've already put these five on my "do-not-miss" list.Katya Andresen (Capital One) — An Anthropologist Walks into a Bank - and Other Thought Experiments for Brilliant CXAlon Alroy (Bizzabo) — An Organizational Playbook To Turn Your Employees Into Frictionless CX HeroesDeb Calvert (People First Productivity Solutions) — How to Create Value & a Memorable Customer Experience by Asking Better QuestionsLindsay Tjepkema (Casted) — The Future of Content Marketing is ConversationTyi McCray, PhD (Airbnb) — The Who, What, and How of Being an Inclusive 21st Century LeaderAgenda's in the first comment. Who are you most excited to hear from? #hubspot #CX

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: There are no easy answers when surrounded by so much uncertainty, but Katya Andresen does a wonderful job of thinking through 6 ways that leaders can approach their teams with compassion and humanity in times like these when it matters most.

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Before the world was turned upside down by a global pandemic, I had a great conversation with  @tanyaott1 for the Deloitte Insights podcast: “Within Reach: Conversations with leaders on the front lines of the financial services industry.” Our discussion includes a glimpse into my career path, leadership style and the passion for solving "big, hairy, interesting problems" that drives my work.

Name: Katya Andresen
Text: Thank you, Katya Andresen  for empathetic and strong words of leadership courage at this time

Name: David H. Stevens, CMB
Text: Home building/remodeling is hiring. Industry should post a year over year gain for jobs in the coming month or two.

Name: David H. Stevens, CMB
Text: Life isn't about finding yourself. It's about creating yourself.- George Bernard ShawIn a world where things are always changing, sometimes you have to take a moment to step back and think about where you are in life and where you want to go. The best way to get there is to reinvent yourself in a way that models your future success. Your biggest goals are possible with the right mindset and drive to be the best version of yourself!#poweredbyhamilton #hamiltonhomeloans #HHL #creatingopportunities #createyourlife #creatingyourself

Name: David H. Stevens, CMB
Text: In 1994 my mom's dreams came to a sudden halt. She found out she had stage 4 breast cancer, and they gave her six months to live.My father saved up to pay $100,000 out of pocket for a half-million-dollar experimental procedure.I'll never forget how scary the prospect of losing my mother was at 18. But I didn't.She went into remission in 1995 and took a year to recover. When she finally went back to work, her energy was just depleted.I don't think she was ever the same again.In 2010 she was diagnosed again and went into remission in 2011. Luckily she had regular exams and caught it early.Here we are a decade after her second diagnosis, and I have to reflect on the mark she's left in my life.She's the embodiment of survival and tenacity. Even at her weakest moments, she fought mentally, emotionally, and physically to press on.And that's what all cancer patients do.October is Breast Cancer Awareness Month, and here at EPM, we're doing everything we can to support the cause.Did you know that about 1 in 8 U.S. women will develop invasive breast cancer throughout their lifetime?I urge everyone to donate to the foundations looking for a cure.Help people like my mom fight.Together, we are stronger than cancer.#livesnotloans #empoweringpeoplemore

Name: David H. Stevens, CMB
Text: Great comments about Dynex Capital, Inc.  as well as this point: Wall Street, however, doesn't expect much in the way of surprises, because the third quarter didn't have any of the market turmoil that roiled mortgage REITs at the start of this year. Credit Suisse expects that the group will report a mild increase in book value, as "volatility in book value has quieted down following outsize moves in the past two quarters."So while leverage always brings risks, these securities could be one of the rare places in today's market where investors can earn hefty yields without needing to be extra vigilant. Barron's Credit Suisse J.P. Morgan #reits #investments

Name: David H. Stevens, CMB
Text: While COVID has been the source of much tragedy, I believe there's a silver lining.People are discovering how to be resilient, and they're focusing on what matters most.But maybe the most important: they're learning to enjoy things that they never have before.• They're building new routines around their mental, emotional, and physical health. Now I see people walking and running outside when before they had no interest.• They're creating new friendships and investing in old relationships. Before, people didn't have enough time to focus on others, but now it's vital to stay connected.• They're restructuring their business more efficiently. Many people were resistant to new strategies because they were doing fine. Now, evolving isn't optional.It's interesting how the things that should break us only make us stronger.While it may not seem like it in the moment, challenges can be your greatest gift. They teach you how to build a sturdier foundation than you had in the first place.What's one thing you enjoy now that you didn't eight months ago?#mortgagebankers #mortgagebrokers #brokersarebetter #loans #loanofficers #mortgages #livesnotloans #empoweringpeoplemore

Name: David H. Stevens, CMB
Text: Going public means, we have achieved a major milestone that very few companies accomplish.  This is a thrilling development for Finance of America and on behalf of the leadership team, I want to thank each and every one of our teammates for their hard work and dedication you invested to make this day happen.  Your efforts have been Herculean.  Many continued blessings. #leadership #nextlevel2020

Name: David H. Stevens, CMB
Text: Martin Luther King Jr said, “Darkness cannot drive out darkness, only light can do that.” And that quote sticks with me every day. Even in these difficult times, I try to look at our challenges as opportunities.#mortgagebankers #mortgagebrokers #loans #brokersarebetter #loanofficers #mortgages #realtors #livesnotloans #empoweringpeoplemore

Name: David H. Stevens, CMB
Text: Earning my CMB in 2011 was one of my greatest accomplishments in business!!  Having not finished college, this is my diploma.  It was a long road getting here.  I’ve since had the chance to Sponsor a candidate,Teach SOMB I, Teach the CMB Prep Course, Sit on Orals Panels, and give back to the MBA and this industry. I had the support of a great network of friends encouraging me along the way.  So many to thank. Patrick (PJ) Harrigan, CMB my sponsor. Griff Straw, CMB and Pete Taglia, CMB, my teachers, Jodie Morgan,CMB  my study partner. A special shout out goes to my friend and mentor David Frase, CMB, “This is all your fault!  You got me into this mess!!!”#CMBStrong

Name: David H. Stevens, CMB
Text: Looking forward to keynoting the NAMB - National Association of Mortgage Brokers conference this Wednesday. They have a pretty good line up including FHFA’s Mark Calabria, Rob Chrisman , Frank Garay and Brian Stevens , the GSE’s....and more.

Name: David H. Stevens, CMB
Text: Microsoft will allow employees to stay remote permanentlyBy Nicolas VegaOctober 9, 2020 | 11:38am

Name: David H. Stevens, CMB
Text: My #CMB Journey began with Griff Straw, CMB   scaring the crap out of me....”you know the information but you need to be able to answer in concise responses”. He’d quiz me over and over, week after week. Then Patrick J (PJ) Harrigan CMB®, AMP  joined in and tried to keep me calm. My wife would run flash cards by me on long 4-5 hour drives to our lake house. The night before the written exam I emailed both Griff and PJ to be prepared for me failing the test. Oh, and Amber Lawrence  was always there with her smile and support. To my surprise I passed the written and the orals and joined the #CMB society and, honestly, felt very proud. To this day I know that what all CMB’s have done is beyond what my many friends, who have yet to go there, have not. The non CMB list includes several MBA Chairs and many others in leadership - c’mon gang - get with the program and become a #CMB! Mortgage Bankers Association

Name: David H. Stevens, CMB
Text: My #CMB Journey began with Griff Straw, CMB   scaring the crap out of me....”you know the information but you need to be able to answer in concise responses”. He’d quiz me over and over, week after week. Then Patrick J (PJ) Harrigan CMB®, AMP  joined in and tried to keep me calm. My wife would run flash cards by me on long 4-5 hour drives to our lake house. The night before the written exam I emailed both Griff and PJ to be prepared for me failing the test. Oh, and Amber Lawrence  was always there with her smile and support. To my surprise I passed the written and the orals and joined the #CMB society and, honestly, felt very proud. To this day I know that what all CMB’s have done is beyond what my many friends, who have yet to go there, have not. The non CMB list includes several MBA Chairs and many others in leadership - c’mon gang - get with the program and become a #CMB! Mortgage Bankers Association

Text: “My #CMB journey began by an initial push by Tom Cronin, Master CMB and then a shove Melanie Reid, CMB. Name: David H. Stevens, CMB
Text: Two years ago I set out to achieve my Certified Mortgage Banker® designation. The CMB® is the highest designation one can acquire in the Mortgage Industry. Last night my hard work paid off. Special thanks to David H. Stevens, CMB for agreeing to sponsor me, Theresa Angelo, CMB, AMP for being my go-to for questions on what to expect and how best to prepare, my entire study group who collectively assembled a 200+ page study guide that was used to pass the 6-hour written exam as well to folks like Joshua Weikers, CFA, CMB and Sherry Gallitz who graciously shared tips with me on how best to prepare for the oral exam. To the CMB Society, I am excited to join your ranks and look forward to keeping the fire lit and will help carry the torch for decades to come. #CMBStrong

Name: David H. Stevens, CMB
Text: Meet Ann Hawkins, our SVP of Mortgage Operations Risk & Compliance at GMM! Ann volunteers once a week at Lake Norman Humane, located in Mooresville, North Carolina. Lake Norman Humane rescues, rehabilitates, and rehomes companion animals so they can get a second chance at a forever home. Her work there is not easy; she spends most of her time walking, feeding, cleaning the runs for the dogs, and giving each of the animals individualized attention once all of the chores are complete. Ann chooses to volunteer because of her love and passion for animals. She hopes to make a difference in their lives as they have made one in hers. GMM is proud to have employees who make a difference!To view Lake Norman Humane’s residents who are looking for a forever home please visit: https://lnkd.in/eDMGY7j

Name: David H. Stevens, CMB
Text: Just like in Blackjack where "21" is the lucky number.....I have had an incredibly lucky and fortunate "21 year run" at Cisco. Recently I accepted the early retirement package and my final day was yesterday. I leave with incredible memories and lifelong friendships from all over the world. Thanks to all the great team members, mentors and leaders I have worked with....not only here at Cisco...but at our Partners. Your advice and guidance has helped shape me as a person and a leader. After some time off I will be looking for a new adventure......and I can only hope I am "lucky" enough to find something that rivals the amazing journey I have experienced here. Oh and FYI changing your phone, email addresses, hotel programs, airline programs is not a great time :)

Name: David H. Stevens, CMB
Text: The man on the left is Delonte West. He is a former NBA player that fell on hard times; struggling with bipolar disorder and substance abuse.He earned around $16 million dollars during his playing career. Today he is homeless... scratch that. He WAS homeless. He was homeless until the man on the right heard about Delonte’s plight. The man on the right is Mark Cuban. He is currently worth 4.3 billion dollars. He heard that West had been seen panhandling at a gas station in the Dallas area. Cuban got in his car and searched him out.  Cuban didn’t send for someone to go get West, he went himself. He wanted to be certain that West got in the car; He wanted to make sure West would accept treatment - so he went to make the pitch himself. You see, West played for Cuban’s Dallas Mavericks and Cuban was just looking after one of his own. West, in fact, did get into Cuban’s car and is on his way to recovering his life Message:1. Actions always speak louder than a checkbook.  2. When it’s important enough, its personal.

Name: David H. Stevens, CMB
Text: Who is someone you look up to that your childhood self never would have looked up to?When I was a child I looked up to athletes. I was inspired by the guys playing in Seattle where I grew up, such as Gary Peyton and Sean Kemp, but as I grew that began to change. The circle of people I looked up to began to shift towards business leaders. I began to find inspiration from the people that I believed could have an even larger impact.I’ve been extremely fortunate to meet some incredible mentors in life, but I also believe you can learn things from others who might not necessarily be mentors.You can do this by filtering what will work for you.I believe children can teach us more than anyone. Children haven’t been told no. They truly believe they can do anything.#RoleModels #Employment #DirectImpact

Name: Jacques Attali
Text: The number of #satellites in orbit should quintuple by 2030 as the global #space industry expands. From satellite broadband, to weather forecasts, long term #climate monitoring, #agricultural crop yields, sustainable fishing or navigation, space-based #technologies and services will durably #transform our economies and societies. Yet, the growing number of actors involved in space, particularly from the private sector, and the ever-increasing and unmanageable number of debris, are raising #challenges for the #sustainable use of space. Revising and adapting existing international space treaties will become inescapable.

Name: Jacques Attali
Text: Whereas so much research could be done on how to reduce the misery of people without aggravating the misery of the planet, what a wonderful idea to give the #NobelPrize to two respectable economists who have figured out how to make more money by auctioning off rare goods.

Name: Jacques Attali
Text: South #Korea has proven to be a well-managed country. A #pandemic under control since January 15, i.e. BEFORE the first case in the country. It makes no sense not to learn from what they are doing!!! #economyoflife

Name: Jacques Attali
Text: While 2 billion people currently suffer high water stress situations, the global #freshwater demand is expected to grow by 55% towards 2050, putting further strain on water resources, which will affect the most #vulnerable and increase the risk of localized #conflicts.  There is enough water to meet the world’s growing needs. However, without deeply #transforming the way we use, manage, and share it, the world could suffer a 40% shortfall in water by 2030. The time is ripe for a #cooperative, #sustainable and #ambitious #governance of water.

Name: Jacques Attali
Text: The American dream is turning into a nightmare; and if Europeans know how to organize themselves, we could one day see vast movements of ideas, people, capital, from the United States to the old continent.

Name: Jacques Attali
Text: The economy will bounce back only if #health care systems recover; and it infuriates me to see that health care is not the top priority of the #2021 budget, neither in France nor in most major Western countries.

Name: Jacques Attali
Text: #Philosophers debate incessantly about what is worth #sacrificing. #Ordinary people know that it is by #work for the #well-being of future generations that we will prevent having to take the risk of dying for them.

Name: Jacques Attali
Text: The eradication of poverty and the access to equitable and inclusive quality education are intricately linked. Progress has been made but we fall short of attaining universal education. Investing more in education, especially for girls, is an absolute necessity, for current and future generations.

Name: Jacques Attali
Text: No matter how much admiration the woman, the jurist, the protector of minorities deserves, Non-US  politicians should not forget, in their comments, that the rule of law applicable in their country is not established by the Supreme Court of the United States #RIPRBG

Name: Jacques Attali
Text: The COVID has shed light on significant weaknesses in health systems. We need to learn lessons from this crisis and act jointly, rapidly and massively to strenghten healthcare capacities on the long term. It is high time to stop the cycles of panic and neglect.

Name: Jacques Attali
Text: The debate about #5G in France revolves solely around what consumers could do with it, while ignoring that the impact of this technology will first of all be a revolution in how we produce all of our current goods and services.Other countries have understood this.

Name: Jacques Attali
Text: We are trying to solve a 21st century #crisis with resources that were thought out at the beginning of the #20th century. Must we go through a new #lockdown to understand that the current recovery plans are inadequate and decide on massive investments in the economy of life?

Name: Jacques Attali
Text: It is time to act for our #future and for future #generations.

Name: Jacques Attali
Text: Final energy demand is expected to increase at least by a third towards 2060. If no major shift in policies is made, fossil fuels will remain the norm in global energy production. The time is ripe for major and structural changes.

Name: Jacques Attali
Text: What is universal and must be defended; particular and must be accepted? The nation must be universally secular. Managing the new school year and the recovery plan must be applied differently on the basis of the regions, social groups and economic sectors. Not the other way around!

Name: Jacques Attali
Text: The last tweet of a very great intellectual, a free creator of major concepts, at the forefront of major battles.

Name: Jacques Attali
Text: When darkness sets in, you have to look for a few rays of light and use them to lighten your way. When bad news accumulates, we must seek good news and lean on it. Here are ten news that may possibly come true before the end of 2020.

Name: Jacques Attali
Text: If countries don't want to lose control of the pandemic, and endure a new lockdown causing the collapse of their economy, they must IMPOSE THE MASK EVERYWHERE OUT OF HOME. Delaying this decision will only make it necessary for longer.

Name: Jacques Attali
Text: Which armies would support Greece if the Turkish army ever set foot on a Greek island? And if the Russian Forces came to the rescue of Lukashenko? Probably none... #Greece #Belarus #NATO#europeandefense

Name: Jacques Attali
Text: Are the European universities preparing for the start of their new academic year as well as the best American ones? Are their students as well informed?

Text: The pandemic has exposed weaknesses in existing #sales models and gaps in #digital readiness. In many ways, this #data revolution in sales matches what happened to marketing departments 3-5 years ago, when they became more analytically driven. https://mck.co/34yzyom

Name: David Edelman
Text: I am honored to be joining the Board of Northwestern University with Heather Bogdanoff Baker, Tarek Elmasry, Bridgette Heller, John Kukral and Albert Manzone, and excited to support my alma mater’s commitment to excellent teaching, innovative research, and the personal and intellectual growth of its students in a diverse academic community.

Name: David Edelman
Text: This Friday I was unexpectedly admitted to the hospital for critically low sodium and chloride levels which I have been managing for a while now, but lately my levels have dropped to a point that they thought it was prudent to have me monitored as they brought it back up to a safe level. After being admitted, a team of specialist including my Endocrinologist, coordinated a plan to safely bring my sodium up. They adjusted my medication and monitored my vitals as they slowly were able to correct it. But while I was going through this weekend, I began to re-appreciate why I got into the healthcare practice and field in the first place. As I walked around and talked to other patients, I learned about their personal situations and how, in their minds, they could have been a little more proactive in managing their conditions and avoided what is now more of an acute care situation.  As I heard these patients describe their “why”, the rationale ranged from the cost of healthcare, difficultly navigating the system, and ease of access. It made me re-appreciate how proud I am to spend my career trying to help people on their path to better health, and ultimately what it means to be well-being ready and proactively manage your well-being journey. Thought I would share.  #payflex

Name: David Edelman
Text: Get ahead of it: ICYMI from @McKinsey - rapid shifts are underway for consumer-facing companies. Because many of the longer-term changes are still being formed, companies have an opportunity, if they act now, to help shape the next normal. https://mck.co/3cF08jx

Name: Josh Bersin
Text: In this 22 minute podcast, Josh Bersin talks about #diversityandinclusion (D&I) in the context of Belonging. Based on his conversations with several D&I leaders, Josh mentions how he is seeing a trend where there is a shift away from Diversity as a strategy to one of inclusion & belonging as a strategy. Said differently, diversity is an outcome that is the result of feelings of #inclusion & #belonging. Several ideas are discussed. You can access the podcast link & other resources through the Sept 20th issue of the Talent Edge Weekly Newsletter. https://bit.ly/3hY1NkZWhen you click on the podcast link,  you can can also access several materials that Josh references in the podcast.To receive the free newsletter each Sunday and/or to access  other #HR, #talentmanagement,& #talentstrategy resources, please visit www.brianheger.com

Name: Josh Bersin
Text: "The single biggest driver of business impact is the strength of an organization's learning culture." - Josh BersinI recently completed, "The Agile Learning Organization" course from Josh Bersin Academy and absolutely loved it. It left me even more excited for the future of learning and development.This course focused on:(1) The New L&D World: the opportunity for learning and development to play a great role in driving innovation(2) Learning from Experience: uncover learning that can reshape how we work and think (3) Learning from Each Other: intentional learning builds confidence and knowledge with shared learning across mentors, coaches, sponsors, and peers (4) Learning by Design: design programs to be learner-centric

Text: And that's a wrap. Farewell NAB, thanks to all the wonderful friends and colleagues who I've met and worked with along the way.Stay tuned for my next challenge . . . .#agile #transformation #learning

Name: Josh Bersin
Text: *** IGNITE: Driving open sharing and knowledge in communities – Session 1069 ***Engaging the people in our teams, making them feel included and providing ways to discuss shared topics and align around common interests, is not only key to #knowledgesharing and #collaboration anymore - it's become essential to empowering people, to make more informed decisions and act faster. And make our entire organization more agile and #resilient. We have re-built #Yammer from the ground up and it was (re-) launched in July this year. With #ProjectCortex, the new intelligent, integrated #MSSearch, #SharePoint and the #Communities app in Teams we now have the most holistic suite of Knowledge solutions - not just a content management platform. Tacit #Knowledge can now be codified and surfaced!Myself and Kaleem Rahman discuss some of the #businessvalue of #CommunitiesofPractice and how the #ThePowerOfCommunities comes to life in the new Yammer! Check out this blog post from Michael Holste, listing all the great sessions we have lined up for you on #EmployeeEngagement, Project Cortex, Communities,  Yammer and the rest of the #M365Knowledge solutions... With tons of exciting announcements planned for #MSIgnite#YearOfYammer #KM #TacitKnowledge #microsoft365 #M365Knowledge #Microsoft

Name: Josh Bersin
Text: Today I interviewed a women for a female business owners’ Executive Team. This woman is extremely accomplished in her field, is well respected in her industry and teaches at a renowned university. She recently became unemployed and shared her thoughts and lessons about what she could have done differently in her last role.She said, “I advocated for everyone but myself. I didn’t ask for help because I didn’t want anyone to think I wasn’t capable. I didn’t track my own successes because I didn’t want to occur boastful. I felt like I was always trying to prove myself so they would see my worth.”She gave almost a decade of employment to her former organization. No outplacement. No career coaching. Just good bye. This happens daily in current economic situations. The lesson is - Ladies, no one is coming. The only advocate you really have is you.My mom taught me - If it’s to be it’s up to me.Ignite Your Personal Power!#womensleadership

Name: Josh Bersin
Text: If you are into conspiracy theories, you might question if humans actually landed on the moon, you might believe that Mount Rushmore holds some of America’s biggest secrets or you’ve probably heard that Justin Bieber’s latest music video Yummy is secretly about Pizzagate. I am not one who believes the world is run by secret societies or “the commission” (nod to Umbrella ☂ Academy), & enjoy Myth Busters & Snopes.Today, I’m going to “fact check” the urban legend that Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) are black holes:- Myth #1: The ATS uses artificial intelligence that reject you when you apply for a job.Truth: Often when you get an auto reject right after applying for a job, it’s because you answered “no” to a question that you should have answered “yes” to. An example of a screen out question is “Do you have a BSN nursing degree?” If you answered “no” and having a BSN is a job requirement, the screen out question would rule you out. - Myth #2: An ATS can’t read shading & text bolding Truth: Modern resumes include design elements like shading and light pops of color. The average recruiter only spends 6-8 seconds scanning the resume to decide if they want to continue reading it. You have to draw the readers eyes to the text you want them to see What are other #myths?

Name: Josh Bersin
Text: I just got promoted to my biggest leadership role yet: Twin mom. I'm hoping the last 20 years of progressive leadership experience, management development, human resources expertise and crisis management have prepared me for this new challenge. I can tell you from 8 days in, the on-boarding has been fierce, and kind of chaotic. I think it's all going to be ok though. I feel prepared and I've had amazing mentors in my career who I've seen do it all. I'm hoping I've absorbed some of it.Wish me luck! I'm going to need it.

Name: Josh Bersin
Text: Google, Not just talking, but also walking the talk. Changing job description requirements and stating what they consider equivalency to a 4 year degree. Many other employers have also undergone changes to their recruiting qualifications.Is the 4 year college degree dead? No, not at all; but its the realization by employers that its not the only pathway to sourcing qualified candidates and better paying and sustainable employment for in-demand 21st century skills.Tiger Todd Cory Warfield Raoul Encinas (he/him) Cheryl Waldrup Keith Keating Kimo Kippen Meredith Curley Todd Zipper Daniele Grassi Jeanne C Meister Scott Mason Josh Bersin Bob Mosher Bob Danna Jane Hart Roseanne Way Bart Patterson Ann Kirschner Kimo Kippen Leonard Cochran, CPTD Constance St. Germain, Ed.D., J.D. Ed Conway Kerry Hearns-Smith DAVID COGAN David T. Fagan Isabel Donadio

Name: Lucien Engelen
Text: Amsterdam is the only city in Europe where staying in an Airbnb is more expensive than staying in a hotelOn average, an overnight stay in one of the nearly 20,000 Airbnb accommodations in Amsterdam costs 156 euros.'De Baarsjes-Oud West' is the most popular neighborhood, with more than 3,000 listings. Followed by 'de Pijp-Rivierenbuurt' with almost 2,500 listings.A visual exploration: mapping every accommodation listed on Airbnb in Amsterdam.#datavisualisation interactive visualization: https://lnkd.in/gbrETuy(data: insideairbnb)

Name: Lucien Engelen
Text: Do you know who Lucien Engelen is? Why did he decide to create a company called Transform.Health? To challenge the status quo? To accelerate innovation in healthcare systems? To empower the patients? I am pleased to have Lucien joining us virtually from his home in #TheNetherlands at "The Future of Health - A European and World Perspective" tomorrow, Oct. 19th. He will join Saurabh Johri, Julia Pietsch, Julien de Salaberry. The panel will be moderated by my friend Natalie Dakers. Hurry! Less than 24 hours left to INTERFACE Summit 2020.Register NOW: interfacesummit.com#digitalhealth #patients #healthcare #AI #innovation #digitaltransfomation

Name: Lucien Engelen
Text: Hidden DeathsIn week 40 the estimated* number of deaths (~3,000) is ~280 higher than the weekly average in week 40 over the past 3 years. The higher mortality is probably related to the second wave of COVID in the Netherlands.However, ‘only’ 66 corona deaths were recorded in week 40. Meaning that the real number of people dying from the COVID virus is probably up to ~210 higher in reality.#datavisualisation #tenminutecharts*Figures are based on estimates because there is usually some delay between the actual date of death and the moment this information reaches Statistics Netherlands.

Name: Lucien Engelen
Text: July 10th, 2019 I wrote a blog "Is CGM (continuous glucose monitor) the new Fitbit or are we just chasing the wrong metrics for health?" ( https://bit.ly/3lepOql ) - I was addicted to wearing a CGM, but as soon as we (temporarily) moved to US & given a CGM is prescription-only here, I dropped the use of it until I stumbled (🙏 Ari Tulla) on Levels and thanks to Josh Clemente & team I am up and running again.. (most likely with a crappy metabolic health to be improved )

Name: Lucien Engelen
Text: To all who were part of it: many many thanks for the ride that has led me to the next station!  For 13 years, building up my dermatological knowledge and sharing it in practice with patients and colleagues was the daily routine. I loved it! Through the years, one piece of me was gaining more terrain though: problem solving and idea generation. Connecting the dots and for sure also the people in order to create new innovations in #digitalhealth.I got the chance for one day a week in the Health Care Innovation Lab at first, but needed more. More focus on this passion.So, from Now on, I am focussing my career on Digital Health Innovations and Digital Transformation. My work for Maastricht UMC+   continues as was (mainly the NFU Citrien e-Health programma) but I also aim for digital innovations in Dermatology (from online platforms for the #NVDV to #DHH Hackathons).I am looking forward to expand my skills, knowledge and network in these areas. I know that I can make impact on Digital Health and I am convinced I can make a change in Digital Dermatology. Will we meet on the intersection of the above? Send me a line if you think you can use my input, we’ll get a coffee and see where the road of impact leads!#followmeformore #wondering #digitaldermatologist #ehealth

Name: Lucien Engelen
Text: "How #VR therapy can cure PTSD, obesity and even the pain of childbirth": New York Post covers my new book, #VRx, on the power of virtual therapeutics & the new field of "Medical Extended Reality" (#MXR). Article reviews key stories & lessons from the book. Link:

Name: Lucien Engelen
Text: My friend Daniel Kraft, MD rocks again at TEDxMarin with a talk on the future of health and biomedicine as catalyzed by #COVID.  The acceleration of collaboration, innovation and discovery can help us reimagine healthcare and bring us a healthier, smarter, more equitable post-Covid world.

Name: Lucien Engelen
Text: U.S. Leadership Failed to Respond to COVID according to New England Journal of Medicine (NEJM) Editorial Board:"COVID has created a crisis throughout the world. This crisis has produced a test of leadership. [...] Here in the United States, our leaders have failed that test. They have taken a crisis and turned it into a tragedy.[...] Our current leaders have undercut trust in science and in government, causing damage that will certainly outlast them.[...] When it comes to the response to the largest public health crisis of our time, our current political leaders have demonstrated that they are dangerously incompetent. We should not abet them and enable the deaths of thousands more Americans by allowing them to keep their jobs."VOTE!#healthcare #medicine #publichealth #COVID #health #coronavirus #leadership #science

Name: Lucien Engelen
Text: Proud of my #team, performing this morning again in a nice online setting, called Friday Lecture Series: 'Crossing borders between sports & occupational medicine and leisure time & occupational physical activity'.Good and clear presentation of Sander Hoorntje about the results of our ACTION trial and the role  #goalattainmentscaling can play in individualizing the rehab of patients willing to resume work and leisure activities following #knee #arthroplasty. 👊🙌 Also great moderation by Paul Kuijer and good questions asked by the audience! 👍👏#teamwork #personalizedkneecare #research

Name: Lucien Engelen
Text: Today, is my first day as Global Head of KPMG International’s healthcare network. Taking over from Mark Britnell who did a great job in growing our global healthcare network over the last 11 years. I come into this role at a time when the sector is experiencing an unprecedented level of disruption. Now, more than ever, healthcare systems around the world are facing exceptional challenges that require policy makers, payers, providers and suppliers to rethink how they work. But even in this crisis I believe every cloud has got a silver lining. With the challenges brought about by COVID there is also the potential to reimagine tomorrow in healthcare systems and organizations and transform the sector to become more future-ready.As a network of more than 4,500 people in 47 countries and territories, we have worked on over 100 assignments to help clients deal with the pandemic. Internally we have discovered new ways of delivering services to our clients and work together. Creating together the resilience that will be needed in the new reality. I am excited about the journey ahead, I know that our network is ready for it and I am looking forward to work with clients to create the healthcare systems and organizations of tomorrow.

Name: Lucien Engelen
Text: 1 of 10 quotes of #RBG: About women on the US supreme court:"When I'm sometimes asked 'When will there be enough (women on the Supreme Court)?' and my answer is: 'When there are nine.' People are shocked. But there'd been nine men, and nobody's ever raised a question about that."I see of lot of women posting about RBG (so far no men - in my network - posted) but believe men should be equally impressed, thankful and forward looking; and supportive of vital importance of women in all positions, in all organisations and in all countries. More diversity, give (far) better results.

Text: I am so proud and excited to share this acknowledgment and award that Cablefax  bestowed upon Pluto TV’s communications team comprised of the brain trust and amazing ladies of Beck Media & Marketing ( Kaitlin Hargrove Stephanie Booker Brittany Marya Aubrey Siegel Yurie Kwon Brittany Sandler). Having worked so hard over these past years to establish and build the awareness and amplify the Pluto TV  brand, it is a gift to receive such industry validation. We were extremely fortunate to have such an inspirational roadmap to work from based on the vision and leadership of our CEO and co-Founder, Tom Ryan. Adding to this amazing team are my esteemed and cherished VCBS Corp comms counterparts, Karen Shosfy  and Justin Dini - my lifelines, sounding boards, gut checkers, editors and so, so, so much more. And this doesn’t even scratch the surface. Timing is everything and so it is said - In even the darkest of times, a light shines through.

Name: Ilya Pozin
Text: While cleaning out the garage today I found this business plan for my first startup, Cductive, which was one of the first digital music retailers. My cofounders, John Rigos and Alan Manuel, and I bootstrapped the company and raised a bit of angel funding, running the business super lean in frothy times. Our vision for the digital distribution of music was ultimately correct but we were way too early and we were fortunate to be acquired a few years before the first iPod was released (which I also found in the garage today...keeper!). There were many early learnings: the power of building a mission-driven organization; the importance of market timing; it's hard to compete with free (e.g. Napster); paradox of choice; access to capital is half the battle; 10x team members are invaluable and can help you outmaneuver much bigger rivals; and, importantly, that startups are hard as hell but far more rewarding and fun. All of these lessons served me extremely well at Pluto TV and I'll be forever grateful for the magical experience and amazing people I worked with at Cductive back in the day. If you can't read the date on the bottom of the document then the now taboo startup swag in the picture tells it all!#cductive #plutotv #startupstories #digitalmusic #streamingvideo #avod

Name: Ilya Pozin
Text: Thank you, Andrew Paul of Slate Magazine, for writing one of the most insightful pieces ever published about our business opportunity and why "the future of digital streaming is Pluto TV." Andrew has many choice quotes, but my favorite is this:"Pluto TV also takes away the anxiety of choice plaguing most of its competitors. Too often have I succumbed to the Death Scroll, that interminable amount of time spent deciding what, exactly, to watch—a process made exponentially more stressful by the number of people seated around the screen. On the one hand, the appeal of a decisionless downtime might sound unnerving, lazy, or even slightly soul-crushing (that’s probably because it, in actuality, is all the above). But that doesn’t change the simple fact that, at any given time, I can turn on Pluto TV to a random channel and be, at the very least, mildly entertained for an indefinite period of time. "#plutotv #viacomcbs #streamingvideo

Name: Ilya Pozin
Text: Hawkefest was an incredible success and better than I could have ever imagined.  Thank you to Rob Dyrdek and Roman Tsunder for closing us out in such a special way.  Thank you to the ridiculously hard put in by the Hawke Media team.  Thank you to our sponsors and partners who make this even possible.  To our speakers who make people actually want to come.  To our attendees who are the only real reason we do this. To my family who got to experience there first #hawkefest. To my business partner, Tony Delmercado who has helped make Hawke soar in such a great way. And just thank you to life and some of the incredible things that come with it.  It’s days like yesterday that make all of the hard work, the grind, the stress, the sacrifice completely and utterly worth it. Life is good.

Name: JT O'Donnell
Text: NEVER tell an employer you're waiting to hear back on a job offer!You just got a job offer from Company A, but you still haven't heard from Company B.What do you do?!?The 1st thing you should do is not reveal too much.Never tell 1 company you can’t give them an answer because you haven't heard back from another.Why is this?The moment Company A learns you're still considering other options - you become a hiring risk. Waiting to learn all your options makes them feel like they're not your 1st choice. In some cases, they might even rescind the offer.Instead, you can respond to Company A with something like this:“Thank you so much for the opportunity. I would like some time to go through the entire written offer to see if I have any questions. Can I get back to you by tomorrow?”Then, if you're still serious about Company B, now is the time to reach out to them.Send them this message;“I just received an offer from another company, but you are my first choice. Am I still in the running for this position? And, if so, do you have an idea of when you might make a decision?”#JTTalksJobs #Jobsearch #Jobseekers #Hiringandpromotion
