Name: JT O'Donnell
Text: FREE LIVE TRAINING: INTERVIEWING DURING A PANDEMIC - TODAY!Job interviews are hard, interviewing during a pandemic feels impossible!What if I told you that even though it feels this way; you can still successfully land a job even during this crisis?That’s right! Despite what you might hear, there are still companies regularly recruiting right now – you just have to get in front of them and prove you’re the right fit. A huge part of proving your worth is nailing that job interview and navigating the new rules of interviewing during this pandemic.I want to help you do that…for FREE!Join me for my live event, Wednesday, 10/21 @ 12pm-12:45pm ET to learn the secrets to successfully interviewing during and after the COVID pandemic!A reminder that I’ll also be taking questions & comments at the end of the session, so if you can catch it live I’ll try to answer yours!PS – Have a friend, colleague, or loved one who would be interested? Feel free to invite them to this event! I’m looking forward to helping you with your job search#JTTalksJobs #Interviewing #Jobsearch #jobseekers

Name: JT O'Donnell
Text: Do NOT put these 3 sections in your resume, or else you'll look OUTDATED!If you want to land a job, it's important to make a good first impression - now more than ever!The 1st impression most recruiters & hiring managers have of you is your resume.If you're using these outdated techniques you need to stop immediately!1) Summary Statements.Your responsibilities & accomplishments are listed in your job history section.No need to be redundant!2) Objective Statements.They know you're interested in the job, you're applying to it!No need to state the obvious!3) What You're Looking For In A Job.Your goal is to sell how you can help the company, not the other way around!Instead of using these 3 outdated techniques....Start your resume with one sentence.It should broadly reference your background and at least 2 strong skills.#JtTalksJobs #Resume #Jobsearch #Jobseekers

Name: JT O'Donnell
Text: ONLY A FEW DAYS LEFT TO JOIN MY BOOTCAMP!2020 was a learning experience.This year, we’ve all learned a lot more about the world, about our strengths, our wants and needs; personally and professionally speaking.Perhaps you lost your job due to the pandemic, or maybe you’d been furloughed and don’t know when you might be going back to work.Or you might have been lucky enough to keep your job...only to realize how unhappy you are with it.No matter what your situation is, chances are you took a closer look at your career and realized you need and want a change.You’re not alone! Many professionals have realized that they want to pivot and change careers. It could be a new position or a completely new industry.No matter what it is; you DESERVE this change, and you DESERVE a successful one!Let me help you with this!For only $7 Work It Daily’s Head Career Coach; Ariella Coombs & I will be hosting a Career Change Bootcamp - Thursday, 10/22 (10 am - 2:30 pm ET).This intense training will walk you through EVERYTHING you need to know for a successful career change in 2020.If you feel robbed by 2020 & want to take your career back - then join us!https://lnkd.in/eSe7ty4#JTTalksJobs #Covid19 #CareerChange #Careers

Name: JT O'Donnell
Text: Today, every job is temporary & most new jobs are gotten via referral.Your network is your net worth. The best way to build a strong network is to offer them value now. When the time comes for you to ask for help, your connections will return the favor.4 Ways to Serve Your Network (Today!)1) Sending personalized individual emails/ LinkedIn notes.Check-In & see how they're doing.Catch up on what each other's current career focus and strengths are.2) Post interesting & valuable professional content on a regular basis.This allows your connections to learn from it.3) Identify people in your network that would benefit from knowing each other.Make a personal introduction to one another.4) Post compliments & praise for fellow professionals that are doing great things in your industry. Commit time each week to serve your network.This establishes yourself as a trusted & respected peer, committed to helping others.If the time comes where you need help, your network will be excited to offer their assistance.#WorkItDaily #Network #Jobsearch #Careers

Name: JT O'Donnell
Text: Graphic from NWEA - Address varied instructional level needs within a classroom in a sustainable way.1) Have three general plans - one for students below target, at target, and above target.  What scaffolds/supports (graphic organizers) are needed for lower level groups? For students in general? What additional texts/resources are needed for those at a high instructional level?2) Plan your instruction around how you can provide more one-on one support for students at lower instructional levels. What can other students be doing in learning stations while you work directly with students more in need?  3) Consider additional school resources. Is there school-based tutoring/remediation support outside of the classroom to compliment what is happening in the classroom?  It's not either/or but both. Is there an enrichment/GT program?  How are students selected for these programs? How does one exit these programs? How do you differentiate?See for ideas - https://lnkd.in/ewFu9Sjhttps://lnkd.in/e-v6bB7#differentiatedinstruction #K12education #teachingandlearning #instructionallevels

Name: JT O'Donnell
Text: Whether you’re a long-time follower of mine or a new one (if so - welcome!), there is one thing I can’t stress the importance of for a successful job search…It’s your cover letter.If you’re not getting job interviews or hearing back from recruiters, there is a good chance your cover letter is to blame.This does NOT mean that you should run to the first cover letter writer you find on Google.There are lots of cover letter writers and services out there that will charge you $100s or $1,000s to write or review your cover letter.And do you want to know a secret? 9/10 they don’t work because no one can write your cover letter except YOU!There is an art to writing these that I want to teach you; and I’m not going to charge you $100+.For just $5, you’ll gain unlimited access to my Cover Letter Accelerator Package.The package includes:Video TutorialCover Letter Guidebook (downloadable with a notes section!)Bad vs Good Examples Cover Letter TemplateIf you’re ready to start getting interviews then click the link below to get started!https://lnkd.in/eNUrdFW#JTTalksJobs #Coverletter #Jobsearch #Jobseekers

Name: JT O'Donnell
Text: If you’re searching for a job right now, don’t panic. Your chances of getting hired aren’t lost, it just means your way of interviewing has changed.I want to give you my top tips for preparing for video interviews! 1) Dress like you're going in for a face-to-face interviewEven though you're not in an in-person interview, you're still representing yourself as a professional and you want to look the part2) Maintain Eye-Contact With The Camera As If It Is The Interviewer This will feel awkward so I recommend practicing ahead of time!3) Steer Clear Of Swivel Chairs!It’s a natural reaction to move, but this can make you appear nervous to the interviewer4) Run Throughs Are A Must!If the interviewer wants to use a streaming service like Zoom, Skype, etc - test it out beforehand to make sure you know what you’re doing! What recent events/news are you worried might affect your career? Comment below!#JtTalksJobs #Interviewing #JobInterviews #jobsearch

Name: JT O'Donnell
Text: I'm going to share with you a simple framework to help you determine if it's time to make a change in your career.I'm going to break this down into 3 easy steps: Step 1: Understanding "Experience + Learn = Grow"The reality today is that if you aren't constantly growing in your job, you're dying. What I mean by this is that the experiences you have should build up your skill sets, and it's really important that every few months you take a step back and assess if this is actually happening.Step 2: Analyze Your Experiences & SkillsThe skills themselves you develop along the way matter, because the reality today is that you have to continuously stay relevant to your work (as shown in the example above). As you're building up your skill sets, you are becoming more and more valuable to an employer.Step 3: Make The Decision (And Stick With It!)The last step in the process is to make the decision of whether or not to leave, and then stick with it.Once you've done the first two steps, you'll know whether or not you've hit a roadblock. If you have, you really only have two options here:A) Sit down with your boss and have an honest conversation to see what you can do to get back on track.B) Make the decision to leave.#JTTalkJobs #Careers #LinkedIn #Jobs

Text: BUILDING UP A NEW INTERNATIONAL MARKET, MISSION IMPOSSIBLE?2020 is horrible. So, of course, it is NOT the right time to expand internationally, right?Not so fast! Name: JT O'Donnell
Text: I find people hate network as much as public speaking. I think it's because many think they are being insincere for having an agenda. But what it this real purpose of network? If you reframe how you look at it, you will find it can be a positive and rewarding experience. Here are my 3 tips to help you approach network.1. Expect nothing. Just focus on getting to know them better. Your only goal is to explore where you are similar so that you can find: - a common value- belief- past experience To create a connection.2. Do your homework. Research people in your industry. Look for the things you have in common. Have a meaningful conversation that makes you both feel energized and productive.3. Use the I.E.O. method for developing the relationship. Your initial conversations are meant to IDENTIFY where you see eye-to-eye. This will move your discussions into opportunities to EXPLORE how your skills, knowledge and experience compliment one another. Ultimately, helping you both naturally start to talk about potential OPPORTUNITIES to collaborate together. You may chat 3X and get through this process, or it might take 12X. The key is to make sure you don't rush the process. #JTTalksJobs #Network #Careers #MarketingStrategy

Name: JT O'Donnell
Text: 1 Thing You Should Do To Grow Your Career This Week.Create a content capsule to showcase your expertise.When it comes to your professional reputation, brand or BE branded. Not taking an intentional approach to personal branding?You're wasting a golden opportunity. A content capsule is some professional content, authored by you.It's posted on social media to validate your expertise & build credibility.  Content capsules can include:- An article where you share your wisdom.-A video of you talking about the subject of the article- A graphic that can be used to promote the topic.Anyone on an executive-level career track will need to create these.We live in a time where leaders must be visibly comfortable presenting their expertise online. Not having a content capsule to showcase your brand sends a message.You will be unknowingly saying one of these:A) "I'm out of touch"B) "I'm not tech-savvy"C) "I don't have much to offer".While this may seem like a lot of effort, I want you to look into the future.You don't want to be saying:"I should have taken more time to work on my career."#JTTalksJobs #PersonalBranding #ProfessionalDevelopment #Careers

Name: JT O'Donnell
Text: The good news is that no matter what your workplace situation is, I believe there are some universal steps employees can take to strengthen their relationships with their bosses, and these steps aren’t overly difficult, they just take a little initiative.#JTTalksJobs #Worklife #Careers #officelife

Name: JT O'Donnell
Text: If you want to land a job in 2020, you need a resume that WOWs employers.Not just any resume. You need an effective one that will bypass the ATS system and capture the hiring manager's attention.Easier said than done, right? The job search process has changed drastically, and chances are your resume has some outdated techniques.That can’t be that bad, right? WRONG.When you're using the same hard-to-read, outdated resume format that the rest of the competition is using, you'll continue to be overlooked for opportunities.You might be tempted to go to a resume writer, but I urge you NOT to do this!Many (if not most) will charge you $100s or $1,000s for 1 resume.The worst part? Most of the time they don't work!I don’t believe that a resume should cost you a fortune!That’s why I want to help you create an effective resume for ONLY $5.Introducing Work It Daily's new Resume Accelerator Package! Here’s a sneak peek at what you’d get for $5:- Exclusive Work It Daily Resume Video Tutorial- Exclusive Work It Daily Resume Guidebook- Exclusive Work It Daily Skills Table PDF- Exclusive Work It Daily Resume TemplateYou deserve the job of your dreams; let me help!https://lnkd.in/eTJAzPi #JTTalksJobs #resume #jobsearch #Jobseekers

Name: JT O'Donnell
Text: Tips To Prepare For Job Interviews Right Now...1)  Interview prep starts BEFORE you apply. The moment you start applying, you should be ready for the unexpected call from a recruiter saying, “can we talk right now?” Saying no will cost you the interview because they have 100 more applicants.2) Each type of interview is different.  It’s important to know your audience! Recruiters screen you for basic fit. Hiring managers screen you to see if you’ll make their life easier or harder. HR wants to make sure you are a cultural fit. CEOs want to make sure you are worth the money. Knowing how to address each person in the interview process you meet with is part of making sure you get chosen as the right person.3) Thank you doesn’t mean “sell yourself.”Sending a thank-you note after every interview is a must-do.You should also try to send one to each person in the hiring process. This is NOT the time to try to sell them or recap your strengths. 4) Behavioral questions are meant to get inside your head. Employers use behavioral questions to assess your personality and depth of knowledge. I recommend that you use the Experience + Learn = Grow model when crafting your responses. #JTTalksJobs #Jobsearch #Jobseekers #JobInterviews

Name: JT O'Donnell
Text: 5 Things You Need To Do If You’re Changing Career Post COVID1) Inventory your skills.Honestly look at yourself and identify your transferrable skills & skill gaps.It's important to know what you'll be marketing yourself with & what needs improving.2) Create a bucket list of companies that you want to work forIdentify 10-20 companies that you want to work for, and would hire you for your skill sets. This is important because it gives you a chance to really focus on your job search.3) Make new connections Identify people that work at the companies on your bucket list and begin to make connections with them4) Update your resumeThe top of your resume should include 6-8 of the transferable skill sets or skill sets that you have that the job posting is asking for. 5) Be ready to tell your storyYou’re not just changing careers because you need a new job or more $. There’s likely a deeper, more personal reason why you’re making the career change.You must convey that story in cover letters & during interviews.#JTTalksJobs #Careers #CareerChange #Covid19

Name: JT O'Donnell
Text: How To Successfully Work From Home When You Have KidsWorking from home is an adjustment on its own, but it can be a CHALLENGE to manage when you have children (esp. young ones!)As a fellow parent (who has been through this) I want to share my top tips with you! We are in this together!💪1. Talk with your kids about the importance of your work. Educate them calmly and positively about it's impact on your lives. i.e. your work pays bills that let them have food, shelter, water, internet, car, etc.2. Create a designated area that lets them know when you are there, you are work.3. If they are old enough, set some ground rules in terms of what is considered "urgent" for them to interrupt you.4. Give them an incentive to help you get through your workday at home. i.e. points for not interrupting you and keeping quiet around your desk.5. Do something special with them after work to signify your appreciation for their assistance.6. Understand that all days won't go smoothly and remember this will eventually pass.7. Consider getting up early or work after their bedtime as a way to get some basic tasks down without interruption.8. If possible, think of ways to include them in some of your work so they feel like they are "helping.#JTTalksJobs #Life #WorkFromHome

Name: JT O'Donnell
Text: 4 Reasons You Didn't Move Forward In The Interview ProcessI work with lots of recruiters.While I can't speak for them all; I can for many. Here are 4 common reasons why you didn't move forward in the interview:1) You were a fit, but so were 5 other people. After talking to you, the recruiter had more phone screens.1 or more applicants were an even better fit than you. Since the recruiter's only supposed to submit the top 3 candidates for consideration, you didn't make the cut.2) The hiring manager said "no", and the recruiter can't explain why. The recruiter submitted your credentials to the hiring manager.The hiring manager said "no" without any real explanation as to why. The recruiter's frustrated but can't show it, the hiring manager's a customer. So, she goes back to the drawing board and looks for someone else.3) The job description changed, and you're no longer a fit. The recruiter submitted your credentials.Hiring manager realizes they need a different set of skills & strengths than previously thought. 4) The job's on hold, indefinitely. The hiring manager announced they're not ready to hire.They want the recruiter to keep screening more candidates for when they're ready.#JTTalksJobs #HiringAndPromotion #LookingForJob #JobInterviews

Name: JT O'Donnell
Text: 9 Signs You're the Team's Weakest LinkAre you at risk of being let go? Here's how to tell.1. Your boss acts more serious around you than other teammates.2. Teammates don't ask for your advice or help.3. Impromptu meetings are happening when you aren't around.4. You haven't been new assignments.5. Your manager is increasingly micromanaging you.6. Co-workers who started after you are getting promoted over you.7. New employees are getting projects that would normally go to you.8. Your boss asks you for a list of your responsibilities & the step-by-step process you use to do each one.9. Procedures are put in place to have your work checked.If This Is You: DON'T GIVE UP...OWN UP!If you now think you're the weakest link, please don't throw in the towel & assume your days are numbered.You can turn this around.1st: Own Up To The Situation.Meet w/ your boss & share your concerns about your value & desire to increase your contributions2nd: Focus On Better Serving Your Teammates.What can you do to make their lives easier?3rd: rank up the activity level -- both in energy and time on the job. You need to show some hustle around your desire to improve. #JtTalksJobs #Worklife #Strategy #CareerDevelopment

Text: Are you looking for a job right now?If so, you need to know how important your LinkedIn profile is.If it’s not correctly formatted and optimized; then you’re missing out on employment opportunities.Why is this?In order for recruiters & hiring managers to find your profile, it must be optimized correctly; if not then you might as well toss it!How can you tell if it is optimized correctly?Easy.Are recruiters finding and viewing your profile? Name: JT O'Donnell
Text: Does Your Resume Pass the "Skim Test"?Resumes are a necessary evil. It's the career document we love to hate. Nobody feels comfortable writing about themselves.It's tempting to hire a resume writer.But doing so can kill your chances of landing the job.Instead, you should take the time to write it yourself.Here is one of my top tips to see if your resume is interview ready.Your resume must past the 'Skin Test'.Grab a friend who doesn't know what you do for work, and a stopwatch. Give the person a copy of your resume.Then, give them only 6 seconds to look at it, take it away.Why 6 seconds? That's how long recruiters spend on your resume initially.They skim it for key information. If they like what they see, the go back and read it a bit more carefully. If not? You get tossed.Does your friend get a good sense of what your key skills are?If not, you know your resume needs work.The key to a more readable resume is to have more whitespace.Don't cram everything in and use tiny fonts & small margins. Create whitespace around simplified, keyword-specific text. A 2-page resume w/ whitespace  is better than a 1-page one that's impossible-to-read #JtTalksJobs #Resume #Jobsearch #HiringAndPromotion

Name: JT O'Donnell
Text: People repeatedly fail at improving their careers because...Job seekers looking to move the need on their careers say they've tried "everything." But, that's not true.They're failing to use the right combination of tools and techniques.The right combination is what drives their transformation.Career transformation doesn't happen accidentally.To break it down more succinctly, if you want your career to improve, you need to:A) Close your gap in knowledge. Learn things that help you view your situation differently and enable you to identify your goal and build a clear gameplan to reach it.B) Get help through the roadblocks. Work with an expert who can help you navigate past challenges and reinforce good behaviors.C) Stay motivated and inspired to work at it daily. Connect with like-minded professionals who encourage you to keep going and can relate to what you are going through.#JtTalksJobs #Strategy #Careers #Motivation

Name: JT O'Donnell
Text: How To Be A 'Purple Squirrel' In Your Post-Crisis Job Search. This term is commonly used in the staffing industry.It refers to people with a rare combination of skill sets.So rare, it takes a ridiculous amount of effort to identify and hire them. How To Become A Purple Squirrel: Step 1: Collect attractive job postings.Find 5 - 10 job opportunities you're interested in. You should be 70% + match.They should be in the same industry or skill set.Step 2: Create a word cloud.Copy and paste the text of all the job postings in an online word cloud creator.Look for which hard and soft skill sets are most common across them.This will help you to realize which key terms are the most popular & important. Step 3: Add relevant keywords in strategic places.Take the top 10 - 12 skill sets.Add them to your LinkedIn profile and résumé​ in strategic places.The terms you put in your LinkedIn headline matter greatly. When a recruiter uses a key skillset in their search parameters & you have it in your headline, the chances you'll show up in their search results increases.The more keywords you have in the headline that match their search, the higher in the results you'll appear.#JtTalksJobs #Jobseeker #LinkedIn #Careers

Name: JT O'Donnell
Text: How To Conduct A Successful Long-Distance Job Search During A Crisis.This is a question I've been getting asked a lot.Finding a job is hard, finding one out of state is harder, and finding one during a crisis feels impossible.While it can be stressful, you can land your dream job with some preparation!Here are 2 tips that you can use today to conduct a long-distance job search!Tip #1: Create An Interview Bucket ListPut the 5-10 companies you'd like to work for on it.Make sure there is something that you truly value about each of them.Tip #2: Connect With 3-5 People At Your Bucket List Companies.The goal of connecting isn't to ask for a job.You should start a conversation (and hopefully a relationship) with these individuals.Ask them for information on the company and how they came to work for it.#JTTalksJobs #Jobsearch #Network #InterviewPreparation

Name: JT O'Donnell
Text: I find people hate network as much as public speaking. I think it's because many think they are being insincere for having an agenda. But what it this real purpose of network? If you reframe how you look at it, you will find it can be a positive and rewarding experience. Here are my 3 tips to help you approach network.1. Expect nothing. Just focus on getting to know them better. Your only goal is to explore where you are similar so that you can find: - a common value- belief- past experience To create a connection.2. Do your homework. Research people in your industry. Look for the things you have in common. Have a meaningful conversation that makes you both feel energized and productive.3. Use the I.E.O. method for developing the relationship. Your initial conversations are meant to IDENTIFY where you see eye-to-eye. This will move your discussions into opportunities to EXPLORE how your skills, knowledge and experience compliment one another. Ultimately, helping you both naturally start to talk about potential OPPORTUNITIES to collaborate together. You may chat 3X and get through this process, or it might take 12X. The key is to make sure you don't rush the process. #JTTalksJobs #Network #Careers #MarketingStrategy

Text: Why "THEY" Got it WRONG...If I had a dollar for every time I heard an unhappy professional say they did what, "they" told them to do, I'd be a rich gal.In this video, I'm giving it to you straight. We all got it wrong. But, that doesn't mean you can't fix it.It starts with realizing these hard truths.PS - If this makes sense to you, come join my community of like-minded career professionals who want to GROW in a pandemic. 3-day free trial with this link so you can see why we are the #1 career coaching platform online: https://lnkd.in/eWJTKv9

Name: JT O'Donnell
Text: Were you laid off & are currently looking for a new job?Then you need to know the WORST thing you could possibly be doing right now.What is it?Feeling sorry for yourself.I know this sounds harsh, but hear me out.It's totally acceptable AND normal to go through the 5 stages of career grief if you were laid off:1) Denial2) Anger3) Bargaining4) Depression5) AcceptanceHowever, the important thing to remember is that now is NOT the time to throw yourself a pity party.Instead of using your time to be upset over things out of your control, focus on things you can control.Use this time to help prepare yourself and your career for the next big career move!Here are some things you can do today:1. Update your resume and LinkedIn profile2.Make a company bucket list3. Check-in with and add value to your professional network. (This is a big one; 85% of all jobs are gotten via referral!).What are you going to do today to improve your career outlook?Tell me in the comments below!#JTTalksJobs #Careers #JobSearch #JobSeekers

Name: JT O'Donnell

Name: JT O'Donnell
Text: 5 Questions You MUST Ask Your Employer If You Get Laid Off!It’s likely you know multiple people who have lost their jobs.And, the reality is, the next person could be you.Here are 5 questions you need to be prepared to ask in the event this happens to you:1) What is my last official day of employment?2) Will I be receiving any severance? 3) When will I receive my last paycheck and how will I get it? They need to give this to you immediately or within your next pay cycle.4) Will I get paid for any outstanding vacation or personal time?5) How long will my medical benefits last and when will I be eligible for COBRA?#JTTalksJobs #Careers #FutureOfWork #LinkedInLearning

Name: JT O'Donnell
Text: I'm going to share with you a simple framework to help you determine if it's time to make a change in your career.I'm going to break this down into 3 easy steps: Step 1: Understanding "Experience + Learn = Grow"The reality today is that if you aren't constantly growing in your job, you're dying. What I mean by this is that the experiences you have should build up your skill sets, and it's really important that every few months you take a step back and assess if this is actually happening.Step 2: Analyze Your Experiences & SkillsThe skills themselves you develop along the way matter, because the reality today is that you have to continuously stay relevant to your work (as shown in the example above). As you're building up your skill sets, you are becoming more and more valuable to an employer.Step 3: Make The Decision (And Stick With It!)The last step in the process is to make the decision of whether or not to leave, and then stick with it.Once you've done the first two steps, you'll know whether or not you've hit a roadblock. If you have, you really only have two options here:A) Sit down with your boss and have an honest conversation to see what you can do to get back on track.B) Make the decision to leave.#JTTalkJobs #Careers #LinkedIn #Jobs

Name: JT O'Donnell
Text: 3 Things You Can RIGHT NOW To Make Your LinkedIn Resume Stronger:1. Use key skill sets in the headline.Get rid of the long, run-on sentences in your headline. Even if they are the most creative & witty thing, they could hurt your chances of getting a job.Instead; keyword optimized the headline with the 5-6 most popular skill sets used in your profession.2. Keep the summary short.Summary, by definition, means short. Think white space and keyword optimization when crafting a short, impactful summary.(PS - NEVER write in 3rd person, you'll seem narcissistic & desperate)3. Quantify accomplishments in work history.Again, avoid long, detailed sentences. This will cause the hiring manager or recruiter to lose interest immediately.What should you do instead?Create  3-5 single-line bullet points with spacing between each one that quantifies your results. How many people did you manage? How many clients did you serve? What % of revenue growth did you deliver? How big was your budget or territory? When you list these types of measurements, a recruiter knows you know what you are talking about!#JtTalksJobs #Resume #JobSeeker #LinkedIn #LinkedInLearning

Text: I am pleased to collaborate with Goleman EI and EADV for a webinar series on “Emotional Intelligence (EI) & Healthcare”.Join me along with Michele Nevarez, MSPOD (CEO of Goleman EI) and Belinda Chiu, Ed.D. (Goleman EI Faculty and VP of Content/Education) on Thursday April 30th, when we talk about how to operationalize Emotional Intelligence and its relevance to the unsung heroes and warriors work in healthcare. We will introduce strategies to help you manage optimally as a healthcare practitioner. #emotionalintelligence #resilience #emotionalagility #ei #positiveoutlook #empathy

Name: Daniel Goleman
Text: Goleman EI is honored to collaborate with EADV for a webinar series on “Emotional Intelligence (EI) and Healthcare.”Join us next Thursday for this extraordinary webinar, listen to Daniel Goleman, our CEO Michele Nevarez, MSPOD, and Belinda Chiu, Ed.D. talk about the fundamentals of EI, and learn some tips and strategies that will help you manage optimally as a healthcare practitioner and individual in your daily life.

Name: Daniel Goleman
Text: It takes generations for a population to recover from the emotional and neurological impacts that occur in the aftermath of war, trauma and poverty. Fernando Restoy, one of the participants in the Goleman Emotional Intelligence Coaching Certification (EICC) program, shares a powerful example of how he is leveraging EI in his work with Cambodian children who have grown up in a nation healing from genocide.#neuroscience #resiliency #emotionalintelligence

Name: Daniel Goleman
Text: And that’s a wrap on our January 2020 EICC cohort’s first residency in Orlando, FL! This cohort is made up of folks with passion, drive, and heart—characteristics that cultivated instantaneous bonds of friendship within our learning groups, allowing them to go deep with the material and with one another. We want to offer a special thank you to our brilliant faculty who facilitated and guided 18 Meta-Coaches and 33 EICC participants through immersive classroom training, which is the first phase of the rigorous 9-month Goleman Emotional Intelligence Coaching Certification (EICC) program. We look forward to seeing you all again in person in March for the second residency! #EICCJan20 #EmotionalIntelligence #Coaching

Name: Daniel Goleman
Text: I invite you all to watch my friend Richard J. Davidson's latest TEDx San Francisco talk on the ways in which mindfulness can improve well-being by developing the components of a healthy mind: awareness, connection, insight, and purpose.

Name: Daniel Goleman
Text: Start the New Year with a Mindful Habit Change.One of the most marvelous things about the mind, the Dalai Lama once said, is that it can be transformed. In that spirit I’m inviting you to repattern old habits of thinking, feeling, acting, and interacting to join me and my wife Tara Bennett-Goleman in a weekend, January 10-12,  at Kripalu Institute ion Lenox, Massachusetts,. Drawing from our books, Emotional Alchemy,  Mind Whispering, Focus, and Emotional Intelligence, we will integrate the sciences of attention and habit change with Eastern and Western psychologies.In this groundbreaking program, you will explore how to•	Apply nurturing mindfulness to emotional habits •	Cultivate an attuned, discerning, and mindful “overseer” to make clearer choices•	Ground yourself in a wise heart instead of being driven by reactivity•	Build a genuine and secure foundation for all your connections.Experience a new lens for understanding the patterns that play out in your life and relationships.These methods are useful to life and executive coaches, to HR professionals, and to anyone who would like the start the new decade with a fresh, more open repertoire for living. For more information:

Name: Daniel Goleman
Text: Happy New Year!“I hope that in this year to come, you make mistakes. Because if you are making mistakes, then you are making new things, trying new things, learning, living, pushing yourself, changing yourself, changing your world. You're doing things you've never done before, and more importantly, you're Doing Something.” — Neil Gaiman

Name: Michael Dell
Text: Awesome to chat to Michael Dell at our recent UBS leadership event and share views on topics such as tech trends, leadership and social responsibility.  It’s clear that the pandemic has brought challenges that have in turn driven innovation across the tech industry and digitalization across the board. Michael shared his future views also around AI/machine learning, the explosion of data and the rise of machine to machine interaction. Another topic we touched on was cloud. Currently at UBS we are pushing forwards on our cloud journey, so it was interesting to hear from Michael how he sees trends in the space developing. For example having a focus on multi-cloud strategy, allowing for movement of workloads and data between diverse sets of infrastructures.  Thanks again Michael Dell for joining the session. Connect soon! #delltechnologies #shareubs #innovation #fintech

Name: Michael Dell
Text: My virtual trip series continued last week into Germany where I met with a broad cross section of our business there, including customers, partners, our leadership teams, and our employee resource group leads. The sessions were extremely interactive with great levels of energy and engagement across the board. Partners and customers alike were consistent in their feedback: they are seeing increased levels of productivity with a genuine preference for remote work. The next big challenge and focus area will be how we work together to enable this new ‘hybrid workforce’ , half virtual, half ‘in the room’ . One thing is for certain – our ERGs have fast become the glue that are keeping our teams gelled together which is a key learning I’ve been able to share with our customers and partners. I’m very proud of what we have been able to achieve in Germany over the past 6 months and I want to say a huge thank you to Stephane Pate and all of the teams across Germany for everything they have done for our teams, our customers, and our partners.

Name: Michael Dell
Text: l’ve been running a series of virtual trips across the International Region, hearing some amazing stories from our teams, our customers and our partners. Last week, I had the opportunity to spend 3 days with the teams in India – it was a packed agenda and great to hear how they’re getting on. India is one of our most important global markets at Dell Technologies and one of our biggest team hubs: we have around 24k team-members across India work from 26 sites. We heard from a key biomedical customer, Anthem Biosciences Private Limited , who are rolling out some fascinating IoT programmes, putting several Industry 4.0 concepts into practical use. They are also work on transforming a number of their business critical elements including security, multi cloud, and the application stacks. Also spent a good session with our ERG leads and was blown away to hear that 74% of our team members in India participate in community service as part of the outreach work. One example is Naim Tabriz Khan, who has provided food, shelter, medical care, jobs, etc. to thousands of people in his community. Thanks to Alok Ohrie and all of Team India - Looking forward to the next in the series of virtual trips, keeping me connected to our teams, and in fact, in some ways, we are closer than ever!

Name: Michael Dell
Text: Late last night, Dell Technologies published its second quarter fiscal year 2021 earnings results. Second quarter performance was strong, as our company continues to effectively navigate the current business environment, providing the essential work- and learn-from-home, cloud and storage solutions customers need. This was only possible through real team work while most of our team members are work from home. I am proud that we were able to help our customers to speed up their digital transformation and to become more flexible and resilient in a faster than ever changing environment.

Name: Michael Dell
Text: Celebrating 17 years today in this #bestevercompany with the #besteverteam in the #besteverregion! While obviously i joined Dell Technologies when i was still very young, it has been a blast! Hoping for 17 more!#DellTechCEE

Name: Michael Dell
Text: Dell Technologies strives to drive human progress through technology. Partnering with NITI Aayog & Atal Innovation Mission, we have launched #SheCodes – a flagship program championing girl-led innovation & entrepreneurship to make them #FutureWorkforceReady. #ProgressMadeReal #Iwork4dell Amit Midha Aongus Hegarty Ramanan Ramanathan Archana Sahay

Name: Michael Dell
Text: I am thrilled to announce that I will be taking the lead of the Latin American Sales.I feel grateful and humbled to be given the opportunity to lead such a vibrant and growing region. Our power and strength come from our diversity and optimism. We are resilient, we are persistent, and we are passionate. That is a powerful combination. Together we will continue to build on our key priorities: our people, our customers and our business. To do so, I am privileged to be met with a team of such talented professionals, who always go the extra mile, especially in these extraordinary times.I am thrilled to carry our potential all the way through. I'm confident that together we will build a bright future for Dell Technologies in Latin America. Once again, thank you!

Name: Michael Dell
Text: ‘Turning 25’ at Dell Technologies: Then & Now - #DellLove I feel very proud to complete 25 years with Dell this week, a place I call my second home. I remember feeling, both, excited and nervous about starting this new job when I first stepped into the Dell Round Rock office in Austin. Michael Dell was already an inspirational figure, challenging the industry bigwigs, launching a whole new direct way of doing business, and exceeding market expectations. A decade old company with the spirit and energy of a startup, had so much to offer. From 1995 to now - Full-year earnings of $3.5 billion (to $90+ billion today), 6400+ strong team then (165,000+ global workforce now) and global expansion to Europe, Asia (now in 180 countries serving 98% of Fortune 500 companies). What an incredible journey it has been for #DellTech and I am truly fortunate to be part of that journey these past 25 years! I am so grateful for all the opportunities and to everyone instrumental in shaping me – my mentors, business leaders, peers, colleagues and team members for being part of this journey. Last but not the least, I would be remiss if I didn’t acknowledge the invaluable support of my family through this amazing journey. They are my true north star! #DellTech #Iwork4Dell #25yearsatDell

Name: Michael Dell
Text: A very long chapter of my life and career has closed as I finished my last day at Dell Technologies. It has been an amazing 21 year run with a lot of memorable events in my career and my family. I've been fortunate to work with and for so many great leaders that it is hard to capture them all. I wanted to thank Lory Pilchik  and Erin Mulligan Nelson  for my time in Consumer (remember the Dell Dude Steven? Here is a pic with Michael and Steven from 20 years ago!), Steve Felice and Tom Sweet from the LCA days, Bob Barr from the Online Days, Tim Mattox, Scott Wells, Chuck Stewart and Tim Stadthaus  during my time in Enterprise Marketing and finally Greg Davis, Jim DeFoe, Gregg Ambulos and Joyce Mullen for the past 12 years in Channel Programs, Operations and Sales.  All of these great leaders taught me so much about being a successful executive in so many different functions.  And finally, I wanted to thank my current channel sales team and my NSP partners for the last 8 years. No doubt about it, the best 8 years of my career. I am looking forward to a long drive through Colorado and Montana seeing friends and family before looking for the next chapter in my career!  I will be cheering on Dell Technologies from afar and looking forward to seeing the continued success.

Name: Michael Dell
Text: Couldn’t be more proud of the #DellTechnologies results published last night. On top of the great financials it is worth calling out that we launched 9 new products and solutions during Q2 – all while work remotely! It was extremely important for our team to prove this can be done, as we expect that 60% of our own workforce will stay remote or adopt a hybrid model going forward – only coming to the office once or twice a week. Without discussion current circumstances are far from easy, but at the same time we clearly hear from our customers that technology has never been more important and that their digital priorities remain clear – enabling long-term work- and learn-from-home solutions, while ensuring automation and agility of IT for more resilient operations in both the short and long term. It’s going to be a marathon and we’re ready to be there to support and inspire them on their #digitaltransformation journey the whole time!https://lnkd.in/eEYppy4

Name: Michael Dell
Text: These are exciting times @Presidio - the good news just keeps rolling in.  Welcome, Linda!

Name: Michael Dell
Text: These are exciting times @Presidio - the good news just keeps rolling in.  Welcome, Linda!

Name: Michael Dell
Text: Excited to launch these lifestyle monitors for your modern work/life. S2721Q/QS, S2721D/DS and S3221QS#delldesign

Name: Michael Dell
Text: Dell Technologies Q2FY21 results.N.1 in everything, all in One place.https://lnkd.in/eyC3R-R#digitalworkplace #digitaltransformation

Name: Michael Dell
Text: My thanks to all VMware employees, customers, partners on a solid Q2, thru the tough pandemic. Product Innovation and Customer Obsession remain our focus. Glad to see momentum in Subscription & SaaS revenue - esp. Multi-Cloud, Digital Workspace, Security and App Modernization.

Name: Michael Dell
Text: It has been a pleasure to have Michael Dell in LATAM today, who joined us in a virtual tour with our customers and the team along with Diego Majdalani and Luis Fernando G., our new Dell Technologies President for LATAM. “This is going to be a marathon and it’s going to be uneven and frustrating at times. So, we are all going to have to be incredibly flexible, agile, and patient" said Michael Dell Thus, we must take a longer-term view of the new normal. We also had the chance to talk with Jorge Ospina, Bancolombia's CIO, about the opportunity we have ahead to help Colombia and the region through our best tech solutions. Thank you all for this!#JourneytoCloud #WFH #NewNormal #LATAM

Name: Michael Dell
Text: Surround yourself with people who are willing to disagree with you. If there’s a lot of comfort in the room - start to worry - #frictiongood

Name: Michael Dell
Text: Wanted to send a heartfelt thank you to my friends over at Faction for thinking of me...they heard that I snapped my ankle skateboarding and the next thing I know I've got a personal video from Tony Hawk Media and a bundle of swag from his awesome, skatepark-building charity! Almost makes me want to break some more bones ;-)In all seriousness, if you are on a cloud journey and haven't looked at Faction's Multi-Cloud Wizardry, you're missing out. These are the folks delivering the ground-breaking technology that powers Dell Technologies Storage Cloud.Thanks friends: Luke Norris, Sean Charnock, Pete Bell, John Drake, Matthew Wallace and the rest of the team!!!

Name: Michael Dell
Text: One year ago, when we signed the Business Roundtable’s new purpose statement, we had no idea just how much the economy was about to be tested by a global pandemic. As the fault lines of our society have been laid bare, it has become even more clear now that we all rely on multiple stakeholders for collective progress. At Dell Technologies, we are committed to drive change for all of our stakeholders to transform lives, cultivate inclusion and advance sustainability. A multistakeholder approach is not just what is right, it’s what we need to come out of crisis better, stronger and fairer by creating an economy that works for everyone.

Name: Michael Dell
Text: Last night, we had our first virtual Sales Engineering (SE) class with the highest attendance on record. Students from Morehouse College, Spelman College, Clark Atlanta University and Georgia State University were invited to the opening session. Angela Harper spoke about the curriculum, employment opportunities and the importance of diversity to Dell Technologies and the Presales organization. Brittanie Rice and Royce Payne provided an overview of their experiences as interns and as previous SE students. I had the pleasure of talking about our Diversity & Inclusion initiatives. Thank you Brian Reaves Angela Harper Danny Best, MBA, SPHR , Brittanie Rice Royce Payne Deva Nelson Kinnis Gosha Curtis Byrd  Irving R. Corrales  Shuguang Hong Tedra Cheatham, CEcD Denise Holmes Richard Phillips Balasubramaniam Ramesh Monica Cooper  for your support! #ILoveMyJob #Iwork4Dell #inspiration #HBCU #diversityandinclusion

Name: Michael Dell
Text: Dell EMC PowerFlex is redefining the software defined landscape, starting from a few nodes to hundreds or even, thousands of nodes!One area where it really shines is containers, if you are planning to implement (and who doesn't) Docker, Inc or Kubernetes with Redhat OpenShift or VMware TKG, you ought to look at it!

Name: Michael Dell
Text: In the three years since Hurricane Harvey, all those supporting the Rebuild Texas Fund have helped more than two million people restore their home and community. Susan and I are incredibly grateful. 🙏

Name: Michael Dell
Text: We are all thrilled to warmly welcome Rola Dagher back to lead Dell Technologies Partners on to even greater success! 🤗🚀 #delltechpartners

Name: Michael Dell
Text: Here's one more reason you MUST register for #VMworld2020, I am honored to chat with Indra Nooyi, former chairman & CEO of PepsiCo, and Fortune #MostPowerfulWomen.  Register here, its FREE and virtual: https://lnkd.in/gC5jvBK

Name: Michael Dell
Text: Today a year ago, I took this pic before crossing those doors to start my new adventure at #DellTechnologies.We all know about the uncertainty when we make the move to a different job and company, especially coming from the IBM family in my case. The night before the start date is all about dreaming and wondering.First week was exhausting. Lot of onboard information to absorb and new processes to follow, etc but most important, meet the Team and start interacting with them.Thankfully I had the best onboarding buddy possible, who made all these things a breeze along with the warmest welcome ever, still today can't be thankful enough to Claire Regan for all this not to mention how joyful and rewarding has been work with her and the rest of the Team. It was my new family, I was over the moon!Today a year later and still through this pandemic, I'm still over the moon, work on a very exciting product, fully remote, enjoying every single day and singing in the shower along with the birds every morning. And my Dell family has been expanding steadily and keeps going!So here, to all of you that have made of this my dreamed job and a happy life: THANK YOU.- Special thanks to Steven Roy for all you do to make this possible day after day, you are something else.#iwork4dell

Name: Michael Dell
Text: Despite the huge impact of Beirut sad explosion our Dell Technologies Vmax in the picture is still up and running!Great support from Dell services to make sure our customer's services are restored efficiently 👍🏆🥇

Name: Michael Dell
Text: Government organizations are boosting digital infrastructure. We’re outlining a path to reimagine the future of government in a new digital transformation white paper: https://bit.ly/31smVde #iwork4dell

Name: Michael Dell
Text: Thank you, Suzette Kent, for your leadership -- particularly through these past months.

Text: It is important to attract and retain talent with the right set of technology tools. Dell Tech’s David Lancaster and Randy Kendzior will discuss workforce transformation tomorrow at 9 a.m. ET: https://bit.ly/2XB5oyq #iwork4dell

Name: Marshall Goldsmith
Text: We’re LIVE with Sally Helgesen and Sharon Melnick to explore powerful practices that enable women to build satisfying and rewarding careers. Discover how women can be empowered to articulate their talents and help organizations to thrive. Dive into data revealing the under-representation of women in the workplace (Sharon). Examine how habitual bias can sway women’s decisions whether to leave a role, stick it out, or develop their skill sets so they can elevate themselves to take on new opportunities.

Name: Steve Tappin
Text: 🔴 It is important for us to remember that not all 7.3 billion people in the world are digitally empowered.People without digital skills & means are more likely to experience health inequalities. Those unable to connect and use digital technology face increased health risks: they cannot order medicines online, find health information online, book doctor or hospital appointments online, or get health advice using video calling. They are also more likely to experience loneliness and social isolation, both of which can have damaging effects on mental health.Digital inclusion is more important than ever and something we do not talk about enough.🟢 That’s why eRB, our eCommerce, CRM and digital division, is partnering with Good Things Foundation to help fund 15 ‘Digital Health Hubs’ which bring essential digital skills and health literacy to over 1,500 people, so they can access vital online health services and trusted information. Improving social inclusion through digital is close to our heart, and we want to play our part in the journey.Read more about it here: https://lnkd.in/dHMzGAi#WeAreRB #RBproud #digitalinclusion #socialinclusion #BAME #pandemic #COVID

Name: Steve Tappin
Text: Our half year results for 2020 are available today: reporting like-for-like growth in Group net revenue of +11.9%. eCommerce grew over +60%, now c. 12% of group net revenue - hitting a record GMV of over $1.5bn in the first six months of 2020. We will continue to put the needs of our consumers first, making sure that our products are available as widely as possible. Learn about our financial results in detail here: https://lnkd.in/dgJjm4Z #WeAreRB #RBproud #WeCommerce #ecommerce

Name: Steve Tappin
Text: Today officially marks the end of my 6-month Intern at Cancer Research UK. I would like to express my thanks for all the support that I received during my time. I feel proud to have been involved in their new Entrepreneurial Programmes Initiative (encouraging early career oncology researchers to pursue translational avenues for patient benefit).During this time, I had the opportunity to independently drive an evaluation project that successfully produced outputs and recommendations, to take the initiative successfully into the future. It's been a pleasure work at Cancer Research UK, and with inspiring people, in particular Benedict Conway, Alessia Errico PhD MBA and Stephen Shaw. In addition, to all the other lovely interns that I was fortunate enough to spend the short amount of time with. I am also currently completing an intensive short course at LSE in Managerial Finance, in order to strengthen my existing knowledge and experience, I want to learn more about the valuation principles and financial health of organisations.I am excited about the next chapter in my career and exploring new opportunities.

Name: Steve Tappin
Text: I am thrilled to have graduated from the University of Leeds in Psychology(2.1) I thoroughly enjoyed learning a broad range of modules this year including; Occupational Health Psychology, BioPsychosocial Issues in Ageing and Techniques in Human NeuroPsychology (72). The highlight of my education at Leeds was definitely having the opportunity to collaborate and have my Final Major Research Project supervised by esteemed Professor Daryl O'Connor. The opportunity to research thematic topics including Stress and Suicide Intervention, coined ' a global imperative' by the World Health Organization (WHO) was extremely rewarding and hugely enhanced my psychological perspectives. I am extremely grateful to have met so many amazing people during my time at University and wish everyone the best of luck in their future endeavours. I look forward to embracing and effectively utilising my psychology skills to pursue my passion of obtaining a creative role in global media.

Name: Steve Tappin
Text: Thrilled to join Steve Tappin and the Xinfu team as Chief Communications Officer and lead for Americas! Steve: “Trevor brings a combination of creativity and experience that will help Xinfu expand globally and especially in the US market. I’ve known Trevor for many years and look forward to him bringing the same profound insights, entrepreneurial spirit and passion for epic campaigns to Xinfu as he has done for Fortune 100 companies around the world.”

Name: Steve Tappin
Text: We launched the #HandWashChallenge 5 days ago to teach people how to wash hands correctly - in a light hearted way.https://lnkd.in/g6bid8vIn just 5 days, this has become one of the most viewed campaigns in the world.It has reached over 10.6 Billion views on TikTok with over 120,000 videos created.We are now taking this campaign even broader, worldwide, at even greater scale, aiming to reach every person we can, globally.We invite you to join the movement by sharing and participating with your own video. Stay safe and stay calm. Handwash. #staycalmandhandwash #wearerb #dettol #lysol #rbproud #tiktok RB

Name: Steve Tappin
Text: In the weeks leading up to the failure of FlyBe, it was disheartening to see some people wishing to hasten our demise. Many airlines are now facing a very real threat to their own business. Having lived through the experience of an airline collapse and seeing the devastating impact it has had on so many colleagues, I wish them all the very best of luck and hope they can avoid the same outcome for their people.The aviation industry is notoriously difficult and prone to shocks and challenges. Recent events have highlighted that, whilst always maintaining healthy competition, there is often a need to pull together. Whilst many have challenged the suggestion that government should support airlines, one area where there is much agreement is that government should change APD. I hope that government will make some urgent change and provide welcome relief to airlines without needing to breach the rules for state aid.

Name: Steve Tappin
Text: Stay calm and hand wash!To slow down the spread of the Coronavirus, official guidance is to #StayCalmAndHandWash. But it is critical to hand wash correctly. #Dettol and #Lysol have partnered with TikTok to teach people how to hand wash correctly with the #HandWashChallenge (link: https://lnkd.in/gZr_3TB). And also to do this in a light hearted way to bring some calm in these challenging times. Please spread the word! Share this post and share on TikTok!Stay safe and stay calm. Handwash.#RB #RBproud #tiktok #StayCalmAndHandWashRB

Name: Steve Tappin
Text: The past 48 hours have been probably the most challenging of my 32 year airline career. It is with great sadness that we have had to manage the cessation of operations at Flybe last night. It is a great disappointment not to be able to continue the work to build a great airline, but I look back on the last few months with pride at having been a small part of such an amazing team. My sincere thanks to all in the FlyBe family for your commitment and professionalism, which shone through to our very last arrival. Best wishes to you all for the future.

Name: Steve Tappin
Text: Phenomenal speakers, supporters, sponsors, venue, guests & friends. THANK YOU for helping us go out with a very special bang this year for our phenomenal end year Annual Event “Celebrating Diverse & Inclusive Leaders” at the The Ritz London. Awe inspiring speakers with jinlong wang, CEO of PizzaExpress, Kari Daniels, CEO OF Tesco Ireland, Mapula Kanyi Wanjau (Nee Mashishi, HRD GMC of Diageo & Fiona McDonnell, MD of Advertising Amazon. A very special thank you to our incredible masters of ceremonies Simon Tyler who did what he did best and held the evening together perfectly!Lots of celebrate this year including the launch of DIAL Global & continued growth of Leila McKenzie Associates Limited + my first book “Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging - A Leadership Guide About Why Everyone Matters & How To Make Them Feel Like They Do”. Hope you all had a wonderfully festive & inspiring evening. Love you all lots & cant wait to see you all next year🎄💖🎄💖🎄 www.dialglobal.org 🌎www.leilamckenzie.com 🥳 #inclusiveleadership #businessleaders #belonging #inspiration #annualevent2019

Text: Over the past 200 years, we have seen an abundance of healthcare technologies enable a massive lifespan boom.Now, exponential technologies like artificial intelligence, 3D printing and sensors, as well as tremendous advancements in genomics, stem cell research, chemistry and many other fields, are beginning to tackle the fundamental issues of why we age.What will you be able to achieve with an extra 30 to 50 healthy years (or longer) in your lifespan?Personally, I’m excited for a near-infinite lifespan to take on Moonshots.

If the things you’re used to depending on are no longer available, do a mental inventory of what is available now. A great creative response is to use every available resource you have today, tomorrow, and the next day to achieve as many small results as possible.

Name: Peter H. Diamandis
Text: Genome sequencing can uncover disease susceptibilities years before symptoms present, allowing for personalized preventative care to begin sooner than ever before. For example, the Cancer Genome Atlas Program at The National Institutes of Health (NIH) is currently using gene sequencing to decode the genetic underpinnings of 30 cancer types.Perhaps the most impactful potential of low-cost genome sequencing is its ability to be used in what is called a liquid biopsy -- the ability to find free-flowing cancer DNA in your bloodstream that might indicate the existence of an undetected cancer in your body.And, as we know, finding cancer at stage-zero or stage-one is the key to survival.

Name: Peter H. Diamandis
Text: My mission is to help #Abundance360 members identify their massively transformative purpose, select their moonshot, and hone an Abundance, Exponential, and Longevity Mindset.

Name: Peter H. Diamandis
Text: To date, we’ve seen maybe 10% of all the possible longevity-extending technologies that will impact us in the decade ahead… Get ready for a massive acceleration coming from AI and the arrival of quantum computers able to model molecular interactions within cells and on the cell surface.Given all of these exciting developments, the right mindset to have is one that’s optimistic and focused on maximizing your health and adding decades of healthy years onto your life.That’s the spirit of the Longevity Mindset. And here’s what it looks like in practice ➡️ https://bit.ly/2GQQpeq

Name: Peter H. Diamandis
Text: Every year, my team and I select a group of 360 entrepreneurs and CEOs to coach over the course of a year-long program. A360 starts each January with a live event and continues every two months with Implementation Workshops, in which I personally coach members in small groups over Zoom. (In 2021, you have a choice of live “in-person” or “virtual” participation).

Name: Peter H. Diamandis
Text: The mindset of “mortality is normal and expected” is pervasive in society.For many years, it has been taboo in medical and research circles to talk about extending the healthy human lifespan, or the idea that “aging is a disease.”Scientists proclaiming this doctrine were shunned, and feared that their grant funding might evaporate.This negative mindset also permeates life outside the lab. You can see its effects everywhere.So much of society is structured around people dying in their sixties, seventies, and eighties.As well as the belief that anyone making it to 100 meant a wheelchair and a diagnosis of Alzheimer’s.Government policies, insurance, medicine, religion -- they’re all organized around this mindset and its assumptions.Now more than ever, during a period of exponential medicine, you don’t have to accept the cards you’re dealt. Technologies like genome sequencing, RNA transcriptomics, Wnt pathway modifiers, vaccines, CRISPR, liquid biopsies, CAR-T cells, Gene Therapy, exosomes, and stem cells are just some of the technologies in development.

Name: Peter H. Diamandis

Name: Peter H. Diamandis
Text: Happy #WorldSpaceWeek to my fellow space cadets! If you’ve ever dreamed about going to space, this webinar is for you!Jane Poynter and Taber MacCallum are no strangers to pursuing Moonshots in human spaceflight.They currently serve as the co-founders and co-CEO’s of Space Perspective — a company that wants to take you to the edge of space with its Spaceship Neptune, a high-performance balloon and pressurized capsule.Prior to the Space Perspective, both Jane and Taber served as co-founders of Paragon Space Development Corporation.In 2014, Alan Eustace, former Senior VP of Engineering at Google, Paragon, and the Paragon StratEx team completed a record-breaking free-fall from an altitude of over 135,000 feet.(If you’re not familiar with this amazing story, then your homework tonight is to watch #14MinutesFromEarth. The epic space documentary is available on Netflix or YouTube.) Watch the full webinar: https://lnkd.in/gSsA2fr

Name: Peter H. Diamandis
Text: Entrepreneurs who understand the power of exponential growth, and can hop onto an exponential growth curve, can benefit significantly where others do not 📈Let's do an experiment...If you have a child or younger brother or sister, consider giving them the following choice:🔹Option 1: Offer them $1 a day for the next 30 days.🔸Option 2: Offer them a penny on the first day, two cents on the second day, four cents on the third day, and so on.Chances are, they take the first option.$30 isn’t bad for zero work.But if they took the second offer, what started out with a penny would result in $10 MILLION on the final day.Now we’re talking!!Remember these numbers and how vital it is to recognize exponential growth.The same forces that enabled the fall of Kodak and the rise of Facebook can also lead to your next billion-dollar opportunity.Want more conversations like this? Join me at Abundance 360 ➡️ https://bit.ly/3irkiP0

Name: Peter H. Diamandis
Text: There are six specific mindsets that I find most powerful and important to hone during this era of exponential growth. https://bit.ly/2HFaTXD

Name: Peter H. Diamandis
Text: Your mindset is the filter through which you see the world. It determines how you spend your time, what decisions you make, and where you invest your resources.There’s an old saying in business that you’re the average of the five people you spend the most time with.If you want to be fit, hang out with friends who exercise. If you want to think big and aspire to change the world, hang out with people who have Moonshots and a massively transformative purpose (MTP).Just as you are the average of the five people you spend the most time with, the same is true for ideas.The news and media we consume are data that we allow to flow into our brains (AKA our neural nets).What is your news diet? What kind of movies or documentaries are you watching?What books or blogs are you reading? (Thank you if you're subscribed to mine!)Do these inputs reinforce the mindsets you want? Or do they reinforce mindsets you’re trying to avoid?As an entrepreneur, answering these questions is a critical part of your journey to be successful during this era of exponential change.The next step on that journey is choosing the mindset(s) that works best for you.

Name: Peter H. Diamandis
Text: The two key inputs that shape our mindsets are: the people we spend time with and the media we consume.

Name: Herb Greenberg
Text: I joined Descript! Descript is the tool for storytellers, and since we're all natural storytellers, I finally get to work on something that everybody needs. We're building a platform of creative tools that make audio and video creation as fast, accessible, and collaborative as Google Docs.We have a bold vision, an amazing team of researchers, engineers, designers, and business leaders, backing from some of the world's greatest investors like Andreessen Horowitz and Redpoint Ventures, and a proven - and delightfully quirky - CEO. We're 25 people. It's like the early Digidesign days when you're just on the brink of something epic.Your teammates are pioneers and everybody has an impact on the future of media creation. So here's where my network comes in. I'm looking to you. I want to see how descript can help you. Reach out to me directly at jleboeuf@descript.com and let me know what you're thinking for a partnership, a collaboration, use of the tools for wonderful or weird purposes, or anything. Really. If you're an educator, a creative, a brand or content marketer, a fellow business development person, an entrepreneur or startup with amazing tech... please reach out.  I'd love to hear your ideas. Oh! We're hiring too!

Name: Herb Greenberg
Text: It’s time for a change. Over 5+ years, 40 universities, and through more than 10,000 students, I’ve led Real Industry as it’s founder and Executive Director. Starting in a few weeks, I’ll pass the baton and will transition to Real Industry’s board.    What’s next? I’m excited to rejoin the media & entertainment technology industry. Where? I really want your ideas and feedback. Send me your thoughts and suggestions below (...here we go…) or via emailHumera Fasihuddin, the Co-Director of the University Innovation Fellows at the Hasso Plattner Institute of Design at Stanford ( d.school ), is joining Real Industry as our Chief Designer. Humera will also be joining our  board to bring significant leadership and scaling to our programs!I’ll be continuing to serve Real Industry as an advisor, student mentor, and on the Board. Thank you everyone for your incredible support! I look forward to your comments!

Name: Dan Ariely
Text: A request for helpWe are a group of researchers (Harvard University, Boston University, University of Georgia, Duke University, and City University of London) who are trying to understand how consumers make decisions when organizing a funeral. We are looking to interview individuals who have organized a funeral for a loved one in the past two years and/or made plans for their own funeral, have a household income of $35,000 or higher annually, and were born and are currently living in the United States. If you would like to share your experience with us in a one hour interview, please contact us at f.bardhi@city.ac.uk. We will compensate you for your time with a $25 gift card. The interview will be conducted online to preserve social distancing.Many thanks

Name: Dan Ariely
Text: The Work From Home mandate is dramatically changing the way we work. We have developed a simple and scientific WFH Diagnostic Survey Tool to help business leaders quickly learn how their employees are doing on 5 key areas we have identified as crucial to success and well-being1/ Trust is essential– and trusting one’s employees predicts loyalty and the likelihood of feelings of anxiety 2/Creativity is a function of not only the person, but also the environment. It is also moderated by levels of anxiety felt by employees which is likely to be high at this time. However, the silver lining is that individualistic brainstorming can lead to better creative output now3/Collaboration is being challenged. There is a risk of the loudest voice dominating, shared ideas to be the focus of discussion instead of unique perspectives making their way through, and a lack of follow-through in the wake of a diffusion of responsibility4/Social connection boosts remote workers’ identification with their company and benefits their health and wellbeing.5/ Psychological Safety is one of the cornerstones of employee success. Muddied by job insecurity, it is imperative that it be closely monitored and cultivatedLet us know if you are interested in learning more!#leadership #workfromhome #employees

Name: Dan Ariely
Text: How Investors can Stay Rational in Irrational Times ???The Financial Impacts of COVID are Deeply Impacting Individuals, Businesses, and Government: The Science of Human Behaviour can Provide Guidance on how to Weather this Storm Financially People are facing an increasingly stressful period of time. Not only are they concerned about their own health, and that of their families, but they stand by watching their investments take a hit, striking them to action and potentially irrational investment behaviours driven by a host of psychological biases. @Kelly Peters (CEO & Co-founder of BEworks and my business partner), @David Lewis (BEworks Chief Client Officer) and I, outline the 4-key biases influencing investment decisions and how to overcome them.  Look out for an upcoming webinar and course for financial advisors. Follow @BEworks for more details.

Name: Dan Ariely
Text: Work-from-Home Business Insider Article & Webinar! As more and more organizations are rolling out work from home policies in response to COVID, Behavioral Economics can tell us a lot about how this will impact employees. It can also help us to make better decisions for ourselves and our colleagues. Read our latest article on the 5-ways managers can adapt to the new work-from-home force.https://lnkd.in/eDP3PsUIn addition, on Monday, April 6th at 11 am EST, @Kelly Peters, CEO and Co-Founder of @BEworks, and renowned Organizational and Applied Psychologist @Adrian Furnham are hosting a free webinar on the Science of Working from Home. They will provide concrete recommendations geared towards CEOs, HR, and team managers answering questions such as…• Are fears around losing productivity and creativity misguided?• Might we see unexpected advantages by having people work remotely?• What solutions might hold special promise in mitigating some of the negative impacts (e.g., by brainstorming online rather than in person)?  Visit https://hubs.ly/H0nPjQd0 to register and receive a recording to your inbox following the session.

Name: Dan Ariely
Text: On January 27th, @BEworks will be hosting its first Meetup in New York City.  If you're interested in BE and curious about how its been applied to leading financial institutions, come out to hear my co-founder @Kelly Peters speak about how we've transformed the way our clients approach their biggest challenges using BE.The session is designed to introduce New York’s financial services community to Behavioral Economics using proprietary cases from BEwork’s portfolio.  While many organizations have attempted to solve the problem of irrational investment decision-making, they have relied on traditional, but limited solutions such as providing consumers with more information and education. Educating investors by increasing their financial literacy has not proven to be an effective method for changing behavior.Instead, by identifying the predictable irrationalities of consumer behaviour, financial institutions can set themselves up to facilitate consumer outcomes and be adaptive and successful despite the changing landscape. To purchase tickets, visit https://bit.ly/2u8jb3l

Name: Dan Ariely
Text: Just over a year ago, we set out to fix a leaky pipeline that was severely broken.TL;DR: it’s still broken, but some of the very leaky parts are getting patched up. Among the 4 of us, Maya, Adi, Yael, and myself, we’ve spoken, met, hugged, and advised more than 150 badass women. They were strong, and brave, and we were just listening, and sharing from our experience. Turns out that listening and sharing goes a helluva long way, especially when way too many women are opting out.Here’s some of the women we spoke to in The Leaky Pipeline, Year 1:- Women in the delivery room (!) worried about maintaining their job and team;- Women entrepreneurs who felt oh so very lonely among the very male VC world and needed to hear that yeah, the situation is pretty dismal, but we’re here w/you;- Women who were embarrassed to ask for a salary raise but then realized everyone else had, and got it;So yeah, the leaky pipeline is still very leaky. But it can be patched up, here and there.By speaking with you all this past year, we too understood our challenges aren’t as rare as we thought, our fears are shared and can be dealt with, and that empowering one another has this magical domino effect.Want to talk? We’re here. Schedule time here:

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: Online voting could be done w/bank SSO. You'd sign into a secure, private voting site/app using your bank's credentials, where you're already verified. (Like Google or Facebook login on 3rd party sites.) This can also be an opportunity to open accounts & conduct benefit xfers to poor/unbanked. This kind of limited third party access to personal financial data is not unprecedented. Companies like Intuit (TurboTax) and Yodlee access your bank, broker and ADP (paycheck) accounts to pull in W-2s and other financial data.If done on mobile, additional sensors/camera can be used to aid in the verification/authentication process.This doesn't all have to happen at once. Multiple systems can coexist (including existing ones) to test which are most effective, secure and inclusive.The unbanked (~8M households) should be able to sign up with a bank the same way non-drivers can get IDs at the DMV. The poor without internet access should have access to expanded free/subsidized cell phone programs (Like these: https://t.co/vnzx5dcoV7) with the voting app installed.

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: Proposal: New Framework for #Regulation of #SocialMediaAs social networks make more editorial decisions, are they still "platforms" that should be protected from illegal acts by their users or are they publishers, as  some politicians (& publishers) want?My 2 main criteria for deciding:—banning people beyond legal requirements—post selectionProtections explained:- If banning people AND choosing posts (whether human or algorithmic selection), they are publishers & should have comparable legal exposure- Same even if they don't ban people beyond legal mandates- If they do neither, section 230 should protect them- Trickiest one is no post selection (other than user-controlled), but accounts can be banned. If there's clear banning criteria ("hate" likely too mushy & has no legal standing) AND clear path to redemption, plus some sort of follower portability, a version of 230 should apply.Notes:- there should be some exemption for ad insertions- emphasis should be on creating tools for users to control their own feeds, like a graphic equalizer that chooses what frequencies to over/under-emphasize- this is high-level & directional, meant as a starting pointMy #podcast exploring this solution in-depth. https://lnkd.in/gN-mQfx

Text: To say the least, life in quarantine has been weird, especially in New York. For the first time in my life, this bustling metropolis was silenced and hollowed out, like it's a zombie movie. My good friend and photographer Josh Katz captured a unique slice of New Yorkers persevering and making the best of these strange times - on their rooftops. Check out his terrific new coffee table book of photos on Kickstarter. All profits will be donated to Doctors without Borders.

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: Say it isn't so, Fidelity!The popular and respected Fidelity Investments seems to have a dark side. According to Reuters, the Johnson family that controls Fidelity has a separate, private fund that invests in IPOs before Fidelity does. Then those massive funds pile into the same stocks, at much higher prices, likely even lifting prices, yielding a fortune for the family, not Fidelity investors. Reuters found other sketchy activities like:- sharing compliance executives across both the private fund and Fidelity itself- star Fidelity managers get a piece of the separate fund, dividing their loyaltiesDisappointing.https://lnkd.in/gZVXjsq#investing #ethics #financialservices

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: From Carl Sagan, 1995:I have a foreboding of an America in my children's or grandchildren's time - when theUnited States is a service and information economy; when nearly all the key manufacturing industries have slipped away to other countries; when awesome technological powers are in the hands of a very few, and no one representing the public interest can even grasp the issues; when the people have lost the ability to set their own agendas or knowledgeably question those in authority; when, clutching our crystals and nervously consulting our horoscopes, our critical faculties in decline, unable to distinguish between what feels good and what's true, we slide, almost without noticing, back into superstition and darkness. The dumbing down of America is most evident in the slow decay of substantive content in the enormously influential media, the 30-second sound bites (now down to 10 seconds or less), lowest common denominator programming, credulous presentations on pseudoscience and superstition, but especially a kind of celebration of ignorance.#future #predictions
