Name: Steve Faktor
Text: Every Strategy Has a PriceFor years, Samsung has been using The Trojan Mule Strategy against Google on its own devices. It's a very powerful #strategy *IF* you commit to it. But Samsung was wishy-washy. In this endless war no one asked for was an opening for Google to end it with cash. And that seems like what's happening. #Google is paying Samsung (as it does Apple and others) for preferred placement on its devices. (https://lnkd.in/gCJWyE8 )It's too soon to know how this cash-for-peace will play out, but you can read my piece on what #Samsung did wrong - and others did right - using the Trojan Mule here: . (If you enjoy it, don't forget to sign up for my newsletter.)#mobile #tech

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: Every company wants a #monopoly. Only challengers don't (until they're the incumbents). There are benefits to monopolies: stability, interoperability & convenience. Apple and Google app stores offer those, making it hard for government to dictate what's fair without setting prices and policies for private businesses. Also not desirable.Since writing "Why Monopoly is the Future & We Love It" (https://lnkd.in/g_xE6dh), the natural next step is figuring out if/when/how monopolies, duopolies & oligopolies should be regulated. It's down to 3 main considerations:1) market dominance2) structural vs situational anti-competitiveness3) Short vs Long-term consumer benefitWith app stores, market dominance is clear but the other two are more murky. It's why regulators should lean towards having enough situational violations to warrant structural regulations.More on this topic soon (via newsletter at https://lnkd.in/gEpxvJP)

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: Release your betas!Too many companies waste months or years trying to perfect a new product or service. But they're missing out on an important opportunity to get timely, tangible feedback from real customers and to develop deeper relationships with hardcore devotees. While we're used to seeing software betas, other industries might go as far as building prototypes for trade shows, like CES, but never release them. As Coronavirus cripples trade events, it's more important than ever to get "par-baked" products into lead users' hands. There are ways to set up these programs so they are exclusive brand differentiators and loyalty-builders. Real loyalty, not points program trickery. A big part of success is setting expectations and strong messaging throughout the distribution chain.(If you're interested in learning more, reach out to ideas@ideafaktory.com)#innovation #NPD #productdevelopment

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: Great to see startups work on solving #food waste. It will allow us to sustain more people with fewer resources. With poverty declining, lots of empty habitable land, improving crop yields & shelf-life #technology, we can easily sustain a projected peak world population of 10B in ~50 years. Our real issue is resource distribution, not overpopulation. In fact, many nations face SHORTAGES of young workers to sustain the old.#economics #future

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: This is a Sophie's Choice for TikTok - risk being banned in the US or abandon a powerful propaganda tool for China.What many don't realize is TikTok's primary threat isn't tracking & data access. It's the potential for propaganda. I was born in the USSR, studied it & know TikTok is a communist's wet dream. Imagine every young person at your adversary subscribing to a social network where you control the narrative - which posts and voices get heard or squelched. Don't believe me? Watch ex-KGB chief propagandist Yuri Bezmenov explain how communist tactics work:https://lnkd.in/gkk5sf2Thankfully, a private, American-owned social network could never facilitate our self-destruction...

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: "Restaurants..place that mysterious “MP” next to seafood items. What if you forgot to visit the local fishing village that morning? Or, you’re not a clam commodities trader? You’re screwed. So “market price” becomes whatever the restaurant thinks it can get away with. Ironically, the only thing it’s getting away with is lost sales."

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: How does Sephora stay in business as a physical #retailer? - the value of below-the-eye makeup plummets the longer we wear masks in public & indoor entertainment is closed- no one can (or wants to) try samples- physical shopping in crowded stores/malls ranges from unappealing to risky🤞 mask #innovation

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: 4 common money mindsets:1) save a buck: spend hours trying to save $40 on a new TV2) make a buck: invest hours bettering yourself to earn more in future3) share a buck: see pie as static & ponder how best to allocate4) give me a buck: I've fallen & can't get upAt times, I've found myself drifting into 1 or 3 and had to gather the will to put myself into 2. Investing in yourself is the only way forward. To financial success and happiness.Then, I see something like this service... Poverty wages dressed up as "engagement". Like adult films, doing surveys to save $5 on cable, can only flourish under parental, educational & economic neglect. That same amount of time spent learning a skill could double one's income in 1-2 years.

Text: A worthy tribute to something we all took for granted until the pandemic - supermarkets.

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: Wonder how the rich get richer? The IPO hustle is one example.Top VC investor Bill Gurley explains how investment banks purposely underprice IPOs to reward their big clients by creating a big 1st day "pop", while shortchanging the company & its original investors. It's almost the same tactic Ticketmaster uses with top artists. It creates an artificially low price on tickets and favorable profit split. Then, they sell lots of seats to legal scalpers (some they own) who re-sell them at the real market price. Artists get none of that premium.#pricing #strategy #economics

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: For a long time, everyone was convinced that experiences matter and 'stuff' was dead (unless you're a rich kid Instagrammer or buying from Unclutterer-In-Chief Marie Kondo). If Coronavirus, fear of infection, or extreme inconveniences persist, are we back to buying stuff to fill the emptiness?1) That dopamine rush of opening a new Amazon box never went away, especially in the suburbs, where IKEA-assembly is a fun Saturday night.2) People are aching to return to normal. Comedy clubs & restaurants are already filling up, people are travelling. They might just do more of it closer to home.3) Digital lives are hollow. People crave contact, interaction. Cities, events & experiences will come back. Till then? Nothing wrong with a night of Netflix, a new pair of heels & a hermetically-sealed cuddlebuddy.--#future #experiential #retail

Text: This is good news for sellers on the Amazon platform. Very similar to what Kabbage does with eBay, using actual sales data to ensure the business can pay back the loan. Expect to see Shopify to offer something similar to its merchants shortly. #retail

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: I'm living the vegan dream. Almost fully converted from milk to almond milk. Taste and cost are comparable. Plus, it's 30 calories vs 130 per serving. #Innovation is how most people will reduce consumption of animal products. Of course, someday science might show that increased almond production is somehow killing otters. Till then...

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: If you trust your government or live under authoritarianism, this works. But fear and uncertainty can lead liberal societies to surrender freedoms they'll never get back. There's also a chance that #technology will lead all three to the same #future.More on inevitability:

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: I opened this article with high hopes. Unfortunately, the examples used are either high-touch or small scale. Very hard to build a no-code scaleable business that's not just a website or basic app. One  possibility is outsourcing the high-touch elements overseas. This has been done with bookkeeping, customer service, research, design and others. But there is no magic bullet.

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: Germany preserved #jobs, and likely people's sanity, much more effectively and at less expense than the US by subsidizing payrolls directly. (Note, the composition of these economies is different so the same strategy might produce different results here.)#economy

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: This piece is way too academic. Not how #innovation or #startup partnerships work in real life. Nor does it accentuate the real problems that come up, like capacity and power dynamics. Here's my more realistic take: "10 Rules for Partnering With Big Corporations"

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: Does "new" really need "brand" 's help?

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: The real (not advertised) value of college is:1) certification2) socialization3) network4) education (only matters for trade majors like engineering, finance, medicine, law, etc.)In that order.So online education FAILS because it addresses the LEAST IMPORTANT part. One that's available for free all over the web.More on this podcast episode & forthcoming ones on iTunes.TheMcFuture.com. Subscribe.

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: An unintended consequence of the unemployment benefit boost is it raises unemployment payments above median salary for two thirds of workers. That eliminates their incentive to return to work and help reopen the economy.

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: The ultimate irony of this pandemic will be if the collapse in property values leads to rich Chinese (and other) investors buying up huge chunks of America, benefiting from their own negligence & our failure to regulate foreign property investment.

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: With his $100 million #podcast deal, did @joerogan make the same trade that @howardstern did? Full episode & #future of #media series: https://lnkd.in/eErzUCk #culture @SiriusXM #radio #JoeRogan #joeroganexperience #podcasting #TheMcFuture #podcast

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: There are 49 other desperate states that will bid for SpaceX's business, especially now. California already chased away chunks of the entertainment industry with high taxes and regulations. Many shoots now happen in Canada or New Mexico. New York has bled residents for the past five years with 420,000 of the richest leaving during the pandemic.Eventually, interstate competition forces policy changes. Unfortunately, this process also means states are at the mercy of corporations, as they refuse to negotiate jointly, to their own detriment. See:

Text: Good move by Facebook. Giphy is genius. A repository of animated clips made by people and taken from other people's intellectual property that almost completely evades copyright restrictions. (See: https://lnkd.in/dVryA_9)

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: "F&%k DoorDash"You have to read this. DoorDash is a dirty trickster that's been highjacking Google listings & undercutting small businesses, funding the whole thing with VC losses. A truly dirty player worth not just rooting against, but prosecuting.

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: "Sorry, the next available train is Thursday October 15. Thank you for your patience."Partial solution: make subway resident/worker-only, for now. Tourists (if any) fend for themselves or go off-peak.Better: use differential pricing (incentives/discounts/premiums) to stagger commute times. More: https://lnkd.in/e8gtASJCan be done via chip card or Android/Apple Pay integration.

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: It's 50-50. Yes this could be a near-depression.OR, combo of:-pent-up demand-stimulus-repatriating essential industries-limiting impact to travel/leisure/hospitality/retail-exodus from cities-safety retooling (like delivery, proximity, design)-baby boomSpurs a fast recovery.Follow for full projection next week.-(image source: https://lnkd.in/eRnV-Wq)

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: Remote work is already "subsidized" or "incentivised". It's already more expensive to have more office space, commute, fly employees to meetings and conferences. Coronavirus lockdown simply forced a comparative case study that will make many companies realize those extra costs and friction aren't worth it. Additional incentives might not be unnecessary, nor desirable, because of unintended consequences. No free rides in introducing behavioral distortions.

Name: Steve Faktor
Text: Harvard professor wants to ban homeschooling. No word on failing schools, indifferent parents, property-tax funded inequity, bad teachers, silly majors, obscene tuition.Homeschooling isn't necessarily great, it's just good to be skeptical of 'banners'. So what's her real agenda?Since most homeschooling parents are religious, saying it "may keep [kids] from contributing positively to a democratic society" suggests mandatory secularization.Maybe a better answer is minimum standards for homeschooling AND better schools people *choose*..in "a democratic society".Are there examples of mandates or authoritarian measures that preserve democracy? Some examples I can think of:- Military service (like in Israel)- Required immunizations- Mandatory car insurance (US)- Compulsory voting (Australia)Others?

Name: Narendra Modi
Text: In the journey of every nation there are moments that bring utmost pride and have a historic impact on generations to come. India has successfully tested the Anti-Satellite (ASAT) Missile. Congratulations to everyone on the success of #MissionShakti.The Mission is special for 2 reasons:(1) India is only the 4th country to acquire such a specialised & modern capability. (2) Entire effort is indigenous. India stands tall as a space power! It will make India stronger, even more secure and will further peace and harmony.

Name: Narendra Modi
Text: The festival of democracy, Elections are here. I urge my fellow Indians to enrich the 2019 Lok Sabha elections with their active participation. I hope this election witnesses a historic turnout. I particularly call upon first time voters to vote in record numbers.The last five years have shown that with the blessings and participation of 130 crore Indians, what was earlier deemed impossible has now become possible. 2019 polls are about a spirit of confidence and positivity with which India is fulfilling the aspirations of its people.Guided by ‘Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas’, NDA seeks your blessings again. We spent the last five years fulfilling basic necessities that were left unfulfilled for 70 long years. Now, time has come to build on that and create a strong, prosperous & secure India. #PhirEkBaarModiSarkar

Name: Narendra Modi
Text: On the truly historic occasion of passage of the GST Bill in Rajya Sabha, I thank leaders & members of all parties. Our MPs must be congratulated for their path breaking decision to give India an indirect tax system for the 21st century. We will continue to work with all parties & states to introduce a system that benefits all Indians & promotes a vibrant & unified national market. This reform will promote 'Make in India', help exports & thus boost employment while providing enhanced revenue. GST will also be the best example of cooperative federalism.

Text: Followers want to be taken care of. Leaders want to take care of others. Be the leader you wish you had.

Name: Simon Sinek
Text: Do you have a Just Cause? Is it your own or do you follow someone else’s? Here’s mine: I imagine a world where call centers are the heart of the organizations they service and that the employees found in them can thrive in a culture of engagement and empowerment. Where they can build meaningful connections with their clients and inspire each of them to go on and do the same. ❤️Imagine how we could change the world. I help Leaders do just this 🌟Putting my learning from “The Infinite Game” class into practice! Stephen Shedletzky 💪❤️🙌🔥🔥🔥#justcause #infinitegame #infinitemindset #grateful #inspired #engaged #employeeexperience #leadership #hr #customerexperience #callcenters #contactcenter #culture#Ynternational

Name: Simon Sinek
Text: Have you heard of the Infinite game?Last night I attended "The Infinite Game Class" with Stephen Shedletzky - What an inspiring and engaging 2 hours!Time well invested to help me clarify and add to my leadership tool box the skills I need to:- Inspire real change- Propel my Just Cause of what a call center environment can be- Meet and connect with other inspiring people - Refocus on the importance of trusting teams - Learn about the value of my worthy rivals- Prepare to help organizations through their Existential Flex- Have and demonstrate the courage to lead Check out the book and the class if you want to expand your horizons and help change the world around us I am inspired by all the people I met who aspire to doing just that ❤️❤️❤️#leadership #leadershipdevelopment #thoughtleadership #infinitemindset #infinitegame #inspire #Ynternational

Name: Simon Sinek
Text: Changing the world takes more than everything any one person knows, but not more than we know together. So let's work together.

Name: Simon Sinek
Text: If you get the promotion, "win" the argument or make the "best" product, do you win the game? No. You keep going. All too often we show up to win when we really should be showing up to improve. Learn how to adopt the right mindset... an infinite mindset ∞ 🧠 ... for games that have no end, like business, careers and all of our relationships. Check out an upcoming Infinite Game class...Tue, Oct 6, 3pm ETMon, Oct 12, 9pm ET (Oct 13, 11am Melbourne time)Tue, Oct 20, 2pm ETSign up at https://lnkd.in/g2F6KaE. #theinfinitegame #simonsinek #liveonlineclass #inspireu #continuousimprovement

Name: Simon Sinek
Text: I’ve never been one who learns from books, I learn best from listening and asking questions. That’s where all my best ideas come from. When I decided to do a podcast, I wanted it to capture some of those conversations.  I wanted it to be honest and open…even a little voyeuristic. I’m looking forward to season two. Until then, season one is now available wherever you like to listen to podcasts.

Name: Simon Sinek
Text: Monday is not my favorite day of the week.  Yesterday's Infinite Game class with Stephen Shedletzky broke that rule.Having already read the book and participated in Book Club with Simon Sinek, I wasn’t expecting a “lightbulb moment”. My expectations were exceeded! Credit goes to my partners Dave LoSavio and Christophe Burckbuchler.  Multiple discoveries were made as we unpacked the five Infinite Game principles:1.    Just Cause2.    Trusting Teams3.    Worthy Rivals4.    Existential Flexibility5.    Courage to LeadAt the outset, we saw how our just causes revolved around what it means to be part of “team human” -- our connections with others, share our knowledge to advance the knowledge of humanity, and work together to realize our potential and build a better future. (There were connections to my Why, although time didn’t allow me to ponder this).Another one of my “aha moments” was identifying a worthy rival.   Worthy rivals are the people that make you feel uncomfortable when you hear how well they handle situations in which you struggle. This is an extension of the idea that personal growth requires you to get comfortable with the idea of being uncomfortable.See Simon Sinek Inc. at https://lnkd.in/gAxww3r for details. #SimonSinek #Inspiration #Learning

Name: Simon Sinek
Text: Life is beautiful not because of the things we see or the things we do.Life is beautiful because of the people we meet.

Name: Simon Sinek
Text: What's the best version of you?  Your WHY?   We are three weeks into The Honor Foundation experience here in San Diego.  Tonight, we launched the WHY Discovery process.   Sooooo good!   Curious to learn more?   Go straight to the source at Simon Sinek Inc.!   Are you in the Special Operations community and within 18 months of separation?  Prepare now and learn about our mission at honor.org!   With four campuses and an incredible Tribe, we can serve you from anywhere in the world!#veterans #transition #flow #purposedriven #waypoint Stephen Paul Matt Joe Lee Matt William Marla Victoria

Name: Simon Sinek
Text: Because so many young people are only communicating via text or DM, they're not learning vital interpersonal skills. Now, companies have no choice but to teach things like listening, effective communication, feedback, and how to have difficult conversations.

Name: Simon Sinek
Text: We can’t choose the game. We can’t choose the rules. We can only choose how we play... The infinite mindset is essential for any leader who aspires to leave their organization in better shape than they found it. The five essential practices to lead in an infinite game: 1. Advance a Just Cause2. Build Trusting Teams3. Study Worthy Rivals4. Prepare for Existential Flexibility5. Have the Courage to LeadThank you to Stephen Shedletzky and all of team Simon Sinek for delivering another inspiring, constructive, and insightful workshop on how to lead and live life with an infinite mindset.Ultimately, those who live with an infinite mindset are the ones who lead the rest of us into the future... Highly recommend the class and the book! #infinitegame #leadership

Name: Simon Sinek
Text: Where does optimism come from? I think it comes from an innate sense that the future is bright. Andy Grammer, an incurable optimist, thinks it starts with pain. I love his point of view. This is not a Bit of Optimism. This is...A Lot of Optimism. Hear our conversation at apple.co/simonsinek or wherever you like to listen to podcasts.

Name: Simon Sinek
Text: Are you honest? Have you ever told a lie? You see the problem. We all think we are honest, yet we have all done things that are dishonest. We can rationalize our actions, “it’s just a little white lie,” or “yeah, but it didn’t matter.” Dr. Lenny Wong has spent years studying “ethical fading,” when organizations and individuals make unethical decisions believing they haven’t done anything wrong. What’s astounding is how pervasive it is.In this week’s episode of A Bit of Optimism, we talked about what ethical fading is and what we can do about it. Listen wherever you get your podcasts or at apple.co/simonsinek.

Name: Simon Sinek
Text: Zoom Fatigue is real! Why is it that Zoom can zap my energy in an hour?  Well, the clock said it was just an hour, but it felt like FOREVER. Yet, there are those rare Zoom calls in which the time flies, and I leave the call full of purpose. What makes those calls so uplifting? What creates the feeling of engagement and connection?Like many, I was thrust into a “Zoom world” with little training. (I just learned there is a setting so you automatically mute when you login).   As a job seeker, I need to be able to make real connections on Zoom.   That is a tall order when it involves meeting for the first time.When I saw that Simon Sinek and his team at  Simon Sinek Inc. were offering a new class on “Build Relationships From Behind A Screen”, I jumped at the chance to learn more.  The 90 minute class with Kristen Hadeed was amazing.Not to be a spoiler, but in the first break out groups, we were instructed to do everything but listen attentively (which was hard as I was curious).  The last break-out group we used Kristin’s LISTEN technique, and it was magical.  I found myself having fun with my group members. I wanted the class to last longer!I highly recommend this class.  Keep your eye out as I think that further classes are on the horizon. #SimonSinek #Empathy #Zoom

Name: Simon Sinek
Text: In a society hooked on immediate gratification, it’s hard to remember that each of us is on our own timeline. Bruce Deel has the empathy to see the best in every person, and the patience to help them move closer to that ideal version of themselves, in their own time. The stories he shared about his life and his organization, City of Refuge, Inc., on this week’s episode of A Bit of Optimism are equally gut-wrenching and heartwarming. I’m so thankful to be able to share his work and his wisdom with you. Find it at apple.co/simonsinek or wherever you like to listen to podcasts.

Name: Simon Sinek
Text: It’s often easier to learn lessons when we look at extreme cases. I turned to the military to understand trust. To learn about compassion, I turned to Bruce Deel. He’s an extraordinary man and the second chances his organization, City of Refuge, Inc., gives people can teach the rest of us how we can do the same.Check out this week's episode of A Bit of Optimism at apple.co/simonsinek or wherever you like to listen to podcasts.

Text: Two things - money and the internet - influence and impact almost everything in our lives. Which is a problem when both are run by just a few companies. Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss, co-founders of Facebook and early investors in Bitcoin, have an idea of how to give the people back their power. Check out this week's episode of A Bit of Optimism at apple.co/simonsinek or wherever you like to listen to podcasts.

Name: Simon Sinek
Text: We all want to belong to a cohesive team where we are accepted and understood.  We all want to feel a part of something larger than ourselves.  Why is this so elusive? What sets these teams apart?   This week, I participated in the Building Trust Teams class led by Rich Diviney and Stephen Shedletzky (aka Shed).  I gained a new appreciation for how critical trust is for teams to be able to pull together in times of stress. Without trust, teams can break apart into “every man for himself” when presented with a threat. One of the most interesting concepts was “dynamic leadership”.  In a Trusting Team, the team member best suited can seamlessly take the lead in a crises. Without this deep knowledge of each other, valuable time can be lost in debating how to approach an issue. So, how do teams get to the point where they truly understand the strengths and weaknesses of each team member?  How do you foster these relationship?  Rich Diviney gives a compelling framework for selecting team members.  (Hint:  It's not about having a team of  "all stars". )  I highly recommend this class or anyone seeking a new lens on how to view high performance teams.  This class is offered by Simon Sinek Inc.  See first comment learn more. #Leadership #Teamwork #Inspiration

Name: Simon Sinek
Text: Infinite-minded players see beyond the bottom line. Where a finite-minded player makes products they think they can sell to people, the infinite-minded player makes products that people want to buy. The former is primarily focused on how the sale of those products benefits the company; the latter is primarily focused on how the products benefit those who buy them.

Name: Simon Sinek
Text: The work of Simon Sinek has had a significant impact on my leadership philosophy, so it was awesome to sit down with Stephen Shedletzky and discuss their mission to help leaders create a culture where the vast majority of people wake up inspired, feel safe, and end the day fulfilled by the work they do.Please give this one a listen!  Stephen shares so many great leadership insights and the steps for finding your WHY.  Some of my favorite quotes from this episode:"As individuals we're junk but together we're remarkable."  "Suffering is done alone and struggle is done together.  We should struggle together."  #leadership #inspired #safe #fulfilled #findyourwhy

Name: Simon Sinek
Text: Extreme listening are two words that don’t usually go together. But there is no other way to describe what Deeyah Kahn does. A Muslim woman, she made a documentary, White Right: Meeting the Enemy, about spending time with white supremacists. Her results were so profound, it raises the question, what if we all had the capacity for extreme listening?Check out our conversation on this week's episode of A Bit of Optimism at apple.co/simonsinek or wherever you like to listen to podcasts.

Name: Simon Sinek
Text: True service often includes giving something away that we value. Time, energy, missed opportunities and sometimes our lives. Some call this sacrifice. But not those who serve. For them, it was no sacrifice at all. It was a gift worth giving.Gen Stan McChrystal, author of Team of Teams, has a particular fondness for those who give quietly. No broadcast. No bragging. To him, true service includes humility.Check out this week’s episode of A Bit of Optimism at apple.co/simonsinek or wherever you like to listen to podcasts.

Name: Simon Sinek
Text: Seeing your books across the planet is a reminder that even if we can't be together, we can still do something together. This week is our final LIVE Book Club for The Infinite Game. Friday August 7 at 1pm ET we'll be discussing chapters 10 & 11 on YouTube, LinkedIn, Facebook, and Twitter. Thanks for joining us from all over the world!

Name: Simon Sinek
Text: General Stan McChrystal was the Commander of The Joint Special Operations Command under President Obama and is the author of Team of Teams. He has had a colorful and distinguished career, but what I wanted to talk to him about is how he has lived a life of Quiet Service.Listen to our conversation on this week's episode of A Bit of Optimism: apple.co/simonsinek (or anywhere you like to listen to podcasts)

Text: Former Navy SEAL commander, Rich Diviney, knows the value of trust. He stopped by last week’s Book Club to drop some knowledge. As Rich explained, trust is more than a feeling, it’s a belief. It’s a decision we make based on someone’s behavior. Join us for another round of book club Today @ 1pm ET live on YouTube, LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter. You can also join Rich, and learn how to start building trust with your team (of any kind) in his live online class: https://lnkd.in/eee3TvW

It was an awesome experience with new and old friends in a workshop to “Manage your Emotions in High Stress Times.” Scott and Andrea from the Awesome Institute led an amazing program with great direct takeaways. It was an honor to continue my learning with you both. Thank you for helping me think better. And shout out to my breakout room partners Kelly and Jordan for our real conversations! #simonsinek #inspireon #awesomeinstitute #continuedlearning #petemossmanisawesome

Name: Simon Sinek
Text: Book Club with Simon continues TODAY! Simon will be taking your questions LIVE and discussing chapters 8 & 9 of The Infinite Game at 1pm ET on YouTube, LinkedIn, Facebook, and Twitter.

Name: Simon Sinek
Text: I  am excited for this Friday's Book Club with Simon. The Infinite Games is a great read for our new world as it speaks to what it takes for teams to flourish in times of change and uncertainty.I loved last week's Book Club!  Simon and Rich Diviney had a lively discussion on what it takes to build high performance teams.  Rich is a retired Navy SEAL commander who led teams who had to pull together in crisis situations.Rich provided some real gems. "Skills direct behavior for a known situation", and "When you get into a unknown or uncertain situation, skills don't apply, as we lean on our attributes." The discussion painted the picture of a high performance team made up of individual's who have skills and attributes that complement one another.  Simon connected Rich's trusting team to the Infinite Game.  Finite players try to practice for potential situations so that all the thinking has been been done.  Infinite players rely on their attributes in times of uncertainty.  Those attributes include empathy, humility, adaptability, and patience. I am eager to hear Simon's view on ethical fading and worthy rivals.  Book Club will be live at 1 pm ET this Friday on LinkedIn, Youtube and Facebook.  Hope to see you there!#SimonSinek #Inspiration #leadership

Name: Simon Sinek
Text: To The No Stress Book Club, and everyone out there reading The Infinite Game - thank you for being a part of OUR Book Club! Doing something together is what this is all about.The discussion continues this Friday July 31 @ 1pm ET LIVE on Facebook, LinkedIn, YouTube, and Twitter. We're breaking down and fielding questions on chapters 8 & 9 of The Infinite Game. Got questions or pix? Send them to bookclub@simonsinek.com

Name: Simon Sinek
Text: Naming our feelings is often quite difficult; it’s not something we’re taught how to do. It requires practice. I’m grateful to Andrea Garfield, who knows a lot about feelings, for taking the time to guide me.I’m also really grateful and proud that she, and her co-founder Scott Offerdahl, have joined our lineup of inspiring teachers and are now offering a live online class designed to help anyone who wants gain a deeper understanding of their emotions and how to manage them. The benefits can be profound and can dramatically improve how we show up for ourselves and the people around us. Their first class is tomorrow, Thursday July 30, and again on Thursday August 20, both at 3pm ET.  Enroll at https://lnkd.in/dTwQWvY#feelings #emotions #emotionalhealth #emotionalintelligence

Name: Simon Sinek
Text: We all need courage these days. The courage to speak out, the courage to be optimistic, the courage to take care of our loved ones when we’re hurting. Guy Raz and I talked about where courage comes from and how to find it.  Guy is the podcast king. He was also a war correspondent. So he knows a lot about courage. His ideas are absolutely inspiring.Listen to our conversation on this week's episode of A Bit of Optimism: apple.co/simonsinek (or anywhere you listen to podcasts)

Name: Simon Sinek
Text: Join Simon to discuss chapters 6 & 7 of The Infinite Game LIVE on Friday July 24 at 1pm ET.Got questions or photos of your book club? Send them to bookclub@simonsinek.com

Text: Less than six months since full-scale commercial launch of the world's first fully virtualized mobile network, today Rakuten Mobile takes another step forward to transform the mobile industry: We're offering customers 4G and 5G combined in one simple plan – Rakuten UN-LIMIT V – at the same low price as 4G. Our network technology is built to meet the ever-evolving needs of our customers – and with transformational innovation, we are passing on significant savings to our customers. As we move forward to expand 4G and 5G coverage, we aim to reduce the household cost of mobile services. This is also about encouraging consumer spending across other services and goods, contributing to the sustainable health of Japan's national economy. Today, we're one step closer to transforming telecommunications and building a brighter future for everyone.

Name: Mickey Mikitani
Text: CEOs often talk about the bold bets, but this has to be one of the most audacious: In March 2010, Mickey Mikitani, the founder of Japanese e-commerce giant Rakuten, declared that from now on all Rakuten business — even internal meetings — would be conducted in English. The move almost immediately changed the culture of Rakuten, disrupting social codes, upending meetings and shifting how Rakuten hired and retained employees. A few weeks ago in Tokyo, Mickey and I talked about why he jammed "Englishnization" through and what it has accomplished (and what is hasn't) — as well as how Rakuten intends to keep competing against Amazon and other global giants.#ConversationsWith #Japan #ecommerce

Name: Sachin Tendulkar

Name: Sachin Tendulkar
Text: “𝗣𝗼𝘀𝘀𝗶𝗯𝗹𝘆 𝘀𝗵𝗲 𝘄𝗮𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗢𝗡𝗟𝗬 𝗢𝗡𝗘 𝘄𝗵𝗼 𝗯𝗲𝗹𝗶𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗱 𝗶𝘁 𝘄𝗮𝘀𝗻’𝘁 𝗼𝘃𝗲𝗿. 𝗜𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝗻𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗿 𝘁𝗼𝗼 𝗹𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴𝘀 𝗮𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱”.I recently came across this really inspiring video of Heather Dorniden from a 600m race in 2008.Her blazing effort after falling halfway in the run showcases what mental toughness, grit and never say die attitude is all about! The learning here is that you are always in competition with your own self. The team will help you prepare and do everything possible to get you in the best shape. But when the competition starts it is just YOU who has to manage everything on your own (your body and your mind).As an athlete one has to learn to find strength and bounce back when you hit rock bottom. The whole world was watching Heather when she fell down but she kept her focus on the goal and didn't sit there disappointed. Possibly she was the ONLY ONE who believed it wasn't over. It is never too late to turn things around.I feel this applies generally to everyone because in life we all are faced with challenging moments and we ultimately have the power to change the final outcome.Source of the video: Roadmap Story

Name: Sachin Tendulkar
Text: It’s always been a joy to spend time with youngsters.‬‪At Tendulkar Middlesex Global Academy we began by conducting 🏏 camps in India & the UK. On the auspicious day of Ganesh Jayanti, we climb one more step in that journey as we launch our first full fledged Academy & Sports Centre at DY Patil, Navi Mumbai.

Name: Sachin Tendulkar
Text: On my recent trip to Nepal for UNICEF, I got a chance to witness something truly inspiring. We visited a village named Kavre, one of the many villages that had suffered losses in the 2015 earthquake. Surrounded by the most hospitable people, I could see the genuine efforts they were putting in to redevelop their country.  But what caught my interest the most was a young girl, an active public-health advocate who has set a strong example of how youth can be an important catalyst for social change. She has been leading the efforts in the local community to promote Handwash projects and spreading awareness among young females on menstrual hygiene. Her efforts have helped in bringing a massive shift in the mindset of not only the young ones but also the elders in the village.Can you imagine the impact it would have if every community had such opinion leaders work in various fields?   I firmly believe that the world would be a much better place if our youth is nurtured in the right way. #youth #girlpower #leadership

Name: Sachin Tendulkar
Text: This is something that I love doing the most!🏏

Name: Sachin Tendulkar
Text: मतदान करणे आपल्या सर्वांचे कर्तव्य आहे. माझं मत मी नोंदवलं आहे, आपण सर्व सुद्धा मतदान करून या लोकशाहीच्या सोहळ्याचा भाग व्हा.Happy to have voted & fulfilled my responsibility. Let’s turn out in large numbers to vote & be part of a vibrant democracy.#MaharashtraAssemblyPolls

Name: Sachin Tendulkar
Text: "The world has enough for everyone's need, but not enough for everyone's greed" quoted by Gandhiji signified his views about Mother Earth.On his 150th birth anniversary it is only fitting that we come together & make India Swachh & Swasth.#SwachhataHiSeva #GandhiJayanti

Name: Sachin Tendulkar
Text: While discussing the role of technology with Mr. Piyush Gupta, Group CEO, DBS Bank, I remembered how the introduction of technology in cricket had helped our team strategize and plan better for each batsman and bowler. Here’s a glimpse into this conversation.Look forward to hearing your thoughts on how technology has impacted you and your team.

Name: Sachin Tendulkar
Text: Onam Ashamsakal to everyone! May this festive season bring happiness & prosperity to all!I have always received so much love whenever I've visited Kerala.During my recent visit, I had a very special interaction with Pranav. He is an artist who sketches with his legs and I was just amazed by his drive and motivation to overcome challenges.This, to me, truly symbolizes the Spirit of Kerala!

Name: Sachin Tendulkar
Text: While adapting to changing times, those who thrive are the ones who are flexible, aren't afraid to fail and respond to change by thinking out of the box.In a discussion I had with Mr. Piyush Gupta,  Group CEO, DBS Bank last year, I spoke about putting this into practice in my career when I started opening for India in 1994.

Name: Sachin Tendulkar
Text: Our Hon. PM Shri Narendra Modi launched the #FitIndiaMovement today which is a commendable initiative.It resonates with a dream very close to my heart, that of helping India transform from a 'Sport Loving Nation' into a #SportPlayingNation.In the last few days, I was able to put it into action on a personal level by spending time with some wonderful people playing different kinds of sports.Whether it was a squash session with our 🇮🇳 champ Ritwik Bhattacharya, a game of carrom with the wonder women of St. Anthony's Old Age Home, Tennis & Badminton with Vinod Kambli and friends or the impromptu cricket with Varun Dhawan at a recent shoot, each one was a refreshing and rewarding experience.On #NationalSportsDay, I urge you all to go express your love and passion for sport beyond just watching and cheering but by playing it daily and making fitness a part of your lifestyle.So, which sport are you going to pick up and play with your friends?

Name: Sachin Tendulkar
Text: It has been a lovely partnership with Luminous where we have worked together on project ‘Spreading Happiness’ by bringing electricity to over 25,000 homes across the country. I’m also happy to see that over the years, Luminous has been able to successfully find solutions for the evolving needs of the Indian consumer. It has been a wonderful journey of 10 years with Luminous and I look forward to continuing this association for many more years.Luminous Power Technologies (P) Ltd

Name: Sachin Tendulkar
Text: Happy Independence Day to all Indians! We are a global powerhouse today. If India were to become more happy, healthy and wealthy by 2050 - we need to invest in Early Childhood Development. This calls for involvement from both parents. Share with me how organisations can support equal parenting through policy interventions.

Name: Sachin Tendulkar
Text: I’ve always believed that cricket is played best when your mind is at the opposite end and that problems occur when your mind is stuck at your own end.#SachThoughts #Cricket

Name: Sachin Tendulkar
Text: Be it the Cricket pitch or the pitch of life, the principles remain the same...Before you lay a foundation on the Cricket field, there should be a solid foundation in your heart and you start building on that.#SachThoughts

Text: Chase your dreams but make sure you don't find shortcuts! #SachThoughts

Name: Sachin Tendulkar
Text: Thanks Forbes India for capturing my Second Innings thus far. The pitch is much beyond the 22 yards, the playfield has changed, the rules are different but the support of my team and well wishers makes this journey special. Looking forward to many more learnings and experiences.‬

Name: Sachin Tendulkar
Text: The feeling of going out on to the field and playing cricket was always exciting. And now, being able to share what I have learnt over the years with so many ambitious, young athletes is an amazing feeling.The Tendulkar Middlesex Global Academy (TMGA) is all about enabling youngsters to build a strong foundation, based on MCCC's 154 years of experience and my own experience of 24 years playing professional cricket. Our aim is to not only shape well-trained future athletes, but also fine human beings. The first camp in the UK was a great start. I'm really looking forward to the next few camps in Mumbai and Pune. https://lnkd.in/fZVfdzu #TMGA #Cricket #training #camp #Mumbai #Pune

Name: Sachin Tendulkar
Text: It’s been 20 years since I met the inspirational Sir Don Bradman but I remember that day so vividly. I recall his amazing wit, warmth, and wisdom. It’s not just the legacy of a great sportsman, but the person himself who made a deep and lasting impact on me. Remembering him fondly today, on his 110th birth anniversary.

Name: Sachin Tendulkar
Text: Everything in life is hard-earned. Just like our independence. Among countless other things, there would have been no ‘Team India’ if not for the sacrifice of our brave freedom fighters. Let us not take that freedom for granted. #HappyIndependenceDay 🇮🇳🇮🇳🇮🇳

Name: Dr. Dambisa Moyo
Text: No does not mean ‘never’ – it means ‘not now’. Very often we might be rejected from a position and not even get feedback on why we are not even shortlisted. This can be especially hard for women and minority groups who, without context, detail or information, may believe their gender or race puts them out of contention. But here are three steps I recommend:1. Reach out and ask for feedback (recognizing that we’re not entitled to feedback so be nice when you ask and take criticism constructively)2. Ask an objective friend for their views on why you didn’t make the cut – what can’t you see?3. Don’t get mad! Redouble your efforts to be the best in your craft you can be – because you never know when they’ll come back or an even better opportunity will present itself!

Name: Gordon Orr
Text: Declining Fortunes of US Automakers in ChinaThe top 10 car models sold in China in July, according to Gasgoo, contained 5 Japanese models, 3 German (all from VW) and 2 Chinese. None were American. Indeed it is not just that the US automakers are not in the top 10, there overall sales are in very swift decline – as this table from ZoZo Go shows:US Automaker China Sales GM 2017: 4.04 million 2020: 2.5 million (f)   Ford  2017: 1.25 million 2020: 550,000 (f)   FCA  2017: 223,000 2020: 47,000 (f)   Sources: Company reports. Gasgoo. China Daily. CAAM. LMC. Includes joint ventures where GM and Ford own minority stakes.This decline is not due to any anti-American sentiment among consumers. These American automakers have lost the pulse of the Chinese consumer, their cars are not designed or priced to the Chinese car buyer. Turning this around will take real boldness and large-scale investmentThe exception to this trend is of course Tesla who is currently dominating the market for high end EV in China  #china #cars

Name: Gordon Orr
Text: New adventures....This is my first post on LinkedIn, written on the first weekend since October 1989 that I am not an employee of HSBC  (11,251 days if my maths is correct!) My “gardening leave” is complete, and it is time for new adventures. My journey from International Officer Trainee to Group Chief Executive was such a privilege. I worked with so many talented people, learned more than I ever thought possible, and have nothing but the greatest affection for the Group, its staff, and the customers who trusted us to serve them.I would like to thank my colleagues and friends who provided such wonderful support to me and my family, from my first day at the Bank through to the last. I will be forever grateful.😊

Name: Gordon Orr
Text: Luxury demand booming in China from high end cars to high end clothing and accessories.  Illustrates the weakness in China's consumer recovery.  The wealthier survived lock down just fine and ready to spend aggressively (in China as they cant travel internationally) but the less wealthy suffered relatively more from loss of income and savings during the lockdown.  Now feeling less secure about their income going forward they are saving more and spending less.  So while luxury car dealerships boom, low end restaurants struggle to get traction again #china #consumer

Name: Gordon Orr
Text: As of December 2019, all our cockpits are fully paperless. The digitisation of all manuals and paperwork saved 13.4 million kilograms of paper per year, reducing our carbon emission by 4000 tonnes. Learn more about our paperless cockpits at https://bit.ly/3jtkWgR

Name: Gordon Orr
Text: A blank slate is always exciting because you are unencumbered by what has come before. That’s the approach our designers and engineers took when they created the Lenovo Legion Phone Duel. A new mobile gaming phone that delivers a console-like experience. With it, gamers can enjoy high-performance, immersive #5G gameplay action while holding the device horizontally with both hands. Its landscape-mode design offers the most gaming-centric mobile experience in the market. https://bit.ly/LegionPhone

Name: Gordon Orr
Text: Inevitable fallout from China's indiscriminate distribution of funding to companies claiming they can become a world leader in semiconductors despite having limited relevant experiences to build on.  Other than strong local government relationships.  Not all will fail, but many will, expect more of the same #China #semiconductor

Name: Gordon Orr
Text: Japan follows through on its promise to subsidize Japanese companies to shift production out of China.  About US$7.5mn per company. Such a small amount implies that the manufacturing output being moved is very small or that the companies had already decided to move.  The cost of laying off workers in China, let alone the cost of moving and setting up elsewhere likely exceeds the subsidy provided. #China #Japan

Name: Gordon Orr
Text: Tesla's vehicle road map for China may involve the vehicles becoming more Chinese - China developed self driving software, China produced chips etc.  Also promises to make the self driving software available as open source.  While chips for cars need to be incredibly specialised and powerful, they dont need to be small - lots more space in a car than a phone - and so dont need to use the bleeding edge production technologies not available in China today #tesla #china #ev #shanghai #interconnected

Name: Gordon Orr
Text: Foldable tech – devices that literally fold in half – is a new category, but one driven by purpose. The way people use tech is evolving and that has inspired us to create a form factor that offers unprecedented portability and user flexibility. Is it a tablet, a PC, or a smartphone? It's something unique. Our COO, Gianfranco Lanci, expands on the future of #foldable tech here: https://lnkd.in/eszNH_R

Name: Gordon Orr

Name: William De Vijlder
Text: #FiscalPolicy #Recovery #Businesses #GlobalGrowth

Name: William De Vijlder
Text: #EcoTVWeek | Preparing for a post-pandemic world: towards a more targeted economic policyIn its latest #WorldEconomicOutlook, the #IMF considers that the economic recovery will be "long, uneven and highly uncertain". This will require support from monetary and in particular #FiscalPolicy for a long time to come. However, the emphasis is expected to gradually shift towards a more granular approach – given the constraint on #PublicFinances – and towards preparing for the post-pandemic world, by facilitating the reallocation of resources towards sectors with promising economic prospects.

Name: William De Vijlder
Text: "I think that we’re in a situation that #FiscalPolicy is absolutely crucial, that means that the efforts of various countries, think of Germany, France, and also other countries before that is going to be helpful, but it will take several years before we have #Inflation even converging a tiny bit towards the target and that’s the headache of the #ECB." With Matthew Miller and Anna Edwards on #BloombergTV, "Bloomberg Markets: European Open".

Name: William De Vijlder
Text: Macro Waves | Killing two birds with one stone: fiscal policy to boost growth and meet #Climate goals. The final episode deals with the responses of European governments to the crisis generated by the #Covid19. The “Next Generation #EU” plan recently launched by the European Commission is discussed from this viewpoint.

Name: William De Vijlder
Text: Macro Waves | #Covid19: Towards a lasting change in the way we produce and consume? The second episode focuses on the profound social changes that the pandemic has brought about. Why these changes in behaviour and mindset could prove to be long-lasting?http://bnpp.io/uxCU50BxNjm

Name: William De Vijlder
Text: Video | #EcoTV –  September 2020: Despite its rebound, economy needs monetary and fiscal support. Focus on the new global economy season. http://bnpp.io/y3cX50BreF1

Name: William De Vijlder
Text: Macro Waves | #Covid19, lockdown and the environment. The first episode deals with the concept of externalities to consider how #lockdown, by limiting human and economic activity considerably, have affected the #Environment. http://bnpp.io/pNAb50BpVXX

Name: William De Vijlder
Text: EcoBrief | Philip Lane’s new blog post: a de facto commitment for action"The #ECB blog is becoming an integral part of the communication strategy in the area of #MonetaryPolicy. Following the market reaction to the ECB President’s press conference, it is used to clarify the message if need be. This is illustrated by today’s blog post of ECB chief economist Philip Lane."

Name: William De Vijlder
Text: Macro Waves | #Covid19 and the environment. This new series of podcasts deals with the pandemic’s environmental effects. Governments’ actions to link economic growth and measures for the environment are also discussed. http://bnpp.io/Sx4B50BkC6p

Name: William De Vijlder
Text: Macro Waves | #Inflation, perceived inflation and expected inflation: very different things. In the final episode, the analysis turns to the psychological factors in play when it comes to inflation. http://bnpp.io/kj6A50ALb3X

Name: William De Vijlder
Text: Macro Waves | #Covid19 and the outlook for inflation in the real economy. In the second episode, the analysis turns to the real economy and the factors that could produce #Inflation. http://bnpp.io/74X550AL8of

Name: William De Vijlder
Text: Macro Waves | #Covid19 and the outlook for inflation: a monetary approach. In the first episode, we discover that the risk of an increase in inflation is high on the list of frequently asked questions by clients. http://bnpp.io/QKzT50AKhx3

Name: William De Vijlder
Text: EcoBrief | European Council reaches historical agreement"The agreement illustrates, again, the ability of the #EU to make big steps forward when the need is high."

Name: William De Vijlder
Text: The big concern I would have is that the job creations would be slow, subdued and at the same time unemployment would continue to go up and people would no longer benefit from specific programs that had been put in place to give them income support.▶️ http://bnpp.io/bbo350AA7mn

Name: William De Vijlder
Text: Video | #EU: Impact investing and the European Recovery Plan.Faced with the depth of the recession, there is no doubt about the need for a European recovery plan, in addition to the massive national measures that have already been taken. The European Commission has proposed an ambitious plan, but it has run up against two considerations, among others: moral hazard and strict conditionality. One solution would be to apply the principles of impact investing: targets would be set, and once reached, they would open the door to better financial terms, or even the partial conversion of loans into grants.http://bnpp.io/5KEd50AiGwW

Name: William De Vijlder
Text: "The fiscal support has to come from the European data now. We have seen that there has been a series of announcements at a national level. We then have had the #EuropeanCommission recovery plan proposal, so now all eyes are focused on that. The discussions, I'm afraid, will be tough, will not be easy. At the same time, if you look at European Commission simulations on the economic impact, it is important because it can make a big difference."

Name: William De Vijlder
Text: Macro Waves | New series of #Podcasts #Covid19: #Unemployment, human capital and households’ balance sheet. The first episode focuses on households’ balance sheets by considering how assets and liabilities are influenced by the pandemic. http://bnpp.io/ApIE50A3kBo

Name: William De Vijlder
Text: After the peak of the pandemic, which type of economic recovery?The recession has been ‘mechanical’. With the progressive easing of the lockdown measures, we can expect a mechanical rebound of activity and demand. The key question is what happens afterwards? There are several reasons to expect a slow, very gradual recovery... https://lnkd.in/dsB4nk8

Name: William De Vijlder
Text: "Once the lockdown has ended, the recovery is likely to be gradual and uneven and policy will have to shift from pandemic relief to growth-boosting measures, thereby putting additional pressure on public finances."

Name: William De Vijlder
Text: EcoBrief | After the #Eurogroup agreement on pandemic relief, now for the hard part: how to boost #Growth when the pandemic will be under control"An agreement at last. The Eurogroup meeting last night brought EUR 500 billion – about 4.2% of eurozone GDP – additional firepower to address and attenuate the immediate economic impact of the COVID pandemic."

Name: Betty Liu
Text: I had the absolute pleasure today of being the keynote speaker for several hundred LGBTQIA undergrad students about how to build your  brand while maintaining your authentic self at the #o4utech2020 Virtual Conference. Despite not being able to be IRL, the organizers did a fantastic job creating community and conversation!I am thankful to be able to share my career journey with these students, not just in sharing stories about amazing leaders I have work for, but equally as important are the lessons learned from those leaders who fell short for one reason or another.Thank you to to Tyler Lawrence and Anne Schwartz (they/them) and the whole Out4Undergrad team for giving me this opportunity to inspire the next generation of LGBTQIA leaders! #outforundergrad #o4Utech #o4U #lgbtqia #leadership #mentorship #marketing #leadershipdevelopment

Name: Betty Liu
Text: 54% of corporate boards have a diversity plan in place and 27% intend to create such a plan. Just some of the exclusive findings we've presented in a new survey with our partner, Diligent Corporation on #boarddiversity.

Name: Betty Liu
Text: Today we are celebrating Steven Tristan YoungCMO at Poshmarkhttps://poshmark.com/Steven is CMO at social commerce marketplace Poshmark. Straddling the line between traditional retail and digital disruption, Steven is driving explosive growth at Poshmark. Started his career two decades ago, Steven is a seasoned entrepreneurial leader who is known for scaling high & thoughtful growth across various sectors. Prior to Poshmark, Steven held senior leadership roles at American Express, DIRECTTV, Grubhub and PUMA Group.Steven also knows how to build high performing teams and is applying some proven leadership traits at Poshmark:1) Be the kind of leader who shows people how it works2) Create the right incentives for your team like Richard Branson said "Train people well enough so they can leave, but treat them well enough so they don't want to"3) Get the team together to focus on, not just personal development, but group developmentA self-proclaimed “Jaded Jetsetter”, Steven has been to 83 countries and is a fashionista & gear junkie that I look up to. ~Business Leader Spotlight Series~ Who happen to be of #Asian origin.

Name: Betty Liu
Text: “Lacking any drive to think about their businesses and unchallenged by leadership to do so, teams held meetings that were essentially useless, their presentations clogged up with feel-good jargon, meaningless numbers and analytic frameworks whose chief purpose was to hide faulty logic and make the business look good. When you did a bit of digging, you found that most executives and managers didn’t understand their business very well, or even at all.”The Irish Times shares more from Winning Now, Winning Later on how to banish intellectual laziness within your company: https://lnkd.in/eaES4kd

Name: Betty Liu
Text: Study after study has shown how diversity helps power innovation and strengthen a company’s performance. This starts at the top of organizations by ensuring the diversity in the boardroom reflects the diversity of the customers and markets we serve. The NYSE is doing great work to connect companies with diverse talent. I greatly appreciate the opportunity to join Betty Liu, Dottie Schindlinger, and Pamela Gibbs for a discussion of ways we can accelerate progress in this area. You can watch our full conversation here - https://lnkd.in/gmzcr3b

Name: Betty Liu
Text: Mike Corbat interviewed me 16 years ago to join Citi. I couldn’t have imagined the incredible opportunities I’d have, the many different businesses and regions I’d work in, and, most notably, the remarkable people I’d work alongside – and Mike is one of the most remarkable of all. I value his friendship and am inspired by all he’s accomplished during his time at Citi. His legacy will leave Citi a simpler, safer, stronger, and far more profitable firm – one that is not afraid to stand up for what we believe in. Thank you, Mike. I am grateful for the opportunity to build on this foundation and lead Citi as we continue to position the firm for long term success. I shall do my best to ensure Citi lives up to its potential and promise as the world’s leading bank.

Name: Betty Liu
Text: At the tail end of a pensive summer, I’m thrilled to announce my representation by United Talent Agency (book +) and its sister organization, Greater Talent Agency (lectures). How to design and then inspire people to embrace a holistic system and culture that creates value for all constituencies (business and, hmm, society). Did it against some long odds at Ashley Stewart by harnessing the goodwill of a diversified ecosystem through equal parts Kindness and Math, humanistic and technological. It’s teachable and it’s non partisan and it embraces differences to then transcend differences. UTA/GTN helping to provide scale and amplification in my efforts to recenter the soul of capitalism (profitably). Stay tuned for some fun announcements re: partners and allies and media events/projects. #kindnessandmathDavid Evenchick Sonya Denyse DreamDevelopmentUnited Talent Agency

Name: Betty Liu
Text: I recently hosted a fireside chat with business leader, Dave Cote, Executive Chairman of Vertiv (NYSE: VRT) and former Chairman and CEO of Honeywell (NYSE: HON), in our Radiate Live employee series to talk about his tried-and-tested lessons in leadership in his new book “Winning Now, Winning Later.” Cote discusses how in a world of constant change and global competition, every business leader must plan for tomorrow.  Cote says of teamwork: “Leaders need to make a decision, it’s not their job to develop a consensus, but it’s their job to make good decisions.” All of us can benefit from thinking about leadership and teamwork this way. Thank you so much to Dave for speaking with me and continuing to problem solve and lead with passion and purpose.

Name: Betty Liu
Text: I actually really like this idea.It might not just be physical things you need, but other things like a well-written employee handbook, or a properly set-up Quickbooks account.Happy to host this for my next friend that starts a business. #startups #entrepreneurship #businessshowerEDIT: Before you comment about the “Instead of...” keep in mind that it's just a figure of speech not to be taken "literal", as Colby Cyr pointed out. No one is suggesting to replace baby showers.

Name: Betty Liu
Text: You can build a strong, high-performance culture like we did at Honeywell, but you need to get past the idea that you’re already “doing” culture. Whatever you think you might be doing, redouble your efforts. Drive the culture at every opportunity. Revise your calendar to carve out more time for culture building. Make every decision with your culture in mind. When an opportunity arises to take a stand and make a point about the culture, buckle up and do it, even if it might seem irritating and a waste of time. In short, promote the culture as if your company’s future depended on it. Because it does. Learn more at https://lnkd.in/diVB4a4.

Name: Betty Liu
Text: What industry-changing unicorns will come out of the current economic downturn?It's almost inevitable there will be some. Uber was born during the last downturn. Further back, Hewlett Packard was created at the end of the Great Depression and General Motors was founded during a recession in 1908.It’s not hard to believe we'll see a new crop of businesses grow from this trough. Entrepreneurs are eternal optimists - they see an opportunity to address a problem and fill it. Some love the thrill of starting a business; others stumble into it because they lost a job.A Ewing Marion Kauffman Foundation study found more than half the companies on the Fortune 500 list in 2009 were created during a recession or a bear market. As for existing companies, those who don’t innovate won't survive. Luckily, I've had the chance to talk to many CEOs in our "Work This Way" series to hear how they're creatively running their businesses in this new normal.Adapting to change is why so many have stayed listed on the NYSE for decades, even centuries. And it won't be long before some of the new companies born today will be debuting on the NYSE and ringing that iconic bell.What new companies do you think will come out of this period? I’d love to hear.#entrepreneurship #leadership #unicorns

Name: Betty Liu
Text: Last week, I had the great pleasure of launching our NYSE Board Advisory Council’s first Board Diversity Webinar focused on the importance of younger directors. In partnership with Diligent Corporation, we explored why first-time and young directors are so important to diversifying a board, featuring Manish Chandra of Poshmark and Christa Quarles of Kimberly-Clark and Affirm, Inc. Some of the points discussed included:-- What challenges younger directors face when joining a board of more established members-- Why quotas to diversify a board are a doubled-edged sword. Christa spoke at length on what happens when quotas are put in place.-- How CEOs need to think outside the box when it comes to recruiting new members. Manish gave some examples on steps he is taking to create a more diverse board. If you’re interested in these matters, please have a listen to this engaging and frank conversation. And please comment below on your thoughts around this topic. I’d love to hear. https://lnkd.in/eEyfHx7

Text: I am excited to welcome Tata Consultancy Services as a Presenting Partner for Blockchain Revolution Global 2020, which will be hosted on a new virtual platform specially developed by TCS! Looking forward to a great event! “We are excited to share some of our visionary work being done with our customers and partners. These prove the true value in adopting blockchain as a foundational ecosystem technology.” said Lakshminarasimhan Srinivasan (Lakshmi), Head of TCS Blockchain Services. “We are thankful to the leadership of the BRI and MCI for entrusting us with the responsibility of curating and orchestrating this virtual event as their Experience Agency partner.”  Blockchain Revolution Global is returning October 26-30 as a fully virtual experience. Don't miss out! Register for #BRG2020 today! https://lnkd.in/gCHtt3w #GBW2020 #TCS #Blockchain

Name: Don Tapscott
Text: We have an exciting free webinar happening this afternoon with some of the leading voices behind the Ethereum Baseline Protocol and the adoption of Ethereum in enterprise. The topic: Enterprise Applications and the Ethereum Baseline Protocol, streaming live on Youtube at 1PM EDT!Alex Tapscott will be hosting John Whelan (Banco Santander), Paul Brody (EY), and John Wolpert (ConsenSys) to talk about the Ethereum platform, it’s potential as a tool for global enterprises, and how new initiatives like the Baseline Protocol are making it easier than ever for companies to unlock the value potential of the Ethereum blockchain. Don't miss out!Watch the webinar here at 1PM EDT: https://lnkd.in/gjRwVmN#blockchain #ethereum #baselineprotocol #BRG2020

Name: Don Tapscott
Text: OK, this is very cool. The Crypto for Congress initiative of the Chamber of Digital Commerce as a critical step towards the acceptance and use of blockchain technology.Through a ~$50 contribution of bitcoin to every Member of Congress, the Chamber of Digital Commerce PAC is providing all Members a hands-on experience with blockchain technology to raise their understanding, expand access to blockchain technology, and broaden participation in the political process. Read my writeup on the matter below! #blockchain #crypto #congress Perianne Boring

Name: Don Tapscott
Text: Don't miss Alex Tapscott's thoughtful piece about the future of money and the coming financial order. #blockchain #innovation #digitalcurrency #coindesk

Name: Don Tapscott
Text: Alex Tapscott on the future of digital money in 2030:"These three unstoppable forces – an assertive digital civil society, powerful states and global corporations that aim to be the landlords of our entire digital existence – are on a collision course. The coming cataclysm will, for better or worse, reshape money and our world for decades to come.This story is not about so-called fintech applications that have made banking a bit more convenient. This is about disruption on the magnitude of the post-World War II Bretton Woods conference, which made the U.S. dollar the global reserve currency."#fintech #crypto #future #internet2030 #economy #moneyhttps://trib.al/geSLJLW

Name: Don Tapscott
Text: This week I’m giving you a sneak peak at a new web platform our team has developed at www.DonTapscott.com. They’ve put together a ton of interesting information, research, writing, speeches, videos, music and media spanning my career of almost 4 decades. I value my LinkedIn community and am sharing with you first in the hopes of getting your comments, positive, negative or otherwise, and suggestions for changes before we go live next week. Thank you my friends! #DigitalEconomy #DonTapscott #BRG2020 #blockchain

Name: Don Tapscott
Text: Earlier this week, I was featured in CoinDesk's #Internet2030 series, where I imagined what the world could look like in 2030 if we all got our act together. In this week's edition of the Digital Economy Weekly, I expand on this idea and predict how things might go through the 2020's, what struggles we (hypothetically) will face, and what a promising outcome will look like when this decade comes to a close. All of this with the hope that these crises we face will lead to a new social contract to meet the needs of the digital age, and a more robust, equitable, and compassionate order of human affairs.I also highlight some important news in the digital economy and at the Blockchain Research Institute, where we are busy gearing up for Global Blockchain Week's Blockchain Revolution Global virtual conference. Registration is now open here: https://lnkd.in/gCHtt3w I look forward to your thoughts, enjoy! #digitaleconomy #blockchain #BRG2020

Name: Don Tapscott
Text: I was pleased to write for CoinDesk's ongoing #internet2030 series, where I outlined my vision for a new social contract - one that will meet the pressing needs of an increasingly digital world. In a front-page piece for Coindesk today, I detailed my thoughts on what this new social contract might look like, including new models of work and education, new models of identity, a new commitment to justice and citizen engagement, and a commitment to sustainability. Enjoy! #blockchain #digitaleconomy #innovation Read the article here: https://lnkd.in/gh5zwV6

Text: Join me on Tuesday for a webinar with the University of Alberta titled “Transformations for the Post COVID World.” Learn about 7 opportunities and challenges facing our country and some new directions for the future. Register here: https://bit.ly/34U7cqz #UAlbertaAW #digitaleconomy #Canada

Name: Don Tapscott
Text: This week I have a big announcement: Blockchain Revolution Global (our premier enterprise conference) is going virtual and is going to be bigger and better than ever before! I am excited to announce that Blockchain Revolution Global will be the flagship event for Global Blockchain Week, a week-long initiative filled with speakers, panels, discussions and events to drive the blockchain transformation of enterprise. The inaugural Global Blockchain Week will launch at the end of October to coincide with Blockchain Revolution Global, but will return each year bigger and better than previous! If you'd like to get involved with Global Blockchain Week, please send us an inquiry here: https://lnkd.in/giKgswNI look forward to seeing everyone at Blockchain Revolution Global! Text: Big news! The Blockchain Revolution Global conference will be returning this October 26-30 as a fully-virtual experience on a new and exciting virtual platform! Name: Don Tapscott
Text: You heard it here first! The Blockchain Revolution Global conference will be returning this October to offer an innovative and fully-virtual Global Blockchain Week experience.Co-hosted by the Blockchain Research Institute and MCI Group, Blockchain Revolution Global is the premier enterprise blockchain conference, featuring speakers from across the blockchain ecosystem, including enterprise thought leaders like Don and Alex Tapscott (Co-founders at the Blockchain Research Institute), Dale Chrystie (Blockchain Strategist at FedEx), and J. Christopher Giancarlo (Former Chairman of the CFTC). The event will run from October 26th-30th and will include a range of keynotes, panels, and discussions on the most pressing topics relevant to blockchain transformation in business, government, and society. Don't miss out on this incredible opportunity to engage with some of the leading voices in the enterprise blockchain revolution! Register for Blockchain Revolution Global 2020 today. #blockchain #BRG2020 #virtualconference #innovationhttps://bit.ly/32x1fhL

Name: Don Tapscott
Text: Finally. Corporations like SAP, EY, Microsoft, are hitting the bullseye. Without public blockchains like Ethereum, there is little need for blockchain. Private blockchains create new silos but this whole technology was meant to remove silos, make data more integrated, and scale network effects. The utility of use-cases on public will far exceed the ones kept in the dark. #blockchain #ethereum #publicblockchain

Name: Don Tapscott
Text: This week's edition of the Digital Economy Weekly marks our biggest announcement yet! Though the global pandemic is causing many business to hunker down, we've decided it's time to expand with the launch of the Blockchain Research Institute Europe (BRIE), a new think-tank to lead the digital transformation of Europe and beyond. As our first expansion overseas, we believe this is the first of many regional partnerships to bring the blockchain revolution global! #blockchain #digitaleconomy #Europe #EU #blockchainrevolution

Name: Don Tapscott
Text: Cointelegraph published a thoughtful review of Don Tapscott's recent book "Supply Chain Revolution", the definitive book about the promise of blockchain for logistics and supply chains. The book is available on Amazon here: https://lnkd.in/gjFd29u"This book is a must-read for individuals wondering how blockchain can transform a variety of complex supply chains." Wrote Cointelegraph's Rachel Wolfson. "From global trade to food safety to a powerful use case like China’s One Belt Road, blockchain’s potential for supply chain management is apparent and easily understood."#blockchain #cointelegraph #supplychain #bookreviewhttps://lnkd.in/g8VkrsT

Name: Don Tapscott
Text: Join us tomorrow for a free webinar with Ava Labs, the team behind the Avalanche platform. AVA Labs is work to usher in a new internet of finance, where developers can launch highly decentralized applications, new financial primitives, and new interoperable blockchains.The discussion will feature AVA Labs Founder and CEO Emin Gun Sirer Ava Labs President John Wu, and the BRI's Alex Tapscott. The free webinar will be live on Tuesday, August 25th, at 1PM EST. Register today! https://lnkd.in/edK7Tkc#blockchain #avalanche #webinar #technology #finance

Name: Don Tapscott
Text: On the back of an enormously successful fundraiser and weeks ahead of its launch, the Ava Labs creator Emin Gun Sirer, and President of Ava Labs John Wu, will sit down for a conversation with Alex Tapscott for a wide ranging discussion about the promise and peril of blockchain for the enterprise and the world. Do not miss it! The free webinar will stream next Tuesday, August 25th, at 1PM EST. Register here: https://lnkd.in/eiKPGYf#blockchain #avalanche #technology #webinar

Name: Don Tapscott
Text: This week, I focus on the digital transformation underway in the financial services, drawing from Alex Tapscott's recent book "Financial Services Revolution: How Blockchain is Transforming Money, Markets, and Banking." In the book, Alex thoughtfully details how emerging technologies are paving the way for a new financial order, that is more equitable, transparent, efficient, and collaborative than the financial order of yesterday. Perhaps, it is novel technologies like blockchain that will help steward us towards a new digital economy, as we start to rebuild in a pandemic stricken world.I hope you enjoy this week's edition of the Digital Economy Weekly, and remember to get a copy (or 10) of Financial Services Revolution! https://lnkd.in/ewz9KXX#blockchain #finance #DeFi #financialservices #newsletter

Name: Don Tapscott
Text: The COVID pandemic has taken precious lives and devastated the global economy. It has also revealed chinks in our supply chains. Not only have manufacturers found themselves scrambling unsuccessfully to find new suppliers when their Asian sources shut down, but the Western world has experienced across-the-board shortages of essential consumer packaged goods for the first time in decades. Blockchain technology has the potential to minimize these kinds of pandemic disruptions.Alex Tapscott and I have authored a number of books about blockchain and its impact on sectors like supply chains and the financial services. These critically acclaimed books have been used by global leaders to help them survive and thrive in this era of economic and technological disruption. Our recent book about blockchain in supply chains, "Supply Chain Revolution", is available on Amazon and is best bought in bulk! Read the preview below. #blockchain #supplychains #logisticshttps://lnkd.in/gu3v6FW

Name: Don Tapscott
Text: The COVID pandemic has taken precious lives and devastated the global economy. It has also revealed chinks in our supply chains. Not only have manufacturers found themselves scrambling unsuccessfully to find new suppliers when their Asian sources shut down, but the Western world has experienced across-the-board shortages of essential consumer packaged goods for the first time in decades. Blockchain technology has the potential to minimize these kinds of pandemic disruptions.Alex Tapscott and I have authored a number of books about blockchain and its impact on sectors like supply chains and the financial services. These critically acclaimed books have been used by global leaders to help them survive and thrive in this era of economic and technological disruption. Our recent book about blockchain in supply chains, "Supply Chain Revolution", is available on Amazon and is best bought in bulk! Read the preview below. #blockchain #supplychains #logisticshttps://lnkd.in/gu3v6FW

Name: Don Tapscott
Text: Yesterday I shared about things one has to do to be good boss/leader. Today I would like to share this article written by Jarret Jackson  on How to empower employees. This article highlights the definition of Empowerment. It is an active process on coaching or teaching your employees to self serve and to become adaptive to make decisions. It isn’t, take a hands off approach telling employees to sink or swim. Fear based response from the team leader is quite opposite to empowerment. Good stats and suggestions from Gallup on engaging employees. I am a big believer of engaging disengaged team members to improve team performance. #engagedemployees #gallup #empowerment
