Name: Don Tapscott
Text: This week was a major milestone in the blockchain ecosystem, as we celebrated the 5th anniversary of the Ethereum platform. Five years ago on July 30th, Alex Tapscott and I were in the offices of ConsenSys in New Jersey when the genesis block of Ethereum was launched. It was a pretty dramatic moment and we all felt like history was in the making. Now, five years later, we're fast approaching the launch of Ethereum 2.0. Amazing how fast time flies by!I hope you enjoy this week's edition of The Digital Economy Weekly and I look forward to hearing your thoughts! #blockchain #ethereum #digitaleconomy #happybirthday

Name: Don Tapscott
Text: To learn how blockchain is transforming the banking sector, be sure to read our case study "Mt. Pelerin Banking on the Blockchain: The Rise of Legally Compliant Protocols."This case study looks at Mt Pelerin, which works like a Swiss Army knife in the banking ecosystem. Its full-reserve custodian banking business model excludes on-balance sheet credits, which represents a shift from mainstream banking. Its Ethereum-based open source solution facilitates asset management and cuts ever-increasing compliance costs. It is a must-read for leaders of small to medium enterprises as well as financial service industry innovators.The report is now available to BRI members! #blockchain #research #banking #innovation Gabriel Jaccardhttps://lnkd.in/gNsz4q7

Name: Jon Steinberg
Text: Pope Francis endorsed same-sex civil unions for the first time as pope while being interviewed for the feature-length documentary “Francesco,” which had its premiere at the Rome Film Festival on Wednesday.“Homosexual people have the right to be in a family. They are children of God,” Francis said in one of his sit-down interviews for the film. “What we have to have is a civil union law; that way they are legally covered.”While serving as archbishop of Buenos Aires, Francis endorsed civil unions for gay couples as an alternative to same-sex marriages. However, he had never come out publicly in favor of civil unions as pope.For more: https://chdr.tv/j14

Name: Jon Steinberg
Text: You may soon get better cell service on the moon than here on Earth.Nokia has been tapped by NASA to build the first cellular communications network on the moon. Its Bell Labs' division was granted $14.1 million to build a 4G communications system to be deployed on a lunar lander to the Moon's surface in late 2022.Nokia said its network will provide critical communications capabilities for tasks astronauts will need to carry out like remote control of lunar rovers, real-time navigation, and high-definition video streaming. It plans to eventually upgrade the moon's network to 5G.For more: https://chdr.tv/eb624

Name: Jon Steinberg
Text: Joe Biden has brought his campaign to Animal Crossing.The Democratic nominee's campaign on Friday unveiled "Biden HQ', an Island in Nintendo's "Animal Crossing," where players can learn about the candidate and his love of ice cream, trains, and aviators.The island includes polling station, where players are encouraged to vote in real life, and a field office, where visitors are prompted to help the campaign's textbank and phonebank.

Name: Jon Steinberg
Text: A convertible that John F. Kennedy rode in on the morning of his assassination has sold for $375,000 at auction.The white 1963 Lincoln Continental was used to chauffeur the President, Jackie Kennedy, and Texas Governor John Connally to Carswell Air Force Base on the morning of November 22, 1963 for their flight to Dallas. It is not the Lincoln Continental convertible limousine, dubbed the SS-100-X, in which Kennedy was assassinated later that day. The SS-100-X is currently on display at The Henry Ford museum in Dearborn, Michigan.Auctioneers at the virtual Bonham’s American President Experience Auction on Wednesday had expected the convertible to fetch $500,000 but it ultimately sold for $375,000.

Name: Jon Steinberg
Text: A man in Mexico sheltered about 300 dogs from the strong winds and heavy rain of Hurricane Delta, which made landfall south of Cancun.Ricardo Pimentel Cordero, who runs an animal shelter in the area, posted on Facebook on Oct. 6 that he was going "to fill his home with dogs” to try to save them — and dozens of other animals — from the storm.Not surprisingly, the house smelled terrible, he says. But it was worth it: All survived the storm“The things they broke can be fixed or bought again, but what’s beautiful is to see them happy, healthy and safe, without wounds and with the possibility of being adopted.”For more: https://chdr.tv/ebba0

Name: Jon Steinberg

Name: Jon Steinberg
Text: Half of the coral populations on Australia's Great Barrier Reef have been wiped out in the last three decades, with climate change a key driver of reef disturbance, a new study has found.A report published on Wednesday in the journal Proceedings of the Royal Society studied the coral communities along the length of the Great Barrier Reef between 1995 and 2017, and found that almost every coral species had declined.Scientists blamed widespread bleaching — a process in which corals expel algae and turn white due to rising temperatures — and climate change for the loss of corals.“We used to think the Great Barrier Reef is protected by its sheer size — but our results show that even the world’s largest and relatively well-protected reef system is increasingly compromised and in decline,” researcher Terence Hughes said in a statement.

Name: Jon Steinberg
Text: The first firefighting robot in the United States has made debut in Los Angeles.The Los Angeles City Fire Department recently introduced the Thermite RS3, a remote-controlled, track-mounted robot that can go where firefighters otherwise can’t.The mini robot tanker was used for the first time to battle a major emergency fire in downtown Los Angeles Tuesday, officials said.The RS3 can be used as a safer alternative to battling explosive blazes and it allows firefighters to get inside a burning building that would normally be difficult for humans to enter safely.

Name: Jon Steinberg
Text: After a seventh-month wait, one Japanese tourist finally got to cross 'visit Machu Picchu' off his bucket list.Following Peruvian government closure of the site in March due to the coronavirus pandemic, 26-year-old Jesse Katayama became stranded in Aguas Calientes, the town where most people begin their Machu Picchu expeditions. He had originally only planned to spend a few days in Peru to see Machu Picchu.After seven months, Katayama was given special access to visit the normally crowded site before returning home to Japan.“After the lockdown, the first man to visit Machu Picchu is meeeeeee,” Katayama wrote in a post on Instagram.

Text: Amazon has unveiled its first fully electric delivery van developed with EV startup Rivian.The new vehicles include an advanced driver-assist system, sensor-based equipment, and exterior cameras that can provide a 360-degree view for the driver via a digital display.The move to electric vehicles is part of Amazon's climate pledge to be carbon neutral by 2040. The e-commerce giant says it expects to have 10,000 Rivian-built vehicles on the roads as early as 2022 and 100,000 by 2030.

Name: Jon Steinberg
Text: Six men plotted to try to kidnap Michigan Democratic Gov. Gretchen Whitmer at her vacation home, according to a criminal complaint unsealed Thursday in federal court.The FBI quoted one of the accused as saying Whitmer “has no checks and balances at all. She has uncontrolled power right now. All good things must come to an end."Whitmer has been praised but also criticized for Michigan’s response to the coronavirus. She placed major restrictions on personal movement within the state and on the economy, although many of those limits have been lifted.

Name: Jon Steinberg
Text: The Mercedes-Benz Stadium, home to the Atlanta Falcons and Atlanta United FC, is the first professional sports venue to sanitize its arena using drones.The stadium is partnering with Lucid Drone Technologies to spray medical-grade disinfecting chemicals on the seating bowl, handrails, and glass partitions, drastically reducing the time spent cleaning the arena by 95%, according to a news release.The stadium is preparing to welcome back fans at a limited capacity for the Falcons' upcoming home game against the Carolina Panthers on October 11.

Name: Christopher M. Schroeder
Text: That Future of Work everyone's always talking about? Well...it's here.And so, in true Unsettled fashion, we set out to ask 40+ experts a single unexpected, contrarian question: “What is one thing you think is being overlooked in today’s conversation around the future of remote work?"The result is Unsettled's Future of [Remote] Work 2020 Report, featuring CEOs, HR Managers, and industry thought leaders. Each has shared what they think has been lost in the conversation, across talent development, leadership and culture, and work + life integration. From Singularity University's Chair For the Future of Work, to the CEO of Remote.com, we heard from the experts, and their answers might just surprise you. Interested in learning more? Read the full report here: https://lnkd.in/gzDUinc#UnsettledFOW #FutureOfWork

Name: Christopher M. Schroeder
Text: Its official.  We’re open.  And we’re tackling  #diabetes head-on.  Supported by friends in #siliconvalley with extreme tech chops (who are still in stealth mode - but will share more on that soon), we’re the most advanced #diabetesmanagement center on earth, challenging the rest of the healthcare system with a new paradigm for comprehensive care.  The enormity of the problem is daunting, but we hope to make a meaningful and lasting impact on our patients’ lives. GluCare is a tech-enabled comprehensive diabetes care platform, incorporating the latest innovations in wearables and IoT devices, ML, and AI to empower our clinicians to be what they were trained to be... compassionate humans.   #Diabetes is one of the most destructive health epidemics facing society today, and is largely a disease of habit and lifestyle.   Enabling our caregivers to be data-driven coaches in changing human behavior is our superpower.We would be privileged to care for your loved ones who may be struggling with diabetes or its precursors.  www.GluCare.healthIhsan Almarzooqi

Name: Christopher M. Schroeder
Text: Here's my new profile of General Paul Nakasone, the director of the NSA and the head of US Cyber Command—e.g., the man in charge of defending the nation online. He's done more than perhaps any other military or civilian leader over the last decade to push, drag, and pull the United States into thinking through what warfare will look like in the 21st century. And now, in his powerful role atop NSA and Cybercom, it is likely that Nakasone has already, in just a short, two-year tenure, launched more cyberattacks against US adversaries than the US had initiated in the rest of history. Yet you probably don't know anything about Nakasone—and that's the way he likes it.

Name: Christopher M. Schroeder
Text: How are emerging market startups beating Silicon Valley's tech giants?Building products for the 6 billion people living in emerging markets requires a deep understanding of local cultures. And in recent years, the local tech companies’ innate understanding of its people has enabled them to outcompete the wealthier, Silicon Valley tech giants. The local versions of Uber such as Didi in China, Go-jek and Grab in Southeast Asia, and Careem in the Middle East, have got Uber beat. We’re seeing similar trends in e-commerce, fintech, gig marketplaces, classifieds and other industries.On this week’s episode of our Emerging Markets Startups podcast, we’re joined by Christopher M. Schroeder, venture investor and co-founder of the NextBillion Ventures, board member of several startups, and author of Startup Rising, The Entrepreneurial Revolution Remaking the Middle East. We talk about how localizing products is the ultimate competitive advantage and examples of emerging market startups that are already leapfrogging Silicon Valley. Listen to this episode on:YouTube: https://lnkd.in/geHSzHaSpotify: https://spoti.fi/34SkLFb Apple Podcast: https://apple.co/3iNF9fK Google podcast: https://bit.ly/3lxY0gH ...and all other podcasting apps#emergingmarkets #startups

Name: Christopher M. Schroeder
Text: The gig and independent economy has been rapidly rising over the last few years, and a reliable safety net is vital to support workers as they increasingly have to shift between roles and careers. Today, Mastercard announced a partnership with Stride, a leading portable benefits platform for independent workers in the U.S. Customers will have the ability to offer cardholders in the U.S. access to simple, affordable coverage plans. This marks the first time that differentiated health, dental, and vision benefits will be made available via a payments network. Jobble and MoCaFi will be the first companies to make this platform available to their customers.  This week also saw the launch of WorkRise, a new national platform for transforming the labor market for low-wage workers. The Mastercard Center for Inclusive Growth has been collaborating with the Urban Institute on this project for the last year. And with the Labor Department reporting that 886,000 Americans filed new claims for unemployment benefits last week, the need has never been greater for actionable ideas that can drive economic security and mobility for all workers.

Name: Christopher M. Schroeder
Text: So proud of the Foundation’s “Save Small Business Fund”! Check out this video of our grantees talking about how the funds helped them get through more weeks and months of the pandemic and recession. With great corporate partners, we’ve distributed more than $8M in grants to help small business owners in 50 states, DC, and Puerto Rico.Our grants supported machine shops, food trucks, dentists, bakeries, tech startups, and a surf shop, to name a few. These business owners tell us the funds were an important bridge to help bring back employees, pay another month or two of rent or insurance, or handle significant new costs for reopening safely. #SaveSmallBusiness #JobCreatorsThanks former FH crew Yagmur Cosar and Peter Quinn for making this video happen.

Name: Christopher M. Schroeder
Text: Two years ago today, I started at LinkedIn. My son was four days old, having arrived much earlier than anticipated. I left him with my wife to come in for orientation, and I will admit to being more than a little nervous. I was starting a new job in a new industry with colleagues I mostly didn't know well. 732 days later, I have discovered the most creatively and intellectually satisfying chapter of my career. It's an honor to work among entrepreneurial, visionary journalists deeply committed to bringing members the news and views that will drive their professional lives forward. And yes, I am still counting my time here in days because it still feels as though I've just arrived; as much as we've created in these past two years, the most interesting challenges are just ahead of us.

Name: Christopher M. Schroeder
Text: Personal news: Sufficient to say the global pandemic and economic crisis have made me rethink things every day, trying to use this unprecedented moment to get my footing on what I truly believe. I’ve been asked to be the Executive Chairman of The Commons Project Foundation and I’ve decided to accept because I just can’t sit by the sidelines and wait for someone else to provide the solutions any more. The global shutdown is impacting all of us. Read today’s report on Financial Times on how our digital tool #CommonPass is accelerating safe border reopening while protecting individuals’ data. I couldn’t be prouder to be work with this group of high calibre, high integrity, talented, and inspiring individuals on this vital mission. Please join us, support us, because this matters to all of us, and it takes a village. #DigitalPublicGood #DataProtection #NewDigitalEconomy

Name: Christopher M. Schroeder
Text: In my latest for the Washington Post, I argue that Trump’s utter disdain for and disinterest in the pandemic, and his whistling-past-the-literal-graveyard approach to his own safety and the safety of our top government leaders, represents a fresh and unexpected assault on American democracy. It is the latest lesson that our system of government rests, unsteadily, on the belief that leaders will place the interests of the country above their own.To soothe his ego and avoid his insecurities, Trump has refused time and again to take the basic precautions recommended by public health professionals, dismissing masks and social distancing as the stuff of sissies. Ego and insecurity, though, explains only part of Trump’s problem. More fundamental is that from the earliest days of his presidency, his ahistoric and incurious view of the world has led him to misunderstand the very role of a president in a democracy.

Name: Christopher M. Schroeder
Text: I am honored and thrilled to welcome Andrea Wishom and John Hope Bryant to our Board of Directors here at Nextdoor. The challenge in this search was selecting from the broad group of incredibly talented and inspiring people that I spoke to. Underscoring the importance of building a strong network, creating mutual trust, and making diverse perspectives a business imperative.  John Hope Bryant shares our passion for entrepreneurship and building community — the Founder and CEO and Chairman of Operation HOPE has spent his life focused on empowering people through financial literacy and housing — particularly those who are underserved. His work is rooted in the maxim that you can’t be what you can’t see. He reminds us that simple actions can spark big change in people’s lives, starting in your neighborhood.    andrea W., President of Skywalker Holdings and former EVP at Harpo Productions also serves on the Boards of Pinterest and Tory Burch. Storytelling that builds community is part of her DNA. That combined with her business acumen is what makes her a perfect fit for Nextdoor. As we grow and tell the story of communities around the world, John and Andrea will help us amplify the power of local.

Name: Christopher M. Schroeder
Text: I don’t do personal posts, but my father had a profound impact upon my career. Charles R. Erdmann died in his sleep on the evening of September 13, 2020 in Pittsford, New York. He had suffered from #alzheimersdisease for the past few years.My brother and I grew up in a home where #publicaffairs were followed closely and argued intensely. We were always surrounded by books and newspapers. Informed citizens make good citizens.My dad taught a commitment to #publicservice through actions, not words. After receiving his MBA and before starting his career in corporate America with Ford Motor Company, Cole National, and, finally, Xerox, he served as an officer in the US Army in West Germany. He never missed voting in any election. Any. He volunteered for more local causes than I can count. He served 8 years as an elected member of the Pittsford School Board.He sacrificed much of his own career to give me unlimited opportunities. He supported every step in my “nonlinear” career path.He closed our conversations, until he could not speak, by asking: “is there anything we can do to help you?”#GoPackGo #RIP #egoistheenemy

Name: Christopher M. Schroeder
Text: I am ELATED to announce the second guest speaker in my Philanthropy, Inclusivity, and Leadership class at the Stanford University Graduate School of Business this quarter. Darren Walker is the President of the Ford Foundation and renowned author of "From Generosity to Justice." I am endlessly inspired by his extraordinary leadership in the field of social and racial justice as well as his practice of inclusive philanthropy. What an immense honor  that he is sharing his genius and generosity with my students and me again this fall. We will be reading Darren’s recent New York Times piece, “If Black Lives Really Matter to the Rich, Philanthropy Isn’t Enough” (https://nyti.ms/3mZzSVQ) for class. I will share some key findings after class, and I hope that you follow along with our discussion and share your own perspectives on this critically important theme. #Giving2 #transformyourgiving

Name: Dave Kerpen
Text: I'm pretty sure the rule is you only freeze on an important Zoom calls when you are making an interesting expression. 😂 True?It's funny, but if it's happening a lot it's super frustrating!We are getting A LOT of requests for WIFI upgrades, especially in very large homes.So, I thought I'd share some info:You might consider installing more access points in your home if you are living in a large, multi-level home or home that has a lot of walls.Think of them as a cell tower. When you leave the proximity of one cell tower, you latch on to another one.We set up these access points under beds or in closets. You don't notice them but they talk to each other throughout the house and you stay connected wherever you are.This makes our clients very happy! 👏Do you have WIFI or Tech questions I can answer? Comment with your question below and I'll answer them!#smartpeoplesmarthomes

Name: Dave Kerpen
Text: Every single Tuesday, regardless of what I had on my plate, I left the office at 5:00pm for a date night with my wife. I was fiercely protective of this time with her and made sure that I took time out of my busy work schedule to maintain my personal life. So many people build their career at the detriment of their home life, but I knew that I didn’t want to be on my 6th startup and my 6th wife, so I made both a priority.

Name: Dave Kerpen
Text: In March, the world changed for everyone. For my daughter Kate, it was a pretty horrible month. 1st, her bat mitzvah was postponed on March 12, just 2 days before it was supposed to happen. Then my mom, her Grandma Rayni, passed away. Then my dad, her Grandpa Peter, was hospitalized with COVID. 7 months later, and Kate sure deserves a celebration. Carrie Kerpen always jokes that if I could have, I would have invited everyone I knew to our wedding. Well, one of the silver linings of the dumpster fire known as 2020 is I can now invite YOU ALL to Kate’s Bat Mitzvah - or, at least, her Bat MitZOOMVah. So, You’re cordially invited: Tomorrow, Sunday, October 18th, 9:30 AM ET, watch as my amazing, sensitive, beautiful, caring, intelligent daughter Kate becomes a Bat Mitzvah! http://CelebratingKate.com Oh, by the way, Kate has raised nearly $2,000 for NAMI through her Mitzvah Project! Thanks to the team at Remembering Live and to everyone at RSNS - Reconstructionist Synagogue of the North Shore, especially Eric Schulmiller, and to all of our amazing friends and family for being so supportive! Please join me in congratulating Kate!

Name: Heather Elias
Text: This is true in our market--but not all areas of the country. We have definitely seen a shift in home buyers' priorities when it comes to searching for the next home: location shifts away from more populated areas to homes with more outdoor space, and layout/amenities shifts to multipurpose space for home schooling or home office. How we live in our homes has been redefined by the increased amount of time we are spending in them.And yes, there aren't enough listings. Potential sellers are rightly nervous about not finding their new home. Thankfully in our area there are contractual protections that could give sellers time to find their 'home of choice.' But many don't want to take any risks right now.Yes, you can successfully buy or sell right now--but whether it makes sense is totally dependent on your situation and your local market conditions. A good agent will listen and give you an honest answer as to the options you have. #realestate #housingmarket #homesales #marketupdate #homebuyers #homeownership

Name: Heather Elias
Text: I'm beyond excited to announce today that I've joined the leadership team at Earnnest. Ellesse (Schneider) Smith and I were fortunate enough to buy our first home in 2019 and we couldn't believe how inefficient, outdated and insecure the transferring of funds process seemed. Sending off your life savings via wire transfer is costly, time-consuming, and dangerous.I joined Earnnest because I truly believe that the real estate industry's mass adoption of Earnnest's secure, efficient payments platform will make the buying and selling process better and safer for all parties involved.Let's get to work! #realestate #payments

Text: “Way too many people of color lost their homes during the last crisis,” Ms. McCargo said. Name: Heather Elias
Text: I'm hiring loan officers. The pitch is simple.Join Homebuyer - be a part of something big. ✌️It's 2020. Other financial verticals have gone digital. Winners have emerged. Fidelity won investments. TurboTax won tax prep. There's no clear winner in mortgage, though, because mortgage hasn't gone all digital yet. The opportunity to win is out there. Today's mortgage experience underperforms. It's tough on home buyers, loan officers, processors, and everyone else. There is a better way to do mortgages. Homebuyer is leading the change. You'll be proud to hang your license here, and I have the bona fides as a loan officer, software engineer, and company founder to lead you to everything we promise.I know that every great loan officer has a full pipeline today. It's hard to sell a switch when the going's this good. But, the best MLOs play the long game.Homebuyer is backed by Novus Home Mortgage. We lend in 46 states. We sell & service our own loans. Our benefits rock. And, pricing? :chef's kiss:But that's just table stakes.You should earn more money per loan. You should spend less time per closing. You should have a life outside your work. You should feel in control - every day.Message me confidentially about this opportunity. Let's set up a call. 🚀

Name: Heather Elias
Text: We grew almost 30% this quarter.In the middle of COVID.Saying “I am proud of my team” doesn’t even do it justice.Now, I will be the first one to tell you that we were very lucky just to have this opportunity.That is not lost on me. At all.As I reflected back on this crazy quarter,I ended up looking back through some notes.And I found the exact message I communicated to my team back in early March.Figured I would share. For better or for worse...Here it goes:“--It’s ok to be scared and feel pressure now. Everyone is feeling this in some way or another. Everyone.--We will be tested in all directions: marketing, sales, CS, personal, family...--No one has seen anything like this before. --But...--We were built for this. And not because we were largely a remote business already. But because we are used to dealing with uncertainty and incomplete information. Our values, who we are, our makeup, makes us ready.--It’s time to trust our judgment and each other.--We will need to help each other, and I, for one, will need help.”That’s it.My team did the rest.So yes, I am damn proud of them and what we did here.We have talked openly that we will likely not remember what we did in say, Q3 of 2018,But we will remember this one.

Name: Heather Elias
Text: My family and I are embarking on a new adventure and returning to New Zealand for a year.Professionally, I’ll still be the same Mike. I’ll continue my research, writing, reports, webinars, presentations, start-up advising, and consulting. And I’ll continue to remotely teach my real estate tech course at the University of Colorado Boulder.I’ll remain plugged into the U.S. and global real estate markets, and I’m excited for the opportunity to reinvigorate and expand my work from a new environment. Residing in a different time zone will give me the opportunity to engage with a new community of real estate leaders in New Zealand, Australia, and Southeast Asia, and look at different markets (like the U.S.) from a new perspective.Given the big move, I’m open to new opportunities to engage with the local community. Drop me a line if you’d like to connect!

Name: Heather Elias
Text: As we close out the quarter, I am reflecting on the last few months. Five weeks after I joined Home Point Financial, COVID hit. There is nothing like a crisis to demonstrate the character of your company or your leadership team. Today, I am very proud to be a part of the Home Point family and grateful to Willie Newman, Phil Shoemaker, Maria F., Phillip Miller, and Brian R. Ludtke for their exceptional leadership.When COVID struck, we didn't lay people off; we leaned in - launching an Associate fund and several other "We Care" programs to support Associates and their loved ones who may be experiencing hardship or disruption. When George Floyd was killed, our CEO, Willie Newman, didn't focus on what we should say externally; he focused on what we should do.When you join a new company, you always hope that you join something meaningful. I believe we are building something extraordinary.Be a part of something extraordinary and join our family. We have over 150 open roles and are looking to hire 600 positions by year-end. https://lnkd.in/gCZA6Rz #wecare #leadership #mortgage

Name: Heather Elias
Text: Sharing to my real estate peeps! Sounds like a great role!

Name: Heather Elias
Text: We are so grateful to RealScout for their partnership and for featuring our company in their latest blog! #realestate #blog https://lnkd.in/e2mTjZj

Name: Heather Elias
Text: Starbucks reversed their employees wearing BLM.Amazon supports BLM on their website.Cosmetic companies are listing stats of the race of their employees. Where is the line between opportunistic marketing and support? For me, as a Marketing Director, if you're providing a safe pace, offering equal opportunity in the workplace for current employees and new candidates, and using your influence to give a voice to those that should have a louder one you're doing it right.What do you think? We need to do this right.#blacklivesmatter #marketing

Name: Heather Elias
Text: Success in the real estate industry can take many forms. To me, I have the most respect for companies that keep their people at the heart of what they do. I loved having the chance to interview the leadership at Leading Edge Real Estate on behalf of RealScout about how their culture has helped them survive and thrive this year. What Christine Carlo George and the team have built there is just amazing. Please take a moment to read. #realestate #brokerage #culture #community #technology #realestateindustry #leadership #people

Text: I've had the opportunity to get an inside look at how many real estate brokerages are managing through COVID-related challenges. Leading Edge Real Estate is a MA brokerage worth studying. Here's a profile piece we published this morning, written by Heather Elias, which showcases how these uncertain times have brought agents closer together and motivated them to deliver more to clients. Solid leadership by Linda O'Koniewski, Christine Carlo George.
