Name: Ray Dalio
Text: Natural selection’s trial-and-error process allows improvement without anyone understanding or guiding it. The same can apply to how we learn. There are at least three kinds of learning that foster evolution: memory-based learning (storing the information that comes in through one’s conscious mind so that we can recall it later); subconscious learning (the knowledge we take away from our experiences that never enters our conscious minds, though it affects our decision making); and “learning” that occurs without thinking at all, such as the changes in DNA that encode a species’ adaptations. I used to think that memory-based, conscious learning was the most powerful, but I’ve since come to understand that it produces less rapid progress than experimentation and adaptation. #principleoftheday

Name: Ray Dalio
Text: Doing that sustains their evolution. In the case of Bridgewater, we do that by having an idea meritocracy that strives for meaningful work and meaningful relationships through radical truth and radical transparency. By meaningful work, I mean work that people are excited to get their heads into, and by meaningful relationships I mean those in which there is genuine caring for each other (like an extended family). I find that these reinforce each other and that being radically truthful and radically transparent with each other makes both the work and the relationship go better. #principleoftheday

Name: Ray Dalio
Text: The most meaningful relationships are achieved when you and others can speak openly to each other about everything that's important, learn together, and understand the need to hold each other accountable to be as excellent as you can be. When you have such relationships with those you work with, you pull each other through challenging times; at the same time, sharing challenging work draws you closer and strengthens your relationships. This self-reinforcing cycle creates the success that allows you to pursue more and more ambitious goals. #principleoftheday

Name: Ray Dalio
Text: Understanding what is true is essential for success, and being radically transparent about everything, including mistakes and weaknesses, helps create the understanding that leads to improvements. That’s not just a theory; we have put this into practice at Bridgewater for over forty years, so we know how it works. But like most things in life, being radically truthful and transparent has cons as well as pros, which I will describe as accurately as possible.Being radically truthful and transparent with your colleagues and expecting your colleagues to be the same with you ensures that important issues are apparent instead of hidden. It also enforces good behavior and good thinking, because when you have to explain yourself, everyone can openly assess the merits of your logic. If you are handling things well, radical transparency will make that clear, and if you are handling things badly, radical transparency will make that clear as well, so it helps to maintain high standards.Radical truth and radical transparency are fundamental to having a real idea meritocracy. The more people can see what is happening—the good, the bad, and the ugly—the more eﬀective they are at deciding the appropriate ways of handling things. #principleoftheday

Name: Ray Dalio
Text: Doing that sustains their evolution. In the case of Bridgewater, we do that by having an idea meritocracy that strives for meaningful work and meaningful relationships through radical truth and radical transparency. By meaningful work, I mean work that people are excited to get their heads into, and by meaningful relationships I mean those in which there is genuine caring for each other (like an extended family). I find that these reinforce each other and that being radically truthful and radically transparent with each other makes both the work and the relationship go better. #principleoftheday

Name: Ray Dalio
Text: Companies that get progressively better over time have both. Nothing is more important or more difficult than to get the culture and the people right. To see this principle in action, check out this week's Case of the Week in the free iOS app, which will be released on Android and in the UK, India, Spain, and Germany this month, with other countries to follow: https://lnkd.in/gpyJu25#principleoftheday

Name: Ray Dalio
Text: Having a hierarchy of merit is not only consistent with an idea meritocracy but essential for it. It’s simply not possible for everyone to debate everything all the time and still get their work done. Treating all people equally is more likely to lead away from truth than toward it. But at the same time, all views should be considered in an open-minded way, though placed in the proper context of the experiences and track records of the people expressing them. Imagine if a group of us were getting a lesson in how to play baseball from Babe Ruth, and someone who’d never played the game kept interrupting him to debate how to swing the bat. Would it be helpful or harmful to the group’s progress to ignore their diﬀerent track records and experience? Of course it would be harmful and plain silly to treat their points of view equally, because they have diﬀerent levels of believability. The most productive approach would be to allow Ruth to give his instructions uninterrupted and then take some time afterward to answer questions. #principleoftheday

Name: Ray Dalio
Text: Be audacious. There is always a best possible path. Your job is to ﬁnd it and have the courage to follow it. What you think is attainable is just a function of what you know at the moment. Once you start your pursuit you will learn a lot, especially if you triangulate with others; paths you never saw before will emerge.  Of course there are some impossibilities or near-impossibilities, such as playing center on a professional basketball team if you’re short, or running a four-minute mile at age seventy.#principleoftheday

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: COVID has created an urgent fiscal crisis for cities.Bloomberg Philanthropies and What Works Cities' new City Budgeting for Equity and Recovery program will provide support to local leaders driving pandemic recovery for all residents– while saving money and jobs, too.https://lnkd.in/eiMhwRq

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Media companies have to adapt to changing appetites—and  Bloomberg News is no different. We’re excited to see Bloomberg QuickTake expand and take on streaming services.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: We’re glad to be work with Ford Foundation and other partners on America’s Cultural Treasures, an initiative to help ensure that vitally important arts organizations of color can withstand the pandemic – and thrive in the future.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Cities are where the fight against climate change will be won or lost. And many mayors around the world are doing an incredible job fighting climate change—but they can’t do it alone.  It takes a global effort—one that the Gap Fund can help supercharge. https://bit.ly/303RZ2R

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: 11 million people die a year around the world because of poor diets—but few governments are doing anything about it.  So Bloomberg Philanthropies is stepping up to invest again to help make diets healthier around the world.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Jakarta is home to 10 million people. And each one of them deserves to breathe clean air. That’s why Bloomberg Philanthropies is partnering with the Indonesian capital to tackle the city’s air pollution and create a healthier and more prosperous future for its citizens. jakarta.cleanair.id

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Tobacco kills 8M people a year - and its effects are even more deadly during a respiratory pandemic. I’m glad to join the #WCTOH summit this spring alongside our partners to fight back against tobacco companies & confront the burden of tobacco-related diseases.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: We have an opportunity to craft a recovery that strengthens public health, rebuilds economies so they are more equitable, and fights climate change.But to accomplish one, we need to take on all three. That’s what the United Nations’ #RaceToZero campaign is all about.#climatechange #climateaction #americaspledge #environment

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: We don’t have to choose between fighting climate change and growing local economies. We can do both.That’s why I’m excited to speak at UN's #RacetoZero campaign. Please join us. https://bit.ly/32RcUrP

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: When I said our Beyond Coal program would help transition us to a clean energy economy, there were doubters. When Trump became president, they said it was impossible. Well—today we’re announcing the program has successfully retired 60% of U.S. coal plants. And we’re not done. We’re on track to close 100% by 2030.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Coal pollution poisons us and our planet —that’s why Beyond Coal has retired 318 coal plants in America since 2010. For our health. For our environment. For our future. https://lnkd.in/dc7wUWj

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: The Trump administration may have pulled us out of the Paris Climate Agreement—but make no mistake—countless cities, states, and businesses are still in.We have actually accelerated our progress on climate over the last four years.And we’re not done yet. #AmericasPledge

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Despite the pandemic & four years of climate denialism from the White House—states, cities, and businesses have kept the U.S. on a path of climate progress. As our report says, if we stay on track – and vote for candidates who respect science - we can meet #AmericasPledge.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: September 11th tested us as Americans. But it also brought us together. On Friday, I hope you’ll tune in to “9/11 Remembered: The Day We Came Together,” ABC's special, filmed at the opening of The National September 11 Memorial & Museum, airing at 8/7 pm CT.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: When countries phase out coal-fired power plants, they reap the health and economic benefits of clean energy – and help accelerate the global fight against climate change. We’ve made great strides through Beyond Coal campaigns in the U.S. and Europe, and I want to thank our Korea Beyond Coal partners for expanding this movement to Asia. Together, we can speed up our progress cleaning the air we breathe – and achieve a greener, healthier, and more prosperous future. http://beyondcoal.kr/en/

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: During my campaign for president, I proposed a set of bold policies focused on increasing generational wealth among Black families called the #GreenwoodInitiative. Bloomberg Philanthropies' $100M gift today is the first step we'll take to bring that work to life.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: COVID has underscored the urgent need for more Black doctors.That’s why Bloomberg Philanthropies is helping America’s four historically Black medical schools ease the debt burden of their students. Student debt should not stand in the way of their careers.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: This crisis can be a turning point that leads to a stronger, more sustainable, and more equitable global economy and a brighter, healthier future. It’s an unprecedented opportunity —and we must seize it. https://bit.ly/2QOieFK

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: The more we work together, the stronger we’ll emerge from the pandemic—that’s what the Bloomberg New Economy Forum is all about. By bringing together leaders from both the public and private sectors, we can help those vulnerable, and help the world move forward.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Mayors are dealing with multiple crises at once. But unlike other elected officials, they don’t have the luxury of playing politics during a pandemic.The Bloomberg Harvard City Leadership Initiative helps mayors deal with this moment by offering training that can achieve real results.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: The Glade at the The National September 11 Memorial & Museum honors the sacrifice of all who became ill or died from causes related to the aftermath of the 9/11 attacks. On this episode of our podcast Follow the Data, President & CEO of the Memorial Alice Greenwald shares the Glade's significance. Listen here: https://lnkd.in/dCZPgH6 #podcast #september11th #newyorkcity

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Public art is essential to the vibrancy of our cities.Take a look at how Newark, NJ Mayor Ras Baraka is empowering leaders to use public art not only to drive conversation—but change. #publicart #art #newark #newjersey#mayors

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Our goal shouldn’t be to bring back the pre-pandemic economy. It should be – as Joe Biden says – to build it back better. #DemConvention

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: I’ve supported Democrats, Republicans, and independents. Hell, I’ve actually been a Democrat, Republican, and independent.To me, elections are about people. And the two people running for president couldn't be more different. #DemConvention

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: The Medford Public Library played such a big role in my family when my sister and I were growing up. It means a lot to us to have our parents’ names attached to that institution—and to provide a place in our hometown for people of all ages and backgrounds to learn. https://bit.ly/2E1MxFS

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: The country needs stable, mature, responsible leadership to pull us out of this ongoing disaster—and Kamala Harris will help Joe Biden deliver it.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: 100,000 oil and gas workers have been laid off this year.We could fight climate change & create jobs by employing these Americans to clean up abandoned gas wells that are leaking methane.Joe Biden and Nancy Pelosi strongly support the idea - and Senate Republicans should too.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Experts at Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health have worked tirelessly for months to fight COVID.And now, their Blood Plasma Therapy is receiving funding from the United States Department of Defense for two nationwide clinical trials. https://bit.ly/3hOePly

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: The NYC COVID Response & Impact Fund, launched in collaboration with Ford Foundation, Carnegie Corporation of New York, and others, shows the value of partnerships in a crisis. And the strong support for the Fund shows how critical NYC’s nonprofits are to our city. https://lnkd.in/dj3MgNS

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: "Before #COVID arrived, the U.S. had only about 2,000 credentialed contact tracers ... In a national plan published on April 10, the Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health Center for Health Security called on health departments nationwide to hire an 'army' of 100,000 contact tracers."

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: This hasn’t been an easy summer for families and kids.  That’s why we’re glad to support the The Fresh Air Fund so that kids in New York City can play outdoors safely—and young New Yorkers can have a summer job.  This can still be a summer to remember.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: There are few people who have more experience serving our country in high-pressure situations than my good friend General Colin Powell. His advice to mayors in our Bloomberg Harvard City Leadership Initiative Leading Social and Economic Recovery Series:Put aside your ego and listen to experts.It’s good advice for any leader.https://lnkd.in/d2CqNj6

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Right now, when the world needs real truths and life-saving answers, the work of the Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health is more important than ever. For over 100 years – through the Spanish flu, polio, malaria, and now, COVID – The Bloomberg School of Public Health has given hope to humanity.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: President Trump's move to destroy the CDC's ability to gather, analyze, and report data is unconscionable. Make no mistake: people will die as a result of this decision.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: The urgency to fight climate change—and get results—has never been greater.We need a president who understands that - and Joe Biden does.His plan to invest in clean energy and green infrastructure will create jobs when we need them most, and provide cleaner air and water for the communities that need them most.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Mayors around the world are leading efforts to respond to the pandemic – not just to repair their cities, but to rebuild so that they are greener, healthier, & more equitable than ever.Thanks to the city leaders in C40 Cities for driving us forward. https://lnkd.in/db9iKnW

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: We need to reinvest our energy into online learning to ensure every child has the access to the education they deserve this fall & beyond.My sister, Marjorie Tiven, founder & president of Global Cities, Inc.  shares some timely lessons on digital learning.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: In business, executive training is common. But it's not in local government.  The Bloomberg Harvard City Leadership Initiative is changing that.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Mayors are more important than ever.That’s why, for the fourth year, the Bloomberg Harvard City Leadership Initiative is helping 40 mayors make their cities stronger, better, & more equitable.With the right tools, mayors can drive recovery to keep cities, & America, going. https://lnkd.in/dZJScvp

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Everyone, everywhere deserves life saving treatment. We can do this – but we'll need to work together. Thanks to the European Commission, Global Citizen, and Ursula von der Leyen for bringing us all together today. #GlobalGoalUnite

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: I keep getting asked if I'm hosting the #GlobalGoalUnite Concert, and I tell people, no, it's The Rock. ...We get mixed up a lot. I’m glad to support such an important cause and I hope you’ll join us tonight 6/27 at 8 pm ET. http://glblctzn.me/Unite

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: On Saturday, entertainers, business & government leaders will come together in support of the #GlobalGoalUnite Concert to ensure no one is left behind in this pandemic.We’re proud to support the #GlobalGoalUnite Summit & Concert  – & hope you’ll join us. https://lnkd.in/gmxVVd5

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Cities are adapting to the pandemic, and transportation is a vital part of that response. Bloomberg Philanthropies and NACTO (National Association of City Transportation Officials) are awarding 10 cities grants to make city streets safer & more equitable. This is a chance to move forward.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: COVID is quickly accelerating in Latin America & Africa, but local leaders can slow the spread with the right tools. To help, Bloomberg Philanthropies is providing mayors with science-based guidance to navigate their way through the pandemic. #cities4health

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Testing & treatment should be available to everyone, everywhere.I’m glad to support the European Commission and Global Citizen’s campaign to build a healthier and more equitable world.On 6/27, the #GlobalGoalUnite Summit & Concert will help get us closer to our goal. http://glblctzn.me/Unite

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: No two cities are the same, but many share similar challenges. The new Bloomberg CityLab breaks down city by city, issue by issue, the new realities we're all facing.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Trump won’t say this in Tulsa. But it’s true. And we need to talk about it - and address it. https://bloom.bg/2UWT2Pt

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: We cannot wish equality into existence.We cannot pretend that time will heal old wounds.Healing begins with justice, and justice requires admitting wrongs.So on Juneteenth, let’s talk about what happened in Greenwood and take action.Change cannot wait.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Racial justice. COVID. Rebuilding the economy.Mayors are on the frontlines of America's most important fights. I'm glad I could address city leaders with my friend Darren Walker of the Ford Foundation in the first meeting of the Leading Social and Economic Recovery Series.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: In a public health crisis, data is vital.  Today, Bloomberg Philanthropies is releasing the COVID Management Metrics for Cities to provide data tools for #localgov to better manage pandemic response and help vulnerable residents.  It will assist cities to focus their resources—and help save lives.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Much of the world has seen its peak in COVID cases, but in Africa, countries are just starting to see an increase.  To help, Bloomberg Philanthropies is helping 31 African countries strengthen lab testing & provide training for nearly 6,000 healthcare workers. https://lnkd.in/dhQxsb2

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Graduating seniors are facing a lot of challenges and unknowns.That’s why Bloomberg Philanthropies is supporting College Bridge—a partnership with The City University of New Yorkto provide every graduating NYC public high school senior with help transitioning to college in the fall.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: In a victory for equality everywhere, the Supreme Court ruled it’s illegal for employers to discriminate based on sexual orientation. Equality is good for business and for humanity – and it’s something we at Bloomberg LP have prioritized for years.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Today is National Gun Violence Awareness Day.  I #WearOrange for the millions of moms, students, survivors and volunteers work to end gun violence. We’ve made so much progress already—but we’re just getting started.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Running a small business is always tough—but perhaps never tougher than right now. But small businesses are still the backbone of the economy. I'm proud that Bloomberg LP is partnering with Goldman Sachs to help businesses as they adapt, survive, and soon, start growing again.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: As reopening begins, cities will need the best data available and we’re work to help them get it.   We’ll to rely on experts and institutions like Harvard University and its president Lawrence S. Bacow. I’m grateful he could join this week’s weekly Bloomberg Philanthropies COVID Local Response Initiative call.  https://lnkd.in/dH9uwYR

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Global challenges require global cooperation. Bloomberg Philanthropies is collaborating with the EU Commission and Global Citizen for Global Goal: Unite for Our Future—to help find a vaccine & ensure everyone, everywhere has access to testing & treatment for #COVID. https://glblctzn.me/Unite #GlobalGoalUnite

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: The key to getting through this crisis is listening to experts like Dr. Anthony Fauci & making decisions based on science.We're glad to have Dr. Fauci join more than 100 mayors for our weekly Bloomberg Philanthropies #COVID Local Response Initiative call.Science and safety should lead our way back.Learn more: https://lnkd.in/eTVNuMn

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: During this crisis, we can’t allow hysteria to overtake reliable information. And while we’re all wondering what happens next — we know to rely on experts and data for clarity.Here are five questions we’re all asking that Bloomberg Philanthropies' Dr. Kelly Henning, MD can answer.#COVID

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Convalescent plasma therapy is a promising treatment for COVID. Dr. Arturo Casadevall and Dr. Jessica Leighton explain why researchers at The Johns Hopkins University believe blood plasma - which has been used to treat outbreaks in the past - could work again. https://lnkd.in/ejDX5n7

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: It was great to have Vice President Joe Biden join our weekly call with more than 350 mayors yesterday as part of Bloomberg Philanthropies' COVID Local Response Initiative. https://lnkd.in/eEdY_GtHe shared words of encouragement and support and knows leadership grounded in facts and science saves lives.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Mayors have been on the frontlines of this crisis. On a weekly call with more than 350 mayors organized by Bloomberg Philanthropies, Vice President Joe Biden spoke about how important local leadership is - and the strong support they deserve from the federal government. https://lnkd.in/eeHKNHX

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: The partnership between Chef José Andrés' World Central Kitchen and Bloomberg Philanthropies started with one goal: to thank New York Health & Hospitals front line workers.We’ve served 500,000 meals to front line workers since April 15. Thanks for all you’re doing to keep NYC safe:

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: To reopen safely, New York State and Governor Andrew Cuomo need thousands of contact tracers.  With Bloomberg Philanthropies' support, Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health has developed a free online curriculum to train this army of tracers.  This course is the next step on the road to reopening. https://lnkd.in/etVdD8s

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: To begin re-starting economy, we need to ensure workers and businesses have more protections. Here’s how Congress can help provide them:

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Cities and mayors need to protect their most vulnerable populations – including the hungry. That’s where Chef José Andrés and World Central Kitchen come in. Thank you, Chef, for joining yesterday’s Bloomberg Philanthropies COVID Local Response Initiative virtual convening of mayors. https://lnkd.in/eTEjBzU

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: New York State is now hiring contact tracers, team supervisors, and community support specialists.  To be part of the team that will track the virus and help save lives, please apply here: https://lnkd.in/eDgVueq

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: COVID can be a turning point that propels us forward – including in the fight against climate change.At Bloomberg LP, we’re committed to doing our part to build a stronger economy and healthier planet. Learn more in our #BloombergImpact Report: https://lnkd.in/eQsjS64

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: While a highly contagious and deadly lung disease is raging, the Trump Administration has found ways to make air pollution worse. We must demand our elected leaders put people, not polluters, first.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: One of the most important steps to take to re-open the economy as safely as possible is to create a system of contact tracing. When social distancing is relaxed, contact tracing is our best hope for isolating the virus when it appears – and keeping it isolated.Governor Andrew Cuomo recognized that, and since Bloomberg Philanthropies has deep experience and expertise in public health, we are glad to support the state in developing and implementing a contact tracing program. And we will share what we learned publicly, so cities and states around the country can build on our efforts, and so can nations around the world.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: To safely reopen New York, we need to find and isolate the virus.Andrew Cuomo and Bloomberg Philanthropies are building a contact tracing program that will hire an army of tracers to get us back on our feet. Working together, New Yorkers will get through this.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Data about COVID testing will determine the path forward to recovery. That’s why The Johns Hopkins University is partnering with Bloomberg Philanthropies to launch the COVID Testing Insights Initiative.It will be a resource for everyone on the road to recovery. https://lnkd.in/e9JKjkx

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: In times of crisis like this, Americans need steady leadership more than ever. That’s why we’re lucky to have Speaker Nancy Pelosi. Thank you, Speaker Nancy Pelosi, for being part of the Bloomberg Philanthropies #COVID Local Response virtual convening of mayors. https://lnkd.in/eakzHiV

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: For decades, the International Rescue Committee has come to the aid of millions of people displaced by conflict and crisis. Amid the pandemic, their work has taken on new urgency.  Bloomberg Philanthropies is committing $10 million to the IRC as they help save lives around the world. https://lnkd.in/ecn9bau

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: The Bloomberg Philanthropies initiative to work with New York State to develop a contact tracing program will be hard work.But I know, because we’re work with Governor Andrew Cuomo, Resolve to Save Lives, and the Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health, that we’ll succeed.Now is the time to rely on each other.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: New York is in need. But New Yorkers can rely on one another. And they can rely on Governor Andrew Cuomo.I'm glad to announce that Bloomberg Philanthropies is committing to partner with New York State to build a contact tracing program. #NewYorkTough

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: In the midst of the coronavirus pandemic, the best thing local leaders can do is to ask questions and learn from others.Thank you, Bill Gates, for sharing insights and advice with mayors during this week’s Bloomberg Philanthropies COVID Local Response Initiative’s virtual convening of local officials. https://lnkd.in/eeJgz7B

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: When New Yorkers come together, nothing can stop us. The NYC COVID Response & Impact Fund has raised over $95 million from 500 donors to help 276 nonprofits pay rent, make payroll, and continue their work.I’m proud Bloomberg Philanthropies can play a part. Join us: http://COVIDresponse.nyc

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Today we announced that the Bloomberg Terminal has enhanced its mapping tool to monitor the coronavirus outbreak, visualize insights, and help companies better track exposure to #COVID.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Health care workers are risking their lives to protect ours - and need our support now more than ever.That’s why Bloomberg Philanthropies is donating $6 million to World Central Kitchen for fresh meals for workers at 16 NYC Health System hospitals and care facilities. https://lnkd.in/eWrqVRc

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: In the past three weeks, the Bloomberg Philanthropies COVID Local Response Initiative’s virtual convening of mayors has heard from three presidents - President Bill Clinton, President George W. Bush, and today, President Barack Obama.They are examples of what good leadership - and now good citizenship - looks like.I want to thank them for lending their time, their advice, and their mutual desire to help Americans through this crisis. We are stronger when we work together. https://lnkd.in/eVaYGj4

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Mayors know how to get things done – and are acting as our front-line leaders & battalion commanders in the war against the coronavirus.In order to fight the pandemic, officials in state houses and the White House must listen carefully to our mayors.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: New York has become the largest state to enact a ban prohibiting the sale of all flavored e-cigarettes, and I applaud Governor Andrew Cuomo and other state leaders for standing up to the tobacco industry and protecting millions of children and families. The youth e-cigarette epidemic is still with us, and getting these dangerous products off the market is even more essential than ever.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: #COVID has disrupted transportation across the US - but we must keep emergency personnel & supply chains moving and transit workers protected. Today Bloomberg Philanthropies and NACTO (National Association of City Transportation Officials) launch a new effort to support transportation leaders responding to the crisis:

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: American cities are at the center of the fight against the coronavirus. That’s why Bloomberg Philanthropies is work with the United States Conference of Mayors to help cities navigate access to federal coronavirus aid.We’ll work to keep cities & citizens safe.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: The fight against the spread of the coronavirus is a global issue.That's why Bloomberg LP will be giving £1 million to the London Community Response Fund. By work together, we will defeat this global threat.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Mayors are on the frontlines of the COVID pandemic, taking extraordinary steps to lead their communities through the crisis.Bloomberg Philanthropies and National League of Cities are launching The COVID: Local Action Tracker to give local leaders insight into what’s work in cities across the country:

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: New York has a strong philanthropic spirit and network. From 9/11 to Hurricane Sandy and beyond, we have collectively weathered these storms together before. We know the value of these institutions in New York’s ecosystem and we know we must act fast to help these institutions provide the services that they do now and every day.That’s why we’re a part of the #COVIDResponseNYC fund, providing $75 million in grants and support to the city’s social services and cultural organizations.Learn more and apply here: https://lnkd.in/eFbfRyR

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: I've said I'll do whatever it takes to defeat Trump. That's why I'm supporting the group that matters most in this fight: the Democratic National Committee.If we're united, I have no doubt Democrats will win up and down the ballot and take back the White House in November.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Local social service and cultural organizations play an essential role in the daily lives of New Yorkers, providing food, health care, jobs, and so much more. The coronavirus’ economic impact is being sharply felt across our city.We’re proud Bloomberg Philanthropies will be part of a consortium of more than a dozen funders here to provide $75 million in rapid grants and support to New York’s critical social service organizations and cultural institutions.Apply here:

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: On the heels of launching our initiative to help mayors across the U.S. manage COVID, Bloomberg Philanthropies is committing $40 million to help prevent and slow the spread of the virus in vulnerable low- and middle-income countries. We’ll be work with Vital Strategies and the World Health Organization (WHO) on these global response efforts.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: Trump has spent the last four years attacking the Latino community. This November, he will hear their voices loud and clear. Glad to support Voto Latino. Together, we’ll make sure every Latino who is eligible to vote registers and gets to the polls.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: This is the moment mayors need to be their best. So we’re joining forces with Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health and Bloomberg Harvard City Leadership Initiative to guide mayors through the coronavirus outbreak. By taking action on the ground now, we might prevent or delay tens of thousands of infections.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: My favorite book growing up was “Johnny Tremain,” a story about a teenage messenger and spy for the Yankee rebels during the Revolution. I liked to think of myself as the hero patriot, sticking it to old George III.I developed a love and appreciation for history from an early age, and I’ve always emphasized the importance of learning and remembering the lessons of our past as we think about how to build a better future.

Name: Mike Bloomberg
Text: I’ve always valued the right to vote. As a kid, I remember escorting senior citizens to the polls on election day. Twice, I had the honor of giving my arm to our town’s most revered resident - Amelia Earhart’s mother.She hadn’t been able to vote for most of her life. But I helped enable her.The right to vote is one of the most fundamental rights in American democracy - and must be protected. As president, I’ll ensure the security and integrity of our elections.

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: I enjoyed speaking with Adam Bryant and David Reimer about #leadership, #people development, and board effectiveness.

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: Terrific to see two talented scientists recognized for one of the most important editing tools we have today.  Congratulations Jennifer Doudna and Emmanuelle Charpentier!

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: 2020 Physics Nobel- Penrose, Genzer and Ghez- for Black holes!  And the first woman (so far) in 2020- and she is at @UCLA!

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: Today’s announcement of the 2020 Nobel for Medicine or Physiology celebrates Houghton, Rice and Alter for their discovery of Hepatitis C, findings that allowed for development of therapy for millions across the world.

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: “Public confidence in vaccination is fragile”.  As the USA hits a sad benchmark of 200,000 deaths from COVID, all of us must support efforts to use of scientific principles in the approval process so we can all trust in the safety and efficacy of COVID vaccines.  #covid #publichealth

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: We are in uncharted territory with COVID. It’s a strange moment, but also a deeply human moment. And, for those of us in the biopharmaceuticals industry, a carpe diem moment. We are being asked to help because science is what we do best. And the scientific community sprang into action—a unified force against disease. I am reminded why I work in healthcare. #globalhealth

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: Coronavirus testing is starting to get better — but it has a long way to go The Roche test is great news, but it does not solve our problems here.

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: Some thoughts on COVID as this week ends with multiple event cancellations and UW no longer holding classes in person.

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: Beyond humbled and excited to return home tomorrow to Vulcan Inc. as VP communications and marketing, inspired more than ever by Vulcan’s mission to make and leave the world a better place. Although bittersweet to say goodbye to Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation last week, I am thrilled to work again with chair Jody Allen, CEO Bill Hilf, and a very talented team across communications, brand + design, marketing, and social / digital, some of whom I’ve known for 20 years.

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: On my first day as CEO at the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, I'm reflecting on the huge responsibility that comes with this job. Knowing that we at the foundation can't achieve our ambitious goals alone, I am deeply committed to building our community of partners and to ensuring that our culture at the foundation enables the impact we aspire to have. Building a community is easy to say, but I know that it will take a lot of work. So I've set myself a goal to take the extra time to connect with colleagues and partners, to listen to their experiences and ask them, and myself, the tough questions. I am especially excited to spend my first week as CEO in South Africa, where I was raised and where exposure to apartheid first instilled in me a desire to use the advantages afforded to me to help tackle injustice and inequality. I can't think of a better place to start this next chapter in my career (and I'm pretty happy that it gives me a chance to see my parents as well).

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: Last week, Mayors from all over the country came to Washington, DC for an annual conference hosted by the United States Conference of Mayors to discuss solutions to some of our country’s most pressing challenges like strengthening our nation’s infrastructure, and developing benchmarks for creating a cleaner environment.  During the conference, The Interstate Natural Gas Association of America  was honored to support a reception hosted by the African American Mayors Association where we talked with mayors and federal policymakers about what we can do together to spur economic development and make our environment cleaner. #AAMA #USCM #INGAA #natgas #cleanenvironment #economy #uscm #mayorsDC20

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann was exactly the right leader for the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation because she perfected the mix of head and heart. She's a brilliant scientist and, I say with much affection, a huge nerd. But she also has a special ability to keep the humanity of our work front and center at all times.For the past five years, we had a doctor with perfect bedside manner taking care of the foundation, and that was a very special thing.The foundation will forever bear Sue's imprint, and I will miss work alongside her warmth, her gregariousness, and her compassion.Thank you, Sue, for everything.

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann was exactly the right leader for the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation because she perfected the mix of head and heart. She's a brilliant scientist and, I say with much affection, a huge nerd. But she also has a special ability to keep the humanity of our work front and center at all times.For the past five years, we had a doctor with perfect bedside manner taking care of the foundation, and that was a very special thing.The foundation will forever bear Sue's imprint, and I will miss work alongside her warmth, her gregariousness, and her compassion.Thank you, Sue, for everything.

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: January is National Mentoring Month. I’ve been lucky enough to have a number of amazing mentors in my life — from Mr. Swanson and Mr. Long, who saw my potential in high school, to Dr. Meg McNamara, who leads the pediatric residency program at the University of California San Francisco, to Melinda Gates and Bill Gates, who have been mentors to me as Mark and I launched our philanthropy the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative.From all my mentors, I’ve learned that mentorship is a two-way street — both people need to be learning and caring for each other. For anyone who is looking for a mentor: Make sure you are pulling your weight in sharing your learnings from your life journey. We all have so much we can give and learn from each other!#mentoring #mentorship #mentors

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: January is National Mentoring Month. I’ve been lucky enough to have a number of amazing mentors in my life — from Mr. Swanson and Mr. Long, who saw my potential in high school, to Dr. Meg McNamara, who leads the pediatric residency program at the University of California San Francisco, to Melinda Gates and Bill Gates, who have been mentors to me as Mark and I launched our philanthropy the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative.From all my mentors, I’ve learned that mentorship is a two-way street — both people need to be learning and caring for each other. We all have so much we can give and learn from each other!#mentoring #mentorship #mentors

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: Sue Desmond-Hellmann shared a letter of encouragement and support as I take on the role of CEO Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation on Feb 1. Here's my reply.

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: In the vein of U.S. presidents leaving a letter of support to their successor, this is my attempt at starting that tradition here at the foundation. I shared this with Mark earlier and he thought it would be nice to share publicly.

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: Great advice from the incoming CEO of Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation. I’m rooting hard for you, Mark Suzman! #ListenWithRespect

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: These global health heroes have helped Bangladesh become a model for other countries for how to respond to infectious disease outbreaks: https://lnkd.in/euywdNS

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: This is a special week @gatesfoundation for a few reasons, but one is that it's the first of 2 weeks of annual Strategy Review meetings. These meetings are our seminal governance moment because they represent the one time of year when our leadership team evaluates our full portfolio. Looking across our programs – ranging in topics from malaria to agriculture, US economic mobility to vaccine delivery, and education to financial services - we ask whether we're using our resources in the best possible way to achieve the impact we all want.  We're work to put the foundation's resources—our dollars and people—to their highest and best use. By making more informed, transparent decisions about our work and the resources we've committed, we can deliver even higher impact. Despite the stacked binders that arrive en masse and require hours of reading in preparation (see below!), I find this time of year to be quite stimulating, and I come out of every strategy review meeting with a better understanding of the problems we face and how we can play a catalytic, leveraged role to improve the lives of those we aim to serve. Hoping to be as excited about this at the end of the week as I am today at the start!

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: Today I embark on an amazing journey where we all are impatient optimists, executing the vision that all lives have equal value.#gatesfoundation #equalityforall #inclusionmakesusbetter

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: Today I embark on an amazing journey where we all are impatient optimists, executing the vision that all lives have equal value.#gatesfoundation #equalityforall #inclusionmakesusbetter

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: For twenty years, Gavi, the Vaccine Alliance has worked to ensure that every child in the world is protected from preventable diseases. The results are incredible. But their work is far from done. There are still too many children -- many living in some of the hardest-to-reach places on the planet -- who aren’t getting basic vaccines. Gavi is the best tool we have to reach them.  #VaccinesWork

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: I am so grateful for Millie Garcia and our value commission work in creating a true measure for #HigherEd success.

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: My advice to future leaders in #health is knowing that people are vulnerable and that you have a big responsibility. Thanks, STAT, for having me.

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: I spent a lot of time in the library, too, in college. Thanks for chatting with me, Michelle Cooper, back in the fall when the Washington Nationals weren't World Series champs yet.#highered #education

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: "Transformation" is a bold word, but it is what's needed if we want things like race and income to no longer be predictors of student outcomes in this country. #equity #highereducation #data #college

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: As I approach my next career change taking the role of CEO at the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation on Feb 1, I've been reflecting on what I've learned through various stages of my career. As a journalist I learned how to really listen, to not just hear but really understand those you're interacting with - this has been a critical skill in every job I've had since then. I'm so grateful for that time as a journalist, which started in 1989 as an intern at TIME Magazine in NYC (picture to prove it!). It's great to feel the same excitement to be taking on a new challenge as it did back then!

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: Building bridges! It's a great time to be in San Francisco.#JPM2020 #DailyGratitude

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: Curious how the clinical trials with #CRISPR as a cancer treatment turn out, but the “Also in 2020” stories at the bottom of the article deserve more attention... also.

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: Over the next decade, I’m optimistic we’ll increase women’s power and influence around the world. I’m excited for the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation’s work with all of our partners to accelerate progress in 2020 and beyond.

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: It's nice to see a positive opinion as a new decade begins. There is still a lot we could be doing to make the world better; but hope, drive, passion, and an optimistic outlook are so important for that fight. #happynewyear2020https://nyti.ms/2MBGkBL

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: It's nice to see a positive opinion as a new decade begins. There is still a lot we could be doing to make the world better; but hope, drive, passion, and an optimistic outlook are so important for that fight. #happynewyear2020https://nyti.ms/2MBGkBL

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: One of the greatest global health achievements in the last century.  20th century: 300m deaths.  21st century: 0 deaths.

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: When art meets science, good things happen. Congrats to Lynn Hershman Leeson, whose book “Anti-Bodies” is among the NYT’s “Best Art Books of 2019.” So proud NIBR researchers could collaborate on her research.

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: What would it mean for higher education's promise of social and economic mobility to be fully realized for all students? What would crafting a commitment equal to this promise mean for our communities, for higher education, and for society?I've been thinking deeply about these questions (as asking the right question can lead to surprising answers!) at the start of a new decade - hopeful that we can all do the work that is necessary to engage deep, meaningful, and pervasive institutional transformation. I'm looking forward to being a more active contributor this year on LinkedIn, and to share what I'm learning about what it would take to reduce the barriers to mobility. I'm eager to learn more about the good work that is being done, where we can begin to build on that work and more clearly define what student success means beyond graduation, and how higher education can live up to its potential as an engine of opportunity. Most of all - I'm eager to learn from you and from others on how we can meaningfully do this work together and address the adaptive challenges of institutional transformation.The Chronicle of Higher Education | The Barriers to Mobility:https://bit.ly/2F9Wj5I

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: As the decade and my final year as Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation CEO come to a close, I take this moment and season to reflect with great joy on the accomplishments of my committed colleagues and our dedicated partners and grantees. I can’t wait to see what's next...

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: Public health hero Dr. John Robbins epitomizes a life well lived in service of preventing disease with safe effective vaccines.#VaccinesSaveLives

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: December is a great time to take stock of everything you’ve done over the last twelve months—including all of the books you’ve read. I found these books to be really clever and engaging. I hope you them find as intriguing as I did: https://lnkd.in/egVhn33

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: I always enjoy chatting with Adam Grant – and this advice could not have come at a better time: “When it comes to real difficult #career-decisions, don’t worry about making the right decision. Try to make the decision right.” Right on!

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: I'm going to a-miss-a this one. Happiest of birthdays Amissa Cormier! Your strength has meant the world to me.

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: It has been such a privilege to work for and learn from Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann. In a sense, I've taken a 3-year course in leadership for free. Like so many, I will miss her.

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: It has been such a privilege to work for and learn from Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann. In a sense, I've taken a 3-year course in leadership for free. Like so many, I will miss her.

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: Sue is a humble, brave, brilliant, empathetic leader. She is an exemplar among CEOs and an incredible role model for everyone, especially women.Thank you, Sue. #gatesfoundation #leadership #genderequality

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: Sue is a humble, brave, brilliant, empathetic leader. She is an exemplar among CEOs and an incredible role model for everyone, especially women.Thank you, Sue. #gatesfoundation #leadership #genderequality

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: Quite simply, the smartest person I have ever known. We all knew, all of her colleagues 40 years ago at the University of Nevada Reno that Sue would change the world. She did. She is a "giant of medicine".A memory. Sue was the 4th year med student on my medical ward team at the Reno VA when I was an intern. A newly admitted complex patient was assigned to her. She produced a perfect H&P, roughly ten hand written pages, with references in lightening fast time. Her assessment and plan were brilliant and flawless. I recall showing it to the attending physician and we were both blown away.

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: It will be hard to see Sue leave.  She has been a passionate and fierce advocate for not only the foundation, but all of us who are part of the team!  Best of luck to a fantastic leader.   #leadership #sue #success

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: I want to thank Sue Desmond-Hellmann for five years of great leadership and congratulate Mark Suzman on his new role!

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: I want to thank Sue Desmond-Hellmann for five years of great leadership and congratulate Mark Suzman on his new role!

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: It’s with mixed emotions that I’ve decided to step down as CEO of Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation.The past five-plus years are easily among the most rewarding of my career and I'm delighted that my successor is foundation veteran Mark Suzman, who will assume the role February 1. It has been an immense privilege to help Bill Gates & Melinda Gates pursue their vision of a world where every person has the chance to lead a healthy and productive life, and, in the process, get to know their family better—especially Bill Sr. Thank you. Thank you. Thank you to our north star! The progress we've made here will undoubtedly continue under Mark, who has served in executive leadership here for 12 years. He has a deep knowledge of our programs and priorities; and approaches both with intellectual curiosity and great judgment. My colleagues here are doing an incredible job every day to improve and save lives around the world. They—and the partners we work with—have left a lasting mark on my life, and for that, I shall forever be grateful. Thank you, thank you, thank you to everyone who has helped me in this incredible experience. I’m looking forward to celebrating the holidays and New Year with family, but for now… it’s back to work.

Thank you, thank you, thank you to everyone who has helped me in this incredible experience. I’m looking forward to celebrating the holidays and New Year with family, but for now… it’s back to work.

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: It’s with mixed emotions that I’ve decided to step down as CEO of Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation.The past five-plus years are easily among the most rewarding of my career and I'm delighted that my successor is foundation veteran Mark Suzman, who will assume the role February 1. It has been an immense privilege to help Bill Gates & Melinda Gates pursue their vision of a world where every person has the chance to lead a healthy and productive life, and, in the process, get to know their family better—especially Bill Sr. Thank you. Thank you. Thank you to our north star! The progress we've made here will undoubtedly continue under Mark, who has served in executive leadership here for 12 years. He has a deep knowledge of our programs and priorities; and approaches both with intellectual curiosity and great judgment. My colleagues here are doing an incredible job every day to improve and save lives around the world. They—and the partners we work with—have left a lasting mark on my life, and for that, I shall forever be grateful. Thank you, thank you, thank you to everyone who has helped me in this incredible experience. I’m looking forward to celebrating the holidays and New Year with family, but for now… it’s back to work.

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: Thanks for shining some light on the Family First Community Center this #GivingTuesday, GeekWire and digging into your archives for this one..."I tell people there’s no bad generosity. It might be your church, it might be the local soup kitchen, it might be actually somebody you say a kind word to because you’re being generous and kind and can sense they might need a kind word."

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: The #Uganda for these kids isn’t the same as was mine 30 years ago. We now live in a world with #antiretrovirals where you can LIVE with #HIV! Yet #stigma and #discrimination around #AIDS still persist. Fortunately, we have youth-led groups like these dancers and UNYPA helping change that reality. And you can too!#worldaidsday

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: The #Uganda for these kids isn’t the same as was mine 30 years ago. We now live in a world with #antiretrovirals where you can LIVE with #HIV! Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: It's almost #GivingTuesday! So, I'm sharing #MyGivingStory, about a #charity I’m personally donating to this year. I hope it might inspire you to share your own giving story. This year I celebrate five proud years as CEO of Gates Foundation. We have a cool program here where employees get an incremental bonus every five years to donate to a single #charity. That includes me! So, I met Doug Baldwin Jr at Seattle Seahawks training camp in 2018. His charisma engaged my team and his curiosity surprised me. He asked great questions and one, in particular, was whether I'd support a community center he was building in Renton. I asked him to tell me more.This video pretty much sums up what we discussed.There are many other great charities that I will be giving to this season and throughout the year, but it’s The Family First Community Center in City of Renton where I’m donating my 5-year gift!I’ve been lucky in life, and I was raised to believe I should share good fortune with those lacking similar opportunities. Why is #philanthropy important to you? What’s a #nonprofit I should know about? What’s your #MyGivingStory? https://lnkd.in/guh3ivA

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: Congratulations to the Nigerian Government for making access to safe sanitation a top  priority! The governments committing to end open defecation by 2025. This is an important call for the sanitation industry leaders, development partners, civil society to support champions in Nigeria and the government efforts. #reinventedtoilet # #sanitation, #Nigeria009

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: “Managers tell people what to do. Leaders hopefully inspire them to do it.” #positivepsychology #increasedproductivity #workculture #leaders

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: “Managers tell people what to do. Leaders hopefully inspire them to do it.” #positivepsychology #increasedproductivity #workculture #leaders

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: Technology took center stage @ the  inaugural #STATSummit — is AI over hyped? “For the first time ever, we have the tools and technology to generate the massive data sets needed to use deep learning to unravel cell language and identify pathways that connect to disease.  AI is under hyped when you think about the data sets we have.” - Dr. Hal Barron, Chief Scientific Officer @ GSK

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: Technology took center stage @ the  inaugural #STATSummit — is AI over hyped? “For the first time ever, we have the tools and technology to generate the massive data sets needed to use deep learning to unravel cell language and identify pathways that connect to disease.  AI is under hyped when you think about the data sets we have.” - Dr. Hal Barron, Chief Scientific Officer @ GSK

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: Researchers at Concerto HealthAI have effectively developed an #AI model that can correctly identify 32% more cases of metastatic breast cancer compared to traditional diagnoses. Another one of their AI models were able to predict the survival of lung cancer patients three to twelve months from their last clinical visit. The use of health data is tangibly improving patient outcomes and innovative, forward-thinking companies like these are leading the way. What are the main challenges health tech startups will face in the future and how can they best address them?

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: What I’m thankful for this year:-My family—I am especially thankful for the health and wellness of my parents.-My friends—I am especially grateful to the ones who care enough to give real feedback-My job—I am privileged to do a job that I love (most of the time :)-My colleagues —I am lucky to work with the dedicated, committed people of CareMore Health & Aspire Healthcare—who are defined by going the extra mile every single day.  Especially grateful to my assistant, Mireille Sire, and to my direct team who often feel more like family than colleagues.-My adventures—I was lucky to take some personal and professional risks that weren’t expected or anticipated.  Not all of them worked out, but I am better for having tried.-My health—I started the year with an ankle injury that’s now mostly recovered.  Nothing makes you appreciate your health like losing it (even it a little).-My state—When I moved to California, I never anticipated liking it as much as I do.  Turns out sunshine is good for your health and well-being :).Wishing everyone a wonderful Thanksgiving spent with family and loved ones.

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: We were excited to be in Geneva today to meet with Dr. Tedros and senior leaders of the World Health Organization. The world needs a strong, effective, and fully funded WHO to ensure that it can deliver on the many mandates that its member states have assigned to it. #EndPolio #VaccinesWork #EndMalaria #HealthforAll

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: This morning, I took a call from Bill Gates. He shared an update on polio. He announced from Abu Dhabi that $2.6 billion has been pledged toward the $3.3 billion budget to end polio.He credited Rotary International for raising much of the money from national leaders around the world.He expressed appreciation to Larry Ellison and Mike Bloomberg for their donations.If I can be honest for a moment, it was pretty cool to have my second conversation with him. #endpolio #endpolionow

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: Congratulations to #mentor and friend, Dr. Bill Foege, for his 2019 Recognising Excellence Around Champions of Health (REACH) Lifetime Achievement Award! We've only successfully eradicated one disease in human history, #smallpox, and Bill's work is a big reason why. I still have your “10 Suggestions” hanging in my office.

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: I can listen to Henrietta Holsman Fore all day. She has a grace that easily draws you in. This was recorded back in July but especially since it’s UNICEF #WorldChildrensDay today, I still hope she gets her chocolate sundae. 🍨 #ForEveryChild

Name: Dr. Sue Desmond-Hellmann
Text: On the first episode of our new series, we dive into a disease that is carried by one of the world's tiniest (but deadliest) creatures.

Name: Jim Yong Kim
Text: Governor Charlie Baker of Massachusetts has been a visionary leader during this crisis.  Here’s an article from today describing the contact tracing project we’ve now established in Massachusetts.  These programs will have to be in place everywhere if we are to have any hope of restarting our economies.

Name: Jim Yong Kim
Text: Who are you grateful for?Hailed as the world’s number one CEO Coach my dear friend Mark C. Thompson specializes in work with leaders in high-profile roles who have broad reach and incredible impact. Mark is a four-time CEO who today focuses exclusively on coaching global C-level executives. He is a member of our #100Coaches initiative and a best-selling author. This series, C-Suite Master Class will focus on the C-Suite and topics important to leaders at high levels who want to impact the entire organization in the most positive ways.In this episode, Gratitude: The Key to True Success! we’ll discuss the concept and practice of gratitude and how it makes a huge difference in your happiness as a person and the sustainability of your efforts as a leader.Who are you grateful for? In what special ways have they contributed to and touched your life? Mark and I would love to hear your answers to these questions! Please leave a comment here on LinkedIn.Alan Mulally Jim Yong Kim Whitney Johnson Sanyin Siang Peter Bregman Alexander Osterwalder Michael Bungay Stanier Connie Dieken Tasha Eurich James Citrin Carol Kauffman PhD PCC Scott Osman Bonita Thompson Dorie Clark Rita McGrath Asheesh Advani Chester Elton Claire Diaz-Ortiz #CEOCoach #leadership #Gratitude #happiness

Name: Jim Yong Kim
Text: The Power of Honesty: Why Being Straightforward Matters.Why do leaders have such a hard time being honest?Pride can cause people to be less straightforward. Ego is a serious problem in a lot of organizations. Too often, senior leaders don’t acknowledge their problems. And when they do, they hide them. “How can I tell others that I have a problem with that? They won’t respect me. They will think I’m weak.” So often it is pride that discourages us from saying, “I don’t know.” When I am asked a difficult question about quality, and I don’t have an answer, it is incumbent on me to admit, “I don’t know.” I can imagine people thinking, “What the heck? You are supposed to be the quality expert.” And I am. But I am not omniscient. I am not a genius with all the answers.In my experience the most successful people are not afraid to say, “I don’t know.” They are not trapped by their pride.Rita McGrath Dr. Marshall Goldsmith Mark C. Thompson Alisa Cohn Michael Bungay Stanier Bill Carrier Whitney Johnson Price Pritchett, Ph.D. Mark Parsells Deepa Prahalad Abhyankar Matt Gajda Jodi Caldwell Richie Norton Jim Yong Kim#pride #respect #culture #leadership #honesty

Her talk, 'How to Make the Most Out of Not Having Enough', provides great insights into how we can survive - and even thrive - under scarcity by work together. Name: Jim Yong Kim
Text: No country that hopes to succeed in the economy of the future can afford to underinvest in health care. Yet half the world’s population – 3.5 billion people – don’t have access to essential health services, and 100 million people are pushed into extreme poverty every year because of health expenses. Universal Health Coverage is critical to meet our goals of ending extreme poverty and increasing shared prosperity. Good health is not only essential for the well-being of every person on earth, it’s fundamental to healthy and productive economies. On #UHCDay, we join the call for stronger, more equitable health systems that leave no one behind. The only way that we will actually bring healthcare to every person, everywhere in the world, is if we fundamentally change the system so that governments and people demand more investments in health. #HealthforAll

Name: Jim Yong Kim
Text: My conversation with La Nacion on Latin America, the G20, drivers of economic growth, and the importance of multilateralism.

Name: Jim Yong Kim
Text: As we mark the 100th anniversary of the end of World War I, we’ve learned that what affects one city, one country, or one region can have immediate and lasting impacts on us all.  Watch my conversation with France 24 and IMF Managing Director Christine Lagarde on the economic, demographic and technological trends shaping our international landscape today.  http://wrld.bg/MWZS30mzTPM

Name: Jim Yong Kim
Text: I joined Bill Gates and Vice Chairman Chen Zhou today at the “Reinvented Toilet Expo” in Beijing -- a 3-day event bringing together innovators, academics, and public- and private-sector leaders who want to accelerate new sanitation technologies in the developing world. I also announced a new partnership with the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation that will leverage over $1 billion in World Bank financing and unlock more sources of funding for sanitation. Our goal is to harness the power of disruptive technology to revolutionize sanitation, so that everyone has access to efficient, clean and sustainable sanitation, especially the poorest and most vulnerable. Learn more about the Urban Sanitation Innovation Partnership:  http://wrld.bg/wyV230mvHHD#sanitation #disruptivetechnologies #internationaldevelopment #finance #sustainability #urban

Name: Jim Yong Kim
Text: With 5 million woman and children dying each year from preventable causes, we urgently need more and better-targeted financing for health. Replenishing the Global Financing Facility on Nov. 6 will nearly double the countries it helps to more effectively invest in people.

Name: Jim Yong Kim
Text: The world can learn a lot from Guizhou - one of the poorest provinces of China - from the way they’ve embraced #bigdata to tailor subsidies for poverty alleviation, to how companies are using digital platforms to revolutionize things like truck delivery and elderly care services. In the last five years, #poverty fell in Guizhou from 26.8% of the population to 8%, lifting some 6.7 million people out of poverty - and it won’t stop there.I saw how "Taobao villages" empowered new online entrepreneurs, allowing their young families to come back home and take care of their relatives, while enabling farmers  to get a better price for their products.This paves the way for a new development path - I hope many will learn from Guizhou’s example.

Name: Jim Yong Kim
Text: I had the honor or speaking today at the High-Level International Symposium on Doing Business Reform in Beijing. Our just-released 2019 Doing Business report reveals 128 countries implemented 314 reforms to business regulations between June 2, 2017, and May 1, 2018 – a record year!  Host China was among them and rose 32 spots to rank 46th out of 190 economies. Our Doing Business and Human Capital Indexes have taught us that regardless how complex an area is, it can be measured—and that measuring and ranking economies promotes accountability, transparency and reform. While no one size fits all for business regulation reforms, countries that do well in our Doing Business Index share certain features: strong leadership, long-term vision, proactive action planning, systematic results tracking, communicating achievements, and extensive engagement with the private sector.  Given the accelerating pace of reform, countries are increasingly fostering an environment where entrepreneurs and small and medium enterprises can thrive -- which is essential to ending extreme poverty and boosting shared prosperity around the world. Take a look at our 2019 Doing Business results: http://wrld.bg/zQ9I30mtmqY

Name: Jim Yong Kim
Text: Proud to support the world's first sovereign blue bond,  issued by Seychelles to finance sustainable fisheries and protection of marine areas. As one of the world’s biodiversity hotspots, Seychelles is balancing the need to both develop economically and protect its natural endowment. Its blue bond, funded by three investors and backed by the World Bank and the Global Environmental Facility will support the sustainable use of marine resources and improve livelihoods. http://wrld.bg/BVoy30mmEq6

Name: Jim Yong Kim
Text: I’m speaking Tuesday 10/2 at Stanford  University on the importance of #HumanCapital and how the tech community can help shape a more inclusive, prosperous world  Condoleezza Rice is moderating. Join our livestream at 12:15 PT and follow on Twitter with #InvestInPeople http://wrld.bg/Rjsw30lYeSq

Name: Jim Yong Kim
Text: I had the honor of moderating a panel at the inaugural meeting of the Leadership Champions of the Women Entrepreneurs Finance Initiative (We-Fi), on the sidelines of the UN General Assembly in New York. Extraordinary women from around the world, all leaders in their fields, are work to mobilize global support for women’s entrepreneurship and economic empowerment.The World Bank Group will continue to partner with We-Fi to expand access to finance for small and medium women-owned/led enterprises. We-Fi was launched last October with funding from 14 countries and is expected to unlock billions of dollars in financing for women entrepreneurs. The first round of funding alone -- $120 million – allocated in April, is expected to mobilize over $1.6 billion in additional funds for projects implemented by the Asian Development Bank , Islamic Development Bank (IsDB), and World Bank Group:. www.we-fi.org

Name: Jim Yong Kim
Text: Innovations in battery storage can address the challenge of integrating solar and wind into power grids. This week at #OnePlanetSummit in New York, I announced our plan to mobilize $5 billion to finance the expansion of this technology in developing countries.  We think this could greatly expand access to energy and boost the fight against #climatechange.  wrld.bg/QccH30m0o7e

Name: Jim Yong Kim
Text: Famine is an ongoing international crisis that affected over 20 million people in 2017 alone. With support from Microsoft, Google, and Amazon Web Services, we’re partnering with the  United Nations and the International Committee of the Red Cross - ICRC to launch the Famine Action Mechanism (FAM) to  explore the use of disruptive tech such as artificial intelligence and machine learning to estimate #famine risk more accurately, quickly, and cost-effectively  We announced our partnership today at the UN. http://wrld.bg/nd7730lW7BK

Name: Arianna Huffington
Text: In an excerpt from Business Chicks founder Emma Isaacs's "Winging It," she writes that organizations will see a culture shift when they "lead the way on being pragmatic and not dramatic."

Name: Arianna Huffington
Text: One deeply human truth that's rarely acknowledged - especially at work - is that courage and fear are not mutually exclusive. Most of us feel brave and afraid all day long at the exact same time. And, during our really tough moments, when we're pulled between our fear and our call to courage, we need shared language. We need tools. We need skills. We need daily practices that can support us through these difficult rumbles.The goal of our Dare to Lead podcast is to create a place where we can learn (and unlearn) from each other. Welcome!Follow + listen for free on Spotify: https://lnkd.in/etDqpGG

Name: Arianna Huffington
Text: No one is exempt from this process. Having it go well depends on people’s abilities to make frank assessments of strengths and weaknesses (most importantly weaknesses). While it’s generally as difficult for managers to give this feedback as it is for their subordinates to hear it, in the long run it makes people happier and the organization more successful. To see this principle in action, check out this week's Case of the Week: https://lnkd.in/ekEDGR4 #principleoftheday

Name: Arianna Huffington
Text: Even before the pandemic, we were in a mental health crisis, which has only intensified this year and will last long after the pandemic is over. That’s why it’s great to celebrate heroes like Gage Blanck-Singer MS LCADC LAC, who’s being honored for his work at an addiction treatment center in N.J. (and is the son-in-law of my rightly proud friend Ellyn Shook). Congratulations, Gage!

Name: Arianna Huffington
Text: Working parents in the US are now devoting, on average, 52 hours per week on education, childcare, and household chores—more time than would potentially be spent on an additional full-time paying job. Among Black and Hispanic work parents, 23% are considering leaving their job within six months due to new COVID-related challenges, among Asian American and white respondents, 13% are considering leaving. An active caregiver strategy is necessary to safeguard a company’s talent pipeline.#WomenatBCG #Leadinginthenewreality #caregivers https://on.bcg.com/3o2MqMp

Name: Arianna Huffington
Text: I’m a total fan girl of our recent WorkWell podcast guest speaker, Susan David, Ph.D.! Her work on emotional agility has impacted me in many ways, as a person and a leader. She teaches us that emotions aren’t something we need to fear. In fact, they help us better understand our values and grow as people. This one is a must listen!  🙏🌞🧠💚🙂⁠🎧 Listen here:⁠ https://bit.ly/2H9jt0J⁠#emotionalagility #emotions #workwell #podcast

Name: Arianna Huffington
Text: Resilience is not a luxury. It’s the foundation of being able to thrive in times of crisis, change and transition like the ones we’re living through now. When we don’t tap into our resilience, it's easy to give in to cynicism, resignation and despair.

Text: Angela Duckworth writes about how, from the lens of a parent, we should both show *and* tell those around us what we value to create a thriving world.

Name: Arianna Huffington
Text: Could not be more proud of Gage Blanck-Singer MS LCADC LAC  for this well deserved and well earned recognition. Please read the story to see how heroes, like Gage, during the pandemic step up to help people who need a hand up. I have been hugely impressed with the care and compassion Eva's Village shows not only during the crisis but especially now. Thanks to Gage and all the mental health heroes who put others before themselves. I have said before that long after the Covid Pandemic is over the mental health issues that have come with this crisis could be our next pandemic. Arianna Huffington Thrive Global

Text: Powerful essay from Richie Jackson on not only the amount of hate that exists in 2020 but how he has found hate to exist within himself. "Hate’s remedy is faith," he writes, with a call to move from outrage to action.

Name: Arianna Huffington
Text: Leaders are paid for their judgment, not their stamina. “Powering through” is not a sustainable quality for leadership – it’s ultimately a recipe for failure.

Text: I'm speaking at The Drum's #Agencies4Growth festival next week about building mental resilience in this new normal. Join me and many others by registering here ➡️   https://bit.ly/355fydl

Name: Arianna Huffington
Text: Big Think founder and CEO Victoria R. Montgomery-Brown writes about how she stopped romanticizing struggle and suffering as prerequisites for success and embraced the Buddhist saying: "Grasp, and it shall surely elude you; open your hands and it may come."
