Name: Brené Brown
Text: A conversation with Austin Channing Brown on love, faith, anti-racism, tapping out, and staying in (even when you want to run).Austin is a writer, producer, activist, and a good friend. This episode feels like the best kinda church to me. She will move you. Austin is also taking over my Instagram today - check it out! #ShareTheMicNow﻿Listen to the full episode here: https://bit.ly/3fctNAx

Name: Brené Brown
Text: A conversation with Austin Channing Brown on love, faith, anti-racism, tapping out, and staying in (even when you want to run).Austin is a writer, producer, activist, and a good friend. This episode feels like the best kinda church to me. She will move you. Austin is also taking over my Instagram today - check it out! #ShareTheMicNow﻿Listen to the full episode here: https://bit.ly/3fctNAx

Name: Brené Brown
Text: Today, Breonna Taylor would have celebrated her 27th birthday.Breonna was an award-winning EMT and first responder in Louisville, KY.On the night of March 13th, the Louisville Metro Police executed a no-knock warrant, reportedly looking for drugs they never found, trafficked by a person who did not live with Breonna or in her complex — and whom they already had in custody.They sprayed her home with 20 rounds, shooting Breonna 8 times — killing her while she slept in her bed.No one has been arrested.Today, we are asking you to:1) Email Mayor Greg Fischer to demand that the LMPD fire and revoke pensions of the officers who murdered Breonna; and arrest, charge, and convict them for this crime. Email: Greg.Fischer@louisvilleky.gov2) Demand that special prosecutor Daniel Cameron comport with full transparency and accountability. Email: attorney.general@ag.ky.govPlease join us in this fight by making your voice heard now. Further information is at FightforBreonna.org#BreonnaTaylor #JusticeforBreonnaTaylor #BirthdayforBreonna #SayHerName

Name: Brené Brown
Text: Today, Breonna Taylor would have celebrated her 27th birthday.Breonna was an award-winning EMT and first responder in Louisville, KY.On the night of March 13th, the Louisville Metro Police executed a no-knock warrant, reportedly looking for drugs they never found, trafficked by a person who did not live with Breonna or in her complex — and whom they already had in custody.They sprayed her home with 20 rounds, shooting Breonna 8 times — killing her while she slept in her bed.No one has been arrested.Today, we are asking you to:1) Email Mayor Greg Fischer to demand that the LMPD fire and revoke pensions of the officers who murdered Breonna; and arrest, charge, and convict them for this crime. Email: Greg.Fischer@louisvilleky.gov2) Demand that special prosecutor Daniel Cameron comport with full transparency and accountability. Email: attorney.general@ag.ky.govPlease join us in this fight by making your voice heard now. Further information is at FightforBreonna.org#BreonnaTaylor #JusticeforBreonnaTaylor #BirthdayforBreonna #SayHerName

Name: Brené Brown
Text: Thank you Ibram Kendi for your thought leadership. Listen to the full episode here: https://bit.ly/30gcpqz

Name: Brené Brown
Text: Ibram Kendi writes, "By not running from the books that pain us, we can allow them to transform us. I ran from antiracist books most of my life. But now I can’t stop running after them — scrutinizing myself and my society, and in the process changing both."A teacher, scholar, and student who can teach us all. We did an organization-wide read of this book last year and it's a culture-changer. Listen to the episode at https://bit.ly/30gcpqz

Name: Brené Brown
Text: My conversation with Celeste Ng is the first of two episodes on the amazing book and Hulu series, Little Fires Everywhere!Celeste and I talked about the writing process, the stories that we tell, and the stories that define us.We also covered how our hometowns shape us, how parenting is a shame minefield, and how we all have the power to mourn moments even while we’re in them. I loved this episode as a reader, as a writer and as an observer of what it means to be human.Listen to the full episode here: https://bit.ly/2XDIIg9

Name: Brené Brown
Text: We read Kendi's new book for our last organization-wide read. The book in the photo is actually my copy. As you can see - lots of notes and questions. More passages highlighted than not.   Learning is hard. Unlearning is harder. Pretending that most of us don’t need to do either when it comes to racism is its own form of violence.

Name: Brené Brown
Text: Such a tremendous honor to give The University of Texas at Austin commencement address last night! A true highlight of my career. 🧡To ALL 2020 GRADS: You have exactly what it takes to change the world.It won't be on your terms or on your timeline. The world does not ready itself for our plans.Our ability to live a life of love and meaning, to make the world a braver and kinder place, and to disrupt and reshape the future has NOTHING to do with the greatness of our plans – it depends completely on our ability to get back up and begin again when our plans fail.We must be committed to getting back up and beginning again the exact same number of times that we fall, trip, or get pushed down.That commitment starts now - with this crisis.We must learn how to lean into our vulnerability, stay curious, and practice courage.Get back up. Begin again. ❤️🎓❤️Watch the full commencement address at https://lnkd.in/eipMvfs

Name: Brené Brown
Text: Such a tremendous honor to give The University of Texas at Austin commencement address last night! A true highlight of my career. 🧡To ALL 2020 GRADS: You have exactly what it takes to change the world.It won't be on your terms or on your timeline. The world does not ready itself for our plans.Our ability to live a life of love and meaning, to make the world a braver and kinder place, and to disrupt and reshape the future has NOTHING to do with the greatness of our plans – it depends completely on our ability to get back up and begin again when our plans fail.We must be committed to getting back up and beginning again the exact same number of times that we fall, trip, or get pushed down.That commitment starts now - with this crisis.We must learn how to lean into our vulnerability, stay curious, and practice courage.Get back up. Begin again. ❤️🎓❤️Watch the full commencement address at https://lnkd.in/eipMvfs

Name: Brené Brown
Text: Join me and The University of Texas at Austin graduating class of 2020, Saturday night at 9pm CST. Such an honor to deliver the commencement address to these amazing students.#40Acres #HookEmHorns 🧡🤘🏻🧡PS Yes, That is my lipstick.

Name: Brené Brown
Text: Join me and The University of Texas at Austin graduating class of 2020, Saturday night at 9pm CST. Such an honor to deliver the commencement address to these amazing students.#40Acres #HookEmHorns 🧡🤘🏻🧡PS Yes, That is my lipstick.

Name: Brené Brown
Text: Join me and The University of Texas at Austin graduating class of 2020, Saturday night at 9pm CST. Such an honor to deliver the commencement address to these amazing students.#40Acres #HookEmHorns 🧡🤘🏻🧡PS Yes, That is my lipstick.

Name: Brené Brown
Text: Join me and The University of Texas at Austin graduating class of 2020, Saturday night at 9pm CST. Such an honor to deliver the commencement address to these amazing students.#40Acres #HookEmHorns 🧡🤘🏻🧡PS Yes, That is my lipstick.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: WorkLife season 4 launches in 2021, and by popular demand, one of the guests is Brené Brown. What questions should I ask her?

Name: Adam Grant
Text: A mark of emotional intelligence: treating unpleasant feelings as teachable moments. Regret is a seminar on making wiser choices. Guilt is a class on doing the right thing. Boredom is a lesson on finding flow. Disappointment is a tutorial on preparation or perseverance. Anger is a crash course on setting boundaries.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: If at first you don’t succeed, you're in luck.Effortless excellence is a lousy teacher and a fickle friend.The achievements we savor most start with a struggle and end with hard-earned mastery.Success is sweeter—and more repeatable—when it's the product of deliberate practice.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: I'm thrilled to announce my new book #ThinkAgain. It's about developing the humility to know what we don't know and the mental flexibility to rethink our opinions: https://lnkd.in/eBDwEi5

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Jargon isn't a sign of expertise; it's a signal of insecurity.9 studies: when people lack status, they resort to unnecessarily technical language in an attempt to look smart. When they have status, they're more concerned with communicating clearly. https://lnkd.in/ee_cVcz

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Putting people in a group doesn’t make them a team. A team is a collection of people with a shared identity who collaborate to achieve a common mission. Each member makes a unique contribution.Turning a group into a team starts with clarifying core values, goals, and roles.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Your first job doesn't have to make the world a better place—it just needs to make you better.It isn't selfish to invest in your own development. You do that when you go to college, and it applies to your early career too.Learning today prepares you for more impact tomorrow.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: The focus on independent achievement leaves many students woefully unprepared for an interdependent world of work. Organizations value people who make their teams better and motivate their colleagues to contribute more. We owe it to our students to teach them that no one succeeds alone.My #NewEducationStory for Big Change:

Name: Adam Grant
Text: I'd love to live in a world where people spend as much time developing their character as they do developing their careers. What if our moral codes were as clear as our ambitions?Goals without values are empty. Here's to leading an honorable life, not just a successful one

Name: Adam Grant
Text: When people criticize your work, the first question to ask isn't whether they're right or wrong. It's what you can learn from their perspective.Even if they're judging you unfairly or harshly, you can still gain insight about how to elicit a different reaction next time.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: A core skill of emotional intelligence is treating your feelings as a rough draft. Like art, emotions are works in progress. It rarely serves you well to frame your first sketch. As you gain perspective, you can revise what you feel. Sometimes you even start over from scratch.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Our new children’s book is out today: bit.ly/LeifandtheFallThe most creative kids are the least likely to be the teacher’s favorite. They don’t color inside the lines or conform to every rule. Too often, they learn to keep their imaginations to themselves. We wrote this book to change that.It’s about a leaf named Leif who’s afraid to fall from his tree in the fall. With encouragement from his friend Laurel, Leif invents a series of contraptions to protect himself. But as the other leaves taunt him, he discards each invention as a failure. Just as Leif is about to give up, a surprise twist changes everything.School Library Journal calls it “a clever and triumphant tale” and Kirkus describes it as “a polished, clever take.” We hope it will encourage kids to persist with their original ideas.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: In job interviews and college admissions, we focus too much on what candidates have accomplished, and too little on what obstacles they've overcome. The true measure of people's potential is not the height of the peak they've reached, but how far they've climbed to get there.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: The new books to read this fall are about building careers and companies, rebuilding our lives and institutions, including those who have been marginalized, thinking more clearly, entertaining others, and sustaining our energy, our workplaces, and our environment.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: You can learn a little about people's principles by listening to their words and a lot by watching their actions. But you don't truly know what they stand for until you see their sacrifices. The ultimate test of integrity is what we're willing to risk to uphold our core values.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Not every opinion needs to be voiced. Not every emotion needs to be expressed.A key question: does what you're about to share align with your values?It's good to be true to your thoughts and feelings in the moment. It's better to be true to your guiding principles in life.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: The most important people in your life aren't always the ones you know the best or like the most.They're the people who see your potential and help you reach it. Who care enough to lift you up even when they're down. Who restore your faith in humanity when it's shaken.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: People will follow leaders who create a common enemy, but they’re inspired by leaders who create a common vision.The purpose of leadership is not to divide and conquer. It's to unite people in service of a greater good.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Liking someone does not mean you'll like work with them... or work well with them. Don't forget to consider how dependable people are—and whether they have different skills but similar values. It took me too long to learn this lesson!

Name: Adam Grant
Text: New skills to put on your COVID resume: -On call as tech support to entire extended family-Developed extreme patience as unwanted teacher/camp counselor-Proved learning agility as YouTube-trained plumber-Displayed conscientiousness by obsessively disinfecting packages and scrubbing hands until they bledUpdating my LinkedIn profile now 😆

Name: Adam Grant
Text: In every team and every organization, the responsibility for creating psychological safety starts at the top.When people get penalized for voicing problems and concerns, they learn that it's not safe to speak up.It’s up to those in power to open the door—and keep it open.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: How to decide whether your idea should become a project:1. Interest: do you think about it in your free time and bring it up in random conversations?2. Importance: will it benefit others?3. Contribution: do you have something novel to add?

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Bad bosses during the pandemic:

Name: Adam Grant
Text: A question to start asking in job searches: what practices do you have in place to help people learn and grow from a distance?When people aren't in the same room, organizations need to take steps to facilitate remote mentorship and sponsorship. A simple starting point: holding office hours. It gives junior people access to senior leaders, and gives senior leaders access to fresh ideas and perspectives.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: If you define success solely in terms of gaining wealth, achievement, or influence, what you often lose is freedom.One of the greatest accomplishments in life is earning the autonomy to choose how you spend your time. No currency is more valuable—or more scarce—than freedom.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: As work parents brace themselves for hectic school and childcare schedules this fall, now is the perfect time for managers to ask how they can be supportive. Flexible hours and adjusted meeting times can go a long way toward reducing stress.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: It's disappointing that so few interviewers give feedback to job applicants after rejecting them. When turning candidates away, the least we can do is make it a learning experience. Ghosting is selfish. People are hurting. A bit of guidance might help them get hired elsewhere.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: New data on remote work, March thru May:(1) Work days are 10-20% longer(2) Best predictor of adaptation isn't introversion, but being agreeable and emotionally stable(3) Communication went up 40% with strong ties but down 10% with weak tiesInsightful analysis from Ethan Bernstein, Hayley Blunden, Andrew Brodsky, Wonbin Sohn, Ben Waber:

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Let's not confuse being open to different views with being uncritical. Being willing to hear dissenting opinions doesn't mean you don't have quality standards.I want to work and live in a world where people have the freedom to express contrarian thoughts *and* the freedom to criticize them.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: How do you build an enormous platform? Start with small, achievable goals. That's how DonorsChoose raised almost $1 billion for schools: taking it classroom by classroom, goal by goal. We talk with founder Charles Best (plus DonorsChoose board member Stephen Colbert!) in the latest episode: https://lnkd.in/ePneG5N

Name: Adam Grant
Text: If you think you have to dumb down an idea to explain it, you're not giving your audience enough credit.If people don't understand your idea, start with the assumption that you haven't explained it well.Communication requires clarity, not simplicity.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Great mentors aren't like The Godfather. Their gifts don't come with strings attached. All we owe them is to reach the potential they see in us. We don't need to pay it back, but we can pay it forward. It honors their time and spreads the norm of generosity.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: We listen too much to people who think fast and shallow, and too little to people who think slow and deep.Being quick on their feet may make them sound smart, but it doesn’t mean they’re wise.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Weak leaders praise themselves and criticize others.Strong leaders criticize themselves and praise others.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: I used to think a real friend was someone you talked to every week. Now I see a real friend as someone who’s there for you even if you haven't talked in a year. Deep connection can exist without frequent communication.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: You don’t have to agree with every idea in a book, article, talk, or podcast to recommend it. Sometimes the perspectives that challenge our thinking are the ones that teach us the most. The point of learning is not to affirm our beliefs. It's to evolve our beliefs.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: It's unacceptable that women and people of color get penalized when they advocate for diversity at work.When people who aren't white or male speak out on bias, it's not a self-serving act. They're putting their careers at risk to fight systemic injustice.When I mentioned this evidence last week, I failed to call out how desperately it needs to change. It’s a double bind for oppressed groups: the very people who suffer from systemic disadvantage are punished when they voice it.One small way we can all be supportive is to celebrate our colleagues who go out on a limb to speak up and reinforce the importance of change. Yes, it might create some discomfort, but dismantling broken systems is not supposed to be comfortable.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: One of the most powerful ways for us to speak up is to amplify the voices of those with deeper understanding and broader data. Here are the books that have taught me the most about what we can all do to combat racism:

Name: Adam Grant
Text: In workplaces and communities, white people often stay quiet on racism because they feel it's not their place to speak up. But just as sexism is not only a "women's issue," racism is not only a "black issue."Now is not the time for silence. We all have a responsibility to raise our voices against injustice.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Remarkable display of compassionate leadership from inside the Canadian government:

Name: Adam Grant
Text: The new leadership books debuting this summer cover how to inspire and empower, bust bureaucracies, find meaning in the mundane, and make smarter choices.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Success isn't something we become. It's a snapshot of a result we achieve. A key to sustaining excellence is striving to reproduce and refine that snapshot day in, day out. As Phil Jackson put it in my favorite line from The Last Dance: “You’re only a success at the moment you perform a successful act.”

Name: Adam Grant
Text: A skill I never expected to see on our son's kindergarten report card: "Can independently mute and unmute himself when requested to do so."Maybe we should add this to performance reviews at work. I know a few adults who are still struggling with it 😆

Name: Adam Grant
Text: When remote work is stressful, it's worth remembering that things could always be worse.You asked for a podcast episode on how science can fix remote work, and we delivered. Listen here: tedtalks.social/WLAdam

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Dear leaders: Do everything you can to avoid layoffs. They don't just hurt the people you lose—they crush the morale of those you keep.Survivor guilt and fear are real costs. If you have to let people go, make it your mission to help them find another job.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: In remote teams, it's even more critical to establish compelling goals and clear roles. We do our best work when we believe in the mission and know our contribution.Today on #WorkLife: how science can fix remote work. Learn how creative teams are solving communication challenges and an astronaut maintained his resolve during 340 days in outer space. Listen here: https://lnkd.in/evNgMZ3

Name: Adam Grant
Text: In remote work, we don't need micromanagers. We need "macromanagers" to highlight our contribution to the team and reinforce the broader purpose of our work.One of the most meaningful parts of a manager's job is making other people's jobs more meaningful.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Remote collaboration improves when people are online at the same time for a few hours a day. Evidence: it enables "burstiness," where interactions are literally bursting with energy and ideas.Just before the pandemic, Esther Perel and I sat down to discuss this and more:

Name: Adam Grant
Text: The people who keep inventing are the ones who keep reinventing themselves. They're not afraid to experiment: tackle a new problem, try a new skill, take on a new collaborator, work in a new culture.Today on #WorkLife: career decline isn't inevitable. Listen here: https://lnkd.in/evNgMZ3

Name: Adam Grant
Text: I’ve teamed up with Omaze to give you the chance to win a virtual discussion with me. Every donation will support Direct Relief’s COVID efforts to provide personal protective equipment to health workers. Enter here: https://bit.ly/34L5ci9

Name: Adam Grant
Text: If you're work from home, the pandemic has extended the average work day by 2-3 hours.Now is the ideal moment for employers to reverse that trend by testing out 6-hour work days or 4-day work weeks.By freeing up attention and energy, less time can mean more quality.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: When you meet charismatic leaders, don't forget to look behind the curtain. They may be inspiring people to pursue the wrong ends—or the wrong means.Today on #WorkLife: an exclusive postmortem on WeWork's leadership & culture with one of their top execs. Listen here: https://lnkd.in/evNgMZ3

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Great leaders don't always insist on taking the reins. They have the wisdom to delegate or even step aside when others are more qualified.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Attention micromanagers: if you can’t trust people to work from home, you…(a) Probably shouldn’t have hired them in the first place(b) Haven’t done a good job motivating them(c) Might be projecting your own work habits onto them(d) All of the above😆

Name: Adam Grant
Text: It's not just the time to connect—it's the ideal time to reconnect. Although many people are nervous about reconnecting, 90% end up finding it fun and enjoyable.Old contacts also have more novel ideas and more useful advice than current ones. Since the last time we talked, they've been meeting new people and learning new things.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: It's not just the time to connect—it's the ideal time to reconnect. Although many people are nervous about reconnecting, 90% end up finding it fun and enjoyable.Old contacts also have more novel ideas and more useful advice than current ones. Since the last time we talked, they've been meeting new people and learning new things.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Virtual meetings don't erase power or status. Those who speak loudest and longest tend to drive the agenda—even if they don't have the best ideas.It's a good time to remember the evidence: we reach better decisions and more creative solutions when we hear the voices who are usually silent.(For a good overview of the evidence, see In Defense of Troublemakers by Nemeth, Wiser by Sunstein and Hastie, or chapter 7 of Originals by some bald guy)

Name: Adam Grant
Text: It doesn't matter how much experience people have if they're not determined to get better. It doesn't matter how much talent people have if they don't use it to make others better. Let's bet on people who are driven to improve their teams and themselves.Today on #worklife: reinventing the job interview. Listen here: https://lnkd.in/evNgMZ3

Name: Adam Grant
Text: During the loneliest week of my life, I made a list of the people who mattered most to me. Then I wrote them each a note about what I appreciated most about them.Feeling grateful is good, but showing gratitude is better. Voicing the unspoken can remind us we're not alone—and strengthen our connections.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: In crisis, leadership is not waiting, downplaying, deflecting, or justifying past actions. It's acting swiftly, communicating openly, taking responsibility for past mistakes, and making adjustments to improve future decisions.Timely analysis by Amy C. Edmondson and Michaela Kerrissey: https://lnkd.in/eQzFcuk

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Crises don't just test our resolve. They can also build our resilience.3 years ago, Sheryl Sandberg and I wrote a book on finding strength in the face of adversity. Today, we're releasing a new foreword and key sections of the book free: https://lnkd.in/e7bsumQ#OptionBThere

Name: Adam Grant
Text: When we're lonely, we feel invisible. One of the most powerful ways to fight it is to help others feel seen.Listen here on #worklife: https://lnkd.in/evNgMZ3

Name: Adam Grant
Text: For anyone work from home with kids at home...

Name: Adam Grant
Text: One of the best anti-anxiety medications available is generosity.Helping others reduces stress by helping us feel valued and capable.Talking through someone else's problems can give us wisdom for our own challenges—and motivate us to follow through.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: You shouldn’t have to hide your opinions and emotions at work-- or your ideas and identities. But it doesn’t hurt to reflect on the many different selves that are already part of who you are-- and the selves you might become.New today on #WorkLife: effective authenticity, with Alicia Menendez, Mohamed El-Erian, Herminia Ibarra, Leah Finnegan, and Carmen Medina. Listen here: https://lnkd.in/evNgMZ3

Name: Adam Grant
Text: We say we want advice from people who have relevant expertise and experience. But the data show we're more likely to turn to people who seem likeable and available.In important decisions, it's worth sacrificing some comfort for quality.https://lnkd.in/euawkhP

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Trust is breached when expectations aren't met. It's betrayed when expectations are voided, as if a commitment never existed.Repair starts with taking responsibility for the impact of our actions and making a commitment to change.My conversation with relationship therapist Esther Perel is live: listen at https://lnkd.in/evNgMZ3We discuss trust, power, and people pleasing. We answer audience questions about work spouses, the tension between autonomy and loyalty, and when to quit a job. And I get an unexpected taste of therapy.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: "Find a quiet room and close the door..."  People mean well, but let's face it: the boundary between work and home has blurred. Here's to relaxing our expectations for virtual meetings. Interruptions are part of our new reality. We're all BBC dad now.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: The art of the deal was about crushing competitors. The science of the deal reveals that great negotiators refuse to believe in a win-lose world. They care about both results and relationships. They don't declare victory until all parties win.#WorkLife

Name: Adam Grant
Text: To avoid burnout, we don't need huge accomplishments. We just need small wins. The strongest predictor of engagement at work is a sense of daily progress. We gain energy and efficacy in moments of learning, problem-solving, and helping.Listen here: https://lnkd.in/evNgMZ3#WorkLife

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Bad leaders believe people work for them.Good leaders believe people work with them.Great leaders believe they work for people.Especially in crisis, we all depend on servant leaders to put others first.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Burnout is not in your head. It’s in your circumstances. Since workplaces are responsible for the causes, they need to take responsibility for the cures.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: A beautiful moment of connection in isolation: in Italy, people are leaning of out their windows to sing together.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: We can't control what people say, but we do have a say in how we react. Refusing to give others power over our feelings is a mark of emotional intelligence.It's worth asking: has this person earned the right to influence my emotions? If the answer is no, return to sender.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: We might have more insightful discussions if we worried less about avoiding awkward silence and being quick on the draw.Deep conversations are full of pauses. They're not uncomfortable because we're too absorbed in thought to stress about filling the silence.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: If self-help books delivered on their promises, the genre would eventually put itself out of business.Although books are ideal for learning and reflecting, they're not a substitute for coaching or therapy. Behavior change is tough without social support and feedback!If you have favorite coaches, tag them below-- would be great to crowdsource a list

Name: Adam Grant
Text: It is with a mixture of sadness and excitement that I share with all of you that I will be leaving the Goizueta Business School after the semester ends to take a position as the Dean of the Wharton School. It has been an honor and a privilege to work with the dedicated, innovative, and world-class staff and faculty here at Goizueta. I am proud of what we have accomplished together and grateful to have been a part of this tremendous community. I shall miss you all. This is an exciting time to be in business education. The scope and platform of the Wharton School provides an opportunity to create far-reaching impact for students, scholars, and the business community. I am excited for this next phase of my career. https://lnkd.in/efqZtGv

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Exciting news: the new dean of The Wharton School is trailblazer and organizational psychologist Erika James. I can't wait to work with a widely admired leader who's also a leadership expert. Welcome, Erika!!

Name: Adam Grant
Text: If I could only teach kids one thing about achievement, this might be it. Success is not a function of how many setbacks we face, but how much we learn and grow from them.https://lnkd.in/e_yYFj4

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Before taking a job offer, it's worth asking: do I want to become more like the people here?You can aspire to change the culture of a group, but don't overlook how the culture will change you.Few of us are immune to the values of the people around us.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: How close we come to achieving our potential depends in part on how we respond to the achievements of others.The people who grow the most aren't threatened or deflated by someone else's success. They see it as a source of insight and inspiration.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Therapist extraordinaire Esther Perel and I are getting ready to do a podcast episode together on relationships at work. Submit your questions below—we’d love to hear what’s on your mind about communication, conflict, trust, and more!(The episode will air on #WorkLife and on How’s Work?)

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Although productivity in a day depends on the amount of time you spend doing, productivity in a career hinges on the amount of time you spend thinking and learning.I like getting things done. But when I looked at my calendar, I saw that nearly all of my work time was blocked out for doing. New goal: carve out at least an hour a day for thinking and learning

Name: Adam Grant
Text: When short-term tasks feel trivial, lumping them into a larger goal makes them meaningful.When long-term goals feel impossible, slicing them into smaller pieces makes them manageable.Zoom out for purpose. Zoom in for progress.https://lnkd.in/ecpYyYV

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Even when we intend to multiply the intelligence of those around us, sometimes we accidentally diminish it. I’m especially guilty of being the rescuer, the rapid responder, and the energizer bunny. What are your favorite ways of avoiding the unintended consequences?Love this infographic from Liz Wiseman

Name: Adam Grant
Text: When people say happiness is the most important goal in life, I'm curious about why character isn't higher on the list.I'm all for the pursuit of happiness, but above that I hope people care about moral values like justice, integrity, respect, and compassion.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: The true measure of leadership is not the authority you command or the number of followers you have. Your success as a leader is how much good people do thanks to your presence. Your legacy as a leader is how much good people keep doing in your absence.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: We need more leaders who are givers, not takers.Takers demand attention. Givers pay attention.Takers brag about success. Givers take responsibility for failure.Takers aim to be better than others. Givers strive to do better for others.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Even if a job title impresses other people, it's the wrong choice if the day-to-day work depresses you.In career decisions, beware of being seduced by status. Pursue a job where you can express your values in a culture where people share those values.

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Before you criticize people, you should walk a mile in their shoes. That way, when you criticize them, you're a mile away and you have their shoes.-Deep Thoughts by Jack Handey

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Listening well is more than talking less. It's skill in asking and responding.Show an interest in people's interests, not in trying to judge their status.Help them express their thoughts clearly and crystallize your understanding.https://lnkd.in/eSeGU9i

Name: Adam Grant
Text: Leaders who don't have time to read are leaders who don't make time to learn. My top picks for new reads to bring in the new year cover problem-solving, relationships, rhythms of work and life, identity, and happiness.

Name: Mohamed El-Erian
Text: While debates rage on who is leading, lagging and the contrasts, practical realities include:Governments still react to case data due to concerns about hospital capacity:We need to do better “living with COVID” for now; andThere’s no easy way as yet to solve simultaneously and well for public heath, normal economic/social interactions and personal freedoms.

Name: Mohamed El-Erian
Text: And the seemingly good news from the  reported improvement in the unemployment rate — down from 8.2% to 7.9% — is countered by the bad news from the fall in the labor force participation rate.  #economy #markets

Name: Mohamed El-Erian
Text: The just released US September #employment creation — of 661,000–falls well short of consensus expectation and amounts to less than half of the revised August #jobs outcome. It’s yet another indication of an ongoing recovery falling behind what is needed and what should be possible. #economy #economics #markets

Name: Mohamed El-Erian
Text: Yet another indication of the unusually uncertain, unsettling and fluid world we live.Until now, the majority reaction of investors has been to recognize the unusual uncertainty in words but not in actions due to the liquidity conditioning enabled and reinforced by central banks

Name: Mohamed El-Erian
Text: Pre-and current market sessions around the world that were focusing on the upcoming monthly US jobs report are now dealing with the news that President Trump and the First Lady have tested positive for Covid.Dow futures are down 500 points in response to a whole host of new questions about what's ahead.#covid #covid_19 #COVIDeconomy #economy #markets #COVID #COVIDnews

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: In an interview with Darius Rochebin of LCI - La Chaine Info, I looked back on my first year as President of the European Central Bank and the work we have undertaken to support the eurozone economy during the pandemic.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: I had productive discussions this week at the virtual #IMFMeetings. I talked about Europe’s experience in responding to the pandemic and emphasised that a global challenge like the coronavirus requires global solutions and strong international cooperation.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: The fight against the pandemic has brought us all together in that we are all confronting the same issue. Hopefully that unity will remain. #IMFMeetings

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: Tune in on 21 October to the first #ECBListens event, hosted by ECB President Christine Lagarde and Chief Economist Philip R. Lane. They will be engaging with civil society organisations as part of the #ECBstrategyreview. Watch live on our website https://lnkd.in/ewpzpcT You can also share your views and ideas via the #ECBListens Portal, available in all euro area languages https://lnkd.in/eeH74kJ

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: In a debate on the global economy hosted by @CNBC, I spoke about how the support we have put in place has produced exactly the effects we intended. #IMFMeetings

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: Thank you to Kristalina Georgieva, Sri Mulyani Indrawati and Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala for a very thought-provoking discussion. The pandemic has caused an unbelievable crisis in terms of brutality and depth. We have done a lot and if more is needed, we’ll do what is necessary.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: I invite those of you living in the eurozone to share your input via the #ECBListens Portal https://lnkd.in/dT9ZzG7 I also look forward to hosting the first #ECBListens event on 21 October with Chief Economist Philip R. Lane and engaging with civil society organisations. You’ll be able to watch the event live from 09:30 CET on the ECB website and via the ECB’s Twitter profile.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: Keeping the boat steady is even more important in turbulent waters. I told the Harvard International Review how supporting the economy has very much been the role of the ECB’s extraordinary measures during the pandemic. Read the full interviewhttps://lnkd.in/gbY8Vmm

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: I spoke to Leaders magazine about the importance of dialogue with citizens. Listening to their voices can only make our policymaking stronger, which is why we’ve launched #ECBListens. You can share your views with us by 31 October https://lnkd.in/ddUcQP9

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: Dare to be different! That was my message to young women when receiving the Woodrow Wilson Award for Public Service. Delighted that it was presented by my dear friend Jane Harman, President of the Wilson Center.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: I am pleased to see our findings on the benefits and the challenges of a digital euro. In these times of rapid technological progress we must ensure that our payment systems continue to keep up with the needs of the people who use them.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: It was a pleasure to welcome Agustín Carstens, General Manager of the Bank for International Settlements – BIS, to the ECB today (while observing social distancing). We discussed current challenges facing the global economy.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: At the ECB and its Watchers conference I spoke about why the ECB is holding a strategy review and what we seek to achieve. We need to analyse forces driving inflation dynamics today and consider whether our policy strategy needs adjusting in response https://lnkd.in/dGKqmNG We aim to listen to as many voices as possible – have your say via the #ECBListens Portal https://lnkd.in/ddUcQP9

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: My colleague Isabel Schnabel spoke yesterday about the persistent underrepresentation of women in economics. More needs to be done to address the systemic causes of this, and the ECB’s experience shows that targeted measures can yield tangible results.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: My friend Ursula von der Leyen relishes a challenge, is undeterred by adversity and epitomises grace under pressure. I was delighted to write a piece for TIME reflecting on why she is one of the world’s most influential people https://lnkd.in/dA3PaTg

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: I am glad to see the ECB take this important step in the fight against climate change, which is a challenge that affects us all. I look forward to work together even more closely with the Network for Greening the Financial System.https://lnkd.in/dFnt4wx

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: I had an interesting discussion at The Council of Governors of the Arab Central Banks and Monetary Authorities' Governors virtual meeting.I explained how the ECB’s monetary policy has reacted strongly to the pandemic and shared our view about the outlook for the global economy.Read my remarks https://lnkd.in/dDPFGQC

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: Good discussions at today’s #Eurogroup meeting, the first led by Paschal Donohoe. I’m sure we will move the eurozone forward under his leadership.The coronavirus is testing our economies and significant policy support continues to be needed – we cannot afford to be complacent.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: I was honoured to speak at the Deutsche Bundesbank about payments in today’s fast-moving world. With our lives going digital, it's natural for people to change the way they pay. We must ensure that our payment systems continue to modernise along with European consumers’ preferences.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: I’m looking forward to speaking at the Deutsche Bundesbank’s conference on banking and payments in the digital world. Watch live from 19:00 CET.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: For International #YouthDay together with President Christine Lagarde, we are joining United Nations for Youth and the UNITED NATIONS DEPARTMENT OF ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL AFFAIRS to celebrate young people and your contributions to policymaking. Your ideas matter – that’s why we want you to have your say in shaping the policies that affect you.The future of the euro belongs to you. Go to the #ECBListens portal to share your views and expectations about our economy and help us define our new monetary policy. https://lnkd.in/dJBtN8P

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: Young people’s participation in policymaking is crucial to ensuring a better future for all. I’m delighted to join United Nations for Youth and the UNITED NATIONS DEPARTMENT OF ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL AFFAIRS in celebrating International #YouthDay. On this occasion, I invite you to have your say on the #ECBListens portal and help us shape the future of your currency, the euro.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: The pandemic has shown that Europe has learnt the lessons of the past and moved towards a new model for dealing with crises. In this article I explain how we are now able to act quickly, adapt our institutions and lay the groundwork for forging a new Europe.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: In my interview with The Washington Post, I spoke about the remarkable role women leaders have played amid this pandemic.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: Thank you to David Ignatius from The Washington Post  for our discussion today. I spoke about how the EU recovery package is a decisive act of solidarity. It shows determination to move forward together.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: Thank you to all European Council members for your resilience and determined action over the last days. We can only fight the economic consequences of COVID by work together.Today’s agreement shows that when most needed, the EU steps up and comes together to help the people of Europe.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: Today is Frankfurt Pride. I am proud to lead an organisation that is committed to enabling diversity. We all want and need to be who we are – no matter what our sexual identity or gender expression may be. Happy Pride!

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: At today's press conference, I explained why price stability is important for the economy. It is key for the decisions that families, businesses and governments make everyday.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: My congratulations to Bulgaria and Croatia on taking a big step today on the path towards joining the euro area. The euro is part of our shared identity and a tangible connection between over 340 million people across Europe.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: Congratulations Paschal Donohoe on your election as Eurogroup President. I look forward to work with you! Also my thanks to outgoing President Mario Centeno for our excellent collaboration and for your contribution to Europe.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: Last November I provided my signature to be printed on euro banknotes – it was great to see the finished product this week. Euro banknotes are a symbol of European integration that serve as a daily reminder of what we have achieved together.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: The recovery will require all tools to address a critical moment that may be as transformational as it is bleak. Watch my remarks at the United Nations conference with fellow women leaders on “Rebirthing the global economy to deliver sustainable development” https://lnkd.in/dXAuFAh

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: I am pleased that the ECB and the Eurosystem will join the #BISInnovationHub. The new Bank for International Settlements – BIS centres in Frankfurt and Paris, coordinated by the ECB, will bring their expertise in designing the future of digital banking and finance. Global challenges need global answers.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: In the recovery from the coronavirus pandemic, we need to be attentive to those likely to be affected more by the crisis: the poor in all countries, the poorest countries, young people and women. I spoke about some of the challenges they face at the Northern Light Summit today.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: The recovery from the coronavirus pandemic is going to be a complicated matter. Thank you to everybody who participated in the important and thought-provoking discussion earlier at the Northern Light Summit.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: Tomorrow at 09:00 CET, I'll be discussing the prospects for economic recovery from the coronavirus pandemic at the online Northern Light Summit. You can follow the conversation live https://lnkd.in/gZvCQfy

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: Today we announced a €600 billion expansion of our pandemic emergency purchase programme (PEPP) to further support the eurozone economy. President Christine Lagarde explains why further action had to be taken.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: Prepare yourself for change. This was my answer during the online Q&A for the European Youth Event Online earlier today when asked what I would have liked to have known as a graduate. We will all have to transform ourselves over the course of our careers.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: I was so pleased to answer questions from young people today during an online Q&A for the European Youth Event Online. We covered topics such as climate change, the economic recovery from the coronavirus, and how young graduates can prepare themselves for today’s work world.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: I’ll be taking part in an online Q&A on the European Central Bank's response to the coronavirus pandemic as part of the European Youth Event Online on Wednesday 27 May at 09:30 CET.I’m really looking forward to seeing and answering your questions. You’ll be able to watch the event live on the ECB website https://lnkd.in/ewfYVnv

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: I was recently asked by the Financial Times about the first thing I’ll do after lockdown. I did not know that I would not see my family for 10 weeks, other than on a screen. When I saw my 14-month-old grandson kiss the phone to wish me goodbye, I knew what I missed most.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: Do you have a question about the impact of the coronavirus on the European economy or what the ECB is doing to help those affected?On 27 May 2020 at 09:30 CET, I’ll be taking part in an online Q&A on these topics and more as part of the European Youth Event Online. The event will be streamed via the European Central Bank's website and Twitter account.I really look forward to reading your questions. You can already submit them via Slido – just follow these steps:1. Go to https://lnkd.in/gR_4frx2. Type in your question

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: We need to counter the current economic shock with determination in order to help our economies recover as quickly as possible. This was my message when speaking in an interview to four European newspapers – read the full text here https://lnkd.in/eYZBHpS

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: Today’s #EuropeDay marks the 70th anniversary of the Schuman Declaration, which laid the foundation for the European Union we have today. In my remarks yesterday at the State of the Union Conference, I shared my view that the pandemic we now face can be our “Schuman moment”.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: Thank you to Bloomberg LP, Mike Bloomberg and Francine Lacqua for hosting today’s webcast on reopening the economy while protecting public health. Balancing economic and public health will be crucial in ensuring everybody – families, firms and governments – can bounce back.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: The coronavirus pandemic is a truly global challenge. As I have said before, solidarity is in fact self-interest. So all countries must work together – first to defeat the coronavirus and then to rebuild our economies. This week’s virtual #IMFMeetings were a welcome opportunity to hear from colleagues on the effectiveness of their various policy responses, share information and coordinate policy actions.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: Europe stands together in the fight against coronavirus. I am heartened to see #Eurogroup finance ministers reach an innovative deal.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: Coronavirus represents a new form of economic shock that cannot be tackled using the textbooks of the past. In an article, I outline how the ECB’s policies are designed to reach those most exposed to this crisis.Our response will be made more powerful if all policies reinforce each other. Full alignment of fiscal and monetary policies – and a level playing field against the virus – is the best way to protect our productive capacity and employment, enabling us to return to sustainable growth and inflation rates once the coronavirus outbreak passes.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: The ECB is committed to doing our part to support every citizen of the euro area through this extremely challenging time. In this article, I outline how our temporary pandemic emergency purchase programme will help in this unprecedented situation.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: I’m proud to strike the #EachforEqual pose with fellow ECB Executive Board member Isabel Schnabel and colleagues from across the ECB, celebrating this year’s theme for #InternationalWomensDay. An equal world is an enabled world.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: This #InternationalWomensDay I was so pleased to meet Hanni Schoelermann, a senior economist work in International and European Relations at the ECB, to share my thoughts, experience and advice.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: Climate change presents both threats and opportunities. At the launch of the UN Climate Change COP 26 Private Finance Agenda, I outlined how the financial sector can contribute to a more sustainable economy. My full remarks https://lnkd.in/etaxsZgIt was also good to see Alok Sharma MP, President of the COP 26. I wished him success as he leads negotiations on climate action.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: David Attenborough’s work has inspired millions around the world, myself included. It was great to see him again at the launch of the UN Climate Change COP 26 Private Finance Agenda.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: I was very pleased to hear of Antoinette Sayeh’s return to the International Monetary Fund as Deputy Managing Director. I wish you all the best in your new role, Antoinette!

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: I had a good discussion earlier today with Volker Bouffier, Minister President of the State of Hessen. The ECB is based in Hessen and I look forward to work closely with him. I also conveyed to him my sympathies regarding the recent attacks in Hanau and Volkmarsen.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: Many of us don’t realise the challenges those with physical disabilities face. Being aware of this is the first step towards fostering an inclusive work environment. Today I met with two colleagues to see how they move around on a daily basis – a very insightful experience.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: We’re coming to the end of a fruitful two days at the G20 meetings in Riyadh. We must work together if we are to forge a global economy in which everybody can live, work and thrive.#G20SaudiArabia

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: A pleasure to see Federal Reserve System Chair Jerome Powell for a longer discussion today. We reflected on recent developments in our economies. #G20SaudiArabia

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: I very much enjoyed the cultural programme offered by my hosts at the #G20SaudiArabia.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: An excellent first day at the #G20SaudiArabia meetings with discussions on digitalisation and the outlook for the global economy.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: I was back in Brussels today for the Eurogroup meeting. We discussed the economic situation in Europe and the European Commission's priorities for the Economic and Monetary Union. It was also good to meet up with Michel Barnier and exchange thoughts on Brexit.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: I was delighted to see my friend Christian Noyer, the first Vice-President of the European Central Bank. He will always be part of our family.J’étais ravie de rencontrer mon ami Christian Noyer, le premier vice-président de la BCE (European Central Bank). Il fera toujours partie de notre famille.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: Addressing members of the European Parliament earlier, I spoke about the challenges facing the eurozone economy, including digitalisation and climate change.I also met with other colleagues from the institutions and exchanged views on a number of current issues. A productive day indeed!

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: David Lipton - a true hero of my eight years at the helm of the IMF and a beacon of intelligence, integrity and total commitment to improving the state of the world. Merci David!

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: I enjoyed seeing Deutsche Bundesbank President Jens Weidmann at the Deutsche Börse New Year’s Reception. I was also able to meet representatives from Frankfurt’s financial community – the city would not be the important financial centre it is today without them.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: I am sad to see our British friends leave the EU. We will act within our mandate to ensure Brexit causes as little disruption as possible for the citizens, employers and financial markets of the euro area. We look with confidence towards the future, united as Europeans.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: Boris Vujčić, Governor of the Croatian National Bank, and I reflected today on Croatia’s economic development in recent years and spoke about the country’s journey towards adopting the euro.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: It was good to see my friend Sveriges riksbank Governor Stefan Ingves today and discuss developments in the global economy. The euro area and Sweden have always been strong partners.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: I had a good meeting yesterday with Australian Finance Minister Mathias Cormann. I took the opportunity to express my sorrow about the death and destruction caused by the recent wildfires in his country.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: It was good to meet with Austrian Chancellor Sebastian Kurz today in Davos. We discussed priorities for the coming year, including the need to preserve Europe’s competitiveness in the face of global challenges.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: I was delighted to see my friend Kristalina Georgieva, current Managing Director of the International Monetary Fund, at #WEF20. So nice to catch up.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: I spoke this morning about tackling climate change on Bloomberg Television. Central bankers can participate in the process, but everybody has to be at the table – regulators, policymakers and governments alike.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: European countries have joint exposures to the climate, to the global economy, to multinational firms, to foreign powers. At the #WEF20, I outlined three ways we can work together to address these challenges:1. Demonstrating what is needed to make openness globally sustainable2. Leveraging the areas where the EU is powerful, namely the Single Market3. Linking Europe’s potential more visibly to people’s concerns. Europe adds most value in areas where people now want to see results.Read my full remarks here https://lnkd.in/exTHVxm

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: My mission as President is to harness all the views around the Governing Council table in this strategy review. I want to make sure that we come to as close as possible a view that is shared by all.

Name: Christine Lagarde
Text: It was a pleasure to attend the New Year’s Reception of the Representation of Baden-Württemberg to the EU in Brussels, where I met Minister-President Winfried Kretschmann and Guido Wolf, Minister of Justice and European Affairs in Baden-Württemberg.We all share the goal of bringing citizens and the EU institutions closer together. It was a wonderful opportunity to meet with representatives from this innovative and research-driven region, which can make a powerful contribution to Europe.

Name: James Altucher
Text: Hey, going to have a live Q&A at 8PM TONIGHT on Zoom about my next book, "Skip the Line". Here's the link:

Name: James Altucher
Text: "Why are people so racist against Green people?"What??The two producers on the Zoom call were not sure what I was asking about. The audio engineer had muted himself. The other audio engineer was confused because he didn't grow up in this country.Even David Banner, known for being a rapper but also an activist, was silent."Like the Hulk," I said, "From the TV show. You picked his name. The Hulk is green."And then he told me something I didn't know...#racism #slavery #BLM #rap #hiphop

Name: James Altucher
Text: So proud of what the team at TechUnited created at this year's digital Propelify Innovation Festival.  Checkout this high-energy 2 min highlight to see what what down, including me getting dunked.Over 6000 registered.  Over 1.8 million(!) minutes watched.  Over 15 countries attending.  Over 50 high-fives fived.Members: good news, the full library of content is available to you including talks from Al Roker, Marc Lore, Gov Phil Murphy, Ralph Izzo, James Altucher, Rick Thigpen, Virginia Biggins, Lindsay Kaplan, Leslie Garcia-Amaya, Madison Merritt, Kenny Esser, Julie Samuels, James C. Rhee, Anthony Scaramucci, Jose Lozano, Cindy Eckert, David Meltzer, and 100 more.Thank you to our incredible speakers, sponsors, and attendees for make this part of 2020 such a pleasant surprise.#buildabetterfutureforall

Name: James Altucher
Text: WHY I WON'T VOTE AND MAYBE YOU SHOULDN'T EITHER I'm not going to vote. I've never voted in a Presidential election. I've been vote shamed all of my life. It's part of the American religion that if you don't vote, then you are a bad person. "You're not entitled to an opinion if you don't vote!"I've never seen politics so muddy as this year. And when you get in the mud with a pig, the pig gets happy and you get dirty.  There are better ways to help society than voting. And most people probably should not be voicing their opinions in an election. And maybe a vote is actually a bad thing for society. This is my "Guide to Not Voting". Please subscribe to my LinkedIn Newsletter. #politics #election2020 #votingmatters

Name: James Altucher
Text: I was dubious of James Altucher's "New York is Dead" article. I cheered on Seinfeld's rebuttal in the The New York Times. I came back to NYC from Texas this month & couldn't believe it...James Altucher was right. The city is dormant. A flutter of what it used to be. Could it come back? Sure. Will it look completely different? Absolutely.The majority of my friends with school-age children have left. Fled to second-homes or all together moving on to (literal) greener pastures. I used to loathe walking in SoHo or near the Empire State Building. Now I do it weekly & it's bliss. There are no people. No tourists. What's wonderful for a walk is terrible for businesses. For owners. You were right James. I didn't want to believe you. I needed to see it.New York is empty and I'm not sure it's coming back. This Times piece (note the irony of the same publisher of Seinfeld's article!) says it all...#travel #business #smallbusiness

Name: James Altucher
Text: WHY I WON'T VOTE AND MAYBE YOU SHOULDN'T EITHER I'm not going to vote. I've never voted in a Presidential election. I've been vote shamed all of my life. It's part of the American religion that if you don't vote, then you are a bad person. "You're not entitled to an opinion if you don't vote!"I've never seen politics so muddy as this year. And when you get in the mud with a pig, the pig gets happy and you get dirty.  There are better ways to help society than voting. And most people probably should not be voicing their opinions in an election. And maybe a vote is actually a bad thing for society. This is my "Guide to Not Voting". Please subscribe to my LinkedIn Newsletter. #politics #election2020 #votingmatters

It's part of the American religion that if you don't vote, then you are a bad person. "You're not entitled to an opinion if you don't vote!"I've never seen politics so muddy as this year. And when you get in the mud with a pig, the pig gets happy and you get dirty.  There are better ways to help society than voting. And most people probably should not be voicing their opinions in an election. And maybe a vote is actually a bad thing for society. This is my "Guide to Not Voting". Please subscribe to my LinkedIn Newsletter. #politics #election2020 #votingmatters

Name: James Altucher
Text: No one in America is as thoughtful in this "weird" moment as James Altucher. If you want to improve your life, James is the #1 person I'd pay attention to right now. His recent article, "New York City is Dead Forever" has been read over 30 million times and has been attacked by Jerry Seinfeld and the #woke mob. Our podcast chat focused on the data surrounding the upcoming presidential election. What are voters afraid of? What do they want? Who will they vote for? Here’s what I found...Listen now for the full breakdown. https://lnkd.in/gnkPrh3#FireThemNowBook #datadriven #presidentialelection #databacked #POTUS #2020election #politics #trump #joebiden #COVID #antiwoke #economy #podcasting #podcastersparadise #ThursdayThoughts #bigdata #ideas #news #entrepreneurship

Text: "Let it go” can become “hold it lightly,” and when that happens, the heart expands. This does not mean a passive resignation to fate, but rather a vital engagement with the way things actually are, unfiltered and undistorted by rigid mental lenses.

Name: James Altucher
Text: Great Seinfeld appearance tonight on 60 Mins tonight, where he once again defended NYC and challenged James Altucher’s LinkedIn article about the city’s future. Jerry: “When you were a kid, remember kicking over the anthill?” Reporter: “Sure.” Jerry Seinfeld: “That's what just happened to us. They just kicked over the whole anthill. And what do the ants do? ‘All right. Hand me the next crumb. Let's get back to work.’ And by the way, I have nothing against that guy. He's fine. I didn't like that nobody was rebutting it. Then I realized, ‘Oh, I guess that's my job.’ Somebody --a real New Yorker has to answer this.”He also made fun of LinkedIn, which is a obviously a huge source of naches:Reporter: “Are there words that are objectively funny?”Jerry Seinfeld: “LinkedIn. Putz. I mean, LinkedIn, if I was to break it down, it's the Ks and the Ns and the Ls...”

Name: Tim Ferriss
Text: “What makes life worth living? No child asks itself that question. To children, life is self-evident. Life goes without saying: whether it is good or bad makes no difference. This is because children don’t see the world, don’t observe the world, don’t contemplate the world, but are so deeply immersed in the world that they don’t distinguish between it and their own selves. Not until … a distance appears between what they are and what the world is, does the question arise: what makes life worth living?”— Karl Ove Knausgård

Name: Tim Ferriss
Text: “The dynamic of friendship is almost always underestimated as a constant force in human life: a diminishing circle of friends is the first terrible diagnostic of a life in deep trouble: of overwork, of too much emphasis on a professional identity, of forgetting who will be there when our armored personalities run into the inevitable natural disasters and vulnerabilities found in even the most average existence.[...]But no matter the medicinal virtues of being a true friend or sustaining a long close relationship with another, the ultimate touchstone of friendship is not improvement, neither of the other nor of the self; the ultimate touchstone is witness, the privilege of having been seen by someone and the equal privilege of being granted the sight of the essence of another, to have walked with them and to have believed in them, and sometimes just to have accompanied them for however brief a span, on a journey impossible to accomplish alone.”— David Whyte

Name: Larry Fink
Text: BlackRock is committed to doing its part, consistent with our purpose, to help build a better, fairer society. This commitment to make change is core to who BlackRock is and the difference we can make in the world.

Name: Larry Fink
Text: I am appalled – as is anyone who cares about diversity, fairness and justice – by the events of the last few weeks involving racial injustice in the U.S.

Name: Larry Fink
Text: As the coronavirus continues to harm economic well-being around the world, we are committed to making sure our people have the support they need during this time.

Name: Larry Fink
Text: Congratulations to my fellow BlackRock co-founder Barbara Novick, and my colleagues Anne Ackerley and Carolyn Weinberg, for being named among the most influential women in U.S. finance by Barron's! Barbara, Anne, and Carolyn are all outstanding leaders – raising the bar for corporate governance and sustainability, developing innovative retirement solutions, and increasing access to investing for millions of people. They are also outstanding mentors to women at BlackRock and across the industry. I’m proud to work with these three leaders and to see them recognized for their tremendous achievements in finance. #IWD2020https://lnkd.in/gp5BuAY

Name: Larry Fink
Text: In January, I wrote in my letter to CEOs that investors are increasingly recognizing the impact of climate risks on investment portfolios, and I believe we are on the edge of a significant reallocation of capital. The BlackRock Investment Institute recently published its latest thinking on the drivers of this reallocation and why investors will need to fundamentally reassess portfolio construction because of sustainability issues – read more here: https://lnkd.in/gSNuJAf

Name: Larry Fink
Text: Today we established The BlackRock Foundation to provide long-term funding for BlackRock’s philanthropic initiatives. As I’ve written before, I believe that companies have a responsibility to all their stakeholders, including the communities where they operate – and that includes helping to build a more sustainable and inclusive economy. We’re excited to expand on efforts such as our Emergency Savings Initiative, partnerships to help train and find employment for refugees, and much more.Our philanthropic efforts will remain aligned with our mission as a firm, and they will focus on advancing sustainability and economic mobility, and building a financial safety net for underserved and underemployed people. Read more here:

Name: Larry Fink
Text: As I’ve written before, profits and purpose are inextricably linked. This is an excellent piece in the Financial Times by Rodgin Cohen about how taking the interests of stakeholders into account is ultimately good for shareholders.

Name: Larry Fink
Text: It was a pleasure to be in Paris this morning to meet the newest employees of BlackRock, who arrived with our recent acquisition of eFront and are going to play a key role in helping us serve investors around the world. We talked about the origins of BlackRock and some of the principles that have made us successful, including how important it is to never stop learning. Thanks to Tarek Chouman and the whole eFront team for the warm welcome to your office and I’m excited about everything that we will do together.

Name: Larry Fink
Text: I was in Riyadh last week talking about foreign investment in Saudi Arabia. Like other global corporations, we represent clients around the world looking to invest there and have clients living in Saudi Arabia looking to invest abroad. Global companies operating in Saudi Arabia today often want to operate under the radar or avoid talking about their business there. I believe just the opposite. Corporate leaders should be having a public dialogue about it. Not because everything in Saudi Arabia is perfect – but precisely because everything is not.I believe greater economic integration and diversification will help Saudi Arabia build a more modern and sustainable economy and society for all of its citizens. I also believe that corporate engagement and public dialogue can help with that evolution. The murder of Jamal Khashoggi was horrifying. There is much Saudi Arabia needs to do to demonstrate that it is truly committed to reforms that strengthen the rule of law and the rights of all of its people. As I have said repeatedly to Saudi leaders, for Saudi Arabia to be on the world stage, it must act like a world leader. If the country can continue on that path, I believe it can play an even more important role in the global economy and create a brighter future for its citizens.

Name: Larry Fink
Text: #diversity #purpose #finance #women #inclusion  #history

Text: This morning, we published my annual letter to BlackRock’s shareholders, in which I explain how we deliver value for our investors, and embrace our purpose in everything we do to help people achieve financial well-being.

Name: Larry Fink
Text: The world's biggest investment firm is hiring software engineers twice as fast as investment staff. That's meant changing the dress code, offering new hires different laptops, and expanding its annual hackathon to a record 1,000 employees."We continually need to be tweaking the culture to manage a culture of innovation," BlackRock COO Rob Goldstein told LinkedIn's Devin Banerjee, CFA. "At some point, the best talent is going to want to work in the most innovative organization."Read the article here: https://lnkd.in/gW-funGDoes your industry require more tech talent? #LinkedInFinance #LinkedInVideo

Name: Larry Fink
Text: Each year, I send a letter to the CEOS of major companies – which we invest in on behalf of our clients – in support of practices that drive long-term growth.I wrote this year’s letter in the context of society’s rising expectations for companies. People are demanding that companies have a social purpose and demonstrate leadership on key issues. And they are right to: without a sense of purpose, no company, either public or private, can achieve its full potential or meet its obligations to society.You can read my full letter here:   https://lnkd.in/eYputzJ

Name: Larry Fink
Text: For #givingtuesday, I told The New York Times about a charity I’m proud to support – the International Rescue Committee:We are in the midst of the largest refugee crisis since World War II. Conflict, poverty and disaster have driven more than 65 million people from their homes in places including Syria, Sudan and Myanmar, and we have a shared responsibility to help. The International Rescue Committee is on the front lines. It’s an incredible organization — it works swiftly, in dangerous places, and it helps people rebuild their lives. That’s maybe what I admire most about the I.R.C. Its approach is built on the idea that displaced persons cannot be consigned to hopelessness — that, like anyone else, they are families trying to work, send their kids to school and build futures. That kind of empathy is what’s needed to solve this crisis, and I’m proud to support the I.R.C.

Name: Oprah Winfrey
Text: On this Sunday’s episode of “Super Soul Sunday,” I speak with the insightful LinkedIn CEO Jeff Weiner about his spiritual evolution, unique approach to running a multibillion-dollar tech company and what it means to lead and live with compassion.  The episode will also showcase inspiring examples of people around the world expressing their highest calling through the work that they do.Jeff shares the ultimate game-changer in how he lived his life: https://lnkd.in/bMzjymx I hope you are able to join me 9/18 at 11 a.m. ET/PT on OWN: Oprah Winfrey Network.

Name: Oprah Winfrey
Text: Happy to join Weight Watchers as a Board Member, investor and advisor as they evolve their already successful weight loss program, into a larger mission to inspire people to lead healthier, more fulfilling lives! I appreciate having the tools to make a lasting shift in my own life. So aligned with everything I know and believe. Can't wait for what the future holds for everyone!

Name: Sara Blakely
Text: Favorite part of this: Trust the process. Even when things aren't going your way... trust the process. #MondayMotivation

Name: Sara Blakely
Text: Spanx turns 20 today!!! Not exactly the celebration I imagined, but some very special guests helped me celebrate! Until we can all be together again.. HAPPY BIRTHDAY Spanx!!!! They said it wasn’t a good idea.They said it couldn’t be done.They said it would never work.Then they said...We wouldn’t last long, that we were a one hit wonder.Boy were they wrong!Happy 20 years of defying the odds, changing lives, putting a man on the moon (ok we didn’t do that, but close enough 😉). To becoming an industry leader, a disruptor and raising the bar on product COMFORT, QUALITY, and INNOVATION so that the competition had to step up and care about those things too. 👍 To throwing out traditional business rules and writing our own. Leading with intuition, vulnerability, empathy, and kindness. And to not taking ourselves too seriously – yet doing serious things.And last but not least... to giving back our profits to support and elevate women around the world! ❤️ Happy 20 years of great rears Spanx!!! #Entrepreneur #Business

Name: Sara Blakely
Text: Happy International #DayOfTheGirl. Girls are magical, and should be celebrated everywhere! Deeming girls “less than” or inferior for the last several thousand years, has only held back half the global innovation and disrupted the balance of earth. Girls are amazing. They’re resilient, brilliant, spunky and fearless. And… they are a big part of our future. 💪 After three amazing boys, we had a baby girl. When Tepper arrived – she was not to be messed with from the very start. We always say Tepper is half warrior, half princess because she’s fearlessly herself. When I look at her, I see my mother, my grandmothers and all the other women who came before her who made it possible for her to have a future filled with possibilities. When I think about empowering my daughter to fulfill her great potential, it means she feels supported to believe in herself, to cultivate confidence, and that she has the courage to pursue her passions and dreams regardless of her gender. I hope this for ALL little girls around the world. Throw a 👍💪👊or 💥 if you agree!! #DayOfTheGirl

Name: Sara Blakely
Text: 15 months ago, I came home to an empty dining room and a missing couch. When I asked my wife where they had gone, she casually replied, “I sold them on Facebook. We’re doing this!” This being the move to Hawaii we had talked about for so many years.Then she followed up with the following: I don’t want to look back in one, or two, or even five years from now and have the pain of regret be heavier than the weight of the struggle. (I wish I could bold that statement)The struggles are numerous and daunting at times (a global pandemic???) but so too are the joys and the lessons, and the growth.This evening we celebrated son #3’s birthday, surrounded by friends (safely spaced) on the famous “7 Mile Miracle.”Borrowing a line from Sara Blakely’s recent post: Goal - be the person in the nursing home with the best stories!So, a career change, a move, a promotion, a pitch....what will your “I’m doing this” story be? #tuesdaymotivation #tuesdaythoughts #inspire

Name: Sara Blakely
Text: Taking a page out of the ultimate #boss (Sara Blakely)’s book with this one. Today’s #wordsofwisdom:☕️You can do hard things - but make sure you lessen your load wherever/whenever possible.Ask for help. Outsource where you can. Delegate. Collaborate. I’ve had some inspiring and motivating conversations over the past few days (looking at you, Cami Zimmer and Ricardo Anzaldua to name a couple). These conversations have ignited the spark to continue #givingback and creating new ways to lighten the load for others in creative ways.I love my work and being part of partnerships that not only reach great distances but great depths as well. #strategy #boss #leadership #educationtowork #workforcesolutions #inspiredaily #teamAvenica Avenica

Text: Please, please, please be brave with your life! I often think about the end of my life, sitting in a rocking chair talking to my friend Christina (I've known since I was 3). I don't want to be saying, "well, I wanted to try this, and that, and this, and that, but I didn't because I was scared." No way! GOALS: Be the one in the nursing home with the best stories! 👍😉 #MondayMotivation #MondayMugShot
