Name: Marillyn Hewson
Text: As the COVID situation evolves, Lockheed Martin’s top priority continues to be the health and well-being of our employees and partners around the world. That’s why we’ve put measures in place to safeguard our workforce, mitigate risks to our team, and promote flexible work arrangements, wherever possible.Our people are our most valuable asset, and we are work directly with federal, state, and local officials to minimize the spread of COVID. At the same time, the Lockheed Martin team plays an essential role in strengthening national security and supporting the men and women of our military. Yesterday, the U.S. Department of Homeland Security identified the defense industrial base as a critical infrastructure that has a special responsibility to continue operations. We recognize the need for national security never stops, and neither does our duty to enhance the global capacity of our armed forces.On behalf of the 110,000 men and women of Lockheed Martin, we remain committed to the safety, security, and well-being of our people, our nation, and the world.More here: https://bit.ly/3bjEMq5

Name: Marillyn Hewson
Text: Starting a new chapter in anyone’s career draws mixed emotions, and that’s especially true for me now. But throughout my career I have embraced change. Recently, I decided to transition from my role as president and CEO of Lockheed Martin.Lockheed Martin is not just any corporation. It’s a national asset. We play an important role in supporting our military forces keeping Americans – and our allies around the world – safe and free. So, it’s important as I leave the CEO role that this national asset is in top shape, and the corporation is in good hands. Read more below.

Name: Marillyn Hewson
Text: For this year’s International Women’s Day, we have a simple message for women around the world: “You can.”With a global workforce comprised of nearly 25 percent women, we know that we can build a future that offers equality and opportunity for all. Learn more: https://lmt.co/39iOCI1 #IWD2020 #EachForEqual

Name: Marillyn Hewson
Text: Seventeen years ago, I was a part of a small group of women who gathered at Lockheed Martin's corporate headquarters to discuss common challenges and how we could collaborate to push our company forward. A small gathering evolved into the Women’s Impact Network, and today, there are thousands of members across the corporation focused on providing leadership training, mentorship, and career growth opportunities for our female talent. How do you seek to have an impact in the workplace? I look forward to hearing your stories of inspiration. And for #WomensHistoryMonth, I encourage you to check out some of the inspiring women of Lockheed Martin who are blazing trails, shaping our organization, and building on the legacy of the pioneers who came before them: https://lmt.co/39iOCI1

Name: Marillyn Hewson
Text: Congratulations, United States Air Force Capt. Kristin “BEO” Wolfe, on being named the F-35 Demo Team’s new pilot. Last year, the team showcased the aircraft’s 5th Gen capabilities to audiences across the nation. This year, I’m excited to see Capt. Wolfe take to the skies and usher in a new chapter for the F-35. As a fellow graduate of The University of Alabama, I’m confident she’ll lead the demo team to new heights. #RollTide http://bit.ly/2vBtmi7

Name: Marillyn Hewson
Text: Special thanks to the U.K.’s Secretary of State for Defence Ben Wallace for an important dialogue on how Lockheed Martin, alongside our industry colleagues, can help the U.K. continue to achieve its national security goals. Engagement with our customers is key to understanding and meeting their needs. And today, more than 1,800 Lockheed Martin employees work hand-in-hand with the U.K.’s government and armed forces to advance security, progress, and economic growth in the nation. To join our team, click here: https://lmt.co/38fPg7H

Name: Marillyn Hewson
Text: It is always rewarding to demonstrate first-hand the capabilities of our platforms. Thank you, Sec. McCarthy and Sen. Duckworth, for joining the Lockheed Martin team to witness our #Sikorsky X2 Technology in action and experience our vision for the future of vertical lift.

Name: Marillyn Hewson
Text: It's Engineers Week, and this year's theme, “Pioneers of Progress,” embodies our Lockheed Martin engineers, technologists, and scientists. Whether they work on programs based on land, at sea, in the air, space, or cyberspace, our global experts are driving progress in nearly every area of #STEM.I hope you’ll join the Lockheed Martin team in celebrating DiscoverE.org's #EWeek2020 and the engineers around the world who are helping shape the future and inspiring students to pursue exciting opportunities in this field: http://bit.ly/2v28EHV

Name: Marillyn Hewson
Text: What an amazing weekend at the Black Engineer of the Year Awards STEM conference!  Extremely humbled by the opportunity to meet Lockheed Martin’s Chairman, President and CEO, Marillyn Hewson and Senior Vice President, enterprise business transformation, Stephanie C. Hill. I also had the opportunity to meet and engage with our company’s future engineers, scientists, and innovators!Across all business areas, we were able to extend a total of 118 same day offers! This weekend really reminded me of how much I love my job!! I am extremely grateful to be apart of a company that values diversity and inclusion. #BEYA #stem #WeAreLM

Name: Marillyn Hewson
Text: Amazing weekend out in Washington DC recruiting top talent for Lockheed Martin at the BEYA 2020 Stem Conference! Humbled by the opportunity to meet Lockheed’s Chairman, President and CEO Marillyn Hewson as well!#lockheedmartin #beya2020 #leadership

Name: Marillyn Hewson
Text: Amazing weekend out in Washington DC recruiting top talent for Lockheed Martin at the BEYA 2020 Stem Conference! Humbled by the opportunity to meet Lockheed’s Chairman, President and CEO Marillyn Hewson as well!#lockheedmartin #beya2020 #leadership

Name: Marillyn Hewson
Text: It was an honor once again to talk with Marillyn Hewson, our dynamic and powerful #CEO of Lockheed Martin at #beya2020.  #aeronautics #lockheedmartin

Name: Marillyn Hewson
Text: It was an honor once again to talk with Marillyn Hewson, our dynamic and powerful #CEO of Lockheed Martin at #beya2020.  #aeronautics #lockheedmartin

Name: Marillyn Hewson
Text: Last week, I attended the Black Engineer of the Year Awards #BEYA2020 STEM Conference and Awards Gala with Lockheed Martin. The highlight of the conference was celebrating 31 talented Lockheed Martin colleagues as they were recognized for outstanding achievements in STEM. Before the gala, I had the pleasure to briefly chat with a personal #sHERO of mine, Marillyn Hewson, Chairman, President, and CEO of Lockheed Martin. Thank you Marillyn for your continued commitment to BEYA! I am already looking forward to #BEYA2021!

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: What lessons has Nasdaq learned while navigating 2020’s challenges? Nasdaq President and CEO Adena Friedman joined Fortune CEO Alan Murray to discuss during Workday’s Conversations for a Changing World.The takeaways from #wdayconversations:💡 You can never overprepare for unprecedented challenges🧑‍💼 Being human is part of being a leader↗ The Purpose Initiative focuses on inclusive growth and prosperity, especially for those who are largely underservedLearn more: http://spr.ly/6048GfF40

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: Kudos to Keith McIver '88, director of development at Columbia College in Missouri, on being named president of the Minority Men's Network, a local non-profit focused on leadership development and community service. Read more: https://lnkd.in/gMTXGhw

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: Nasdaq has a long-standing partnership with Invesco US to provide public access to the companies at the forefront of innovation. We’ve achieved this through our partnership that began in 1999 with the launch of the QQQ ETF. We are now moving forward together on the next generation of investment products through the Invesco QQQ Innovation Suite, which expands our Nasdaq-100 product ecosystem to be more inclusive and accessible, giving investors more opportunities to invest in the future.

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: Today, Nasdaq announces a new product suite with Invesco US related to the Invesco $QQQ, a top-performing large-cap growth ETF that tracks the innovative companies included in the Nasdaq-100 Index (NDX).Learn more: http://spr.ly/6045GN5DT

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: We have big news! Our new Invesco QQQ Innovation Suite has launched in partnership with Nasdaq. We are work together to create innovative ETF products that drive broader participation in investing and allow more democratized access to ground-breaking companies. Learn more about the new members of the QQQ family: https://inves.co/2T3ABaR

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: The ability for companies to raise capital is crucial for a well-functioning economy, and the listing on a stock exchange is an unparalleled source of funding in terms of visibility and access to capital for companies of all sizes.  After a spring with extreme volatility and uncertainty, I am happy to see the listings climate heating up again, both here in Europe and in the U.S.  Our U.S. exchange saw 41 listings in September, among them the addition of AstraZeneca - now listed with Nasdaq in both New York and Stockholm – while our European exchanges saw its best September in six years. So far in 2020, 46 companies have listed with Nasdaq in the Nordics, and we are particularly happy to see an interest from non-Nordic companies such as the recently listed Implantica (Switzerland) and Media and Games Invest (MGI) (Germany). Other recent highlights are the listings of the consumer tech pioneer Readly in Stockholm and the EUR 1.6 billion listing of Ignitis Group in the Baltics.  Watch this interview with our European Head of Listings Adam Kostyál on CNBC for more thoughts on some current listings trends and an IPO outlook in Q4 and beyond.

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: Congratulations to Paul Milgrom and Robert Wilson. Their work demonstrates that auctions play a vital role every day in markets everywhere. It’s a vision that we share at Nasdaq. Learn more about their insights and discoveries: https://lnkd.in/ep-PezC

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: This week, CME Group launched a futures contract on the Nasdaq-100® Volatility Index (VOLQ®), providing investors with a new way to gauge equity market swings.Learn more about the VOLQ: http://spr.ly/6044G2zsk

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: At Nasdaq, we recognize that diversity, inclusion and belonging are a fundamental driver of our corporate growth and culture. We also believe that our organization in full  contributes to our success.For the first time in our history, we are publishing our global workforce composition that illustrates  our efforts which strive to make an impact internally and in the communities we serve:http://spr.ly/6046G2MZe

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: Nasdaq Head of European Operations Gunilla Hellqvist talks about business continuity planning. This practice helped to prepare her team for operation under #COVID, ensuring market resiliency.Learn more: http://spr.ly/6041G2jTD

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: Actions Matter. Today, JPMorgan Chase & Co. is making a $30 billion commitment over the next five years to address drivers of the racial wealth divide. We have a collective responsibility to take action to address systemic racism, starting within our own workforce by building a more inclusive environment, and helping Black and Latinx people build small businesses, become homeowners, find an affordable place to live, and improve their financial health.

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: Talking with Lars Ottersgård, who oversees our global Market Technology business, we discussed how #COVID has accelerated the move to the cloud, SaaS and our continued focus on data, analytics and modernizing markets. I'm proud of our client-driven work as a company and our vigorous approach.

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: It’s clear that capitalism needs an upgrade. Employers have a responsibility to pay their workers a living wage. This is not only the right thing to do, but has long-term benefits, since decreasing employees’ financial stress fosters a more engaged and innovative workforce. I’ve made the financial health of PayPal employees a personal priority, launching our own employee financial health program to make sure our employees are able to focus on serving our customers. I’m excited to partner with my friends Martin Whittaker and Paul Tudor Jones II at JUST Capital to bring this effort beyond PayPal’s walls. We’re announcing a new initiative to help other companies conduct a Worker Financial Wellness Assessment – something I found was a critical first step to understanding the current financial state of my workforce and how to make tangible, often life-changing improvements. We’ll also be collaborating with Jennifer Tescher at Financial Health Network and the Good Jobs Institute to give CEOs the resources and counsel to undertake this assessment. Together, with this comprehensive resource guide, we can help establish new financial standards for the employees that power our economy. Read more in The New York Times with Lauren Hirsch: https://nyti.ms/36FGjrc

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: Seasoned director Barry Lawson Williams shares why #diversity is key to #DrivingExcellence. Plus, find out why he says companies with greater diversity and thought are better performers.Watch the full episode here: http://spr.ly/6046GLNIg

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: Today, Nasdaq launches the Purpose Initiative, designed to support women and underrepresented minority communities with the resources needed to grow and sustain their businesses. The Purpose Initiative comprises the company’s philanthropic, community outreach, corporate sustainability, and employee volunteerism programs, to leverage Nasdaq’s unique place at the center of capital creation, markets, and technology.Learn more about the launch here: https://lnkd.in/dEDvc_s

Text: For #InternationalPodcastDay, Nasdaq is looking back at episodes from the latest season of #TomorrowsCapital.Amid a global pandemic, “we’ve had more of a sense of team than ever,” says President and CEO Adena Friedman about Nasdaq.Listen to her discuss with guest hosts from CNBC Fast Money, Dan Nathan and Guy Adami: http://spr.ly/6040GxO7a

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: As an extension of Nasdaq’s Purpose Initiative, we've launched a Smart Investing portal to inform the general public on all elements of retail trading and investing. This educational hub includes a range of resources on the principles of investing, from how diversification can help reduce risks, to how ETFs and options work.New content will be added on a regular basis and is organized in three categories: ➝ Introduction to investing➝ Money matters➝ Trading essentialsWith data showing 14% of Americans do not invest because they don’t know how, Nasdaq believes that greater access to educational resources can help to drive increased investor engagement from all ages, genders, and race. Aligned with Nasdaq’s renewed purpose, the Smart Investing portal’s tools are aimed to help investors – both seasoned and novice alike – make more informed decisions about saving, making trades, and protecting their money.Visit the hub here: https://lnkd.in/dSQj6jy Learn more about Nasdaq’s Purpose Initiative here: https://lnkd.in/e_w5Uxc

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: Today, Nasdaq announced the launch of our Purpose Initiative, designed to advance inclusive growth and prosperity. The Purpose Initiative aims to leverage Nasdaq’s unique place at the center of capital creation, markets, and technology to support women and underrepresented minority entrepreneurs with the resources needed to grow and sustain their businesses.

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: Ruth Bader Ginsburg dedicated her life to be an advocate for equality. Her career paved the way for countless women to expand their professional ambitions, and her actions as a trailblazing Supreme Court Justice opened new doors of opportunity for so many while strengthening societal protections for millions of women and underrepresented groups.  In my own career, I benefited from the actions that Justice Ginsburg took to ensure women have an equal opportunity in the workplace, and as a result, I have carried with me the conviction that I could reach the highest levels in my field. Because of her strength and courage, Justice Ginsburg leaves a legacy that will benefit our country for decades to come.

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: To honor the late #RuthBaderGinsburg, Moira Forbes asked 17 female leaders from across industries to share their personal and professional reflections on the singular spark of #RBG — including Nasdaq CEO Adena Friedman.  Read their responses here: http://spr.ly/6048Gvvs6

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: With #COVID persisting, the push toward moving markets to the cloud has never been more pertinent. Scalability has been a major advantage for Nasdaq during the pandemic and allows firms to scale applications and services more efficiently than managing it on their own servers.Nasdaq will migrate markets to the cloud over the next decade, allowing firms to realize added scalability, efficiency and capacity.Learn more in the The Wall Street Journal: http://spr.ly/6048GQmfA

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: Our goal at Nasdaq is to bring transparency, fairness and integrity to the markets. As a recognized global leader in surveillance technology, we are expanding our efforts in combating financial crime by launching a new artificial intelligence-powered offering to help automate anti-money laundering investigations.

It’s time to mark a shift from winner-takes-all mentality to shared prosperity. Learn more about how #Imperative21 proposes we RESET capitalism now: www.imperative21.co Art by: Amplifier, Thomas WImberly and Nurul Yaqin.

Her appointment as CEO also represents another significant milestone for women in the financial industry and across corporate America, and it sends an important message to all professional women -- there are no limits to our capabilities and our potential. I would also like to thank Mike Corbat for his contributions to the industry and his leadership at Citi during his tenure.

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: Nasdaq’s Brad Peterson and Donald Beery joined Datadog’s #Dash2020 to discuss market resiliency amidst #COVID. How did our global team maintain markets remotely? Here’s how ⬇️.✅ Moving to a remote environment required: ensuring employee safety, establishing trust and over-communication. CEO Adena Friedman’s empathy and compassion were critical during #COVID, as it created space to have open conversations.✅ Hurricane Sandy taught Nasdaq that we should regularly operate in crisis mode. Since then, Nasdaq has run global markets remotely and spends 40+ weekends testing systems and processes. Following any event, teams measure performance and optimization opportunities. ✅ Every morning the team holds a global call before the market opens where participants test for system health. There are policies, procedures and practice in place to maximize efficiencies.✅ Nasdaq distributes critical operations globally across multiple locations in the US and Europe. The strategic distribution of operation centers creates a robust fabric.✅ The tools and technology that make #WFH a success: connectivity, visualization tools, and constant communication.

Name: Adena Friedman

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: It’s great to see PayPal celebrate a major milestone – five years ago today was PayPal’s first day trading on Nasdaq as an independent, publicly listed company. The last five years have been an exciting and educational journey for all of us. I’m grateful to our PayPal community for their ongoing commitment to our mission and success.

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: Five years ago today, PayPal celebrated its first day trading on Nasdaq, marking an exciting new chapter as an independent publicly listed company. In honor of that anniversary, I want to thank our employees, customers and partners for supporting our mission and share a few photos from my favorite PayPal memories over these last years, including visits with our teams across the globe, meeting with our talented interns, and Kids At Work Day. Our company has been on an incredible journey since then, and our commitment to democratizing financial services has never been stronger than it is today.  The COVID pandemic and underlying economic downturn have put a spotlight on how important it is to keep our customers at the heart of everything we do, help connect people with the products and services they need, and ensure we’re bringing even more people into the global digital economy. Today we serve more than 300 million active customers, reflecting incredible growth that is a testament to the hard work of our global employees. There is still so much to do to achieve our mission and I look forward to what lies ahead for our company.

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: This is particularly true at this moment, when the pandemic can be a portal between the world and all the ideas we need to leave behind and the world we need to imagine and create.

More than ever, we recognize the importance of uniting together in solidarity against racism. https://lnkd.in/dAfKiTk

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: The #COVID pandemic has ushered in unprecedented and unpredictable changes into our world—including the role of CEO. Barron's highlights the top 25 CEO's who have excelled during the crisis, including Nasdaq's Adena Friedman. The entire #NasdaqFam couldn’t agree more with Adena’s recognition and we are grateful for her leadership.

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: As my time in Detroit as an ICU travel nurse for COVID has come to an end, I return to Nashville humbled by the opportunity to have worked alongside many remarkable nurses, physicians, respiratory therapists, techs, and health care professionals at Henry Ford Health System. I never expected to return to bedside nursing, but I feel privileged to have served alongside such selfless health care professionals during such a turbulent time. I would like to thank Vanderbilt University - Owen Graduate School of Management, whose professors worked with me so that I could complete my final semester of business school while helping fight the pandemic. I look forward to continuing my journey in health care at Medtronic this August, and am grateful to the team I will be joining for their continued support during my assignment.

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: We at Nasdaq are deeply saddened to hear of the passing of our friend and former colleague Tom Gira.  Early in our careers, we both worked under one parent organization, the NASD, until Nasdaq was spun out into an independent company. I was fortunate enough to have worked with Tom while we were a part of NASD, and, thereafter, during his long and successful career at FINRA.  Tom was instrumental in structuring Nasdaq’s ongoing regulatory relationship with FINRA and his legacy will have a lasting impact on our industry for decades to come. He was truly a thoughtful friend and terrific family man. I am joined by many Nasdaq colleagues in shared grief at his passing.

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: I’m so proud of the work that the Nasdaq Tech teams worldwide are doing to embrace and transition markets and data to the cloud. Financial markets are part of the critical infrastructure supporting the global economy, and the cloud offers limitless opportunities to innovate. This byline from Bradley Peterson and Lars Ottersgård demonstrates how we are helping move this forward.

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: Ran thru Wendy's drive thru just now, the girl at the window was crying. Her boss was standing there explaining she had to leave work because her mask broke and they had no extras. She was sobbing, "but I don't have a ride and I NEED the money!" Her boss was sympathetic and looked sorry for her. I hopped out, grabbed the bag of extra masks in my trunk that my husband gave me, and handed them a few thru the window. They both looked so shocked and it made the poor girl cry harder when she was thanking me. I got a free Frosty and a damn good feeling inside! #payitforward #kindnesscounts #goodvibes #wendysfrostysthough #yum

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: Today, Nasdaq announces next steps in our global commitment to equality. Black lives matter, and we are taking additional steps to create long-term, positive change in our company, communities and beyond. This day is also the 155th anniversary of #Juneteenth, which recognizes the end of slavery in the United States. It takes new meaning today with an ongoing health crisis and recent events that have magnified the injustices disproportionately impacting Black communities.Nasdaq is:→ Focusing on Nasdaq’s communication, training, development, professional advancement, and talent acquisition programs. The company’s Global Link of Black Employees network is engaged in identifying and prioritizing our efforts.  → Allocating $3 million to: Equal Justice Initiative, NAACP's COVID project, and the World Central Kitchen program. These organizations provide critical assistance to communities disproportionately impacted by the global health, economic, and social justice crises. → Honoring the day by Amplifying Black Voices on the Nasdaq Tower in Times Square, an ongoing series of art and photography documenting Black American life featuring artists Debora Cheyenne, Mark Clennon and Steven John Irby. Learn more: https://lnkd.in/e4AskVk

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: Today, Nasdaq is sharing additional steps in our continued commitment to diversity and inclusion. Black lives matter and we are committed to creating lasting, positive change within our company and in the communities we serve.There is a lot of momentum inside of Nasdaq to build on and to accelerate our efforts to advance our culture – and our ultimate goal is for Nasdaq’s global team to reflect the diversity of the populations of each of the countries where we operate across all levels of the organization. We will continue to improve our culture and our existing focus on respect and belonging for all of our employees. Given where we are today, it is a bold goal, and we have to admit to ourselves that we have a lot of work to do to achieve it. But by moving #ForwardTogether, I am optimistic that we can tackle tough issues and literally change the world – by rewriting tomorrow. Read more about our efforts here: https://lnkd.in/e3XH7De

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: Nasdaq is committed to using its platform to create positive change in its immediate communities and beyond. Being an effective ally and anti-racist is a continuous process that requires education and action. We have and will continue to compile resources to educate ourselves and others on how to be an advocate for racial equality and equity. Read about them here: http://spr.ly/6048GKA04

Name: Adena Friedman

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: Today's Supreme Court decision is an important milestone in the hard-fought journey for equal treatment for LGBTQI+ people in the workplace, building on the foundation set by the Civil Rights Act of 1964. As the court noted in its majority opinion, “Sometimes small gestures can have unexpected consequences. Major initiatives practically guarantee them. In our time, few pieces of federal legislation rank in significance with the Civil Rights Act of 1964.” While there is much more to do to achieve equal rights and inclusion, let’s use this decision as a catalyst to drive progress in our society.

Name: Adena Friedman
Text: Today’s landmark ruling by the Supreme Court is a major victory for LGBTQ+ equal rights in the workplace. Nasdaq has been a proud supporter of the LGBTQ+ community and while this year’s #PrideMonth month looks a bit different, we are celebrating virtually by spotlighting our OPEN Nasdaq employees – because telling their stories and experiences bring us #ForwardTogether

Name: Sramana Mitra
Text: I’m publishing this series on LinkedIn called #Colors to explore a topic that I care deeply about: the Renaissance Mind. I am just as passionate about entrepreneurship, technology, and business, as I am about art and culture. In this series, I will typically publish a piece of art – one of my paintings – and I request you to spend a minute or two deeply meditating on it. I urge you to watch your feelings, thoughts, reactions to the piece, and write what comes to you, what thoughts it triggers, in the dialog area. Let us see what stimulation this interaction yields. Name: Carrie Schwab-Pomerantz
Text: Financial education is so important, and it starts right here at home and in our local communities. That's why Charles Schwab Tampa is so excited to partner with Charles Schwab Foundation and DONORSCHOOSE.ORG INC to support Mrs. Torres at Paul Wharton High School in bringing #FinancialLiteracy to over 70 students! #Schwab4Good Juliana Ramirez, CRPC® Kevin Colosimo Michele Moskonas

Name: Carrie Schwab-Pomerantz
Text: Mrs. Lowry wanted to inspire her students, especially girls, to explore STEM fields.  One important component of a successful STEM career is building a strong foundation in math and she is teaching fractions to students in Grades 3-5 at Kernersville Elementary School in Kernersville, NC.    Charles Schwab Winston-Salem and Greensboro offices are proud to support Mrs. Lowry via DonorsChoose.org.   At Charles Schwab Foundation, we believe financial education can open doors and change lives. That is why we partner with DonorsChoose. Together, we support innovative financial education projects in K-12 classrooms across America by championing teachers and giving students the financial knowledge, skills and confidence they need to thrive.#Kernersville #Greensboro #WinstonSalem #Schwab4Good

Name: Carrie Schwab-Pomerantz
Text: There are so many preconceived notions about financial planning, but I can’t emphasize enough that a financial plan isn't something esoteric or only for wealthy investors. It doesn't have to be complicated or take a lot of time. And nowadays, it doesn't have to be expensive. #AskCarrie

Name: Carrie Schwab-Pomerantz
Text: I remember in high school when my mentor Lisa Kossiver from Students Rising Above took a group of us Black and Brown students from East Palo Alto, Ca, a low income community to the bank to help us open our first bank account and credit card to start building good credit. Today I have a credit score of 800, I am licensed as a Financial Professional and I help advise clients on how to navigate their finances and accumulate wealth. My goal is to serve as an example and help empower more minorities and people from diverse backgrounds to learn about money and know that they can build wealth by developing a saving and investment strategy. You can reach out to speak with a professional like myself.I look forward to work with @YMCA of San Francisco’s Bayview YMCA as part of this year’s @CharlesSchwab Pro Bono Challenge! My fellow volunteers and I will help Bayview review mobile apps for financial education so their students can learn virtually about banking, building credit, and investing! #Schwab4Good #Probono #Financialliteracy #Community #Money #bridgethegap Carrie Schwab-Pomerantz Richard A. Armellini Rosalinda Tran

Name: Carrie Schwab-Pomerantz
Text: Today is my 1 year anniversary of being a Commissioner on the Commission of the Status of Womens for the City and County of San Francisco. Although I am still trying to find my bearings and COVID hasn’t helped, I am looking forward to my second year to dig in! Thank you Mayor London Breed for appointing me and your trust. It’s a honor to serve and learn from these incredible strong women leaders. Thank You President Breanna Zwart (she/her/ella), VP Dr. Shokooh Miry  , Past Commissioner Debbie Mesloh , Commissioner Andrea Shorter ,Commissioner Carrie Schwab-Pomerantz, and Commissioner Julie Soo for your mentorship and all your support.Special thanks to the San Francisco Department on the Status of Women for all the work they do for the commission and the city.

Name: Carrie Schwab-Pomerantz
Text: After reading Micki Wagner's Worth Media article, which extensively quotes Carrie Schwab-Pomerantz, chair & president of the Charles Schwab Foundation, I can say confidently that you should meet #virginia:  + where economic education and #financialliteracy is incorporated in the K-12 curriculum; + where a one-credit Economics and Personal Finance course is required for graduation; + where teachers gain access to professional development and receive ongoing support (at no cost to them); + and where all sectors - the government, the state, the school divisions, families, employers, nonprofits - work together to improve the life outcomes of our young people. This is progress over perfection. This is moving the needle. This is the Virginia Council on Economic Education (VCEE). Let's talk.

Name: Carrie Schwab-Pomerantz
Text: I remember in high school when my mentor Lisa Kossiver from Students Rising Above took a group of us Black and Brown students from East Palo Alto, Ca, a low income community to the bank to help us open our first bank account and credit card to start building good credit. Today I have a credit score of 800, I am licensed as a Financial Professional and I help advise clients on how to navigate their finances and accumulate wealth. My goal is to serve as an example and help empower more minorities and people from diverse backgrounds to learn about money and know that they can build wealth by developing a saving and investment strategy. You can reach out to speak with a professional like myself.I look forward to work with @YMCA of San Francisco’s Bayview YMCA as part of this year’s @CharlesSchwab Pro Bono Challenge! My fellow volunteers and I will help Bayview review mobile apps for financial education so their students can learn virtually about banking, building credit, and investing! #Schwab4Good #Probono #Financialliteracy #Community #Money #bridgethegap Carrie Schwab-Pomerantz Richard A. Armellini Rosalinda Tran

Name: Carrie Schwab-Pomerantz
Text: The Nobel Prize in Chemistry was awarded today to U.S. biochemist Jennifer Doudna and French scientist Emmanuelle Charpentier for their work on developing a method of genome editing, also known as CRISPR/Cas9 genetic scissors.  A female first: This year marks the first time 2 women jointly share the award without a male awardee. Only 5 other women have received the prize out of 185 honorees since its inception in 1901.  https://lnkd.in/etHdU3n

Text: Based on key trends, benchmarking data and insights from The Civic 50 2020 honorees, we are proud to release this year's The Civic 50 impact report, providing insights on how leading companies do well by doing good.

Name: Carrie Schwab-Pomerantz
Text: Moving essay from Sophie Grégoire Trudeau from #WorldMentalHealthDay: "It is time to unlock ourselves, trust our inner compass, share our stories and keep faith in our shared human goodness. We will. And we will only heal this world if we heal ourselves first."

Name: Carrie Schwab-Pomerantz
Text: At Charles Schwab, our company has always been dedicated to building and maintaining a dynamic organization and culture that values and reflects the individual strengths of every employee. We understand that through diversity we gain a wider range of perspectives and experiences, which benefits everyone and enables us to support our business strategy of "seeing through clients’ eyes." Our commitment to building an inclusive environment where everyone feels valued is part of what sets us apart. We believe diversity and inclusion are part of our success as a company, our unique culture and our purpose of serving every client with passion and integrity. Thank you Dr. Laurie Dymes from North Lincoln Middle School in Denver, NC for recognizing the diversity in your classroom!  The Charlotte Complex of Charles Schwab is proud to support your classroom through DonorsChoose.org.  #Schwab4Good

Name: Carrie Schwab-Pomerantz
Text: This year, our most vulnerable populations have become even more vulnerable. 2.5 million elderly people are currently cut off from family, many people have lost their jobs and the homeless numbers are rising.  Children have traded recess for video calls, and health care providers are risking their lives daily. Our world needs kindness more than ever. The Southeast Leadership team spent the afternoon today putting together #kyndkits for those in need. As always, this group had fun volunteering together and made an impact at the same time!#schwabcares #schwab4good #schwabimpact #bekind #covidkindness #southeastleadership #virtualvolunteering Michele Moskonas Monica Vazquez, MSF Juliana Ramirez, CRPC® Kevin Colosimo David Rosenfeld, CWS®, AAMS® Joe LaCagnina, CWS® Jason Hale Olivier Guerin Robert Schmidt jim gallagher Adam Heatley Ty Gibson James Settle, MBA Skip Markins

Name: Carrie Schwab-Pomerantz
Text: The #COVID crisis has been a stark reminder of how fast financial hardships can hit. Our new #FinancialLiteracy survey shows 51% of all Americans would struggle to cover an unexpected expense. Action step: Start an emergency savings if you can. https://lnkd.in/g9SNi6X. See the survey at https://lnkd.in/gS-EvHQ. #FinancialPlanningMonth

Name: Carrie Schwab-Pomerantz
Text: A lack of #FinancialLiteracy can have a lasting impact, and COVID has revealed how crucial it is that we make financial literacy a national priority. We can get started by having money conversations at home with our kids and bringing financial literacy programs to local schools. I enjoyed speaking about this with Liz Frazier, CFP at Forbes. Read more here.

Name: Carrie Schwab-Pomerantz
Text: Thank you Thea Lewis, CFP®, Carrie Schwab-Pomerantz, & and the incredible team at Charles Schwab for supporting our Boys & Girls Clubs of Central Orange Coast, the Boys & Girls Clubs of Metro Los Angeles, and so many Clubs across the country!  #collectiveimpact #financialliteracy #SchwabGives

Name: Carrie Schwab-Pomerantz
Text: Today is my 1 year anniversary of being a Commissioner on the Commission of the Status of Womens for the City and County of San Francisco. Although I am still trying to find my bearings and COVID hasn’t helped, I am looking forward to my second year to dig in! Thank you Mayor London Breed for appointing me and your trust. It’s a honor to serve and learn from these incredible strong women leaders. Thank You President Breanna Zwart (she/her/ella), VP Dr. Shokooh Miry  , Past Commissioner Debbie Mesloh , Commissioner Andrea Shorter ,Commissioner Carrie Schwab-Pomerantz, and Commissioner Julie Soo for your mentorship and all your support.Special thanks to the San Francisco Department on the Status of Women for all the work they do for the commission and the city.

Name: Carrie Schwab-Pomerantz
Text: Exciting life update: I passed the CFP Board exam! After 18 months of hard work studying the ins and outs of financial planning, I'll soon be able to put those coveted letters after my name. I have so much to learn still and will certainly continue to be a student of all the CFPs who work day in and day out with clients, but I'm thrilled to have this credential under my belt and to continue to bring you smart, helpful, and (hopefully) inspiring personal finance stories through Business Insider. Many thanks to my very supportive editor Libby Kane, who congratulated me with this awesome CFP merch 🤑 , and my former editor Lauren Lyons Cole, who fervently encouraged me to pursue the certification in the first place.

Name: Carrie Schwab-Pomerantz
Text: One of the most rewarding parts of my job is being able to help people take control of their finances and manage their money. I had a few thoughts following my conversation with The Wall Street Journal’s Bourree Lam at #WSJWomenIn the Workplace Forum that I wanted to share with you all:  💰 Saving for retirement should be a priority. Invest in    yourself. You’re more in charge than ever of securing your future.📝 Budgeting is crucial in this environment. One way to keep track of your budget? Grab a piece of paper and write down all of your expenditures for one month. 🤝 If you’re struggling with your finances, don’t be afraid to seek help from a professional or confide in your loved ones. 🏥 When it comes to emergency funds, the rule of thumb is to save 3-6 months of cash for essential expenses like food, utilities and housing.👶 We need to start teaching our kids financial literacy at a young age. But your financial education should never end. For those who weren’t able to join the conference yesterday, please comment below or reach out with your personal finance questions! You can also visit SchwabMoneyWise.com for more resources.

Name: Ryan Holmes
Text: I caught Google CEO Sundar Pichai talking recently about "on-sites" as the future of work — i.e., using offices just for occasional team gatherings, with most work done at home.This got me thinking, what's the optimal amount of time to spend "in-office"? This is obviously different for everyone, but I'd love to know your thoughts. This is actually a question with a lot of nuances, so let me know in the comments if you have a perspective.  #wfhlife #productivity #leadership #culture

Name: Ryan Holmes
Text: So, remember "off-sites" — when employees got together in a hotel or conference center for special team-building or planning exercises? According to Google CEO, Sundar Pichai, the future of work is a spin on that concept: "on-sites."  Basically -- we'd work from home most of the time, then just come into the office together for special occasions.  Do you buy it? Would this work for you? I explore the potential of "on-sites," plus look at ways to fight Zoom fatigue, in my latest newsletter. Oh yeah, I've brought back the #DadJoke tradition, as well ... "What did the shy pebble wish for ... ?" Check out the newsletter below to find out!  #leadership #remotework cc: Victoria Taylor

Name: Ryan Holmes
Text: How can senior leaders motivate and inspire during the crisis? Great hacks here from Jeffrey Hayzlett, former CMO of Kodak and CEO of The C-Suite Network https://lnkd.in/gdRRd78

Name: Ryan Holmes
Text: Have you heard of "dopamine dressing"? What's the optimal length for a "cat nap" in your home office? I take a look at these unusual #WFH hacks, as well as the explosion of the #gigeconomy during the crisis, in my latest newsletter.  As always, love to know your thoughts! What's the most surprising work-from-home hack you've come up with over the last few months?  #remotework #leadership #inspiration

Name: Ryan Holmes
Text: I saw a report recently from Upwork saying that half of Gen Z is now engaged in some form of #freelance work, partly as a result of the crisis. I was wondering if this trend extends across the board. Are you taking on more "gig work" these days (or doing it for the first time)? Love to know in the comments what kind of work you're doing and what motivated the shift. #gigeconomy cc:Victoria Taylor

Name: Ryan Holmes
Text: Great insights here from Clearbanc CEO Andrew D'Souza on the power of social media for leaders, especially in turbulent times.

Name: Ryan Holmes
Text: Welcome to Getting Social with Biz leaders, our LinkedIn live series where we chat with the top business leaders and professionals using social media and digital channels to drive their business. On today’s live we’re welcoming Andrew D'Souza! Andrew is CEO & co-founder of Clearbanc, the world's largest eCommerce investor now funding B2B SaaS. He’s also one of the finalists for 2020 CSuite Award for Best Business Leader on LinkedIn-- and with good reason! On a weekly basis, Andrew posts authentic and engaging videos on his LinkedIn about leadership, management, and entrepreneurship. Not many CEOs have leveraged social media in the way authentic and consistent way Andrew does. He documents every step of Clearbanc's growth inclusive of the good, bad, the triumphs, and the challenges. How and why does he do it? Tune in to find out!

Name: Ryan Holmes
Text: A bit late to the party here, but super excited for Greg Smith and the Thinkific team. I was an early investor and have been a long-time supporter of this great product!

Name: Ryan Holmes
Text: Perks/benefits are such a critical part of company culture -- especially in terms of recruiting/retaining talent. My question is: what are the new "must-have" perks for #remotework? In the past, the Googles and Facebooks of the world raced to one-up one another in terms of office perks — from catered meals and in-office gyms to climbing walls and salons. In the #WFH era, who’s going to be the company that’s known for having amazing remote work culture and benefits — the company all the best new grads and talent will flock to? Love to know your thoughts on key WFH benefits below!

Name: Ryan Holmes
Text: Theory: Remote work perks are going to be the next big differentiator when it comes to recruiting and retaining great employees.  Just one problem ... nobody's nailed the perfect "WFH benefit package" yet.  Some analysis and insights on what we're really looking for in WFH perks -- and which companies are on the right track -- in my latest newsletter. As always, love to know your thoughts on what WFH benefits are absolute "must-haves."#wfh #leadership #benefits #culture

Name: Ryan Holmes
Text: Although I usually share posts on LinkedIn around marketing, today I have a bit more of a personal update... A couple weeks ago Jennah and I said "YES" to being work-from-home colleagues for life by getting married!After the ceremony, we took 2 weeks offline to travel around Vancouver island and disconnect from social media to soak in the milestone. Now we're back online to say thanks everyone for their kind messages, surprise gifts (you know who you are) and encouraging notes. We couldn't be more excited for the next chapter ahead and are ready to dig back into the work world!

Name: Ryan Holmes
Text: Question: Would you rather do job #interviews remotely? As an employer, I would have answered "no" before the crisis. But having gone through this process recently, I'm seeing some clear upsides to virtual #hiring. Not perfect. But as process and tools get better, this could be one change that's here to stay.  Thoughts?

Name: Ryan Holmes
Text: Excited to be featured in Forbes talking about where to find inspiration for your next great business idea! Some fantastic insights here from friends and colleagues, including Lewis Howes, Jeremiah Owyang, Terry Hogan, Alec Tidey and Jill Sinclair. Big takeaways: 1) Prioritize pain. 2) Seek un-balance. 3) Find frustration, add tech. 4) Ask yourself, What’s NOT here? 5) Listen to hearts, not lips.  Agree/disagree? Love to know where you find inspo for business ideas! #entrepreneurship #inspiration #startuplife https://lnkd.in/gGbvbsE

Name: Ryan Holmes
Text: Excited to share the latest milestone on our mission to modernize competitive enablement: US$15m Series A led by Craft Ventures. Brian Murray and David O. Sacks are amazing individuals who know how to build a category. It's more challenging than ever to win, expand and defend business. We believe every department of every business will benefit from competitive insight. We're fortunate to have hundreds of companies sign on and see tangible, revenue impacting results. Klue is their system of record for compete content. We'll be using this investment to broaden intel collection, machine enrich curation, and innovate how intel is consumed. Expect more integrations with partners like Highspot, Seismic, Gong, Chorus.ai, Microsoft Teams, and deeper integrations with Salesforce, Slack and Google. Grateful to early believers Matthew Coblentz, Jay Nakagawa, and Ryan Holmes who took a chance on us early on, and for amazing clients like Shopify, Cisco and SAP who are modernizing CE with us today. #klue #productmarketing #competitiveintelligence #salesenablement #sales #tech #venturecapital #startups #bctech #canadatech

Name: Ryan Holmes
Text: Although my posts on Linkedin are mostly commentary around business, economics or innovation, this post today is a personal update. Some of you may have heard that I was struck by a jackknifing transport truck while out riding my bike on Wednesday. Thankfully my head was unaffected but despite several surgeries, it is unlikely that I will regain the use of my legs.    I am as committed, and as able as always, and will be back in full force as soon as humanly possible on the pending launch of my Private Equity fund and to continue my advocacy work for Canadian Innovation.  I want to thank all of the hospital staff for my wonderful treatment and care and truly appreciate all the love and support we are getting from our family and friends.  I do ask that my family’s privacy be respected at this time, and I expect my social media interaction will be limited for the near term. Thank you again for all of the support and I look forward to reconnecting with you again soon. John

Name: Ryan Holmes
Text: Question: What's on your WFH software wish list (apps you wish existed, but don't)?  Better video calls? Smarter calendars? Slack alternatives? I ask because, honestly, today's tools leave so much to be desired. The reason we're all experiencing so much video fatigue right now is partly because the tech has a long way to go. Ditto for frustrations with messaging tools, calendars, etc.  Love to know what some of your dream #WFH apps would be!  #productivity #apps

Name: Ryan Holmes
Text: Theory: pretty soon, the phrase "remote work" is going to be redundant. Why? Because that's just what "work" means going forward. Problem is we've still got SO far to go in terms of having the  tools, culture and infrastructure to really thrive in a #WFH setting. (Zoom, I love you, but I can't stand you ... there's got to be a better way.)I dig into some of the macro changes we really need -- childcare, home design, software, etc. -- to make WFH work in my latest TECH AND WORK newsletter. Love to know your thoughts -- what are the biggest changes/improvements needed if WFH is truly the new normal going forward?

Name: Ryan Holmes
Text: Question: Why does #Walmart (really) want #TikTok? I've got a theory — love to know what folks in the industry think. It's got a few parts: 1) Ecommerce giants like Walmart and Amazon are currently highly dependent on social networks like Facebook to reach an audience and advertise. 2) As social networks become ecomm players in their own right (a la Facebook Shops), a conflict of interest emerges. Traditional ecomm giants risk losing access to their audience if, say, Facebook decides to limit the reach of their ads down the road.  3)  In the long view, building/buying their own social network is the only surefire way for the Walmarts and Amazons of the world to secure access to audiences. 4) Hence, Walmart's interest in TikTok (which is hard to explain otherwise). OK - probably a few holes in that theory, but I wonder if anyone else out there is thinking along the same lines. Love to know your thoughts.  cc: Jeremiah Owyang

Name: Ryan Holmes
Text: Question for the #entrepreneurs out there: Where do you get inspiration for your business ideas from? I’d love to know what triggers your “lightbulb moment.” If you’re already in business, what inspired you to go down that particular path? If you’re thinking of starting something, where are you getting your ideas? Maybe it’s conversations with friends. Maybe it’s pain points in your own life. Maybe you watch for bigger trends and growth industries and chase those (AI, blockchain, etc.). I’m just really curious about the “where” — where do brilliant business ideas come from. Love any input!  cc: Joanna Buczkowska-McCumber, MBA, Lewis Howes, Jeremiah Owyang, Zach Bell, Chris Hadfield, Alec Tidey

Name: Ryan Holmes
Text: I've been wondering — Is the crisis pushing everyone to be a bit more "entrepreneurial" (whether you work for a company or for yourself)? Think about it. Before, we had schedules and bosses to motivate us. Now, we’re having to rely on our own initiative — finding the drive to fire up that laptop in the morning and check off our to-do list. Before, we had whole teams to fall back on for support. Now, we’re having to summon the grit to get projects home ourselves. Just a pet theory ... but could #WFH actually trigger a wave of #entrepreneurship in the years ahead, as professionals take these skills and strike out on their own?   cc: Victoria Taylor

I look forward to building off the momentum they’ve created and accelerating the company into its next stage of growth.

Name: Ryan Holmes
Text: After 12 years as founder and CEO of Hootsuite, Ryan Holmes is stepping into the Chairman role. Thanks for this  incredible ride, Ryan! You've built such a great company, inspiring us all with true values of humility, innovation and fun.Look forward to having un croissant with you again in Paris!#SocialCEO

Name: Clara Shih
Text: Today, Starbucks chief operating officer Roz Brewer was named one of Fortune's Most Powerful Women in Business of 2020. This year, editors added another question to their criteria, asking “In this moment of crisis and uncertainty, how is [the executive] using her influence to shape her company and the wider world for the better?"Read more:

Name: Clara Shih
Text: As you know, both my own background and my study of history have led me to believe that the failure to provide equal opportunity is not only unjust but also a threat to our society's well-being. We each have our own values and approaches to this issue. To me, reducing disparities in education and healthcare are the most important steps to rectifying the equal opportunity gap and an important way for those who are blessed to help those who are suffering. It’s for this reason that my wife and I are so happy that Dalio Philanthropies is partnering with NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital to form a new Heath Justice Center, which will address health disparities and health justice through research, education, advocacy, and investment in communities.

Name: Clara Shih
Text: Women are throwing the flag, but not throwing in the towel. This years McKinsey & Company report on #womenintheworkplace had some alarming findings. One in 4 women, one in 3 mothers, are considering scaling back or quitting. My latest Forbes article is about what we need to do in response.Crises are litmus tests for belonging - one corporations are clearly failing on behalf of women. We must send a message to parents, work moms and all those buckling under the pressures of this year - the problems not you, it's us. Huge call out to my many friends and colleagues who are work tirelessly on this issue and doing what they can to create cultures where everyone feels they belong: Dee Poku Spalding Tiffany Dufu ServiceNow Arianna Huffington Bill McDermott John Donahoe Beth Stewart Clara Shih Hemant Taneja Pat Wadors Alexandrina (Alia) Bojilova Johanna Jackman Rebecca Parsons Geraldine Laybourne Dr Andrea C. Johnson Sandy Hoffman John Chambers Pure Storage #forbesmagazinehttps://lnkd.in/dUjh_ca

Name: Clara Shih
Text: For many the global #pandemic brought our mortality to the forefront - hard choices and conversations were had with many seeking out protection for their loved ones. For life #insurance companies they were faced with balancing tech efficiency and convenience all while forging deep client relationships with a human-touch. No easy task. Hear how last-mile digital engagement drives both growth and efficiency and what the pandemic has taught these two companies about the importance of human-first digital engagement. Hear from Andrew J. McMahon, Clara Shih and   Jay Weintraub address this at InsureTech Connect's ITC Global NEXT WEEK! #itc2020 #insurtech

Name: Clara Shih
Text: Delighted to be attending the first sessions this morning of the Natixis Investment Managers two day virtual International sales and marketing conference. More than 600 attendees are gathered from all around the world, including a number of our affiliate asset managers such as Loomis, Sayles & Company, AEW and Ostrum Asset Management. We have already heard from our CEO Jean Raby and head of Int’l sales and marketing Oliver Bilal, while other leaders including Joseph Pinto, David Giunta, Benedicte Rabier, Harald Walkate, Esty Dwek Elaine Stokes and Philippe Berthelot, CFA will be presenting during the event. A special thanks goes to our keynote speaker Clara Shih, founder and executive chairwoman of Hearsay Systems as well as to the amazing virtual platform partner supporting the event meetyoo conferencing GmbH In addition to business updates, we will be hearing about topics including ESG, private assets, digital selling and remote sales, opportunities in credit, key investor challenges given by our solutions team and real estate. Welcome to Natixis Investment Managers!  #leadership #digitalselling #virtualevents

Name: Clara Shih
Text: WE NEED YOUR HELP. America’s small businesses are in crisis. Almost half of small business owners do not believe they will be able to continue operations beyond the end of this year without more federal assistance.Please join me in telling the President and Congress that we need a comprehensive small business recovery plan now, by signing this petition at https://lnkd.in/gUJRJfR and sharing it with your friends.The petition urges our elected leaders to adopt several key principles to save our country’s small businesses:- Federally guaranteed loans, at favorable terms, that will enable small businesses to transform and sustain themselves through 2020 and well into 2021.- Businesses should have flexibility to determine how loan funds are used.- The hardest-hit businesses should be eligible for at least partial loan forgiveness.- Relief needs to be delivered quickly.

Name: Clara Shih
Text: The shoe isn't real.Many still think AR is ‘niche’.While VR is still constrained by device adoption, AR is not. There's now more than 3 billion smartphone users in the world.As an example, across Facebook and Instagram, more than 600 million people now use AR every month, and more than 400,000 creators have published over 1.2 million AR effects.AR is already expanding our language of expression, changing the way we discover new things, and transforming the way we shop. This will affect all industries over the coming decade.Imagine the potential when this can be combined with all-day wearable AR glasses. 😎🤯All credit for the awesome AR example below goes to M—XR, a small pioneering R&D studio here in London. More details on them - and the demo - in the first comment.#innovation #technology

Name: Clara Shih
Text: I think most of us are in the rare moment of being able to agree that Ruth Bader Ginsburg was a hero which is a really big deal because we now live in a society in which there are no agreed upon heroes. That is because most people who stand out are torn down because people who are on the other side want to discredit them. Because we can agree that she was a hero, we should be able to look at the principles that made her a hero so that others can live by them and we can have more heroes.

Name: Clara Shih
Text: Have to love the RBG 5k (ht Sandy Peters)

Name: Clara Shih
Text: Last week, I was honored to receive the Global Leadership award at LinkedIn's annual Sales Kickoff. If you know me, you know I generally like to fly under the radar, but I wanted to express my deep gratitude for this incredible honor. Navigating this past year has been challenging for all of us, but these people have been instrumental in my growth and development. Catherine, this is as much your award as it is mine. When I grow up, I want to be just like you. Alyssa, Julie, Jonathan, Mike, Jeff, LaRon, Peter, Steve, David, and Ryan, you've shown me that true leaders are both courageous and kind. You set the bar and continue to raise it.  My team: Alejandra, Sandy, Veronica, Janesh, Ryan, August, and Nelson -- you bring out the best in me everyday. Cali-Alliance for life. Right now, the fight for justice in our country may feel like trying to boil the ocean, but I encourage everyone to be open-minded, brave, and like my late Father Paul Graves, thoughtful. Let's take it one day at a time. Peace and blessings to all of you. KG

Name: Clara Shih
Text: While we grieve today the passing of a hero - my hero - Ruth Bader Ginsberg, I celebrate her life and many accomplishments. Everything she did to help women advance in the legal profession was one of the reasons I wanted to pursue the law and to advocate for women in the field. But her influence and wisdom had even greater impact. I’m reflecting on two of my favorite RBG quotes:"I would like to be remembered as someone who used whatever talent she had to do her work to the very best of her ability.""You can disagree without being disagreeable."She inspired so many to stand up for what they believe in, for equality. RBG, you have inspired millions to continue on the trail you blazed. Rest In Peace, notorious and legendary RBG. History has had its eyes on you.

Text: If you're designing a category be VERY careful who's "feedback" you listen to. Never forget, - no one wanted a "horse-less carriage", - 10 out of 10 people said they would not pay for bottled water - and in 1998 there was almost complete opposition to the cloud.

Name: Clara Shih
Text: Close your eyes. Remember where you were on 9/11. I know your memory was instant and vivid. I was on the 63rd Floor of 2WTC. I escaped and have been blessed with the opportunity to be a daughter, a wife, a mom, a sister, an aunt, a friend, a boss, a colleague, a mentor, a volunteer and a Board Member with The COMMIT Foundation. At my first COMMIT workshop, many years ago, I sat across from veterans well half my age who told me that 9/11 called them – called them – to service. The utter selflessness and bravery forever moved me to my core. I am also infinitely grateful to our first responders, our brave, selfless policemen and women and our firefighters who saved so many lives, even knowing they might lose theirs. And so many were. Please pray for them and all who perished. #NeverForget #HonorThem #GiveBack

Name: Clara Shih
Text: 9/11/2020.Hard to believe 19 years have passed. As a 9/11 survivor, this day holds such sadness for me, and for countless others.I remain indebted to the bravery of the FDNY, NYPD and the PAPD who remained steadfast in their commitment to serve and protect; they saved thousands of lives that fateful day, including mine.To my Citi/Salomon Smith Barney 7 WTC friends, I am thinking of you today and grateful for the support we gave each other that day and the days that followed.#neverforget

Name: Clara Shih
Text: Exciting that “The Social Dilemma” a film project I’ve been involved in over the last three years on how the race for attention between social media tech platforms has driven the world mad, broken down truth, and eroded mental health — comes out globally on Netflix September 9th in 200 countries.🎬 WATCH the trailer below:https://lnkd.in/gc8hMGKIf you care about the existential threat posed by these platforms and their effect on democracies around the world, please help spread the word by sharing the trailer. 🙏

McMahon in our Keynote Fireside Chat at #ITC2020, moderated by InsureTech Connect founder & CEO Jay Weintraub 💡#humanclientexperience #insurtech #digitalchannels

Name: Clara Shih
Text: For many the global #pandemic brought our mortality to the forefront - hard choices and conversations were had with many seeking out protection for their loved ones. For life #insurance companies they were faced with balancing tech efficiency and convenience all while forging deep client relationships with a human-touch. No easy task. Hear how last-mile digital engagement drives both growth and efficiency and what the pandemic has taught Hearsay Systems and Guardian Life about the importance of human-first digital engagement. Only at ITC Global 9/22-23 will you hear this conversation with Jay Weintraub, Clara Shih & Andrew J. McMahon.   #ITC2020

Name: Clara Shih
Text: It’s time to stop treating anxiety and depression as personal failings.

Name: Clara Shih
Text: Mike Corbat interviewed me 16 years ago to join Citi. I couldn’t have imagined the incredible opportunities I’d have, the many different businesses and regions I’d work in, and, most notably, the remarkable people I’d work alongside – and Mike is one of the most remarkable of all. I value his friendship and am inspired by all he’s accomplished during his time at Citi. His legacy will leave Citi a simpler, safer, stronger, and far more profitable firm – one that is not afraid to stand up for what we believe in. Thank you, Mike. I am grateful for the opportunity to build on this foundation and lead Citi as we continue to position the firm for long term success. I shall do my best to ensure Citi lives up to its potential and promise as the world’s leading bank.

Name: Clara Shih
Text: My co-founder Steve Garrity and I incorporated Hearsay Labs on September 1, 2009. Today marks my 11th anniversary at the company, and it’s with so much pride and optimism that I announce our COO Michael Boese will be CEO for Hearsay’s next chapter. Thank you from the bottom of my heart to those who have joined and supported me in this startup journey. I love this company, our team, and our customers, and am so excited for the decade ahead! ❤️ #humanclientexperience #startup #scaleup #founderstories

Name: Clara Shih
Text: Very excited and proud to be partnering with Clara Shih and her talented team at Hearsay Systems. Hearsay will enhance our social media program and truly equip our advisors with best-in-class technology to build their practice digitally.

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: As a company built on the foundation that hospitality is about being on one another’s side, it is even more crucial now for us to support and stand with each other. Name: Danny Meyer
Text: We've launched an online auction to benefit our employee relief fund, #USHGHUGS, with experiences from across our businesses as well as items generously donated by friends of USHG. When we are able to gather together again, you could join Danny Meyer for dinner at Union Square Cafe; have the Shake Shack truck cater a party of up to 75 guests at your home; get a private Union Square Greenmarket tour from Chef Mike Anthony and finish with lunch at Gramercy Tavern. And while we're waiting for that time to come, there are things you can enjoy now, including a one-on-one cooking class with Gramercy Tavern's Chef Mike Anthony and personalized copies of Danny's bestselling book, #SettingTheTable. The auction is open through Tuesday 4/14, so bid now at ushg.link/auction.You can also donate directly to the fund at ushg.link/donation.

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: I'm interviewing Union Square Hospitality Group's Danny Meyer tomorrow at 12ET on Business Unusual, our daily live show focused on how the coronavirus is impacting the ways we all work. The impact on COVID is devastating across many industries right now, but there is no industry that is more vulnerable right now than restaurants. We'll talk with Meyer about how he is navigating his business through the crisis and take your questions on the topic as well. Bring your questions and follow LinkedIn Editors to be notified when we go live here: https://lnkd.in/fXkzC4r #BusinessUnusual

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: Thank you Scott Pelley and CBS 60 Minutes for revealing the challenges being faced by 660,000 restaurants and 12 million employees who cook for you and bring your communities together. Many ways to help. Here’s ours, USHG HUGS: http://ushg.link/hugs

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: Folks have asked me..."I cant watch more CNN this weekend, what leadership books should I read instead?".  Adam Bryant, Danny Meyer, Doris Kearns Goodwin, Ben Horowitz and Gerstner all deliver inspiration and practical advice made for a time of crisis.  #leadership #businessleadership #management #leadershipdevelopment #leadershipadvice

Text: Thank you Scott Pelley and CBS 60 Minutes for revealing the challenges being faced by 660,000 restaurants and 12 million employees who cook for you and bring your communities together. Many ways to help. Here’s ours, USHG HUGS: http://ushg.link/hugs

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: Heartfelt gratitude to so many friends who’ve already donated to #USHGHUGS. It’s work. Asking you to please consider pitching in for our Union Square Hospitality Group team: ushg.link/hugs

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: Last week we announced that 100% of gift cards sold through tomorrow (3/24) would go to our new employee relief fund to support former and current USHG employees affected by the crisis. The outpouring of support from current and former USHG employees, guests, partners, purveyors and friends around the world has been incredible.Thank you for sharing your stories of memorable meals, well-wishes for our team members, and plans for how and where you’ll use your gift card. We can’t wait to be back home and to welcome you in.If you’re interested in buying a gift card, you can go to ushg.link/gift. Or, make a donation directly to our employee relief fund via Paypal at ushg.link/donation.

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: Reconciling who we are with what’s needed for this moment is nearly impossible. And it’s entirely heartbreaking. ushgnyc.com/updatesMy video message to our team here: https://lnkd.in/dmFBrZu

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: We’ve created a relief fund for Union Square Hospitality Group team members. To seed the effort, I’m immediately contributing my entire compensation and our executive team is taking a meaningful pay cut. Additionally, 100% of all USHG gift card sales through 3/24 will go to the fund. Join us please: ushg.link/gift

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: If ever there were a time for the government to provide fiscal leadership for hospitality workers and the industry it’s NOW. Mandated closings wisely protect communities, but minus revenue, restaurants alone simply cannot fully care for our people and be able to reopen when this storm passes.

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: We’ve decided to temporarily close all Union Square Hospitality Group restaurants. For those of us whose passion is to bring people together in a spirit of healing, it’s nearly unfathomable to confront the reality that our very purpose could be a threat to the health & safety of our community.By fully facing this storm today, we hope to return to serving our guests and community sooner than later. Our entire team cannot wait for that moment.https://lnkd.in/gYie9ZE

Thank you Kane Pappas and John Niser PhD for a great trip!

Text: Amazing session with Danny Meyer this afternoon ... honest, authentic and inspirational.. true leader that does so by example  #portmarnockgolfclub #cmae2020

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: Whew... What an incredible CMAA conference!   🏆 I received my CCM certification🏆 Nebraska was awarded the Small Chapter of the Year award🏆 CCL Junior Member Guest won the Idea Fair Most Innovative Idea ... AND ...🙌 Danny Meyer was a keynote speaker.   Such a fan!And all of this while spending time learning with colleagues and friends from Nebraska and beyond.   What a great few days #cmaa2020

Text: Had the distinct pleasure to first meet Danny Meyer today and more importantly hear his tremendous talk on belonging and how we make others feel.  “You will not always have the best food but you have to be their favorite place to go”.  #cmaa #chooseyourattitude #clubmanagement #cmaa2020 #peoplematter #emotionalinteligence #countryclub #inspiration #leadership #leadershipdevelopment #payitforward #lifelonglearning

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: General Education Session with Danny Meyer at Club Managers Assn of America (CMAA) World Conference  #cmaaconf #CMAA2020 #leadership #experience

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: Transform your business’s employee and customer experience through the power of hospitality. This April, join our 3-day ‘Creating Raves’ leadership development workshop rooted in our distinctive culture and 30+ year record of excellence. Throughout the workshop, you’ll hear from key leaders across USHG, go behind-the-scenes at our businesses, and learn how to apply our strategies for service and hospitality to any industry. Learn more and reserve:#leadershipdevelopment #leadership #employeeengagement #companyculture

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: “In the not too distant future, we may actually see the end of childhood hunger in America. And I think No Kid Hungry will have been the reason why.”- Last fall Danny Meyer joined the Share Our Strength #NoKidHungry Leadership Summit to collaborate and share best practices in the fight to end childhood hunger. Listen to highlights from the summit on the latest episode of #AddPassionStir: https://lnkd.in/dRbFFM3#endhunger #podcast

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: We’re thrilled to be included in Human Rights Campaign's 2020 Corporate Equality Index and designated a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality. As a global company, we take pride in respecting and celebrating diversity in race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, religion, disability, age and more. We believe that variety in life experience positively impacts the growth and innovation of our business and only makes our culture stronger. As leaders training future leaders, we’re proud to encourage and celebrate individuality in our #shackfam. Click here to learn more and check out the full list of inclusive companies: http://bit.ly/hrc-2020-cei

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: So enjoyed this far-reaching conversation with Poppy Harlow and Randy Garutti.  Covered plenty of timely and tough topics, and also shared a few good laughs.

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: Listen as Danny Meyer and Shake Shack's Randy Garutti share an enriching conversation with CNN's Poppy Harlow on #BossFiles covering the future of food, leadership lessons they've shared with each other, and some of their most memorable guests. https://lnkd.in/duTd6G5

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: We are beyond excited to have two inspiring leaders join the Union Square Cafe team in late January: Lena Ciardullo as Executive Chef and Denez Moss as General Manager. Last week, they stopped by to say hello—we can’t wait to see what gifts Lena and Denez share with the team!

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: Delighted to enjoy delicious affogato and friendly hospitality at Caffe Panna. Congrats on a beautiful spot, Hallie Meyer! You've elevated Danny Meyer's principles in your own unique vision. Keep up the great work. Friends, schedule your next meeting over a special treat at Caffe Panna. You won't regret it. Great to see you, Scott Hopper!#hospitality #womenownedbusiness #icecream

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: Read 26 books in 2019. Highlights: The Critical Few by Jon Katzenbach, Turning the Flywheel by Jim Collins, Lifespan by David A. Sinclair Ph.D., A.O., the Longevity Paradox by Steven Gundry, Lessons of History by Will and Ariel Durant, the 4 Disciplines of Execution by @Sean Covey, Setting the Table by Danny Meyer, Alchemy by Rory Sutherland, the Effective Hiring Manager by Marc Horstman, the 15 Commitments of Conscious Leadership by Jim Dethmer, Leadership: In Turbulent Times by Doris Kearns Goodwin

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: Introducing Maialino Mare, our new Roman-style trattoria in Washington D.C.'s Navy Yard! 🐟 Executive Chef Rose Noel's seasonal menus showcase locally-sourced seafood alongside classic Roman dishes, complemented by a robust Italian wine list and beautiful, rustic desserts. Text: These are a few of my favorite things - JPMorgan Chase & Co., coffee and Danny Meyer.

Text: A holiday 🎁 from me to me. Thank you Joshua Matheus for the recommendation. Setting the table into 2020. #hospitality #restaurantindustry #settingthetable Danny Meyer
