Text: A holiday 🎁 from me to me. Thank you Joshua Matheus for the recommendation. Setting the table into 2020. #hospitality #restaurantindustry #settingthetable Danny Meyer

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: “Service without soul, no matter how elegant, is quickly forgotten by the guest.” - Danny Meyer I genuinely believe that service and hospitality are the linchpins in creating the guest experience. I don’t care if you are a QSR, a coffee shop or a food truck - leaving your guest with a lasting impression of how you made them feel is the real “secret sauce” of the restaurant business. What was the⚡️BEST⚡️ example of outstanding hospitality you have ever experienced? #hospitality #restaurants #commercialrealestate #retail #cre

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: These restaurant groups continue to defy the odds, and are setting a bar of excellence for the rest of the industry to follow.Featuring! Darden, Brent Berkowitz of Sage Restaurant Group, Landry's, ThinkFoodGroup, The Dinex Group - Chef Daniel Boulud, Sebastien Silvestri, Union Square Hospitality Group, Danny Meyer, INVEST HOSPITALITY, Rachel Walensky, Cameron Mitchell, Cameron Mitchell Restaurants, David Miller, Craig Barber, Alexander Curley, Southern Proper Hospitality Group.

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: It seems I might be kicked off from LinkedIn if I don't share a 2019 retrospective so here are 12 of the Books I enjoyed this past year that my LinkedIn network might find enjoyable and useful as well.In no rigorous order:- Charlie Munger: The complete investor by Tren Griffin- The High growth handbook by Elad Gil (great reference book)- Working by Robert Caro- When breath becomes air (thanks to recs by Roland Daher and Ivan Jakovljevic)- Subscribed by Tien Tzuo- Big Debt Crises by Ray Dalio- Bloomberg by Bloomberg by -you guessed it- Mike Bloomberg- Not Fade Away: A short life well lived- High output management (I thought I read it before but was worth it anyways)- Barbarian Days a Surfing life (Really a book about passion)- Alibaba: The House That Jack Ma Built- Setting The Table by Danny MeyerInterested to get recommendations from others for good books to read in 2020. I read slowly so I am very selective with what I read. Thanks and here's to another year of learning and growth!

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: Join us in Washington, D.C. on December 17th for a ‘Top of Mind’ panel on wage, compensation, and tipping with Danny Meyer and John McDonnell of Clyde's Restaurant Group, moderated by Jill Gardner of The Talent Shop. Learn more and RSVP here:

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: Hi, Linkedin network! As the calendar turns to December I figure it is a good time to start reflecting on one of my goals for 2019 of reading more books (well, listening to more books. Thanks Audible, Inc.).Below are the books I completed this year. What are your recommendations for books to dive into in 2020?- The Coddling of the American Mind by Jonathan Haidt- The Happiness Hypothesis by Jonathan Haidt- Born Standing Up by Steve Martin- Dad is Fat by Jim Gaffigan- Shoe Dog by Phil Knight- Brotopia by Emily Chang- Comedy Sex God by Pete Holmes- Trillion Dollar Coach by Eric Schmidt, Jonathan Rosenberg, and Alan Eagle- Grit by Angela Duckworth- Setting the Table by Danny Meyer- The Culture Code by Daniel Coyle

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: “We saw that the better third-wave coffee brands were all identified with a particular city: Intelligentsia (Chicago), Stumptown (Portland), La Colombe (Philadelphia), Blue Bottle (SF). Joe Coffee Company was the original New York brand. That appealed to us.”#EnlightenedHospitalityInvestments

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: Incredibly honored to have been given the opportunity to take the stage at Red Ventures #CultureFest 2019 - two days packed with inspiring stories from Abby Wambach, Danny Meyer, Baratunde Thurston, Shingy, and Mick Ebeling paired with presentations from RV teams across the globe!

Name: Danny Meyer
Text: Last year, we acquired Zagat. And today, we released the Zagat NYC 2020 Restaurants Guide into the world. Get your copy here: https://lnkd.in/d3qe3cPThe book is made up of 1400+ reviews based on 200,000 reviews and ratings from people who eat out in NYC, plus hundreds of indexes to sort through them all. And because this is a special 40th anniversary edition, there's also a look back at the NYC restaurant scene over the past 40 years, a foreword by Danny Meyer, and more.

Name: Kathy Matsui
Text: "While businesses were given a decade to undergo their digital transformations, CEOs do not have the same luxury for sustainable transformation. Recent events have shown that taking a comprehensive, stakeholder-driven approach to your business is a "must have", not a "nice to have". "Databricks supports the digital transformation required for modern ESG data handling, and accelerates evaluation ability for ESG scores.#Whydatabricks Databricks#databricks #esginvesting #esgdata Junta Nakai Antoine Amend

Name: Kathy Matsui
Text: Virtually paneled at the ADC Forum (previously known as the Australian Davos Committee) 'What are the lessons, so far, about COVID and how do we apply them?'Panelists: Terry Moran AC, Secretary of the Department of the Prime Minister and Cabinet (2008-2011); Prof. Raina MacIntyre, NHMRC Principal Research Fellow and Professor of Global Biosecurity at UNSW; Prof. Kanta Subbarao, Director of the WHO Collaborating Centre for Reference and Research on Influenza; Mio Takaoka, CFO of Medical Note, Inc; Prof. Kenji Shibuya , Director at the University Institute for Population Health at King’s College London; A. Prof. Louis Irving, Director of the Department of Respiratory and Seep Medicine and Director of Clinical Training at the Royal Melbourne Hospital.lots of insights into discussion raised amongst experts on society's handling of the pandemic:* COVID is a syndemic, not just a pandemic* pandemic response and policy issues can be broken up into 5 parts, each has to be addressed by the right experts: 1) early detection and the handling2) maintaining medical capacity 3) contact tracing4) vaccination and how to efficiently bring up vaccination rates 5) politicization of the pandemic, given that balancing disease control and the economy is not binary  #healthcare #policy

Name: Kathy Matsui
Text: Great to be in this excellent article. Even though foreigners are not necessary for Japan to rally, it’s good to have them. Building the domestic equity culture based on dividends and long term growth is much more important... so a dividend tax cit would be useful (for income up to a cutoff point).

Name: Kathy Matsui
Text: Greener Smarter Healthier Buildings FOR ALL. Especially during the pandemic. Heat pumps are not only a silver bullet for #climatechange, but they can also clean indoor air to reduce the spread of COVID in high risk urban environments. Heat pumps, and the jobs, climate, and public health impact they will create, are the technology breakthrough that we need in this difficult moment. #climate #jobs #COVID #buildbackbetter #crises #sustainability

Name: Kathy Matsui
Text: For the first time, we are offering all of our employees who are eligible to vote and currently in the U.S. up to a half-day of paid leave on Election Day, November 3rd. The pandemic raises unique challenges for those who want to exercise their civic responsibility to vote safely, so our hope is this will provide our people with the time and flexibility to vote on Election Day.

Name: Kathy Matsui
Text: We were all deeply saddened to learn that Jim Johnson passed away this morning. Jim’s deep experience in business and politics gave him a unique perspective on the world, and made him an invaluable counselor over nearly 20 years of service on our board.  We will miss Jim, and his sunny disposition, and express our deepest condolences to Heather, Alfred, and his family.

Name: Kathy Matsui
Text: The Goldman Sachs Women's Network, in partnership with the Firmwide Black Network, held a discussion on how to talk with children about race and racism. The session was moderated by Chief Diversity Officer Erika Irish Brown (she/her/hers) and featured two specialists from nonprofit the Child Mind Institute: Kenya Hameed, a clinical neuropsychologist, and Janine Domingues, a clinical psychologist. The Child Mind Institute focuses on transforming the lives of children and families managing mental health and learning disorders.

Text: This week we kicked-off our annual Neurodiversity Hiring Initiative. Creating a space that champions diversity in all forms is critical to empowering the ideas and perspectives of our people. Name: Kathy Matsui
Text: A couple of interesting stories this week on womenomics in Japan:* the inspiring story of reinvention and entrepreneurialism from Eiko Hashiba-san covered by Bloomberg: Banker Who Quit for Her Kid Builds Empire of 110,000 Consultants https://lnkd.in/gDmVfED* another from Reuters which illustrates how much progress is still to be made: Japan firms fall woefully short of meeting government goals on women in management - Reuters poll https://lnkd.in/gF4a8xMFrom the Bloomberg story: "Hashiba is among a select group of female CEOs of #Japanese companies. Only 11 out of 2,076 listed firms that disclosed the information, or less than 1%, had a woman as #CEO last fiscal year, according to data compiled by Bloomberg...” VisasQ’s stock has risen 95% since listing on the Tokyo Stock Exchange in March. The surge has pushed the company’s market value to about $238 million."— thanks to Robin Lewis from #MyMizu for highlighting the Hashiba-san’s story.#japan #womenomics #business

Name: Kathy Matsui
Text: My colleague Tricia Haskins sees a new way of work in the future. As Trish notes in WealthManagement.com, three in five advisors reported an increase in their firms’ digital capabilities since January – and that trend is expected to continue beyond the COVID crisis. In a remote environment, the “human touch” is as important as ever, and Trish’s article outlines how advisors can more effectively use technology to build deeper relationships with clients. https://lnkd.in/gywAn5H

Name: Kathy Matsui
Text: The Black New Venture Competition: a Harvard Business School Case StudyA year ago, Tyler Simpson and I sat down to talk through a little idea we had. We wanted to have a seat at the table to increase access to capital for Black entrepreneurs. After a few twists and turns, we decided to build our own table - the Black New Venture Competition & Tech Master Series.Never would have thought all of those hours spent in Spangler would have resulted in us being featured in our very own Harvard Business School case.Special thank you to Karen G. Mills, Jeffrey Bussgang, and Martin Sinozich for bringing this case to life. Huge shout out to Ivan Alo, Damien Hooper-Campbell, and Pierre Laguerre for taking part in our story. Forever grateful for Kam S. Phillips-Sadler, Cydni W., Brian Hollins, CFA, and Cary Williams for carrying the torch. Keep an eye out for the 2021 edition of the BNVC/BTMS - we're just getting started!

Name: Kathy Matsui
Text: Women remain under-represented in STEM globally. To learn how to address this, register for the trilateral ‘Summit on Women’s Leadership in STEM’ - featuring leaders from the US, Japan and Korea who are driving change for women and girls in STEM, sponsored by the Asia Foundation, US State Dept, and MIIS. (Oct 20-23 Asia/Oct 19-22 ET; my panel is on Oct 22, 7:30am JST)#WomeninSTEMTrilat2020STEM分野の女性は依然少ないが、今回米日韓のカンファレンスで女性のSTEMリーダー育成に何が必要かを議論します。是非ご参加下さい！

Name: Kathy Matsui
Text: I’ve been part of our #CommunityTeamWorks volunteer program for over 20 years – and this year our work is more critical than ever. In April, we pivoted to a virtual program, allowing nearly 7,000 people at Goldman Sachs to help bring relief to those disproportionately impacted by the pandemic. And just last week, we launched our latest campaign to support students and educators through more than 90 virtual volunteering projects with 57 nonprofit partners, like SolarBuddy, pictured here, that our volunteers worked with to assemble solar lights for students experiencing energy poverty. Thanks to all of our people who have stepped up to give back virtually.

Name: Kathy Matsui

Name: Kathy Matsui
Text: This post is hard.I haven't posted the past few days because my mind has not been right.I've debated if this is even the right platform to share something like this.I've come to my senses.Being vocal about #BlackLivesMatter and the fight for justice and equality is always right.Platforms don't matter. The message is what matters.Saturday night, a human being I shared human experiences with was shot three times by Wolfe City police in Texas.He intervined to help a woman during a domestic violence situation, which correlates with his character and demeanor. He died at the hospital.Jonathan Price was a black, young and kind man.We were groomsmen for one of my childhood friends.Last night, I watched his mother weep for his life on the local news. It rocked me. It crushed my heart.I share this with my LinkedIn network because it's important to acknowledge this call for #justice.It's important to say #BlackLivesMatter because they do.It's #HispanicHeritageMonth and Jonathan's life is an example of how black, brown and all lives are interwoven.This is not political.This is fucking human.This has to stop.J Price, rest in peace brother. God bless you, your family and everyone that knew you during this difficult time.

Name: Hans Vestberg
Text: Today on #InternationalDayoftheGirl, I’ve been thinking about what I would tell my younger self. In the process of writing down what insights would have been beneficial to me as a girl growing up in a small town in Nebraska, a funny thing happened. I realized this advice is very much what I still need today... #WhatINowKnow- Think bigger. Whatever your dream is, stretch it further. You’ll be amazed at what you are capable of achieving. - Read lots of great books. They are a passport to the world and will open your mind to different perspectives. - Watch your thoughts, as they become your words. - Don’t be afraid to make mistakes. They are often the best teachers. - Be bold. Don’t let anyone diminish your voice. - Be respectful. As Michelle Obama so wisely shared, when they go low, you go high. - Be confident. You have more potential than you know. - Be intelligent. Be a sponge for learning and be prepared. You will shine.- Be helpful & a force for good. Many of you will have privilege that others do not. Use that privilege to bring equity where it doesn’t exist today. - Be you. Unabashedly, authentically, you. I invite others to reflect on what they would tell their younger self. Together, let’s address the inequities and barriers that hold too many girls back.

Name: Hans Vestberg
Text: Being self-aware is one of the most crucial skills a leader should possess in the future of work. The American Management Association did a study of 72 senior executives and found that a high self-awareness score was the strongest predictor of overall success. According to corporate organization psychologist Dr. Becky Winkler, it’s because the leaders who are self-aware of their weaknesses are able to hire people who perform better in the areas where the leaders are lacking. One fascinating aspect of Dr. Winkler’s research found that harsh leaders who are focused on driving results at all costs actually diminish the bottom line instead of improving it. On the other hand, self-aware leaders are able to deliver better financial performance.Hans Vestberg, CEO of Verizon Communications summed up this concept nicely in an interview 👇👇👇Learn from over 140 CEOs like Hans --> http://ow.ly/Ispg50BVbHS#futureofwork #leadership #selfawareness

Name: Hans Vestberg
Text: As we wrap up Hispanic Heritage Month, we take a moment to reflect on the contributions and influence of Hispanics - to the history and culture of the U.S., but also Verizon - and our continued commitment to this community.Amid the COVID outbreak and global awakening for racial justice, this year’s #HispanicHeritageMonth is even more relevant to who we are as providers of the world’s most reliable network, and who we are as colleagues and people on this planet. The facts are bold:- There are nearly 60M Hispanics in the U.S.; the largest minority in the country - 41M Hispanics speak Spanish at home in the U.S. - Verizon has nearly 13,500 Hispanic employees We are compelled to build a more inclusive culture; one of equity, belonging, and prosperity. We are called to educate employees and consumers on the great work Verizon has done with the Hispanic market, with employees, suppliers, and partners, and role model what good looks like in outreach and inclusive business practices. We have gained momentum, let’s sustain it. We have achieved progress, let’s outpace it. Verizon te da más (“gives you more”) because we care for our Hispanic employees and consumers. So, as we close out Hispanic Heritage Month, let’s continue to celebrate, recognize, and move #ForwardTogether.

Name: Hans Vestberg
Text: Business Roundtable CEOs are committed to breaking down barriers to economic opportunity, and collaborated on a set of corporate actions and public policy recommendations to advance racial equity and justice.Multiple crises have shined a spotlight on continued racial inequities in America, which cut across the socioeconomic spectrum. Despite some significant strides over the generations, the events of 2020 have illustrated how far we still have to go to ensure that every person can fully realize opportunity and justice in America. This infographic shows how racial disparities impact each step of a person’s life. Business Roundtable recommendations detail how business and government can address inequity and injustice across employment, finance, education, health, housing and criminal justice systems. Read the recommendations at www.BRT.org/equity.

Name: Hans Vestberg
Text: Today is #InternationalDayOfTheGirl, a time to promote the empowerment of young girls. As I reflect on my own coming of age, #WhatINowKnow is that I was “more” than I ever imagined. I would tell my younger self that imposter syndrome exists but truly, you are “more” - more powerful, more capable, more gifted, more accomplished - than you think you are. However you see yourself, know that you are more. To all the young girls out there, our world needs all of you. In celebration of our future, on this International Day Of The Girl, I encourage you to share what you’d tell your younger self. Let’s join together to create a movement of positive messages to embrace and empower the leaders of tomorrow.

Name: Hans Vestberg
Text: What if there is something in the values and the way that companies are run in Sweden that could help accelerate sustainable change in companies and industries in other parts of the world? Something like a 'Swedish way' to sustainability leadership based on tradition and values? I argue that this is the case and that other countries can learn from the Swedish approach.  October 22, Norrsken Foundation is hosting an online event where we will discuss exactly this. Some very insightful people will share their experiences and thoughts on the topic: Johan Rockström of the Postsdam Institute, Elsa Bernadotte at Karma, eva karlsson at Houdini Sportswear, Rickard Gustafson at SAS - Scandinavian Airlines and Hans Vestberg at Verizon.  I will also be there together with Elaine Weidman-Grunewald to discuss the three-step-model summarized in the book we have written about Sustainability Leadership.  If you can, you should join the event and listen to the experiences from this fantastic group of leaders and help us spread the word about the Swedish approach to making the world a better place. #SustainabilityLeadershipBook

Text: Deepest congratulations to our colleagues from the World Food Programme (WFP), the largest humanitarian agency fighting hunger worldwide, on being awarded the 2020 #NobelPeacePrize!The Norwegian Nobel Committee paid tribute to WFP's efforts to help some of the world's most vulnerable people by work for #ZeroHunger, supporting those in conflict-affected areas and preventing hunger from being used as a weapon of war."The women and men of the WFP brave danger and distance to deliver life-saving sustenance to those devastated by conflict, to people suffering because of disaster, to children and families uncertain about their next meal," said UN Secretary-General António Guterres on Friday. "Such solidarity is precisely needed now to address not only the pandemic, but other global tests of our time," added the Secretary-General.  See how they are making a difference: http://wfp.org/zero-hunger📷: The Nobel Prize

Name: Hans Vestberg
Text: I recommend reading this moving letter from Verizon Chief Human Resources Officer Christy Pambianchi to her daughter Sarah ahead of #InternationalDayofTheGirl, on Oct 11.The passage below sets up several pieces of advice for Sarah as she finishes high school and gets ready to go out into the world under unprecedented circumstances. Lots of wisdom here from an amazing leader."Equality is not something to take for granted. Whenever there is a 'first' for women — be it politics, business, sports, academics — not enough is done to ensure she is the first of many and not out there alone breaking ground. For every step forward, women have felt the pressures of society pushing back — and this year is no different. While a record number of women are leading Fortune 500 companies, we are also seeing many mothers feel pressured to abandon their professional dreams and ambitions in light of the continued impact of the pandemic. Our crisis response as a society cannot be to sacrifice women's contributions and the future of young girls. We are not expendable."My dearest daughter, as we approach International Day of the Girl and acknowledge the distance we must travel to realize real and lasting equality, here are a few lessons that I hope will help illuminate your path forward..."

Name: Hans Vestberg
Text: Tomorrow is World Mental Health Day. And while this is the 28th year we are marking the occasion, the conversations we are having—and indeed need to have—about mental health sound a lot different this year. The challenge ahead of us as a global community is a big one and (due to the pandemic, looming US election, and racial injustice) it’s getting bigger. The question I ask myself is: what can we do? What can we do to create a mentally healthy and supportive work culture? What can we do to minimize the stigma and make people feel seen and heard, regardless of where they are on the spectrum or in their mental health journey? I've shared my thoughts, and would love to hear yours. #mentalhealth #worldmentalhealthday

Name: Hans Vestberg
Text: Just over a week ago we gathered virtually for the Leadership Forum. We discussed a concept called "what for". The idea is to think deeply and expansively about the purpose of our work  and what we are really here to do. When we answer the "what for", we tap into and access an endless source of resilience. As we look at the world around us and the challenges we are collectively facing, it is clear that this resilience and connectedness to our purpose and to each other is how we will continue to move the world forward, together. Name: Hans Vestberg
Text: Today is the day and I am thrilled to be part of this eventful day where more than 900 leaders, head of states, business executives and thought-leaders will share their perspectives on the future. The focus of my topic is "Millennials and Generation-Z: Shaping the Far Future".I am also delighted to see that Hudiksvall (in Sweden) has two leaders represented, myself and Hans Vestberg.Excited to share this topic with some exceptional individuals:- Vijay Eswaran, Executive Chairman, QI Group, Hong Kong- Kevin Lee, COO, China Youthology, China- Amandeep Midha, Founder, Nerd9, Denmark- Aleksandr Stommels, President, Circle of Sustainable Europe, Belgium- Marcelo Garcia, Founder, WisdomAccelerator, SwitzerlandThank you Frank-Jürgen Richter for the invitation!

Name: Hans Vestberg
Text: It is with great pride and honour that we today present our keynote and opening speaker, H.M. Queen Silvia of Sweden!H.M. Queen Silvia is one of the world’s leading advocates for children’s rights. In 1999, she founded the World Childhood Foundation, which aims to safeguard the right of the child to a safe and loving childhood, and works in particular to improve the living conditions for children at risk of becoming victims of violence or sexual abuse.The Brighthood conference is free to attend and open for everyone, please read more and register; www.brighthood.com#SDGs #sdgs2030 #sdg16 #CSR #CSAM #tech4good #betterfuture #childrensrights

Name: Hans Vestberg
Text: So much #5G news: Verizon expands 5G home internet to Minneapolis and St. Paul, now bringing blazing fast 5G to customers in 8 cities. The flexibility and reliability to work, live, and play at home with cutting-edge equipment and premier content. #5GBuiltRight

Name: Hans Vestberg
Text: So proud that Christy Pambianchi was just named to the 2020 Top CHRO List, among 25 people leaders to watch. From making a meaningful imprint on the industry with initiatives like the People+Work Connect platform to ensuring Verizon employees are provided for during these unprecedented times, she's been a true inspiration to our HR team and company. Because moving our company and the world forward takes more than the best technology - it takes the best people. Learn more about the empowering culture our team helps bring to life now. #vzcareers https://vz.to/2r98Vq3

Name: Hans Vestberg
Text: We’re on a roll with Verizon Fios! J.D. Power recognized that Verizon Fios is #1 in customer satisfaction in the East and also #1 in performance and reliability, and so much more. Details here:

Name: Hans Vestberg
Text: I had the privilege of speaking with Suzanne Vranica, Rick Gomez, Sofia Hernandez and Fernando Machado about how brands are engaging with the Hispanic and Latinx communities at this year's L'Attitude conference. As an Argentinian I'm proud of the way Verizon approaches the community - not as a segment, but at the center of our marketing strategy. From creating the first-ever Spanish language ad without subtitles to air during the Oscars and providing plans that provide free calls to Mexico, to employee engagement and responsible businesses efforts that support small businesses and closing the digital divide, Verizon is delivering on our mission of relevance and value to the Hispanic and Latinx communities that cannot and will not be ignored.

Name: Randi Zuckerberg
Text: Next week, I’ll be back in India (virtually!) to present at the Forevermark Forum on innovation and disruption in this new normal! The theme of the event is Meaningful Tomorrows and how we can use these challenging times to connect in deeper ways with customers and partners. I hope you’ll join us, Aug 19 @ 11am local time to hear my talk on how “Diamonds (and disruption) are forever!” Forevermarkforum.com

Name: Randi Zuckerberg
Text: ‪The Future of Travel. Is There One? This week, I spoke with four travel experts/founders on my SiriusXM show from Travelocity, Kayak, The Points Guy, Hipcamp, and JSX about when the travel industry will be back to “normal” and what changes will be here for good.  #businesstravel #airlines #cruises #rvtravel

Name: Randi Zuckerberg
Text: How will the pandemic permanently change the live entertainment industry? I spoke with leaders from Comic-Con International, Carnegie Hall, Variety, and Broadway to understand the new rules of work in live entertainment. #liveevents #broadway #streaming #conferences #performingarts #liveentertainment

Name: Randi Zuckerberg
Text: If this was a normal year, I’d be on my 30th keynote/conference. I so miss traveling and being there in person, but I love that I have been able to “travel the world” through online events. On Saturday, I’m heading to India (virtually!) to teach a live Class on Unacademy  about opportunities for entrepreneurs in this new normal. I’ll tell stories from my own career and share thoughts on the importance of reinvention and resilience in the face of crisis. Join me at 8 PM IST on June 27! https://lnkd.in/gpBqZ4v#Liveclass #education #entrepreneurship #unacademy

Name: Randi Zuckerberg
Text: Join me and Michelle Reeves, co-founder and CEO of The Accessory Junkie, for an intimate discussion about finding power through purpose, all while building a new generation of awesome businesses. And there may be a surprise or two from The Accessory Junkie along the way! Thursday May 28th at 4pm ET / 1pm PT. RSVP here:

Name: Randi Zuckerberg
Text: Zuckerberg Institute is rolling out a brand new program for high school students -  A 3 week online course!  Come join our webinar to learn more. Can’t wait to see you there!

Name: Randi Zuckerberg
Text: Are you looking for a way to get involved in an effective and compassionate response to COVID? I couldn't be prouder to have teamed up with Pledgecamp as they use blockchain technology to bring trust back to crowdfunding. The transparency and collaboration that the blockchain enables has never been more important than it is right now, and, indeed, Pledgecamp is currently using their system to ensure that PPE actually gets sourced and donated to facilities that need it most. People everywhere can now send PPE directly to doctors, nurses, and hospital staff, knowing that 100% of their donations will go directly to care facilities that are saving lives. To learn more, check out: https://plg.camp/supplies #COVID #crowdfunding #blockchain #donations

Name: Randi Zuckerberg
Text: ‪The children’s quarantine reading list we really wish we had, featuring classics such as: “Where the Wild Things Are: Costco edition” and “Don’t Hop on Pop: a Tale of Social Distancing.”

Name: Randi Zuckerberg
Text: TODAY on SiriusXM's Randi Zuckerberg Means Business: kathy ireland Worldwide! Tune in at 12 ET on Channel 132!

Name: Randi Zuckerberg
Text: Yesterday, I had the incredible opportunity to sit down at @siriusxm with Kathy Ireland to discuss her awe-inspiring career. The Supermodel turned Business Mogul just released her first novel, Fashion Jungle, a truthful and insightful look into the cutthroat fashion and modeling industry which she co-authored with #1 New York Times Bestselling Author Rachel Van Dyken. Kathy is hailed by Harper’s Bazaar as the most successful “model in the world” but her story goes well beyond her modeling career. Her company, Kathy Ireland Worldwide (kiWW) – which all started with a pair of socks -- is now a multibillion-dollar worldwide brand. Kathy is the only woman from all the notable women with licensing empires to still have and fully own her company! She is also a wife and mom to three children and is renowned for her charity work and philanthropic activities.The interview will be LIVE on @SiriusXM Business Channel 132 at 12 ET next Wednesday!

Name: Randi Zuckerberg
Text: Honestly, Kathy Ireland might just be one of the most inspiring people I've ever met. I sat down with her today on my SiriusXM show to discuss her new book, Fashion Jungle, and her amazing career - from supermodel to multi-billion dollar business mogul, she has launched more than 17,000 products, written dozens of books, appeared in countless television shows and movies...not to mention that she opens Warren Buffet's Berkshire Hathaway investor meeting every year, manages other major celebrity's careers, and still fully owns her own company. When I asked her what new initiatives she was doing this year, she had to pull out her iPhone to read out a list of 20+ things! kathy ireland Worldwide #businesswoman # #entrepreneur #mogul #integritymatters

Name: Randi Zuckerberg
Text: Honestly, Kathy Ireland might just be one of the most inspiring people I've ever met. Name: Randi Zuckerberg
Text: Some news! This day is one of the most exciting of my career as it was announced that I was elected to the Foot Locker, Inc. Board of Directors, starting Feb 2, 2020. I’m beyond excited about this opportunity. I LOVE Foot Locker's portfolio of brands (Foot Locker, Lady Foot Locker, Footaction, Champs, Eastbay, and others) and its mission to empower and inspire youth culture. The company and its brands are so iconic and have had such a profound impact in my life. Many thanks to the wonderful board and CEO, Dick Johnson for this opportunity. This is so amazing.

Name: Randi Zuckerberg
Text: #freestylelovesupreme #linmanuelmiranda #linmanuel #improv #entrepreneur #improvisation #yesand #creativity #inthemoment #business #leadership #comedy #standup #ideas #impulses #open #receptive

Name: Randi Zuckerberg
Text: Aaaaaand that's a wrap on speaking events for 2019! Thank you to everyone around the world who joined me for events this year and showed up to support women in business. I still can't believe I did 50+ speeches this year in 20 countries, all while pregnant, nursing, juggling being a new mom of 3, but it's thanks to incredible people like all of you that I love doing what I do, even if it means spending 100 days a year on airplanes. This has truly been a memorable year in so many ways. Much love to everyone, happy holidays, and hope to see even more of you all around the world in 2020!!! #speaker #keynotespeaker #workmom #worldtraveler #womeninbusiness

Name: Randi Zuckerberg
Text: Check out my interview with @mralexquin on his podcast #hustleinspireshustle! Alex, thanks so much for having me!

Name: Randi Zuckerberg
Text: How do we get more women and girls in STEM? By showcasing relatable female role models. Listen to @OnTheDotWoman's See It To Be It Podcast where I chat with Melinda Garvey about women in education, technology and entrepreneurship.

Name: Randi Zuckerberg
Text: We are all faced with a series of great opportunities brilliantly disguised as impossible situations.

Name: Randi Zuckerberg
Text: Join me for a very special #personalbranding for leaders session with the Zuckerberg Institute on Sept 26th! RSVP online here: https://lnkd.in/gzvaJG5Are you interested in building your own personal brand but don't know where to start?Do you want a brand that helps you get positively noticed at work and beyond? Learn the basics of building a personal brand for anyone who is a current or future leader at work.This session is perfect for everyone from the small business owner running a 3 person team to a seasoned executive with multiple branches of ownership.#leadership #branding

Name: Randi Zuckerberg
Text: Join me for a very special #personalbranding for leaders session with the Zuckerberg Institute on Sept 26th! RSVP online here: https://lnkd.in/gzvaJG5Are you interested in building your own personal brand but don't know where to start?Do you want a brand that helps you get positively noticed at work and beyond? Learn the basics of building a personal brand for anyone who is a current or future leader at work.This session is perfect for everyone from the small business owner running a 3 person team to a seasoned executive with multiple branches of ownership.#leadership #branding

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: To celebrate this year’s #DayOfTheGirl, I wrote a letter to my 15-year-old self. #GenerationEquality

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: Thank you to all the youth for bringing your questions forward for a special episode of Ask Me Anything. May we keep pushing for change together with #GenerationEquality.

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: There has been progress for gender equality, but not yet enough, and too slow. Women and the people of the world are demanding change. https://lnkd.in/dvjv8AX

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: Adopted 25 years ago at the Fourth World Conference on Women, the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action marked a new era in the fight for gender equality. It is in our hands to tackle the unfinished business of realizing women's rights. #GenerationEquality

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: Women are half of the population, but society doesn’t treat them as equals. This is a legacy that needs to change. Here and now. Here’s a powerful segment from the #NationsUnited film. Find out more about the current status of gender equality: https://lnkd.in/dRhuwhH

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: Today marks International #PeaceDay. Peace is a prerequisite for health, equality and human security. Our vision is a world that values women’s power to overcome crises and takes a path to lasting peace, justice, equality and inclusion. #WomenPeacePower

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: The future of our countries and communities belongs to all people. By crafting a #COVID response that is truly inclusive and rooted in the power of women-led peace, we have a transformative opportunity to build back better, into a more peaceful, sustainable and equitable world.UN Women statement for International #PeaceDay: https://lnkd.in/dKT3weC

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: I want to hear from youth who want to see a change in the world. What would you like to know about gender equality and how we got here in our journey? Reply to this post with your question, age and country and you may be featured. #GenerationEquality

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: A woman’s payday shouldn’t be a reminder of an unjust world. As we mark the first ever International #EqualPayDay on 18 September, take a closer look at the gender pay gap and what can be done to close it.

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: Exactly 25 years after the opening of the Fourth World Conference on Women in Beijing, China, its significance is undimmed. On this important anniversary, let us reaffirm the promises the world made to women and girls in 1995.

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: NEW: UN Women's report, Gender Equality in the Wake of #COVID, in collaboration with UNDP, highlights projections on poverty by sex and age in a post-pandemic world.

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: On this #WorldHumanitarianDay, as we commend the commitment of humanitarian workers across the globe, let us learn about, support and celebrate the efforts of humanitarian workers. #RealLifeHeroes

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: As we celebrate International #YouthDay, let's recognize the immense value of young people who are at the forefront of global action for change, both in responding to the pandemic and in work to address the systemic inequalities it has unearthed. #GenerationEquality

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: Standing against racism, discrimination and sexism is more than a trend. Keep your activism going during #COVID. Learn about these powerhouse Black women who are sure to inspire.

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: We're far from achieving equality. But through intersectional feminism, we can better understand one another and strive towards a just future for all.

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: My op-ed with Dr. Natalia Kanem, the Executive Director of the United Nations Population Fund on the need to put women at the centre of the Syria Crisis Response. As the conflict enters its 10th year, the effects of #COVID are compounding the risks and hardships for millions.

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: On our 10th birthday, as we look ahead to #GenerationEquality, we thank all those who have made this journey with us; all those who went before in the women’s movements on whose shoulders we stand, and who were relentless in calling for gender equality to be given its rightful place and for UN Women to be created. We know that to change the world will take the world.

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: In fighting apartheid, it took people of the world also to be in solidarity and to fight together and help to end apartheid. This time has come again. We must be united to end racism as well as gender inequality in the world. #FightRacism #StandUp4HumanRights

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: Conflict-related sexual violence is being used as a tactic of war and terrorism in many countries. As a member of UN Action, UN Women calls on all parties to conflict to commit to ceasing all acts of sexual violence as part of the call for a #globalceasefire. http://ow.ly/IxRj50A5GDg #stoprapenow #wpsin2020

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: It is only through holding ourselves accountable that we will see sustainable change. I believe we could be doing more to project the commitment of the marketing and advertising industry to a world that is inclusive.Here's our joint call to action to the industry with Stephan Loerke, CEO of WFA and founding member of the Unstereotype Alliance.

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: How are #Gender, #ClimateChange, and #Security linked? Climate change hazards can expose women and men to new and distinct security risks or exacerbate existing gender-based inequalities. Simultaneously, insecurity at various levels can undermine women and men's ability to adapt, prevent, or recover from climate change impacts. Find out more in our new report Gender, Climate and Security: Sustaining Inclusive Peace on the Frontlines of Climate Change. #GlobalGoals

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: Sunday is the International Day Against Homophobia, Biphobia, Interphobia and Transphobia #IDAHOBIT). We at UN Women will continue to stand up for #LGBTQI+ rights, in recognition, respect and celebration of the diversity and resilience of our communities worldwide. #LoveIsLove

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: There are millions of girls who could right now be learning from home – if only they were connected. On International #GirlsinICT Day, we urge governments not to leave these girls behind.

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: Ready to come together virtually today at 2pm ET with Global Citizen and World Health Organization? Tune in to the One World: #TogetherAtHome concert, a historic, global broadcast to support the fight against #COVID!

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: With 90 countries in lockdown, four billion people are now sheltering at home from the global contagion of #COVID. It’s a protective measure, but it brings another deadly danger. We see a shadow pandemic growing, of violence against women. #coronavirus #violenceagainstwomen

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: One thing is clear about the #COVID pandemic, as stock markets tumble, schools and universities close, people stockpile supplies and home becomes a different and crowded space: #coronavirus is not just a health issue.

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: It’s been 25 years since the adoption of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action, but how close are we really to achieving gender equality? UN Women's new report, "Women’s Rights in Review" takes a closer look. #GenerationEquality

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: BREAKING NEWS: UN Women has found a country that has achieved gender equality! This is what #GenerationEquality has been work for. Take a tour of its bustling capital.

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: We have to recognize and act on the fact that the current economic models are not protecting and supporting women’s rights. Our #GenerationEquality campaign is calling for urgent action. I've shared my thoughts in World Economic Forum's blog. #gendergap20

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: During my trip to Cox's Bazar, I met with a number of refugee women and girls. I visited the UN Women Multi-Purpose Women’s Centre and the Women Friendly Space run by Action Aid, where UN Women supports women’s skills training, and spoke with women and young girls that were at the Centres. Both these “women-only” places provide a safe space for the most vulnerable, neglected and marginalized Rohingya women, especially single mothers and adolescent girls who have little opportunity to come out of their houses due to the strict gender norms and segregation imposed by cultural and religious practices. Read more about my trip:  https://lnkd.in/dUD3GCB Photo Credit: UN Women/ Allison Joyce

Name: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka
Text: In Cox's Bazar, Bangladesh, to visit the Rohingya refugee camp, I was so inspired by people’s resilience. UN Women, together with partners, is addressing the fastest growing refugee crisis. More than 688,800 Rohingya refugees have arrived in Bangladesh since August 2017, fleeing persecution in Myanmar, more than half of them women and girls. Learn more about what we are doing on the ground:

Text: Me Too Movement -  #metoo first went viral three years ago, on October 15, 2017 - but the movement is actually much older than that - it was founded by Tarana Burke in 2006. On the third anniversary of the movement going viral, ‘me too’ is releasing something big. It’s a brand new tech platform called “Act Too.” It gives everyone the chance to join the fight to end sexual violence with everyday actions - find incredible books to read, engaging podcasts, powerful protests to join, and ways to donate.Learn more here: https://lnkd.in/eHwpVDH

Name: Katie Couric
Text: If at first you don’t succeed, you're in luck.Effortless excellence is a lousy teacher and a fickle friend.The achievements we savor most start with a struggle and end with hard-earned mastery.Success is sweeter—and more repeatable—when it's the product of deliberate practice.

Name: Katie Couric
Text: I'm thrilled to spotlight feminist icon, Gloria Steinem, in the latest #SeeHerStory! Gloria initially wanted to be a political writer but when serious writing roles for women were few and far in-between, she famously took a role going undercover as a Playboy Bunny. Frustrated by the continued lack of opportunity, she later took part in the growing women’s movement of the late 1960s. “I became aware that I could no longer only write about something — I had to also act on it,” she said. Gloria is continuing the revolution today by making sure Black women’s voices are incorporated in feminist history.

Name: Katie Couric
Text: Paris Hilton joined me to discuss her new YouTube documentary, "This Is Paris." I’ve been playing this ditzy character for so long in the public that people would assume that’s how I really am,” Paris told me during a discussion about the film. “Now I feel like people can finally see that I was acting this entire time,” she added. The film also gives a glimpse into her past—including alleged abuse she suffered at boarding school in Utah.

Name: Katie Couric
Text: Exciting news! I just launched a ✨new✨ podcast called “TURNOUT” and the first episode is out now! In this limited series, I explore America’s voting record - past, present, and future - with the help of activists, historians, and politicians. We dive into the way voters have been kept out of the system and spotlight those fighting - on the ground and in the courts - to ensure everyone can participate in our democracy.In this first episode, I go back to the beginning to find out what our founding can tell us about the continuing war on voting rights with the help of historian Jon Meacham. I’m also joined by Wendy Weiser of the Brennan Center for Justice, voting rights expert Gilda Daniels, and Oregon Governor Kate Brown. Listen to the full episode anywhere you get your podcasts! I look forward to hearing your thoughts on this episode.

Name: Katie Couric
Text: On this week’s #MolnersTable, Katie Couric Media CEO John Molner sits down with YouTube stars Collins and Devan Key. Together, these brothers’ wacky family-friendly YouTube videos have attracted more than 22 million subscribers. Their videos have gotten the attention of big-name brands — from AT&T to General Mills — and have been referred to as ‘this generation’s Saturday morning TV.” John speaks with Collins and Devan about growing an audience, going viral, and what it is about their wacky videos that makes so many people click play.

Name: Katie Couric
Text: I don’t know about you all, but when it comes to retirement planning - I’m a bit out of my element. Did you know a healthy 65 year-old-couple retiring in the US will need $285,000 to pay for healthcare costs for the rest of their lives?! My friends at Silvur (owned by Kindur) are back to help explain the real-life healthcare costs in retirement everyone needs to know about!

Name: Katie Couric
Text: Tracee Ellis Ross makes everything she does look so easy. As Diana Ross's daughter, she grew up in the limelight and went on to launch her own acting career. She's graced T.V. screens as powerful Black female characters, first in Girlfriends, and now, in Black-ish. (Plus, she's a businesswoman, as the head of Pattern Beauty, a haircare line for curly, coily, and tight hair textures!) I'm thrilled to profile this amazing woman in this week's #SeeHer Story.

Name: Katie Couric
Text: Why I Changed my LinkedIn Profile PicRecently, I took a long hard look at my LinkedIn profile photo – the woman staring back at me had newly highlighted hair and a fresh cut, a pressed blazer, a hint of a smile that showed just the right amount of teeth to let you know she was serious but could be lighthearted when needed. I remember standing in my power pose as my husband snapped the photos. We poured through about 80 shots before we found the one that looked perfectly polished. But the person I was exuding then is not always who I am, and certainly, not who I am right now.  Today’s remote world has blurred the lines between my professional and personal selves, so I’ve chosen to represent that in my photo. Barely dried hair, comfy pullover, ripped jeans - slightly frazzled from having just gotten 3 kids ready for "school" - but smiling and ready for work.I’ve witnessed and read enough on authentic leadership to know that being genuine and vulnerable will get you a lot farther in your career than a glossy headshot.

Name: Katie Couric
Text: On Friday evening, Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg passed away at the age of 87 due to complications from pancreatic cancer. In 2014 and again in 2016, I had the honor of interviewing Justice Ginsburg. I wanted to share our conversation from six years ago which shows her deep intelligence, her sharp wit, the hurdles she faced, and the forces that shaped her. She also shared what she hoped her legacy would be. It was such a privilege. And she fought to the very end. #restinpeace #rbg https://lnkd.in/gc57WPz

Name: Katie Couric
Text: It was devastating to hear about actor Chadwick Boseman’s death from colon cancer at the age of 43. And it hit particularly close to home for me, as my late husband Jay died of the same disease when he was 42 — more than twenty years ago. One of his doctors was Mark Pochapin, who is now President of the American College of Gastroenterology. He answers my questions on the latest developments in colorectal cancer research and offers advice on how you can protect yourself and your loved ones from the second leading cancer killer in the U.S.

Name: Katie Couric
Text: I’ll never forget where I was when I heard that Princess Diana was critically injured in a car accident in Paris. It was the end of August 1997, and I was at our home in Millbrook, New York. My husband, Jay, was in the middle of his battle with colon cancer, and it was an incredibly stressful time. When the news broke, I spent hours glued to the TV in our family room, waiting for any bit of information. I was so upset and holding my breath like the rest of the world. But eventually, Brian Williams announced she had died. I was devastated. I hopped on a plane to cover the funeral. Although I was reporting on what was going on, I too was mourning Princess Diana. Now, 23 years after that tragic car accident, Diana is preserved in our memories: young, vibrant, and still figuring out who she was as she entered a new, exciting and probably nerve-racking period in her life. So much lost potential, but so many indelible images of a woman — loving her boys and finding her purpose, as well as herself. And in death, as in life, inspiring all of us to do the same. #rememberingprincessdiana #princessdi

Name: Katie Couric
Text: Happy Birthday, Melissa McCarthy! Melissa has remained unapologetically herself throughout her genre-bending career - creating her own roles, never giving up on her dreams, and fighting for equal pay and opportunity in her industry. #SeeHerStory #equalpayforequalwork
