Name: Katie Couric
Text: This month marks 100 years since the 19th Amendment’s passage. For #seeherstory, we’re highlighting the life of Alice Paul — a famous suffragette. Born in 1885, Alice attended suffrage meetings with her mother from a young age. She organized the National Women’s Party — and held protests at the White House. When women finally received the right to vote, Paul dedicated her life to the Equal Rights Amendment, which has yet to be ratified by all states. #vote #votingrights #19thamendment #history #seeher

Name: Katie Couric
Text: Today is #BlackWomensEqualPayDay. Black women work full-time in the U.S. typically earn 62 cents for every dollar a white man makes. Per a new analysis, this wage gap costs Black women more than $23,000 a year. There’s also research that shows that Black women are among the hardest hit by the coronavirus unemployment crisis.

Name: Katie Couric
Text: My latest for @TIME: I  spoke to Dr. Loretta Christensen, chief medical officer at Navajo Nation, to understand the crisis the Navajo Nation is facing with the COVID pandemic and how they are supporting their communities during this time. https://lnkd.in/dBxjkZH

Name: Katie Couric
Text: Today in Wake-Up Call - an interview with Emily Ramshaw, CEO and co-founder of THE19th - a nonprofit news organization with a focus on gender, politics and policy. https://lnkd.in/eJrwYaT#women #womeninmedia #womeninbusiness #genderequality #seeher #interview

Name: Katie Couric
Text: Love this reminder on #SelfCareSunday. Tag someone you love. 💜

Name: Katie Couric
Text: My latest for TIME: The Washington Post media columnist Margaret Sullivan explains how the decline of local news can have significant consequences for communities - and how many communities across the country are becoming “news deserts”—places with limited local news sources. #timereports #localjournalism #localnews #interview

Name: Katie Couric
Text: My final mission for my Rally Health series is to DANCE more. Did you know dancing can help burn more calories than running or swimming? I recruited dance extraordinaire Ryan Heffington who’s worked with superstars like Britney Spears, Sia, and Emma Stone, to show me some moves! PS: I may or may not have taught him a move or two!😉  #kcmpartner #healthy #wellness #getmoving Katie Couric Media https://lnkd.in/eSGv8Px

Name: Katie Couric
Text: For her 39th birthday, we’re featuring Meghan Markle, Duchess of Sussex in today’s #SeeHer Story. A Los Angeles native and Northwestern grad, Meghan nabbed her breakout role in Hollywood as Rachel Zane in Suits. In 2016, Meghan met Prince Harry on a blind date — and two years later, almost two billion people watched their wedding. But life as a royal wasn’t always a fairy tale and, as the upcoming book Finding Freedom explores, Meghan and Harry stepped away from royal life. #seeherstory #meghanmarkle #happybirthday

Name: Katie Couric
Text: #SeeHer Story: Hattie McDaniel made history as the first Black Academy Award winner for her role in "Gone With The Wind", but she wasn’t allowed to attend the ceremony due to the color of her skin. SEEHER

Name: Katie Couric
Text: Today we kicked off our virtual National Sales Conference! It is so exciting to be connected with most of our customer facing team members at one time. We spent time discussing our strategic journey and how we are accelerating our mission with the important role our 360 smart bed has to an individual’s health and well-being. We also built on our foundation of individuality with a deep discussion on the value of listening and learning to advance our diversity, equity and inclusion. Katie Couric and I discussed importance of quality sleep and what we’ve learned during the convergence of the pandemic and the movement for social justice. We also discussed how my “5 Cs” of authentic leadership – courage, clarity, compassion, confidence and commitment have been instrumental in leading Sleep Number through challenges to become even stronger in our commitment to our purpose of improving lives through a kinder, more rested society. I could not be more proud of our Sleep Number team and their dedication to our mission and culture of individuality and innovation. Thank you, #TeamSleepNumber, for the many lives you improve! P.S. Last night my SleepIQ Score was 86!

Name: Katie Couric
Text: During our virtual National Conference this week, it was an honor to recognize the outstanding work of #TeamSleepNumber. Their continued resilience, passion and dedication to our mission of improving lives by individualizing sleep experiences is impressive. I am grateful for their commitment of progressing our culture of individuality and innovation. THANK YOU, team members, for all that you do! We also presented our Circle of Excellence Award to Caesar Barron. This award recognizes consistent, inspiring leadership and excellence in execution with uncompromising demonstration of our company values. Caesar is a warm, inspiring leader who has tremendous empathy and passion. His resourcefulness, kindness and tenacity drives performance to incredible levels in every situation.  Congratulations, Caesar!

Name: Katie Couric
Text: It's disappointing that so few interviewers give feedback to job applicants after rejecting them. When turning candidates away, the least we can do is make it a learning experience. Ghosting is selfish. People are hurting. A bit of guidance might help them get hired elsewhere.

Name: Katie Couric
Text: It's disappointing that so few interviewers give feedback to job applicants after rejecting them. When turning candidates away, the least we can do is make it a learning experience. Ghosting is selfish. People are hurting. A bit of guidance might help them get hired elsewhere.

Name: Katie Couric
Text: I had the privilege of being Nadine Dietz's guest on CMO Moves earlier this month! Listen to our full conversation below! Adweek #podcast

Name: Katie Couric
Text: Today in Wake-Up Call -- Congressional hopeful and former CEO and tech entrepreneur Brynne Kennedy on rebuilding an economy where everyone can thrive.

Name: Katie Couric
Text: On the next episode of Back to Biz with Katie and Boz, Bozoma Saint John and I will be interviewing the presidents of our alma maters — Wesleyan University and the University of Virginia — about the future of higher ed. If you’re an incoming freshman or recent grad whose plans have been affected by the pandemic, share your story, thoughts, concerns with us! Leave a detailed message at 844-479-7883 or email  info@katiecouric.com with ‘COLLEGE’ in the subject line.

Name: Katie Couric
Text: Simone Biles has continued to defy barriers — and physics — in the world of gymnastics. At only 23 years old, Biles has become the most decorated gymnast in history and even has a list of moves so difficult that only she has ever performed them. But her road to success wasn't always easy, and her determination to never back down is why we chose to honor the athlete in this week's episode. #seeherstory #seeher

Name: Katie Couric
Text: So many of our normal activities have drastically changed amid the ongoing pandemic — including dining out. Nextdoor asked 745,000 people in the U.S. how they feel about eating at restaurants right now. While nine in 10 people want to support these local businesses, most just aren’t sold on indoor dining. We also spoke with restaurant owners about how they’re enforcing mask rules and taking safety precautions. Check out more below!⬇️#nextdoorbusiness #nextdoorinsights

Name: Katie Couric
Text: This week’s episode of #SeeHer Story profiles Australian swimmer Annette Kellerman — who made a splash around the world with her groundbreaking swimwear choices and focus on female fitness.🏊🏼‍♀️💧https://lnkd.in/g_3zhCp

Name: Katie Couric
Text: I am passionate about well-being: Sleeping well, exercising, eating right and beginning each day with gratitude. Few things are as empowering as taking good care of yourself – and the benefits to boosting immunity and preventing disease are compelling. A disease like cancer impacts us all and I want to be active in fighting against it. This is why I recently joined the CEOs Against Cancer - Minnesota Chapter as the Vice-Chair. Today, I’m joining seven other CEOs in a one-day step challenge to kick off #Fit2BeCancerFree, a three-week virtual race that #TeamSleepNumber will participate in - and hopefully win! Keep an eye on the CEO leaderboard today!

Name: Katie Couric
Text: July is #MinorityMentalHealthAwarenessMonth. This year, it’s happened to fall during a global pandemic, when self-care is more important than ever. Finding the right therapist can be challenging, but the search is even more difficult for immigrants, and people of color, who want someone who can relate to their unique experiences. Today in Wake-Up Call,  Alisha Ramos - Founder/CEO of the popular Girls'​ Night In’ newsletter - writes about her search for a Korean American therapist. #mentalwellness

Name: Katie Couric
Text: July is #MinorityMentalHealthAwarenessMonth. This year, it’s happened to fall during a global pandemic, when self-care is more important than ever. Finding the right therapist can be challenging, but the search is even more difficult for immigrants, and people of color, who want someone who can relate to their unique experiences. Today in Wake-Up Call,  Alisha Ramos - Founder/CEO of the popular Girls'​ Night In’ newsletter - writes about her search for a Korean American therapist. #mentalwellness

Name: Katie Couric
Text: During this uncertain time, many of us are going through unprecedented changes. Bruce Feiler gets it — he lived a pretty “linear” life... until it was upended by a series of tragedies. In his search for answers, Feiler talked to people who went through major periods of upheaval, — who left cults, lost legs, and more — for a book of advice: Life Is In the Transitions. Feiler offers some foolproof tips on how to cope with difficult transitions. ⬇️

Name: Katie Couric
Text: New episode of #MolnersTable! Today, CBS This Morning co-host Gayle King takes a break from the news to join John Molner on #MolnersTable. Watch the full conversation below!

Name: Katie Couric
Text: Check it out! Molner's guest this week on #MolnersTable is the one and only Bozoma Saint John! Boz was recently appointed Netflix's chief marketing officer and has worked with some of the world’s largest corporations — including PepsiCo, Apple, Uber, and Endeavor. They talk about Boz's new gig at Netflix, what business leaders can do to be more inclusive, and how she managed to convince Spike Lee to make Beyoncé, prior to the start of her phenomenal solo career, the face of Pepsi when she was only 24 years old. Check out the full conversation below!

Name: Katie Couric
Text: At only 22 years old, Malala Yousafzai has become one of the most influential champions of female education in the world. She survived being shot by the Taliban, became the youngest winner of the Nobel Prize, and just graduated from the University of Oxford. Learn more about Malala's incredible story⬇️  #SeeHerStory

Name: Katie Couric
Text: Did you all know that my husband John Molner has started his own feature in Wake-Up Call? On Molner’s Table, he sits down with top business leaders to discuss issues and solutions during these unprecedented times. (He’s coming for my spot people!🤣) But in all seriousness, today’s episode is a conversation with our good friend and incredible human being, Wes Moore who is the CEO of Robin Hood- one of the largest anti-poverty organizations in the country.Molner and I have long supported Robin Hood and the incredible work they’re doing - and we are supporting their COVID relief fund as well as their newest initiative, The Power Fund. Over the past two decades, only 10% of philanthropic dollars have gone to organizations led by people of color, despite giving increasing nearly 400%. This fund will invest in and elevate leaders of color who share Robin Hood’s mission to support families on pathways out of poverty. I hope you’ll join me and Molner in supporting this amazing fund and organization and making a donation if you’re able (https://bit.ly/2DhfsoF) And check out the full interview with Molner and Wes below!#robinhood #fundraising #business #nonprofits https://lnkd.in/egtSnNy

Name: Katie Couric
Text: “What you’re seeing is going to be in the history books… Act accordingly” Today in Wake-Up Call - we have an interview with Paul Delaney - a former editor at The New York Times and one of the founders of the National Association of Black Journalists (NABJ). He covered the civil rights movement and the aftermath of MLK's assassination. He shares his advice for journalists today:https://lnkd.in/eYPVrZn#journalism #socialjustice #advice

Name: Katie Couric
Text: I'm thrilled to share the second episode of #SeeHer Story, Season Two. Fannie Lou Hamer was a former sharecropper who dedicated her life to fighting for every Black American's right to vote. Fannie's inspirational work as a civil rights leader helped to secure black voter rights and break political barriers. #SeeHerStorySEEHER #seeherstory #herstory #vote #votingrights

Name: Katie Couric
Text: On this week's episode of Back to Biz, Bozoma Saint John and I talk to Airbnb co-founder and CEO Brian Chesky about Airbnb's racial reckoning and the future of travel. #podcast #business #airbnb #travel Listen here: https://lnkd.in/e--8SUz

Name: Katie Couric
Text: “I’m a mom of five, and I have cancer — during a pandemic.” Janet Dagenais is keeping up with her coaching business and homeschooling her kids, all the while dealing with melanoma. In other words? Superwoman. Her story is the latest in my new series, “Cancer During COVID,” with Merck. Read Janet’s story:

Name: Katie Couric
Text: Fake news is causing global harm and hampering our ability to make progress on many of the world’s most pressing issues from fighting the pandemic to the struggle for racial justice. We must all work together to counter misinformation. Instead of sharing content in the heat of the moment, PAUSE. #TakeCareBeforeYouShare.  Learn more via @unitednations @who: TakeCareBeforeYouShare.org

Name: Katie Couric
Text: The pandemic has made getting a good night's rest a challenge for many people. So I chatted with Sleep Number Corporation's CEO Shelly Ibach for some expert tips to a good night's rest. Here's what you can do about it... (Hint: it includes cutting caffeine after a certain time!)#sleeptips #sleephealth #wellnesstips

Name: Katie Couric
Text: On June 26, 2015 - the Supreme Court ruled in a 5-4 decision that the Constitution guarantees a right to same-sex marriage. "No longer may this liberty be denied," Justice Anthony M. Kennedy wrote for the majority in the historic decision. "No union is more profound than marriage, for it embodies the highest ideals of love, fidelity, devotion, sacrifice, and family."  Back in 2015, I interviewed Jim Obergefell, who was the plaintiff at the heart of this historic case. Thinking of Jim and the countless other individuals who fought so hard for the right to love and marry whomever they wanted to. 🏳️‍🌈  #pride

Name: Brad Smith
Text: The pandemic has widened the digital divide across much of the U.S. We've partnered with Land O'Lakes, Inc., Tractor Supply Company, and National 4-H Council to turn on free public Wi-Fi at more than 2,300 locations in more than a dozen states. You can check out the map here:

Name: Brad Smith
Text: COVID has underscored the need for people to acquire 21st century skills in every corner of the planet. Our "More for Brazil" plan will help provide job matching for up to 25M people, and free digital skilling for more than 5M people. And since the Amazon is such a precious resource, we’re also announcing an initiative to help protect this rainforest from deforestation using AI.

Name: Brad Smith
Text: During my visit to São Paulo, Brazil last year, I spoke with several business leaders, startups, and entrepreneurs. I was so impressed by their energy, creativity and drive to innovate using technology. Today I am delighted to share the " More for Brazil " plan to expand Microsoft’s cloud infrastructure in Brazil, as well as an alliance with the Ministry of Economy to help job matching for up to 25 million workers and a new program to protect the Amazon rainforest from deforestation using AI. #MicrosoftMaisBrasil #digitaltransformation

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Today’s announcement represents much more than building data centers. It’s an opportunity to bring to Austria the technology needed for people, businesses and government agencies to reimagine and transform their operations, grow their enterprises, and gain new digital skills. Learn more: https://lnkd.in/ePgew3R #digitaltransfomation

Name: Brad Smith
Text: I’m looking forward to listening to Casper Klynge's Tech Fit 4 Europe podcast as he explores the big tech policy questions in Europe and beyond.

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Today we are thrilled to bring to life our #TechFit4Europe podcast! Join us as we bring you some of the most influential voices on the key policy discussions in Europe & around the globe 🌍 And just in time for #EUGreenWeek we focus on the #GreenDeal & sustainability in our first episode with Member of the European Parliament, Pascal Canfin. The EU is focused on enabling a green economic recovery from the COVID crisis. From increasing green investments to supporting the roll-out of carbon neutral technology, MEP Pascal Canfin weighs in on how to realize Europe’s green ambitions and the role the private sector must play.https://lnkd.in/dJ79c9JMicrosoft Brad Smith Shelley McKinley Virginijus Sinkevičius Mark Lange Adina Braha-Honciuc (Ellis) Nikolaj Juncher Wædegaard Andreea-Doina Calbeaza Alex Vasey

Name: Brad Smith
Text: As Julie Brill outlines in this thoughtful blog post, it's time for business and government "to work together to pass laws and reinvent practices to recognize the individual right to own and control personal data and to place the responsibility for protecting privacy where it belongs – on companies." Read more here: https://lnkd.in/esUUUjV#privacy #recovery #data

Name: Brad Smith
Text: As some of you may have seen, we've expanded Microsoft Bing's #GiveWithBing program to make it easier for more people to donate to more nonprofits around the globe. I wanted to take some time to share why this Give With Bing program means so much to me.

Name: Brad Smith
Text: As COVID continues to force many of our lives online, millions are being left behind, especially in communities of color. Partnerships like ours with the City of Los Angeles and Starry Internet are critical to closing that opportunity gap. https://lnkd.in/ex_H4g6

Name: Brad Smith
Text: #AI models the world based on the data given – but if that data doesn’t include people with disabilities, the tech won’t work for this important community. Learn more about how we’re tackling the issue of algorithmic exclusion of people with disabilities by partnering with some incredible people and organizations around the world. https://lnkd.in/exvRzQA

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Our skilling initiative has now reached more than 10 million job seekers in 231 countries and territories! The ultimate goal is to better serve people, filling jobs and creating opportunities for individuals around the world. We should all aspire to turn a year that had a bleak beginning into a decade that has a bright finish. https://lnkd.in/gUcQKp3

Name: Brad Smith
Text: “You know, technology in the end is neutral. How it is ultimately developed and how it is applied is really a function of values, either of the entity that is developing the technology or the country that is employing the technology.” More from my conversation with The Brookings Institution's Gen. John Allen here: https://lnkd.in/eqG4NM9 #multiateralism #democracy #UNGA #AI #ethics

Name: Brad Smith
Text: We need to develop new ways to capture, transport, and store carbon. This will require enormous investment and innovation, including a huge amount of computing power and data. As a company, Microsoft is excited about and committed to supporting promising carbon capture approaches. I was delighted to spend time (virtually) this morning in Oslo with Norwegian Prime Minister Erna Solberg and Minister Tina Tru to announce that we’re exploring how new solutions like the Northern Lights project can help the world address climate change – as well as help companies like ours meet our carbon goals.

Name: Brad Smith
Text: One of the keys to a genuinely inclusive recovery from the impacts of COVID are programs to provide easier access to digital skills for people hardest hit by job losses. We’re excited to build on our global skills initiative to help 1.5 million people in the UK build careers in technology by 2025.

Name: Brad Smith
Text: During this year's virtual UNGA, Microsoft Senior Director for Strategic Partnerships Jean-Yves Art and Doreen Bogdan-Martin, director of the Telecommunication Development Bureau of the International Telecommunication Union, discuss what's at stake and meaningful solutions as countless people around the world struggle to access digital tools and broadband. #connectivity #COVID #UN75

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Ransomware is a significant threat to the upcoming election. Great work to protect the integrity of our elections and our democracy by Tom Burt and our DCU team. https://lnkd.in/eret6YT #electionsecurity

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Honored to be a participant in this awesome panel and conference of lawyer moms doing some pretty amazing things in and out of the legal profession!

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Microsoft announces plans for the first datacenter in Greece as part of the “GR for GRowth” digital transformation initiative, which includes cloud services. Eurobank, the first Greek bank to use Microsoft cloud computing, is proud to be supporting this major €1 billion investment, which signals the country’s potential in becoming a leading regional hub for innovation. Learn more: https://lnkd.in/d8RAfQh#Eurobank #Microsoft #GRforGRowth #Datacenter

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Exciting news: I am joining Microsoft as the Global Lead, Sustainability Science.My first task is to build a sustainability science team. See open positions👉https://lnkd.in/gefUFVz What excites me about this role:(1) 𝗖𝗼𝗿𝗽𝗼𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝘀𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗻𝗮𝗯𝗶𝗹𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗹𝗲𝗱 𝗯𝘆 𝘀𝗰𝗶𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲. Microsoft has committed to operating carbon negative, zero waste,& water positive by 2030. To ensure that corporate strategy continues to be guided by the best science, Lucas Joppa recognized the need for a global #sustainability #science team, which we are building now!  (2) 𝗦𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗻𝗮𝗯𝗶𝗹𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝘀𝗰𝗶𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗮𝘁 𝘀𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗲. Climate change, biodiversity loss, pollution, water, health,justice & equity are interconnected and must be understood within a planetary perspective. Our team will work w/science, bussines & policy communities to build knowledge & tools to help tackle these challenges at scale. (3) 𝗦𝗵𝗮𝗽𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗴𝗹𝗼𝗯𝗮𝗹 𝗲𝗻𝘃𝗶𝗿𝗼𝗻𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗹 𝗴𝗼𝘃𝗲𝗿𝗻𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲.The digital age is transforming how we monitor & manage the natural world, and is opening opportunities for transforming how we govern for global sustainability. We get to work w/ amazing engineers who are building a “Planetary Computer,” to help operationalize science in support of policy & action.

Name: Brad Smith
Text: The boldest chapter in our 28-year long history in Greece begins today! With our new Greece datacenter region and the parallel upskilling program of thousands of citizens, we are fueling up the economy and society with all the technology and expertise to tackle the challenges and seize the opportunities of the future. The time is now: to sustain and transform businesses, to explore new entrepreneurial opportunities, to innovate, thrive and surpass some of the country’s most challenging constraints. The time is now to GRow. #GRforGRrowth​https://lnkd.in/gwF2rH4 ‎

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Building on Microsoft’s racial equity commitment, we are increasing technology support for nonprofits that support Black and African American communities by assisting them in accessing donations, discounts and resources to support their impact https://lnkd.in/gkGqBem

Name: Brad Smith
Text: October is National Disability Employment Awareness Month. This month is an opportunity to reflect on and understand how COVID has disproportionately impacted people with disabilities – and ensure this important community is included in the economic recovery. #NDEAM https://lnkd.in/e8vDbaq

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Apps are an important part of the digital economy, and app stores have become a critical gateway. Today we adopted 10 principles for the Microsoft Store on Windows 10 that are designed to promote choice, ensure fairness and protect innovation. https://lnkd.in/dbBwjAR

Name: Brad Smith
Text: How do we build a more sustainable, inclusive, and fair future as we recover from the COVID pandemic - and what's the role of the corporate sector? At this year's #UN75, I had the opportunity to chat about all this with United Nations Human Rights High Commissioner Michelle Bachelet. Learn about her important role and some of the issues that are top-of-mind for #HumanRights advocates today through our recent conversation. Watch: https://lnkd.in/ecY49hY#UNGA United Nations

Name: Brad Smith
Text: We support #TheTrinityChallenge as a Founding Member through the #AIforHealth program as they encourage collaboration and innovation by leveraging data science and advanced technology to help prevent future health crises.

Name: Brad Smith
Text: I'm looking forward to discussing with Sean how Microsoft is using technology to go from data to insight to action.

Name: Brad Smith
Text: While Kent Walker and I are from competing companies, we share concerns that the SCOTUS decision on the Google vs. Oracle case could impact the tech sector’s ability to continue innovating – and for consumers to continue using different digital services on the devices of their choice. We explain the importance of interoperability in this Wall Street Journal op-ed: https://lnkd.in/eym5-6r

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Healthy democracies require healthy journalism. However, technology has created significant challenges in the news business, that are only accelerating with the pandemic. That’s why we’re piloting a new initiative to help rebuild local newsrooms, restore integrity, and increase security. Here's more from Mary Snapp: https://lnkd.in/dfNN3kQ#journalism

Name: Brad Smith
Text: We need a multilateral approach when it comes to closing the digital divide and looming skills gap. Watch this important conversation:

Name: Brad Smith
Text: I had another opportunity to discuss our goals as a team and the work we're doing at the UN.

Name: Brad Smith
Text: "Perhaps George Orwell made only one mistake when he wrote his book ... he should have titled it 2024, not 1984." I can't think of a better place to discuss technology and the future of democracy than in the cradle of democracy -- Athens, Greece. https://lnkd.in/g8D36AP Brad Smith

Name: Brad Smith
Text: In 1992, before I joined Microsoft, I visited Athens as a lawyer work for the software industry. I never dreamed that 28 years later I would help announce something as significant as what we shared today - plans to build datacenters in Greece. By a substantial margin, this is the largest investment Microsoft has made in Greece in the 28 years we’ve been operating here. In part, this reflects confidence that our world-leading datacenter technology can help enable innovation and growth across Greece’s economy — as well as our confidence and optimism in Greece’s future. https://lnkd.in/dkCPintTheodosis Michalopoulos, Nanna-Louise W. Linde, Carol Ann Browne, Antigoni Papanikolaou, Tilemachos Moraitis, Kostas Loukas, Vangelis Morfis, Eugenia Bozou

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Another stark reality we’re facing in 2020: Democracies are fragile. We’re seeing firsthand how technology can be used as a tool to advance – or degrade – democratic principles. We in the tech community have a responsibility to do more to protect societies around the world. Of course, that starts with ethics training for anyone designing tech. Thanks to Yuval Noah Harari, Kristen Davis and Alexis Papahelas for a thought-provoking discussion during the Athens Democracy Forum. You can watch the panel here: https://lnkd.in/eZ69RJH #democracy

Name: Brad Smith
Text: The mid-1960s was an era of reinvention for the US and much of the world – including the art world. And Sol LeWitt helped lead much of that evolution. Today, as we go through another time of reinvention, we can all experience and learn about his art digitally: https://lnkd.in/ew4DSKF

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Misinformation comes in many forms, which makes it hard to spot. While the tech industry needs to do more to combat it, guides like this one from Harvard Library can be useful tools for all of us looking to protect ourselves: https://lnkd.in/ex9PBKw

Name: Brad Smith
Text: As the pandemic evolves, so does the science. It is crucial that we continue to adapt to this change and have a full understanding of the progress we are making against COVID. We have partnered with Harvard Global Health Institute and now Brown University School of Public Health to provide visualizations of their new mitigation targets and surveillance approach of high risk populations as well as a calculator to allow US states to adapt their local strategies in the future. https://lnkd.in/g5P9X5u#AIforHealth

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Through shared values and supportive partnerships, Tyler Ellison decided to make TitletownTech the new home for ChemDirect, Inc. It was so fun to work with the Microsoft team to capture this amazing story!

Name: Brad Smith
Text: This report from The World Bank shows how deeply COVID has impacted education and economies around the world – but it also tells us why we need to invest in human capital now more than ever. Making sure people have the skills they need to succeed in a post-pandemic world is critical.

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Microsoft Digital Defense Report 2020: #Cyber Threat Sophistication on the RiseToday, Microsoft is releasing a new annual report, called the Digital #Defense Report, covering #cybersecurity trends from the past year. This report makes it clear that threat actors have rapidly increased in sophistication over the past year, using techniques that make them harder to spot and that threaten even the savviest targets. For example, nation-state actors are engaging in new reconnaissance techniques that increase their chances of compromising high-value targets, criminal groups targeting businesses have moved their infrastructure to the cloud to hide among legitimate services, and attackers have developed new ways to scour the internet for systems vulnerable to ransomware.https://lnkd.in/gvvqiCY#electionsecurity #elections #cyberattack #nationstateattack

Name: Brad Smith
Text: The final #SummerOfOpenData panel contained some eye-opening lessons on how to effectively remove barriers to efficient data sharing. Really enjoyed following this series from The Governance Lab, and excited to apply these learnings to our #OpenData work. #collaboration #innovation

Name: Brad Smith
Text: We have long believed that diversity is not a “nice to have” that can be deprioritized or abandoned in challenging economic times. There is no doubt that 2020 has been a challenging year—with COVID, the ensuing impact on the economy, and the important and renewed focus on social and racial justice. Today, we are honored to announce the 2020 top performers in Microsoft’s Law Firm Diversity Program and share advancements to the program for the year ahead that focus on accelerating diversity among acutely underrepresented groups in the legal industry. Clearly, there is much more work to do, but we are proud of the progress so far and will continue to evolve the program and invest in other diversity and inclusion initiatives. Congratulations to our top performers, Perkins Coie LLP and Latham & Watkins. #LawFirmDiversityProgram

Name: Brad Smith
Text: In June, we launched our skilling initiative to help reskill 25 million people with the digital skills needed to succeed in the new economy. As of today, we have reached 10 million learners. Ryan Roslansky has more on our progress:

Name: Brad Smith
Text: I'm proud to share an update on our efforts to help those impacted by COVID get the skills they need to land their next job.

Name: Brad Smith
Text: I had this amazing experience today. Mike Jackson led his first D&I team meeting today and he used the first part of this meeting to say very generous things and then others said super nice things about my time leading D&I. And then these flowers arrived. Wow. Thank you. Mike is amazing and going to do such great things! And thanks to Kymerie Schmidt, Yemi Fleming Jackson, Merisa Heu-Weller, Pablo Castro, Makalika Naholowa'a, Elizabeth Wan, Amy Colando, Mark Swatzell, Katie Bates and so many others. You made my day and I cried. #microsoft #diversityandinclusion #inspiration

Name: Brad Smith
Text: I had this amazing experience today. Mike Jackson led his first D&I team meeting today and he used the first part of this meeting to say very generous things and then others said super nice things about my time leading D&I. And then these flowers arrived. Wow. Thank you. Mike is amazing and going to do such great things! And thanks to Kymerie Schmidt, Yemi Fleming Jackson, Merisa Heu-Weller, Pablo Castro, Makalika Naholowa'a, Elizabeth Wan, Amy Colando, Mark Swatzell, Katie Bates and so many others. You made my day and I cried. #microsoft #diversityandinclusion #inspiration

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Cybercriminals and nation-state actors are only getting more sophisticated and their activity is increasing. That’s why we are sharing what we are seeing in hopes that the world can collectively take steps to address these threats. More from Tom Burt on our first Digital Defense Report:https://lnkd.in/dy7YKzV#cybersecurity

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Jonathan Kanter is one of the most talented, creative and insightful competition law attorneys out there. At #Microsoft, we have had the benefit and pleasure of work with him for years. Congrats, Jonathan, on opening your own law firm.  I can't wait to see what you build.

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Every part of our business must set bold goals to address climate change. Our Devices Sustainability Report dives into how we're reducing the impact our products have on the world around us. Thanks for sharing this information, Panos Panay. #sustainability #climatechange

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Earlier this year, we launched our #OpenData campaign to help organizations better access data to innovate with #AI. We committed to developing 20 data collaborations by 2022. Here’s a quick progress report on where things stand. I’m excited to see we’re partnering with others to tackle COVID, climate change, and digital access/skills training. Here's an update from Jennifer Yokoyama: https://lnkd.in/eZg9eBQ

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Two years ago at #UNGA, Microsoft launched #AI for Humanitarian Action. With the urgency of the moment, we’re expanding access and eligibility to the program to help improve humanitarian efforts around the world. #AI4Good

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Technology can help unlock solutions for some of the world’s biggest challenges, including food insecurity and climate change. Great conversation today on how AI can help support and accelerate the FAO’s important work. Thursday's virtual discussion took place seven months after representatives from Microsoft, IBM and Pontifical Academy for Life gathered in Italy to sign the Rome Call for AI Ethics. More on today's event here: https://lnkd.in/edYbEpCWatch the webcast: https://lnkd.in/eGdhTqh#foodinsecurity #UN75 #UNGA #AI

Name: Brad Smith
Text: During today's United Nations Roundtable on Climate Action, we discussed the real and devastating effects of climate change. Governments and companies have a shared responsibility to tackle the greatest crisis facing our generation. Watch here: https://lnkd.in/e9PC_WhLearn more about Microsoft's sustainability commitments here: https://lnkd.in/es3BXGs#sustainability #climatechange #UN75 #UNGA

Name: Brad Smith
Text: “The smallest things can make the biggest difference.” In celebration of the United Nations' 75th anniversary, I spoke with Trevor Noah about what inspires him, what 2020 has taught him, and what he sees as our biggest challenges in the coming years. Watch the full video here: https://lnkd.in/ejBmVhn#UNGA #UN75

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Our products are a reflection of the people who make them and use them. We continue to push ourselves to set higher standards and goals to ensure we build products of the highest quality and with integrity. Building on the company’s sustainability commitments, today the team is sharing our progress with the release of our Devices Sustainability Report.

Name: Brad Smith
Text: We've learned a lot from the COVID crisis – and it's an opportunity to pivot towards a more sustainable and inclusive future for all of us. In about 15 minutes, join Ian Bremmer and me virtually as we chat about the approaches businesses and governments can take. The livestream starts at 11am ET/8am PT: https://lnkd.in/eqh4DKh#COVID #economicrecovery #UN75

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Live now:

Name: Brad Smith
Text: We've learned a lot from the COVID crisis – and it's an opportunity to pivot towards a more sustainable and inclusive future for all of us. In about 15 minutes, join Ian Bremmer and me virtually as we chat about the approaches businesses and governments can take. The livestream starts at 11am ET/8am PT: https://lnkd.in/eqh4DKh#COVID #economicrecovery #UN75

Name: Brad Smith
Text: COVID has shown just how valuable a role tech can play in a global crisis – and how it can also be exploited as a weapon. John Frank shares more in this GZERO Media/Eurasia Group video looking at one of the core themes of our partner coverage from the UN General Assembly: What life could look like after the pandemic. #UN75 #recovery

Name: Brad Smith
Text: The case for tech intensity has never been more urgent, and we’re adding new capabilities across our tech stack to help every organization be resilient and transform in a world of unprecedented constraints. #MSIgnite

Name: Brad Smith
Text: When Ian Bremmer mentioned we'd be discussing the topic of crisis response and recovery #In60Seconds, I was skeptical. In the end, we made it work. Thanks for having me - and for the bit of extra time to cover some very complex issues! #UN75

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Viruses don't respect borders. People, governments, companies, and civil society have to work across borders as well. Microsoft president Brad Smith in a #UN75 edition of GZERO Media World #In60Seconds.#gzeroWithMicrosofthttps://lnkd.in/dYVEKb8

Name: Brad Smith
Text: The scientific consensus is clear – #ClimateChange is the biggest threat of our generation. Those of us who can move faster and go further to reach net zero must do so – and taking a multilateral approach is the best way to make true progress. During the opening day of #ClimateWeekNYC, I joined many others leaders to discuss how the shift to a zero-carbon economy is accelerating through #RaceToZero. Learn more about the campaign here: https://lnkd.in/e-3fUhQ

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Every year, September 21st is observed as a day of global peace – and this year, it's more important than ever. As COVID has moved the world more online, today should serve as a call to action for both the tech sector and governments to do more to create peace online. We're proud to support Peace One Day's global digital experience, which included a full-day lineup of incredible speakers and performers. See the replay below.  #PeaceDay #UN75

Name: Brad Smith
Text: History has taught us the importance of coming together in times of crisis. The spirit of multilateralism that gave rise to the United Nations is needed now, more than ever. That’s why we participate with 1000+ other companies in the UN Global Compact to unite in the business of a better world. #UN75 #UnitingBusiness https://lnkd.in/eq5GZQf

Name: Brad Smith
Text: We must protect our most finite resource – the planet – by work towards a more sustainable future, which is why we’re announcing our commitment to be water positive by 2030.

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Will the #COVID crisis lay bare the G-Zero nature of the global system?I'll discuss the road to recovery with Brad Smith, Frances Townsend, John Frank, and Susan Glasser. Special guests: António Guterres & Christine Lagarde#gzeroWithMicrosoft 🗓Sept 23 ⏰11 AM ET 🔗https://lnkd.in/exM5t-B

Name: Brad Smith
Text: The basic need for water has determined much of how societies have been built and operated. Yet as human civilization has expanded, we've depleted and degraded our freshwater supplies, and climate change is only making the situation worse. Getting ahead of the world's water crisis is critical – which is why we're doing our part and committing to becoming water positive by 2030. Watch this quick explainer:#sustainability #water

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Protecting our planet requires us to set bold goals. In 2020, we’ve committed to becoming carbon negative, zero waste, and preserving biodiversity. Today, we’re announcing that we’ll also be water positive by the end of the decade. https://lnkd.in/gt_Hihj #sustainability

Name: Brad Smith
Text: If you want to learn more about the mission we are going after this is your chance to hear from the source.

Name: Brad Smith
Text: My heart goes out to Ruth Bader Ginsburg’s family and loved ones. She was a trailblazing jurist, and champion of gender equality and justice for everyone. Her legacy will live on through future generations.

Name: Brad Smith
Text: It was always special listening to Ruth Bader Ginsburg at the Supreme Court or when she visited a law school. She combined a penetrating intellect with a sense of decency that changed the course of history - and touched people around her. Her legacy offers inspiration for us all. #RBG

Name: Brad Smith
Text: The challenges the world faces today can't be addressed by one country or organization alone, they must be tackled jointly. More from John Frank, who is leading Microsoft’s UN Affairs office:

Name: Brad Smith
Text: From COVID to climate change, the challenges we face as a society are too great for any one company or country to tackle alone. Microsoft has been a longtime partner of the United Nations, believing that in today’s fractured world, collective action is still our best hope for building a future that empowers every person and organization on the planet. Today, we’re doubling down on that commitment. I couldn’t be more excited or humbled to be leading our new team based in New York City and begin this next chapter of Microsoft’s engagement with the global community.

Name: Brad Smith
Text: This year’s #UN75 will be quite different because of COVID, but it won’t be any less important. We’re partnering with Eurasia Group and GZERO Media to tell you what’s the same, what’s different, and how to get the most out of this year’s virtual event.

Name: Brad Smith
Text: As Foreign Policy lays out here, a real recovery from COVID needs to be more sustainable and inclusive than past recoveries. Ensuring access to #DigitalSkills training, and doing our part to combat #ClimateChange, is a solid path forward. https://lnkd.in/g3a6api

Name: Brad Smith
Text: We support Business Roundtable's call for a comprehensive U.S. strategy to reduce greenhouse gas emissions because we must move fast to prevent the worst effects of climate change. No one can do this work alone. The private and public sectors must come together.  https://lnkd.in/gG5qCTe#climatechange #sustainability

Name: Brad Smith
Text: This is a great read on how Microsoft and Google worked together to bring the dual screen #SurfaceDuo to market.   It’s wonderful to see Panos Panay and Hiroshi Lockheimer led these great companies to innovate together on a new mobile form factor.  I’ve stated a number of time how much I love the #SurfaceDuo.  It is a game changer.   I’ll never forget the day Panos called me and said “hey I have an idea I want you to work on with me.”  Reflecting back on that day and the journey to get to today it is so rewarding. I can tell you much of the Microsoft 365 team contributed to Duo.   It has been a broad effort to innovate on the hardware and apps to deliver a beautiful experience.

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Join me at Microsoft HR Summit 2020 on 22nd September as I dive into the business case for diversity and inclusion at the workplace and talk about Microsoft's commitment and accountability to diverse and inclusive practices in all that we do. Register at: https://lnkd.in/g3jvxfp

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Join me at Microsoft HR Summit 2020 on 22nd September as I dive into the business case for diversity and inclusion at the workplace and talk about Microsoft's commitment and accountability to diverse and inclusive practices in all that we do. Register at: https://lnkd.in/g3jvxfp

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Ian Bremmer and I are excited to preview GZERO Media's coverage of #UN75, in partnership with Eurasia Group and Microsoft. Learn more and see the schedule of upcoming virtual events here: https://lnkd.in/g5evq3WFYI: Our first livestream on climate change is happening right now! Check it out here: https://lnkd.in/grB5u66#gzeroWithMicrosoft #UNGA75

Name: Brad Smith
Text: Net Zero: Climate Ambition and Action   GZERO Media — in partnership with Microsoft and Eurasia Group — kicks off a series of livestream discussions about the most important issues facing the 75th UN General Assembly. The first event, Net Zero: Climate Ambition and Action, will consider how we get to net zero emissions.Our panel will be moderated by Julia Pyper, host and producer of the Political Climate podcast, and will include Gerald Butts, Vice Chairman & Senior Advisor, Eurasia Group; Lucas Joppa, Chief Environmental Officer, Microsoft; Rachel Kyte, Dean of The Fletcher School, Tufts University; and Mark Carney, Finance Adviser to the UK Prime Minister for COP 26 and UN Special Envoy for Climate Action and Finance.https://lnkd.in/d_TrYi6#gzeroWithMicrosoft

Name: Brad Smith
Text: LIVE on LinkedIn in 15 minutes: Climate change isn't a problem for future generations – it's a problem right now, and we're witnessing its impacts all over the world. As a global company, we have a responsibility to make it our biggest priority – thanks to our own Lucas Joppa for always leading the way.

Name: Brad Smith
Text: LIVE on LinkedIn in less than an hour: GZERO Media's panel discussion with Gerald Butts, Lucas Joppa, Rachel Kyte, and Mark Carney—moderated by Julia Pyper—on how we can become carbon neutral.GZERO Media will be streaming live on LinkedIn and on its website:https://lnkd.in/d6d-4v7https://lnkd.in/ePY22mHDon't miss! #gzeroWithMicrosoft https://lnkd.in/dkraFS5

Name: Brad Smith
Text: From work to socializing, our lives are operating at a distance from one another. So what does that mean for our work relationships and culture? I asked Frances Frei about this dynamic, and in this #PeopleTalk, she explains how we can both sustain and reimagine our organizational cultures to be more flexible and inclusive - and have our differences cherished. #growthmindset #culture

Name: Brad Smith
Text: For those who chose the U.S as their home, for those who came here as children, for those born into their American life  – we proudly stand beside our Hispanic and Latinx colleagues and celebrate the strength, tenacity, and resilience of the community. Our country, our economy, our company; all of us are better for the culture, talent, skills, and perspective that this vibrant and robust community brings. #HispanicHeritageMonth

Name: Emily Chang
Text: The world according to Benchmark Capital's Bill Gurley right now -- our extended conversation about IPOs vs DLs and SPACs, the future of Silicon Valley post-pandemic, and a possible argument FOR the breakup of big tech.

Name: Emily Chang
Text: The pandemic has created a catastrophe in education. What will the long-term impacts on our children be and how do we fix it? Watch our special, The Virtual Classroom, with Sal Khan of the Khan Academy, former US Secretary of Education Arne Duncan, ed-tech investors, Masterclass, the superintendents of major school districts and more. Watch here:https://bit.ly/2G53eS9

Name: Emily Chang
Text: As fires continue to wreak havoc on our country and pollute our air -- I wanted to share my full interview with Bill Gates, who says climate change could be a worse disaster than COVID. His outlook on vaccines, the pandemic, and the great Mother Nature here:

Name: Emily Chang
Text: "An asteroid has hit the economy but..." My chat with Linkedin Co-founder and Greylock partner Reid Hoffman about his outlook on the economy and how the pandemic will play out for tech. This as Greylock announces a new $1 billon fund to invest in the next generation of startups. Greylock is also an investor in TikTok and Hoffman is on the board of Microsoft. He says the TikTok saga is the "ringing of the bell" that Chinese technology is a global competitive threat and America's "free run" is over.

Name: Emily Chang
Text: "Coming to you live in sweatpants and slippers!" I wrote a thing about what it's like to shoot a live daily show in a pandemic, with four kids, and remote school...

Name: Emily Chang
Text: The Bill Gates podcast is out! He predicted a pandemic years before it happened. His foundation has now pushed $350 million into fighting the virus and vaccine development. How soon will a vaccine be ready? When does this end? Will we be ok? Plus his thoughts on the conspiracy theorists who think he seeded the disease for his own nefarious gains, Microsoft buying TikTok and the disaster he thinks will be worse than COVID.Listen here: https://lnkd.in/gviJBAK

Name: Emily Chang
Text: This is one of the most powerful interviews I've ever had the honor to conduct. A conversation with four Black founder/CEOs you need to know, about racism in life and business. Tristan Walker of Walker and Co, Iman Abuzeid of Incredible Health, Stephanie Lampkin of Blendoor and Chris Bennett of Wonderschool. Black Leadership Matters! A must-watch, especially if you want to learn more about how to build diverse and inclusive teams.Check out the show here:https://lnkd.in/gfjmArjOr listen to the podcast here: https://lnkd.in/gkdciAa

Name: Emily Chang
Text: Today, I spoke with former Pinterest COO Francoise Brougher, who sued the company last week for gender discrimination -- it was her first television interview. She opened up about how she felt powerless in her role, and how work with Jack Dorsey in her former job at Square was a completely different story. This is a MUST WATCH for anyone who cares about creating more inclusive cultures, and a rare view into a woman's life in the C-Suite.

Name: Emily Chang
Text: “Take a step back.And realize.That we’re doing something wrong.”My chat with 23andMe CEO Anne Wojcicki about the protests, racism and how she’s leading through this urgent social crisis. She shares a step by step plan on how she and her company plan to do better.

Name: Emily Chang
Text: Media coverage is more robust when perspectives of women experts are included. That's why Bloomberg launched the New Voices program -- and I'm so proud of it -- which is work to broaden the pool of women commentators in media across all topics. Please consider applying or nominating someone you know!

Name: Emily Chang
Text: Hi, Linkedin network! As the calendar turns to December I figure it is a good time to start reflecting on one of my goals for 2019 of reading more books (well, listening to more books. Thanks Audible, Inc.).Below are the books I completed this year. What are your recommendations for books to dive into in 2020?- The Coddling of the American Mind by Jonathan Haidt- The Happiness Hypothesis by Jonathan Haidt- Born Standing Up by Steve Martin- Dad is Fat by Jim Gaffigan- Shoe Dog by Phil Knight- Brotopia by Emily Chang- Comedy Sex God by Pete Holmes- Trillion Dollar Coach by Eric Schmidt, Jonathan Rosenberg, and Alan Eagle- Grit by Angela Duckworth- Setting the Table by Danny Meyer- The Culture Code by Daniel Coyle

Name: Emily Chang
Text: With Uber’s stock near an all-time low, what’s on the mind of the CEO?My exclusive interview with Dara Khosrowshahi two years into the job.

Name: Emily Chang
Text: I wrote this op-ed for the New York Times about women and privacy. We don't think about digital privacy as a women's issue, but we should.

Name: Emily Chang
Text: Brotopia was chosen as the book of the month for the PBS/New York Times book club!!! So honored. Check out the other picks here if you want to read along.

Name: Emily Chang
Text: I wrote this with the founder of BUILD, Suzanne Klahr -- a college advancement program for low-income students -- where I'm also proud to serve on the board. Time to face up to the fact that our nation is not a meritocracy and this college admissions scam is just another example of it. Meet Ana, an amazing young woman who most certainly "merited" a different ending. We are really fired up about this!!!

Name: Emily Chang
Text: Had so much fun speaking about the new edition of #Brotopia on CBS This Morning -- and yes, Gayle King really is that cool! The book is out now in paperback with a new Afterword.

Name: Emily Chang
Text: #Brotopia is coming out in paperback with a new Afterword on 3/5! There's so much to discuss one year later. I've spent the last few months reporting on the progress we've made and the lack thereof...Change is happening slowly, but it is most definitely happening!You can pre-order your copy now:https://amzn.to/2Vl6D12

Name: Emily Chang
Text: I sat down with Facebook COO Sheryl Sandberg today. So many big questions it was hard to decide where to start. She commented on the Research App controversy, getting punished by Apple and why anyone should trust Facebook. But if the deluge of data scandals and bad press are hurting anything, it's not Facebook. The company reported record earnings.

Name: Emily Chang
Text: Congrats to Jonathan Stull, Garrett Lord and the entire Handshake team! Democratizing opportunity one job and school at a time.

Name: Emily Chang
Text: We are looking for a new production assistant for Bloomberg Technology! An amazing opportunity to work on one of the coolest shows on TV (in my totally unbiased opinion 😉). Apply now!

Name: Emily Chang
Text: Amazon has an opportunity to radically diversify its workforce in a record amount of time -- by shooting for 50/50 at HQ2. Here's a "moonshot proposal" for Jeff Bezos by myself and my colleagues in this week's edition of Bloomberg. Businessweek.

Name: Emily Chang
Text: Thanks to the New York Times Book Review for this timely review of Brotopia! How do we build a better and more equal world? That's the “question with the billion-dollar valuation” that the book digs into and this review explores.

Name: Emily Chang
Text: Thank you, Ian for this very thoughtful review. This, is why I wrote the book.

Name: Emily Chang
Text: “Trolling used to be seen as a fringe activity,” Twitter's co-founder told Emily Chang. “We weren’t thinking about it enough…had we had more women on the team, maybe we would have known better.” #WeekendEssay

Name: Emily Chang
Text: My new book, Brotopia: Breaking Up the Boys' Club of Silicon Valley is in stores now! Kicking off the book tour this week with some incredible conversations about how we can include women in the greatest wealth creation in the history of the world. Please pick up a copy and help me get this movement going!http://amzn.to/2Esghdv

Name: Emily Chang
Text: So excited to share a new excerpt from my book in Bloomberg Businessweek: Women once ruled computers, when did it become Brotopia? Silicon Valley often blames the "pipeline" for its gender problem. One of the most surprising things I discovered in my research is that the tech industry created the pipeline problem.https://lnkd.in/gANTEEx

Name: Emily Chang
Text: One week to go before you can open the doors to BROTOPIA: Breaking Up the Boys' Club of Silicon Valley! Pre-order now to get it on publication day 2/6. http://amzn.to/2DiYG7T(After two years of research, writing, impassioned debate, thanks to many people especially a very patient husband, can't believe this is finally happening!)

Name: Emily Chang
Text: Reading an advance copy of Emily Chang's new book Brotopia https://lnkd.in/g48b6T3. Important that we continue to push for greater diversity and inclusion in tech.

Name: Emily Chang
Text: An excerpt from my forthcoming book "Brotopia" in Vanity Fair. Drug-heavy, sex-laced parties among the Silicon Valley Technorati -- and the inevitable mixing of business and pleasure -- are putting women in an uncomfortable position.

Name: Emily Chang
Text: I've been work on a book about women in tech for the last two years. I had no idea we would find ourselves in such a critical and relevant historical moment as I was about to publish, but here we are. Lookout for "Brotopia: Breaking Up the Boys' Club of Silicon Valley" on February 6, 2018!

Name: Emily Chang
Text: Former Binary employee Ann Lai is now suing the firm for post-resignation harassment.

Name: Emily Chang
Text: Binary is shutting down its $175 million fund (Fund II) after its co-founder resigned amidst allegations of sexual misconduct. What happens to Fund I is still in question.

Name: Emily Chang
Text: We are looking for a new producer for "Bloomberg Technology" -- passion for the tech beat and TV experience is a must. Apply here!

Name: Emily Chang
Text: We are looking for a new producer for "Bloomberg Technology" -- passion for the tech beat and TV experience is a must. Apply here!

Name: Emily Chang
Text: We are looking for a new producer for "Bloomberg Technology" -- passion for the tech beat and TV experience is a must. Apply here!

Name: Emily Chang
Text: A little something I wrote about asking the "mom question" after sitting down with YouTube CEO Susan Wojcicki -- power mother of FIVE -- and one of the highest ranking women in Silicon Valley

Name: Emily Chang
Text: Just back from New Zealand where I spoke with Kim Dotcom at his mansion. Don't miss it this season on Studio 1.0

Name: Emily Chang
Text: What does the future of workplace wellbeing look like at The Huffington Post, Yahoo, Facebook, Zappos Family of Companiess, Gallup and VirginFind out: https://lnkd.in/dnpy-up ‪#‎VirginDisruptors‬

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Today we launched Quibi!  Jeffrey Katzenberg and I began work on Quibi over two years ago based on the idea that new technology has always enabled the creative community to tell stories in new ways. Quibi was created to entertain, inform, and inspire by reimagining the way mobile users consume premium video content on their phones.We launched today with nearly 50 shows. Enjoy a movie in chapters, be delighted by one of our documentaries or unscripted series, and be informed and inspired by our Daily Essentials -- our news and entertainment programs.  The world is a very different place today than it was even two weeks ago. It is our hope that Quibi will provide a small moment of laughter, inspiration, or information during this unprecedented moment in our lives. For this reason, we have made Quibi free for 90 days if you download & sign up any time this month: https://lnkd.in/eDmYetyI am so proud of the hard work of the entire Quibi team who have poured their hearts into building this new technology platform from the ground up. And, thank you to everyone who has made this possible, from our incredible content creators to our outstanding brand partners.#entertain #inspire #inform #quibi #entertainment #technology #mobile

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Addressing the critical challenges we face in educating the next generation is one of the most important issues that we face as a society.Last month, I had the opportunity to join the LeBron James Family Foundation’s (LJFF) as they hosted the first ever State of the Family address at the I PROMISE School (IPS) in Akron, Ohio. The evening brought together all of the school’s teachers and staff as well as IPS families to hear about the magic that is happening at IPS and what is still to come. And, as the Chairman of Teach For America (TFA), I was honored to join such an inspirational group of teachers who are part of a joint effort to address educational inequality in disenfranchised communities across the country.IPS is LeBron’s incredible mission to make meaningful change to his hometown. It’s truly inspiring.Today, we announced “I PROMISE,” a Quibi original documentary series featuring an in-depth look at the first academic year inside IPS. "I PROMISE" tells the story of LeBron James’ efforts to close the achievement gap in his hometown through the eyes of the inspiring students who are resetting expectations for their futures.We can’t wait to share this important story.#teachforamerica #lebronjames #IPROMISEschool #Quibi #documentary #TFA #education

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Today we are living through another revolution in entertainment, this time on our mobile phones.

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: I am voting for Marshall Tuck for California State Superintendent because California's public schools rank 44th in the nation and we can do better. I know Marshall can improve things. Hear directly from students he has impacted. #TeamTuck

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Having experienced work for companies at every level, from start-ups to Fortune 50, I wholeheartedly recommend Maynard Webb's new book Dear Founder. A must read for leaders everywhere.

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: After more than six years leading Hewlett Packard Enterprise, it’s time for someone new—someone who has an unmatched passion for the company, a contagious love for our technology and deep relationships with our customers —to take the wheel. I’m absolutely confident that Antonio Neri will go the distance and bring HPE to the next level. Here’s to many, many successes ahead, my friend!

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Kudos to our HPE team as they pulled out all the stops in organizing Meg Whitman’s first Buffalo visit. I got to see firsthand how charismatic and personable she is. Considering what she has done in her relatively short tenure as CEO of Hewlett-Packard, One could only imagine what she could do down the road with a little encouragement. #Meg2020!

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Kudos to our HPE team as they pulled out all the stops in organizing Meg Whitman’s first Buffalo visit. I got to see firsthand how charismatic and personable she is. Considering what she has done in her relatively short tenure as CEO of Hewlett-Packard, One could only imagine what she could do down the road with a little encouragement. #Meg2020!

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Seven months after acquiring Nimble Storage, we're excited to announce the industry's first AI recommendation engine, which is now bringing us one step closer to the autonomous data center.

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: As our customers face an increasingly Hybrid IT reality, they require a new approach to managing their multi-cloud environments. With HPE OneSphere, we've simplified the management experience so our customers can focus on what's really important — driving their business outcomes.

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Data could hold the key to understanding the origins of space and time. The problem? There's 14 billion years of information to analyze. In order to discover the clues hiding in these large data sets, Stephen Hawking’s COSMOS Research Group is relying on HPE Superdome Flex's ability to transform the flood of data into insights.

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: It's time for another HPE Discover, and the last time I will address the Discover crowds as CEO. Be sure to tune into the General Session tomorrow at 2pm CET to hear about our latest services and partnerships, as well as the future of Hewlett Packard Enterprise.

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: We are in the midst of the next great technology revolution — one which is fueled by data. To help organizations more effectively capture, analyze and turn data into value-driving innovations, Hewlett Packard Enterprise is unveiling new solutions and partnerships designed to help customers compete in the digital world and achieve their business goals faster. Get a first look at what we're announcing this week at Discover 2017 Madrid:

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Earlier this week, I️ had the privilege of spending some time with Meg Whitman in our Plano office. We spoke about life, technology, and our career paths - she even jumped on a customer call with me. Meg was extremely down to earth and transparent, which really says something about her character as a leader and business icon. It's extremely refreshing and uplifting to have a CEO who makes it a priority to spend time with her employees, and I️ look forward to another exciting year at Hewlett Packard Enterprise!

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Earlier this week, I️ had the privilege of spending some time with Meg Whitman in our Plano office. We spoke about life, technology, and our career paths - she even jumped on a customer call with me. Meg was extremely down to earth and transparent, which really says something about her character as a leader and business icon. It's extremely refreshing and uplifting to have a CEO who makes it a priority to spend time with her employees, and I️ look forward to another exciting year at Hewlett Packard Enterprise!

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Earlier this week, I️ had the privilege of spending some time with Meg Whitman in our Plano office. We spoke about life, technology, and our career paths - she even jumped on a customer call with me. Meg was extremely down to earth and transparent, which really says something about her character as a leader and business icon. It's extremely refreshing and uplifting to have a CEO who makes it a priority to spend time with her employees, and I️ look forward to another exciting year at Hewlett Packard Enterprise!

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Yesterday my colleagues and I had the chance to meet the president of HPE, Antonio Neri. It was a pleasure to see Antonio, Meg Whitman, and the rest of the C-Level team visit the call center in Plano. Thank you for coming out!  Griffen Jones, Tyler C. Allen, Craig Allen

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: The Mesosphere, Inc. evolution perfectly captured by Business Insider! We’re helping 25 percent of the Fortune 50 companies to bridge the gap between their own data centers and the cloud. Our team has grown to almost 300 employees and we’ve been tripling our revenue each year. It’s been an amazing journey thus far and I am beyond excited about what’s ahead. Needless to say, I am grateful to clients like Royal Caribbean Cruises Ltd. and more for their trust - we won’t let you down.

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Innovating for the future of space travel could have positive benefits for life here on Earth, but success hinges on our ability to increase spaceborne technology’s ability to compute. Tom Bradicich, PhD and fellow forward-thinkers tackled the challenges of space travel during today’s A New Space Age event and talked about how we’re taking technology to the ‘Extreme Edge’. Learn more and watch the livestream of our breakfast panel below.

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Congratulations to our storage team, who continue to raise the bar in the market! Gartner has named Hewlett Packard Enterprise a leader for general purpose disk arrays. Learn more about the ranking in this perspective from Alain Andreoli:

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Innovation and disruption have become common words in our business lexicon, but how many companies actually put these words into action or know even how to start? At today’s AT&T Enterprise Business Summit, I was fortunate enough to chat with other leaders and experts like @Thaddeus Arroyo and Doug Parker (CEO, American Airlines) about how to best apply these ideas in real and positive ways. One of the key ways I’ve found to get started is by ensuring that you fill your teams with people who can embrace change and by enabling a communication style where people’s stories can be used to inspire. What are some of your suggestions?

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Welcome to the team Archie Deskus! We’re excited to have you as our new Global CIO. I can’t wait to see the future you’ll help us build at Hewlett Packard Enterprise!

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: If we’re going to get to Mars, increase cancer survival or more accurately predict catastrophic weather events, machines will need to be 10x faster than today’s fastest supercomputers. Take a look at our short film made withThe Atlantic, discussing how exascale supercomputing is ushering in a new era of possibilities.

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: For one month, we waited with bated breath as the Hewlett Packard Enterprise Spaceborne Computer travelled to the International Space Station. Now, I can finally announce that the system is successfully installed, powered up and running one teraFLOP in space. Congratulations to our engineering team for turning this dream into a reality. Learn more about the launch from our co-principle investigator, Mark R. Fernandez, Ph.D.

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Excited to join the Board of @Dropbox. Looking forward to work with Drew Houston and the team!

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Even though we were planning to launch this next week, we are equally as excited to announce today that Mesosphere is now supporting Kubernetes (K8S) on top of DC/OS. We’re doing this because we strongly believe in giving customers the freedom to choose their Docker container orchestration solution alongside of their preferred data services, such as Cassandra, Kafka, ArangoDB, Machine Learning libraries like TensorFlow and many other systems. When we founded Mesosphere we had a simple mission: to take the amazing tools used by the brightest and most innovative technology brands to build and scale world-changing technology, and make them easy to adopt and use by mainstream enterprise IT teams and startups alike. With DC/OS we are providing the building blocks that make development of modern applications a breeze. And, again, we are doing this because our only focus is to provide our customers with the agility and flexibility to build their own AWS-like cloud services in their own data center or on the Infrastructure-as-a-Service layer of a public cloud provider while maintaining control over applications, data and cost. More about our Kubernetes announcement below:

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Congratulations to Chris Hsu and the new Micro Focus team whom today begins operating as the largest pure play software company in the U.K., and the seventh largest in the world.

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: I support Ken Frazier's decision. I’m thankful we have business leaders such as Ken to remind America of its better angels. Americans expect their political leaders to denounce white supremacists by name. Hate must not be given refuge in America.

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Normally I do not comment on rumors, but the speculation about my future and Uber has become a distraction. So let me make this as clear as I can. I am fully committed to HPE and plan to remain the company's CEO. We have a lot of work still to do at HPE and I am not going anywhere. Uber's CEO will not be Meg Whitman.

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: It’s only Wednesday, but it’s already been a big week at Hewlett Packard Enterprise! On Monday, HPE won the Global Grand Prize for Innovation at the ISPIM Innovation Conference for our Living Progress Challenge. And today, we were named one of the 50 most community-minded companies in the U.S. by Civic 50. I’m very proud of our company’s continued focus on corporate citizenship. Congratulations to everyone involved with these important initiatives.

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Congratulations to the team at  Mesosphere, Inc. (an HPE Pathfinder-backed company) on being named a World Economic Forum Tech Pioneer today. This is a huge honor for this young company and their CEO Florian Leibert, who now share this title with past honorees including Dropbox, Palantir, Blockchain, and Slack.

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Today, I’m thrilled to tell you that Hewlett Packard Enterprise has created a computer with the largest single-memory system the world has ever seen. Read my take below & tune in to my FB page at 11:20a PT / 2:20p ET to watch a live broadcast on what it means for the mission to Mars.

Name: Meg Whitman

Join me tomorrow at 11:20a PT / 2:20p ET for a Live broadcast from Washington DC: Making The Mission to Mars Compute. Details here: http://hpe.to/600889D20. Watch this video for a sneak peek!  https://lnkd.in/eF4b-Cc

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Tune in next Tuesday at 11:20a PT / 2:20p ET to watch my colleague, Kirk Bresniker, deliver a live broadcast from #AtlanticSpace on Memory-Driven Computing and its potential to support the mission to Mars. Details here: http://hpe.to/600089DC8

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: This week, I attended the opening ceremony for Hewlett Packard Enterprise's new Asia Pacific and Japan Headquarters building in Singapore, where we have been based for 46 years. It was great to celebrate this milestone with our Singapore-based employees, Hewlett-Packard Alumni, and the Chairman of the Singapore Economic Development Board, Dr. Beh Swan Gin, who helped us officially open the building.

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: When legacy technology says No, Hybrid IT says Yes. Meet Brian and learn how Hewlett Packard Enterprise allows IT professionals around the world to push past limits and act as catalysts for growth. Proud of the very talented team behind our new campaign.

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: When legacy technology says No, Hybrid IT says Yes. Meet Brian and learn how Hewlett Packard Enterprise allows IT professionals around the world to push past limits and act as catalysts for growth. Proud of the very talented team behind our new campaign.

That focus has brought incredible new solutions for our clients, including HPE Synergy, the world’s first platform architected for Composable Infrastructure, designed with customization and adaptability for the future top-of-mind. Text: Today I’m proud to share that Hewlett Packard Enterprise has successfully built the first proof-of-concept prototype that illustrates our Memory-Driven Computing architecture, a significant milestone in The Machine research program. Read more in my latest post.

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: See how your business can benefit from the same IT solutions that powered Levi’s Stadium during Super Bowl 50 and prepared Rio’s airport for the Summer Games.

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: The Machine: a radical approach to computing that could change everything in the not-so-distant future. http://hpe.to/6045BSCdH

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: About to take the stage at ‪#‎HPEDiscover‬, where I’ll be speaking to 10,000 customers and CIOs from some of the world’s leading companies. For those who can't be with us in Las Vegas, you can watch the live broadcast here - https://lnkd.in/bB7NYYP - starting at 2p PT. Just reviewing my speech one more time before showtime. See you in 10 minutes!

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Climate change is one of the world’s most complex challenges. I’m proud that Hewlett Packard Enterprise is one of the 110 major U.S. companies formally welcoming the signing of the ‪#‎ParisAgreement‬ at the United Nations this week, encouraging sound policy decisions that will drive a low-carbon economy. Uniting to solve the world’s toughest challenges—that’s Living Progress!

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Did you get your taxes filed before the deadline? Did you use TurboTax? HPE’s Vertica technology helps TurboTax analyze data to continually improve the user experience and make the tax-preparation process go a lot faster and smoother. http://hp.nu/4mQa2z

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: On behalf of everyone at Hewlett Packard Enterprise, we are saddened to learn of the passing of Andy Grove. Andy was a friend and partner to HPE and a leading voice in Silicon Valley for more than 40 years. He taught a generation of business leaders how to stay sharp and led a technology revolution that has inspired mankind. Andy will be missed, but his contributions and incredible spirit will never be forgotten.

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Had a great time addressing all the Airheads at Atmosphere 2016 today with Dominic Orr of Aruba, a Hewlett Packard Enterprise company. ‪#‎ATM16‬ http://hp.nu/ZedCw

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Enjoyed chatting with Stanford University students last night. Hewlett Packard Enterprise will continue to hire college grads this year, and I can already see how different they are from the generations before them. When I came out of grad school, I just wanted a job. This generation wants to know if their role is going to make a difference and if our company is going to make a difference. They refuse to work on things that do not matter. Those are the kind of people you need to succeed.

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Happy Employee Appreciation Day to all of the Hewlett Packard Enterprise Employees around the globe! Thank you for all that you do. I believe the best is yet to come.

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Great visiting with the Hewlett Packard Enterprise Inside Sales team in Barcelona today. So much energy!

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Last year, we divided a 75 year old company, successfully completing the biggest and most complex separation that may have ever been done. And, it was literally flawless. It is a testament to our IT team. So, when you run into an IT person, give 'em a hug! See how we split 2,500 applications, 300,000 employees, 20,000 customers, and 150,000 partners in 170 countries in this short, behind-the-scenes video.

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: It’s that time of year again! This week, thousands of IT experts from around the world are gathering in London for Discover, Hewlett Packard Enterprise's largest customer event. For two-full days, we’ll be meeting with customers and CIOs from some of the world’s leading companies, introducing new HPE products, services and innovations, and talking about the tech trends shaping the future. See you in London!

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Want to learn more about the new Hewlett Packard Enterprise? Watch this short film by award-winning filmmaker Alison Klayman​.

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: Quick stop at LinkedIn HQ in New York to chat with Daniel Roth about the new Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Leadership, and career advice for young professionals. Video interview coming next week. Stay tuned.

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: I’ve been fortunate to be part of some exciting moments during my business career, but I don’t think I’ve ever been more energized than I am today as we launch the new Hewlett Packard Enterprise.  You can read more about it in my latest LinkedIn post here: http://hp.nu/U8q0J

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: I’m starting a new job today! You can read about it in my latest LinkedIn post. Here’s to change. To new beginnings. And to going further, faster.

Name: Meg Whitman
Text: New job doesn’t officially start until tomorrow when we ring the bell at the NYSE, but I’ve already updated my LinkedIn profile. Can you tell I’m excited?
