Name: David McCormick
Text: In honor of #NationalNonprofitDay, I’d like to highlight an organization I’ve had the opportunity to work with for over 20 years, Robin Hood. The work Robin Hood does every day to fight poverty in NYC, from food banks like the one pictured here, to providing emergency cash assistance and health and education services for those in need, has been especially important amid #COVID, and I’m proud to have played a small role in supporting their efforts.⠀⠀As I spend time with my family at the end of summer, we will make time to reflect on the work Robin Hood and other organizations do to help those who are less fortunate. I encourage all of you to share with family and friends a cause you’re passionate about, to celebrate the work that a non-profit does to address that challenge.

Name: David McCormick
Text: The global spread of COVID has accelerated the transition of the world's economies into a new investment paradigm that our research team has been describing for some time: an environment of near-zero interest rates as well as coordinated monetary and fiscal policies against the backdrop of geopolitical tensions — a widening wealth gap and growing competition among world powers. Explore some of Bridgewater’s research on how we got here and how to navigate this new investment environment:

Name: David McCormick
Text: I want to thank Shamil Idriss, CEO of Search for Common Ground – whose work recently earned a nomination for the Nobel Peace Prize, for joining me and the Bridgewater community in a conversation about managing conflict in an ever more interconnected world. While Shamil and Search’s work involves international disputes and heads of state we read about in the news, the lessons he conveys extend to our everyday lives – how we deal with differences of opinion between family, friends, and neighbors, or how we manage disagreements in a work setting. Thank you for joining us, Shamil. Full tape of our discussion available here: https://lnkd.in/dhPT6K7

Name: David McCormick
Text: It was wonderful to host an insightful discussion between two great thinkers, doers, and strong friends of The Alexander Hamilton Society, Christian Brose and David McCormick, on the current and future challenges of our national defense and Chris's great new book.

Name: David McCormick
Text: In an interview with Bloomberg TV, Bridgewater Co-CIO Bob Prince describes the market impacts of zero interest bonds, the challenges of managing a portfolio in this environment, and implications for the dollar as reserve currency. Watch the full interview: https://lnkd.in/gP3MvtP

Name: David McCormick
Text: Investment Associate Devon Long was recently recognized on Business Insider’s “Power Players of Quant” list. Having joined Bridgewater in 2012, Devon now leads our trading analytics team, playing a critical role in our investment process with expertise in market microstructure, transaction costs, and systematic trade execution. https://lnkd.in/geKTGCG

Name: David McCormick
Text: I recently had the privilege of leading a conversation with Secretary of Defense Mark Esper at the 2020 Aspen Security Forum. Secretary Esper spoke on a range of issues, including his efforts to implement the National Defense Strategy, increase the Department of Defense’s focus on China, and protect troops and civilians from COVID. I particularly enjoyed our discussion of Mark's leadership and work to foster a culture of innovation at the Pentagon. His care for the men and women in uniform, as well as their families, shone through. I thank the Aspen Security Group for hosting this excellent forum and Secretary Esper for being so generous with his time and insights. https://lnkd.in/gbTb7MH The Aspen Institute

Name: David McCormick
Text: We can’t help but evolve and come away changed by these times. But rather than let change happen to us, we can be intentional and actively participate in our evolution. In my latest Thrive Global guide, I share techniques to guide your journey of transformation.     🐛🦋🐛🦋https://bit.ly/2EpmPuR#evolution #journey #thrive #reflection #knowledge #adapt #transformation #change

Name: David McCormick
Text: A huge win for wildlife.🔎 Learn more about how we can protect whales: https://bit.ly/3ajfh8P

Name: David McCormick
Text: The Aspen Institute's Zach Neumann "estimates that of the 110 million Americans who live in rental housing, at least 30 million are at risk of #eviction by the end of September." This is a looming crisis that we must address as a country.

Name: David McCormick
Text: I was glad to join The Economic Club of New York for a discussion with Goldman Sachs Chairman and CEO David M. Solomon and former Citi Chairman Michael O’Neill. I especially appreciated David’s insights on the economy, the policy response to date, and the responsibilities of business leaders in this time of crisis. While we each can say we learned a lot from the last recession and how it can and should inform the initial policy responses to the current crisis, we also know how these days require new thinking and new approaches.

Name: David McCormick
Text: The Aspen Security Forum starts TOMORROW with conversations led by the nation’s top journalists:Gillian Tett of Financial TimesPeter Baker of The New York TimesJim Scuitto of CNNCecilia Kang of The New York TimesSusan Glasser of The New YorkerMargaret Brennan of CBS NewsAnd of course, our wonderful NBC News Partners.  First in the line up is Peter Baker interviewing former U.S. Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice. Register here: https://lnkd.in/e78ncuk #AspenSecurity

Name: David McCormick
Text: The U.S. Senate has confirmed Maj. Gen. Jody J. Daniels for promotion to lieutenant general and assignment in the dual role of Chief of Army Reserve and Commanding General of the U.S. Army Reserve Command.Daniels is the first female Chief of Army Reserve and Commanding General of the U.S. Army Reserve Command in the 112-year history of the Army Reserve.Read the story here: https://go.usa.gov/xf5Bn#ArmyReserve

Name: David McCormick
Text: I have always deeply admired General Scowcroft's commitment to public service, to our country, and for his belief that America must play a significant role on the global stage. The General’s reputation and legacy are unparalleled — even beyond the fact that he is the only person to have ever served two presidents as national security adviser. I count among my blessings to have learned from and had a friendship with this great American — and, it was an especially meaningful honor for me to succeed him as chairman of the Atlantic Council's International Advisory Board in 2017, an organization he deserves credit for having helped to build. Today, we celebrate a great man and a great patriot, while we mourn with the Scowcroft family for his loss. As Americans, we are better off today because of the values, principles, and service of this extraordinary man.

Name: David McCormick
Text: Bridgewater’s LGBTQ+ affinity group, B Proud, recently hosted industry leader and longtime client and friend, Raytheon CIO Robin Diamonte, for a conversation alongside Client Advisor Jessica Oleson. As a pioneer herself, I asked Robin what advice she had for me as we strive to make Bridgewater an ever more diverse and inclusive community. Thank you, Robin – for you for your partnership through all these years, and for sharing your wisdom with us.

Name: David McCormick
Text: I was honored to sit down with my friend Christian Brose for a wide-ranging conversation about his powerful new book, The Kill Chain: Defending America in the Future of High-Tech Warfare. Chris made some provocative points about the challenges to America’s military and technological edge, and we discussed the pressing need to innovate, as well as how to foster an even deeper culture of innovation at the Department of Defense. I particularly appreciated Chris’s candor about the challenges we faced combined with his optimism about our country’s capacity to adapt to the increasingly challenging geopolitical environment. It’s an excellent and provocative book and I thank the The Alexander Hamilton Society for hosting this timely conversation. https://lnkd.in/gCYJNX3 Gabriel M. Scheinmann

Name: David McCormick
Text: I’m proud and honored that Apple Books selected #FiveDays as one of the #JulyMustListens!Check it out here: apple.co/mustlistens

Name: David McCormick
Text: While on the Federal Reserve, this chart from the Financial Times re the expected evolution of the Fed's balance sheet.#centralbanks #markets #economy #fed #federalreserve #ft Financial Times

Name: David McCormick
Text: Today I joined The Economic Club of New York for a discussion with Bridgewater Associates CEO David McCormick on advancing sustainable growth, economic opportunity and racial equity. All of us as leaders need to use our platforms to shine a brighter light on these topics to move forward faster. Thanks to former Citi Chairman Michael O'Neill for hosting our conversation and #ECNY for having me.

Name: David McCormick
Text: “Tales of strong female leaders succeeding through this crisis could lead to a change in the overarching narrative of what a strong leader looks like.” A recent piece in the Harvard Business Review highlights the skillful management of COVID by several women leaders and asks, “Will the pandemic reshape notions of female leadership?” I hope so. We need women involved at all levels of decision-making.

Name: David McCormick
Text: The rapid policy response to the COVID pandemic has resulted in an unprecedented speed of asset reflation. What took almost two years to achieve during the 2008 financial crash and almost four years during the Great Depression has unfolded in only one month during the current crisis. Co-CIO Greg Jensen and members of our research team explore the unique lengths and the potential limits of policy makers’ efforts to stimulate the economy. https://lnkd.in/gWET2nq

Name: David McCormick
Text: Since the outbreak of COVID, employers are looking to hire the best talent. #Veterans are equipped with the experience to handle chaotic situations. 'That resilience and tenacity are exactly what may help our economy survive and thrive during these unprecedented times.'

Name: David McCormick
Text: I recently had a great conversation with Eric Schmidt and the Bridgewater community as part of our Distinguished Speaker Series, where we had a wide-ranging discussion on the pandemic, economy, technology, diversity in the workforce, teamwork, and leadership. Eric’s remarks on leadership and mentorship really resonated. For someone who has enjoyed his kind of success (Eric was CEO, Executive Chairman, and Technical Advisor at Google and Alphabet for almost two decades), I was struck by his humility and emphasis on teamwork. Here are some of my favorite quotes of his from our chat:“If you spend your day work for love…and I mean love of how I feel about the people, love of what I do, that’s a pretty good life.”“You can win by influence, by leadership, by feelings, by reflecting other people.”“Historically America fights and wins. So, this is your generation’s fight to win…let’s figure out a way to thrive during this period – that’s how Americans do it.”

Name: David McCormick
Text: WATCH: Ray Dalio, founder and co-CIO of Bridgewater Associates, talks about the long-term market implications of the past few months at the recent "The Way Forward" virtual conference held by Goldman Sachs: https://click.gs.com/xl9y

Name: David McCormick
Text: Important read for anyone thinking through the new normal of remote work. Much of these findings resonate with what we’re finding at Bridgewater: Productivity is up and our employees have figured out ways to create routines to support work from home. At the same time, I worry about burnout and losing the kind of face-to-face interactions that lead to new ideas and foster solidarity and culture. As we prioritize the health and safety of our community, Bridgewater will not return to office work en masse until at least January 2021. In the meantime, I’m particularly grateful to our technology and security teams who have worked for several years to enable a more flexible remote work environment, and to our community engagement team who has delivered high quality opportunities for our people to stay connected in this virtual world.

Name: David McCormick
Text: Thanks to the Atlantic Council for publishing the article I wrote with Bridgewater colleagues Charles Luftig and James Cunningham. Preserving America’s leadership position in the world has been on my mind and is something that will be critical in coming months and years as we recover from the pandemic and rebuild our economy. I welcome your feedback on our ideas, which lay out ways to promote development of critical technologies, adopt strategic approaches to economic statecraft, and restructure government agencies to better implement these policies.

Name: David McCormick
Text: There has never been a more important time for national service. America needs this nonpartisan call to serve. Kudos to Senator Chris Coons and colleagues for such important leadership. What’s powerful about this idea is that it would draw together people from different racial, economic and geographic backgrounds into a common enterprise. In this way, argues David McCormick, an Army veteran who is now chief executive of Bridgewater Associates and has helped mobilize support for the bill, “National service would go a long way toward solving some of the most important challenges our country is facing — to overcome our divisions and reaffirm our common purpose.”https://lnkd.in/dK-VvGK ‬

Name: David McCormick
Text: Congrats, Sean Macrae. You are a tremendous leader for Bridgewater and we are excited to see you expand your impact through this fellowship.

Name: David McCormick
Text: I applaud Senators Christopher Coons and Roger Wicker for recognizing how expanded national service would be transformational for our country. During training for the 82nd Airborne, I made lifelong bonds with soldiers from all walks of life who I probably never would have met in the civilian world. Bringing together Americans of all different backgrounds to serve the greater good makes the United States better. A more unified America means a stronger America on the world stage, and I laud the forward-thinking leadership demonstrated here. Thank you to David Ignatius for shining a light on such an important topic, and for including my thoughts in your article.

Name: David McCormick
Text: Sgt. 1st Class Joseph Maloney's story is inspiring. Beginning with 9/11, then Hurricane Sandy and now the COVID pandemic, he has been to New York City with the National Guard for every major activation. Thank you for your incredible service!

Name: David McCormick
Text: Thrilled to join Robin Roberts on #GoodMorningAmerica on my first day at The Wharton School and discuss topics so important to me and so pivotal to our country right now: workplace diversity, bridging the gender and racial gaps, and setting the example for younger generations.

Name: David McCormick
Text: Raising a Thief is now available as an e-book on Amazon and Apple and paperback on Amazon. This is the story of our family’s efforts to raise our daughter, a Russian adoptee who was treated terribly before we took her in.  At the center of this story is the notion of attachment. This reality of interrupted attachment between parent and child goes well beyond our family’s saga. It is an issue that will come up with border separations, troop deployments, front line workers with Co-19, a demanding work-place and any other time a caregiver abruptly steps away from a child. My hope is this book can transform awareness about attachment and provide a good summer read at the same time! Enjoy.

Name: David McCormick
Text: Thank you to the board of FINRA for giving me the opportunity to serve as Chair and help ensure that our securities industry operates with the highest standards for investors.

Name: David McCormick
Text: Bridgewater Associates CEO David McCormick offers valuable career advice to students graduating at a challenging time in this video of a recent Clarke Forum event, “How Mentors Can Shape Your Future: A Conversation with a Global Leader.” Throughout the hourlong virtual event, Dickinson President Margee Ensign and U.S. District Judge John E. Jones III '77, P'11, discussed the he importance of mentorship in fostering leadership skills with McCormick.

Name: David McCormick
Text: It was an honor to sit down with someone I’ve long admired, Lieutenant General H.R. McMaster, to discuss some of the biggest problems facing the world today – the pandemic, inequality, and the recession. We had a great back-and-forth on strategies to bolster America’s standing through economic statecraft and tech innovation. Thanks to the Hoover Institution for hosting the event. https://lnkd.in/dqmTeArThe Hoover Institution, Stanford University

Name: David McCormick
Text: “For those of us in the LGBTQ community, Turing is an enduring icon, and the growing appreciation of his life and his great contributions to the world are a cause for hope and celebration.” - Chair of #PrincetonU Department of Computer Sciences Jennifer Rexford ‘91Alan Turing *38 was born on this day in 1912. We celebrate his groundbreaking achievements in computer sciences, his work to help break the Enigma codes in World War II, and his legacy in the #LGBTQ community. His portrait was unveiled this fall and added to Lewis Library atrium. https://bit.ly/2Z5A9Lw #PrideMonth

Name: David McCormick
Text: During our virtual global town hall yesterday, my colleague Dina Powell McCormick and I had the pleasure of hosting Robin Hood CEO Wes Moore for a deep and meaningful discussion on poverty, race and how #COVID has had a disproportionate impact on people of color. I am so impressed by Wes’ leadership and all that he and the team at Robin Hood is doing to drive truly impactful action in addressing the inequities our community.

Name: David McCormick
Text: The recovery from the coronavirus pandemic is going to be a complicated matter. Thank you to everybody who participated in the important and thought-provoking discussion earlier at the Northern Light Summit.

Name: David McCormick
Text: I am grateful for the generosity of my Black colleagues at Bridgewater, who lent the power of their voices to our community so we could better understand their lived experience. I encourage you all to watch this powerful video on their encounters with racism.

Name: David McCormick
Text: The current #COVID crisis has shed light on the important role that private and public companies play in their communities. Thank you Mike Milken for inviting me on the Milken Institute podcast to discuss the significance of cooperative capitalism as we rebuild.

Name: David McCormick
Text: "In the 60's, 70's, and 80's you could not hold a top-secret clearance and be openly gay," according to CIA officer Tracey Ballard. Before 1995, federal law stated that government agencies could not hire homosexuals. During #PrideMonth, we recognize public servants like Tracey Ballard, who took the risk to join the IC even when it could have cost her career. Learn more about Tracey: https://lnkd.in/djHC-xp

Name: David McCormick
Text: Alan Bowser’s impact can be felt in every corner of Bridgewater. He stands out for his wisdom and humility, his relentless pursuit of our goals, and his measured and thoughtful approach to solving tough problems. I count myself fortunate to have worked with Alan for all of the 10 years we’ve both been here. Congratulations Alan, and thank you for all you have done for Bridgewater. https://lnkd.in/gHFDkQq

Name: David McCormick
Text: I recommend catching up online with Oprah Winfrey’s OWN special, “Where Do We Go From Here?” It features a remarkable group of Black leaders, activists, and writers talking about next steps in the work to end systemic racism and how we all have a role to play.

Name: David McCormick
Text: I have said this a lot over the past weeks and months, but it bears repeating again. We show who we are in times of crisis.

Name: David McCormick
Text: Today, we face a reckoning that has been a long time coming. About a history of racism that too often gets oversimplified, about imbalances in power and equity that marginalize large portions of our population, about our choices in how we address these iniquities – through force and intimidation or through education, understanding, and compassion.We have to accept some hard truths and take a hard look at where we have come up short. It’s a tough conversation to have, but it’s one that makes us all stronger. Having grown up in an inner-city housing project, I have seen a grace and community that’s possible when we embrace, respect, and value each other.When we reject prejudice, chose to engage with each other, and tap into that rich diversity around us, one that defines us as a nation, we start to see new ways of doing things and free ourselves from the tired, old thinking that led us to this week.There are a lot of questions about where we go now and how we progress that I don’t know the answers to.But we owe it to ourselves to be brave enough to pursue those answers honestly and thoughtfully. And we owe it to those lost along the way – George Floyd and so many others – to step up and call out injustice so that all of our tomorrows are better than today. #blacklivesmatter

Name: David McCormick
Text: I was honored to host my good friend Wes Moore in a virtual fireside chat at Bridgewater so he could share his perspectives on race in America. Wes has an upcoming book about the 2015 uprisings in his hometown of Baltimore following Freddie Gray’s death in police custody, "Five Days: The Fiery Reckoning of an American City." He is also CEO of The Robin Hood Foundation, one of the largest anti-poverty organizations in America.Wes, who has to consider what is okay for him to wear when he goes out for his morning jog, has witnessed and lived through institutional racism. He reminds us that racism permeates so many aspects of our society, resulting in discrimination in housing, healthcare, education, finance, voter access – the list goes on. That puts in perspective what Wes posed to our community: “Where is our collective pain supposed to go when there is no justice?”Thank you, Wes, for joining us – and thank you to the Bridgewater Black Network for organizing the event. Our conversation left me ever more committed to the challenge of figuring out what we as individuals, what we as a community, and what I as a leader will do to make lasting change against the crippling effects of institutional racism.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: I had the pleasure of joining Shatterproof’s virtual Chairman’s Reception, alongside founder Gary Mendell and NBC’s Craig Melvin. I am constantly impressed by Shatterproof’s efforts to combat addiction and end the stigma around this disease, which has become even more challenging amid COVID. You can visit Shatterproof.org to learn more about their life-saving work and find out how you can get involved.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: As part of our efforts with the New York Jobs CEO Council, a collective of corporations work to hire 25,000 The City University of New York students by 2030, Goldman Sachs is happy to announce the launch of our inaugural CUNY Possibilities Summit. Through interactive workshops, network opportunities and financial wellness resources, our CUNY Possibilities Summit seeks to create pathways to stable careers for New Yorkers in low-income and underrepresented communities. If you or someone you know is interested in applying, learn more about our virtual programs: https://click.gs.com/aw4u

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: For the first time, we are offering all of our employees who are eligible to vote and currently in the U.S. up to a half-day of paid leave on Election Day, November 3rd. The pandemic raises unique challenges for those who want to exercise their civic responsibility to vote safely, so our hope is this will provide our people with the time and flexibility to vote on Election Day.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: This year, Milken Institute’s annual Global Conference focused on “Meeting the Moment” in an effort to address the dual crises of a global pandemic and social injustice. I had the privilege of joining Mike Milken with BNY Mellon's Todd Gibbons, Credit Suisse’s Thomas Gottstein, and Wellington Management's Jean Hynes to discuss Goldman Sachs’ approach to serving our clients amid uncertainty, our support for small businesses and the importance of staying connected. #MIGlobal #MIMeetingTheMoment

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: We were all deeply saddened to learn that Jim Johnson passed away this morning. Jim’s deep experience in business and politics gave him a unique perspective on the world, and made him an invaluable counselor over nearly 20 years of service on our board.  We will miss Jim, and his sunny disposition, and express our deepest condolences to Heather, Alfred, and his family.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: RedBird Capital Partners is opening a West Coast office in Los Angeles and has hired longtime top Goldman Sachs banker Andy Gordon to lead it.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: I came out at work 16 years ago because it was getting increasingly difficult for me to show up at work each day hiding myself, taking energy away from making the best impact I could.  It felt like I was living with my own personal handbrake on. Whilst we have come a long way since I came out I know there are so many people looking for others like them in leadership roles, much like I was all those years ago.  In recognition of National  Coming Out Day I want to recognize the people of Goldman Sachs - the LGBTQ+ community and our allies - who make everyone feel safe expressing their individuality and bringing their authentic selves to work.  In my first year back at GS I have met countless role models and teachers who inspire me.  Diversity is what makes us impactful and innovative as a firm, and advancing diversity and inclusion means we are embracing everyone for their unique contributions, recognizing them and challenging them to grow with us.  No matter who you are, you should be counted for it #NCOD #lgbtqpride #handbrakeoff

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: This morning I had the pleasure of speaking with Alix Steel  and with Guy Johnson on Bloomberg Markets. If you would like to hear about our latest views on why the traditional 60/40 portfolio is broken and how savers can actively pursue new sources of growth and income, please click here._____Any reference to a specific company or security does not constitute a recommendation to buy, sell, hold or directly invest in the company or its securities.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: The onset of the COVID pandemic has meant that 2020 has been a year like no other. Emerging from a year of uncertainty & with the upcoming US election, geopolitics over the next 4 years will be #TopofMind for global investors. I encourage you to subscribe to Allison Nathan's podcast for important insights from Goldman Sachs.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: Check out this Talks@GS with philanthropist and entrepreneur, Ric Lewis, who talks real estate, race, and our responsibility to actively support the next generation.   #TalksAtGS #blackhistorymonth

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: Honored to be recognized as one of the 100 Most Intriguing Entrepreneurs by Goldman Sachs 2020 Builders & Innovators Summit!At Pensando Systems, it's my goal to always push for new and innovative cloud solutions for the future of today's enterprises. Thank you #GSInnovators! #innovation #innovator #entrepreneur #cloud

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: Today at Goldman Sachs’ annual Builders + Innovators Summit, I was named as one of their “100 Most Intriguing Entrepreneurs of 2020.” I’m very honored to be a recipient of this award, and to be recognized by Goldman Sachs along with some of the industry’s top entrepreneurs. More from #Behavox about this #GSInnovators recognition at: https://lnkd.in/gruzR9P

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: Thanks Goldman Sachs for recognizing years of hardwork and rapid profitable growth of GrubMarket Inc. #GSInnovators #buildgreatcompany #disruptfoodsupplychain #profitablegrowth https://lnkd.in/ehPdsp8

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: So honored to be included as one of Goldman Sachs’s 100 Most Intriguing Entrepreneurs named at Goldman’s 2020 Builders + Innovators Summit this week. Thank you to the Unqorkers, customers, and partners that are driving the #nocode revolution forward. #GSInnovators #Unqork

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: This week we kicked-off our annual Neurodiversity Hiring Initiative. Creating a space that champions diversity in all forms is critical to empowering the ideas and perspectives of our people. Our dedication to cultivating a work experience where all of our people can realize their full potential and thrive, while being valued and celebrated for their differences, is essential for advancing inclusion and diversity at Goldman Sachs: https://click.gs.com/bzbv #NDEAM

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: Yesterday I kicked off Goldman Sachs’ Builders + Innovators Summit, bringing together the 100 Most Intriguing Entrepreneurs. While we’re typically in sunny California for the event, it was still great to connect virtually with this crowd. Thanks to Howard Schultz for sharing his story: from humble beginnings in Brooklyn to building one of the most recognizable and socially-conscious brands in the world.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: I’ve been part of our #CommunityTeamWorks volunteer program for over 20 years – and this year our work is more critical than ever. In April, we pivoted to a virtual program, allowing nearly 7,000 people at Goldman Sachs to help bring relief to those disproportionately impacted by the pandemic. And just last week, we launched our latest campaign to support students and educators through more than 90 virtual volunteering projects with 57 nonprofit partners, like SolarBuddy, pictured here, that our volunteers worked with to assemble solar lights for students experiencing energy poverty. Thanks to all of our people who have stepped up to give back virtually.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: Excited to share the latest edition of Top of Mind at Goldman Sachs: Beyond 2020: Post-Election Policies. We speak with Kevin Hassett, former Chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers under President Trump, and Jared Bernstein, economic adviser to former VP Biden, on the candidates' economic policy priorities. And Ian Bremmer, Eurasia Group’s President and Founder, offers his take on what to expect for US foreign policy after the election on issues such as the US-China relationship, the Iran nuclear deal, and relations with Russia. Check it out. ￬￬￬

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: Earlier this week I had the pleasure of kicking off Goldman Sachs’ 5th Annual Disruptive Technology Symposium with my colleagues in Banking, Global Markets and PWM.  We are hosting c 30 virtual series with a focus on Fintech, Healthcare-tech, travel/mobility and Edtech.  It is great to see such amazing growth within the Technology sector in Europe!   #GSEurope

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: I am thrilled to share that Code First Girls has surpassed its goal to teach 20,000 women across the UK to code! It has been a privilege to support their 2020 campaign over the past three years — Goldman Sachs remains committed to achieving gender parity in STEM, as well as making coding more accessible to women. This is a significant achievement and I look forward to continuing to support Anna Brailsford and the team on their mission.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: The Youth INC NYC team is thrilled to be hosting Eurazeo CEO Virginie Morgon and Goldman Sachs President and COO John Waldron for the latest entry in our State of the Market Virtual Speaker Series sponsored by Latham & Watkins! Register today to ensure you don't miss out on this fantastic event. All proceeds support Youth INC programs to empower grassroots #NYC youth-centered nonprofits #raisingourcity #leadership

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: This morning I had the pleasure of connecting virtually with our Global 2019 Managing Director Class. One day we’ll celebrate their tremendous achievement in person, but for now I’m incredibly grateful for their outstanding #leadership over this past year and commitment to One Goldman Sachs. Thanks to Kerryann Benjamin for an insightful fireside chat.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: South African 10,000 Women graduate awarded Fortune Most Powerful Women AwardAs part of our long-standing partnership with the Fortune Most Powerful Women Summit, each year one of our phenomenal #10KWomen graduates is selected for the highly prestigious @Goldman Sachs and @Fortune Global Women Leaders Award.I am especially delighted that the winner of the 2020 prize is one of our very own graduates from South Africa – @Rayana Edwards.9 out of 10 graduates of the #10KWomen program go on to help other women, and Rayana’s story is an incredible example of the power of paying it forward. Through her Saris for Change initiative, Rayan trains unemployed mothers in the Guateng region with business skills and needlecraft to enable them to create their own employment, become self-reliant and care for their families.At the start of the year, before lockdown was a reality, I had the privilege of meeting Rayana at the @JSE for a #10KWomen event. I was struck by her drive and dynamism - she is a truly inspiration person, and so deserving of this award.To join a powerful community of liked-minded entrepreneurs like Rayana, sign up to our completely free 10,000 Women online course here: https://lnkd.in/dkP9Pn5 #10KWomen #southafrica #womenleaders

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: What is inclusive entrepreneurship? Let me start by saying what it’s not: only 1% of US venture capital funding going to Black founders and Black business owners being rejected for bank funding at 3x the rate of white business owners.  These numbers can no longer be ignored. Good ideas and grit can only take you so far. We must implement a full-court press strategy aimed at closing major gaps in financial and social capital for female and minority entrepreneurs by expanding access to business education, capital, and advocacy. Ultimately, we’re solving for a misallocation of capital – advancing inclusive entrepreneurship is a massive investment opportunity.   I walked away energized and hopeful after discussing solutions Forbes’ first-ever virtual Small Business Summit. What an honor to speak alongside leaders like COO of Facebook, Sheryl Sandberg, Senator Cory Booker, Forbes Chairman, Steve Forbes, Forbes Senior Editor, Maneet Ahuja, and Co-Founders of The Female Founder Collective, Rebecca Minkoff, and Alison Koplar Wyatt. Watch here: https://lnkd.in/emytV6a #ForbesSmallBusinessSummit

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: Namaskaram Hyderabad! We look forward to opening our new office in Hyderabad in 2021.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: Yesterday I had the opportunity to be interviewed by Michal Lev-Ram for Fortune’s Most Powerful Women Summit. I expressed the importance of setting targets, not quotas, when it comes to diverse hiring practices in corporate America. It was a pleasure to be a part of this event alongside so many inspiring female leaders across industries. https://lnkd.in/g7PJyCq #FortuneMPW

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: Today, more than ever, I view my CEO role as a responsibility to make a sustainably positive impact on other people’s lives. At Russell Investments, we’re committed to improving people’s financial security and building their financial resilience. One positive to come out of this year of global crisis and unrest is that our industry will sharpen its focus on inclusive capitalism. Congratulations to my fellow American Banker 2020 Most Powerful Women in Finance honorees. Let’s work together on this front. #leadership

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: Thank you to Congressman Josh Gottheimer and Congressman Tom Reed for inviting me to speak with the Problem Solvers Caucus yesterday. We had a dynamic discussion about the state of the U.S. and global economy, the federal stimulus and our long term debt trajectory. I applaud the caucus for continuing to work to find middle ground on complex policy issues.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: If there’s one thing I’ve learned in 22 years at Goldman Sachs  it’s that as our clients’ needs evolve, so do we. Which is why the firm announced this week that we will bring together our traditional and alternative asset management businesses into one unified Asset Management division. As I mentioned during a townhall with our global team earlier today, this move is really driven by our deep commitment to our clients, as exemplified by the firm’s values – which include client service, partnership, and excellence – and supported by our platform’s strong investment culture built over many years. It is a privilege to work with and invest alongside such a wide range of institutions and companies around the world to help them grow and scale their businesses. This change only enhances our ability to offer them a full suite of integrated products and services to meet the total needs of their portfolios. I look forward to partnering with Eric Lane, work with such a talented group of professionals, and accomplishing great things with our clients.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: Congratulations Iain Drayton !  Great recognition for a great leader and friend.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: From health screenings to social distancing and mask wearing, a lot has changed as you walk into 200 West but this view hasn’t. I’m more grateful than ever to my colleagues around the world who make Goldman Sachs such an incredible company to lead as I head into my third year as CEO.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: Enjoyed participating in insightful conversations with women leaders at this week's Fortune Most Powerful Women Summit. Last night, we had a roundtable discussion with our clients where I was joined by colleagues Stephanie Cohen, Asahi Pompey, Meena Lakdawala-Flynn, Dina Powell McCormick, Margaret Anadu, Beth Hammack, Ericka Leslie and Kim Posnett. And today, I spoke with Fortune’s Jen Wieczner on advancing #diversity and #inclusion, as well as honored the recipients of the Goldman Sachs Global Women Leaders Award, including Rayana Edwards, a #10KWomen graduate and founder of non-profit group Sari for Change. #FortuneMPW

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: I’ve been in the Private Wealth Management business for over three decades, during which time I’ve witnessed a remarkable transformation, both in our clients’ needs and our ability to serve them. I am immensely proud of the wealth management teams meeting this challenge every day, as we have continued to innovate, attract talent, and grow our business. I am looking forward to work with my partner, Stephanie Cohen, and with our teams across the Consumer and Wealth Management Division to drive the next wave of innovation and continue to deliver a world class offering to our clients.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: Over the past several years in my role as Chief Strategy Officer of Goldman Sachs, I have had the privilege to work closely with colleagues across the firm, including in our Consumer and Wealth Management businesses. I’ve learned so much from engaging with our private wealth clients, Marcus customers, and founders and CEOs of transformational financial technology companies. In our business, we’ve seen the rapid growth of Marcus under Harit Talwar and Omer Ismail’s leadership, and most recently, we’ve welcomed the United Capital team (now Goldman Sachs Personal Financial Management) to Goldman Sachs. We’ve also begun to embed our digital consumer capabilities into the ecosystems of our clients, like we did with the Apple Card. I’m excited about where the industry is heading and look forward to work more closely with my partner Tucker York, with our colleagues across the Consumer and Wealth Management Division, and with our clients. https://lnkd.in/gKvBWjT

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: After 5 remarkable years as global head of Goldman Sachs' Consumer business, I’ll become its chairman on Jan 1. In this role, I’ll provide strategic advice to the firm, division and business as we continue to grow.Building Marcus by Goldman Sachs continues to be the most rewarding experience of my career. How often do you get the opportunity to build a modern digital business from scratch inside a 150-year-old preeminent investment bank?  There were many skeptics and it’s safe to say we proved them wrong. $90 billion in deposits, $7 billion in loan/card balances, $1 billion in annual revenues and unique products with partners including Apple, Amazon, Walmart and JetBlue! This success demonstrates the firm’s ability to build new business platforms at scale.More than the stats, I’ve been humbled to work with the most talented, diverse and entrepreneurial team. We’ve stayed true to our north star of customer-centricity and used a fusion of engineering, data and design to make life simpler for customers.I couldn't be more proud that Omer Ismail will become the global head of Consumer. From day 1, I have relied on him not just for his tireless work and commitment, but also for his insights and friendship.  I have no doubt the business will continue to scale to new heights.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: Following the celebration of #WomensEqualityDay and the 100th anniversary of the #19thAmendment, I had the pleasure of speaking with Melissa Karsh from Bloomberg LP on the topic of gender equality on Wall Street. If you would like to read about how women in positions of power in finance are thinking about gender equality as it relates to leadership, perseverance, advancements, results, and the way forward, please click the link below.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: “Courage, inspiration, respect, judgment, wellness, and loyalty guide every decision we make.” It was a privilege to interview tristan walker, CEO of Walker & Company Brands, Inc., a subsidiary of Procter & Gamble, during a recent episode of our #TalksatGS series. An inspirational leader.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: For the second instalment of our new #WhenWomenLead series, #10KW graduate Wambui Ngayu demonstrates how she found opportunity within a crisis, leading to the launch of her pioneering children's hair salon business in Kenya. A truly inspirational story of resilience and courage:#10KWomen #womenentrepreneurs

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: An email to our Research community sharing personal thoughts on what it means to be black in this country, now shared more broadly. Thanks to GS for giving a platform to black voices when we need the world to listen, in order for the future to be different for our children. “I have a dream” ... Black. Lives. Matter.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: It isn’t lost on me how lucky I am to work for a great company and with incredible people. Last November Goldman Sachs announced 20 weeks of paid parental leave for all new parents at the firmglobally regardless of their gender or caregiver status. I immediately told my boss that I wanted to take the entire period off to be with my wife Lindsay, baby Bodhi, and two older children (Nirvan 6, Bea 4). To say this has been one of the best decisions I’ve ever made would be an understatement. I have loved every minute of quality time at home with my family. As luck would have it, the firm’s policy came during an especially challenging year for families who have been severely disrupted by COVID. I am extremely thankful for the kindness and support I’ve been shown by my colleagues and clients during my time away. Look forward to seeing you all next week! #family #paternityleave #goldmansachs

Name: David M. Solomon

Today I had the opportunity to speak with this exceptionally talented group, and a special thanks to Maxton, Norman, Tanisha, and Dave for their questions.

Big shoes to fill...and a bright future ahead for this franchise.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: Over 670 small businesses will spend the next 14 weeks going deep into their business.  This month, Goldman Sachs 10,000 Small Businesses kicks off 19 cohorts across the country, delivered 100% virtually for the first time in our ten-year history. The focus will be on growth, not just of their businesses but their capacity as leaders. Our commitment to providing an exceptional experience in the classroom is unchanged and we thank our nearly 50 program partners on the ground in Baltimore, Chicago, Dallas, Detroit, New Orleans, Long Beach (just to name a few!) who make this effort possible.In these exceptionally trying times, we are honored to be providing a platform to help businesses rebuild, grow and be surrounded by like-minded entrepreneurs.  My message to our newest scholars: Take pride in your role as a job creator, as a builder, and as a leader in your community and take heart in knowing Goldman Sachs 10,000 Small Businesses will be with you every step of the way.  #MakeSmallBig #10KSB

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: There is a lot of uncertainty in these challenging times, but it’s more important than ever to continue engaging on the issues that matter most. I’m a firm believer in #WCDGlobal2020’s mission to increase representation of women on company boards, and appreciated having the opportunity to participate in the dialogue.

Name: David M. Solomon

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: Protecting and improving the health of people around the world is nothing new to Johnson & Johnson—it is what we were built to do. The COVID pandemic is the greatest public health crisis of our generation, and from the beginning we have been compelled to use our decade of vaccine development expertise and our innovative vaccine technology to help develop a COVID vaccine. We have held our lifesaving medicines and other products to high standards of science and regulatory review for the last 134 years, and we are unwavering in applying the same rigor to the development of a vaccine for COVID—no matter the speed. That’s why we at Johnson & Johnson are joining our peer organizations today in signing the COVID Vaccine Maker Pledge, which reaffirms our commitment to developing a COVID vaccine that meets high ethical and scientific standards. Learn more: https://bit.ly/2R9i0ZC #WeStandWithScience

Name: David M. Solomon

They also have great advice for anyone growing a business in today’s environment. You can hear more about their journeys on the full-length episode on Apple Podcasts and Spotify. #LaunchWithGS

Name: David M. Solomon

Despite all this, their ability to pivot and persevere inspires, and we are proud to shine a light on what they are to us - essential. #LongLiveSmallBusiness #MakeSmallBig

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: Yesterday we hosted our 10th Annual EMEA Leveraged Finance Conference welcoming over 1400 individual investors and 75 issuers to our virtual sessions.  From Brexit to Europe’s path forward, we were able to bring investors and thought leaders together to discuss topics affecting the industry.Thank you to everyone who took part and made the day possible.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: I always love geeking out about this stuff - I am lucky enough to soak up knowledge and insight from colleagues and clients and great to share it and keep on learning. But why am I particularly excited for this? Two reasons:1. Megan Starr and Martin Whittaker are experienced practitioners from whom I (and hopefully the audience) can learn a lot. They are people who truly have a perspective worth listening to on the question of where ESG has been and where it is going2. The three of us have, in various combinations and permutations, worked together for some time. That means that beyond the knowledge and perspective we each bring, we can sink our teeth into the issues, bat them around, test them, and maybe have some arguments worth having. I know these two keep me on my toes and always hold me to account and that makes for a much more interesting conversation.Tune in!

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: Great to speak at 2020 Climate Bonds Initiative annual conference alongside colleagues from AllianceBernstein (Erin Bigley), BNP Paribas Asset Management (Helena Viñes Fiestas), and the Luxembourg Stock Exchange (Julie Becker). We focused on the prospects for transition bonds and the impact they may have from a market perspective in providing greater capital flows towards climate friendly efforts. Check it out.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: It is with immense gratitude that I share I will be joining Goldman Sachs next summer as an investment banking sophomore analyst within Leveraged Finance in New York City! This amazing opportunity would not have been possible were it not for the mentorship of Maeve DuVally (or her story of bravery in the NYT that led to our connection), as well as the guidance of Jon Tamposi and Sasha Kelemen!  Additionally, I want to thank Chris Aldarelli, Laura Muriel Duque, as well as the entire GS Insight Series team and various guest speakers from across the firm!Next, a huge thank you to the SEO (Sponsors for Educational Opportunity) team, as well as to the amazing network of kind, diverse, and driven alumni!And last (but certainly not least) thank you so much to the University of New Hampshire Peter T. Paul College of Business and Economics community, my first economics professor Michael Goldberg, Stephen Ciccone, Megan Shea Turnbull/UNH Career and Professional Success (CaPS), as well as The Atkins Investment Group!#investmentbanking #newyork #goldmansachs #onegoldman #unh #paulpride #levfin #internship #paulcollege

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: Exactly 1 year ago, I was participating in the University of Houston, C.T. Bauer College of Business's Pre-Recruiting Mixer, where I received a phone call informing me that I had just received an internship offer from Goldman Sachs. I will never forget the wave of emotion that I felt that day.Today, that sheer emotion was felt once again as I am elated to share that I have accepted a full-time analyst position with Goldman Sachs within the Dallas, Texas office.As a first-generation Latinx student, this has been one of my proudest achievements, however it was not done alone. It genuinely does take a village (or in my case, a familia). I would like to share my deepest gratitude to all of my colleagues, mentors, friends, and family for their constant support as I could not have done this alone. Thank you to the C.T Bauer College of Business, ALPFA Houston Chapter, and especially HBSA Bauer for the development, the neverending support, but most of all for being my familia.I look forward to beginning this new chapter in my life, post-graduation. #goldmansachs #accepted #makethingspossible #latinx #firstgeneration #ALPFA

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: I am extremely grateful and thrilled to announce that I have officially accepted a full-time offer to join Goldman Sachs. After my graduation from Tulane University in May, I will be joining the firm in the New York office as a New Analyst in the Human Capital Management division.Throughout my internship at the firm this summer, I was able to experience the unique culture of GS first-hand. Name: David M. Solomon
Text: The day after Labor Day in the U.S. signals change and new beginnings for many: the return to school, the return from vacations to work. Of course, in 2020, everything is different. And this is starkly true for many small business owners, for whom there was no summer break, no respite from the stresses caused by the pandemic, and no further relief package. Small businesses are made up of essential workers, and they are essential to our economy and our communities. That’s why we will continue supporting them, and continue encouraging our elected officials to do the same.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: Under Armour has an important role to play in the future of #Baltimore and beyond. I’m excited to join the board and help grow and guide the future of this company that means so much to so many. There’s a lot of work to do and I’m eager to get going.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: I’m honored to have some of my leadership principles included in David Rubenstein’s new book, How to Lead. His book provides a unique opportunity to learn from the perspectives of some exceptional individuals and I hope it’s as educational for you as it was for me.
