Name: David M. Solomon
Text: The day to day commitment of our people at Goldman Sachs to the communities in which they live and serve was recognised today with a place on the “50 Companies That Care” from Great Place to Work and PEOPLE.  #ourpeoplemakethedifference

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: A crisis tests an organization’s values – in particular how it responds and tries to be part of the solution.  I’m proud to see Goldman Sachs named to PEOPLE Magazine | PEOPLE.com’s Companies That Care list, recognizing in part the work our team is doing to bring relief and resources to hard-hit communities.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: I’m pleased to see a broad and inclusive Fortune 40 Under 40 this year, with over 100 women named, among them two of my Goldman Sachs colleagues, Margaret Anadu and Amy Hong. Huge congratulations to Margaret and Amy on this outstanding achievement.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: Over the last few months I’ve been humbled by the extensive efforts of the people of Goldman Sachs to lift up their communities and give back in any way they can during this challenging time. These stories from around the world have helped us to earn recognition from Great Place to Work and PEOPLE with a place on their “50 Companies That Care” list. Our firm’s purpose is to advance sustainable economic growth and financial opportunity, which in times of crisis takes on even more meaning and importance. We’re honored to be included on this list of organizations who are focused on using their time, talents, and resources for society at large. https://click.gs.com/awfz

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: Happy #WomensEqualityDay. Thank you to the women and men who came before me who fought for equal rights, and for the ones who made it possible for me and so many others to pursue our own dreams. The original Wonder Woman TV show came out in 1975 when I was 4 years old. I remember being in awe of Lynda Carter because she didn’t need to be saved… she was the one doing the saving. I thought... "Women can be superheroes?" In the 1970s, women still had very limited options – I watched my own Mother and Grandmothers never really get the chance to fulfill their full potential. It motivated me to do everything in my power to fulfill my own potential on behalf of those who weren’t given the chance. Thank you to my mom for making this Wonder Woman Halloween costume! I remember you cutting and sewing each star, sewing the Wonder Woman top to my turtle neck so I wouldn’t be cold, the tin foil arm cuffs that kept coming off, and the head band I was so excited to wear I didn’t wait for the glue to dry and it stuck in my hair. It meant everything to me and I was truly transformed. Women really are superheroes, especially moms. #WomensEqualityDay

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: This summer, I had the wonderful opportunity to intern with Goldman Sachs! As a Summer Analyst with the Anti-Bribery Group (ABG) within Financial Crimes Compliance, I was thoroughly impressed with the firm’s commitment to creating a truly robust, challenging, and fulfilling summer internship experience that allowed me to truly appreciate the firm, its people, and the work they do to effectuate broad level change in the communities in which we live and work.I am elated to have accepted a return offer to join the firm as a Senior Analyst in the Global Compliance Division upon my graduation from William & Mary Law School! I am incredibly thankful for the countless people who have supported me throughout my scholastic career—I truly would not be here without the outstanding mentorship and guidance you all continue to impart to this day! I especially want to thank my AWESOME team within ABG who hosted me this summer: you all are the BEST!! I cannot wait to begin my professional career in Salt Lake City, Utah with this fantastic firm!

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: I am very excited to share that after an incredible and challenging 5 week summer internship, I have accepted a full-time offer at Goldman Sachs. After Graduation in May 2021, I will be joining the Credit Risk team in Dallas, Texas.This wouldn't have been possible without the help of my family, my mentor Eduardo Regueira, my manager Ana Erazo and buddies Jorge Martinez and Jen Receveur, MBA. I am so grateful for their guidance, patience, and help throughout the enriching internship experience. I would also like to thank the recruiting team for making all of this possible.I am excited to join the team in Dallas next summer and continue to expand my knowledge and experience as a professional!

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: After an exciting and insightful internship, I am thrilled to share that I have accepted an offer to join Goldman Sachs again next year, as a returning Compliance Summer Analyst in Salt Lake City. Thank you to the GS Registrations Team, my mentors, and my peers for helping to make this happen. I am excited to enter my Junior Year at Arizona State University, and continue my studies in Business Management and Political Science as part of Barrett, The Honors College. #internship #university #compliance

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: It’s official! I’m excited to announce that I have accepted a full-time offer with Goldman Sachs! As a result, I will be moving to Houston, Texas following my graduation in May, to begin my career in Private Wealth Management. I would especially like to thank my host team, mentor, buddy, program champions and summer management for all their help and encouragement along the way. The experiences I had over the summer not only allowed me to make new friends and business partners, but also showed me that PWM is what I am truly interested in. See you next summer Houston!

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: One hundred episodes of The Daily Check-In! I’ve learned so much from these conversations with Goldman Sachs people around the world, on topics ranging far and wide. Look forward to more in September.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: Shirley Chisholm said it best: "In the end anti-black, anti-female, and all forms of discrimination are equivalent to the same thing: anti-humanism.” #WomensEqualityDay commemorates an important day in history as we celebrate women’s suffrage. At Goldman Sachs, diversity and inclusion are of the highest priorities — while we take today to celebrate a historic win for women in America, we must also take the time to reflect on how we can continue to elevate women’s voices.

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: At Goldman Sachs, we are committed to diversity across dimensions – importantly, our approach to sustainability and inclusive growth is integrated across the firm. I was thrilled to share my perspectives on our ESG efforts with our summer intern class and prospective candidates. As a result of the ESG “What’s Next?” Challenge, we received 500+ student responses focused on inclusion, accountability, and sustainable growth. Ten candidates have been selected as our challenge winners. We look forward to putting their ideas into action. Congratulations to our winners!  Leandro Johner y Cruz, Columbia UniversityIsha Ganguli, New York UniversityVineet Daswani Joukani, Leicester UniversityJonah Heyl, University of Victoria Emma Lee, Clemson UniversityGrace Mather, University of MichiganPhilippe Mendez, University of Chicago Morgan Montgomery, Boston CollegeEmily Stammers, Edinburgh UniversitySofia de la Sierra, University of Pennsylvania

Name: David M. Solomon
Text: We are honoured to support the Goethe University’s Corona Fund through our Goldman Sachs Gives initiative. Our donation is dedicated to research projects focused on the development of medication and therapies, prevention methods and the broader consequences of the pandemic. https://lnkd.in/ekwFm4m

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Our investments in these manufacturing facilities underscore how committed we are to our employees and our communities. Manufacturing is one of our greatest strengths and these three facilities will help lead us into a new era as we work toward a zero-emissions future.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Congratulations to Mary Barra, CEO of General Motorsas she is honored with the Kettering UniversityDistinguished Alumni Award on Oct 22. Mary, you are truly a STEM leader who inspires young learners to pursue their passion!https://lnkd.in/d7jUugw#STEM #leadership #awards

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Today my friend Bob Feldman launched The Dialogue Project—a global study of how business can improve civil discourse and reduce polarization in our society. I’m humbled to be featured alongside Mary Barra, Jamie Dimon, Michael Sneed and other leaders who share a commitment to action. #CommitToDialogue

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Listening is the singular first step on the path to any positive change in the world. As part of The Dialogue Project, launched by Bob Feldman, I #CommitToDialogue, as dialogue leads to understanding, and understanding leads to change.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: At General Motors, we’re celebrating National Manufacturing Day today by reflecting on our amazing team while also raising awareness about the rewarding careers available in #manufacturing. Throughout the COVID pandemic, manufacturing has demonstrated its critical role in producing and delivering essential items needed. My hope is that students everywhere are able to see manufacturing roles as an opportunity to make a difference in the world.  Our Electrifying Manufacturing Toolkit is an opportunity for people of all ages to get a behind-the-scenes look at manufacturing. To learn more visit: https://bit.ly/3laepI6#MFGDay20

Name: Mary Barra
Text: At General Motors, we’re celebrating National Manufacturing Day today by reflecting on our amazing team while also raising awareness about the rewarding careers available in #manufacturing. Throughout the COVID pandemic, manufacturing has demonstrated its critical role in producing and delivering essential items needed. My hope is that students everywhere are able to see manufacturing roles as an opportunity to make a difference in the world.  Our Electrifying Manufacturing Toolkit is an opportunity for people of all ages to get a behind-the-scenes look at manufacturing. To learn more visit: https://bit.ly/3laepI6#MFGDay20

Name: Mary Barra
Text: It was great speaking with Ellen McGirt at #FortuneMPW Summit. The Summit was full of energy and I left feeling inspired. Diversity, equity and inclusion has been important to this company for a long time, but as I look ahead at what it will take to ensure true accountability inside and outside our walls, I know it’s a journey, and one we are committed to. Our words, deeds and actions will continue to be our guiding principles, and I am confident in our commitment to make our world a better and more equitable place for everyone.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Over the past three months, I have "zoom"ed across 15 countries talking with people about GM’s vision for Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and the resurgence of Cadillac across the globe. It is not quite how I imagined I would be connecting with our markets, but here's why I think it works. Ken Morris Jesse Ortega Adam Kwiatkowski Crystal Windham Brian Smith #electriccars #cadillac #design #evcars #evbattery #zoommeetings #zoommeeting #chevrolet #iworkforgm #videoconferencing #cars #automotive #craftsmanship #ev #autonomousvehicles #electricvehicles #autos

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Climate change is one of the greatest and most pressing challenges facing us and the planet we depend on. Businesses are an essential part of the solution. It’s a priority for me at Walmart and as part of the Business Roundtable. The BRT’s new climate position reflects the belief of over 200 CEOs that a national market-based emissions reduction policy is critical to reducing greenhouse gas emissions.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: There is scientific consensus that climate change is real and the consequences are too. Climate Week is a moment to come together across industries to discuss policies that will drive solutions, and as part of the Business Roundtable, we announced a new position on how we plan to combat climate change.  At General Motors, our business strategy is to deliver an all-electric, zero emissions future, with our Ultium battery platform making it easier to put everyone in an #EV as fast as possible. Through our innovations and technology, and also work collectively with other companies and government, we will be able to make the world a cleaner, safer place for future generations.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: General Motors will win in electric vehicles: we will create a profitable, all-electric future with a range of products that look great, charge fast and conveniently, and have the right combinations of range, power and performance. Thanks to RBC Capital Markets for having me today. Here’s a look into what I think of as the world’s first all-electric supertruck: the GMC Hummer #EV.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: The #19thamendment was ratified and adopted 100 years ago this month. The amendment, which granted women the right to vote, is an important milestone in American history that strengthened the democratic foundation of this country. However, many Americans still face barriers in casting ballots – due to lack of information or time, language barriers or voter suppression laws and tactics. Every American who qualifies to vote should be able to exercise this fundamental right, free from unnecessary hurdles. As a business leader and employer of nearly 100,000 in the U.S., I believe no American should have to choose between keeping their job and casting their vote. That is why for more than two decades, General Motors has designated Election Day in the United States as a paid company holiday. With the Business Roundtable, I encourage companies to make voting more accessible to their employees by providing paid time off and providing information on voter registration and alternatives such as voting by mail or early voting. While we commemorate women’s history, we shouldn’t forget how far we still have to go. Let's make sure all voices are heard.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Ed Bastian, thank you for sharing this piece. When we made this announcement last year, we couldn’t have imagined how important the commitment would prove to be a year later – and how many lives it would touch. I continue to be inspired by the stories – including Delta Air Lines’! – and I look forward to learning from each other.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: If someone told me that I would be interning with General Motors out of my childhood bedroom in Massachusetts, I would have laughed. It is remarkable how quickly things can change. With less than a month left of my virtual internship with GM, this experience has already pushed me to grow. The internal communications team and everyone I have met has provided me with meaningful work and have made me feel like a valued member of the GM family, even from Massachusetts. A few weeks back, I was given the once in a lifetime opportunity to moderate a Q+A session for our virtual intern super slice with Chairman and CEO of General Motors, Mary Barra. For an hour, I got the chance to virtually sit down with Mary one on one and represent a diverse class of nearly 600 interns. Topics ranged from career advice, innovation, leadership, and anything that was on our minds. It was surreal to have the chance to speak with Mary, and many of the interns in attendance felt the same.I never would have dreamed that this role with GM would have given me the opportunity to speak with someone like Mary, but this only touches the surface of the amazing projects that I have had during my short time here. I cannot wait to see where this last month takes me, thank you GM! #IWorkForGM #NationalInternDay

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Women are almost half of the U.S. labor force, but represent fewer than one fourth of the automotive workforce. We are depriving our nation and our industry of the talents of so many women, and at General Motors, we are committed to changing that. I have always been a believer that you can achieve anything you set your mind to, and with our partnership with the Girl Scouts of the USA, I hope to provide and encourage more opportunities for young women to pursue STEM. On August 5 at 2 p.m. ET, I’ll be talking with Sylvia Acevedo, Robin Roberts and Girl Scouts from across the country about building the next generation of female leaders. I hope you’ll join us. https://bit.ly/2Csfb2t

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Today, Business Roundtable released a statement supporting paid time off and flexibility for voting. I want to thank Mary Barra and my fellow Business Roundtable CEOs for their leadership. I hope the leaders of all organizations will join us in putting the infrastructure and resources in place to ensure the right to vote is accessible and encouraged.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Yesterday we launched General Motors' annual sustainability report, marking our progress over the past year toward our vision of a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion. The report offers transparency across GM’s environmental, social and governance pillars, demonstrating what we are doing, why we are doing it and the progress that is being made.I invite you to read more about our progress at GMSustainability.com.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: While we are pleased to share this report, we remain conscious of the increasing role for companies to do even more to leverage their resources and voices to provide leadership. Our company and our world have changed. And as we move forward, I believe society will have an even greater appreciation for the well-being of each other, and our planet. General Motors has helped changed the world before, and we are determined to do it again.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Today I announced the guiding principles of General Motors’ Inclusion Advisory Board, and the eleven members who will join me. We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world – through our words, our deeds, and our culture. This is just one step.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: It is important to have difficult, and sometimes uncomfortable, conversations. They lead to understanding, and understanding will lead to change. Gerald, thank you for sharing your message. We are listening and we see you.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Today’s decision by the Supreme Court is a historic day for LGBTQ Americans and we’re proud to stand with this community. Everyone deserves to feel welcomed and valued for who they are, no matter their race, gender, or sexual orientation. This #Pride2020, remember to celebrate each other’s differences and be true to yourself.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: I’m looking forward to talking with Daniel Roth for his #ThisIsWorking series, where we will discuss GM’s aspirations and how we are all moving through the world in a new way. I hope you’ll join us and ask your questions today at 2:30pm ET.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Today I stood alongside the mayor of Detroit and local leaders and made a commitment to our hometown and to the nation: we will no longer allow our company the indulgence of asking “why.”  We as a company will focus on “what.” What can we do?

Name: Mary Barra
Text: A message to the #Classof2020: the world may be a strange, different and difficult place right now, but moments like these inspire us to rise to the occasion, and develop an inner strength and resilience. You will be prepared to face just about anything, and I encourage you to embrace it. Congratulations!

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Mary Barra, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of General Motors, spoke in Laura Arrillaga-Andreessen's #PowerofYou: Women in Leadership class at the Stanford University Graduate School of Business (GSB) about her own leadership journey and decision-making style. “In my career, I have had to make tough decisions, but explain why,” said Barra. “When you have a company of 180,000 spread across the globe, you have to depend on them to live your values and always do the right thing - even when it is hard.” Barra, a GSB alumna and a member of Stanford’s Board of Trustees, emphasized the importance of Arrillaga-Andreessen’s seminal course on women and leadership - a class she wish she had taken in business school - encouraging students to take to heart the opportunities and learnings the class provides to use as they embark on their future careers.  #leadership #womenleadership #herstory

Name: Mary Barra
Text: As we celebrate the 50th anniversary of #EarthDay, it’s important to recognize the impact #COVID has had on the planet, and ensure we continue to aggressively work to keep the world clean and sustainable for future generations.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: As we all fight to stay healthy and safe during this global pandemic, I continue to see a rising sense of hope and optimism. Visiting Kokomo, IN to mark the start of mass production of the Ventec Life Systems VOCSN critical-care ventilators with Christopher Kiple gave me an overwhelming sense of pride. In my almost 40-year career at General Motors, this moment rises to the top as one I will never forget. In such a short period of time, we’ve come together to support the greater good and it truly is our GM team at our best.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Incredibly proud of the General Motors team for delivering the first round of masks to local hospitals this week. Employees led this initiative, with more than 1,000 volunteers producing and hand delivering over 50,000 masks. To meet the overwhelming demand for face masks, we’ll be helping other manufacturers ramp up their own production with our GM suppliers. Thank you to our healthcare professionals, governments, communities, individuals and our employees who are work together to fight the #COVID pandemic. We are in this together and we will overcome this together.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: It’s truly incredible what we can accomplish in a short period of time when we rally together. I’m so proud of the entire General Motors team coming together to support those impacted by #COVID. Here, Mary Barra and I are at our Warren, MI facility where in less than seven days, the team took the mask idea from concept to production. And by next week, we’re expected to deliver 20,000 masks to frontline workers. Once the line is running at full speed in early April, it will be able to produce up to 50,000 masks every day – or up to 1.5 million masks a month. https://bit.ly/2JwVQN9

Name: Mary Barra
Text: As we all come to terms with this global pandemic and how it is changing our own lives and the livelihoods of those around us, there are resounding reminders that we can and always will do what it takes, in any crisis, to come out stronger on the other end.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: In our lifetime, most of us haven’t encountered something like the coronavirus. As an employer, our first responsibility is to our people and our communities. We will suspend production in our North American manufacturing operations, evaluating each facility’s condition on a weekly basis to ensure a systematic and orderly approach. As a major employer and a manufacturer deemed by the Department of Homeland Security to be part of the Critical Manufacturing Sector, we are doing our best to maintain economic stability, while taking steps to prevent the spread of the virus. As soon as it’s appropriate to reopen our facilities, we will do so. We’re also stepping up to help customers however we can. Working directly with customers and through our dealerships, we are offering flexible payment arrangements and extensions, OnStar Crisis Assist services, and in-vehicle WiFi data to help keep customers connected. We’ll continue pulling the levers we can to ensure that customers – particularly those in critical professions – are able to continue providing vital services. My message to employees at this time is to stay connected: over-communicate, and then communicate some more. Even while social distancing, we are all in this together, and we will get through it together.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: As the coronavirus evolves, we’re asking General Motors employees who can work remotely from home to do so. For those who can’t, we’re taking every precaution to ensure their safety. We know how critical our vehicles, parts and services are to our customers, particularly in such extraordinary times, and we’re focused on navigating the situation responsibly.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: #IWD2020 is an important day to raise awareness against unconscious bias and take action for equality. We continue to believe that employees’ gender should not factor into any compensation decisions, and we work to ensure everyone in the company has an opportunity to broaden their skills and advance. I am grateful for the opportunities General Motors has provided me to become the company’s first female CEO, and I am committed to helping this trend become the norm.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: This week was filled with momentum, excitement and dedication and I’m so proud of our General Motors team. We met with hundreds of employees, dealers, investors, analysts, media and policymakers to share our multi-brand, multi-segment #EV strategy with economies of scale that rival our full-size truck business. Electric vehicles will make the world a better place today and for generations to come. And, at GM, we intend to play a lead role in creating a zero-emissions future. https://lnkd.in/eaRR8Qc

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Attended my first RSA Security Conference yesterday. Huge learnings for everyone and I spoke to how #cybersecurity is critical to the future of the automotive industry. Our vehicles are only going to become more connected, and we need to make sure their data – and our customers’ personal information – stays safe, secure and private. Thanks to the RSA team for hosting me and for all the work they do to encourage and inspire future generations to take on increasingly critical roles in cybersecurity. Backstage, I got a chance to chat with #RSAC Senior Director and General Manager Linda Gray Martin about the pipeline of talent and more. Please forgive the sound quality; the conference’s energy was high and so was the volume!

Name: Mary Barra
Text: My message for all young women today for #IntroduceAGirlToEngineeringDay: you can be and do anything!

Name: Mary Barra
Text: We believe that climate change is real and are driven by this belief to create an all-electric, zero-emissions future. We are establishing a new set of key goals and publicly committing to meet even more ambitious targets to help us get there. There is already incredible work underway at General Motors and we will continue to make the right decisions and take the right actions to ensure a brighter future for generations to come.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: What an exciting day. Today marks one more step forward in our journey to zero emissions. Congrats to the team!

Name: Mary Barra
Text: At General Motors, we see an all-electric future, and in 2020, we expect big strides from our industry to help us move closer to a world with zero emissions. With the development of new EVs, including battery-electric pick-up trucks, the auto industry will continue to evolve personal and shared transportation – making it cleaner, quieter and more convenient. We’ll see infrastructure advancements making it easier than ever to charge at any station in any setting by continuing to expand options where you live, work, and play. #bigideas2020

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Becoming a better leader is a goal you never quit work towards. I’ve had some wonderful opportunities this past year to grow as a #leader, and I’m excited to share with you what I learned!#IWorkForGM

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Becoming a better leader is a goal you never quit work towards. I’ve had some wonderful opportunities this past year to grow as a #leader, and I’m excited to share with you what I learned!#IWorkForGM

Name: Mary Barra
Text: We’re focused on improving our vehicles in every way. Our earlier investment of over $1.4-billion, part of General Motors $5 billion investment in U.S production of new, full-size pickups and SUVs, will allow our Arlington Assembly Plant to become more efficient and maintain the highest possible quality of the all-new 2021 @Chevrolet Tahoe and Suburban. Thanks to all the #manufacturing team members at Arlington that have helped bring these new vehicles to market. #IWorkForGM

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Congratulations to the entire team on redesigning two industry-leading vehicles. The redesigned SUVs are a product of listening to customer feedback and demand and I’m excited to see them on the roads next year. We will continue to grow in our core business, which includes SUVs, trucks and cross-overs, while we balance creating lineups for the future of mobility.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: At General Motors, we believe the future is all-electric. We’re work hard toward this future by investing more in electric vehicles in the next five years than gas fuel cars and by developing new models to meet the demands for every customer. However, there are still major barriers to general acceptance of EVs. Range anxiety is the biggest concern, with cost and convenience closely following. My colleague and President of GM, Mark Reuss, discusses how we're breaking down these barriers to enable widespread EV adoption with CNN.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: I recently (re)joined GM's EV Infrastructure Team and excited to share all the great work being done by the team. #generalmotors #electricvehicles #evcharging

Name: Mary Barra
Text: This morning at GM, we kicked off our sixth Global Safety Week, an annual event where we collectively reaffirm our commitment to ensure all employees, contractors, suppliers and visitors who enter our facilities return home safely, every day. When our employees are safe, customers benefit as well, from improved product quality and manufacturing efficiency. Keeping our customers safe begins in our own house, with our own workforce.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Every day, we are moving closer to a world with zero crashes. This report reflects the progress of our team to develop advanced safety features that result in safer roads.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Today we shared our 2019 Q2 results. Our performance demonstrates the earning power of our full-size trucks franchise, with more upside to come. We will continue operating our business with discipline and the vision to deliver a stronger future for our employees, customers and shareholders. https://lnkd.in/e27Bm8D

Name: Mary Barra
Text: By training, I’m an engineer. Diploma in hand, when I started at General Motors, it’s what I thought I’d do for my entire career. I’ve ended up with jobs in manufacturing, product development, human resources, communications and other departments. With every role, I’ve gained a better, deeper understanding of an extremely complex business. All of that learning feeds into my job today.As in any walk of life, until you stand in a different set of shoes, it’s hard to appreciate both the challenges and opportunities ahead. As you consider career options, prioritize organizations that emphasize learning and are deliberate in their approach to professional development. You always want to be with a company that wants you to grow just as much as you do!

Name: Mary Barra
Text: I had the pleasure of meeting Dr. Mae Jemison at our 2020 Chevrolet Corvette Stingray reveal where she shared her powerful advice for aspiring leaders: we have endless things yet to learn, don’t hold back because of fear. Take the time to look up. Be willing to explore and learn.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Great discussion at Stanford University Graduate School of Business while visiting Laura Arrillaga-Andreessen’s Women in Leadership class. All leaders face challenges, but Laura’s focus is on helping female leaders navigate additional obstacles – whether institutional, economic or cultural. It’s both inspiring and encouraging to watch these students shape their leadership paradigms in a way that emphasizes social value and empowers others, particularly those who have traditionally been disenfranchised. And very exciting to see more men in the class each year – as Laura says, they are our allies!

Name: Mary Barra
Text: In today’s world, it is crucial to build a culture of innovation. To be able to succeed and survive, we need to continuously work fast, try new ideas – sometimes fail – and try again. I sat down with General Motors Vice President of Innovation, Pamela Fletcher to discuss how to break through and make change in an industry through innovation.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Detroit is hosting the FIRST Robotics championship this week and I met with the 2018 champs, Team Rush 27. The skills they are learning will set them up for success in any career path they decide to take. It truly is impressive! Wishing Team Rush 27 and all the competing teams the best of luck this weekend.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Today we continue the conversation about what needs to be done to ensure equal pay for equal work for every job and title. A deep, diverse talent pool that better reflects our customers will be critical to delivering the future of mobility. To develop tomorrow’s leaders, we are focused on providing equal opportunities today.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: We believe in an all-electric, Zero Emissions future. Today, we took another step in that direction by announcing a new Chevrolet EV that will be produced at our Orion Assembly Plant in Michigan, adding 400 jobs and committing to $1.8 billion of investment in our U.S. manufacturing operations across six states. Where we see growth opportunities, we will continue to invest. Proud to bring these jobs and investment to the U.S.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: In honor of #InternationalWomensDay, we asked influential women across industries what their 1 Big Thing is for this year.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Young women entering the workforce often ask me for advice, and a valuable approach I’ve taken in my career is to think of it as a tree, not a straight line. There are a number of branches and paths you can follow, each an opportunity worth embracing, so don’t cut them off too early. Progress isn’t always lateral, so even if there are unfamiliar aspects of a position, conquering them and widening your experience can advance you into leadership. #WomenAtWork #BalanceforBetter

Name: Mary Barra
Text: International Women’s Day is nearing, and it’s a day that drives important conversation around critical issues. In recognition of the day, LinkedIn’s #WomenAtWork series asked how I received my big break. I can tell you I wouldn’t be sitting where I am today without the support from my family and mentors. Because I had a support system that believed in me, I was able to become the first female to run engineering at General Motors and the first woman to run an American auto company. I believe that every single girl in America should have that same opportunity.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Safe deployment of self-driving vehicles is a huge technical challenge - but the scale of the opportunity matches the scale of the task. Connected, electric, self-driving vehicles will help unlock safer roads, cleaner air, and less time spent in traffic. The newest generation of battery electric vehicles that we’re rolling out in Cadillac is one more step towards that future. In my chat with NYSE's Betty Liu, we discuss the opportunity to redefine transportation, our mission and strategy, and the pressure to move quickly.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: It was great to be in Arlington, TX with our CFO Dhivya Suryadevara and our Global Head of Manufacturing Alicia Boler Davis. You don’t need to come from a manufacturing background like Alicia and me to appreciate the sight of an assembly plant running 24 hours, with three shifts of workers, building nearly 1,200 vehicles a day. The full-size SUVs produced at Arlington are part of the lifeblood of our economy and will be for many years to come. With every model that gets safer, smarter and more fuel efficient, we get closer to our vision for a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion. Days like this – spent on the plant floor and hearing from employees – are some of my favorite days on the job.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: I’d fill in the blank with “essential.” We have 30,000 forward-thinking engineers at General Motors who are the force behind the scenes, creating solutions for mobility at scale. Whether it's the tech behind our Corvettes, pickups, or AVs, these engineers are bringing us closer to our self-driving, all-electric and connected vision for the world.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Our engineers are many things: collaborative, hard work, creative and brilliant. How would you fill in the blank? Follow along during #EngineersWeek as we highlight different engineers and the work they do to help make the world a better place! #EWeek2019

Name: Mary Barra
Text: It was great to be in Arlington, TX with our CFO Dhivya Suryadevara and our Global Head of Manufacturing Alicia Boler Davis. You don’t need to come from a manufacturing background like Alicia and me to appreciate the sight of an assembly plant running 24 hours, with three shifts of workers, building nearly 1,200 vehicles a day. The full-size SUVs produced at Arlington are part of the lifeblood of our economy and will be for many years to come. With every model that gets safer, smarter and more fuel efficient, we get closer to our vision for a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion. Days like this – spent on the plant floor and hearing from employees – are some of my favorite days on the job.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Our full-year report is a reflection of our commitment to our strategy to lead in both our core business and the future of mobility. We will build off of this momentum in 2019, fully committed to our vision for a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion.See our full-year earnings report: https://lnkd.in/eY5qVHt

Name: Mary Barra
Text: How do you give tough feedback?  Feedback is key to continuous innovation.  As Mary Barra, Chairman & CEO of General Motors, transforms this iconic company into a technology company, it’s one of the tools in her leadership toolkit. In this 1 minute video, she shares her advice on how to give and receive feedback.  We captured this impromptu video after Mary spoke in the Distinguised Speaker Series in our Duke University - The Fuqua School of Business.And sharing good news! This week, LinkedIn announced its Global Top Influencers Voices list, recognizing 20 leaders who are shaping the conversations on business, economy, and the leadership.  Proud to be recognized on this list with Mary.  We are all excited to continue to share insights and ideas that can transform the way we work. #InfluencertoInfluencer #LinkedInTopVoices #leadership cc Daniel Roth, Caroline Fairchild, Ashley Peterson, Muna Hamza

Name: Mary Barra
Text: I’m proud to be included with this inspiring group of people. It’s a privilege to share topics I’m passionate about and I’m always inspired by the responses and feedback. Thank you all for following along! #LinkedInTopVoices

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Just left the stage at #CityLabDetroit from a great discussion with The Atlantic’s David Bradley. We covered many important topics, but if there’s one thing to takeaway, it’s General Motors’s vision for a better world.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Today, we submitted a proposal for a National Zero Emission Vehicle program to the Administration. A single, 50-state solution will help move the U.S. to a leadership position in electrification, and will help create jobs, improve the environment and make electric vehicles more affordable. The stakes are high, and time is short.

Name: Mary Barra
Text: Today, and every day, my colleagues and I raise our hands to encourage young girls around the world to pursue their dreams. The support of my family and mentors helped guide me to where I am today, and I hope these words of encouragement will inspire you to follow your passions, too. #DayOfTheGirl

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: We shouldn't underestimate the pace of changes taking place today. Banking was already being transformed before COVID, but the pandemic has accelerated digital adoption. At Grupo Santander, 44% of our sales is now on digital channels, up from 36% a year ago. Technology is driving down cost of service, big data is enhancing the customer experience, while Big Tech and other players are entering financial services. So the market is changing fast. Last week at our International Banking Conference,  Francisco D'Souza - who I'm delighted has recently joined Santander, Dan Schulman and Nuria Oliver, PhD discussed with James Harding the outlook of financial services with a focus on payments, platforms and their impact on people. The challenge is to build trust and loyalty while offering convenience. Banks have the ability to deliver, particularly in what Frank calls ‘slow money’ (savings, investment, physical assets) thanks to long-term customer relationships built on loyalty. Santander is also competing in the ‘fast money’ landscape (daily expenditures, current checking accounts, etc,) investing in digitalization so we can use our scale to compete.Enjoy the debate here: https://lnkd.in/dJ6S-yD

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: One of the early things we did as the COVID pandemic unfolded was to engage in conversations with governments and central banks around the world as they were thinking about how to efficiently send stimulus payments to their constituents. What became clear through those conversations was that the shift to digital forms of currencies is inevitable, bringing with it clear advantages in terms of financial inclusion and access; efficiency, speed and resilience of the payments system; and the ability for governments to disburse funds to citizens quickly. Today, we announced the first steps on our journey to help facilitate the understanding, redemption and interoperability of these new instruments of exchange. We’re starting by introducing the ability to buy, hold and sell cryptocurrency directly within the PayPal digital wallet. Early next year, we plan to significantly increase cryptocurrency’s utility by making it available as a funding source for purchases at our 26 million PayPal merchants worldwide. We are eager to work with central banks and regulators around the world to offer our support, and to meaningfully contribute to shaping the role that digital currencies will play in the future of global finance and commerce.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Congratulations to Julie Sweet and Mary Barra and the incredible women on Fortune's 2020 Most Powerful Women list. I'm inspired by each of you and humbled to be in your company. Together, we’ll continue to work toward a future full of possibilities for the women and girls who follow.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Congratulations to Julie Sweet and Mary Barra and the incredible women on Fortune's 2020 Most Powerful Women list. I'm inspired by each of you and humbled to be in your company. Together, we’ll continue to work toward a future full of possibilities for the women and girls who follow.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: I was thrilled to speak with my friend John Hope Bryant at this year’s HOPE Global Forum hosted by Operation HOPE. At the start of my session, we shared a video about Cameron Kirkland, owner of Cam Kirk Studios—a creative studio based in Atlanta.  Cam opened the studio to create a safe haven for artists and to nurture the rising Atlanta creative community. But earlier this year when the pandemic hit, he was forced to temporarily close his studio—which not only affected his bottom line, but also eliminated creative resources that many artists depended on to make a living. To help relieve some of his financial stress, Cam applied for PayPal’s Empowerment Grants for Black Businesses program and was selected as a recipient. He said the grant made him feel recognized: “As an entrepreneur, you can feel like it’s you against the world, but to know that a company like PayPal actually has your back and supports you is an amazing thing.” This challenging year has led all of us to lose our sense of hope at times, but I’m encouraged that these grants are restoring optimism for small businesses. More on Cam’s story here: https://lnkd.in/g_TFdMN

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Given the similarities in our businesses and vision, PayPal's partnership with Mercado Libre was a no brainer. And as the co-founder of the largest online commerce and payments ecosystems in Latin America, Marcos Galperin was a natural fit for my next episode of #NeverStandStill.  I’m constantly inspired by Marcos, who grew an idea in business school in 1999 to the massive eCommerce platform MercadoLibre is today. Over 20 years ago, he believed in the power of the internet to fill a clear need in Latin America—despite classmates telling him that his idea would never work. His perseverance and deep belief in the importance of universal access to financial services often inspire me, and I was honored to have Marcos join me on the show. Our full conversation will publish later this week.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Just finished reading Getting There by Gillian Zoe Segal. Thanks to Nitin Prabhu for the recommendation. It is a set of short stories of 30 successful leaders and their journey of focus, obstacles, overcoming, and resilience on their path to success. Strengthens my belief that success when deconstructed, highlights a journey of learning, deep self-discovery, and growth. #books

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: I’m excited to feature Amy Arora, a PayPal alumna and current director of corporate development at Google, as the next guest in my #RisingLeaders series. Amy has spent time at some of the world’s largest corporations, including IBM, Nike, Boeing, PayPal and Google, where she’s excelled in not only her career, but also through her support and empowerment of women leaders in the workplace. I’m inspired by her motivation that’s pushed her to grow professionally and I know she’ll serve as a role model for young leaders in the tech industry for years to come.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: I had the great pleasure of speaking to my friend Ana Botín, executive chairman of Banco Santander and a true role model for responsible leadership. As the fourth generation in her family to serve as executive chairman of Banco Santander, Ana is admirably transparent about her privilege and her sense of responsibility to use that privilege to contribute to society. From work in partnership with the government to help efficiently distribute resources during the COVID pandemic, to helping people and businesses do well using Santander’s services every day, Ana embodies what it means to be a values-driven leader who gives back. Ana and I always look to each other for counsel and wisdom, and I am so glad to share some of hers with each of you here. Here’s some of what I took away from our conversation.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: PayPal is “a radically different company” than it was five years ago, according to CEO Dan Schulman. Under his leadership, PayPal has become one of the most successful tech companies in the world. He joins Charles Trevail on the Outside In podcast to talk about why profit and purpose should never be at odds, and why being a “customer champion” means sometimes going against your own business model to do what’s right for customers. https://lnkd.in/d-dYCQu

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: The Forbes #JUST100 list recognizes companies doing right by all their stakeholders—workers, customers, communities, the environment and shareholders—as defined by the American public. I’m humbled that PayPal has been named to that list again this year ranking #26 overall and #1 in the Commercial Support Services industry.  In celebration of this honor, I had the pleasure of joining my friend Paul Tudor Jones II of JUST Capital at the Forbes JUST 100 Virtual Summit for a discussion on our recently announced Worker Financial Health Initiative. If we come together as a business community to ensure that all of our employees are not just surviving, but actually thriving, the collective impact companies can have is huge. Congratulations to all the companies named to this year’s #JUST100 list!

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Mixing #business and #socialjustice isn’t a strategy most companies are willing to adopt, which is why Dan Schulman actions as CEO of PayPal have garnered so much attention. In 2016, he canceled a plan for an operations center in North Carolina after the state passed its infamous “bathroom bill.” Schulman champions his “employee first” strategy and has raised wages and benefits for PayPal’s workforce. His leadership has proved that #activism doesn't have to come at the cost of PayPal’s bottom line. Listen to the full interview at luminary.link/guy

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Ever so often in business you meet someone whom you immediately see eye to eye with as you share the same world view. Dan Schulman, Paypal's CEO, is one such person. We both agree that businesses need to deliver to shareholders in the right way to be sustainable.Grupo Santander and PayPal share a common mission: we want to bring more people into the financial system and help them bank responsibly, so all can share in economic progress. We don’t want anyone to be left behind in the digital economy. Profit with purpose: it’s becoming a bit of a cliche - but that’s a good thing, as it might mean that more people are beginning to see this approach as normal or, better still, as something we expect of businesses.Watch my interview with Dan here: https://lnkd.in/dYHpmyg#NeverStandStill

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: In recognition of National Disability Employment Awareness Month in October and World Mental Health Day today, I’d like to highlight a valuable member on our Global Talent Acquisition team, Ann Marie Hawryluk (she/her). Ann Marie is a Navy veteran who suffered injuries while on active duty. She had multiple reconstructive surgeries that restored her ability to walk and she ran half marathons until degeneration prevented this. Not to be stopped, she now finds her outlet in adaptive outdoor activities. I deeply admire her resilience in overcoming a hardship that not only takes a heavy toll on the human body physically, but also mentally.  Among others, Ann Marie is a core member of Thrive, a PayPal employee resource group (ERG) for employees with disabilities (invisible & visible). She’s leading several initiatives focused on enhancing our D&I recruitment practices to ensure we’re creating a workplace that’s inclusive of everyone and helping people feel safe enough to share their full identity at work. As someone who has two children who are neurodiverse, Ann Marie wants people to know that Thrive is for people with visible and nonvisible disabilities, including neurodiversity and mental health.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Having a meeting that’s uninterrupted by something happening at home is so 2019. In 2020, many of us are now dealing with the balancing time between personal time and office hours, it can get taxing. The #pandemic and work from home have taught us to become more tolerant and understanding of issues that people face while work from home. So, if a toddler of my co-worker starts crying in the middle of a presentation, no one frowns - it almost comes as a welcome respite. Personally, staying connected and talking to people helps me stay motivatedRead more about my work schedule, learnings and how we have continued to stay connected in my interview with ET Panache - https://lnkd.in/erT9g9k#Leadership #COVID #WorkFromHome

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Last year, PayPal launched a comprehensive Employee Financial Wellness Initiative after discovering that many of our team members were struggling financially. Given we were already paying employees at or above market rates, we knew the problem extended beyond PayPal. And our own experience of conducting an employee financial health assessment and providing solutions to boost our workforce’s financial health meant we had valuable insights to share with other companies so they could do the same.  Through our recently-announced partnership with JUST Capital, and in collaboration with the Financial Health Network and Good Jobs Institute, we’ve launched a Worker Financial Wellness Initiative to make employees’ financial health a priority for other C-suite leaders. We hope the tools and research stemming from this initiative will serve as an essential resource for companies to understand the financial vulnerability of their workforces and prioritize making essential changes. We’ve witnessed firsthand the impact these efforts can have on employees and the businesses they work for, and I’m confident that we can build a more resilient workforce by paying them the wages they need for a more financially secure future. https://nyti.ms/34xaZYZ

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: PayPal and Grupo Santander share a similar mission, work to build a financial system that embraces all citizens and allows everyone to be part of the digital economy. Throughout Ana Botín’s career, she has created various initiatives that drive financial inclusion, and has also embedded it into the culture at Santander—a company that’s been around for more than 160 years. She told me that Santander aspires to have a culture that “combines the wisdom of age with the spirit of youth” and she knows, as I do, that companies perform better for their shareholders when doing good is part of a company’s core business strategy. #NeverStandStillWatch our full conversation here: https://lnkd.in/g_az_eN

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Last week, we at the Aspen Institute Business & Society Program honored 9 business courses from around the world with the Ideas Worth Teaching Award. I was thrilled to kick off the (virtual) celebration with a discussion with Kerwin K. Charles, Dean of my alma mater, the Yale School of Management, and Dan Schulman, President and CEO of PayPal, about what managers of the future need to lead. I wrote about some key takeaways from that session and new research on changing expectations of business leaders.#IWTAwards #businesseducation #bized #socialimpact#leadership #ceo #valuesmatter

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Last week, we at the Aspen Institute Business & Society Program honored 9 business courses from around the world with the Ideas Worth Teaching Award. I was thrilled to kick off the (virtual) celebration with a discussion with Kerwin K. Charles, Dean of my alma mater, the Yale School of Management, and Dan Schulman, President and CEO of PayPal, about what managers of the future need to lead. I wrote about some key takeaways from that session and new research on changing expectations of business leaders.#IWTAwards #businesseducation #bized #socialimpact#leadership #ceo #valuesmatter

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Throughout the pandemic, public and private sector organizations around the world have been work together to help people more quickly than they would have been able to on their own. At PayPal, we saw this firsthand when we worked with the U.S. government to disburse Paycheck Protection Program loans and individual stimulus checks quickly to people in need.In my latest #NeverStandStill conversation, Grupo Santander Executive Chairman Ana Botín and I discussed the power of partnerships like these, how they’ve helped fast track solutions to the people that need them most, and how we see these partnerships becoming more common in the future. Keep an eye out for our full conversation publishing later this week.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: It’s clear that capitalism needs an upgrade. Employers have a responsibility to pay their workers a living wage. This is not only the right thing to do, but has long-term benefits, since decreasing employees’ financial stress fosters a more engaged and innovative workforce. I’ve made the financial health of PayPal employees a personal priority, launching our own employee financial health program to make sure our employees are able to focus on serving our customers. I’m excited to partner with my friends Martin Whittaker and Paul Tudor Jones II at JUST Capital to bring this effort beyond PayPal’s walls. We’re announcing a new initiative to help other companies conduct a Worker Financial Wellness Assessment – something I found was a critical first step to understanding the current financial state of my workforce and how to make tangible, often life-changing improvements. We’ll also be collaborating with Jennifer Tescher at Financial Health Network and the Good Jobs Institute to give CEOs the resources and counsel to undertake this assessment. Together, with this comprehensive resource guide, we can help establish new financial standards for the employees that power our economy. Read more in The New York Times with Lauren Hirsch: https://nyti.ms/36FGjrc

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Increased access to financial education is critical to enabling and furthering the financial health and wellbeing of individuals and communities around the globe. Many young aspiring professionals still lack basic access to the resources, workplace experiences and mentors needed to launch their careers, and this disparity contributes to long-term economic inequality while leaving tremendous potential untapped. PayPal has made an ongoing commitment to support nonprofit organizations that are work effectively to address this opportunity divide, which is why we are partnering with Code Nation, PIVOTAL and Year Up to extend the reach of their critical work and drive meaningful social impact in the San Jose community. https://lnkd.in/dcA_3HJ

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: I had the opportunity to join a longtime friend Julius Young Jr. at Wells Fargo for a conversation with their Government and Institutional Banking division and their clients about the unique challenges all organizations, including the government and public sector face as more transactions move digital in the midst of the pandemic. Julius had a great anecdote of opting to see his doctor via telemedicine which required his first digital payment medical co-pay. We discussed how consumers demand a safe and trusted solution for digital payments. Additionally, how PayPal was proud to support our customers when they needed us the most throughout the pandemic including work with the U.S. government on the Payment Protection Program small business loans and digital stimulus check initiatives. Julius and team, thank you for having me!

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: I’m so excited to officially unveil the Venmo Credit Card today. This was an amazing process involving countless hours of hard work and creativity from our teams and our partners at Synchrony and Visa. It’s so great to see this incredibly unique card come to life. We’re delighted to provide the Venmo community this new way to use Venmo to spend, manage finances, earn customized rewards and split transactions with friends. The Venmo Credit Card is a natural extension of the Venmo experiences our customers already know and love. This is a one of a kind credit card that will make Venmo a more important part of our customers’ every day lives.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: I’m so excited to officially unveil the Venmo Credit Card today. This was an amazing process involving countless hours of hard work and creativity from our teams and our partners at Synchrony and Visa. It’s so great to see this incredibly unique card come to life. The Venmo Credit Card is a natural extension of the Venmo experiences our customers already know and love. This is a one of a kind credit card that will make Venmo a more important part of our customers’ every day lives.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: I’m excited for the engaged Venmo community to gain another option for managing finances. Today marks a significant day in Venmo’s history with the launch of its first-ever Venmo Credit Card, issued by Synchrony and backed by Visa. Over the years, I’ve watched Venmo grow into an incredible platform that enables personalized and accessible financial services. The Venmo community is not just getting a new credit card – they’re getting an easier way to access their financial statements, split money with friends, and earn money back in the categories where they spend the most. Select users can now apply for the card, which will be rolling out to customers over the next few months. Congratulations to Darrell Esch for his leadership at Venmo and thanks to our partners at Synchrony and Visa for helping us bring this to life.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: I’m happy and deeply humbled to share that my course ‘Future of Work’ is the recipient of 2020 Ideas Worth Teaching Award by the Aspen Institute Business and Society Program. The Aspen Institute, I’m thankful that you have considered my course for this prestigious honor. Thank you for recognizing the intent and worth of ‘Future of Work’.An equally distinguished discussion panel during the opening ceremony of the awards event. The discussion between Kerwin K. Charles and Dan Schulman was thought-provoking and enriching. It highlighted the theme of being Leaders by choice; discussing influences, serendipity, thoughts, business & society and choices. Kudos to the efforts put in by the Aspen Team to manage the  journey of this award from nomination till the closing ceremony in a beautiful manner. I extend my thanks to Jaime Bettcher, Claire Preisser, Judy Samuelson, Zach Moo Young  and other Team Aspen members. A very big thank you and deep gratitude towards Ahmedabad University, the top management and well-wishers. Link: https://lnkd.in/dGgfmzP#IWTAwards #FutureOfWork #leadership #AspenInstitute #businesseducation #2020IdeasWorthTeachingAward #IdeasWorthTeachingAward #businessandsociety

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Synchrony is powered by people, including our thousands of incredible partners! As we share details of our new Venmo credit card, backed by Visa, I want to personally thank the PayPal, Venmo and Synchrony teams and, of course, Dan Schulman for your continued trust and partnership. We could not be more appreciative of the opportunity to serve the growing Venmo community! http://gosyf.com/venmo20

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Synchrony is powered by people, including our thousands of incredible partners! As we share details of our new Venmo credit card, backed by Visa, I want to personally thank the PayPal, Venmo and Synchrony teams and, of course, Dan Schulman for your continued trust and partnership. We could not be more appreciative of the opportunity to serve the growing Venmo community! http://gosyf.com/venmo20

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Protecting the environment is more closely tied to PayPal's mission than many people realize. We know that the increasing frequency and severity of hurricanes, heatwaves, and wildfires, for example, are made worse by climate change. And we also know that these disasters disproportionately impact vulnerable and underserved communities. As a result, estimates show that 100 million people could be pushed into extreme poverty by 2030 due to climate change—a key problem we’re trying to solve for at PayPal. As part of our #ClimateWeek activities at PayPal last week, I hosted a fireside chat for our employees with my personal friend and President of Repairers of the Breach, Reverend Dr. William J. Barber II. Repairers of the Breach is one of PayPal’s partners in advancing racial equity and social justice, and they are a recent recipient of one of PayPal’s grants for nonprofits. During our time together, Reverend Barber spoke to us about three interconnected justices—economic justice, racial justice, and environmental justice—and how they impact people in America. This was an important conversation in so many ways, and one that has reinvigorated our focus on all three areas. I’d like to graciously thank Reverend Barber for joining us, and here is just a small piece of our discussion.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: 2020 has been a challenging year, with many of us who are work remotely seeing the boundaries blur between work and home. Burnout has become an increasing issue for many employees. McKinsey & Company and Lean In’s 2020 #WomenInTheWorkplace report identifies three groups of women who have faced distinct challenges: work mothers, senior-level women, and Black women. According to this report as many as two million women are considering leaving the workforce. This could lead to fewer women in leadership roles, causing the progress toward gender equality we’ve made in the past several years to be potentially erased.  We cannot let these findings become a trend or reality, and it’s critical that we take immediate action to reverse this trend. For me, this reinforces the importance and relevance of the various employee relief programs PayPal has introduced and expanded in response to COVID. Companies are at a crossroads, and the decisions we make now will shape what the workplace will look like for women in the future.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Listening to Yo-Yo Ma’s music is good for the soul, and so is having a conversation with him. Yo-Yo is a good friend and neighbor of mine, and he was a perfect person to turn to during these extraordinary times to gain some perspective and make sense of the big picture.As someone who played for two U.S. presidents, Leonard Bernstein, and Johnny Carson all before the age of ten, Yo-Yo has always carried experience and wisdom beyond his years. I’m so thrilled to share some of it with all of you on this episode of #NeverStandStill, where Yo-Yo discussed why music is a cultural connector, why he always wears a United Nations pin whenever he performs, and how we can emerge from the pandemic with a mind for long-term thinking. He even played a sample of music for me with the help of Petunia, the nickname he gave to his cello crafted in 1733.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: I’m excited to recognize an integral member of our team at PayPal, Sabrina Flores. Sabrina directly supports me as an Executive Support Technician, and I can say firsthand from work with her that she is fantastic. Sabrina originally joined us through our partnership with Year Up, a nonprofit that empowers young people with professional skills and is a recent recipient of one of PayPal’s grants to nonprofits that are supporting underserved youth in San Jose. After her one-year program with Year Up ended, she stayed with us permanently, now helping to keep our executive team running smoothly and ensure we’re set up for success. She’s said that this is her favorite part of the job: “Being equipped at the forefront of technology to help the senior leadership team continue their workflow without feeling the tug and pull of technological changes.”  Sabrina is also a member of Aliados, our Employee Resource Group for Latinx employees and allies that is leading the kick-off of PayPal’s Latinx Heritage Month celebrations. I’m also happy to say that outside of work, Sabrina purposely detaches from the technology of her day job and enjoys hiking, painting, and photography. Thanks to Sabrina for her years of work at PayPal, and to Year Up for helping us find such great talent.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Continually humbled to be mentioned among this list of impressive women. As we work toward building a more equal world, let’s commit to paving a road full of possibilities for the next generation of Most Powerful Women.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Continually humbled to be mentioned among this list of impressive women. As we work toward building a more equal world, let’s commit to paving a road full of possibilities for the next generation of Most Powerful Women.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: My friend Chris Gardner, who many of you know from his autobiography, “The Pursuit of Happyness,” and Will Smith’s portrayal of him in the major motion picture film of the same title, recently joined me in a fireside chat for our employees to share his story of being a single father who struggled with homelessness before becoming a successful American businessman and philanthropist. During the discussion, Chris shared an inspiring story about the power of humanity and friendship and the role “friends, families, and folks” have to play in addressing issues like financial insecurity and homelessness. PayPal’s mission is to democratize financial services, and accomplishing that mission that starts from within. That’s why when we looked internally and saw some of our own employees were experiencing significant financial hardship, we took a number of measures to help build the financial health of our employees. I am thankful to be able to share part of our discussion with you all today. Thank you, Chris, for speaking with our team!

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Every day, Yo-Yo Ma considers how he can serve those in need by creatively using his platform as a famous cellist. As a humanitarian, a U.N. Peace Ambassador, and Presidential Medal of Freedom recipient, Yo-Yo is a great example that you can have any occupation and still change the world.  During our #NeverStandStill discussion, Yo-Yo Ma reflected on finding his purpose as a musician. He told me, “the world does not need another cellist.” He found a higher calling by leaning into his musical gift to build bridges through music. We need leaders like Yo-Yo, particularly in times like these, who always consider the bigger picture.https://lnkd.in/geg4aZX

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Thank you PayPal for making this possible, this week I met with my inspirational hero Chris Gardner via a fireside hosted by John Rainey . His Biography and the movie "Pursuit of Happyness" has inspired me a lot and contributed to the person I am today. Thank you for sharing your life experience to the world M. Gardner

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: JUST Capital's Chair Paul Jones and PayPal CEO Dan Schulman in CNN today calling for corporations to assess employee financial security as part of their overall commitment to workers. This is what #stakeholdercapitalism looks like in action. Concrete actions driving tangible beneficial outcomes, and 100% consistent with running a great company. Click below to see how you can get involved.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Special thanks to my friend Dan Schulman for speaking with our Synchrony family this week. Always enjoy talking culture and values with someone so passionate and committed to people. Equally appreciate all Dan and PayPal are doing to increase voter participation! #MakeTimeToVote.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: I’m excited to recognize an integral member of our team at PayPal, Sabrina Flores. Sabrina directly supports me as an Executive Support Technician, and I can say firsthand from work with her that she is fantastic. Sabrina originally joined us through our partnership with Year Up, a nonprofit that empowers young people with professional skills and is a recent recipient of one of PayPal’s grants to nonprofits that are supporting underserved youth in San Jose. After her one-year program with Year Up ended, she stayed with us permanently, now helping to keep our executive team running smoothly and ensure we’re set up for success. She’s said that this is her favorite part of the job: “Being equipped at the forefront of technology to help the senior leadership team continue their workflow without feeling the tug and pull of technological changes.”  Sabrina is also a member of Aliados, our Employee Resource Group for Latinx employees and allies that is leading the kick-off of PayPal’s Latinx Heritage Month celebrations. I’m also happy to say that outside of work, Sabrina purposely detaches from the technology of her day job and enjoys hiking, painting, and photography. Thanks to Sabrina for her years of work at PayPal, and to Year Up for helping us find such great talent.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: With new realities businesses face, it’s not enough for CFOs today to think of their roles as just managing cash flows. With the support of tech-driven insights, we have a unique role to play in examining operations in real time to pivot quickly and enable our teams to serve customers in new and agile ways. Thanks to PYMNTS's Karen Webster for giving me the opportunity to discuss how PayPal has been navigating the current environment to continue to support our employees, serve our customers and deliver strong business results.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: The impact of COVID on Black-owned businesses has been especially devastating. This type of deep-seated racial inequity and economic injustice has existed in our country for far too long. In June, PayPal announced a $530 million commitment to empower and support Black and minority owned businesses and their communities and to do our part to help close the racial wealth gap. As an immediate first step, we distributed $10 million in grants to Black-owned small business to help them stabilize and reopen. But beyond immediate funding, we also are committed to strengthening the ecosystem of support for these small businesses. Today, we are announcing the 20 organizations that have been awarded partnership grants by PayPal to help ensure Black-owned businesses have the network of support critical for their long-term success. Small businesses are essential to creating economic opportunity for families and communities. Each of these organizations has a history of high-impact work and we are excited to be partnering with them to further their efforts to empower and strengthen Black-owned businesses. https://lnkd.in/gF3pcEF

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Brian and I had a great discussion with CNBC's Tyler Mathisen and CNBC Events talking about how Synchrony is navigating these unprecedented times by putting people first. Thanks for having us! #CNBCatWork https://gosyf.com/3iXNZbv
