She’s said that this is her favorite part of the job: “Being equipped at the forefront of technology to help the senior leadership team continue their workflow without feeling the tug and pull of technological changes.”  Sabrina is also a member of Aliados, our Employee Resource Group for Latinx employees and allies that is leading the kick-off of PayPal’s Latinx Heritage Month celebrations. I’m also happy to say that outside of work, Sabrina purposely detaches from the technology of her day job and enjoys hiking, painting, and photography. Thanks to Sabrina for her years of work at PayPal, and to Year Up for helping us find such great talent.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: At PayPal, we are dedicated to strengthening our communities in which our employees live and work by partnering with nonprofits whose work closely align with our mission and values. As part of our commitment to expand these partnerships, we have selected Code Nation, PIVOTAL and Year Up to receive $250,000 in grant funding to help in the continuation of their important programs that support underserved youth in our San Jose headquarters community. https://bit.ly/302xHqJ

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: We are six weeks out from #ElectionDay and are coming up on voter registration deadlines across the country. To help ensure everyone has the opportunity to participate in civic engagement and safely cast their ballots – by mail or in person –, PayPal has launched a non-partisan civic action hub to confirm voter registration and share essential state-specific election news and updates. Coming out of #NationalVoterRegistrationDay, make sure that your vote will be counted in November - visit www.PayPal-Votes.com. #PayPalVotes

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: One of Yo-Yo Ma’s philosophies, which I love, is the idea that it isn’t as painful to learn something if you do it incrementally. On #NeverStandStill, he demonstrated this concept in action. With the help of Petunia, the name he gave to his cello, Yo-Yo showed me how he learned his first piece of music on the cello—emphasizing that if we approach situations using incremental pattern recognition, we can construct all the information in the world. With this model, we can all avoid becoming overwhelmed by the big picture and achieve more than we might imagine. Our full conversation can be found here: https://lnkd.in/d5k_WHN

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: I have religiously listened to every episode of How I Built This. Guy Raz's new book (of the same title) brilliantly brings together all of those insights in a handbook for any aspiring entrepreneur or intrapreneur. Yesterday I spoke to Guy about his book, career, and even what #podcast "the king of podcasting" likes the best. I couldn't disagree with his choice. (And thanks to Seema T. for recommending the question!)

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: When we launched PayPal’s Employee Financial Wellness Initiative about a year ago, we set a goal for employees to have a net disposable income (NDI) of at least 20%—a target designed to ensure all employees have enough discretionary income to cover more than just essentials. After instituting significant changes, we’ve made substantial progress. By the beginning of 2021, we estimate that the minimum NDI for employees will be about 16% globally. This is up significantly from our original benchmarks, which were as low as 4% in some cases, despite PayPal paying at or above market rates. And, we’re well on our way to achieving our 20% goal. 50 years ago this month, Milton Friedman published his seminal essay on shareholder primacy. It marked a consequential shift in business philosophy at odds with how I, and many others in business today, see a company’s role in serving all stakeholders while work towards financial returns. Thanks to JUST Capital’s Paul Tudor Jones for joining me in sharing what it could mean for our society if more businesses embrace this approach. The economic impact, particularly for those who’ve historically been marginalized, would be enormous.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: During this extraordinary time, I turned to an old friend for insight and inspiration on #NeverStandStill. Yo-Yo Ma is a world-renowned cellist, but he’s also a humanitarian. His immediate response to the pandemic was to share music with the rest of the world—streaming #SongsofComfort for all to hear while we sheltered in place. But he also shared with me that this period has given him an important opportunity to reflect on how we want to emerge from this pandemic as a better society in the long-term. You can listen to our full conversation later this week.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: As we step into #ClimateWeek, I’m pleased to announce that PayPal is taking the next step in our commitment to address climate change. We have joined the Business Ambition for 1.5C, pledging to align our Science-Based Target to the climate imperative that global temperature rise does not exceed 1.5 degrees Celsius. Find out more in my blog post.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Nearly one year since announcing PayPal’s Employee Financial Wellness Initiative, we’re seeing the impact of this global program in ways we couldn’t have anticipated at the time of launch. It has been critical to bolstering our employees’ financial and mental well-being during this extraordinary year, and it has given our team members the security they need to innovate and help fuel unprecedented growth for PayPal. As a result, we’ve been able to further our customers’ and merchants’ financial security globally at a critical time.  I’m so proud to see this work recognized beyond our organization and am hopeful that this helps inspire and encourage other companies to prioritize employees as their most important constituency. Thank you to Fortune for recognizing PayPal on this year’s #ChangetheWorld list.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: While we grieve today the passing of a hero - my hero - Ruth Bader Ginsberg, I celebrate her life and many accomplishments. Everything she did to help women advance in the legal profession was one of the reasons I wanted to pursue the law and to advocate for women in the field. But her influence and wisdom had even greater impact. I’m reflecting on two of my favorite RBG quotes:"I would like to be remembered as someone who used whatever talent she had to do her work to the very best of her ability.""You can disagree without being disagreeable."She inspired so many to stand up for what they believe in, for equality. RBG, you have inspired millions to continue on the trail you blazed. Rest In Peace, notorious and legendary RBG. History has had its eyes on you.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: In 2018, PayPal came together with Levi Strauss & Co. and Patagonia to determine how to best support and promote civic engagement within our employee communities and across our nation. Nearly two years later and leading into this year’s election cycle, our #TimeToVote coalition has expanded in reach and impact, hitting an important milestone. As of this week, more than 1,000 companies have committed their support to dedicated time off for employees to participate in civic engagement on #ElectionDay. I’m so inspired and encouraged by this great movement to ensure that no American should have to face the difficult decision of whether to vote or earn a paycheck. I believe democracy only works when everyone has an opportunity to exercise their right to vote. #PayPalVotes

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: “Until you walk in somebody else's shoes, it's hard to moralize or to just say, somebody should do more or less.” This is just one of the insights on seeing people in 3D from Dan Schulman of PayPal, the first guest on my new podcast #EMERGEEverywhere. EMERGE Everywhere features leaders from across industries and sectors who bring unique insight into the customers, employees, and communities they serve, and whose approach offers lessons for building an integrated financial health system for all. Take a listen and be sure to subscribe wherever you get your podcasts, as new episodes will be uploaded every other Wednesday.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: I was honored to join my friend and Financial Health Network CEO Jennifer Tescher for the inaugural episode of the #EMERGEEverywhere podcast. She’s asking important questions about financial empathy, inequality, and accountability, which I have made part of our mission at PayPal as we work to be a customer champion company. I’m looking forward to following along as she continues these conversations.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: When I first heard Alphonso David's personal story when he and I met for a fireside chat at PayPal's New York office in February, it was pretty arresting. It makes you sit up a bit straighter when you hear it—partly because of its uniqueness, but mostly because it demonstrates the incredible perseverance Alphonso has shown to get to where he is today.Alphonso truly embodies what it means to get back up after you’ve been knocked down. He brings undeniable conviction, clarity and focus to his role at the Human Rights Campaign, and it was such a pleasure to continue my conversation with Alphonso on #NeverStandStill. In this article, I share some of the key points I took away from our time together.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Having previously served as a civil rights lawyer, Alphonso David understands the importance of changing policy to affect systemic change. In his first year leading the Human Rights Campaign, Alphonso has worked to place an emphasis on advocating for people who are “multiply marginalized” and explained on #NeverStandStill why they’re at greater risk for discrimination.https://lnkd.in/eFPJb_k

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: I'm incredibly excited for Jane Fraser, who will become the first woman to lead a major U.S. bank when she takes over as CEO of Citi next year. Congratulations to Citi on this historic choice, and to Mike Corbat on his well-deserved retirement. Looking forward to continuing our partnership!

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Congratulations to Jane Fraser who will take the reins as Citi’s CEO in February, becoming the first woman to lead a major U.S. bank. An incredible achievement and a huge step forward for women in banking. The PayPal team is proud to continue our partnership under Jane’s leadership!

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Excited to share that PayPal and Visa are expanding their partnership to extend real time access to funds for consumers and small business globally. This expanded partnership will also enable PayPal to extend global white label Visa Direct payout services through PayPal and its Braintree, Hyperwallet and iZettle solutions. During these challenging times, instant access to funds is more critical than ever and we’re excited to be partnering with Visa to deliver this solution to our customers around the world.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: “There’s a recognition that you’ve got to make it easier for people to vote, or at least make sure that they’re not facing an impossible choice. We want to make sure that we give people the flexibility so that they don’t have to make a choice between being able to earn a paycheck that day or being able to vote.” I couldn’t agree more, Franz Paasche. So proud of PayPal’s paid time off on Election Day commitment and our #PayPalVotes initiative to encourage civic engagement for our employees, customers and communities. Well done, Franz and team! #TimeToVote

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Human Rights Campaign President Alphonso David is one of the most inspirational people I know, and I was lucky to have him on #NeverStandStill. As a member of the Black and LGBTQ communities, Alphonso is challenging all of us to think about identity in a more intersectional way than we have historically. Both identities shape who he is at work and in his personal life, and his efforts at the HRC advocate for society and institutions to see people’s whole selves as valuable.Conversations like these continue to inform our efforts at PayPal to ensure employees can not only bring their full identities to work, but also be celebrated and respected for those identities. Many thanks to Alphonso for the important and candid discussion. You can watch our full conversation here: https://lnkd.in/etM5mKd

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: PayPal's Dan Schulman says capitalism needs an upgrade.  Market forces won't create a just society.   https://lnkd.in/eV-zz5e https://lnkd.in/eE6EaXh# #stakeholdercapitalism #leadership

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Businesses are under increasing pressure to take care of all their stakeholders and lead in a world that’s facing multiple crises. As a result, many CEOs are reevaluating the status quo and considering how we can all do better to advocate for the society we want to live in. I’ve shared this perspective for a while now, but this year it has come into focus perhaps more than ever before: Our system of capitalism needs an upgrade—and it’s a moral obligation for business leaders to be part of the solution. My thanks to Alan Murray and Ellen McGirt for hosting me on Fortune's “Leadership Next” podcast to have this important conversation.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: We were in a completely different environment when I met Human Rights Campaign President Alphonso David in February, when he joined me for an in-person fireside chat at PayPal as part of our Black History Month celebrations. I was grateful to continue this conversation on #NeverStandStill and dig even deeper on his life experience, being the first person of color to serve as president of the HRC, and leading the largest LGBTQ civil rights organization in the world—particularly in this tumultuous year. I loved hearing his perspective on how throughout the inevitable challenges he faces, Alphonso finds purpose and builds reserves to draw from when the going gets hard. Tune into our full conversation later this week.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: It was a pleasure to speak to my longtime friend and colleague John Donahoe, president and CEO of Nike and chairman of our board at PayPal, for my latest episode of #NeverStandStill. John recruited me to PayPal almost six years ago and we’ve navigated a lot together.Over the course of his career, John has led many businesses through high-profile transformations. He’s a great businessman, but also an admirable leader. In our conversation, John and I spoke about servant leadership, the power of human potential, what he’s learned from staying home during the COVID pandemic, and more. He even gave us a glimpse into his office where he has murals of the men and women who inspire him to be a better leader.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Being a leader is about adapting, listening and learning. Like many of you, I’ve been adapting to work from home full time and using new technologies to stay connected. I recorded a virtual Never Stand Still episode with PayPal Chairman and Nike CEO John Donahoe, who agreed that leading global companies virtually these past several months has taught us many new leadership lessons. John shared that one of his most profound moments of growth during this period has come from listening to his employees talk about what it’s like to be Black in America, and how Nike can help create a more equitable society. Listen to him reflect on this self-learning. #NeverStandStillhttps://lnkd.in/eFPJb_k

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: The global economic recession has impacted consumers and businesses of all sizes. As a result, businesses are looking for new ways to connect with customers to drive sales, average order values and loyalty without taking on any additional cost or risk, and consumers are looking for more flexible, responsible and interest-free ways to buy the things they want and need now and pay for it over time. As a partner to both consumers and businesses, we’re excited to announce Pay in 4, the newest of PayPal's Pay Later solutions. Pay in 4 can help businesses drive conversion and revenue without paying any additional fees or taking on any additional risk, as businesses get paid up front, while enabling consumers to make a purchase and pay over four, interest-free installments. Learn more about Pay in 4 here.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Businesses and consumers alike have been impacted by the economic recession. As a result, businesses are looking for ways to drive sales, average order values and customer loyalty without taking on any additional risk or cost and consumers are looking for more flexible and responsible ways to buy the things they want and need. To help both our business and consumer customers, we’re excited to announce the newest of our PayPal Pay Later solutions: Pay in 4. This short-term installment offering can help businesses drive conversion and revenue without taking on any additional risk or fees, while enabling consumers to make a purchase and pay over four, interest-free installments. Learn more about Pay in 4 here.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: In today’s challenging retail and economic environment, businesses of all sizes are looking for trusted ways to help drive sales and attract customers, without taking on additional costs. At the same time, consumers are looking for more flexible and responsible ways to pay when they shop. I'm proud to share that PayPal today announced Pay in 4, which builds on our history as the original company to offer a buy now, pay later solution. By combining the buy now, pay later trend with PayPal’s brand ethos, trust, and ubiquity, we are enabling a responsible, flexible way for shoppers to pay while businesses can utilize a tool that drives sales and doesn’t cost anything extra. I recently spoke with Forbes's Jeff Kauflin about our new product and what it means for the industry.  #buynowpaylater #paypal #credit #shoppingonline

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: This year has challenged individuals, businesses, institutions and communities around the world. Our realities have abruptly changed and we’ve worked to strengthen our company community as we adapt to the evolving new normal. Through it all, one thing has remained constant – while physically distanced, we’ve come together to support our friends, family and communities navigating these unprecedented times. We’re now facing another challenge as wildfires across California have had a devastating impact on homes, families, and infrastructure during what is an already difficult time – especially for vulnerable populations. As a company with headquarters in San Jose, this hits home for PayPal and we are work diligently to ensure the safety and security of the members of our employee community, and also work to support our customers and communities in the area. Together with PayPal Giving Fund, we have launched a disaster relief campaign to raise critical funds for organizations work to support wildfire response and relief efforts. We’re extremely grateful to anyone able to contribute to those in urgent need.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: It was a pleasure to join Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts on Bloomberg Live’s Equality segment to discuss the advancement of women in the tech industry. In order to create a diverse and inclusive workforce, it’s critical that organizations take intentional measures to ensure women and people of color have equal opportunity. There are a few actions we can all take to eliminate inequalities within the workplace, particularly within the tech industry:1) By expanding networks when recruiting candidates rather than only looking through an existing rolodex, we can proactively and intentionally diversify candidate pools to find the best talent. 2) Build managers’ skillsets to support women and people of color in their career journeys.3) Create a company culture with inclusion at its core to ensure people throughout the organization have equal opportunities. At PayPal, we’ve required all employees to take conscious inclusion training to bring awareness to our inherent biases, and we’ve focused on achieving pay parity to create a fair workplace for everyone. I’m proud of our progress to create an inclusive culture at PayPal but recognize there’s always going to be more we can do. We remain committed to advancing this important work.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Two years ago, leaders from a diverse group of companies including Levi Strauss & Co., Patagonia, and PayPal came together to determine how the business community could address one of the most pressing issues of our time: increasing voter participation in the U.S. As a result, we launched the Time to Vote movement—a non-partisan coalition dedicated to this effort. In the lead-up to the U.S. general election on November 3, we’ve recently announced that PayPal is providing all U.S. employees four hours of paid time off on Election Day to provide the time and flexibility to vote without conflicting work obligations. And, for those who will be voting early or by mail, they can use this time for other forms of civic engagement, such as volunteering at polling stations. This is one piece of a larger PayPal Votes initiative to build awareness and education on civic engagement. Business leaders must do what they can to ensure employees are able to make their voices heard. To date, over 700 companies have joined our Time to Vote movement, and we hope to reach 1,000 companies by November 3. Please join us at maketimetovote.org.https://lnkd.in/dqXXStB

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Two of the leaders that I most admire, Dan Schulman of PayPal and John Donahoe of Nike, talk about servant leadership, the importance of purpose within an organization, and much more https://lnkd.in/gCxdkHD #leadership

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: PRovoke reveals the 2020 #Influence100! In this first tranche of research, the report profiles all 100 influencers, and looks at their backgrounds, education and the sectors they work in, from FMCG, finance/fintech, industry and healthcare, to entertainment, social media and technology. More details here: https://bit.ly/31xfsLb

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: PRovoke reveals the 2020 #Influence100! In this first tranche of research, the report profiles all 100 influencers, and looks at their backgrounds, education and the sectors they work in, from FMCG, finance/fintech, industry and healthcare, to entertainment, social media and technology. More details here: https://bit.ly/31xfsLb

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: These wildfires hit especially close to home for us at PayPal with our headquarters in San Jose and thousands of our team members living in the surrounding area. PayPal is covering all processing costs for this disaster relief campaign to ensure 100% of donations support charities providing relief and recovery efforts, and we’ll also be matching donations from employees. You can support the effort here: https://lnkd.in/eBdEjF6

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: PayPal Chairman and Nike CEO John Donahoe and I share the perspective that businesses play a critical role in solving important social issues—not just condemning things we see, but driving forward a solution. It’s one of the things we discussed when John first recruited me to PayPal and it came up in our recent #NeverStandStill conversation as well. We both acknowledge that while Nike and PayPal are making strong commitments to diversity and inclusion within our own walls and beyond, the journey never ends and there’s still more work to be done. Watch our full conversation here: https://lnkd.in/eUdXKEm

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: This month marks my five year anniversary of joining the leadership team at PayPal. During that time, I’ve had the pleasure of work closely with our CEO Dan Schulman and seeing his incredible leadership up close. I was excited to have Dan join one of our recent Global Finance & Global Customer Operations team calls to share his perspectives on how leadership has become even more important amid the pandemic. I truly believe that character is revealed when pressure is applied. Dan gave our team some great insight into why that rings truer than ever in the current climate, and I’m glad to be able to share his words of wisdom with you.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: This month marks my five year anniversary of joining the leadership team at PayPal. During that time, I’ve had the pleasure of work closely with our CEO Dan Schulman and seeing his incredible leadership up close. I was excited to have Dan join one of our recent Global Finance & Global Customer Operations team calls to share his perspectives on how leadership has become even more important amid the pandemic. I truly believe that character is revealed when pressure is applied. Dan gave our team some great insight into why that rings truer than ever in the current climate, and I’m glad to be able to share his words of wisdom with you.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: At PayPal, we take our obligation to act as a responsible corporate citizen seriously. One of the ways we work to fulfill this commitment is by enabling our community of employees to exercise their right to vote. Today, I’m proud to share that we’ve launched PayPal Votes: a non-partisan civic action initiative designed to encourage safe participation in the 2020 U.S. Election and to build awareness and education on civic engagement.  As part of this initiative and as a co-founder of #TimeToVote, we’ve extended our commitment to ensure that no one at PayPal has to choose between voting and earning a paycheck. We’re providing U.S. employees with paid time off on Election Day to participate safely in the election and in civic engagement – from voting to volunteering at polling stations.  In the days to come, we will also launch a voter information site for the broader PayPal community to confirm registration information, find essential state-specific election details and sign-up to receive real-time updates as states make changes to their election rules due to COVID - more to come on this. We believe democracy works when everyone has the chance to cast their vote and be counted. #PayPalVotes #YourVoteMatters

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: My good friend and PayPal Chairman John Donahoe took over the helm as president and CEO of Nike at the beginning of the year. I had the chance to catch up with him in the latest episode of #NeverStandStill and we discussed why Nike’s purpose drew him to make the career jump, his definition of the word “athlete,” and the amazing power of human potential. Keep an eye out for our full conversation later this week.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: For my latest Never Stand Still episode, I had the privilege of speaking to Dawn Porter about her and Magnolia Pictures' latest documentary, “John Lewis: Good Trouble”—a film about the civil rights icon, community organizer, and Congressman who dedicated his life to social activism and legislative action. With the issues John Lewis stood for currently at the forefront of our national dialogue, Dawn’s film couldn’t be more timely.I spoke to Dawn several weeks before Congressman Lewis passed away at the age of 80. I’m grateful to be able to share this conversation with you as we honor his legacy, and so you can also get to know Dawn—a force in her own right as an award-winning documentarian.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Thanks to The Cherie Blair Foundation for Women mentoring program that many of us have joined from PayPal ! So impressed by new mentee from Nigeria. What an opportunity to listen, share, break taboos. From Paris to New York to Lagos, I am thrilled to continue supporting women achieve their ambition while they feed mine.If you would like to meet extraordinary women, check out the Foundation’s program and wait for your match !

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: A few days ago, I had the pleasure of speaking with Dan Schulman, PayPal CEO. Dan’s commitment to serving the underserved communities and taking care of his employees is something I strongly admire and look up to. I am so thankful to have had the opportunity to speak with him more about how to uphold core values in business and foster inclusivity both within the company and with our products. Thank you Dan for taking the time to speak with me, and Melissa Aquino and the rest of the University Experience Team for making this conversation possible!Along with this opportunity, I am so thankful for all the other events the  University Experience Team organized to create an engaging internship for me. So many individuals contributed positively to my internship experience, but to name a few, I’d like to thank my manager, Mukundan Narayanan and my mentor Xuetao Li for helping learn how large-scale software systems function at PayPal, and John Huân Vu for providing me mentorship and the opportunity to learn how to launch a PayPal product to new countries through program management. I am so grateful for the opportunity to have worked at PayPal, and I’ve learned so much from everyone I was able to meet! #PayPalIntern

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: A few days ago, I had the pleasure of speaking with Dan Schulman, PayPal CEO. Dan’s commitment to serving the underserved communities and taking care of his employees is something I strongly admire and look up to. I am so thankful to have had the opportunity to speak with him more about how to uphold core values in business and foster inclusivity both within the company and with our products. Thank you Dan for taking the time to speak with me, and Melissa Aquino and the rest of the University Experience Team for making this conversation possible!Along with this opportunity, I am so thankful for all the other events the  University Experience Team organized to create an engaging internship for me. So many individuals contributed positively to my internship experience, but to name a few, I’d like to thank my manager, Mukundan Narayanan and my mentor Xuetao Li for helping learn how large-scale software systems function at PayPal, and John Huân Vu for providing me mentorship and the opportunity to learn how to launch a PayPal product to new countries through program management. I am so grateful for the opportunity to have worked at PayPal, and I’ve learned so much from everyone I was able to meet! #PayPalIntern

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Life throws unexpected curve balls at us, but they may lead to opportunity or clarity of purpose. In our #NeverStandStill conversation, ”John Lewis: Good Trouble” documentarian Dawn Porter shared with me how two major losses in her life eventually led her to follow her passion and become the storyteller she is today.https://lnkd.in/eFPJb_k

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: I joined Jim Cramer on CNBC's Mad Money to talk about our record quarter in Q2 and why PayPal’s services are more relevant than ever before. We discussed one of the most important initiatives from the quarter: PayPal’s $530 million commitment to Black and minority-owned businesses. I see the two going hand-in-hand, where businesses with financial strength have an obligation to step up and join the fight on societal issues. Jim said it well at the end of our chat: “A profitable company that does well for shareholders is also a company that does well for the people who desperately need it.”

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: I’m thrilled to share my #NeverStandStill conversation with Trilogy Films Founder and Filmmaker Dawn Porter, where we discussed her recent Magnolia Pictures documentary, “John Lewis: Good Trouble.” It’s perfectly timed for the moment we’re in today, and a powerful reminder of Lewis’ legacy. In the film, Dawn made the creative decision to capture late Rep. Lewis watching footage of himself as a young civil rights activist—a part of the film that I found particularly moving. When I asked Dawn to share her rationale behind that decision she said, “I wanted him to see what we see.” I loved getting to hear about Dawn’s craft and the care with which she tells other people’s stories. Watch our full conversation here: https://lnkd.in/eTbQ-rhNote: This conversation was recorded before Rep. John Lewis passed away on July 17.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: Bridgett Jeffries owns Café Wakefern, a dog daycare and boarding business that’s run out of her home in Columbus, Ohio. Like many other small businesses across the nation, Bridgett’s business was impacted by the COVID pandemic when she had to shut Café Wakefern down completely in mid-March. Shortly after reopening in May, Bridgett applied for a grant from PayPal's Empowerment Grants for Black Businesses program and was selected to receive the maximum grant amount—what she called “a $10,000 hug”—that will help her keep her business’ doors open.   Keeping her business alive means much more to her beyond making a living, and she hopes to inspire and motivate others to achieve and conquer similar challenges. Bridgett has shown tenacity and resilience during the pandemic and I’m proud that, in partnership with AEO (Association for Enterprise Opportunity), we were able to give her hope and offer support during this uncertain time. https://bit.ly/31EtV6U

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: I had the pleasure of hosting Dawn Porter, an award-winning documentary filmmaker and founder of Trilogy Films, as my guest on #NeverStandStill. When talking to Dawn about her and Magnolia Pictures’ most recent documentary on the late Congressman John Lewis, I was fascinated to learn the personal aspects she gathered about him in her two years producing the film—particularly the strategy behind his efforts alongside other civil rights leaders to dismantle 100 years of segregation. It’s an important reminder that in our efforts to create change, we must balance quick wins with long-term strategy.Stay tuned for our full conversation publishing later this week.

Name: Dan Schulman
Text: “Democracy only works when people vote.” Our CEO, Chip Bergh, urges other business leaders to give their employees #TimeToVote in a new CNN op-ed.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: A huge congratulations to University of California, Berkeley professor and Johnson & Johnson Board of Directors member Jennifer Doudna on winning this year’s Nobel Prize in Chemistry. Dr. Doudna’s stellar accomplishments are a testament to the profound, transformative power of science—as demonstrated by the way the CRISPR gene editing technology she pioneered with fellow awardee Dr. Emmanuelle Charpentier has already powered a quantum leap forward towards a future where disease is a thing of the past. #nobelprize2020 #chemistry

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: When it comes to fighting COVID, no one is safe until everyone is safe. Johnson & Johnson is committed not just to the rapid development of a safe and effective vaccine, but also to ensuring that new medical innovations are accessible globally—so no community or country gets left behind. However, no one entity can end the COVID crisis alone. Culminating months of work with our healthcare peers and the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, I am proud to represent the industry in announcing a new communiqué that formalizes our shared mission to make vaccines, treatments, and diagnostics accessible all around the world. As part of Johnson & Johnson’s commitment, we plan to allocate up to 500 million vaccine doses to lower income countries with delivery beginning mid next year. #COVID #innovateforall Read more:

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: A new Harris poll sponsored by Johnson & Johnson found that 2/3 of Americans have delayed or cancelled medical care in 2020. Great post by our Worldwide Chair for Medical Devices Ashley McEvoy on what it will take to make patients feel comfortable and confident returning to doctors' offices everywhere. #MyHealthCantWait

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: When it comes to fighting COVID, no one is safe until everyone is safe. Johnson & Johnson is committed not just to the rapid development of a safe and effective vaccine, but also to ensuring that new medical innovations are accessible globally—so no community or country gets left behind. However, no one entity can end the COVID crisis alone. Culminating months of work with our healthcare peers and the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, I am proud to represent the industry in announcing a new communiqué that formalizes our shared mission to make vaccines, treatments, and diagnostics accessible all around the world. As part of Johnson & Johnson’s commitment, we plan to allocate up to 500 million vaccine doses to lower income countries with delivery beginning mid next year. #COVID #innovateforall Read more:

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Today, Johnson & Johnson announced the launch of a large-scale, multi-country Phase 3 trial of a single dose of our COVID vaccine candidate. We’re moving forward with optimism, confidence, and an unwavering commitment to upholding the highest ethical and scientific standards.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Today, Johnson & Johnson announced the launch of a large-scale, multi-country Phase 3 trial of a single dose of our COVID vaccine candidate. We’re moving forward with optimism, confidence, and an unwavering commitment to upholding the highest ethical and scientific standards.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Today, Johnson & Johnson announced the launch of a large-scale, multi-country Phase 3 trial of a single dose of our COVID vaccine candidate. We’re moving forward with optimism, confidence, and an unwavering commitment to upholding the highest ethical and scientific standards.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Today, Johnson & Johnson announced the launch of a large-scale, multi-country Phase 3 trial of a single dose of our COVID vaccine candidate. We’re moving forward with optimism, confidence, and an unwavering commitment to upholding the highest ethical and scientific standards.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Revisiting Milton Friedman’s influential essay, I was struck by just how much the business landscape has shifted in the past 50 years—and how clear serving all stakeholders remains to Johnson & Johnson.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Protecting and improving the health of people around the world is nothing new to Johnson & Johnson—it is what we were built to do. The COVID pandemic is the greatest public health crisis of our generation, and from the beginning we have been compelled to use our decade of vaccine development expertise and our innovative vaccine technology to help develop a COVID vaccine. We have held our lifesaving medicines and other products to high standards of science and regulatory review for the last 134 years, and we are unwavering in applying the same rigor to the development of a vaccine for COVID—no matter the speed. That’s why we at Johnson & Johnson are joining our peer organizations today in signing the COVID Vaccine Maker Pledge, which reaffirms our commitment to developing a COVID vaccine that meets high ethical and scientific standards. Learn more: https://bit.ly/2R9i0ZC #WeStandWithScience

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Proud to be partnering with Nancy Brown and the #AHACEORoundtable on this vitally important initiative. By breaking down barriers to accessing flu shots, corporations can continue to protect the health of their employees—and help keep seasonal illness from derailing the progress being made in the fight against COVID.  #ThePointofFluPrevention

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: One year ago, The Business Roundtable redefined the Purpose of a Corporation because we believed it was important to articulate our values, share them with the world, and exemplify the principles in our actions. We could not have known how timely clarifying our commitment to leading our companies for the benefit of all our stakeholders would be ahead of the COVID pandemic, and I’ve been proud to see how the private sector has stepped up — both in helping to address ongoing upheaval and uncertainty, and in continuing to evolve our businesses to be as diverse, equitable, and inclusive as possible. Learn more:

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Yesterday I sent this message to the 135,000+ employees of Johnson & Johnson around the world. Because it is so essential that we all speak out, I want to share it with the wider community as well.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: "Sharing the strategic intent allows people the flexibility to decide where, how, when, and what they need to do to achieve the common objective."Alex Gorsky, CEO of Johnson & Johnson, is a true example of what it means to lead during unprecedented, and challenging, times. The work that Johnson & Johnson is doing to fight #COVID will save many lives and play an incredible role in shaping the #future.  Thank you Alex Gorsky, for sharing your leadership experience on building accountability and responsibility within teams in complex times on Episode 6 of #NoTurningBack. I hope everyone can learn from the work Mr. Gorsky and his teams are doing.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Today at Johnson & Johnson we announced that we have selected a lead vaccine candidate for COVID and are developing it against a substantially accelerated time frame. This pandemic is one of the greatest tests we’ve ever faced as a society—but our collective response is showing us that we’re capable of more than we could have dreamed of just weeks ago.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: What an experience !! Interacted with the Chairman & CEO of Johnson and Johnson: Alex Gorsky !!!Healthcare Symposium 2020 at Washington University in St Louis, Olin business school.Thank you Washington University for giving me the opportunity to be in company with some of the greatest minds in Healthcare.. #OlinBusinessSchool #johnsonandjohnson

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: During my "Decision Making in the Leadership Chair" class at Wharton last week, I had the pleasure of learning from our guest speaker Alex Gorsky about the challenges he faces leading the biggest healthcare company in the world, Johnson & Johnson. As a former employee at J&J, I was thrilled to be chosen to have dinner with Alex after class as 10 other students and I were able to continue our discussions with him in a more intimate setting. I was really impressed by his friendliness, transparency, and overall positive energy, and I hope that someday I will be able to channel those same qualities as a leader wherever my career takes me.Thank you Alex Gorsky for your time, and Mr. William Lauder for what has been my favorite class at Wharton so far!

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Our CEO Alex Gorsky came by to take this fantastic selfie with us at our amazing J&J Global Services Leaders Meeting! Ending this week more energized than ever to be work for #mycompany ❤️Thank you Erica Jeffries Purdo for this most awesome experience!

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Today Johnson & Johnson offices in the U.S. are closed in observance of Martin Luther King, Jr. Day. As we pause to celebrate his life and legacy, I’m particularly inspired by Chief Diversity & Inclusion Officer Wanda Hope's reflections on the courage and convictions of ordinary Americans like her own mother who joined Dr. King in standing up for a more just and inclusive society.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: A huge thank you to Alex Gorsky and Johnson & Johnson for hosting the Gender Parity Collaborative members this week for meetings and to formalize our 2020 agenda to accelerate systemic gender parity in the healthcare workforce. #4genparity #HBAimpacthttps://lnkd.in/eaydGHk

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: If you really want to turn over a new leaf at work in 2020, your inbox can wait. Here’s why I think you should be checking your drafts folder for the seeds of the next world-changing innovation.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: So happy to celebrate with David Fischer, Alex Gorsky and Michael Sneed. These are just a few of the 1,500 fabulous friends and partners under one roof at tonight’s #AdCouncilDinner. This truly is one of my favorite nights of the year.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Last Friday, Alex Gorsky, Chairman and CEO of Johnson & Johnson and an Army veteran, spoke with a group of veterans from the Rice Business - Jones Graduate School of Business Veterans Association about military to civilian transitions, leadership, and healthcare innovation.  I was lucky to be a part of this group. A big thanks to Alex and his team for the time spent with us.  And thank you to Anthony DeToto for making this meeting happen.  #veteransday #johnsonandjohnson #ricebusiness #ricebusinessveteransassociation

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Last Friday, Alex Gorsky, Chairman and CEO of Johnson & Johnson and an Army veteran, spoke with a group of veterans from the Rice Business - Jones Graduate School of Business Veterans Association about military to civilian transitions, leadership, and healthcare innovation.  I was lucky to be a part of this group. A big thanks to Alex and his team for the time spent with us.  And thank you to Anthony DeToto for making this meeting happen.  #veteransday #johnsonandjohnson #ricebusiness #ricebusinessveteransassociation

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Took a quick break from maternity leave to complete the STAR 22 Leadership program. I was honored and humbled to kick off our 2nd Residency with the opportunity to moderate a fireside chat with our very own CEO and Chairman Alex Gorsky and my fellow STAR 22 classmates. Thank you for speaking with us and sharing your insights into developing millennial leaders of the future. #MyJnJ

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: There is no large company that does it better than Johnson & Johnson at taking care of and supporting the veterans community. It is demonstrated at the very top of the organization and throughout all of J&J’s business units. Honored to participate in the annual Veterans Leadership Council summit in NJ today. Truly a lead by example organization!  #njveteranschamber #veteran #newjersey #veterans #JNJ #JohnsonandJohnsonJohn P. Joseph Wolk Sandi Hassett Courtney Billington Alex Gorsky Kathleen Widmer Russ Clayton Peter Fechtmann Michael Morand

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Great session at The New York Times #DealBook conference today with my friend Ginni Rometty, chairman, president, and CEO of IBM. Thanks to Andrew Ross Sorkin for giving us the chance to talk about something we both feel so passionate about—the ways corporations can and should drive positive change in society. Photo by Samuel Corum

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Starting today, up to 500,000 doses of our investigational Ebola vaccine regimen are being deployed in the Democratic Republic of the Congo, which is currently undergoing the worst outbreak of the disease since 2014. I couldn’t be more proud of the ingenuity and collaboration—at Johnson & Johnson and with our private and public sector partners—that enabled us to reach this landmark in our fight against global pandemics.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: 8 times more likely to achieve better business outcomes. 6 times more likely to be innovative and agile. 2 times more likely to meet or exceed financial targets. Those are the outcomes when companies don’t just have a diverse workforce, but actively create inclusive work cultures where everyone feels like they belong. It’s a great reminder that fully embracing diversity & inclusion isn’t just the right thing to do, it’s also crucial for your business—a topic Johnson & Johnson explored in depth in our inaugural D&I Impact Review.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: On #WorldMentalHealthDay (and every day) I’m joining my fellow members of the AHA CEO Roundtable to stand with the 76% of American workers who have struggled with issues like stress, depression, and anxiety. Johnson & Johnson offers programs that support our employees’ emotional as well as physical needs because prioritizing your own well-being should be considered a necessity, not a luxury. #AHACEORoundtable #WeStandwith76

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: On #WorldMentalHealthDay (and every day) I’m joining my fellow members of the AHA CEO Roundtable to stand with the 76% of American workers who have struggled with issues like stress, depression, and anxiety. Johnson & Johnson offers programs that support our employees’ emotional as well as physical needs because prioritizing your own well-being should be considered a necessity, not a luxury. #AHACEORoundtable #WeStandwith76

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: I bet this hits close to home for many of us: the feeling of having to move so fast that there’s sometimes not enough time to think. When I’m faced with a really big decision, I force myself to take that extra night to sleep on it, or ask someone to argue the opposing viewpoint. How do you slow down when you’re being asked to move quickly?

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: I don’t need a list to tell me Jennifer Taubert and Ashley McEvoy are two of the most powerful women in business—I get to experience the keen insights and acumen they bring to our company's Executive Committee every day. Congratulations to both—and to Johnson & Johnson Board Member  Marillyn Hewson—for this well-deserved recognition from Fortune Magazine. #FortuneMPW

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Seventy-five years ago this month, General Robert Wood Johnson took his company public through the sale of millions of stock certificates like the one below. The capital raised fueled the growth and innovation Johnson & Johnson needed to elevate the health of people all over the world—and today, the family company that popularized sterile sutures more than a century ago is training T cells to attack cancer, advancing the science of robotic surgery, and developing the world’s first vaccine for HIV/AIDS. As we celebrate the anniversary of our IPO, I’m immensely proud of how far we’ve come—and excited to continue our work changing the trajectory of human health.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Today was one of my best days at Johnson & Johnson! I had the privilege to host a Fireside Chat with our CEO Alex Gorsky for co-ops and interns. I am humbled and honored to have represented our NA TA team and look forward to an amazing 2019-2020 season!  Maren Berge Lorelei Lampe Damon Albano Lou Palma Sean Callahan-Dinish Aimee Cuniglio Leigh Lau Erin Champlin Marc Mascolo #mycompany #jnj #letstalkjnj

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: What an amazing Summer Internship I had at Johnson & Johnson in the Corporate Business Technology Department on the Enterprise Architecture Team! For the past 10 weeks, I have developed new technical skills by using the software collaboration tools Confluence & Leankit,and data visualization tools Qlik & Tableau to increase my teams’ productivity, flow and efficiency. I also had the pleasure of connecting with many J&J professionals & live the Credo by participating in various civic engagement opportunities like building parts of homes for families in need & teaching elementary school students about STEM. Thank you to my day to day manager, John Mnich, for given me the opportunity to conduct the weekly team meetings & helping me to think more about my future career by always asking “so what do you want to be when you grow up?” Thank you to Avni Patel & Priscilla Rodriguez for being the best teammates/Subject Matter Experts!Special thanks to Sade Allen, my recruiter, for seeing something in me and giving me a chance! To Consuela Burton for your guidance and after work conversations, Timothy Brown Saila Incollingo Tangie Jenkins for your words of encouragement & being my mentors!Grateful I was able to schedule the meeting to speak with the CEO Alex Gorsky!#Blessings #jnj

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: What are words worth? They can express our greatest values, shape our actions, keep us accountable and sometimes even influence the world—but only if backed by the courage of our convictions. Read more about why I think the Business Roundtable’s newly-revised Statement on the Purpose of a Corporation is so important.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Today, the Business Roundtable released its revised Statement on the Purpose of a Corporation and reaffirmed the crucial role companies can play in meeting the needs of all stakeholders—not just shareholders. You can read more about the work my fellow members of the BRT’s Corporate Governance Committee and I did updating this statement for the 21st century—and the impact we expect it to have—in this month’s Fortune Magazine cover story.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Proud & honored that J&J is recognized as one of the best companies to work for in the US, UK, Brazil and Japan on the #LinkedInTopCompanies lists. Our employees are what make J&J successful and we strive every day to make J&J a place where they can unleash their potential and continue to drive positive change in the world.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: We’re in the midst of a rising mental health epidemic. As employers, we have the unique ability, and responsibility, to break the stigma around mental health and make employee mental health programs and services just as much of a priority as that of physical health. I’m proud to join Nancy Brown, CEO of the American Heart Association, and Brian Moynihan, Chairman and CEO, Bank of America–in collaboration with leaders across the American Heart Association CEO Roundtable–to show the world how we’re leading the way and fostering supportive workplaces.  #mycompany

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Today, we celebrate the 75th anniversary of Our Credo—Johnson & Johnson’s moral compass and enduring recipe for business success. Adam Grant joined me to reflect on the power of purpose-driven leadership and our company’s past, present and future. #Credo75

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Children are natural innovators. To solve our biggest future challenges, we need their most innovative and daring thinking. This #WorldChildrensDay, we celebrate how we can keep that creativity alive and flourishing.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Congratulations to the Johnson & Johnson Vision team for winning a spot on Time Magazine's “Best Inventions of 2018” list. It’s an incredible honor and recognition of what happens when we put our patients and customers at the center of how we innovate. The final product—a first of its kind contact lens that corrects vision & actively reduces light—couldn’t have happened without the more than 15 years of hard work, in partnership with Transitions Optical, put into solving for an area of great unmet need.  #mycompany

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Leading in the future of #health requires bringing together new technologies, science, data, analytics and insights as well as catalyzing innovative partnerships. At Johnson & Johnson, we’re infusing that expansive mindset into everything we do across our pharma, medical and consumer businesses. Speaking with LinkedIn news editor Jaimy Lee, I discussed what the next wave of #innovation looks like for us and how it helps us live up to our commitments to help people and change the trajectory of health for humanity. #mycompany

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: These days, families are so diverse and come in many wonderful forms. One thing hasn’t changed though: families always come first. At Johnson & Johnson, one of our greatest points of pride is the value we place on work families. Today, on International Day of Families, let’s take a moment to recognize all those who make that balance between work and family a top priority. #mycompany

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Nurses change the world. And in our rapidly evolving healthcare system, nurses have taken on even more responsibility as critical drivers of better health outcomes and innovative solutions. This #nursesweek, take a moment to thank all the nurses out there—and all the nurses in your life—and celebrate the ways they bring a boundless reserve of knowledge, creativity, compassion and ingenuity to their craft every day, as they press for improved patient health. #mycompany

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Last night Johnson & Johnson was honored at DiversityInc’s Top 50 Companies for Diversity event, by being named the number one company for diversity in the country. We believe diversity and inclusion is a key lever in connecting to the diverse and multicultural patients, customers and the consumers that we serve every day. By bringing our unique backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives together, we understand how we can inspire and ignite innovations and ideas that help us bring health to millions of people. #mycompany

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Tonight I had an invigorating and inspiring dinner with Alex Gorsky, the CEO of Johnson & Johnson, as well as many other amazing members of their organization. Key takeaway: Find a company to invest your work hours in that believes what you believe at a higher level and puts it in to practice. And what is that for J&J and for him? That's a passion for developing healthcare solutions that enable all people to live long lives less encumbered by any disease or condition. This is something I strongly identify with. Maybe one day I'll find myself work with this world class organization, but regardless,  together, in work or in spirit, I hope we can accomplish this shared vision. Huge thanks to J&J and to Schwarzman Scholars for making this possible!

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: It takes so much courage to speak publicly about mental health. And it's so inspiring when people break the silence, and the stigma, and remind us no one should be suffering alone, that it’s okay to reach out for help, and that we should start talking. If you haven’t already, I highly recommend checking out this deeply moving and honest essay from NBA superstar Kevin Love.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: When I attend speaking events at universities, I’ve always found the opportunity to connect with potential talent to be the most rewarding aspect. For anyone interested in a career in healthcare and at Johnson & Johnson, I always advise them to reach out to me after hearing me speak. But I’m always looking for ways to avoid missing out on opportunities to extend the conversations and relationships that are sparked at these visits. That’s why innovative digital platforms—like our BE VITAL app—are so exciting to me and so useful for companies serious about attracting the next generation of talent. #mycompany

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: For the past 130 years, J&J has been recognized as a leader in diversity & inclusion as the company believes that every person has unique and valuable experiences and that when you put diverse minds together, problems get solved  #mycompany

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Data science can help fuel solutions for some of the world’s biggest problems, but it involves more than analyzing trends in numbers—you need to understand the meaning behind the data. By empowering more women into STEM careers we can add more diversity of thought and ingenuity to problem solving.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: "Intelligence is the ability to adapt to change.” Today, we celebrate the wonderful and inspiring life of Stephen Hawking. We all have so much to learn from his courage, perseverance, intelligence and, importantly, his enduring curiosity.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: I’m proud to announce the second annual Janssen U.S. Transparency Report. Transparency is integral to how Johnson & Johnson operates, and it’s what patients and families need as they search for clarity around affordability and accessibility in our complex healthcare system. The report highlights not just our deep investment in impactful R&D, but also our fundamental commitment to responsible pricing and ensuring patient access to the medicines they need. Making our current healthcare system work for all requires change, and that starts with having these open and honest conversations. #mycompany

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Today, we join the world in celebrating International Women’s Day and continuing to #PressforProgress. It’s a day that’s deeply important to us at Johnson & Johnson. At our founding, more than half of our original employees were women. Ever since then, women have led our company forward as scientists, technologists, mentors, business leaders and community champions. Today, women hold 43% of senior management positions. But there’s always more we can do and we are committed to the idea that every time a woman succeeds at Johnson & Johnson it advances the empowerment agenda worldwide. #mycompany

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: When we talk about overcoming obstacles and adversity in life, we typically talk about grit and perseverance. They’re certainly important, but they need to be balanced with things like finding your purpose and learning when to strategically recharge. It’s the key not only to wellness but living a fuller and richer life.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Recently spoke with Stanford University Graduate School of Business students about how disruption is creating tectonic shifts for large, successful and established companies. As I explained it, leaders must always be thinking, “How can we continuously disrupt ourselves?” Because, as I see it, there are two options: be changed, or lead change. At J&J, we’re constantly doing the latter, taking a long-term view that transcends tumultuous cycles of disruption and pushes us to be competitive in all our business sectors—while keeping true to our 132-year history, our culture and Our Credo.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Recently spoke with Stanford University Graduate School of Business students about how disruption is creating tectonic shifts for large, successful and established companies. As I explained it, leaders must always be thinking, “How can we continuously disrupt ourselves?” Because, as I see it, there are two options: be changed, or lead change. At J&J, we’re constantly doing the latter, taking a long-term view that transcends tumultuous cycles of disruption and pushes us to be competitive in all our business sectors—while keeping true to our 132-year history, our culture and Our Credo.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: A great idea really can come from anyone, anywhere. It’s the foundation of true innovation, which happens when we collaborate and bring together a diversity of ideas, individuals and disciplines. The result: fresh thinking that champions our ability to develop novel ideas to age-old problems. That’s why global crowdsourcing forums, like Johnson & Johnson’s QuickFire Challenges, are so exciting to me and generate such unique and inspired solutions. #mycompany

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: True leadership is knowing when to balance your actions between guiding and empowering. NBA Coach Steve Kerr did exactly that by letting his team coach themselves for a game, to instill a new sense of responsibility and improved communication. They won by 46 points. Great lessons here for any leader looking for unexpected ways to inspire—and empower—their teams.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Recently spoke with Stanford University Graduate School of Business students about how disruption is creating tectonic shifts for large, successful and established companies. As I explained it, leaders must always be thinking, “How can we continuously disrupt ourselves?” Because, as I see it, there are two options: be changed, or lead change. At J&J, we’re constantly doing the latter, taking a long-term view that transcends tumultuous cycles of disruption and pushes us to be competitive in all our business sectors—while keeping true to our 132-year history, our culture and Our Credo.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Just like other aspects of our lives, consumers are increasingly expecting that access to and delivery of their health care will be simpler, better and cheaper because of technology. This is an insightful look at how digital innovation and data are rapidly transforming health care and empowering consumers to take charge of their health and wellbeing.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: At J&J, we continue to build one of the healthiest workforces in the world. Helping our employees stay more energized and more values-driven, ready to lead and live fuller, more productive lives, is one of my greatest points of pride. Great piece featuring Peter Fasolo, Ph.D. —our Executive Vice President and Chief Human Resources Officer—and Shawn Mason, PhD, LP—our Director of Research and Outcomes—outlining how we’ve been leading the charge and continuing to help our employees be their best and meet their full potential. #mycompany

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Great to see J&J Shine mentioned in Korn Ferry quarterly Briefings magazine. We never stop work on ways to improve the candidate experience at Johnson & Johnson but it's gratifying to see the hard work of my amazing talent acquisition team getting outside recognition.You can see the online version of the article here: https://buff.ly/2oudYgE

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: A great idea really can come from anyone, anywhere. It’s the foundation of true innovation, which happens when we collaborate and bring together a diversity of ideas, individuals and disciplines. The result: fresh thinking that champions our ability to develop novel ideas to age-old problems. That’s why global crowdsourcing forums, like Johnson & Johnson’s QuickFire Challenges, are so exciting to me and generate such unique and inspired solutions. #mycompany

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Every time I visit China, I’m struck by the shift from “made in China” to “invented in China.” It’s an exciting time to see—and take part in—this transformation. And it’s happening everywhere—from consumer technology to artificial intelligence to the 50 healthcare startups at our JLABS facility in Shanghai. Looking forward to next month’s China Development Forum and discussing new avenues of cooperation and innovation. And to our colleagues in the region, wishing you a very happy and prosperous New Year. #mycompany

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: The healthiest generation in history is within reach because of the incredible entrepreneurship, ingenuity and collaboration happening around the globe. Proud of Johnson & Johnson for spotlighting the unique talents of these 6 GenH Challenge winners and excited to see where they go. #mycompany

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: 75 years ago, Robert Wood Johnson wrote our iconic Credo—one of the earliest and most enduring statements of corporate responsibility. While the document has evolved to reflect our expanding commitments, the core vision and values contained in Our Credo are what have shaped Johnson & Johnson into the enduring institution it is today, and guide us toward the future. #mycompany

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: If I had to choose one piece of advice for the next generation of leaders to focus on, right now, it would be: take care of yourself. I recently shared this advice speaking to students at my alma matter The Wharton School, but can’t overstate how important managing your health and your energy is to lifelong success. Enjoying this great list of ways to manage your happiness in the moment.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: J&J recognized as a top innovator for being one of most successful organizations in the world that is active in innovation through research and development #mycompany

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: If you haven’t already, read this important piece addressing the rising, global mental health epidemic. Johnson & Johnson’s Chief Scientific Officer Paul Stoffels, MD argues, “the solution is disruptive innovation and international, open collaboration.” Couldn’t agree with Paul more. Evolving public-private partnerships are the key to generating vital funding for neuroscience research and new ways of understanding, researching and treating mental health issues. #mycompany

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Balancing the challenges, and joys, of a successful career and being a work parent are never easy. Companies can make a huge difference with modern parental leave policies and a commitment to work-life balance, but it’s still natural to feel overwhelmed at times. Get some great tips here on feeling more in control and making your time work for you in 2018.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text:
Proud to announce that J&J was named one of Fortune Magazine's Most Admired companies. A testament to the incredible work we all do—every day—driving forward innovation and putting the needs of people around the globe front and center. Especially energized by our high rankings not just in long-term value and global competition, but also social responsibility. Let’s make 2018 a year of increased purpose and continually thinking about using our reach and size for good.
#MostAdmired #mycompany

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: This year at #CES2018, Johnson & Johnson unveiled a host of cutting-edge technologies. Their focus: improving the lives of people worldwide through healthcare innovation and empowering people to take control of their health. See their ingenuity at work—from next-generation contact lenses to a mobile messaging platform available on WhatsApp. #mycompany

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: It’s important that leaders think about how to make 2018 a year of giving back & using their reach to do more good in the world. This piece explores how smaller companies can make a difference non-financially, but the advice applies for companies of any size. Consider the internal expertise you can donate, or how you can leverage your audiences to spread awareness for valuable causes.

Name: Alex Gorsky
Text: Thrilled that mMitra (short for “mobile friend” in Hindi) has won the "Public Health Initiative of the Year" in the 2017 India Health and Wellness Summit & Awards -- demonstrating the incredible impact we can make by empowering women with access to care through technology.mMitra is an innovative mobile-messaging program that sends vital health information to expectant and new mothers living in low-income urban communities in India.  The goal? Help the roughly 150 mothers and 3,500 children under the age of 5 who die each day in India from pregnancy complications or early childhood disease. To date, more than 1.3 million women have been reached by the program.Johnson & Johnson spearheaded mMitra in 2014, in partnership with the Mobile Alliance for Maternal Action, ARMMAN, the U.S. Agency for International Development, the United Nations Foundation and BabyCenter.

Name: Dane E. Holmes
Text: "Mary, 81, is married to Jake, 86. Mary is a former deputy head teacher, and Jake worked for the post office before retiring. MARY SAYS: When I told my father I was going to marry Jake he said, ‘If you marry that man you will never set foot in this house again.’He was horrified that I could contemplate marrying a black man, and I soon learned that most people felt the same way. The first years of our marriage living in Birmingham were hell — I cried every day, and barely ate. No one would speak to us, we couldn’t find anywhere to live because no one would rent to a black man.MARY: Today we have been married for 63 years, and are still very much in love. I do not regret marrying him for an instant, despite all the pain we have suffered.JAKE SAYS: I feel so fortunate to have met & married Mary, but it saddens me that we could not be accepted by society.Nowadays I say to young black people: ‘You have no idea what it used to be like.’When I arrived in the UK I was subjected to abuse every day. Once I was on a bus and a man rubbed his hands on my neck & said: ‘I wanted to see if the dirt would come off.’And back then you couldn’t work in an office — because a black man in an office with all the white girls wasn’t thought to be safe.Full story: https://bit.ly/30PSIGe

Name: Dane E. Holmes
Text: I’m H.O.T. !!——When describing my leadership style, I have described myself as H.O.T.  — Humble/Honest, Open, Transparent. Over the last few weeks, these attributes have been on display.  The photo on the left is what the world sees, the photo on the right is what my family (personal & professional) have seen recently.  In fact, the one on the right was captured during a video call w/ my direct reports — yes, I cried a VERY ugly cry in front of my team.Why?- Because I was NOT ok- Because I broke & could no longer suppress my pain- Because I love my team &  they love me ... we’re family - Because to hurt makes me human & to be transparent makes it real- Because I am a black woman deeply concerned for my son, my husband, my daughter, my race- Because I know firsthand that education doesn’t confirm us, money doesn’t elevate us, being “articulate” doesn’t protect us- Because both COVID & Racism 2020 are killing us - Because despite my influence, I can’t help all of us However, I now feel a sense of peace that has surpassed my own understanding. My FAITH gives me HOPE My HOPE gives me COURAGEMy COURAGE empowers me to impact CHANGE To my fellow leaders, keep it H.O.T. so that we can move our teams & this world forward together.Together, we can ...💚

Name: Dane E. Holmes
Text: I am the white mother of mixed race teenage children.  My daughter looks like me; my son looks like his dad. It breaks my heart that we have to teach him to be differently mindful of how he dresses (no hoodies), how he reacts (avoid conflict) and how people observe him (store security).  I’m leaning in to change so that we will live in a society where people will be seen for who they are and what they do, not what color their skin is.      #IAM #talkaboutblack I am a motherI am heartbrokenI am leaning in What are you? Thanks for the nomination Shannon Nelson and for getting us started Gavin Lewis.  I nominate Kara Helander Birgit Boykin  @Chris Chung Judith Samuelson @Allison Binns

Text: A little over a year ago, I posted this article on LinkedIn as an attempt to implore people, particularly the silent majority, to accept the dark history of our country.  And, through the acknowledgement of that fundamental truth, begin to build towards a better and more just future.Today, I post it again since it is as true today as it was last year or for that matter, over the course of our nation's history.  I addition, I also currently find myself at a loss for the right words... Wait, I can think of a few - "I CAN'T BREATHE" #justice #blacklivesmatter #nojusticenopeace

Name: Dane E. Holmes
Text: I am honored and humbled to announce that I will serve as the next Howard University School of Business Executive Council President for the 2020-2021 academic year. Our campaign was entitled “DNA". The vision of DNA is to develop the School of Business into an inclusive atmosphere that stimulates all aspects of who the modern school of business student is; rooting them in success and bestowing confidence in themselves down to their DNA. We are committed to creating an environment that allows all School of Business students to thrive in academia, creative outlets, and health and wellness through our principles of transparency, equity, and creativity. I am looking forward to serving the Howard community in this capacity and inspiring the next generation of leaders!DNA: It's who we are!#howarduniversity #HBCU #studentleader

Name: Dane E. Holmes
Text: 14 years ago with butterflies in my stomach I joined Goldman Sachs in Salt Lake City. Today I take a break and say goodbye to one of the most rewarding experiences of my life.  Words cannot adequately describe my last 14 years. Full of professional and personal satisfaction. It taught me resilience and humbled me at times. It pushed me in ways I didn’t think possible. And it allowed me to make an impact on people’s lives. My advice as I take this half-time break?  Take care of yourself FIRST so you can in turn care for others. Prioritize people. More important than budgets, presentations, promotions, emails or projects, make people and those relationships a priority. And prepare for the future so you may have the freedom to choose when you walk away and take a break. For my colleagues at Goldman, you are in the right place. No better place with so many bright minds to chart the course forward. For those of you considering GS, I cannot recommend it enough. Whether you are starting a career or making a switch, it will be an experience hard to match anywhere else.  Now I wish I was boarding a plane to see my darling parents at home in Puerto Rico but I’ll be patient and wait for the time to be right. In closing, if you need me, call/text/email me. 😚 #goldmansachs #saltlakecity

Name: Dane E. Holmes
Text: THE MARATHON CONTINUES!! 50 years ago NABA, Inc. HQ was founded by 9 men who refused to believe the world must stay like it was.  NABA was born to address the systematic inequities in the accounting and finance professions.  Last night we celebrated 50 years of running the race toward our goal of lifting as we climb.  In a night of elegance, we hosted our NABA NY Annual Scholarship and Awards Gala,  affectionately referred to as the "Black Nerd Prom".  We were treated perspicious words of my brother and good friend Dr. Maurice A. Stinnett (he/him) who literally and figuratively brought the house down.  I also was able to see my mentee Joshua Vital receive an award which was very well deserved.Congrats to the other award winners Kimberly Parris, Ainka T. Munroe, MBA, Monica Otieku, Joseph Owusu-Ansah, Sanjaye Thomas, CPA, CGMA, EY and all of the scholarship and award winners.We can't stop, so we won't stop.  The Marathon Continues....stay tuned. #bankofamerica #nabaat50 #leadership #opportunity Bank of America

Name: Kathryn Minshew
Text: Hello network, it's been a while! I’m leading workplace culture at Siemens Digital Industries.  In addition to helping to develop our culture from within (with fun projects and initiatives), I am happy to share one of our latest external projects, where we capture the many facets of Siemens via employee testimonials on The Muse! I’m always so humbled to see how big and small our world is,  via people stories in our organization, especially now that we've become more virtually connected than ever. While all colleagues are coming from a span of countries, almost all of the videos featured also come from somewhere quite familiar, their home offices! Check out what they have to share on their work, life, and impressions of our culture here at Siemens! ✨Thanks to the awesome colleagues who helped with this project and The Muse for the partnership! Same, and uniquely different is a humbling anchoring value I have, and I’m glad to see our virtual world coming together to showcase that, and to also combat distance bias. Maybe you’ll see a bit more of me around here. ✨#culture #peoplestories #digital #employerbrand #diversity #virtualwork

Name: Kathryn Minshew
Text: Only 7% of fintech founders are female!?!  Whoa...Thank you for bringing up this important issue Alaina Sparks & Deloitte FS! I'm proud to be a female co-founder in fintech, alongside fellow co-founder, Lindsay L. -- (and Sultan Meghji isn't "chopped liver" either ;)) at Neocova...I'm also grateful to the banks that invested in our success as well (& the ecosystem that continues to support us!) There are great funds like Shelly Kapoor Collins Shatter Fund who have been funding female founders well before COVID (full disclosure, I'm an investor) - but we still have SO FAR to go...Thank you for bringing up this important issue & discussion topic. What do you say, fellow founders, investors, and bankers? I think we can do WAY better than these numbers show!Lindsay Davis - podcast please? ;) Theodora Lau Laura Spiekerman Shannon Austin Holly Weckler Margaret J. Hartigan Mika Moser R. Danae V. Stephanie MacConnell Misha Rao Monica Murthy Elizaveta Chistyakova Bank Director Michelle TranEdwina Johnson NYC Fintech Women Cokie Hasiotis Asya Bradley, PMP 🌈 she/her  @jason henrichs
