Name: Kathryn Minshew
Text: Yesterday marked the end of my (almost) 5 year career at The Muse. My time there has been rewarding beyond belief. Reflecting on it has brought me an overwhelming sense of gratitude. Flashes of memories like my closing first big deal, my first promotion, my first hire, watching my own team grow and achieve their own promotions, happy hours, softball games, holiday parties, company retreats, co-worker weddings (including my own!), and so many more are filling me with nostalgia. Every experience I’ve had, every opportunity I’ve been awarded, every moment of success & those of failure have brought me to an important point of my career.I’m excited to take all that I’ve learned as I take the next step in my career. Sending a huge thank-you to those who built me up and guided me throughout my journey at The Muse. I wouldn’t be where I am without the leadership of people like Kathryn, Alexandra, Sam, and John (and many more!).No manager can achieve success without the foundation of a strong team, so I also want to take a moment and recognize my team members, past and current, for being so thoughtful and hardwork. You have all had a profound impact on me and I thank you for that. Onward!

Name: Kathryn Minshew
Text: Representation is SO important; the makeup of this panel sends the unfortunate message that VC is not a welcome place for women or people from underrepresented groups to succeed.Really disappointed to see this Duke Venture Community panel that has zero women and really limited participation from underrepresented groups.  Do better y'all.  There are many great Duke alumni women and people from underrepresented groups work in VC who should have been included here.  A cursory search on LinkedIn that took me 5 min yielded dozens of results.  Men / white allies – one simple step to demonstrate allyship is refuse to participate in all male / all-white panels    https://lnkd.in/gQJ7Vw4Please reshare / engage to hold the organizers accountable; this panel is unacceptable to me and doesn't represent the Duke University I want to support. #diversity #inclusion #dukeuniversity #venturecapital

Name: Kathryn Minshew
Text: I have not yet seen this conversation about #wfh.With so many companies permanently allowing wfh, Atlassian being the most recent major player, I can't help but wonder...How are companies extending the cost savings of commercial rent to their employees? The assumption cannot be made that employees have what they need at home to work (e.g. A desk, supplies, and even space).It would make sense that companies would extend those savings to the employee.What have you seen companies offer to employees since the rented sq. footage moved from a commerical office to someone's home and personal space?Thoughts Courtney Branson Jane Hale Hopkins Emily Price, M. Ed. #COVID #business #thehumanway

Name: Kathryn Minshew
Text: Some of you job seekers think that YOU are being rejected. YOUR BEING is not rejected. You’re BEING redirected. Take yourself out of the equation. It’s not about YOU.If Kathryn Minshew believed that she was BEING rejected, do you think she’d overcome the 148 rejections, get into Y Combinator and raise over $28 million for The Muse?Don’t tell me you’re being rejected. Whether you have a Dream list of companies you want to work for or a Dream list of contacts you want to meet with, YOU are not being rejected — I believe that there is someone who needs what you have to contribute. You may need to adjust your approach.You may need to adjust your actions.You may need to adjust your attitude.You may need to go about it differently.Just know — you’re not being rejected. And that company that you want to work for... What do you think it took for that company to get on the Fortune 500 or Crain’s Fast 50 or “fiercest lists” let alone get on your radar? A lot of rejection.Don’t tell me you can’t follow-up!And as much as I love a great strategy and plan, I believe in faith.I believe that you have God-given talents and gifts seeded in you to pursue your greatness and potential. And I believe that God doesn’t reject you, He redirects you.#careercoach

Name: Jim Citrin
Text: Today is #DayOfTheGirl.Girls understand the challenges they face - from COVID and beyond - better than anyone else. They understand the problem. They are critical to finding the solution.As we work to build back better, girls' voices must be at the center.In May @GirlEffect brought 25 girls across 5 countries together to start documenting their experience of COVID for the world to see the pandemic through their eyes.“Since schools closed . . . girls have dropped out from school and married . . . Other girls have gotten pregnant, it's not a good thing.” ​ Tania, 25, Malawi“I know in my head that there's a light at the end of the tunnel but I don't see it.” ​ Emma, 20, USA“I do not learn. Because I can not manage to buy bundles and be online to learn.” ​Merci, 24, MalawiMeet the girls at voices.girleffect.org #TheGirlEffect

Name: Jim Citrin
Text: We could use a few more respondents to this quick but important survey.  Can you give me 4 minutes? Thanks for all the interest! #hr #ceo #leadershiptips

Name: Jim Citrin
Text: As I talk to CEOs and leaders of all kinds, two themes are consistently emerging: (1) individuals feeling exhausted as we progress in our year of “virtual reality” and (2) many of these leaders fear losing connectivity to their teams. So this month, I have some reading suggestions!As many head back to school and face new ways of doing things at work and home, my first recommendation is Mindset by Stanford psychologist Carol Dweck. While this wasn't necessarily a page-turner for me, it is a timely and worthy read as we think through how to shift our mindsets to cope with change and growth. My second recommendation is Daring Greatly by Brene Brown. Her combination of personal storytelling and her research around personal connection is inspiring.  My third recommendation is a book that has been on my shelf for many years but I re-read sections from time to time, E.F. Schumacher’s Small is Beautiful: Economics as if People Mattered. Schumacher’s book is not your usual economics text, but one that makes you think about underlying psychology and behavior. Would love to know what's on your September list! #readinglist #leadership

Name: Jim Citrin
Text: Meet Kimberly Evans PaigeEVP, Chief Marketing Officer at BET (BET Networks, a subsidiary of Viacom Inc.)When it comes to understanding how to build and market a brand, there are few with Kim's experience and talent.  With a BA from Howard University and MBA from Clark Atlanta University, Kim began her journey at one the best places to learn marketing Procter & Gamble.  After a few years she started her own marketing consultancy before joining The Coca-Cola Company for an epic almost 2-decade run.  She began as Global Director on Sprite rising to VP Marketing & Innovation, Ventures and Emerging Brands.  In 2017 she became CMO for Coty and later joined Sundial Brands as Chief Operating & Brand Officer. Paige joined BET in September of 2019, bringing decades of experience in marketing and branding with companies like Coca-Cola and Sundial Brands.*** Spotlight Series: Black Excellence ***Amazing business executives (who happen to be Black)---No more excuses about how folks "can't find" diverse talent to fill the C-Suite and board rooms. I hope this series will shine a light on just a few of the incredibly talented business executives that any company would be lucky to have on their team. #BlackLivesMatter#BlackExcellence#AllyIsAVerb#DiversityIsABusinessImperative

Name: Jim Citrin
Text: Excited to share what I've been work on for the last several months.Using Elemental Cognition’s hybrid AI technology, PolicyPath was built to help organizations bring people back to work and school more safely and confidently amidst the COVID pandemic. We start by work with organizations to quickly define their respective policy using our policy library. From there, our app performs a risk assessment and explains in plain language what each user needs to do in order to comply with a policy, in addition to why their actions are important for their safety and the safety of others. Simultaneously, our analytics portal provides real-time visibility into compliance trends over time and individual case details while keeping sensitive PHI data private.

Name: Jim Citrin
Text: Excited to share what I've been work on for the last several months.Using Elemental Cognition’s hybrid AI technology, PolicyPath was built to help organizations bring people back to work and school more safely and confidently amidst the COVID pandemic. We start by work with organizations to quickly define their respective policy using our policy library. From there, our app performs a risk assessment and explains in plain language what each user needs to do in order to comply with a policy, in addition to why their actions are important for their safety and the safety of others. Simultaneously, our analytics portal provides real-time visibility into compliance trends over time and individual case details while keeping sensitive PHI data private.

Name: Jim Citrin
Text: This could be the most important app/product to help organizations bring their employees, students, and loved ones back to work and school safely and effectively. Check it out and congrats to David Ferrucci, Oliver Citrin  and the entire team at AI company Elemental Cognition .

Name: Jim Citrin
Text: All these new digital leadership skills are essential and won’t go away when Covid finally recedes. Work from home, telehealth, online learning are all here to stay. CEOs need to manage virtually, doctors need to treat patients, educators need to teach, politicians need to communicate.. so real time, move over for screen time. Congrats Jim Citrin, an important wave to catch, look forward to your how-to.

Name: Jim Citrin
Text: Leading at a Distance! Through engaging with leaders over the recent months, it has become clear that a great many are adjusting to the new world of virtual work.  As a result, I'm excited to share the news that my Spencer Stuart partner, Darleen DeRosa and I will be writing a new book, Leading at a Distance. This book will be heavily research based and offer highly practical information to help you maximize the benefits and avoid the pitfalls of virtual work. It will be filled with examples and insights from our work with the most successful leaders and organizations in the world.  We will share insights on topics such as: - Building trust- Working with a virtual boss- Onboarding virtually- Shaping culture from a distance- New organization models- Coaching people you don’t see in person- Enhancing team effectiveness- Conducting successful virtual meetings We will be conducting a survey and interviews with leaders across industries and we plan to share insights along the way here on LinkedIn. Please share your comments and experiences: - What are the most important benefits you are seeing and challenges you are facing work virtually? - As a leader, what are you doing differently now than before the pandemic? Thanks in advance for your engagement!

Name: Jim Citrin
Text: News flash - CEO turnover slows during crises as boards seek stability in volatile times.We at Spencer Stuart and Bain & Company have co-published research related to CEO succession trends during periods of crisis.HIGHLIGHTS:CEO transitions during a recession decline by up to 32%.CEO transitions consistently fall to their lowest level in the year after a recession hits bottom and begin to spike as uncertainty wanes, typically 2 years after the depth of the crisis.We are seeing a similar trend for the Covid crisis thus far. In April and May 2020, CEO successions fell worldwide compared with the same months last year, including by nearly 50% in Europe and Asia.WHY IT MATTERS: The data and insights urge current CEOs to re-imagine their long-term strategies and lean to the expertise on their boards, recognizing that a leadership change may not be the most likely solution.  Marshall Goldsmith Mark C. Thompson Hubert Joly Tim McNary Emily Ford Sanyin Siang Cathy Anterasian Claudius Alexander Hildebrand Molly Lieberman

Text: Meet Bozoma Saint JohnChief Marketing Officer @ Netflixhttps://lnkd.in/gdX-9dD Cutting edge. Culture. Cool. After helping elevate brands like PepsiCo, Apple, and Uber, Boz (pronounced "Bose" like nose) is joining the streaming giant Netflix.  We can't wait to "watch her work" and unleash her marketing magic!***Black Excellence Spotlight Series***Amazing business executives (who happen to be Black)---No more excuses about how folks "can't find" diverse talent to fill the C-Suite and board rooms. I hope this series will shine a light on just a few of the incredibly talented business executives that any company would be lucky to have on their team. #BlackLivesMatter#BlackExcellence#AllyIsAVerb#DiversityIsABusinessImperative

Name: Jim Citrin
Text: I’m going to share something I never thought I would on LinkedIn…My profile picture. Why is this such big news for me? Well, I had a previous senior leader say that I was too fat for my job & that I needed to lose weight. Whether true or not, this statement really affected me, so much so that I stopped allowing my photo to be taken, personally & professionally. Removed my picture from LI for fear that people wouldn’t want to work with or employ me because of my weight. I was afraid to share this for fear that everyone else would agree. I wanted my experience, energy, loyalty and passion to do the talking rather than my looks.Someone mentioned how I didn’t have a profile picture on LinkedIn which set off those fears again, but instead of allowing them to spiral, I thought to myself, no, I am confident in my abilities and what I can offer to the world, regardless of how I look, my weight or any other shallow opinion people have about me. I am more than what my appearance is, & so are you.Words hurt, they really do, but I hope that you can take a moment to step away & realise how not fitting into what others tell you is beautiful doesn’t make you ugly, it doesn’t make you a bad worker either.#beautywithin #bodyshaming #badmanagers #confidence #sorrynotsorry #unashamedlyme

Text: “Research shows that in “child-care deserts” where there aren’t enough day-care spots for kids, there’s a 12 percentage point drop in mothers’ labor force participation . . . .  During this pandemic, more women have lost their jobs than men, Labor Department data show. Economists are deeply worried the pandemic will set American women’s job prospects back for years.” Thanks Heather Long of The Washington Post for highlighting the critically important role daycare plays re:  women’s employment.

Name: Jim Citrin
Text: For the last nine years, we’ve hosted Nielsen Global Impact Day each summer—a day for thousands of our associates to team up and volunteer for organizations in their local communities. This year we had to postpone our in-person #NGID activities due to COVID, but we didn’t let that stop us from volunteering—in fact, we discovered new and different ways to volunteer virtually, leaning into our company’s strengths in data science.Since April, we’ve contributed more than $3 million in pro bono value to projects across every continent. I’m so proud (and inspired!) by how our associates are giving back—at a time when caring for our neighbors and communities is more important than ever. Here’s more about how we’re all #InItTogether: https://lnkd.in/dpEv65D

Name: Jim Citrin
Text: When the 9/11 tragedy happened, it was 6 am in San Francisco. I was awoken by a panicked call from my friend Janine who was on the east coast and could barely speak. I spent the day in my bathrobe in our construction zone of a home with my partner Donald and a couple dozen construction workers glued to the TV. The day is seared into my heart as everything changed so suddenly, horrifically.If you’re old enough to remember where you were when JFK was shot, you can recount a similar tale. Today, we have COVID, a collective experience which requires a different narrative tone. The storm clouds started to form at the start of the year, but we in the west took little notice. As Europe got overwhelmed, many still clung to the American Dream of exceptionalism that this wouldn’t affect our soil and soul. And, of course, soon we came to realize “it’s a small world after all,” and that this new kind of pain would come in waves, full of rancor and divisiveness like we’ve never seen in a time of collective tragedy.

Name: Jim Citrin
Text: “In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends.” - Martin Luther King, Jr. Now is not the time for silence. We need to talk about racism of all types, but especially that which has recently escalated against African Americans—individuals who are our colleagues, friends and relatives. Social justice and equality for all are basic human rights, and we will never stop advocating for fair treatment of all people, inside and outside of Nielsen.

Name: Jim Citrin
Text: My friend, founder and Chairman @KeithFerrazzi has cracked the code to leadership.  He’s outlined a blueprint for transformation in his new book, Leading Without Authority: How the power of co-elevation can break down silos, transform teams, and reinvent collaboration.  Endorsed by Peter H. Diamandis, Arianna Huffington, Tony Hsieh, and more, Leading Without Authority is a mentor in book form. With the guiding ethos of “going higher together,” co-elevation allows us to turn colleagues and partners into teammates.  And you don’t have to have formal authority, or direct reports, to do it.  Learn more about Elevate at https://lnkd.in/eq63XYq or just buy it now: https://lnkd.in/en-DFAX

Name: Jim Citrin
Text: Leadership in a Time of Crisis: The Way Forward in a Changed World I'm extremely excited & proud to share the new 100 Coaches book with contributions from 37 wonderful business & leadership experts! Special thanks to MG100 CEO, Scott Osman for compiling this with me & to the legendary Frances Hesselbein for writing the foreword! The business world as we knew it will never be the same again. And in this time of crisis, leaders are looking for the best guidance and direction they can find.Learn more here: https://lnkd.in/gGyf9SbContributions from:Asheesh Advani, Jenny Blake, Peter Bregman,David Burkus, James Citrin, Erica Dhawan, Connie Dieken, Chester Elton, Robert Glazer, Sally Helgesen, Whitney Johnson, Tom Kolditz, Harry Kraemer, Martin Lindstrom, Rita McGrath, Sharon Melnick, Ph.D. David Meltzer, Richie Norton, Laura Gassner Otting,Liz Wiseman and many more!

Name: Jim Citrin
Text: Leadership in a Time of Crisis: The Way Forward in a Changed World, released on Monday is now the #1 new release in Business Decision-Making and #2 new release in Business Leadership. Thank you to the amazing wisdom and insights of Marshall Goldsmith and 37 of the members of 100 Coaches including Asheesh Advani Peter Bregman James Citrin Erica Dhawan Connie Dieken Robert Glazer Sally Helgesen Whitney Johnson Chester Elton Sanyin Siang Harry Dhillon Martin Lindstrom Rita McGrath Sharon Melnick, Ph.D. Liz Wiseman Laura Gassner Otting Ayse (Eye-Shay) Birsel and with a foreword by the inspiring Frances Hesselbein. #marshallgoldsmith #professionalcoaching #leadershipdevelopment The book offers a wide range of thought. Our ambition is to be helpful to you as you bring out the best in yourself and the best in others. Take a deep breath. Take action. Keep moving forward. We want this book to help leaders globally, so it's available at $2.99 for a limited time on AmazonKindle. If it resonates for you, you can get it at https://amzn.to/3cTNhcg#100CoachesCrisisLeadership

Name: Jim Citrin
Text: "Lessons from the Top", "On Leadership", or "Connections" - Please Vote Now!I’m in the final planning stages of launching a bi-weekly newsletter on LinkedIn and I would love your guidance on the title.  The concept is to interview inspiring leaders from across business and other sectors, bring to bear state-of-the-art research on leadership, governance, and career planning, and share lessons learned from my unique perspective of work with some of the world’s top companies, organizations, and executives.  All with the goal of deriving and delivering valuable and actionable insights to apply in order to help achieve maximum professional success and personal satisfaction.Thanks for your input and looking forward to bringing great content and insights!

And, for the first time, our research also explores how the tech sector is embracing diversity and inclusion and adapting amid the COVID pandemic. Read on:

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: I am proud to announce the Consumer Technology Association and the Connected Health Initiative are launching a new effort to address longstanding health disparities in the U.S., amplified by the COVID pandemic.Together, CTA and CHI will explore ways in which the increasing use of health technology such as mobile health, wearables, remote monitoring, clinical decision support, AI and telehealth can be used to improve the country’s response to health disparities in diverse geographies, communities and demographics. The Coalition’s first project will be a white paper with policy and operational recommendations addressing technology’s role in tackling disparities in the American healthcare system.Read our announcement: https://bit.ly/3jiCPOW

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: According to recent research from the Consumer Technology Association, three-quarters of parents (75 percent) and educators (73 percent) say technology products and services have eased at-home learning during the COVID outbreak.And the demand for consumer technology products and services has also grown due to remote learning. This shift to at-home learning and work has put new demands on our broadband networks. Read my take in Morning Consult on how the U.S. can continue to lead the world in connectivity: https://bit.ly/3jfo5jC

Text: Dr. Malinowski, my wife, a retina surgeon, shared eight ways we can smash the coronavirus curve. Read her thoughts on Medium here:

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: #COVID antibody testing is the best and quickest way to get us back to work. It is in our national interest to identify those who may have immunity – then care for those who haven’t been exposed and lead our country out of the recession. My take:

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: COVID is an economic challenge, especially for small businesses and startups. To survive this, we must all work together and adjust. Read my thoughts on how small tech companies can adapt to navigate this crisis in my latest article.

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: Crises can bring out the best and worst in people. I believe the COVID crisis is a unique opportunity to step up in our communities. Read my thoughts in my latest article here:

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: Thank you to FCC Chairman Ajit Pai and the FCC staff for quickly granting temporary authority for Verizon to use additional AWS-3 spectrum for the next 60 days. This will add capacity to our wireless network and further strengthen our ability to keep our customers connected during this crisis, especially those on the front lines. #forwardtogether

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: Dear Friends - I hope you and your families are safe and well. As I know you are addressing the ever-changing needs of your business right now, I wanted to share that our team has developed a Pandemic Rapid Response Assessment designed to assess the impact of this pandemic on your business and to help share leading practices. The tool can be accessed here ( https://lnkd.in/eSukXQZ ) and our team would be pleased to discuss. Message me here. Take care and be safe. #risk,  #riskmanagement,  #pandemic, #compliance

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: In the midst of the fear, panic, closures and cancelations surrounding #coronavirus, I wanted to share a few thoughts on how this crisis gives us an opportunity to come together as a community and be the best people we can be. Read more of my thoughts in my latest article.

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: With the threat of #coronavirus growing every day, we must be sensitive and supportive of the industries and workers hardest hit by this pandemic. As a nation, we must recognize the sacrifices of our health care workers, teachers and others as they navigate this difficult time. No matter what side of the aisle you're on, the impact of the virus on the U.S. economy and people will only be more devastating if we don't put aside politics and work toward a solution together.

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: Yesterday, iRobot’s groundbreaking Roomba s9+ was launched in China via an online press conference, reaching millions of consumers across China. Thank you to Kelly Zhang, Cathy Song and the iRobot team in Shanghai for an amazing launch. Despite a very difficult few months, you have delivered unbelievable results. The Roomba s9+ is iRobot’s flagship home robot, offering unprecedented power, intelligence and sophisticated design. As stated by a prominent tech outlet, ZOL, “iRobot Roomba s9+ is exactly what robot cleaning should be like… Its innovative yet practical features have met all my requirements for a robot vacuum… This robot vacuum is one of ultimate performance.” https://lnkd.in/euNevnfZOL - https://lnkd.in/edGZfAs Mro #irobot #roomba #china #robot

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: One. More. Day. Only 24 hours and 39 minutes to be exact until those aisles are packed with people looking at all the new equipment. Yes, those aisles... This is the view of the Festival Grounds (about half of it) from my hotel window. #CONEXPOcountdown

Text: #mwc2020 #ces2020  doing the right thing makes hard decisions easier.

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: One of the highlights of CES each year is hearing the stories of the innovative men and women in Eureka Park and how they made it there. See what I learned from Sabine Stuiver of Hydraloop Systems - Smart water savings, Elnaz Sarraf of ROYBI and Baptiste Pageot of myfood - Reconnect with your Food in my latest LinkedIn article:

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: I have a question for tech and business leaders: if you could rewind 10 years, what leadership lessons would you tell your younger self? I’m curious – comment below!

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: I'm thrilled Healthiest Employers named the Consumer Technology Association one of the healthiest workplaces in D.C.! This is just one of the many awards we earned last year: The Washington Post Top Work Places, CARE Award, Virginia Business Best Places to Work, and Best Workplaces for Commuters. Want to work with a fantastic team at an award-winning workplace? See our open positions here: http://bit.ly/3aXwswu

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: #CES2020 was one for the books. A huge thanks to all the Consumer Technology Association staff, exhibitors and attendees who made it such a success!

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: Another great day at #CES2020. I enjoyed meeting with the German and Panama delegations this morning and talking with Chris Duffey about his book!

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: Today started with an incredible NEXTGENTV event and Secretary Elaine L. Chao's fascinating keynote on the new technologies transforming our transportation systems. I also had a great conversation with Fox Business Network's Liz Claman and was inspired by Impossible Foods’ Pat Brown's points at the Leaders in Tech dinner. More to come tomorrow!

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: Every year, day one of #CES is always packed full of incredible events. Some of yesterday's highlights – Ed Bastian of Delta Air Lines' keynote, my fireside chat with Ivanka Trump about the future of work, my conversation with Ajit Pai of the Federal Communications Commission and Joseph Simons of the FTC and the Women in Consumer Technology awards.

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: #NinjaFuture's new chapter explores the tech industry's responsibility to create new pathways to the new and better jobs of the future. The U.S. tech sector could generate 8 million new jobs by 2023, especially in emerging industries like robotics, 5G and artificial intelligence that will take center stage at CES this year.By rethinking our educational system, apprenticeships and embracing government solutions to the national workforce dilemma including the White House’s Pledge to America's Workers, we really can build a competitive, 21st century workforce for all.Get your copy to learn how!

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: Samsung Electronics' President & CEO Hyun-Suk Kim’s keynote and Daimler AG's VIP pre-show keynote were the highlights of today. Who else is excited for the first full day of #CES2020 tomorrow?

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: Join me next Wednesday, 1-2pm, as I share my insights and experience on the topic of “Smart Homes Influencing Real Estate” at #CES2020. Location: Venetian, Marcello 4406. Download the CES app and add it to your schedule here ➡️ https://lnkd.in/enWaAnb #smarthometechnology #CTA #womenintechnology #innovation #technology

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: Tonight we kicked off #CES2020 with CES Unveiled – looking forward to seeing the emerging technologies that will take center stage this year.

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: Value-based health care – care that favors quality over quantity – is the key to more affordable and effective treatment for our world. I recently shared in FierceHealthcare about the technologies you'll see at #CES2020 that can make it a reality. Read my thoughts here: http://bit.ly/2MLgewe

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: #CES2019 brought 175K+ industry professionals, 4.5K+ exhibitors and 1K+ speakers to Las Vegas. What will #CES2020 bring? View this year’s stellar lineup of innovative, industry-leading speakers and sessions today. http://bit.ly/33UBUvK

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: At CES this year, I’m excited to hear Delta Air Lines CEO Ed Bastian uncover how emerging technology and innovation will transform the future of travel. Learn more about his keynote on January 7th and the others you won’t want to miss during CES week here! http://bit.ly/2MghneP #CES2020

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: I’m looking forward to seeing all the innovation that’s in store for #CES2020. To make the most of this year’s event, be sure to plan your week ahead of time. What keynote or session are you most excited for? http://bit.ly/33UBUvK

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: I’m also incredibly excited to announce this year’s CES 2020 Gary’s Book Club authors! Their noteworthy books cover topics from workforce and the government to virtual reality. Congratulations to David DeWolf & Jessica Hall, Carla Bailo & Terry Barclay, Jeff Kosseff, Sarah Boisvert, Jane Sarasohn-Kahn, Lakshmi Sarah & Melissa Bosworth, Chris Duffey, and Martin J. O’Malley for your excellent books. Stop by Gary's book club at CES to get your copies signed!

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: Big news – Ninja Future will be available in paperback with a new afterword at CES 2020. The update talks about our shifting workforce and how new gov. solutions, educational pathways and apprenticeships are key to preparing for the future of work.

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: Thank you, ASAE, for having me keynote at your Technology Exploration Conference this week! Here’s a great recap of my thoughts on the importance of diversity to create the future innovation that will transform our world.

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: While the U.S. and Europe have some differences, our core values of free speech, democracy, self-determination and right to privacy remain the same. Secretary Mona Keijzer and I discuss why our countries can achieve more by innovating together than apart in our recent Fox Business. Read more here.

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: I attended Fortune Magazine's Global Forum in Paris this week and had a fantastic time listening to and learning from industry leaders from around the world. Great speakers across the board on everything from climate change to innovation in the beauty/cosmetics industry. Here are a few pictures recapping the highlights.

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: Innovative hiring practices are critical to bridging the skills gap in the tech industry. See how the Consumer Technology Association's Apprenticeship Coalition with IBM has grown to more than 20 apprenticeship occupational roles, ranging from software engineering to data analytics to cybersecurity.

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: Innovation must be America's primary strategy to remain a global leader. Read more of my thoughts in my recent piece for Fox Business.

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: Our nation is more divided than ever – and it's only going to get worse as we approach the 2020 election. Businesses can help foster unity by investing in their employees and their communities, committing to policies that don't just advance the well-being of shareholders, but of the country as a whole. Read more of my thoughts on how we can change the political climate in Chief Executive Group.

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: #CESUnveiled 2019 was encouraging and inspiring. I’m even more excited to see the potential of global innovation at #CES2020 in January!

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: CES Unveiled in Amsterdam kicked off on Thursday, and, as always, it’s exciting to see the emerging technologies and innovators shaping the industry and our world. I’m looking forward to CES Unveiled in Paris this week!

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: #CES2020 breaking news: Delta Air Lines CEO Ed Bastian will keynote CES 2020! Don't miss out on this incredible keynote from a visionary leader – register today. https://www.ces.tech/

Name: Gary Shapiro
Text: This year as the CEO of @Colorado Technology Association has been a blast.  I treasure the relationship with Jeff Wasden and the Colorado Business Roundtable (COBRT).  The opportunity to interview Gary Shapiro of the Consumer Technology Association was a highlight.  Here's the interview.  When I first met Gary, three things hit me.  He's smart.  He has a comprehensive view of our global market.  He's not vanilla.  Gary, thank you for sharing your point of view and vision.  Thank you Chris Schmidt and Deloitte and @Suma nallapati and John W. Smith of DISH Network for your sponsorship.  Here's the interview.  Hope you enjoy.  Thank you to Lisa Walvoord RevGen Partners Kirk Mielenz Purnima W. Ann Boyd Keenan Brugh Alex Hopkins Alexander Colleran at ICOSA MEDIA, thanks for a quality video production.

Name: Deepak Chopra MD (official)
Text: Deepak, how can we not worry about the ones we love? This time of year is rich in family and friends gatherings and though there are many happy moments, I cannot help but worrying about health, relationships or financial issues being dealt with by sister, mother, father in law and more. Worrying about it does not resolve anything but I cannot help it. Any suggestions?#AskDeepak

Name: Deepak Chopra MD (official)
Text: I’m struck by how many women I know carry the energy of “princessness’ they seem to be very at home in their femininity but also unconscious of how powerful  this is in bringing the positive attention of men to them and helpfulness. I work with young children and notice that this energy is often cultivated very young. I don’t have this energy myself in big way and find that if I put on “feminine charm’ I notice its positive effects on men immediately and feel very manipulative. I also feel like its “not me” . I actually have been without a partner for a few years & feel like to attract someone to me I need to embrace that energy more but also it feels like a compromise to my real self and I want to be loved for truly who I am. I wonder if  you may have any ideas about this?#AskDeepak

Name: Deepak Chopra MD (official)
Text: The Hearth Locker - “Mind over Matter” with Deepak ChopraDon't Forget To Visit https://lnkd.in/efAYQ-cPause. Notice. Choose. Change. Join us as we speak with Deepak Chopra, doctor, author, world renowned pioneer in integrative medicine and personal transformation, and “spiritual Shakespeare” (as Rob affectionately calls him), about the importance of pausing and noticing the world around us, and the power we all have to choose our actions and change our collective future. We also discuss the power of meditation, the importance of diet, and the Never Alone Initiative - a worldwide movement committed to building peaceful, just, sustainable, healthy and joyful communities.

Name: Deepak Chopra MD (official)
Text: Dear Deepak, I respect your words of wisdom and I need some clarity with my sister and her 18 year old daughter. They were inseparable when she was growing up, when she was around 12 my sister started online dating because up until then she had nobody in her life except her daughter. That’s when things changed and the fighting started. She planned a trip with her new boyfriend to Florida, and her daughter went to stay with her father, and never moved back. My sister cannot let go of the hurt she caused her from moving out, and my niece cannot forgive my sister for the online dating. I have a great relationship with her, but can’t get through to her about the power of forgiveness. Can a daughter really hate her Mother?#AskDeepak

Must I make amends with the individuals in order to avoid creating new karma or is it possible that my own healing and forgiveness is going to prevent recreating this abusive cycle for my own soul?#AskDeepak

Text: World mental health day 2020 Happy to share this post from ChoZen Retreat•Gabriella Wright is an actress, mom, activist, and mental health advocate. She generously graced us with her presence at ChoZen Retreat earlier this fall and we couldn’t think of a better person to share our platform with on #WorldMentalHealthDay. We hope her words soothe your spirit and spur you to #LoveInAction, which is also the name of the campaign to raise awareness to mental well being and suicide prevention created by Gabriella and The Warrior Monk Poonacha Machaiah and Deepak Chopra  in partnership with Neve Alone Mental well being initiative of the The Chopra Foundation .If you want to hear more from Gabriella, be sure to sign up for the #ChoZenPath newsletter at https://bit.ly/30PzOOQ, as we will be releasing our full interview with Gabriella on the night of the New Moon, #October16. 🌚⭐.#mentalhealth #consciousness #deepakchopra #nonprofit #suicideprevention #consciousliving #environmentalist #environmentalprotection #neveralonemovement #loveinaction #warriormonk #neveralone #choprafoundation #worldmentalhealthday#worldmentalhealthday2020

Name: Deepak Chopra MD (official)
Text: The Conscious Breath, Episode 8: Directing Energy Through BandhasThe Conscious Breath, Episode 8: Directing Energy Through BandhasThis week we will begin to practice some of the most important practices in Hatha Yoga called bandhas. Bandha literally means a lock or bind, but the way that we can think of them in regards to personal development is as a director of attention and energy. We have natural energy flows and patterns in our body and mind, and in our regular, unregulated states of mind, these patterns can be chaotic of undisciplined. When we do not have discipline, then we suffer. In the practice of yoga we begin to discipline the body, breath, and mind, but we do so gently and steadily. It is not forceful, fast, and impatient. It is steady, consistent, disciplined, and most importantly, joyful. Practices for Week 8Preparatory practices Ashwini mudra Mula bandha Uddiyana bandha Kapalabhati 3 rounds x 25

Name: Jacki Zehner
Text: Seven months into the COVID pandemic, it has become clear that caregivers, particularly women, continue to be disproportionately impacted by the increasing challenges of juggling work and family demands. Learn more about what Fidelity is doing to increase their support. #WomenTalkWomen

Name: Jacki Zehner
Text: I thought you'd appreciate some good news. The Cru raised $2M - our second round of capital since our launch in 2018! We achieved this milestone in the midst of a global pandemic, a historic recession, and against the odds: only .06% of venture capital goes to black female founders. What I'm most excited about is that these new resources will allow us to further our mission of helping women to realize their life intentions at a moment when we're falling behind socially and economically due to this crisis. The Cru matches circles of women who collaborate to meet their life goals. Then we provide the tools and content to support them. Since raising the $2M, we have expanded nationally so that any woman in the U.S. can be matched with a Cru in her time zone. We also launched a revamped application process. It's more user-friendly and it helps YOU decide if The Cru is a good fit. Up next is a new digital platform and curriculum. Thank you for joining me on this journey. Every time you read, share, or like one of my posts, you're investing in my leadership. I don't take it for granted. I'm on the planet to help every woman find her Cru. If you know a woman who needs one tell her to apply. There are a few October spots remaining: https://www.thecru.com/

Name: Jacki Zehner
Text: Jacki Zehner I’ve been so privileged to partner with you, invest with you, and mobilise change with you for so long. This is, as so many have said, the decisive decade, this is the moment for action. Thank you for using your voice and launching this blog, and helping me /us to amplify the work of so many leaders and changemakers. #gendersmart #racialequity

Name: Jacki Zehner
Text: Investment capital has the potential to be a powerful tool for social change. Dig in to a long list of resources that can help you expand your thinking of what is possible as it relates to racial equity and justice.  Welcome to She Invests Newsletter Two.  #sheinvests #impactinvesting #genderequity #genderlensinvesting #racialequity #racialjustice #investing Suzanne Biegel Nathalie Molina Niño Tracy Gray Darian Rodriguez Heyman and so many more..

Name: Jacki Zehner
Text: I loved this film when I saw it in January at the 2020 Sundance Film Festivsl. Now on Netflix. “The movie argues that self-discovery does not have an age limit.” Heck yes! #film #sundancefilmfestival #reinvention

Name: Jacki Zehner
Text: Last week was busy! Pausing a moment to celebrate the reasons why: We surpassed $5 billion in grants to charity so far in 2020 (and counting!) and eliminated minimum contributions to establish a donor-advised fund with Fidelity Charitable. As our 30th anniversary approaches, I am so inspired by the impact of our donors and our work to support them—and the impact yet to come! https://chrtbl.org/r8bje

Name: Jacki Zehner
Text: A lot of people think of L.A. as beach volleyball, Hollywood, Silver Lake, Rodeo Drive, and excess! Well, it is all those things  and SO much more. It's also about passionate, dedicated people work toward a better future for the community. I love that Angeleno Magazine/Modern Luxury chose to highlight that work.  (And, it's pretty cool to be Bozoma Saint John & LeBron James adjacent!) #equityandinclusion #communityimpact #socialimpact #philanthropy #equalityanddiversity #community #socialgood

Name: Jacki Zehner
Text: I'm excited to take on this expanded role building on our longstanding commitment to DEI and digital equity.  There is much work to do but I stand on an incredible foundation with extraordinary commitment from our leadership.  #Gratitude #readyforanything

Name: Jacki Zehner
Text: I am delighted to be joining Random House, an imprint that, through the enduring works it has published over its nearly 100-year history, has influenced, & defined, generations. To my Feminist Press family: Thank you. I look forward to remaining a faithful donor & champion of FP.

Name: Jacki Zehner
Text: Love that Goldman Sachs has this returnship program for people who have been out of the workforce. Check it out.Goldman Sachs

Name: Jacki Zehner
Text: Today we unveil LinkedIn’s fourth annual Top Startups list, featuring the 50 United States-based startups attracting the most talent, investment and attention.None of these companies saw 2020’s collection of crises coming. Start with a global pandemic that abruptly brings just about all business to a brief halt. Add a recession without a clear path to recovery. And wrap it in civil unrest as protesters demand that we reckon with institutionalized racism at every level of society.These companies have risen to the challenges that 2020 has presented. Take a look through the list, and let us know which ones inspire you. You can find many more stories and insights around this year's Top Startups via our LinkedIn News page and #LinkedInTopStartups.
